gkp-13xaTZzy3pKG4_gvHQ.text: The Best bartenders in las vegas and great service aways ..red Sangria always a great start to drink .. Ask for karen as your fav bartender

Q78is0TOfZOnj7PcxckTyg.text: Best tapas in Las Vegas. Too bad they dont have this restaurant in OC! Scallop escargot, tuna tartare and bacon wrap dates are my fav.  The New Girl drink was sooooo good and refreshing!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Refreshing, crisp and gives you a pretty good buzz! You can taste the jalepeno flavor. Don&#39;t like sweet drinks, order this.

X5NdBR4RPZCpBovvasF2Vg.text: I love this place! Every time I come here I am never disappointed! Thank you for your great food and service Fire Fly!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hhizNwQleR8xBPcYPiNukg.text: I have been here twice, once for a girl's dinner about 4 years back and again recently for a bachelorette dinner with 28 people. The food is tapas style and the prices are really cheap (well, compared to SF and LA tapas prices) for the quality of food. We ordered about 10 different dishes to share between the four of us, along with a pitcher of their sangria (large pitcher for only $28!!) and we were all STUFFED!   Our favorite stand out dishes include the scallops "escargot" (juicy scallops in a butter pesto sauce), the bacon wrapped dates, shrimp diablo, clams and mussels. I'm sure everything is yummy because there was not a dish I did not enjoy out of the 10 that we shared. This restaurant will be bookmarked for all my future trips to Vegas! It's great for groups or a romantic dinner and food came out hot and fast.

DnUe0uqgBTKfN0_Cf0R8bg.text: My favorite meal yet in vegas:) I could have thrown a dart blindfolded at the menu and fully trusted that I would receive an interesting and delicious culinary success.   The meal is well paced and the servers are efficient (you get what you pay for). Only drawback? I was there on a Thursday and it was PACKED and very loud.   Also, free valet;)

zQ18pXzeXjIw-xeHTq4f2Q.text: Yay, I would recommend that place without any hesitation. We had an amazing evening, sharing tapas and the drinks were good.

vDB_scAnGFI4bLDwXClV1w.text: Firefly man I love this place. Food orgy time yet again.  I discovered it via a friends recommendation last time I was in vegas and now it is an essential part to any great vegas vacation. First time to the new location which is a stones throw from the old location. I like the larger size but miss some of the character of the old building.   They have a great mojito and a even better happy hour M-F 3-6. Unfortunately the happy hour is only for drinks. I also enjoyed one of my favorite craft beers rouge hazelnut its only 3$ during happy hour.  We brought a few friends along and stayed for several drinks and hours. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. The standouts wrrr the majitos we had both a pitcher and a few extra glasses. It is a little better in a glass the flavors are better proportioned. The sliders and dates were my two favorite dishes. I really enjoyed the shrimp, empanadas, stuffed mushrooms and firefly fishsticks. The only dish I would pass on was the scallop as they were rather fishy.   I feel the best way to experience firefly is with good service,  friends, drinks and great food.

2km8NeG9WrjtpBoDX11ZZQ.text: Always amazing food, super fun atmosphere, and all exponentially magnified by impeccable service with Neo. I love this place.

f-EKjVxCXBnA08vJcWNg1Q.text: Slightly disappointed because all the publicity took away some of the intimate aspects of the "old" Firefly. Parking was horrid (you can't tell if one side is one-way or not) and the wait was long at the new location when we finally found it! Given that, I still think that this is the best tapas restaurant that I've ever been to. My friends and I have been a regular before it was "popular" and hyped up, and we've always loved the menu items, all the way down to asking for extra bread and that yummy butter!   Our regular orders would usually consist of the chicken salad (TO DIE FORRRR!!), petit filet, firefly fries, empanadas and the kabobs among other things. I am absolutely in love with the chicken salad and I wish I could make it at home, but ehh. Price is okay, but I wouldn't go regularly--only on special occasions or when the gang gets together for a dinner date. Their dessert items are also very good.  I have never, ever been disappointed by their food! Also, the white sangria is yummy but I gotta say that their pitcher of Strawberry mojito beats the sangria hands down.   I wish they had a Firefly here where I lived now, that's how awesome this place is (minus the long wait). Last visited August 2013.

OYTyIw13ET2C5SgFtH5DSA.text: Bomb dot com!! Good food good drinks and live Latin music! Super hip, super trendy and good vibes!! Good for groups. Good for dates. Good for a big ass group of dates! Haha! Salsa dancers come and get down!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo clams!!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp ceviche!!

lE_1KK39zaQYQrOLXq2Skw.text: I was a little reluctant to try because of the food poisoning fiasco they had at the previous location but have to say was very pleasant. The tapas were very tasty and although I'm a vodka guy the sangria they are famous for was very good. Good job turning things around Firefly!

qPJREAbZ3HA9NSRh6C5v_g.text: It would be 6 stars if it was available.  Ivan served us today, and was excellent, courteous and fast.  The food is always perfect and Firefily* has the best Sangria on the planet.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EyioinqGhZ7yFO-SLVyAJQ.text: came here a few weeks ago when attending the NFR. a group of friends recommend this place to us, and also dined with us. the cocktails are amazing, and strong!! super service too!! we all orders 2 plates, and shared. everything ordered was fantastic, and fresh! ! we ordered more plates til all was satisfied, and tipsy!! wonderful! !

RJdBaranV3bGgi_HB27U0A.text: Went for a late b day  dinner. Being my first tapas spot it was amazing. The stuffed dates are to die for, l could eat a whole table full. It Has a great scenery and awesome vibe. Service was AMAZING. Had our food in a matter of minutes. And they brought me a b day desert that was really a great added touch. The white sangria was spot on as well

AxbrMhIh7I4jjYlp4cmYnw.text: We went here with a large group. Even though the restaurant was very busy we were seated within 20 minutes, no reservation. We were not in a hurry, but were very happy with their ability to accommodate us quickly.   The atmosphere is swanky and fun. The staff nice and very knowledgable. It was our first time trying a tapas restaurant, the menu is quite extensive giving us many choices.   We tried the sangria, was excellent. The white was a little too sweet to drink a lot of, but was very good. Most in our party preferred the red.   We ordered to share as a group, so we made a rule that if someone before you ordered an entree you could not order the same thing. Doing it that way allowed us to try many different things. Fun!   When the food came we passed it around the table family style. They filled our extensive order accurately and with a great flow, well timed so we were not overwhelmed or ever waiting.   The prices are affordable, the food is flavorful and varied (everyone can find something that fits their taste), the drinks are yummy and the ambiance is unique and perfect for a group looking to celebrate or an intimate date.   Don't leave without trying the filet mignon or bacon wrapped dates, they are fantastic.

0HKyURrZl4TOFsWCD-RvfQ.text: Came here twice so far and every time I am blown away at how well the sangria is and the tapas!  Definitely try the sangria. Some tapas recommendations:  -bacon wrapped dates -ceviche -Steak and mushroom skewers -Shrimp and pork skewers -stuffed mushrooms -mac n' cheese  I'm sure the other selections are great. I'd definitely come back to try more.  Also, free valet! =]  one recommendation: They could tone down the outside music or maybe try a more intimate/romantic ambiance.

fSMs0ry4C7uAnzxj2-ljEw.text: I came here for work, lucky I didn't pay. The food was ok I guess, but it all adds up quickly. It's as its described, tapas, or small plates. Best suited for quick work luncheons,  meetings, or just some side snacks to accompany drinks.

02xU6DUFFEHKJQfNisrfWg.text: Love, love, love this place! Never had a bad meal or service here and much more reasonably priced than all other tapas in Vegas. A must try!

wIaYqlXdHvq_v6lUzjLSKQ.text: Good was good, service left a lot to be desired. We waited 30 minutes between plates. I ordered a medium petite filet and it was cooked to death and flavorless. The patatas bravas, smoked salmon, tuna tartar and camarones diablas were all delicious! The sangria was heavenly

WmSZ9KXrbh402orKebv64w.text: I was brought here by my friends who are locals. This is hands down some of the best food I've ever had! Everyone must try this place. It's about one mile off the strip, so everyone should be able to reach it.  Having traveled all over Spain and also having eaten at Spanish restaurants all over Southern California, I expected to find the typically understated and demure, simple and clean tapas I'm used to. Not So! This is bold and flavorful. It's Innovative, it's creative, it's Spanish fusion.  The Food Style: This is gourmet at at an affordable price. IMHO the chef is a genius. Each small tapas plate is unique and individual, no two dishes are the same. Again, they are flavorful and bold, never bland. They display complex and contrasting flavors that are complimentary and blend seamlessly together to form a cohesive unit. Because each tapas plate is a small bite, the three of us were able to try 9 plates + 3 free bread and olive plates (The honey-almond-butter is amazing). This meal was like an amusement park for the taste buds.  I don't eat much meat, so we stuck to seafood and vegetable dishes. It's great for vegetarians.  My Favs (all 5 stars): The stuffed peppers, the roasted eggplant cannelloni, the manchego mac 'n' cheese, grilled scallops with saffron potato puree, and steamed mussels (incredible sauce). They give you as much free bread with honey-almond-butter and olives as you want. My friends raved about the bacon-wrapped stuffed dates, which are arguably the most popular item on the menu (I don't eat bacon).  Others (4 stars): Tortilla espaniola, patatas bravas (great brava sauce).  To Drink: A pitcher of Red Sangria. This is the real deal and very very tasty. It tastes like a fruity Merlot, not like some frou-frou fake sangria cocktail you get at chain restaurant.  NOTE: some tapas are better than others, but you have to be adventurous and start trying. Use the tips above. The only one I wouldn't order again was the seared ahi tuna skewers. They didn't have much flavor and the texture a little too tough to chew.  Ambience: somewhat dark and intimate, warm decor, comfy booths.   Service: Excellent. very friendly and attentive. They easily accommodate special requests.  Prices: $35 per person after tip per person for 9 plates and a big pitcher of sangria, and we were all STUFFED.   PROS: The Amazing Gourmet Food; great for vegetarians; affordable prices; delicious sangria; comfy booths;  great service too; close to the Strip (about 1 mile)  CONS: NONE  BOTTOM LINE: Come here, or you're missing out! I would consider driving back to Vegas from LA to eat here.

KCqjgZLi2cmNpwku_jn2Gw.text: This is our go to spot for lunch on this side of town. Love the Apple Manchego Salad! My absolute favorite! Flavors of sour apple and rich cheese blend magnificently, and sliced ever so perfectly. This is a must, EVERY TIME!!!!!! Some other favorites are the meatballs, the firefly fries, firefly fish sticks, and the lamb chops. I actually have never had a tapas plate that was bad here. This is great for almost any occasion and any taste bud. Love Firefly!!!!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly Fries

uTZdSLHpNtwMspB3n0WI1w.text: There is a big convention in town and the were busy. Still, we were on time for our reservations but they weren't ready.  Although we waited nearby, they forgot about us until we reminded them. Our table was in the middle of the room and we had trouble holding a conversation because the room was so loud.  We had a long time to wait as the drinks took forever to arrive.  The servers were pleasant and the food arrived quickly.  The dates, albondigas and carrots were pretty good.  The beef salad and fries were okay. The patatas bravas were not crisp and were a bummer.

qOjQ3wUSmzIRDD4eFJlGjQ.text: First, the place is HUGE. I loved the layout, as there are different spaces: Dining, plenty of bar area, and a large patio. It's all very spacious and when the weather is nice, the whole place feels very open and airy when the patio doors are open.  The food was great as I remember it from the previous location, with their signature items such as the bacon wrapped dates. We tried a handful of plates and with each tapas order, we were impressed. I can't even really repeat back to you everything we had but there were plenty of delicious and savory options. We tried so many and didn't feel like we broke the bank in the end. We opted for two desserts, one that was the flourless cake and both desserts sent us straight into a food coma as desired/expected.  We visited on a Saturday night and the one thing that was a little annoying was how loud the music was. There was a nice mix of songs - some Spanish, some radio hits, some rock - but it was all very, very loud. At one point in the beginning of the meal, we considered asking to move to the patio because it was just so so loud inside (seated at the bar). Since it's a very open layout, maybe that wouldn't have even helped.  Luckily, sound did not disrupt our dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Estrellados - Chorizo, potatoes, tomato sauce, fried egg. Just one of the many plates we ordered and loved.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Flourless cake with vanilla bean ice cream (bottom) and something Nutella up top that my husband ordered that he didn&#39;t share.

20mC0ST3q1rxvu9_--UHGg.text: Cool place with a fun vibe. Perfect tapas place that embodies the small plate concept really well. Dishes are flavorful and authentic. Great music too. We went late at night and it was still bustling with a lot of people. There was also a separate area for dancing for which I believe there is an entry fee. We had 6 plates between 3 of us and were pretty full. Octopus, clams, lamb sausage, lamb chops etc were all delicious. Plenty of more diahes to try for which I am going to go back next time I am in Vegas.

Yv1mYHKoNDSm79vj9QwI8g.text: Really love the tapas. I came here with my coworkers after work one day needless to say we were underdressed. But we still had a lot of fun and it was Latin night. Definitely pricey but worth it and the alcoholic drinks were tasty and different

H_uCmH9-lURoRjnnX8k1Qg.text: Saw the good reviews and I wanted some variety with tapas style portions in order to taste several dishes. The waiter recommended an appetizer, a salad dish and several main entries, which were all fantastic! I had the chorizo plate, apple & manchego salad, Tierra y mar skewers, and chocolate cherry bread pudding. My mouth is watering just from writing this review several weeks after I left Vegas. If your in the mood for a change of pace, you can't go wrong with Firefly. They have vegetarian, seafood, meat, spicy options, etc. I will be returning here on my next trip to Vegas.

cItwB53IybPmxqYSyRqD4Q.text: Only been here a few times but every time I've been in, I was never disappointed! This past time, however, every dish we had was amazing!  We started off with the apple manchego salad. AMAZING. Who would've thought sliced apples and manchego cheese together would make such an appetizing dish?! This is a must order for me every time I'm here. Definitely shareable too!  We sat at the bar, to which our bartender was very knowledgeable on the menu and suggested many items to fit our taste buds/diet.  We then ordered their shrimp ceviche, tuna tartare, and scallops "escargot" from his many, delicious sounding, suggestions.   Their shrimp ceviche makes my mouth water just thinking about it. SO FLAVORFUL! Its a little on the citrusy side, but I loved it that way. They came with crackers so balance out the lemon. *droool*  The tuna tartare came with taro chips, which by the way, are my faavorite, so it instantly got a lot of lovinnnn from me. But the tuna tartare alone was delicious. It's basically ahi tuna and avocado, and their seasonings, sprinkled with love.   And lastly, the scallops escargot was very delightful! Herby, buttery, breaded goodness with a nice lilll scallop in the middle.   Those four were about 50 dollars, give or take. I absolutely love tapas for the fact being you can try many different options on the menu without breaking the bank. And with that, I absolutely love this place! The portion sizes, yeah they're still small plated, but I feel like they still give you a good amount! We're small girls tho, so that was enough to fill us up without feeling too full  Also, side note, on another occasion, I had their stuffed dates and those are just as bomb as everything else :) try everything! Or atleast what I've mentioned.

P6xvIHKKAhs0snSMadeSdw.text: Excellent dinner! All appetizers. We had the petite filet, the goat cheese, pork empanada, lamb chops, pulpo asado they were all phenomenal! Our Server Luis was on top of everything! Never had to ask for refills!!! Thank you Luis!!!! After all that, we finished with dessert. Banana Nutella and Chocolate Tres Leches Wow wow wow

yuLSPZ8YvAx7lghTLkK8IQ.text: First ate at firefly when it was just a small restaurant tucked in the corner of a plaza, now look at it. Interior was nice, and had my boyfriend even saying he didn't feel like he was in Vegas when we ate there. Parking lot and valet was full when we arrived, but most were dancing out in the patio, and not eating inside so we were able to get a table instantly.   Service was prompt, with waters and appetizer bread being brought out as I sat down. Boyfriend ordered the calamari and Shrimp with pepper and butter. I was crazy excited to break that yolk on top of the Huevos.   Waters were continuously poured, food came out in a timely fashion, bread was gahhhmazing and service was good. Definitely try it!

Gv9c941ZmohXcV_tmt3hDg.text: Hadn't been here in awhile, used to come quite frequently though. It is conveniently located down the street from LVAC so we stopped here for dinner after a workout. I would probably pay money for the  complimentary bread and butter! We ordered wine and 7? Plates. We got chicken skewers , stuffed peppers , spicy beef salad , summer veggies , apple machango salad and I might be missing one? Either way we devoured everything in an hour between two girls :) the service was great! We sat outside and although it was quite busy our server was attentive. Ended spending about 100$ with tip.

i0uF7LEP3Ip0tw_vWn5TjQ.text: I tried Firefly for the first time 6 years ago, and since then, I have always made it a point to visit every time that I am in Vegas because it is my favorite tapas restaurant, better than any others that I have visited (mostly in SoCal), and possibly my favorite restaurant in Vegas thus far (though I have recently found a couple of solid contenders). Anyway, the tapas, the drinks, and the dessert are all fabulous. You really cannot go wrong with whatever you pick, particularly because you can do family style and if a dish is not your favorite, someone else is bound to enjoy it. My favorite items are the stuffed peppers, the patatas bravas, the bacon wrapped dates, and the chocolate tres leches cake. Aside from the food, the ambiance is great, with a bit of a classy romantic flair, the service is good, and the valet parking is free.

neFjcRgbjMPvifoqb4Wlew.text: Amazing! Arturo was perfect. Great tapas and a fun place. The small plates were perfect for individuals not looking to overfill themselves. Definitely worth it.

auGQviXTUOvc10G_xFeRbA.text: Went here last summer and can't believe I didn't write a review.  The food is outstanding! What a treat.  Visiting Vegas with 2 friends and one of them picked this place for Friday night, late dinner.   Showed up without a reservation, but the hostesses were very kind and got us a table fairly quickly, considering how crowded it was.  Again, the food was unbelievably good. Can't wait to go back the next time I am in Vegas.   Not sure if they have Salsa dancing every Friday, but they did we we visited in June 2017. And that was thoroughly enjoyable as well.

BkGwtHWC6lBeDRXRksDICQ.text: I LOVE coming to Firefly every time I visit Vegas. It's definitely one of my go to spots when I don't want to eat on the strip. They have great lunch specials, happy hour deals, and also great for date nights and dinner time.   It is tapas style so there is plenty of options to choose from depending on your preferences. My girlfriend and I went the surf and turf route as the below will describe our order.  Scallops escargot Tuna tartar Lamb chops Pallela  I think we tried flan or an ice cream dessert I don't remember as I am writing this review over a month later. ( I know horrible procrastinator)  I have never gotten sick here and I've eaten here probably 6-7 times over the years of my Vegas trips. I love the honey butter or whatever butter they serve with the thin baguettes. They used to give olives with the bread but I guess not many people were eating it so they stop. I do believe you can request it though. Will come back as the location isn't really far from the strip either and they have a parking lot you can park in.

UddGzeul7ccn2KsKKJ7Myg.text: Great find off the Strip! Came here with a group of 9 to celebrate my friend's birthday. The tapas style worked perfectly for our large party, and we all got to sample a variety of dishes: ceviche, tuna tartare, patatas bravas, pork empanada, chicken empanada, fish sticks, fried calamari, pulpo asado (octopus), steamed mussels, scallop "escargots", steak and mushroom skewers, lamb chops, and seafood paella. We also ordered pitchers of both red and white sangria. Everything was delicious and there wasn't anything I didn't like! Some plates do only come with a few pieces, so we did order doubles.   The service was attentive the whole night, with our waiter checking up on us regularly and our waters refilled. We brought a cake in, and they helped us cut and serve it for dessert. Price was extremely reasonable, unlike some other restaurants in Vegas. In terms of atmosphere, there was some dim mood lighting, Spanish decor and art, and the space is pretty big. We got seated in a sort of private booth which was kinda cool. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in town!

FrMyoLYok_7C0g8S63LDGQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas! As a local, I tell everyone that visits about Firefly. The atmosphere is cool and a bit fancy. Prices good. They have a big menu of cold and hot tapas. Some of my favorites are the stuffed dates, the pork empanada, the fries, the apple and manchego salad, and the baked goat cheese. The sangria is also amazing! Great place for a birthday celebration!

IEHqC0Mu10NF9E-UixZtFA.text: Sat At the bar and Omg the stuffed dates were the most amazing thing I have tasted in a while!  Service was great and the cucumber Mojito was so refreshing :).  Definitely coming back on my next trip.  Plus it was easy parking and not to far off the strip.

5VlR8in6kEGgJEFO2BvvvA.text: I usually make it a point to visit Firefly whenever I'm in Las Vegas.  No disappointment this time!  The peach sangria was great, the seafood paella was fantastic.  The 'escargot' scallops were amazing!  These are the new dishes I tried along with some of my old favorites.  I'll certainly be visiting again next trip!

Brfyd2XhzJBmWiO5jr01Tw.text: Love this place!!! Good food, Friendly Staff and Nice Decor. I tried this place for the first time and it was delicious. I was so hungry I didn't even get to take a picture but the food was delicious. We ordered the FireFly Fish Sticks for the appetizer, Chicken Skewers and Petite Filet. The amount of food is the perfect size and the food is filling. Our Waitress Jasmine had a great personality and very accommodating. We will definitely be going here again.

sNuNh_ekQ_SypymQoJQjxw.text: What a nice change of pace! I was visiting  head for work and getting tired of eating on the Strip. The reviews don't lie....this place is phenomenal!   A local eatery with delicious food and even better prices! There were four of us dining and we all got 2-3 tapas each and it was more than enough!   Enjoy!

Ltfy0PLpWPrxkK18JmFMng.text: Great place for tapas, food is great and so is the service.  Came for a snack and left satisfied

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great!!!

FArKnWo8VyUJA9NZkCktaQ.text: Have you ever been hungry after work and gone to a local restaurant you have previously had a great experience with looking to pickup your day, only to be disappointed?  I've been here several times, with pretty good experiences, however this time I ordered take out, and was severely disappointed. To start the food was not ready 20 minutes later when I went to pick it up, the teenaged receptionist seemed out of touch and ambivalent about my order, another inquiry 10 minutes later, and I get "it will be up soon, just waiting for the steak". Another 5 minutes and I ask for the manager seeing it's now been over 35 minutes, and they could have started cooking the food when I arrived and it should be ready by now. Another 10 minutes no manager, but the food comes out and seems to be hot. Get home, food is not to order, despite all the time wasted.  While this used to be a go to place, it seems understaffed, management does not care (half full restaurant btw), and service level sucks (did not even order the paella, which takes 30 minutes). I'm done with this place and would not recommend it (despite previous reviews).  Please see my review record to confirm I'm usually a pretty positive person.

Xwme6wgmyRmxVi9f6o3Ipg.text: Great tasting food, cozy atmosphere. Attended a work dinner here for 50 people so everything was served family style and I didn't catch the individual item names. I ate veggie rice, roasted chicken, and artichoke appetizers -- all of which tasted really amazing. Service was very courteous. Have no idea about prices because I didn't pay for anything, but the food would be worth a good amount.

XytiaeP0TldHE1WtAsD4uw.text: Firefly is a local Tapas and small plates restaurant located on Paradise Rd. in the center of Las Vegas. It's easily accessible from anywhere in the city and always open late. I used to come here all the time and accidentally burnt myself out on the place, so I had to take a break but it's been long enough so I'm back. Anytime I come here I usually start with the Stuffed Dates [bacon-wrapped,smoked almond,red wine reduction with blue cheese]. That gets me ready for the next few items that I order which are the Chicken Skewers [grilled marinated chicken breast,seasonal veggies,and roasted garlic cream] The Petit Filet [mini filet mignon, herb cheese,roasted potatoes,mushrooms and red wine sauce] The Baked Cod [lemon,garlic,butter and fried onion] The Chorizo Plate [4 imported thinly sliced cured meats, cornichons, capers and mustard] and lastly The Baked Goat Cheese [goat and garlic cream cheese, tomato sauce, Pesto and toast]. All are delicious and should be given a chance. Now for dessert well they have over ten to choose from so I'm sure you guys will find something. As far as the actual restaurant and bar the vibe is great and always fun. It's a cool hangout if you and some friends just wanna kill some time!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After dinner drinks
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert and Coffee

eEQN0PN5AEmDCRFzoifjig.text: There's a lot to like about Firefly, a bustling, noisy restaurant with lots of varied food options, served tapas-style and meant for sharing. If your idea of a good time is to bring a crowd and sample many different dishes over the course of several hours, then Firefly may be the place for you. Our party of twelve thoroughly enjoyed the experience and tasted just about everything on the menu, along with several pitchers of their excellent sangria.  An added bonus for vegetarians or those with gluten allergies, Firefly has a separate menu with their vegetarian options on one side and their GF options on the other. This came in handy when ordering for our group, and made it easy to have safe meals for everyone, no matter their dietary restrictions.  If you like sangria, be sure to try some. Both the white and the red are excellent, but I preferred the red. Nice and dry, not too sweet, and a fine accompaniment to the Spanish-style tapas. Also good - their mojitos! Available by the pitcher.  My favorite items were the bacon-wrapped stuffed dates, the Padron peppers (deceptively simple, but tasty), and the watermelon sorbet at the meal's close. The sorbet flavor changes daily.  Others at our table raved about the Tierra del Mar skewers and the lamb chops. The bread and almond butter disappeared quickly.  Basically, there's enough variation on the menu to find something for everyone. But that's a little bit of the problem too. The menu feels scattered and not as cohesive as it could be.  Service is professional and fairly efficient, but at times was hit or miss. This is expected with large groups and a busy restaurant, and we never had to wait too long for beverage refills. Plus, the staff wants you to have a good time. As an example, our first order of lamb came out overdone, but Firefly was able to get another going and on the second try the lamb chops were hailed as the standout meat dish of the evening.  One final note. Don't call this a Spanish restaurant if you have an actual person from Spain in your group. It was my colleague's first time in the USA, and he was appalled that Americans think Spaniards eat this way. Live and learn! (Although he did enjoy the food and the drinks. He just took issue with anyone saying it was Spanish.)

Vt4K9L6iGZ0CFyWouP-Acw.text: If you're looking for something off the strip that's got great food and you're short on time and can't dish out $50 for a fancy buffet, then Firefly on Paradise is where you and your friends are going for dinner before the club.  HERE'S A TIP: If your wait is long to get seated, go to the bar, order a pitcher of Sangria and put in your order for a paella because that will take 40 minutes to cook and by the time you get seated you can have the paella delivered to your table. By the way, the Sangria will change your life.          Let's start with the house bread which is garlic and the butter that accompanies it is this sweet, herby mix with I don't know what, but it tasted AMAZING! The staff saw that our group enjoyed this and brought extra bread out without us having to ask. We ordered the mac and cheese which was delicious and used the pasta shells instead of the elbow macaroni. Definitely home made and not out of a box, creamy and delicious.The goat cheese dish was good and had a sort of marinara base. I'm not a huge fan of goat cheese but it went well with the base. The mixed paella was out of this world! I need more paella in my life after eating the mixed paella which consisted of pieces of chicken, shrimp and clams and just a great flavorful bed of rice.  I'm still heart broken that we didn't take the leftover mixed paella (there was at least a cup of paella left) to go because my friend said she didn't want her car to smell (we were headed to XS at Encore after dinner and it would've sat in the car for like 3 hours). It was my friend's birthday, and they brought us flan for her at no additonal charge and put a candle in it. Luckily she hates flan so I got to eat most of it and yeah, I'd lie and say it's my birthday anytime I visit here to get free flan.             Everyone from the hostess at the front to the bartender and wait staff outside were courteous, beautiful and attentive. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm definitely eating here and trying even more tapas and taking the leftover paella to-go and eating it on the way home.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s damn good sangria.

wu_6WUGTEvt-LYiBCMYelw.text: Firefly has set my standards for a great tapas bar really high! I have yet to find a tapas place in LA with food, atmosphere, and pricing as great as this place! If your going to be on the strip this has got to be one of your stops for a girls night or dinner date trust me everyone will be thanking you later!  Atmosphere is fun and flirty here! Love the accents of red and the lighting, service was also really good- our waitress was very accommodating and despite how busy they were her service stayed considerably great throughout the night.   Sangria!!!! About every table had a bottle so we knew it was good, we got both the red and white fruit sangria- I preferred the red but both were bomb! I really can't wait to try their Mojitos next time :).  The tapas here are 5 stars worthy and the price just can't be beat!!!! Love that each person can order a few things to try something different. It was perfect for a large group because it ensured that everyone would find something they liked & the tapas style makes people more open to sharing lol.   Recommend:  - the mussels in their broth are outstanding, everyone was jealous they missed ordering this one, it's definitely a meal within itself bc you won't be able to resist dunking your bread into it. - calamari was good, great dipping sauce. -ahi tuna tartar was fresh & light _clearly there are so many things on the menu id say almost everything looked worth trying once!

qn7KYfm8IHZgxuKLQLrnqw.text: Love the ambiance of this place. They always have ample seating throughout the restaurant, bar and patio area.   Drinks: I would highly recommend there strawberry and watermelon mojitos. May just be some of the best mojitos I've had in a while. I'd skip on the passion fruit option. No Bueno.   Bacon wrapped Dates are still my favorite plate to get here. It's really a great place with good tasting portions.   Try the Camarones al Diabla and Ajillo. Can't forget those.

kiTCkNpRlLsyH_xpfKpZ_A.text: We stopped by Firefly for some drinks and dessert after lunch. Our friend is a huge fan of Tres Leches cake and I read reviews of Firefly's being top notch. We were hanging out in the bar during football Sunday. Both of our friends ordered the Tres Leches and my wife had the Fly Tai cocktail. She liked the drink a lot and ordered a second. The Tres Leches was also delicious, so much that my wife ate about half of one of our friends before he realized it. Our other friend who is the tres leches fan said it was up at the top of his favorite tres leches cakes.   Service in the bar was also excellent for us as the bartender was constantly refilling our drinks including my water before I could finish it. All of us would go back to try their food and also eat more desserts.

NMizhjbgqLIbp-xhsu_chw.text: I had my bachelorette party dinner here - and it was amazing!  The food was amazing, the drinks yummy (and strong!), the vibe inside was classy, and the prices were good.  We made a reservation in advance through the Firefly banquet contact (the information is easily available on their website) and did a pre-fixed menu of family style tapas for a great price!  We did the Tapas Banquet for $33 and with (copious) drinks on top of that, it came to $60 pp including tip.  If we had had the same dinner on the Strip, we would have paid more than twice as much!   Firefly was super easy to work with in making the arrangements.    What also was great is there were great options available for my vegan and gluten-free friends, in addition to the yummy food for us meat-eaters.  We also had a ton of leftover food that we had boxed up and ate the next day as hangover breakfast food.    This worked out super for us based on our bachelorette party schedule, which was as follows:   6 - 7:  Pre-dinner light drinks at The Platinum Hotel (we booked the Marquis Suite, which easily slept 6 ladies with space to spare!),  7 - 8:30 Dinner at Firefly (we ubered there from the hotel, about $6 - 8, the uber ride was about 4 minutes),  8:30 - 10:30:  Back to the hotel to freshen up, pregame, and do some bachelorette games, 10:30 - late:  We went out clubbing to Tao in the Venetian  The overall night went great, and Firefly was one of the best parts!

koLt9OzdziBM6aDQjVIQEg.text: Not only the food but the service and recommendations that we got from Alex was excellent! It was our first time on this place and Alejandro explain really well our options and we like all the tapas and paella that he recommended.  Thank you Alex!   We will return on our next trip to Vegas for sure!

h8yi3WIczcvqWOb0eZtDgw.text: As I finally get around to writing my review about my favorite place in Vegas. This place was introduced to me about 6 years ago and I make sure I go every time I'm in Vegas.. Not even the food poising outbreak at the old location could stop me lol! We tried going the Friday night when we were in town and it was slammed packed. We went back the next day at about 2 and there were only 4 other parties in there at the time.. I stuck with the same dishes that I normally ordered, but my girlfriend was trying new things. I like the tapas style, bc it allows you to be able to share and try more things at once.  Bacon wrapped dates- these things are worse than a crack addiction, I'm assuming lol.. The bacon and the blue cheese go great with the dates. And it doesn't hurt that the bacon is crispy!  Shrimp ceviche- nice fresh taste, lots of shrimp and flavor. The avocado is always a nice touch.  Menchago mac n cheese- cheese cheese and more cheese. You know it's good when the cheese is still bubbling when it gets to the table.  Stuffed chicken and chorizo mushroom- the mushroom add a great texture, the the flavor of the chicken and the chorizo are on point.  I suggest you try the place out.. It not on the stipe but it's not far at all. Give it a try, I'm sure you will like it  Yelp 100 Challenge 2016- 7/100

oz2KlXrYedskD657LIMOJA.text: I have had this place bookmarked for I don't even know how long but I have been low key scared to check it out because of the Salmonella out break a few years back. Finally I found a friend who wanted to go and check it out!   We went on a Wednesday during happy hour (3PM-6PM) and it was pretty much empty. I have a weakness for Mojitos and they have like 9 different flavors. I asked our waitress what she would recommend and she had me try the Paradise Mojito and it tasted like a tropical getaway. With hints of pineapple and coconut this was truly refreshing, And during happy hour they were only $5.00 or a whole pitcher for $18.00!  We got quite a few tapas to share and everything we got I would definitely recommend/get again:  Artichoke Hearts 5/5  Firefly Fries (Happy Hour) 5/5  Calamari 5/5  Filet Skewers 4/5  Stuffed Dates (Happy Hour) 4/5  Shrimp Ceviche 4/5  Warm Spinach Salad 4/5  We ended the day with a beautiful Flan dessert!  I cannot wait to come back and try even more of their expansive menu!

Some of my favorite food items are the apple/Manchengo salad, boquerones, stuffed dates, and chicken skewers. I love that firefly is tapas style because you can try a little bit of everything.

-9zGnpBxBqxIEJVxumY-tg.text: Made a reservation on Open Table. Found parking easy, we were seated right away. All the dishes we ordered were amazing, great flavors, seafood and steak cooked perfectly. Authentic and so much detail put into every dish, even the smallest tapas and dessert. Very busy and pretty loud but I would still recommend for a date night. We were checked on a lot for more orders and refills even with the place packed. Will definitely go back.

H47vzZiwUS_fPjThTLwj4g.text: Def a place to go in Vegas! My boyfriend and I were trying to find a place in Vegas to go that was different, not over priced, and delish. We didn't want to do the traditional steak houses because honestly you can get a good steak from a good steakhouse anywhere. My boyfriend has never had Tapas before so I suggested we look up restaurants with Tapas. Firefly had good reviews so we made reservations for 6pm. When we got there it wasn't very busy yet.   Ambiance: The lighting is dim which is nice because it makes you feel like your the only ones in the restaurant. We were seated in a corner booth and it just made everything perfect. There is a lot of red to the color scheme and it kind of had a tacky-manly-romantic vibe to it but it fit its romantic fun feeling.  Service: We had the best service. Our waiter was attentive, knowledgeable and all around an all star. I have worked in the restaurant industry for a good 5 years and i appreciate when someone is as good as he was. Not only was our server great.. the food runner was good, and the busser or server assistant was amazing. He did not let a empty plate sit on a table for anyone.. I saw him sneakingly cleaning up without interrupting people in the dinner conversations.  Food: It depends what you get. All of the food we had was good. But some were just good and some were AMAZING. The portion sizes are definitely bigger than a normal tapas place which is nice and well worth the money. Some suggestions for food are.. Dates, Filet, Lamb. Those were our favorites.. we wanted to try much more but we got full fast. Not only is the food good.. omg the sangria was heavenly.. we got the pitcher and it was gone at the end of dinner.  Price: The price is very reasonable and I'm so glad we went there. We got a pitcher of sangria and 6  tapas.. our bill was $95. We got to try all different kinds of food and get 6 glasses of sangria out of the pitcher. It is very reasonable.  The next time we are in Vegas we will be coming here!

UU-NQlBN52Exsn5RuWWGcA.text: Perhaps I just did not order the right thing.   Or maybe because I was not drinking pitchers of sangria like others at my table that I was able to taste what their food really taste like.  SO not impressed... the empanadas taste like the Goya frozen ones that you get from the spanish supermarket.  The fries ehh okay.  Although the location is bigger now it is still to loud for a decent conversation... and again the food was just okay.  So if you want okay food and alcohol go here.  Otherwise there are plenty of delicious places to go in Vegas.

GAL8pl6yhhLZiQ4SNvLSjA.text: Came here with a friend.  Great place to share several items.  Everything we had was great.   The sangria is delicious as well.  The portions are large for small plates.

OtLZ9Sbc73hgvW6C1XN-tw.text: Very good loved the dates and other tapas. The Ginger Martini was yummy!  Our server Nahum was very friendly and helpful when answering our questions.

9TxywGOFqRBtvC3LAjMbhg.text: BOMB!!! Since their reopen I have to say even better than before. Their new facility is HUMONGOUS!! 10x the size of their old spot. The layout and design of the restaurant is very chic. Their full bar is a great place to entertain drinks!  As for the Tapas! Well........  They are simply delicious. I love it all. The mini filet is excellent. The potatoes that came with it are great too.  Can't go wrong with the shrimp either. The sauce is succulent.   But the real kicker here is the Mac and cheese! Nothing like anything I've had except maybe the Mac and cheese at BarBistro by Chef Beni Velasquez. These two Mac and cheeses are the best in the city.   Overall a nice dinner date venue.

8rumv5KQ-FmI2r0CElixOQ.text: Wow! My boyfriend and I came to Vegas to celebrate our three year anniversary & had planned to come to Firefly based on multiple yelp reviews. The food was so incredible. The stuffed dates were so good. I'm usually not a fan of bleu cheese crumbles, but it paired so well with the sweetness of the dates. In addition to the dates, we got the vegan crab cakes, the veggie empanadas, and veggie pasta. We finished our meal with the passionfruit mini cheesecakes and it was the perfect combination of tangy & sweet. We hope to come back to Vegas in the next few months with family & we definitely plan to bring them to Firefly. Thanks for such an incredible evening! :)

lcuHRwVPC4JtUhZOK8LNxw.text: A friend of mine and I were looking for someplace to eat some light food before Turkey Day so I did a Yelp search for tapas. Firefly came up so I checked it out and menu looked good so we met there.  The restaurant looked really nice inside; dimly lit, a little loungy-like. We were both pretty hungry so we ordered a few dishes to start. The vegan crab cakes, the patatas bravas and the vegetable empanada were all so delicious and the presentation was great!  Next we ordered the tuna kebabs, the filet mignon kebabs and the lamb chops. They were all perfectly cooked, delicious and well plated as well!  We ordered the dessert sampler because all the desserts looked so good so we wanted to get a bit of a lot of the desserts. The passionfruit tarts were really good. So were the berry tarts and the bread pudding. But the flan! Perfectly creamy and sweet! A great end to our meal! And even though it seemed like it didnt take a long time for our dessert to get to our table, a lovely lady apologized for the dessert taking so long and took it off our bill!  So if you in the area, and are looking for a great tapas restaurant with a great menu, great service and great ambiance, look no further than Firefly!

z9JDoEml3HJtHW1sY588tA.text: I'm local and have been at this Firefly location plenty of times. The party I was with was pretty large, but that should not excuse the lack of customer service.   The food was served sporadically and some were left to watch others eat. I order the stuffed dates and Mac & cheese. My dates were tasty as always, but I didn't not get the rest of my meal for an entire 45 minutes later! This was the case for the group. When I notified the waitress of the ridiculous wait her response was "yes."  I was underwhelmed with the food quality, and the quality of service further aided in this outing.

4cbNq6Rd0y89s0ST3hZzQg.text: We went in late on a Saturday night and got seated immediately. The service was great - very fast. We had the shrimp tempura, empanadas, Mac and cheese,  a cheese fondue dish, and the dessert platter. The shrimp tempura and cheese fondue were disappointing - not much shrimp in the tempura and an odd flavour in the fondue. Everything else was great and worth a stop if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert platter
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac cheese
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese fondue with toast, sausage, onions

Aejk_jzYzL5boLuQf_8oWg.text: Excellent service. Bomb food. Delicious Sangria. You can't really go wrong here. Everything tastes fresh & good. The plates come out pretty fast even on a busy night! Went to this restaurant while visiting Vegas and I'll make sure to come back.   The Tuna tartare was great, the desert sampler was wonderful. I'm still thinking about the flourless chocolate cake & the flan! Also had the Mac and cheese, empanadas, eggplant with goat cheese, baked goat cheese, smoked salmon, toast with avocado and tomato! The chorizo mussels! The bacon wrapped stuffed dates!! Wonderful atmosphere and food. Thanks for the experience.

PCE_r4ZQ5CvOJcULJ6UKSg.text: You can't go wrong when you're ordering a pitcher of Sangria.  Made a reservation before leaving the house and waltzed right in. Okay, not really, we did have to wait a few minutes because there was a line of people at the host stand, but it wasn't more than 10 minutes before our table was ready. Nahum was our server and he was on point. He checked back often but wasn't overpowering the table and he was SO NICE!  The menu is huge and the plates are tapas style so it's easy to over order. A few highlights for me were the Scallop Escargots with the buttery herb sauce and the Chicago Beef. Oddly, my table mates weren't as big of a fan of the Chicago inspired sandwiches but they are east coasters so perhaps they have more to compare it to. I also loved the Hearts of Palm *Crab* Cakes. They are vegan, so don't expect crab, but I loved the texture and flavor.   A few misses were the Serrano Ham & Cheese plate and the Seafood Paella. The cheese on the plate was flavorless and the paella was very bland.  The pitcher of red sangria was amazing though and for how busy this place is, the food comes out super fast. This was my second time here and although it's not my favorite spot in Vegas, it's close to my house and worth the price.

XSlkjUccmirRoFz3OgSO8w.text: This is a little Hidden Gem about a block from my house and I'm so glad I tried some different dishes here . I used to come here just for the bacon wrapped dates and now I know they have so much more to offer I am a big fan ...it is delicious everything was amazing and the chef Jamie was so cute he came by and I told him how good everything was and he told the bartender to comp my dessert plate what an angel  the ribs are a must-try they are delicious and fall off the bone !! Honestly I think they are the best ribs in town.. and those deserts don't even get me started...

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fruit platter... it was so good with chocolate Tres Leches, flan, lemon berry tart and passion fruit mini cheesecakes... amazing
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture of the menu

-UHsi2_gK48TsLVQtoQI9A.text: My fiance and I love this spot. Very dark inside but the stuffed dates were amazing along with the beef skewers and drinks. Hidden little gem of a restaurant and highly recommend.

hB93u5Qk528gm07g3vk9dA.text: Outstanding food, vibe and service. A must stop in Vegas. Really really good! So many good items. Order a bunch and share!! Empanadas are a must! A great place for groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VUnedDVFawo6pofFySJSIw.text: Kind of mixed review here. We had a large group, they were extremely easy to deal with. We did want something not too expensive, they did an amazing job with this. The food was quite good, but not amazing. Spanish food is not my favorite either, but it's decent. Overall they were great to a large party. Kudos.

16fexQADGIV-U6FLTeqBwg.text: This is the greatest restaurant.  My family and I have been here many times over the last 3 years.  All of the food is top-notch and the service is fast and courteous.  Alejandro Garcia has been our waiter several times and he is the best!  He is friendly and knowledgeable about all of the dishes.  He is a tremendous waiter. And most of them are good waiters. And the place is the best.  Authentic and very well organized.   Some of the people who complain on this site must be paid by the competition.  If you go here, you will not be disappointed.

-r34kPL52s1VOtw20Usu5w.text: Great off the strip place to eat. Classy and the food is amazing. If you're the mood for a nice place to have a nice diner or date this is definitely recommended.

4FoLaMyj_iQNPA87Jum3nw.text: CUSTOMER SERVICE: was average. Nothing special. Host was not inviting. Services hardly came to our table. FOOD: Its more of an appetizer and drinking place. Has a couple of entrees but I dont really recommend it. But if you are hungry there is that option. There small plates/appetizers are very good. Alot of them have alot of flavor.  DRINKS: AMAZING! I would definitely say this is a drinking place. Sangria amazing. Mojito amazing!

LIyVXm6MbW4M9aWcIqY38A.text: This place was really amazing.  They have a huge variety of tapas and all selections we sampled were very unique and tasted excellent.  The bar is cool and I strongly recommend the sangria as it is the best I have ever had.  My favorite tapas was the bacon wrapped dates.  The location is just off the strip and it is easy to get to.  Service was fantastic and prices were reasonable for an upscale restaurant with a great atmosphere.

Fucb9xHhsNLLTkDUIzAVsQ.text: This is an outstanding restaurant and we are very picky with food. We tried the mixed paella, the skewers, the ham croquettes, and the red sangria. Everything was above our expectations. Our waiter, Roberto is the best!!! He even told us where to go in Las Vegas. We are even thinking to return tomorrow. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are big. I highly recommend this place!!!!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixt paella, seafood, chorizo, chicken, and more. Delicious!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo, shrimp, and steak skewers

jmt_vwmpzH-P_fKCDXyxsw.text: It's too hot in this restaurant to even enjoy my food.... ridiculously hot.... turn off the heat. People would buy more drinks if they weren't sweating to death :)

08oTa6wlLNAu2ZyhUot7mA.text: This place is conveniently located a few streets off the strip behind the Linq hotel.  The place itself is huge and there is parking in the rear and valet parking up front. The lighting is dimmed inside.  My group of 4 ordered the following items:  Mixed Paella - $26 - All the paella dishes take about 40 minutes to prepare so I placed an order for this as soon as we arrived.  They are also highly customizable.  My mixed paella consisted of shrimp, mussels, clams, calamari, chicken, veggies, hold the chorizo (as I don't eat pork).  This was the star of the night as this dish was bursting with flavors and had quality ingredients.  The dish is designed for 2 to 4 people to share.  Pulpo Asado - $10 - Another one of my favorites was the grilled octopus with potatos, tomato, and a paprika-lemon vinaigrette.  It wasn't as soft and tender as my favorite tapas place, but it was still very good.  Scallop Escargots - $10.50 - This dish consisted of scallops baked in garlic-herb butter and the presentation gave the affect that they were escargots.  Tinga Empanada - $4 - This tapa was a bit small and consisted of 2 crispy chicken empanadas, tomato, onion, and chili-lime crema.  This dish was good as well.  Petite Filet - $13.00. - The filet mignon was tender and I asked them to prepare the dish without the red wine sauce.  This dish wasn't bad, but I would probably order some of the other tapas.  By the time we finished our meal there was a huge wait.  I really enjoyed the meal and would highly recommend ordering the mixed paella as some of the other tapas weren't really filling.  Service was extremely fast for the tapas that we ordered and our water glasses were filled through the night.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed paella, no chorizo $26
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite fillet
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

v9XbMSh04dg_aw8ZzgHKWg.text: As soon as knew I was going to Vegas I bookmarked this place.   I read the reviews, saw the pictures, and knew I had to try it.  I did not have a lot of time in Vegas, just going for a trade show, during the week, and only time off for dinner. First night I attempted to go, place was booked for a private event and wait time was over an hour.  I didn't give up, next day, I went a little earlier and was able to find a spot at the bar.  I was greeted immediately, and given both the happy hour menu and food menu. I love Tapas style restaurants, gives you an opportunity to try many different things, especially if sharing.   Since I was traveling solo, I didn't get to order many things but what I did, I absolutely loved.  I started with one of their specialty sangrias, the sparkling one.  Very well balance between the wine and peach flavor, plus all the fruit.  It's a little too sweet for me but very refreshing and I would order it again.    While enjoying my Sangria, I looked over the food menu and decided on the Mushroom and Steak kabobs, and the Manchego Mac N Cheese.   They didn't take too long to come out, and they served them almost at the same time so I was able to have them as a meal.  Protein and it's side dish. The steak, I ordered medium-well, was soft, juicy and very flavorful.  The mushrooms were decent size, and so delicious with the steak. The Mac N Cheese was crunchy on top, perfect amount of cheese...  maybe if I would have stopped eating this I would have been able to try something else but I just couldn't.    Before I was able to finish my meal, the sangria was done.  Instead of ordering another one, I saw their other specialty are mojitos...  and, they have a passion fruit one.  I just HAD to order it, and absolutely LOVED it!  The passion fruit flavor (my favorite fruit) really comes through, and it's not drowned in sugar/ simple syrup (like many places do).  I like it's natural tartness, and love when people don't mess with it.  Extra points for that!  The food was amazing, service was friendly & quick, and on top of that, I got to talk with some fun people sitting at the bar near me.   So glad I went again that night and got to enjoy this place.  Definitely a must and permanently on my list of restaurants to visit in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion Fruit Mojito
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Mushroom Skewers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manchego Mac &#39;n Cheese

J9kyPI3cvSpWoh_uXyTCIw.text: Perhaps we didn't order the right dishes (despite following some of our waiter's recommendations), but we thought this was not a very authentic Spanish tapas experience. We've eaten at a lot of tapas restaurants in the past, and this one was definitely my least favorite. To break it down:  Food: Based on our waiter's recommendations, we ordered the Stuffed Dates, the Tierra Y Mar (surf n' turf) Skewers, and the Camarones al Ajillo (garlic shrimp). We also ordered the Mushroom Montadito and the Merguez Bocadillos (lamb sandwiches). The Stuffed Dates are apparently the most popular dish on the menu, and we thought they were pretty good (the best dish of the night). It ended there though. The surf n' turf skewers were so overcooked that even the shrimp was tough! We each ate a bite and didn't want to keep eating. The garlic shrimp was way too salty, but at least the shrimp wasn't overcooked... The mushroom and lamb dishes were also salty, not much other flavor profile.   Service: Our waiter was nice and attentive. We thought the dishes came out way too quickly, it felt like they were rushing us. Makes sense, because they were packed - if you're going to eat here, I recommend making a reservation.  Atmosphere: Crowded and noisy, but not necessarily in a bad way.

MgFXVdu-WjIaDQ9Q1ABjDg.text: Terrible! They sold the restaurant as a Spanish tapas place but is toooo far away from the original Spanish food, the only thing they keep in the dishes is the name.   Something funny, they bring the same horrible bread over and over, at the beginning with butter and with every dish.  They add butter to every single thing. The next morning, I woke up with a strange taste in my throat.  A place to avoid in Vegas.

DAgIl8njs_222dSFxHGBHw.text: I have got to call this place out on their TEEEEEEEERRIBLE service! I am a local and since this place has been around it has always had the worst service in Vegas! The service at the old Sahara location was good so it must be the management here that is the problem. I came in here on a slow day during non-happy hour prices and I still got bad service as usual. Im so mad i tipped 20% i shouldve talked to the manager lady that was there but she seemed to be really snobby and also not really worried about helping her team.  1 star for the food 1 star for the decor  -1 star for the service -1 star for the hospitality  -1 star for the value

70LWcNm7szowKCv3-xr68w.text: Oh my goodness this place is absolutely amazing you have to try their Diablo shrimp the tuna tartare chorizo plates and the fondue all of which is absolutely amazing the people hear the staff  amazing  and super helpful!  We will come back again the next time we're in Vegas

5AkkpmVh3uw7P8o9kyXofg.text: First time a couple years ago and everything was really good.  When I came back in July 2017, everything was subpar.  Best dish we had was: chorizo clams tuna tartare  would not order again: stuffed dates (bacon charred, not very appetizing) tierra y mar skewers (good but not memorable) camarones a la diabla (they said the sauce was great...but it was not) chocolate cherry bread pudding

XQHx1S9KIZjyKzHZSO9WAw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants ever. I've tasted most of the menu and haven't had anything I didn't like. Stuffed dates must be part of every meal! Wish I lived closer so I could visit more often!

8WXHHi8eN8HMbv7JilrrKw.text: Very small plates. Yes I know it's tapas and in typical Vegas style they are even smaller plates and the drinks are as well.   2 sodas  1 martini  3 plates $60

jINW2YzxYgp1B8OqiDnsoA.text: Loved the chicken tinga empanadas and the warm spinach salad! The artichoke toasts tasted great even to two artichoke connoisseurs. The flan finished things off nicely. Try the lemon drop martini or the local draft stout--great drinks!

uFOIoVsrW4fn210O_86eCg.text: Loved coming here for a bachelorette party! It was a nice escape from the Strip and the food was delicious and easily shareable. Nice ambiance and helpful staff. If you're coming here for a special event let them know-- we received shots on the house, a great way to start the evening off!

bRFRNM-HQo9-bX1v72EgUA.text: My husband and I stopped by in between lunch and dinner and grabbed food at the bar.  Wide variety and selection on the menu, and a decent amount of vegetarian options as well. Servers were friendly and attentive, and food was really good! If you are looking for food options off the strip, highly recommend. They have a fairly large seating area with nice ambiance, so it would be a nice place for a large group dinner.

MYspt08n78YZp8VVyi0NRg.text: Great Tapas.... Not "authentic", they have a blend of traditional and American "Tapas" dishes, but everything was very good.  Would recommend in a heartbeat!  Order the Sangria.

ZxQ6-_mDjtpqMit96JnRaA.text: Loved every damn minute. Third time here, no disappointments- from the hostess to the valet, all dedicated and on point. We will be back tomorrow and every other visit to Vegas.

QO7MzBzgDknkgrLg1xnxzQ.text: I ate here this past Friday night as a party of 6. The ambience was nice, service friendly, and food was very good. However, all 6 of us suffered from very violent food poisoning. I'm at the 48 hour point and am still recovering. The other location in Las Vegas was shut down due to not following health codes. (Thus why this restaurant opened) Looking at some other recent reviews I noticed others mentioning stomach aches. Under no circumstances will I ever eat here again as no food is worth this amount of discomfort. Eat here at your own risk!

dsaE4fvnY2zT6asmwJI7zw.text: Truly outstanding! I liked it so much I went back two days later. Just down the street from the convention center, so skip the blah convention food and go here. The portions are generous, and the food is wonderful. Not to be missed are the stuffed dates, spicy shrimp, apple salad, and filet mignon. The bread comes with spicy butter that is amazing. The sangria is tasty too. The service is great as is the ambiance. It's a little noisy but it feels festive there. I can't wait to go back!

yKEzRG9oxkAxXFESTyxx4A.text: I really hope this place doesn't shut down.. its my go to spot for good food and great sangria.  Never been disappointed eating here, everything I've tried is amazing.  I am really sad the Henderson location closed, please open another one! New paradise location is really loud, makes it really hard to hold a convo.

BBZhuiaNPt9a6-nPp-o0BQ.text: We never miss a chance to have dinner.  This trip we took granddaughters age 9 and 14 and they loved it too.  The menu has the best Tapas selections we have experienced.  Great Mojitos.  The staff members are friendly and knowledgable.  The manager Carlos makes the whole experience a must stop in Vegas and everyone we've sent from Arizona considers it a must stop for Vegas visits.

_sjzhCwxhK3sOraBs-nWxg.text: A must on every Vegas trip. We ordered the shrimp, bacon dates, beef salad, escargot & more shrimp & sangrias. Dinner w/ drinks around $70 not bad for the taste and selection.

RM4N9JwKjwtF0o42CuCyyA.text: I loved the food! Portions are bigger then what you expect from tapas and the flavor was truly Southern Spanish. They are open late, until 2am with excellent happy hour prices for a few good tapas 11pm to close. An awesome place to recover after the strip ;)

iB-_JYte3JYCd4kV6f-Q7w.text: This place was great (food/drinks/prices), our waiter was not so great. The lady who bussed our tables was AWESOME and took the time to tell us all her favorite things on the menu.  We happened to be there on latin night which was really cool, it was so packed there was nowhere to sit on the patio, but it was no big deal because we got a great view of the amazing dancer.   Best shrimp tempura I have ever had! Will be coming back to try more items

WoJAuWg1BliEO9TJoLjR1Q.text: Grwat food. Love it. They have the best food in town. If you come to vegas stop in abd dine in

KfGaLgf3UsCsXeAjr14ltg.text: I'm borderline obsessed with this place. I love everything here! The vibe is fun the service is impeccable and the food is delicious. The banana Nutella sandwiches are basically gods gift. I love that the plates are small so you can sample lots of things too. Despite the small plates you will leave full. I really enjoy this place was and every time I dine here.

77tfrk4OLcV65dxlZNvw0Q.text: The best in las Vegas.... I love it their customer service is awsome... I order "camarones a la diabla"... I been a customer since 2 years ago. I always go 2 times a month...

XC-NWD48UR6a1SU9sGjApQ.text: One of my favorite places to hit when in Vegas.  Superb food - high quality and very creative.  The mojitos are fantastic.  Only gripe is the long wait during peak times, but, hey, the secret is out, right?

cWf824_zxxNPOxHD__kdbA.text: I've been here several times before, and the food is superb. However today, we were told it would be a 30 minute wait for inside or we could sit outside immediately. We opted for an outside table and after 15 minutes had not been offered water or anything to drink. The waiter came out several times to check on other tables and even after we ask someone to send a waiter to us, and he checked on the other tables again and left. We walked out.

8fVcdhhTqQugtL0KsqkWNQ.text: From SF- 2nd time here and this time for my birthday-hubby's present for me!!!! Love love love this place. pitcher of Sangria....of course!!! but try infused vodka martini! Soooo awesome. Food-gotta try stuffed dates- of the hook! We had 4 other dishes- -also of the hook! Thanks to our friend Andrew for recommending this place! Also our server, Lalo, thank u for taking care of us and for my birthday flan!!! U r awesome!!!!

wzwXcTHZznRV4jH6LqcmpA.text: Was in town in Vegas for a short get away trip with my girlfriends and wanted to go back to Firefly since we remember the food was awesome from the previous visit before the restaurant moved to a bigger and nicer place (few doors down), but this time it was a disappointment. Sorry Firefly.. Your service was good since it was a late lunch, and it wasn't crowded, but your food has changed and not how we remembered it. We each ordered 2 dishes (total 12) plus a paella. Every thing was mediocre except for the scallop with butter and garlic sauce, the mussels, and the salads.. But other dishes either were too sweet (the ribs, shrimps, octopus), and the paella was not even close to be ok. It wasn't your thing. It has too much tomato sauce which causes the dish too wet, and the mussels, clams, shrimp were too dried. Hmm.. Not sure if we would come back here again for the good old time.. You had it going, but not sure what went wrong?? Did you change the chef or just simply because of the expansion that made it go out of hand? Hope you could pull it together so i could recommend others when they're in town because the new place looks awesome with good decor and vibe.

TJ6J-XPiJB9zt39LOeOnaw.text: Second time here and it will not be the last. Happy hour is the time to go. Enjoyed all the food. Service was a little distant and I'm still not sure if I enjoyed that or not. The food I did enjoy and the atmosphere.

qv31Iy4NFwSTAg2ErzBuRg.text: My husband and I just went there for lunch today and it was extremely disappointing. We ordered a veggie paella because we missed the paella we tried there couple years ago. So after 40 mins passed, the paella came with so little rice, and it was really more like a stir fried veggie instead of paella. Paella is a rice dish, there should have been a reasonable amount of rice but there was really not much rice! I remember they gave more than that years ago. And I have eaten paella in various restaurants, so I know how a paella should be. The paella today at Firefly was absolutely ridiculous. It was like a stir fried veggie with little rice sprinkled on it and then stirred together. We felt totally cheated. We didn't send it back because we didn't want to wait another 40 mins. And we totally lost faith in this place so we didn't bother to ask them for making a new one or ordering some other tapas instead. I ended up not touching the paella after 2 bites, and my husband ate the whole thing; he was able to finish it by himself because there was hardly any rice to make him full. the menu said paella is meant for 2-4 people, so u can imagine how little rice there was when my husband could finish it by himself! Compared with the paella we got there years ago, we couldn't finish the whole thing together years ago, while my husband can finish the sorry pathetic "paella" today by himself. It was really jacked up and we got out of there as soon as my husband finished it, and now we are sitting in another restaurant to get fed. We will not go back to Firefly again, it was not like what we had years ago. I never see any paella with so little rice in it in my whole life! Totally not an honest business. $20 for a stir fried veggie looking paella was totally wrong!

NyBywH1ngHex7BzoNgkt8A.text: Good stuff! Delicious tapas at this place, with great atmosphere, convenient off-the-strip location, etc. This place should definitely be on your list if you're heading to Vegas. The short ribs, Mac and cheese, and empanadas were all great.

1w4OP-la-5PfANVZ1uWZ4g.text: Oh wow!  Choco tres leches.  Brought 1/2 dozen buddies with me and we all had a blast, everyone was impressed.  Each dish was better than the last.  We'll definitely be back next month.

7tLnjuOdRjKpslzZqgejQw.text: I heard bad things about this place, but don't listen!!! It's was amazing, went with friends and we each ordered something different. Best thing was the artichoke toast. Loved it!!! The sangria was also incredible. It had apples which are my favorite! Defiantly gonna come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed peppers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria!!!

2ZWdF1BV5H1vjCTfvHoD7Q.text: The garlic bread and almond butter is always delicious but I was disappointed with my tapas this time. I ordered a mushroom tart and it was super greasy and the tart was hard. I looked frozen and re-heated. It was hard to cut pieces to eat it and I've had this dish before, it's always been light and flaky. I also ordered flan and that was so-so. The flan caramel was runny but it was ok. The presentation was nice.   I will say, though, the new location is very nice and stylish.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom tart

61jqs8dfpo2_zDAZqQm13w.text: Met some friends here for a birthday party...she loves it here...I came for the company.  First of all, parking is retarded here.  If you don't care about people parking your car, DO THE FREE VALET.  I drove my boat back there trying to find a parking space, and I couldn't find ONE space I felt comfortable leaving my car.  I ended up parking in the hotel parking lot next door and walked over after leaving the frustration known as Firefly's parking lot.  I wanted the Firefly fries that I've grown to enjoy...They come with Parmesan, Herbs, and an Aioli for $6.  Since I knew I was gonna order another plate or two in addition to the fries, I decided just to spend the money for the steak and fries :P  14oz Ribeye ($20): Red Wine Sauce, Cabrales Bleu Cheese, Firefly Fries and Aioli. Surprisingly large ribeye for the money! It was a good steak, cooked perfectly, but the sauce/seasoning was a little distracting. Still good though!  However, the fries were undercooked and stupid oily.  Like "dripping off your fingers" OILY.  I should have returned them, but my steak was cooked perfectly, and I thought it was a waste to turn over the plate.  They probably would have just brought me a new side of fries, but that's in hindsight.   So you can still get a decent value at Firefly...just factor in bad parking and a hint of inconsistency and you'll probably be fine!  Pics :

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closeup of the Ribeye!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14oz Ribeye ($20): Red Wine Sauce, Cabrales Bleu Cheese, Firefly Fries and Aioli. Surprisingly large ribeye for the money! Good!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Bread...tasty! A bit of spice from the butter as well :)

aJpjvOLtcGWKeNlYT52X8w.text: We had great service with drinks and water always staying full! All the tapas were delicious and their vegan menu was great for all our vegan friends.

InHYyU0ZMzP3ZTL_W3A-Yg.text: Headed this way after  a late of bowling.  Happy hour  11pm to close -1pm m- th. Able to taste a few things that i would not normally order at full price. Apples manchego- pleasantly freshing apple salad with cheese crumbles  tossed in a vinegrette. Steak and mushrooms  on a stick was amazing.. moist with a drizzle of a flavorful  beef and red wine sauce.  Ceviche was right on point with avocado and home made chips .

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and mushroom on a stick
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm spinach salad
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo plate

KJMx3ibn95uZc2JvYsuwGw.text: Fun place, excellent Tapas place in Las Vegas, Oscar Martinez and Carlos Villanueva are wonderful servers.  What a wonderful evening and service after driving for 8 hours from Bryce Canyon thru Zion National Parks.  Reasonable prices and excellent food

5o1uTcWF-r7pNxwdAlU-TA.text: Wow.... From the hot thin slices garlic bread to the fiery shrimp Diablo, your taste buds will scream with delight.  The ceviche had large pieces of fish and had the perfect acid balance.  The stuffed bacon wrapped dates are a must order.  Don't forget to order a traditional mojito and a flan for dessert!  Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates, bacon wrapped
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito

iOnhcuBnuTEtYGK7IrGKdA.text: Great environment, decor, and drinks. Menu is very unique. Vanessa was very nice and knowledgeable about the menu.

xwjkhLjIqoQZ8cX-5VRKXw.text: Another wonderful night at firefly. We come to Las Vegas every year for a convention. We came here last year and it was wonderful so we decided to try it again. Our waiter Mario was such a sweetheart. He was super efficient and polite.  The food was wonderful as always. This time one of our plates was a garden vegetable salad with dried cherries and heart of palm. It was fabulous! The roasted dates are always one of those things you just have to get. The manager Eduardo came to our table several times just to make sure everything was alright. It didn't hurt that they we both adorable. Very efficiently run and all the staff are just so nice!Thank you again for a wonderful evening.

XmivRjyiBXW0J7Nm3NPTVQ.text: At the bar and this place is live!!! Patrick and Omar are BEAST!!! They work the Bar! Awesome customer service and I my wife and I felt VIP. Definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a good place with Great Service, Food,  & Drinks!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar Area!

Y4O2hlVycOxQvmLKsp89ow.text: I love the variety of food choices here. Great atmosphere, location, pricing, and the staff is always professional. You can go dressed up after a show or dressed down from running errands. It's appealing to all walks of life.

cuS_GM627cHXYqQ4ol0RgQ.text: Went back a second time a few weeks later, and unfortunately it wasn't as good as the first visit.  The service from our main server was very impersonal and infrequent (although another person who was mostly serving drinks and floating around the whole room was very friendly and helpful).  Also, the food seemed less well flavored and presented.  Perhaps the kitchen staff was different that night.  I would try it a third time, but I would lower my expectations a bit.

zFscmgjn0cLDeE_mI5RYsw.text: The entire experience was fantastic. Love the atmosphere and the food was all delicious. Really enjoyed the vegetable empanadas. The goat cheese, the lamb the shrimp tempura and the bacon wrapped date. Oh and desserts! Loved the cherry chocolate bread pudding and the dessert plate with the tarts!! Yummy! I can't wait to come back and try some more things. One if the most yummy meals I've had in a while.

nRPTPlnUIIYtTo7Xtow6FQ.text: Okay so it wad hard enough going into this place the first time after all the trouble the company had had with the health department , but hey, i try to keep an open mind so we went for it.   Honestly (surprisingly enough) the food was hands down the saving grace of this place. The stuffed dates were insanely good and everything from fries to steaks was well cooked, expertly seasoned and of decent portion size.
