However, and i wish i knew his name (a big muscular guy, maybe late 20s), the bartender was so incredibly rude--and openly so!-- that instead of moving on to entrees like we wanted to, we cashed out and left.   I wont go into the drawn out details of it all, but trust me when i say i was shocked how clear he made it to us that our business was neither wanted nor appreciated. Its not like the bar or well was even busy. If it was negligence due to that, i could have understood...  Well, we liked the food so much though that we decided to give it a second chance a couple weeks later. But, when we walked in and saw the same bartender with his signature eye roll and snarky comment as our only greeting, we quickly regretted it and left.   So then, it really is a shame, because the food is killer. If you decide to go, i recommend getting a table and bypassing the bar. We wont be back though.

wFn8cngnbo2ctFZYZi76Ig.text: After a long road trip we stopped to grab a bite. Delicious! We had the tomato bread with Serrano ham, chicken croquets, shrimp ceviche, chicken tinga dish, and a flan. Amazing food, flavorful, fresh, was brought to our table at an amazing speed. The waiters and waitresses were extremely attentive, our drink never went empty. I'm sad I found this gem of a place so far from where I live. But any time I'm back in Vegas this will be my first and last stop.

mkGnz3QguS7H0Hr7cfmsEw.text: I love love LOVE Firefly!!! The food is absolutely delicious, the drinks impeccably refreshing, and the service is speedy. I have never tried a dish that I didn't like, but my favorites and first to recommend would be the Stuffed Dates, Ahi Tuna Skewers, Steak and Mushroom Skewers, Petite Filet Mignon, Stuffed Peppers, and Chocolate Tres Leches Cake. Try it and love it too!

wOgSPKkdw8m_cCIdbmkPZQ.text: I've been coming here since 2012 and I've never been disappointed! I'm so glad this place is open and successful in their business the food is great! So many flavors put into each plate. And oh my gosh the almond butter is to die for ((if any foodies can figure out the recipe please let me know )) anyways this place is great whether you're dressy or casual! Each plate is priced differently so it depends on what you order my friend and I spent 50$ all together for 5 plates :) the camarones a la diabla is so gooooooood and it's not really spicy it actually has a Sezchuan taste to it. Well that's my opinion anyways if you like a sweet chili sauce then you'll love the shrimp  can't wait to be back here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch date! Apple manchego salad toast and almond butter camarones a la diabla camarones al ajillo Parmesan fries

sKPsqnVm0Mmt639ovn7yvA.text: This little hidden gem is found right outside the strip.  The service was amazing, the food was AMAZING!! We will definitely dine here again when we come back for another Vegas trip! Everything was so fresh!  Pictures are posted for some of the amazing dishes we enjoyed that afternoon!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Paella
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo clams
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartare

XnUxgtRf6UJS-2pTNumiBw.text: When I first arrived at Firefly I didn't see the signs for parking in the rear so I thought it was really empty.  I parked in the rear and had to walk past the dumpster with a man rummaging through it.    I sat at the bar.  The redheaded server was very sweet and know her menu items.  I was especially impressed when she told me what looked good out of the kitchen that night. I started with the Salmon Toasts.  They had very good flavors but tasted very similar to bagel and loxs(should have listened to the waitress). The second dish I ordered was the shrimp Diablo.  The sauce was a perfect mix of spicy and sweet.  The shrimp were cooked perfectly.   The third dish I ordered was the lamb chops.  They too were delicious.  I would not recommend them if you're in a large party.   Overall the food was good.  The service was great.  One critique would be the presentation of the dishes.  They could have made them look a little better with the small plates.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Toasts

SzbDhGivvEn-7iNhGVzicg.text: The food was great. We had the tomato-basil soup, Grilled Veggies, Firefly fries, and warm spinach salad. The house Sangria was awesome as well.  It was a nice sunny day and they have a nice patio!  Service - meh. The waiter brought in 2 wrong dishes even though we asked questions about those dishes before ordering. By the time the food arrived, we had already waited more than 30 minutes.  I guess the worst part of the experience was that I was charged double the actual amount that I signed for. I called to correct this, and they were very nice, friendly and apologetic but its more than a month later and I still don't have a refund. My advice would be to check your bill twice and make sure you keep a copy in case you need to dispute it later.

5Xbuj1gm0iSNcnxqaKdzMw.text: Had the petite filet and it was amazing!! The flavor was mouth drooling! Also had the white sangria which was delicious as well! Definitely going to be back! Decor was cool too

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7e6bEhqMPg7HlHlcuTx7Ag.text: Firefly, I really do love you. They have some great tapas, if you're in town, you need to stop in. The stuffed dates are so good. I highly recommend the red sangria, it's really good. My favorite item to get is the steak and mushroom skewers, they're cooked in a red wine reduction; and it's amazing.   The only reason I couldn't give 5 stars is because of the service. The service is pretty terrible at best. Everyone looks annoyed to be there, and the servers tend to disappear after you order only to be briefly replaced by what they call, an assistant server. They look even more annoyed that the regular servers.   Firefly, please hire some better servers. The service needs to be comparable to the food!

sINoLGjb_RqKp9ItiafYjQ.text: LOVE. Pure deliciousness. What a treat! We were with a huge group so I think we ordered everything on the menu and everything was incredible. There was nothing I didn't like. What stands out a week later is... the artichoke on crustini, burrata-tomato-lettuce thing, meatballs, and the steak skewers. But really everything was great. Also the SANGRIA is amazing. We were very happy. They also didn't seem to mind that one of our friends was beyond drunk as we all laughed hysterically. Very fun night.   So sad there's not one in California.  Boo.

CfIgisCF62QZoUH2MYbGYg.text: One of the best kept secrets in Vegas!  The food here yummy and the prices are much better than those fancy steak houses on the strip.  The sangria isn't strong but is delicious!  I recommend if you plan on coming here, make reservations.  It can get busy.

lD_h7uxxti8Aqs5Mfiw8GQ.text: We went there last night as a group. My friends wanted tapas and I found this place online. I also asked around and the feelings were all positive. The reason I didn't give a 5star is because they auto added a gratuity. I truly despise that. This is Vegas and hospitality and guest service are expected. All interactions like this should be 5star no matter where you go. That being said, lets talk about the food. ITWAS SOOOO GOOD.  there was 6 of us and we all ordered 3 tapas so u can imagine what our table looked like. I didn't get the waiters name, slight deduction for that as well, but he made suggestions to me based on what my friends ordered and they were spot on. i got to try the shrimp tempura, the filet, the steak on a stick, the ahi tuna, the scallops, empanada ( chicken ), stuffed pepper, the spanish chorizo, the ham, and the mini bagles and salmon. everything was so good. had a stella draft. it was kind of tiny to be honest and this is coming from a non-drinker. either way yo will not be disappointed !  the amount of food they put on each plate is actually pretty significant. enjoy !!!

0XPjhg3CTduj_A4uyFWS5g.text: Great affordable tapas!  I love their sparkling sangria and their honey almond butter. I ate two platefuls of it this time around.   My go-to's are the the tuna tartare and the mixed paella. Make sure you order the paella early on so you don't have to wait too long.   This time we had Jaime serving our table along with our main server and he was amazing. Someone give him a promotion! He never let me see the bottom of my water glass and that is very rare. He even stopped another server from taking away my lemon wedges because he knew I wasn't done with them.   Good food, good prices.

xe8CLZsP6HU_dlBQ1d5Vlw.text: Came here for HH with a friend who's local.  And oh my gosh. the food!  The HH is amazing, super awesome deals and great food to choose from.  I would definitely suggest the bacon wrapped dates, it's insane how good it tastes!!  I would recommend it for the HH for sure, not sure about the regular hours   Super nice place too :)

LD5WYiEo9OjPvA0Bwn9AWg.text: As part of a Bachelorette party package (where the limo takes us to a restaurant and then to a nightclub), we went to Firefly last year in May.  We had 14 girls in our group.  We all ordered different items and we all shared different dishes with one another... the food and service was amazing.  I want to say that nearly every dish out of the 5 that I tried was very good! One year later, I was craving Firefly again because I had such fond memories of how delicious the food was.   Once again, I wasn't disappointed.  The food was as good as I remember, the service was great and I believe you get a good deal for your money.  I highly recommend this place.  It's slightly off the Vegas strip, but worth the trip!

YYekVgPveb_FqYsGbA_Low.text: The smoked salmon bagels and ceviche of shrimp were both a hit with my friend and I. The bar serves drinks with style and a little something extra each time. It's definitely a cute place to bring someone out for a fun little date night.

DNvou-FRLgya7uXUkryymQ.text: i can't come to vegas and not stop here.  their drinks are amazing and whenever i am not in town, i am dreaming of their excellent mojitos. my favorite is the paradise.  i also enjoy their vast menu selection, their top notch service and the atmosphere.  they have recently expanded and there is even more seating- which has cut down on the wait time.

hTQWW4HxbyRVkNClDWa1cg.text: specially loved the Scallop escargot style YUM ask for more bread for the yummy garlic butter, also faves were warm spinach salad and the steak and shrimp skewers Patatas bravas not so much, the potatoes were not hot enough and the aioli had separated. Great mojito

PEV9_y2MNo3rS_HxpUm3lA.text: I was excited to come here after reading all of the reviews. I was in town on vacation, and many friends had recommended this place.   Thankfully, I made a reservation. There was a huge line when we arrived. I liked the feel of the restuarant, but wasn't blown away by the food. Maybe it's because I live in NYC and we have some amazing tapas places (Boqueria), but I wasn't so impressed. The sliders were delicious, but the paella left something to be desired. It was dry and not very flavorful.   I wouldn't come back to the restaurant when I am on vacation, but if I was a local, I could see myself coming back for drinks. Seems like a great place for a date.

Uf-PfNFuu3nLQxZoz0rMvw.text: Yum, yum, yum. I want more. Everything we ate was AMAZING. We ordered so many items, I cannot remember them all, but everything was delicious. I do remember the bacon wrapped dates, they were mouth watering!  I highly recommend this place.  Great food, great vibe.  I don't live in Vegas, but when I visit, I MUST go here!

_5gPoZ1wLwwIpC5vC-Kasg.text: If you are staying by the convention center, this is the place to eat. Simply put, fantastic food.

R_HpiwgKtPr4b8pJLgN9Qg.text: Amazing describes my dinner with my husband. We pretty much had little to no wait time and are at the bar. The bartender was super nice. Good was affordable, fast, and filling. The octopus was to die for and the passion fruit cheesecake is a great way to finish the meal. I am dreaming about it as I wrote now.

Q4eEfmR5ncKM2Yk2gQpRMQ.text: Oh dear! The Gazpacho! The Mac & Cheese! The Flan! The Passion - Fruit Cheesecake! Yum! But really the Stuffed Peppers are to melt for. Whoa! Oh, and the Sangria...... delicious.

wdcp73Id_kgIA65K-pqvpg.text: We found this restaurant on Yelp. It looked like it would be reasonably priced and had four star review.  We were not disappointed in fact we give it five stars! The service was so friendly and attentive. They were very busy but you need to expect to sit and relax at a place like this and enjoy the ambience and the social time...  The small plate of food items were fabulous. Their bacon wrapped dates were very good. I think our waiter's name was Roger. He was a sweetheart. The manager came over and he was very charming as well. Thank you firefly for a great evening!!!!

UmHGjVsiRTS184mMquhmVA.text: The food is hit or miss.  From all the good reviews I was expecting spectacular, but I got average at best.  I ordered some calamari to go and when I ate it the food was way under-cooked and rubbery.  I called up and left a message, explaining what happened and they offered me a refund, but I declined and told them I would like the calamari again, but this time cooked right.  I cooked up some Fettuccine Alfredo and picked up the calamari and it may have been a little less rubbery, but it was still undercooked and I could not eat it neither time.

Mr1SkTujkBsrAHveYCGB-A.text: Some of the best tapas in the country. Happy hour is awesome for drinks. Huge selection of tapas on the regular menu. Infused vodkas, mojitos, all excellent and reasonably priced for Vegas. We went 5 times during our 5 days here

ghuvm-8dn0dGQH9JRdWEFw.text: Everything that other people recommended was superb.  Bacon dates, stuffed peppers, Diablo shrimp, manchego salad, Serrano sliders.   Just go with others recommendations and come with friends!

fQpcF9Yx7fHHNYmhkQpFVA.text: One of the best meals in Vegas! We order multiple plates to share,  the bacon wrapped dates were first, savory and sweet. The we're the fries, I recommend the parmasean dipping sauce, we have to get a second (it was that good).  The Pork chops and chicken were flavorful, the mac and cheese was a must! Service was a little slow and the server could have been around more the food made it with it!

wj5Bqxhmdq0Ody5e77vvhg.text: Just love this restaurant...great staff, great food and they serve Stella Artois.

tm86s99D3mnEkaSO99X06w.text: Great tapas! The atmosphere was up scale causal. It is just off the strip so it was easy to get to and had a bit more relaxed atmosphere. Favorite dishes were the scallops escargot and rib eye.

1EppLBgoS84qMK0fWErVwg.text: Firefly is an AMAZING place to eat and drink.  Service is always amazing and our server today, Patrick, was crazy good.  Come by and see him at the bar for some delicious mojitos and good conversation.  Try the Chorizo stuffed mushrooms, steamed mussels and Passion Fruit mojitos. Freaking bomb!

n1M7GyP59W1E06Qy1m25zA.text: Food was delicious, as always but the service was NOT good. Our waitress was named Rachael I think? Something like that, idk. Took 10 minutes to even come to the table. My boyfriend and I side tipped the busser. He did all the work. If I didn't LOVE Firefly, you can bet I'd never go there again.

hDqHlutOuNrZOtPpGHtZLg.text: Really good sangria; food is really good. Nice venue for a party or a small social gathering with friends.

_WKd5l8VaB9yWTyECQqhBw.text: We went a a month ago to celebrate my partner's birthday. Carlos was our server and he was extremely professional and polite and made our experience very pleasant and enjoyable! The manager came by to check on us and after we gushed about Carlos he gave the table a round of shots!

7x8LicnPpxyvdtGq_lAx3Q.text: I love this spot!!! My girl loves the Sangria, and you can't go wrong with the Paella. They kill it. Service isn't 100% though, had to ask a few times for some things. Otherwise good spot.

JMROpyimLK1lROm9JllFBA.text: Where am I?? Barcelona! Amazing tapas and delightful sangria. Loved the padron peppers, shrimp ceviche, eggplant cannelloni, camerone al ajillo and empanadas.  New favorite Vegas dining location! Great service and upbeat atmosphere.

6kAJW7msPSm85WBU5KYJcg.text: I went to Firefly with some family visiting from out of town. I have experienced tapas restaurants before but never this one. There were four of us and we chose two dishes each and then shared them around the table. Everything was well prepared and tasty. If I had to pick a personal favorite from our choices, I would be between naming the goat cheese or shrimp. That said, everything was good and with multiple choices everyone at the table found things they liked and things they really liked. We finished with a dessert sampler that was also very good. The service was prompt, courteous, and helpful. The price was in line with expectations, about $120 for four satisfied people with tip. Overall, this was a good lunch experience. The only negative is that it is right behind the LV strip so traffic can be a little daunting. That's not the restaurant's fault though. It just is the way of life in Las Vegas.

62uvVvs3h2lLcWR9oPlKGw.text: I've been to this location once, the location on the west side of town, and the one they closed down the street from this one. I'm not sure what happened, their service used to be top notch at the closed location. The placing of the tables in this new location are awkwardly away from everyone, so much so you seem so far from everything (especially your server). The atmosphere is red dim light and art all over but you can't really appreciate it since it's too dark to be able to tell what things are, or the color of food on your plate. I always get the sangria pitcher, which is my favorite. Red or white, both good. Dates wrapped in bacon with blue cheese is still a favorite of mine. The salmon toast aren't that good in my opinion. The rest of the menu of good too. Depends on what you like more, sweet or salty. I haven't been back here and probably won't be for a while. However, I'm hoping my next visit reminds me why I used to go here so often.

uTzMxXqAWBj9pMb35NNL2Q.text: Awesome food and better service! Just happened to stop by because it was close to our hotel and so glad we did! My wife and I both had the petite filet and it was better than some of the five star places we went. The scallops were also awesome! Very cool atmosphere it is a little loud though. We didn't mind, just wanted to mention that it isn't the best place for a quiet date. You can find people dressed up for a bachelor/bachelorette party or just in jeans. Cool place with great food and service!

QRblAKHOtT6d2AKmOpqeOQ.text: I would just like to say that I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT! I discovered it a few years ago and every single time I come to Vegas I make it a priority to come and eat here. I live in Southern California, don't get me wrong, I frequent a few tapas places, but firefly really has it going on! I am obsessed with the bacon wrapped dates, the fantastic chorizo clams, stuffed peppers, MAC n cheese, petite filet is bomb!!!! Even the butter for the bread is amazing!!! I just got back from my bachelorette party out there and I am telling you that even my burbs were delicious after dinner. Haha!!! I can't wait til my next visit to Vegas so I can indulge in all the deliciousness firefly has to offer! To add one more thing... The berry infused vodka drinks they have are tasty and get you smashed! Until next time xoxo

gql-L0wbUPuj_5ltCObt2Q.text: My girlfriend and I love coming to firefly on our nights off together. We always sit at the bar and make sure to come when Athena is working. She always makes sure we have the best time and have everything we need! Her food suggestions are always on point, not to mention the delicious drinks! She works so efficiently and never makes us feel like she's rushed. We will definitely keep coming back here.

Mzs8mbQMOj5PLgbUIPdDQQ.text: My hubby and I love spanish tapas!! Its hard to find a reasonably priced in Los Angeles or Orange County California. So I was excited and we enjoyed all the food immensely. They were even very considerate of my hubby's shrimp allergy and made the paella with a chicken/beef broth ( I think). Next time we are in LV we will absolutely eat there. I also enjoyed because my daughter was able to eat a variety of things too.

3ofEPdlU82moSmwTw-1U8w.text: What a great fun place to come with anyone. The food is excellent I definitely have tried almost all the things on the menu. The vegetarian selection is pretty good and don't forget about those drinks the white sangria is definitely my favorite. Fun place love the atmosphere great location.

-9sny4LeWzu-ALsiP_8ihA.text: The bartender gives the men free beer & she's nice to look at. The food was good and the atmosphere was good.

ticGQnd8-rhra_GywkHxBg.text: A good tad bit noisy, but awesome food at great pricing.  The drinks were awesome as well; not watered down and incredibly great pricing.  (Example:  we paid $11 for a glass of cranberry& vodka and a Midori sour.  2 hours later, we paid double for the exact same drinks at a Latin Club although the drinks weren't bigger or better tasting). The Ceviche was amazing.  The Spicy Shrimp tasted perfectly sweet yet had a nice follow up "bite" lol.  The stuffed dates lived up to their reputation.  We are definitely coming back to this place!!!

WJfmd6tPDf0uGyRIAcJUXw.text: The fid was good.  We had the Albondigas meatballs, baked goat cheese, petite filet, ham and cheese croquetas, chicken skewers, and the chocolate tres Leche cake.  All were pretty good, the skewers were dry and the petite filet was pretty so-so,but everything else was great.  I highly recommend the baked goat cheese.  Service was slow, and my waiter spoke brown English.  The dished were staggered but still really slow and I never got my second drink.

6q2HxMxvi2TONefcsXPB5A.text: Great sangria (the red one especially), delicious paella (though it takes a while to be cooked), and unforgettable tapas...

lj-aPg0YVj4bbnDrCI3cVg.text: If you're looking for tapas in Vegas, this is the place to go! My friends and I came here for dinner one night and ordered the Mixed Paella and 4 tapas to share. We also ordered a pitcher of Sangria. The Sangria was light and sweet. The Paella takes about 40 minutes to prepare so make sure you order that with your waiter as soon as you sit down!   They bring out a nice garlic herb bread with sweet almond butter while you are waiting for your food. my party ordered the ceviche, tuna tartare with taro chips, bacon-wrapped stuffed dates, and pulpo asado (grilled octopus). All of the tapas were delicious and left us craving for more but we knew not to order any more while we waited on our paella. The paella came out and it was huge! I do not understand how a paella serves 2-4 people. I cannot imagine 2 people sharing a whole paella. The paella was good with a nice assortment of seafood and meats. However, it was a little disappointing that the paella didn't have any soccarat at all. I understand that it was probably because they were in a rush to serve us since we were sitting there with no food after we finished our tapas. However, I would have rather waited for the paella to finish cooking fully.   Overall, good food, good service and nice atmosphere/decor! I would definitely just stick with the tapas next time though.   P.S. it is a little pricey but it's Vegas, right?

AZXQi_uPQiEXkpQak41cMQ.text: I have been to Spain and had tapas before this place is as good as it get in the states. The name is perfect cause it is fire!!!!!

d8EoVEWsNTon5F_cRGJ63g.text: This place is awesome, all finger foods, great for an outing with the friends or family. The chicken skewers, and stuffed dates are to die for and the mango bbq babyback ribs are some of the best ribs I've ever had. Prices are ok, but all in all this is a super enjoyable spot, and I highly recommend.

Y8pHlRwbnesQiWOegXtFbw.text: This place is mouthwateringly great! All the good things I've heard and read on about this place is nothing but all True! You have to come check it out yourself really to judge it but I can promise you won't be disappointed at all! Great atmosphere great food great drinks and most of all service is absolutely impeccable! Will be back in the future!

ifb4VBaJZSZzG03rHYqdJA.text: I love going here with my friends, and my sister. Cannot wait to bring my boyfriend on our next date. This place offers the best happy hour deals for the best mojitos and sangrias in the world. They are strong enough and delicious at the same time. The service could be a hit or miss sometimes, but mostly good. They refill your drinks before you need them and have really good foods as well. I personally love their bread and almond butter. Their bacon wrapped dates are a bit sweet but definitely a must try on the menu. Although the paellas take awhile, they are definitely worth every minute of wait as well. I wish they opened another location near my house so I could go more often!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas- meatballs. Just typical
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates with almond. yum
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna ceviche. Never fails

gDIxswX3YJ5XfUs6ggLLGw.text: I'll keep this one short lol  AMAZING FOOD!!! I didn't know I could get full and happy off of tapas!!! Everything tasted great! I couldn't pick one thing over the rest to recommend because it was all good! Portion size was perfect for tapas!   Staff was friendly and engaging, the atmosphere was fun though a little loud for lunch time (probably because my husband, 4 month old and I got seated next to a party of 20!), the food was amazing, the drinks were good and the price was to be expected. You definitely pay for the quality and portion size.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this place!!!

tw0cmWOkpT-eSAdGwbD0ag.text: Another good meal but we were lucky enough to eat there at Happy Hour. Eight tapas and two drinks for $44 was a bargain. And we enjoyed most of our eight dishes.  Favorite is the bacon covered date with some sauce and cheese.  Service was excellent, everyone was nice and the place is classier than most.

wa-rlf20G60dhoaUf4dn3A.text: HOW RUDEEEE!!!  Came here w/ a couple of friends when they finished work & it was late happy hour. We decided to sit at the bar since that's where it seems like it was POPPIN... we sat at the edge near the well wear we could see all the drinks being made...  The 2 stars is for the food ALWAYS being AWSOME at any Firefly location but honestly your palate gets affected when other things affect your mood such as service.  We were greeted promptly ... we ordered some cocktails & one of the guys ordered a bulleit rye on rocks while my man ordered it w/water. They brought both w/ water. Mind that both our boys are bartenders & love their bourbon & know the flavors. BUT we saw the bartender pour just Bulleit Bourbon & not Bulleit rye... also because the bottle was still sitting on the display. The fact is he had the odosity to come & say we ordered wrong & even though it was our fault he would make a new one. We said forget it...it's fine. The boys decided they wanted one more... & again we were watching as the drink was being made.. he poured the regular Bulleit AGAIN!! Brought it over & said it was rye... UGH! ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?!?   APPLE & MACHENGO SALAD $3.50 - absolutely refreshing with thin julienne slices of green apple & some cheese w/toasted almonds & lightly dressed.  STUFFED DATES $3.50 - bacon wrapped w/ toasted almond to give a crunch... sprinkled w/ Bleu cheese crumbles & drizzled w/ red wine reduction. A MUST dish whenever you go into firefly!!  FIREFLY FRIES $4 - large bowl of fries thin & crispy w/ seasoning.  Sadly DEFINATELY will not be back to this location...

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple &amp; Machengo Salad HH 3.50

_NzzDFOaZv57Wp9a90xPZQ.text: So good! Went there because it was within walking distance of my hotel. Ordered way too much food, the sizes were very generous. Had a pitcher of very delicious sangria. Service was stellar & I would come back again.

06YeaAV6PNne7IKPWZUJFA.text: My wife and I had a great meal here. This location has some unique flavor combinations that I would recommend to all. Starting with the bread they serve with all plates included roasted red pepper infused butter. Awesome!! Stuffed picquillo peppers with a garlic cream cheese over a tomato sauce. Wow!! Chicken tinga empanadas are a must try. While Spanish food is not generally spicy the tinga sauce does have a bite to it. I do like eating spicy food and requested something hot to complete my meal. The server,Mario, had no problem with the request and brought back roasted and chopped sorrano peppers. Really good customer service. This is another one of my must try locations to all of you visiting Vegas.

bLw9-1YtuL6TBHiNiyT4rA.text: Best tapas options available if you want to try multiple dishes. Lots of variety. Four stars for good taste.

Bb0vcUDWHXFN3c8Uo1TmLA.text: Amazing happy hour. Lots of great vegetarian options. Good mojitos, easy location with lots of parking. :) what else does one need. The eggplant and stuffed shells tapas are my fav.

MRm-KRMXOvMN7CnqfYmkqA.text: Best place for tapas the stars wrapped in bacon are my absolute fav along with the mussels in a creamy tomato sauce is also amazing but the thing I go for is the sangria it is to die for every time I go on vacation to Vegas I make sure I stop here it's a must

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful painting all over the place I love the vibe

kyf9Qt8pEGoD-UgGh3u97A.text: It's been awhile but the food quality remains awesome!! A lot of tapas to choose and we ordered 5 and they were all delicious & flavorful. Red wine Sangria a must try!!! Finished up with the chocolate tres leche. I couldn't give 5 stars because the service was not great. Our server, Ivan came to our table...no greetings, no introduction, no smile. Basically asked us "Anything to drink?". Took our order, delivered the food and didn't come back to ask how's the food, need anything...we had to flag him down to order more tapas. It was disappointing and it was not busy at 9:30 pm. Nevertheless, we will return because the food is just too good

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tierra y mar (chorizo, steak &amp; shrimp) with aioli sauce
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lamb chops
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tres leche

X57B1PD2An--2CooNDhjvQ.text: The paella had little flavor and tasted salty. The manchego mac and cheese was good but could of used more browning on the top and a hint of spice to cut the cheese. The tuna skewers were overcooked. Not sure how they have received 4.5 Stars this restaurant does not have the flavors to warrant 4.5 Stars.

IbecfBm9R1pWmtpAm-6ATg.text: This place is our new spot! The Fly Tai is super addictive and hits the spot! The service is so on point that they refilled my bf's Arnold Palmer 3 times throughout our dinner, immediately provided a new knife for me when mine fell, and quickly came to retrieve each dish and glass that was no longer in use (Thanks Mario and Lenny). I have tried so many dishes, I wouldn't know where to begin! All I can say is that when a restaurant has a separate vegetarian menu and the dishes come out delicious and in under 20 minutes - I'm impressed!  I heard they had some issues before, but they have truly made up for what ever errors took place in the past and have continued to surpass my expectations for service, food, and ambiance on multiple occasions.

bUYxk78UdzJSd0akNfNKwg.text: The food was amazing! We ordered nine different tapas and shared them all between three people- that along with a pitcher of sangria- it was plenty!!  Favorites: Steak skewers, petit filet plate ($13!!!) both cooked to a perfect Medium rare  The Apple salad was perfect - and plentiful! The shrimp cheviche  was the best I've ever had!!  Also yummy: Baked goat cheese Chicken salad Artichokes toast  It was very busy, my critique would be that I called to make reservations the day before, a left a message and they never called me back. I made reservations through open table and ta-da! Rsvp's for a party of 3 at 7:30 was confirmed.  This is a *must* try place when visiting Vegas!

pYAZind4IinewDyFLUukhg.text: The happy hour is fantastic! The mojitos were "Bomb- tasting". If you have 3 or more people - buy a pitcher!!! The dates, Chicken skewer and pork empanadas were so tasty. The parking lot had a security guard so I felt my car was safe. The staff were friendly and the restrooms were clean! I am definitely coming back!!!

ZJbNBzbisHJ5BUFoHPB5kA.text: Went to this place earlier with my bestie. It was both our first time here and i must say food was really good. Was able to enjoy the happy hour and it was all worth it. Had a drinks named The New Girl, it was bomb. Babyback ribs and chicken skewers was delicious and tasty.  i will definitely come back.

6U4VCIIjL16vqudoeJM-Bg.text: The food here is the best. Every tapa is we had was delicious. The dates was the great. The lamb chops and lentil were the best. Along with the steak and mushrooms. Steak was tender and the mushrooms were great. Dessert was great. Have to try to chocolate cherry bread pudding. This will become a place I visit every time. The service was top notch. Our server Mario was outstanding and very knowledgable with his recommendations. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke toast
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and mushrooms

FGeZhqfqMJidDYj_WBJoyQ.text: This place is amazing, small plates of great food to share. A really fun atmosphere and great food. The staff is incredible, the food comes to the table as it is ready, they do a great job of keeping everything straight. They keep the table clear of empty plate and make sure your drinks are always full. All of this at a very reasonable price!! For dessert the chocolate tres leches cake was fantastic.

Lf7Bp2YLzg8hB7D0pk8I-A.text: I am mostly disappointed that I was expecting 4.5 star food and service but left not impressed and not wanting to ever comeback. You see I gave this place another chance after the salmonella issue they had last year which forced them to shutdown. Food was lackluster at best and service was hmmm? That was no service..3 strikes and your out

_kFxibfuiqkK2_9FlPbINQ.text: Not bad but bring your appetite. Reservation via OpenTable is recommended but do go back to the lady seating ppl when your reservation time is due because it gets busy and she might forget.  Paella was big and really good.  All the recommendations on Yelp were good as promised, including grilled octopus.  Full bar so order your heart out but be prepared to expect no conversation- the place is loud and at dinner time there are lots of people.  Still worth it - dinner for with Mixed Paella $76 (3 tapas, dessert, 2 coffees and a drink).

NAeaqk-ZaTFxWkWlVLartA.text: Love this place!!! Me and my husband went here for an early dinner one week and were so happy with the service the food and even the prices. A friend was telling me how this restaurant was once shut down for health violations but don't panic its under new ownership :)   Our waitress was a super friendly women who checked in on us often and let us order as we go. Not something I recommend if your really hungry, the food did take a little longer coming out then I had hoped.  And its best to come with friends and share you plate.  But I do recommend that you order the desert platter its to die for!

0cQm3dqMp3idDfo3PDlOSQ.text: I must admit that I was a bit weary to dine here given that they were shut down in the past due to severe food poisoning, but a really good friend wanted to eat here and since it was her celebration and ultimately her decision, I went along with it. Another friend, who was also part of the group that ate with me, came here on her birthday and had nothing but great things to say about this location and she didn't get sick from it then.   The parking was a bit confusing. Up front they have a valet area and in the back of the restaurant is self park. When entering the lot, there was no indication that the back parking lot is self park. Here is where I got confused--normally the parking in the front is reserved for self park and valet is sectioned off somewhere in the back. So I thought that the back parking was reserved for valet. I decided to valet my car since I couldn't figure out parking and it was just easier for me to drop my car off. When the valet parked my car in front of the restaurant, I thought that was interesting that I valeted my car to have it within walking distance.   We had reservations already made so we didn't wait at all for our table. Right from the start, our server came by and asked us if we wanted anything to drink and since we were still waiting on one more, we just asked for water for the meantime. We also placed an order of paella since that takes awhile to cook and we thought it wise to get it started. Other dishes ordered were the shrimp ceviche and calamari. We also ordered a pitcher of sangria for the table.   Reasons for the 3 stars: -parking could be better indicated for first time guests -the paella said it could serve 2-4 people. This could be True if more tapas are ordered along with it, but we ordered it as if it was the main dish. When I imagine paella, I think of a big serving of it! -the shrimp in the ceviche were whole. I'm used to ceviche being cut up in smaller pieces and I've had better ceviche at taquerias -it wasn't as busy as it could be, but we still had to wait around and ask for our check several minutes after they cleared our table  I would come here again to try other stuff on the menu. Maybe next time with better knowledge of the place I'll have a different experience. For my first time there I would say that it was ok, but it wasn't spectacular.

OifUutjwE9hqfwePTZmvgw.text: I used to give this place 5 stars but it has gone up in price, down in quality.... I would say it is a good deal for LV but only that....given the exorbitant costs of LV this isn't saying much.

np8QY8eKFp5KFGC7RB5RNw.text: Went for early dinner at Firefly yesterday and got phenomenal service by server Alejandro and mgr J. Eduardo. Tried all 3 sangrias and we decided the winner was the sparkling version (least sweet of the 3), although they're all above average, esp. the white. Scallop escargot was voted #1 of the 7 tapas we tried. I liked the bacon wrapped dates, but my husband liked the stuffed mushrooms better. Tierra Mar skewers were also fantastic. Bottom of the list was the mac 'n cheese which I thought was a little salty. Chocolate bread pudding w/ cherry, recommended by Alejandro, was also outstanding. Overall, a great night out w/ super service.

0_CHTo5YuFCrAXHL8tATzA.text: Best restaurant in Vegas! Our service was spectacular and so generous! Went for my sister's birthday and they gave her a free drink. She couldn't have been happier!! The food was absolutely delectable. Every single item on the menu that we ordered (we ordered a lot) was better than the last! Thanks Firefly for making my sister's 21st her best birthday to date!

wvM3sPB0N6NjhM-YAM5VNA.text: I was relatively unimpressed. The food was just mediocre, though the portions were great for sharing amongst the 4 of us. Some of the better dishes we had were the shrimp tempura and the beef and mushroom skewers. The calamari would have been better if they had used the same batter as the tempura. We went at an odd hour, so the place was pretty dead, but it's definitely spacious and would be great if they hosted weekly salsa nights or something, I'm not sure if they already do. The staff are very friendly and you can tell they really want you to have a positive experience. Unfortunately, I don't think I will be returning because there are plenty of other great choices in the vicinity.

A41s4_FW1k_Jj23g6NHSCg.text: Firefly catered a rehearsal dinner at my house. The guests could not say enough about how delicious the food was! Carlos, the manager, was wonderful to work with, and gave great recommendations and advice as to what to serve and how much. Even the delivery was perfect!  Jonathan was so nice and helpful!  I totally recommend Firefly for any event, and I will use them again!  Can't wait to go eat at the restaurant!

KZbixYdEErNMBDd2PcJNCQ.text: Another great experience at fireflies. Pepe and Vanessa were on point with service, and the food was amazing. One of the best spots to eat in Vegas, hands down. I recommend the pitcher of sangria and anything else on the menu.

x4cf31kJLIOo0hRCVgsbmg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try Firefly because we were in the area looking for brunch. We found out brunch is only on Sunday's but they made up for it. We ordered the fire fly fries to start, chicken skewers and the Tierra y Mar. Both were excellent! The chicken was fabulous and had so much flavor. The fries were delicious as well. Our server, Nahum was very helpful in offering suggestions. The atmosphere is relaxing and pleasant. Reasonably priced for the quality of food. Very impressed, will definitely be returning.

NrQrGB5nIXgi7dSfX4H3eQ.text: We went with a group of four and it was worth the short trip over! We split a few Tapas and then shared the Mixed Paella. The price was incredible, especially considering we were only a 10 minute walk away from the strip. $100, including tip, for 4 people, including drinks! Doesn't get any better than that. We have already suggested it to others and we will be back next time we are in the desert!

TTvoQ6Lcan5Rlri_w6g3PQ.text: This place have stale food which is microwaved when you complain it is cold. I could not believe they reheated our skewers in microwave instead of making new ones. these came out chewy and cold inside. It is pathetic, how can they charge $15 for a plate and not have Courtesy to at least make there edible. I saw lot of people here either they are tourist who do not know any better or people who have never been to True tapas place.

yDIQMQXZYoLisqRrQLetCg.text: Once again awesome tapas and sangria!  All for the same price as three margaritas at the Jose Cuervo  airport bar.  I love the new location!  I hope the kitchen issues are behind you firefly!

qEk045KUjr7NkKbkEOtQUA.text: One night in Vegas  so we wanted our choice to be perfect. We really love tapas and Firefly was close but more importantly yelp reviews were compelling. Went in with high expectations and boy we were not disappointed! The padron peppers were delicately fried (no hint of greasiness!) and piping hot. Some peppers were spicier than the others so order them if you like spicy. Our server was so pleasant and welcoming! He recommended several dishes , one of them the Camerones Diabla which was beyond delicious with the most complex sauce that was finger licking good. The refreshing artichoke toasts with a tasty aioli and the white anchovies with avocado were second to none and great palette cleansers because both are topped generously with fresh, chopped basil. Lastly, we ordered the eggplant cannelloni - 3 delicately rolled eggplant stuffed with airy goat cheese mixture - wow! We ended with the cherry bread pudding with port reduction and ice cream...it was beautifully plated . It was a feast for all the senses.  Oh, don't forget the sangria- we had the red and it was so flavorful with a perfect balance of alcohol and sweetness.  I wish we had another night because we would go back to try more tapas that we could not devour tonight. We have been fortunate to dine in some great places and when you come across friendly and attentive staff...neat setting...and food you would pay double for in other cities..Firefly is your kind of place! We look forward to an encore in the near future!!!!

gPHwUXb-mmtljplxDfaiGA.text: We love this place.  Its a go to every time we visit Vegas.  Love all the food, the service, the sangria.  ZERO complaints.  Wish I was fatter, so I could eat more.  Its very sad when you go here and realize you can't eat anymore and have to surrender.  We have had numerous dishes here and all are great!

7_7jMlvqEkg_-rlpZfPYog.text: Would have put a 1 star, but the food and atmosphere are excellent. Absolutely terrible service followed by a forced 20% gratuity! Wtf! Our server Pepe' came to our table only to take our order, deliver food, and handle the check. I ordered food 5 minutes after my friends, and it took over 30 minutes to bring out my food after reminding several other servers and table cleaners. Almost laughable service. Leaving hungry and upset.

z_ZeG5y-odB4WqKUibtTbg.text: Went here last Saturday night. We sat outside on the patio. The patio was so dark, it made reading the menu difficult to say the least, and I have 20/20 vision. Next visit, I'll make sure to sit inside.  THE SERVICE - awful, confused, unattentive. Our tapas arrived long before our silverware and plates, or water. I tried flagging someone down 3 TIMES to no avail. Finally, I had to pop into the bar area to request plates, silverware, etc. Not very good. Then, it seemed like we had several waiters, none of which communicated with each other. After we were almost finished with round one, another waiter brought bread to to the table and seemed quite confused that we were almost finished with the plates already on our table. So, word to management.....  TRAINING AND COMMUNICATION.  THE FOOD - wonderful! We ordered the stuffed dates.... OMG!! We ordered an additional plate! We also ordered the pulpo, the lamb sausage, manchego Mac n cheese (holy lord that was good!), patatas bravas and a couple of  other plates that escape my mind and a pitcher of sangria. The sangria was pretty tasty.  The quality of the food saved the experience. I will return to Firefly, I only hope that the service is better, otherwise, that will be the end of it, good food can only take it so far if the overall experience is not that good.

pVftDI5qfiz45TkvDAJD1g.text: Great place! A little off the strip, but has an awesome menu and great service. They even got me to try octopus because it looked so good!!  My only complaint is that all of our tapas didn't come out at the same time, so it was more of a two course meal. Other than that, would definitely be back.

JXg6ebpIWMH6TscjGSSCqw.text: Amazing restaurant.  It is near enough to the strip to not be a hassle.  Also, you don't get the overpriced restaurant prices you get on the strip.  Prices here are very accommodating for the quality of food and service.   Every tapas dish we had has been excellent.  I don't think you can go wrong here.  Our favorite is the Scallops "Escargots" (scallops baked in garlic-herb butter).  This is a must.  Amazing cocktails..  we've tied a few and I don't think you can go wrong here. They all had a complexity of flavors and excellent presentation.  There are very few restaurants that excel in every category and I can consider a "favorite".  I stop here every time I am in Vegas.  P.S. Jesus is an amazing server.  Very attentive and friendly.  He even remembered our entire order from the night before (yes, I wen't 2 nights in a row).  I have never had a problem with parking (there is parking in the back).

NYZ5LhX-ihD_lQptrF5WiA.text: Great Spanish tapas for a birthday family lunch. All ages OK in the restaurant. We had a party of 7 and were quickly seated about 1PM. Jesus was our server and was very attentive throughout the meal. The warm bread served with the honey butter is always a nice way to start the meal, of course we had another hot batch mid way ;-)  We started out with waters and a pitcher of sparkling sangria. Very good and dangerous as you can barely taste any alcohol 5/5. We began with some stuffed dates which are... amaze balls 5/5! We also had a couple orders of the Firefly fries 3/5 and a tomato basil soup 2/5.   Since we arrived early in the day they had breakfast tapas available so we tried the Huevos Rancheros 4/5 and the brunch potato bravas 4/5. Camarones Al Ajillo were very good 5/5. We also ordered some of my favorites: Scallop Escargots 4/5, Tierra Mar Skewers 4/5, Albondigas 5/5 and another 2 orders of stuffed dates. To try something new we ordered the Petite Filet 4/5, Pulpo Asado 4/5 and fried calamari 4/5.  Overall a good lunch and everyone enjoyed the variety. For dessert they brought out a flan and sang Happy Birthday. The rest of us tried the Banana Beignet 4/5 and the trio of Gelato 4/5.  Thank you Firefly for making this a memorable birthday lunch! Will be back for Happy Hour as this is one of our faves!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yelper in action! Firefly, Las Vegas MAY-2018
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Beignets a La Carte Brunch

BQnh4kchMXB_5ihGUfUhlA.text: Excellent tapas restaurant! They had the classics (empanadas for me) along with some more known items for first timers (fries and chicken skewers). Everything tasted phenomenal. I only wish this location had the bottomless mimosas because I would have ordered those, stayed longer and ate more!   My group ordered pork empanadas, Parmesan fries, Mac and cheese, chicken skewers, fish sticks, and Italian beef mini sandwiches (forget the actual name). Not a bite left!

3ie6jRvZQCqUuH8QvbEGBg.text: This place has a very huge selection of food. I'm not into the Tapa craze but this place has more than tapas which is awesome. I ordered quit a bit of food with my cousin and my cousin's co workers we came in for brunch they have a pretty bomb white sangeria that I will def. order again when o come back. The staff is super nice and efficient they also are very helpful when it comes down to the menu.   It's a really good Spanish food.

ZuUANaoLw4DIJoQTKyw0tw.text: Came here on a Saturday night, It was quite busy. Three girls/hostess were at the host desk, they were not welcoming, no smile , no greeting, just a "how many?" We said "3" and the girl didn't look at the books or anything, and was like "30 minutes." There was no one else waiting. We knew someone that worked there so we called him and boom got seated right away. From this point on, everything was great! Our server was very attentive and always checking on our table. When our food came out, it was phenomenal. I got the steak and mushroom skewers, and my two friends got the filet minon, and the lamb, we like meat! Lol all three was soooooo good! We also ordered a pitcher of Passion Fruit Mojito, and it was very good and refreshing!!!!   All in all, great food, great servers, great ambiance BUT HORRIBLE HOSTESSES. I think hostesses are a big part of a restaurant operation, they are the first impression of the restaurant, and with those girls there that night, Oh NO, seemed like they were just there chit chatting and checking out guys, not doing their job. Should have been 5 stars, but garbage hostesses made 1 star go to garbage.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RufPXlWxfqNPDJrKmEvobQ.text: The food is great. I love stopping by after work or during the weekend to enjoy some tapas. I know the stuffed dates are a favorite for most customers, but you wants go wrong with this place. The wait staff are hard working and the manager was really nice and made sure everyone was having a good time and enjoying their meal.

-rD6EG1oFvR-RUiDKAgbBA.text: AMAZING!!! The food at this place is just out of this world and tasty. I tried the Red Sangria, FireFly fries, the Chicken Skewers, the Scallop Ceviche, and the Dessert Platter ( Passionfruit Cheescakse, Chocolate Tres Leche, and Flan).  The prices are very reasonable for the food quality. The servers are friendly and the atmosphere is very "homey" and comfortable. It's a great date night or chill with friends eatery. Everyone in Vegas raved about this place and when I FINALLY tried it, I have to say they were not lying. I cannot wait to go back to Vegas to eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly Fries
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Platter

clyEx_lz5WBk2kFRth_K4g.text: I came to Firefly to find a well rated spot that wasn't on the strip. It's great scenery, great branding, and great drinks so definitely worth trying. I had the veggie empanada with was AMAZING. It was flavorful and creamy goodness, I can't say enough about it.  I'm vegan but the person I was with really really wanted the seafood Paella and it is for 2-4 people so I just sucked it up and agreed to share it. IT WAS SO BLAND! How can something so visually appealing taste like nothing? I was able to save it with the salt and pepper but after a 55 minute cook time (we were quoted 40) I was just over it. Save yourself the trouble and order something else from the menu.  If you take pics in the photo booth, expect it to take a week to get the email or text of your photos.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Year&#39;s weekend, great photo spot by the bar
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The branding is pretty clever. Heyyy bartender!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie empanada. BOMB!

uy9Nvs5GKaceOKzb8wMs-A.text: Firefly! Such a great place to enjoy little bites and drinks. It's a Spanish eatery serving tapas and cocktails in a lounge-like setting with patio seating.   I've been going to Firefly so many times in the past years. Long before they moved to this building, I used to like their old location too! Love the paintings on the walls. Very colorful, powerful colors (red, black) and the music! Especially love their Latin nights!   I had almost everything from their menu! I never ever had anything I would not like! All tapas, and big plates of paella delicious! Paella takes about 40-45 minutes to be prepared, so be aware of that! (But, they stated that on the menu, so everyone can read it. I'm sure most people don't read the fine print!) Anyway, knowing that, if you are hungry, I advice you to order the tapas first. They serve them fast! Almost all the time I order the Shrimp Tempura ( 4 large, very tasty beer battered shrimp with ponzu sauce), Steamed Mussels are my other favorite! It is actually a pretty big portion! Black Mediterranean mussels steamed with white wine, shellfish stock, leeks, lemongrass, lemon zest, lemon juice, tabasco, finished with butter, roasted tomatoes and spices. So creamy and delicious! It also comes with garlic bread! By the way, they also serve complimentary bread with herb butter. It's so addicting but don't fill up with it! Save yourself for the delicious food! My friends usually like spicy food, and they order accordingly! I, on the other hand, always stay with mild or no spicy choices!  Love the Albondigas (meatballs), Empanadas (last time I had the chicken), it was kind of spicy, despite the fact that I specifically asked the waiter to tell me if it's spicy or not. Anyway, it was very tasty! So no complaints!  Usually I drink Classic Mojito ($8), and if you like premium alcohol in it ($12). Most of the time drinks are pretty good. Occasionally, I experienced lousy drinks, especially if the place is super busy. I know, it's not funny, drinks should be always on point! But I guess it varies! I'm not a big drinker, but my friends are! LOL  Happy Hours usually on the afternoon! Specifically between stated hours! Deals are if you order a pitcher of Sangria or a pitcher of Mojito!   If you can save room for dessert, you won't be disappointed! My favorite is the Lemon Berry Tarts (very refreshing flavors), and the Chocolate Tres Leches (very light, tasty chocolate cake).  Vegetarian food lovers! There are so many different vegetarian choices on the menu! Everything is absolutely delicious!  I recommend Firefly for everyone who loves tasty bites, good music and great atmosphere! It's open very late, so it's a great place to stop by for a late night dinner and drink!

oc_6f3_775dGkrKMzf6j6A.text: Happy we tried Firefly tapas which has authentic dishes on the menu. They have a great variety of tapas for all palettes. The grilled octopus was one of our favorites along with the Bacon Wrapped Stuffed Dates. The red sangria was very good and a generous pour. My Hubby enjoyed two of the three Old Fashions on the menu, right there a treat to have multiple Old Fashions on a drink menu. Our server, Maria, was wonderful - when one of our dishes was not hot enough she took it right back, apologized and had a fresh hot one brought quickly. I love that kind of attitude - when you are paying for a dinner it should be prepared appropriately - right!!

HJbTpm8W2nPNfIM-EeEopg.text: Wow! Stop by for a snack and what wonderful service, tuna tartare and filet mignon! Would highly recommend. Will be back!

byL1gq4IbvTKGdV5Bqg4Qw.text: My absolute favorite place to eat when I'm in Vegas.    They have delicious food and amazing sangria. Great for groups. The restaurant has a nice vibe. The staff is always so welcoming and friendly. Your trip to Vegas is not complete unless you stop here!

TjCewSbXSgXtg4PpcxzYfQ.text: First visit last Friday. Absolutely a delightful surprise to taste such amazing and beyond delicious dishes. Super fun, efficient and upbeat customer service from the moment we walked in the door. This place is such an LV GEM. First time trying TAPAS and I am forever hooked. Thanks for a lovely and memorable experience!

jIkRV4gS8zrTaQvC70td0Q.text: Probably my third time here. Very underwhelming experience. Every time I go I hope it's better than the last time b/c I want to like this place so bad. I will say they have very unique dishes on their menu. Lots of choices if you like to try new,original meals.   I usually get the sangria but this time I went with the lemongrass cocktail from the happy hour menu. It was refreshing and packed a punch (but not too strong). I also ordered the streak salad (not on HH) which I liked a lot. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I always receive subpar service. Food takes forever to come out every time and the servers are never attentive. I kept trying to get a refill on water and I just had to wait until she dropped off my food to ask. Not a bad place but definitely wouldn't make a special trip to visit here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RvOMdQvHR8d1I0LnzBedJQ.text: Alejandro Garcia was our waiter, and was wonderful! The tapas were also amazing! The stuffed dates and the apple salad were delectable! Thank you Firefly! I would come back every day if I lived here!

hPleXZT8K7dcpvaG0v9aOw.text: Alejandro was amazing! Super super knowledgeable about allergens! And brought a special df/gf dessert for Mother's Day (even though everyday is Mother's Day to me ;).) as always delicious food and allergen friendly!

iFVzC_qKsYorRFMs879DxA.text: The sister restaurant down the block, "Tacos and Beer" is outstanding, however Firesfly is overpriced and quite frankly sub par.  $10 Tapas are not Tapas. A Tapa should range between $3 to $5.   Tonight I ordered the 1/2 chicken trying to avoid the costly Tapas menu. What I got was a very tasty meal sauce wise, but the Chicken, or the Cardboard with Wings was terribly old.   I would have done better ordering from Pollo Loco and adding the sauces.    Always serve your best, 3 day old Chicken is not your best.  I would probably give this place 1 more chance. But not sure what they have that will turn it around for me.

hFVH-2iuVALAE1M82rm2-g.text: One of my go to places for drinks and delicious tapas. Happy hour is affordable and super fulfilling . If you aren't allergic to peanuts you must try the Apple Manchego salad or the tempura shrimp !! Never had a problem with his location except for this one time , we had a party of people and the seafood paella took nearly an hour to make and when the food finally came out is looked as if it had been left out because it was cold and the seafood was super over cooked !! I gave them another chance and since that incident I have gotten nothing but great service from the servers .

XHiscckTfZzzAx6hO8GElQ.text: Came here for a team dinner, and everything was amazing. Bacon wrapped dates were bomb, meat skewers were phenomenal, but the seafood paella...outrageous and massive. Do yourself a favor and order it.

_hp9RgJk-2oYqKsU8BVFyA.text: Was in town on the 24th of October and 12 of us came for dinner.  What an amazing dinner we had.  Every plate we had was delicious with such unique and flavorful tastes!  My hubby and I are just made reservations for our anniversary dinner on the 4th.  Such a great find!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k_ERs_ZJ736T0LEgcUC1KA.text: Great food with friendly casual atmosphere!    We sat at bar and our bartender was amazing!   However. This started as a 4 star rating. The women's restrooms were disgusting. Let the hostess know. She rolled her eyes. Half hour later manager asked about our experience. He immediately apologized and turned to hostess and asked her her to go check. Changed to 5 star rating. Only wished I would have been able to comment if they actually cleaned the rest room. Kudos to the manager for at least trying to fix this. Shame on the hostess. Your looks will only carry you so far.

9g7BM0nP9NxwjAF4KXPFGg.text: Service- amazing Food - Delicious! I went to Barcelona and these tapas were better than anything I ever had there Sangria was way better than most places in barcelona spain Nightlife ambiance: very nice

tmpkvSg94ngCSWN4RP4KCA.text: Loved this spot! Fun atmosphere and really good food. We tried about 6 of their tapas and loved each and every dish!

1xg9gwghJ-UygMDzG4qYLA.text: There is not a single item on the menu that I wouldn't order again. All time favorites are apple manchego salad, bacon wrapped dates and the croquetas.   I just had guests from out of town, ordered catering and everything was absolutely PERFECT and DELICIOUS. Five star excellent service and quality.  Do yourself a favor on your next event: order catering from Firefly. They even delivered extra dressing, butter, bread, plates and utensils.  Highly recommend!

X7z2EBFw2GUsC2T2xHhgdw.text: Ate here last night with a group of 20. I must say the staff was amazing and very accommodating for such a large group. The food was great, we had a variety including: Mac and cheese, tuna tartar, lamb chops, stuffed dates, ceviche of shrimp (which was my absolute favorite), ahi tuna skewer, fried calamari. Overall, great food and service. Since we are locals, we have found a new restaurant to frequent!

FFo7WgMndY4zo3Twy47WkQ.text: One of my boyfriend's favorite restaurants when he visits Vegas so we decided to leave our group and have a romantic dinner for two.  When we arrived it was pretty full already and I would recommend making a reservation if you have a larger party for sure on the weekends.  This is a small plates/tapas syle restaurant.  We were able to sit at a high top in the bat, which was perfecr for the two of us.  We ordered a few smalle plates and only the chicago style bocadillo beef dip sandwich really wowed us.  We ended up sending the grilled octopus back as it was very chewy.  We did order a pitcher of their famous sangria but it took forever for it to be made and we were right next to the bar.  I think it was an off night bc our server was definitely new and it was so loud we had to repeat ourselves several times to ensure she heard us correctly.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ks4o3cLMs1WRyGfyzBzMpg.text: Spanish tapas thats open really really late - 2am. One of the best local food options after midnight.  The stuffed dates, Merguez (lamb sausage), and baby back ribs are excellent.  The Veggie Empanada was just ok. It had too much cream and cheese poured over it for my taste.  I've eaten in and done delivery here. They do both well. Delivery from here is a much better option than room service at most the hotels on the strip.

EsllLpXfN9ZSYkovL-12tQ.text: This brand has had its ups and downs over the years, but it's still one of the best meals you can have in town. The tapas are all singular with amazing flavor.   Bacon wrapped dates still haunt my dreams, but not in a bad way, in the way that I'm always chasing them but can't seem to catch them.   The sangria is fantastic, as well. For hot days and hot nights, it's always a happy addition to any glass.   Parking is good with the spaces in back, just watch out for any jams in the front getting there.

jVaVJ3MFyVDCw2PvEcxyEQ.text: Came here after flying into McCarran airport. We were surprised by the size and decor, but it definitely had a nice vibe to it. What drew our friends to this place was the vegan options, and it was nice to have a separate menu that had so many offerings. We ordered a bunch of tapas and really enjoyed all of them, and the staff was quick to accommodate us with items that were a little more kid friendly. We would definitely go back here. Note: it does get packed out, even on a Monday night!  But all in all, the food was a win here.

sG8QuyIiE2jsCAXKMmonBw.text: The food is amazing. Our server Skyler did an amazing job with suggesting great things to wat. Paella and the blueberry mojitos were the best we ever had.

vNDdInKrUrLj5HAQEWYjYw.text: So far among all the food joints and eateries I have been to since Sunday in Vegas I would say this definitely would top the list according to the price and taste of the food so far. I would really recommend this place and yes it really gets busy super fast so reservation would be nice but they have a big space so no worries. Food comes fast and great taste too. Trust me I am a vegetarian and we were a big group of 16 with vegan too and abundant options too. The staff are amazing,  friendly, kind, and attentive  Our server, Alejandro was friendly and patient with our group which wasn't easy it was like herding cats, lol  thumbs up...  Sorry no photos as we were so busy enjoying the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gets busy fast but no worries foods come fast and taste great as well.

-jDCzum5zsuKEOrJL_WJaw.text: I hadn't been here in over a year so I was wondering if I'd still like it but yup, delicious. It was the perfect temp to sit outside, it's not quite so loud on the patio which is nice especially since we were there for my dad's birthday. He LOVED the cucumber mojito, total win. The artichoke toast had a sorta weirdly heavy sauce that I didn't love but the mushroom toast and spinach salad were really good. The vegetarian was happy, sad the meat eater was happy and I'm a sweets person so...We ended with the dessert platter and I gotta say, that chocolate tres leche cake is amaze. For three people with drinks and dessert the bill was under $100 so I'll say that's a win. Our server was great, the hostess seemed sorta mean but maybe she was having a bad minute-no biggie. So ok firefly, you're still a contender.

eFQ140ODjF-dC9v7WhI01w.text: Firefly is the place to go if you're craving delicious small plates and alcohol. The interior is decorated with dark red walls and paintings.  They have a wide variety of items you can choose from, and basic items with a twist. They also serve paella that is made to order, so you have to give them 40 minutes to prepare.   They start you off with some garlic bread and their house butter. It was sweet, and balanced very well with the savory flavors.  We ordered the firefly fish sticks, and I was pleased with the crispness of the Japanese bread crumbs. The spicy tartar sauce wasn't spicy at all, but it had a slight kick to it.   The vegetable empanada was delicious. The breading had a wonderful texture; soft, buttery and flakey.   We also ordered ribs, that were doused in their mango barbecue sauce. The meat just fell off the bone. It was so soft and tender! The mango chunks and the sweetness of the sauce created a beautiful symphony of flavors!  Finally, we finished the meal off with a pan of chicken and mushroom paella. It was filled with flavors, that just made you want to eat more! By this point of the meal, I was already full, but I just couldn't stop eating.  To top it all off, we then ordered a chocolate tres leches, which was also very delicious. Super soft and moist! Tastes even better with the chocolate bits drizzled around the plate!  I had an amazing experience here at firefly. Definitely would like to come back to try their other tapas options. One of those places where you don't regret spending a bit more for some small plates!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior

qDrxZSWkSgMnVYFDE822vA.text: Fantastic food!  Loved everything we ordered. The stuffed dates were fantastic, loved the green apple Manchego salad, Serrano ham and cheese platter was good, ahi tuna screwed were very good. They only disappoint was the octopus. It was tough and very chewy. And I really wanted the tuna Tatar but the waiter misunderstood me. We also shared the red sangria which was amazing. And for dessert we shared the bread pudding. Yummy meal.

0kpEmnAACBTdAMeFtNIyNA.text: Stopped for happy hour, great selection and fast food delivery. Had some strawberry mojitos, service and quality of food was excellent- will definitely add it to my list of stops in Vegas!

laZmsSmTdwlAhVZw3eZxEg.text: Every dish had its own unique flavors cooked perfectly... An amazing little restaurant... Don't miss it.

JN5Cly2MLm56tkv3SoHF8A.text: Great place, free parking in the back which is nice and convenient. Love the vibe when we walked in. Very romantic with dark colors and low lighting. The tapas list is alittle overwhelming and wish It was a bit more descriptive on size of the items so we knew how much to order. We got the dates which were recommended, however the sauce was alittle too thick and gravy like. The flavors didn't mesh well for me. Then we got the ribs, Lamb, and tuna tar tar. Loved the tuna! The sauce on the lamb reminded me of the sauce on the dates. It worked well with the lamb so that was good. The ribs were tasty and a good size portion. The tapas can vary in size and can add up pretty quick so be prepared for that. For two people with 3 drinks and the tapas i mentioned above it was around $100+ with tip. I would definitely come back and try some other stuff.

Lo8dx1sERWlRw4C_-Gu6HQ.text: I am from out of town and I made this my dinner spot the entire trip. I haven't had one thing bad dish here! The ceviche is killer along with the bread and butter. We ordered about 10 different items and now I'm wishing that we had this in Orange County! Jordan the bartender was very interactive and educated on the menu and also very nice! I highly highly recommend this spot!

ZyWWAanByPTfTkgP35Tw9A.text: This place is amazing!!! Everyone I've brought here loves it. Food is great and services is amazing as well. Anytime I'm in Vegas we come here the escargot scallops and the stuffed dates are amazing!

hrxwG1rMeNkxW8CCAFUwlg.text: LOVED this restaurant! I have never done the tapas style dinning and I really liked it! I got to try so much more from the menu and let me tell you its heavenly! Next time I'm in Vegas I am definitely stopping here!

1miv3QzwJd86nSl1HyTBwg.text: Cancelled flight took me to the Fairfield Inn. The front desk clerk recommended this place that is next door. Fantastic service and the happy hour menu is one of the best! I had the chicken skewers char grilled with fingerling potatoes asparagus and a garlic cream sauce and a cucumber martini with Bombay Sapphire gin for 11 dollars! Stayed at Caesars Palace the night before and spent that on a cup of coffee.

0luJMAKJPh-JNGEmIXZ3xg.text: WOW! How did I not know about this place any sooner?!  We came here for dinner on Saturday night and our server Carlos was just downright AWESOME. He was attentive, courteous, and offered excellent meal recommendations! I love that we didn't feel like we were rushed given how long the wait was and how crowded the place was. We got to enjoy our meal - people watch a bit and take in all the flavors of the amazing food.   Food - bring a huge appetite because this place will rock your taste buds. My favorite staple of the night was the Apple Manchego salad - order it!! It was crunchy and salty and every bit amazing. I almost wanted to order another plate to go as a late night snack post drinking. We also ordered the veggie empanadas, the petite filet, the firefly french fires and for dessert - the trio of gelato. If you aren't drooling yet - you should really re-read what I just ordered. The food came out as each plate was ready and it was nice and hot. I did think we could have lived without the fries. It didn't have much of a wow factor compared to the other dishes we ordered. The food tasted great and it probably now my go to place for every vegas trip going forward.   Amazing food - awesome service and no fancy price tag. Gotta love that! Be sure to make reservation. There are always large groups here so to avoid the wait, plan ahead. Also perfect place for group dinners!

7-T_RJSVtTZ3vLQdrfueng.text: Whoaaaaa this place surprised me forsure! Came here for lunch with a couple friends for the first time and ordered some of the popular items.   Bacon-wrapped dates: I was terrified to try this.. Because dates... But they were delicious ! Perfect balance of sweet and salty.   Chorizo and clams: much bigger portion that I expected. Essentially an entire meal on its own! The sauce is amazing and they give you a healthy serving of clams!   Mac n cheese: what can go wrong? one of my favorites!   Lamb skewers: totally shocked me and definitely my favorite dish. Again, portions were great and this can also stand as a meal on its own. The lamb was not gamey at all and cooked perfectly! Also lentils were flavorful and filling.   Tuna tartare: comes with taro chips that compliment the raw tuna very well! I wish there was a little citrus but it was still really good.  This is one of the few restaurants I've been to where everything I tried was amazing. I can't wait to come back here !

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo and clams
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates

b8yV4OQNjJuTJSKxNFqHoA.text: Please bring Firefly to Atlanta! The tapas here were the best I've had. EVERY SINGLE  item that we tried was a perfect 10!  The mushroom tart was my favorite, it was to-die-for! The petit filet was the second runner up. The tapas are a pretty nice size, my husband and I ordered a total of 4 and we were completely stuffed by the time the last plate came out. Our server was s bit forgetful, but really and upbeat. Overall, this slot was the highlight of my trip. The next time I'm in Vegas I'll plan on eating here daily.

UG_P1-jQ0qUIM6rutZnTgA.text: We come here on Friday nights for Salsa night and it never disappoints. Bartenders are super nice even as busy as they are and the drink prices are reasonable. The interior is beautiful.

m1c2ZUd2PqKG6tzY5FL4Mw.text: My fave when near the Convention Center.  The sangria rocks.  Any and all flavors.   Food is always great.

OXnkZBvsoTM_uhGqpm1Npw.text: Maybe we went on an off night? Everything we ordered was just bleh. The service wasn't terrible but I did feel like we had to flag down our waitress a lot. There are so many better restaurants in Vegas.
