Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hQ37SssRL_BqMkD5UbOO2w.text: This is a great place with awesome food. A taxi driver recommended this place and we are so glad he did. Everything was very nice. Service was on point and the menu provides everything for everyone. I will definitely cone back again when in town.  You must check this out!

_H7uiusluy3Q4wE2IyqGXg.text: Wow a very excellent eclectic blend of flavors.  Terrific service and ample menu choices.

LYQ7HpiKss2iwuQ7ZdXRow.text: I can't believe I lived out here for almost 6 years and never came here before! Talk about an amazing place to go with a group of friends! We must have ordered 10 things off the menu and every single item was beyond amazing! The sangria, the best I have ever had! It gets very crowded, so come early. The inside gets VERY loud, we sat outside and it was beautiful!

QZp5a9VWnixztk5Kv-zwUQ.text: Had a group dinner here during a convention week for my staff, 14 people. They were super easy to work with figuring out a plan, and the food was amazing. Everyone was happy from carnivores to the vegetarian of the group. The ribs are to die for, very tender with lots of umami flavor. The tres leches cake is also not to be missed. Good sangria and mixed drinks too. Overall a great dinner and experience.

T1ezZX_Fu3XM2FKuNfT1VA.text: Love their food, Sangria is my favorite!! Great service, beautiful people and fun atmosphere!!

xolefbdJCFyGivo-ruljJA.text: Came here for Sunday brunch solo at 10:00 a.m., and sat at the bar. This place never disappoints.  Had the bottomless drinks, including the white sangria, red sangria,  and mimosa.  Your best bet is the red.  Also enjoyed the chilaquiles, carne asada breakfast taco, French toast, bacon and banana beignets.  So delicious!  The bartender was so gracious and attentive.  I've been here for dinner too.  Love Firefly!!!! Felt like I was in Espana having tapas.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_yldOq8Sqh55yjjjZXJDew.text: Amazing food and experience. Make sure to order the ahi tuna tartare and baked goat cheese. Our server Eder was AWESOME!!

7iixYcgJrGISPMD4gR9g_g.text: Easy lyft ride from our hotel to the restaurant.  They wouldn't take reservations  on same day (knock a half star for that), but we took a chance, just showed up at around 7:00 and were seated right away.  Surprisingly, there were many seats available for a Sat. Night.  We ordered 6 dishes and I specifically had a discussion with our waiter to bring a couple of dishes out, wait till we were almost done and then bring the rest.  So what happens?  They brought all dishes out at once!! For that poor service, I knock a half star.  Food was good.  Not amazing, but good except for a couple dishes.  Highlights we're the bacon wrapped dates, firefly sticks and ahi Tatar.  We weren't crazy about the stuffed peppers (cheese was just too heavy, thick and flavorless).  Also disappointing was the Tres Leches desert.  Too dense compared to others we've had in the past. The restaurant is nice, clean has a good vibe and we will probably go back with a larger crowd so we can try more items.

BB9pzStMN19TvHNYVI_dGg.text: One of the best tapas places I've been too and I've eaten tapas in Spain. (Humble brag)  Make sure you make reservations because people started piling in on a Friday night when we went at 6:30.   Feel free to take a taxi here, there's a greeter/valet team outside who'll help you get one back to your hotel.  The service here is quick and the menu is huge.   Not only was everything fatty and buttery and delicious but the portions are huge!!!!   Great value and perfect spot to sit in the patio with girlfriends

bj-n2CYriz6m_ZRflYYR1w.text: DEEELISHH!  My co-worker highly recommended this place and no way did it disappoint!  We had lots of food - too many dishes to remember, but I remember the stand out of the night was the seafood paella.  To be honest, I think it was better than most of the paella i had in Spain last year.  It was full of seafood, and the rice was cooked perfectly al dente.  It was perfectly seasoned and the portion was HUGE.  We were all happy campers.  It's just a close cab ride from the strip.  It's moderately priced and there's something for everyone.  It's my new LV place to go for some good food!

cRNaeEld9vk3gVE2OlwQGQ.text: My boyfriend and I come here religiously. The food is so good and it so fun to order a ton of food because it's all small sized and easy to share. The servers are always on point and the hostesses are awesome. This place is incredible and you're not limited to ordering one entree because it's all tapas. 100% love this place and hope they branch out and open up more locations! Anyone who judges this place for things in the past is truly mistaken and missing out on amazing quality food.

if8ih-0j5q6r6NUPnU4ucA.text: Loved the small plate concept.  Stuffed Peppers, filet-sausage skewers, basically everything was great. All the desserts were great as well. We had fun sharing everything and trying a little of everything. Mario gave us great service.

0kZsiP9sI4pGkb4Gi2zCng.text: Service was fantastic. Food is good, although some details hold it back from being great (some dishes were too salty, others were a little bland or watery).

Kco5Fo_JnPS_EB9_W8MyqQ.text: I LOVE this place!  Colorful, Fun atmosphere!  Bacon wrapped Dates, amazing!   Great place to take out of town company!  Not the standard chain place!

VBtH8XR_pCrBlXtZrfkLPA.text: We came in without a reservation and got a nice table on the patio immediately. To start we got the firefly fries.The Aioli that's served with them is delicous and a must try! We also tried the Tierra y mar, baked tetilla, Manchego mac n cheese, stuffed dates, artichoke toast, Camarones a la diabla, and the big bowl salad with grilled chicken. Everything was amazing and was served pretty quickly even though it seems a little busier tonight. The waiter suggested the dates which we loved and can whe why they're one of the more popular dishes. I can't wait to come back this summer and enjoy dinner on the patio again. As a side note, Jonathan, the manager, truly took my dinner to another level. His level of service and care for our experiemcewas on another level. He was attentive, caring, professional, and personable and I can't wait to go back; solely because of him.

_72gDbYNy8IWRhrf27eBDg.text: This is always my go to place in Vegas.  Not on Strip, great food, and close enough for Uber.  They moved into a much larger place from the start so you can get in pretty quickly with a party but always make reservation if you have a large party.  The 1st favorite is bacon wrapped dates, just try it and you will be hooked. Plates are small so sharing is recommended.  The meats are awesome, albondigas(sp).  Etc.  I love almost all fish dishes, try to get the ceviche with fish or shrimp.  You should try the sangria's and order pitcher's, you'll want more after one.  All the food is solid, some of them unique taste.  Go here if you want to eat well, and start with what I said up here.

ZE1LM13x9l0BaMFVLqhmYQ.text: Went to Firefly yesterday to celebrate.  The food were delicious but the service was not great. The lady that served us brought us the wrong order, twice. When we told her we didn't order the first one, she gave us an attitude and insisted that we did order it. We originally ordered stuffed mushrooms but changed our order to mushroom tart when she told us that the dish I wanted on the picture was actually the mushroom tart- not the stuffed mushrooms. We ended up with two mushroom dishes. The stuffed mushroom was mediocre but the mushroom tart was superb! I didn't want to make a big deal out of it (although my boyfriend was a little frustrated.)   Later on, she gave us the wrong order... again. We ordered baked tetilla and got something completely different (I don't remember the name). We couldn't  eat because it was too spicy and frankly, it didn't taste good. My boyfriend was very upset. We ended up paying for food we didn't want and can't even eat because our waitress was not paying attention. She should start writing down the orders and repeating them back to customers to avoid messing up orders in the future. She caused us money that we did not want to spend.   The garlic bread was chewy, but everything else was great! The baked scallops were delicious. The petite filet was juicy and cooked perfectly (medium rare.) The red sangria and the pina colada were both awsome!  If it wasn't for the messed up orders, I would give this place 5 stars.

LyZrNwMpz8QFHQiLFmXGxA.text: What can say about this place except I LOVE FIREFLY AND THEIR FOOD! I originally had eaten, a while back, at their location they used to have off of Fremont in Downtown Vegas. I fell in love the first moment I had their food. It's hard to find any Spanish restaurant that actually has TRUE Tapas. This place has the best Tapas outside of Spain. The flavor of the food is absolutely mouthwatering and delicious. I have never been disappointed. I don't live in Vegas but when I visit, I have to eat here each time. It's a must!!! If you are vegetarian like me, they have a special menu for you. I wish they had more location but I am grateful for even having this one. The Sangria is also a must. And if you are a fan of Nutella, you have to try their banana Nutella sandwiches! Yummy!!!!!

-cft29iXbmlyLBipzpxTcg.text: Sooooo delicious. Try the watermelon mojitos, goat cheese, peppers, paella, tempura, mixed grill, and filet

3-VP0V2TWAFwRDOHQ4eRpg.text: Absolutely the greatest tapas restaurant for locals! Great Latin nights every Friday! Food comes in small tapas portions and it comes out pretty fast! Paella is to die for, just keep in mind it takes about 30-45 minutes to be made! Stuff is super friendly end it is a must visit destination when you come to Vegas!!

JLnYxoDvD0H1hAK9Jt32rQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in town. I'm a fan of  tapas. I've been here more times than I can count and have never been disappointed. Some of my favorites tapas are the stuffed dates, manchego and apples salad, and the Del Mar skewers. They also have amazing mojitos.

VEVzP7hKaLT8W1xFJPWR9A.text: I always order red sangria (the best!), bacon wrapped dates (sweet and savory), shrimp ceviche (fresh and light), Mac n cheese, (cheesy and creamy), tres leches (flour less cake soaked in sweet milk! Mmm). I feel better it is a new location.  Our service this last time was extremely delayed.  She also forgot to put in an item. We did not receive it until we finished  eating everything else we ordered.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches

IAvfCdX-c5GNeYc2G9m7HA.text: This was an late night choice after an event at the Hard Rock Hotel~ a little timid after the issues over the summer....but the worries were for not~      GREAT HOSTESS~ friendly & personal it was a bit noisy and she did try to seat in a more quieter area.      SUPER SERVER~ Jessica, I think. Very helpful and personable and even tho it was late she was friendly.  We ordered the garbanzo beans, FRICKIN INCREDIABLE!!!!!! More addicting that BBQ Potato Chips for me~ just DEEELISH! Ordered the dates, husband ate those said they were quite good. These are highly recommended on Yelp! The chicken Tinga Empanadas also FAB! And the sliders all . The Machego Mac & cheese disappointing, try something else as they have numerous options.     DEFINATLY will return, however the location on Eastern is more convenient from home for us.

3GQkInn8KjwvaRB2Io16xg.text: I'm so upset with myself that I haven't reviewed this earlier when all the food I had was still fresh in my mind. What I do remember is that the prefixed menu of about six course I believe was only about $80.. And on top of that the plates are unlimited! Say what??! I know, I still am trying to fully grasp that idea myself. For prefixed menu this is an amazing deal, let alone for unlimited plates. Also unlimited sangria/drinks included! I don't remember if it's just sangria/mojitos, or if other cocktails are included. I'm pretty sure they were.   The food was pretty good as well. I remember the scallops being delicious. We had sliders included and I only ate half of mine because I don't really like sliders and it tasted like a normal slider you would get at a TGIF. Mussels and the spicy beef salad were very good, I definitely recommend those. We only used the unlimited plate option for a couple items split between 11 girls and by the time our last two plates came we were so full. We ended up wasting a lot of food because we couldn't take leftovers with us as we were having a night out and didn't have time to go back to our hotel.   I definitely recommend this place for group outings.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4vSk_lTYcCkMnql-BT9PBQ.text: Service, food, ambiance and location is good.  This is the first time I have been to this new location and I was surprised how big this location is compared to the restaurant they used to have.  This restaurant was one of my favorite spots to go to when I used to live here.  I will definitely be back next time I home. Great spot for any occasion.

TbA6kAuq86ejISmiWSrL_Q.text: Service on slow side on busy Friday night, but food was fantastic! Everything I tried was very, very good!

7LgELz2fshAx428UB0RoFw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants ANYWHERE. I was in town for work for one night and brought my coworkers here. Rave reviews from all. My favorites are the Tuna tartare, camarones a la Diablo, petite filet and stuffed dates. Try the paella as well, you won't regret it!

kckr0Vo4GpYu2xKjDMVFBQ.text: Super busy when the party arrived but we found out why real soon. Amazing tapas!!!! Definitely worth it!

HZH5Jwq_y4Xs198zucyb9Q.text: Perfect late night meal. Every bite was flavorful yet light. The ribs were perfectly cooked and the steak and mushroom skewers were melt in your mouth. We also ordered the Serrano ham and manchego cheese plate, empanada, fries and calamari and have no complaints. Everything was perfect.

ClSVphFPE83CuwdsOsnIpw.text: I was in Vegas with some girlfriends for a bachelorette party and we were staying at the hotel right next door.  We ate here 2 times in 3 days if that says something about how much we loved this place.  It's a tapas place with a nice variety of dishes.  We ordered the stuffed mushrooms, the bacon wrapped dates, the mussels, some Asian shrimp dish, the apple and manchego salad, and coffee.  All the food was really great and the coffee was much needed after a long night of partying.    We came back again with some other friends and had an issue with their steak.  It tasted really weird and the servers were so great and accommodating.  They offered to make the dish again or replace it with any other dish free of charge.  When we didn't want anything, the chef came out to apologize and sent over a free dessert platter! AND they sent us the steak anyway, which I brought home to my husband (and he said it was delicious).    LOVED the food and the super nice service.  I don't think I've had such great service anywhere (except, of course, for those fancy pants places where it costs $150 a person).    Highlights were the bacon wrapped dates and apple and manchego salad.  I am definitely coming back every time I'm in Vegas.

kcCXgR1D3YGmvNMCdcjo-A.text: Food good, service good, outside parking lot especially in front, SEVERE safety hazard.  Dark curd, nothing to show a curb there, poor lighting, an overall reflection of a management/owner not really caring about the safety of its customers, a common thread for these owners.  Explains why they have had issues and have had to close a few establishments.  My mother law tripped over the curb and fell, the valet guy could have cared less.  Didn't say anything, didn't offer any help, management has no idea, a total lack of caring otherwise there would be plenty of lighting and a well marked curb just like the north side of the building, well lit with a bright yellow curb.  Like I said the service was good, the food came out fast and all tasted good, just disappointed about the outside and the lack of care for customer safety & if someone does have an issue, oh well not their problem attitude.

95qZLF6dgiFdQpd0LSnJVA.text: My first time eating at this restaurant and it was a good experience. If you are planning in going on a friday evening and you don't want to wait for a table for a long time make a reservation. The food was good. The tapas that I recommend are: the chorizo clams, stuffed dates wraped in bacon, baby back ribs, and lamb chops. The pitcher of red sangria was refreshing and very good. My son is Vegan and he had the tomato bread and the veggies and lentils. The coconut sorbet ice cream they had that day was out of this world. I also recommend the banana sandwich with nutela for dessert. I did not like the scalops escargot, pulpo asado, and the ceviche of shrimp. The service was very good and efficient. As soon as you are done with your tapas the servers clear the plates off the table. Selfparking is behind the building and it was full on that friday night so I had to use valet which is awesome that is free of charge. So I gave the valet $5 in and $5 out. I will go back again for sure and if I have guest visiting I would definitely bring them to this restaurant.

_xqquWFzgEM72a0EQMaX9g.text: Love the food here. Have been many times! Try the steak skewers, bacon wrapped dates, shrimp and much more! The only thing that is disappointing, when you order a red bull vodka and they serve you some crappy energy drink w vodka. Yet on their bar counter tops they have a Redbull logo? See attached picture. Maybe get rid of that if you can't service it.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Why have a Redbull logo if you don&#39;t serve Redbull?

DCDE5NDGROXRhXMobwYH_g.text: This tapas bar and restaurant off the Strip, is definitely a hidden Vegas gem. My friends and I came into Vegas on Friday, and decided to check this place out. Prices are fantastic and range from an average of $5 to $10 per tapa dish. I ordered the bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with almonds. Bacon-wrapped dates are one of my favorite tapas, so the almond was definitely a different texture than what I was used to, but still tasty. In addition, I got the veggie empanadas, which were quite savory. I was saddened that there were only two of those on the plate. My table ordered a pitcher of sangria for $28, which was a steal. Firefly* also has some affordable desserts, and so I shared the chocolate tres leches cake with a friend, and was more than happy with its taste and texture--not too sweet, and not too runny.  I am not sure about other nights, but definitely on Fridays, it can be quite loud with the live band, so be prepared to use your outdoor voice inside. The band, Space to Pace, played light salsa music. After seeing one of the waiters dance with a hostess, I really wish I knew how to salsa dance (note to self: take some salsa lessons). I love Latin music, especially the classics like, Oye Como Va and Guantanamera, which they both played, and so it was a treat to be there that night to listen and clap along with the band, as well as enjoy tasty, inexpensive food with great company. This will definitely be a go-to spot every time I go to Vegas.

9tMU_1_sfR8rX6YMcXhPYg.text: I've been coming here for around 7-8 years and for me is a Vegas must (my favorite off the strip). Honestly, I prefer the old location, but I'm happy they have a bigger space now. The tapas here are incredible!!! Mushroom tart, Serrano Ham Sliders, Scallops and ended with the Banana Nutella Sandwiches. All amazing! Typically, I get these with cheese in them because they mainly use Manchego which is my favorite. So, I highly recommend the Mac and Cheese and the Manchego + Apple Salad. We didn't drink this time because we had to immediately drive, but both the white and red sangrias are to die for.  Pitchers on pitchers! Go here, you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella Sandwiches
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Tart

ExQtbB-e7_AcpgRS0MtmAQ.text: Great friendly tapas place. Local and tourist alikenenjoy thisbcool place. Friendlynservice from staff, fast service. Great food.

j1uGBC2WCVpFnji1JSpAXQ.text: Very contemporary and good looking restaurant.  Attentive service, and good food,. Not great..But good.  We had the seafood paella, and while it was good it was just ok. I will be back because I really liked the ambience maybe it was an off day?

sys8MhsQBDU6k3d9N3IsIA.text: This is easily one of the best meals I have ever had in Vegas. Huevos estrellados, Chicago beef bocadillos, baby back ribs, baked tetilla, and baked goat cheese. The huevos alone made the meal worth it. Their sangria is nice, not too dry or sweet and my cocktail was also very good.

npbyIemxEb3FIZKM9D4YEw.text: Fantastic cocktails.   Good selection of tapas and a handful of full meal size plates. Offers paella but me he advises it takes 40 minutes to prepare.  Stuffed Dates - excellent, would get again Baked Goat Cheese - good, Italian tasting Empanada (pork) - pass Baby back Ribs - good, mango salsa had an unexpected kick.

FUzCxG6NNEQsYcYGrx6Zcw.text: The Food made me sick. Tapas plates were too greasy and were not prepared well. The fries was The only thing I liked.  They post food pictures in their bathroom. I don't think that's appropriate when you see food advertising in the bathroom stall behind the door.

xbE--VU5KC99tb4O424sJw.text: Solid Spanish tapas restaurant! We came on a weekday afternoon for a late lunch, which was nice because there weren't many people there and our server was quite attentive. We originally wanted to get the paella, but we didn't want to wait, nor did we have the appetite for the dish (it feeds from 2 to 4 people and there were only 2 of us...), so we ended up opting for the tapas. The tapas were delicious! The stuffed dates were delicious! Bacon! Dates! And a toasted almond in the middle! The croquettas were of course delicious! I'm not sure how that dish can ever go wrong. The stuffed peppers were super cheesy and good. My favorite, though, was probably the baked tetilla. This is essentially a large pot of baked cheese. Oh so good! The cheese also has some tomatoes and chorizo, so each bites has a bunch of flavors and stuff mixed into creamy baked cheese.

aRv57Ly4WbwUqL7UAO6UfQ.text: Food is excellent. My favorite thing to order are the empanadas, they never disappoint! Whenever I go with groups of people we always get the paradise mojito pitcher,  it is delicious and a great value! Portions are a bit small I wish they served more of their amazing food!

OQKagvA12Ng-mMUv6Wkl-A.text: The food here is always very good. The bacon wrapped dates I've always been one of my favorites. The sangria is very refreshing. I would've given it five stars but gave work because the service on this trip is not so good. The server system was excellent I waters were always fall. However the server himself acted like he had somewhere else rather be. I will continue to visit firefly for the great quality food.

DO9HedIrFu54A3LufufDtw.text: FireFly is a great place to eat with 3+ hungry people. Their small plates are perfect for sharing and with 6-8 dishes on the table there's plenty of food and variety. The octopus is great, so is the tuna tartar. Steak and chicken skewers were very good as we're the ribs and goat cheese. Service was friendly and fast.

g5IJI_dQIQX432qzhH8EtQ.text: This was our first time here. Food and service amazing. Stuffed peppers and fried calamari were our favorite. Mussels and ribs also delicious. We will be back next time we are in Vegas.

sOR96O8gLo37AIIlV1D08w.text: This kind of reminded me of a diner that decided to re-brand itself as a tapas restaurant.  The space is large, with both indoor and outdoor seating.  The service was very efficient.  The menu was huge with sections for cold, hot, meat and seafood tapas.    The quality and preparation were not all that great, though.  Best thing about it was that the portions were huge.  The ahi tuna skewers and spinach salad was enough for two people.  The fish,however, wasn't of a good quality and it came in some gooey sauce.  The salad was OK, with pine nuts and artichokes and feta, but needed some vinegar and flavor oomph.  The merguez sausage was odd tasting, unlike any I've had before and quite spicy.  The octopus was mealy and came in a large dish with mushy potatoes and other mushy items - odd.  The serrano ham sliders came on awful supermarket hamburger buns and the burgers were of a low quality.  The fried onions as a side, however, were the highlight of the meal.   Considering the amount of food the prices are very reasonable.  Just like a diner.

hsn3HmP8quDDM-a60QazbQ.text: Amazing restaurant. Absolutely delicious. I've been to Spain and have to say their tapas are pretty similar to what I've had there. Definitely coming back. Also a plus - service was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patatas bravas, padrons, manchego/ham

GlhWx3dbXb-tP9Eg9kaeaA.text: Good tapas place off the strip. It's a really short taxi ride/drive from the Wynn end of the strip so don't be afraid to deviate from the main strip. They offer free valet here too so it's convenient if you have a car.  We went with a fairly large party of 9 and our waiter advised us to just order a few tapas at a time in rounds. They come out fairly fast so you don't have to be afraid of waiting that long. For the most part, he was correct, except our party was pretty hungry and scarfed up every plate almost immediately after they came to the table.... so if your friends are a pack of ravenous dogs like mine, you can order more at a time.   We ordered: Mixed Paella (one order is good for about 4-6 people)- nomskies. Legit Spanish cuisine.  Ahi tartare + avocado- standard dish you can't really go wrong with  Bacon wrapped stuffed dates- I don't normally care for dates but this was like CRACK. So good. Nice balance of salty and sweet. It's really small though, like 5 dates on a plate and one date per person is not enough   Fries- good but also forgettable  Lamb shank? Thigh? I forget which part but it was good. 2 pieces only.  Mac and cheese- nomskies in all it's creamy goodness  Stuffed mushrooms- nomskies,  I'd get it again  Some kind of stewed veggies + egg- meh I'd pass on that one   I can't remember what else because it just kept getting passed around the table rather quickly.  My other advice to you would be GET THE RED WINE SANGRIA. It's a little on the sweeter side but I think everyone can appreciate it, even those who don't care for sweeter tasting wine.   "Take this all of you and drink it. This is the cup of my blood which will be given onto you and to all so that your sins may be forgiven."  If Jesus was talking about the Firefly red wine sangria then I'd be downing that all day and all night... like a mofkn sangria vampire or something.   Okay that's my advice, you heard it, enjoy your time in Vegas!!! :)

UhIaS495MJQ-H-SDC60yFQ.text: This place was packed Saturday night. We waited 45 mins even with a reservation. We got two pitchers of sangria as compensation but I really just wanted to sit down. My husband enjoyed the food, for me it was just ok. The service was good once we sat and ordered some food. The ac was a bit too cold as well. My husband wanted to come back and I didn't. I guess I was put off by all the waiting to be seated.

tUxnzh468TV3EyTqDyRqFg.text: I wanted so badly to like this restaurant. It's one of those places I've been hearing about for years, but never actually got around to visiting. My boyfriend owed me dinner, so I asked him to take me here last night. Not one of the tapas I had wowed me. For the price, the portions are exceptionally small. Three mini stuffed peppers for $9. A single cup of soup for $7. We left with a bill of over $80 (two drinks included), and I was still hungry. I would have ordered another tapa to fill me up, except nothing I had thus far was all that good, so I didn't want to waste even more money on substandard food. Most of the food we had was too salty, aside from one tapa that didn't have much flavor or seasoning at all.   At least the staff was friendly.

WaDQxRsxRjXuH-VN-a-LUQ.text: Off the strip and I got to give up the props. Trendy, clean and priced right. Tapas and cocktails after work are just the ticket for locals or just a great place to visit for out of towners. Full bar for cooling off. I ordered the old fashion.. one of the best I've had. Great for a date, with friends or family. Noise level is about a 7 on a scale of 1-10, music is modern but no rap, rock or country. Great place, I recommend it.

Vi4QImZOQ6bp9JrKsLWTNg.text: We come here twice a year with about 25-30 people. The service is always great, the food is amazing and we all have a really great time!! The place is always packed on the weekend so make reservations!

HEmw05Vv6wO7Ey9AuNNEOA.text: My review is based mostly on the food here -- it's good but not out of this world. The concept of tapas and sangria paired with decent service is sure to be a hit with a majority of people however I just didn't get what all the fuss was.

hq7HVXQzaWrwJUi50XV7Bg.text: We were a party of six and we sat in a booth in the back which was perfect so we could talk.All of our dishes we delicious.My favorite was the tuna stuffed pepper and the shrimp tempura. I WANTED TO go back for Sunday brunch! It's a bit loud for a large party, but,I will definitely make it a go to place on future visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy cocktails,too!

_a0GexG9u5qCzJPRtQgm0g.text: Oh my goodness gracious!  Aside from Brazilian bbq, never dined at an establishment where you get to have your cake and eat it too.  My wife annoys periodically when she asks what I'm having to share.  Secret alert...  not into sharing.  This place Im good with it.  You order a bunch or appetizer portions and get the best of both worlds.  After that satisfying need was met, the quality of the food was ridiculous.  Amongst 6 people eating, we had the to die for chicken skewers covered in a light, but incredibly tasty garlic sauce.  Mouth still humming!  Eder and team made me feel right at home.  Then we filet, tiara y mar, filet and steak and mushrooms.  We left beyond satisfied and full.    This place is off the strip in Vegas and proportionally priced reasonable.  Happening place as well!  Good music good vibes.  Coming back next time!!!!!

cwiEGZQ1ldaaP88WqhOrAw.text: Firefly has become my favorite Spanish tapas restaurant in Vegas! I love love the tapas on their menu. My absolute favorite would have to be the baked goat cheese, unbelievably melts in your mouth. The ambience is dope on the weekends with Spanish music/dancing and all the beautiful Spanish women. Great place to come for some Spanish food and drinks! Glad I found this gem.

njWehmY03Oi8eSYo4K_Ldg.text: Used to be better.   Great service. But locale had a Bucca Di Beppo feel.   Patatas bravas leave much to the imagination.   Octopus rather bland.   Over-cooked bacon wrapped dates.   Good calamari.  Nice artichoke toasts.

BZxjhkbN8-Ojf36ml61YLQ.text: Loved this spot in Vegas.  Our friends who are locals always come here, and we wanted to order the whole menu.  We had the bacon wrapped dates, some shrimp tapas dish amongst other things. Definitely recommend. Ambience is nice and service is great.

k0wCIHHwtO8EiYmokFA5MA.text: We absolutely love this place!  Planning a trip back to Vegas just to eat here.  The bacon wrapped dates are incredible.  The filet mignon is to die for, melts in your mouth. Prices are great, this place is a gem.

T6XLN9onqG3i2C6lkUMW8w.text: I love this tapas place. The quality of their food is always really good. What a fun atmosphere with lively music and art. This place can get really busy so definitely come in non peak hours. Their service is good and really quick. We dined for 4 hrs one time, felt no rush.  -Mussels in coconut curry are delicious. -Summer Salad... The burrata cheese is to DIE for! It literally melts in your mouth, perfect texture and the outside is not overly thick. One of the best burrata cheeses I've ever had.  -Paella comes in a good portion. Although, I could go with more crunchy toasted rice from the bottom of the pan. -Sparkling white sangria is so good and refreshing.  -Baked goat cheese was ehh... Not bad but not that exciting of flavors.  -Always love the Grilled Veggies in mint sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels in coconut curry
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella with great usage of saffron.

VuvSc4hYWjLFiLhSXK9JHw.text: Thank you fellow Yelpers! I was able to find this great place through you. Went here for a late night dinner and it was so damn good. There were 4 us. We started off with ordering a pitcher of red sangria which gave us about two glasses each. Each of us picked 2 plates to being with. I can't honestly say I remember all of the plates since we were randomly picking off the menu. I can say though, as each one came, they got better and better. We were all pretty fully satisfied, but did end up ordering 2 more plates because we really wanted to try them out. We had steak, chorizo, shrimp and mango skewer, Ceviche, ahi skewer, stuffed peppers, Diablo shrimp, chicken skewers, goat cheese dip, petite filet, and mussels. They were all great dishes. We had absolutely so complaints. Service was great, staff were friendly and helpful. Place was nice and clean with attractive decor. Bomb!

hqZXYqQMap__TvM7hVTxEQ.text: Firefly moved to a new location but everything I said in my previous review yelp.com/biz/firefly-las... still applies. They're still located on Paradise but they have moved to a bigger and better spot. This place has a bigger outdoor patio and is large enough inside for big groups. While they have moved on to bigger and better digs, this didn't change their attention to detail when it comes to food or service. My only problem was that I came alone and since it is a tapas place I wasn't able to sample as many items as I wish I could. Firefly is bigger and better than ever and definite worth a visit if you're in Vegas, it's a little off the strip but well worth it.

qdW7KKqJi3Ve3WF8XvbE2A.text: I really enjoyed coming to this restaurant. The ambiance was really nice. Food was reasonably priced and they have a wide selection of dishes. It was my first time trying Spanish tapas but I loved the experience. I will definitely be back again.

P5JQ8cynN_3NB4zm_KW44w.text: Firefly on Paradise  Location/Parking: If I said it's "on Paradise" you would probably smack me, so whatever. Google it.  Atmosphere: We saw a bit about Firefly on Paradise on the show Restaurant Stakeout a few months ago and wanted to give it a try. What a find! This is the kind of place you want to spend 3-4 hours at a time, nibbling on small plates of awesome deliciousness and drinking countless glasses (and by glasses I mean bottles) of wine. It's beautifully decorated with dark, bold reds, striking paintings on the walls, eye-catching chandeliers, and a big open dining room with several smaller sectioned off tables for privacy. Great place to meet up with friends or to have a first date.   Cleanliness: No issues. This place is spotless. The bar is clean, stocked, organized, and well lit. Glasses and silverware are always sparkly and shiny.  Service: Attentive without hovering. You can take your time ordering and no one is rushing you to take your plate away as you nibble. You can linger as long as you want before and after your meal. It's nice.  Food/Drinks: We always get the house Cabernet and it's always delicious. Only $5 a glass and it goes great with pretty much everything on the menu.   6/6/13 - We had the house Cabernet, Warm Spinach Salad, Chicken & Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms, and Baked Tilapia cooked with lemon, butter, and garlic. The bread is delicious. Fantastic meal!  11/1/13 - Tried a more expensive Cabernet and it was really nice. Had more bread than I care to mention, Artichoke Hearts, Lamb Chops, Chicken Tinga Empanada, and the Manchego Mac 'n' Cheese. Yummy!  5/29/14 - We had several glasses of the house Cabernet, bread, Chicken Tinga Empanadas, Ham and Cheese Croquetas, Stuffed Dates, and Lamb Chops. Delicious!  5/30/14 - Had the house Cabernet, bread, Roasted Eggplant Cannelloni, Boquerones, Petite Filet, and Serrano Sliders. Outstanding!  5/31/14 - Third night in a row. This is craziness. We had the house Cabernet, bread, Tortilla a la Espanola, Pisto, Camarones al Ajillo, and the Garden Variety Salad. Another winner!  8/4/14 - Came back for our wedding anniversary. Had countless glasses of the house Cabernet, Steak and Mushroom Skewers, Chicken Skewers, Bacon Wrapped Dates, and the Firefly Fries. Tasty! I could come here every night for a week.  Happy Hour: I don't think there is one, but who cares? It's all tapas and it's all cheap, so stop your bitchin'.  Price: Surprisingly reasonable for a place this nice. Anywhere from $5-$10 a plate. Really good quality dishes.  I've been here six times so far and it never gets old. It's forever staying on my short list of places I have to visit in Vegas.

Steak and mushrooms skewers save the sauce to dip the bread in. Almond butter nuff said. Bacon wrapped dates. Berry tarts for desert. Forgot the mango ribs they were thick and proper.

Ahi Tuna Skewers were the perfect little bite, there was pineapple in between each piece of tuna. Great idea! Love some grilled pineapple. Chorizo stuffed mushrooms weren't my favorite. They tasted like the mushrooms were pre stuffed and frozen.  Lemon tarts were cute, I just wish it was bigger. Not enough of the tart alittle too much crust. Flourless cake looked good, my girlfriend said it was delicious !  All in all, everything was great :) but I'll be back for that red sangria !

PCcNz1-4H2EcHI7LtiANVA.text: When I am in Vegas this is my go to always.  Service is great, food is great, drinks are great.  Menu is very diverse enough to please everyone.  Can not go wrong here!

kWflxx8Jg0S1pXQ7csGS7w.text: I just want to say I have such an excellent experience for my Husband 40's Birthday Celebration. Manuel really take care of everything we need and accommodate all the needs perfectly. Is a great place to run a private events in their privates rooms. The food was fenomenal and service excellent from the Managers to servers and bartenders. Nothing to worry about our guest were so happy as I'm. My husband have a great surprise party. I won't hesitate to make any celebration at Firefly and also we really enjoy the restaurant we usually have tapas there and we love it!! Great place!!!! Thank you so much!!! Sabrina

PxyzrfOyG63WKRPFXlbZng.text: This was a phenomenal experience and my best dining experience in Vegas so far.  The food is prepared to heart and intention, and the dining staff made us feel at home.  Beautiful plates, every bite packed with flavor, and priced very well.  I am happy.  Firefly will make you happy too!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We are LOVING this place.  Party with us!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friends with fantastic food.  You want this in your life.

xEAdMcT1FdDJH3eQ3KIvXA.text: So I wrote a really scathing review of this place before it moved and when I walked in, I told the concierge. I basically got treated like garbage by the bartender because (I'm pretty sure) I didn't fit their hipster classy crowd. They reassured me that the place has vastly improved.  I came with Angela and Kent. We ordered about a dozen dishes here. I'm only going to mention the two that we would order again. The stuffed dates and the spicy beef salad. Everything else we had wasn't even ok. We also got seated outside and there were only two servers outside and we actually waited 5-10 minutes until we got our drinks! Seriously, have you ever waited that long for alcoholic drinks in Vegas? Yeah, it's like we walked into some pocket dimension not in Vegas. Our food also took a long time gettin' to. Even the bread and butter they give you, I had to ask for twice before we got them and they took their time also. What really made no sense was that we got our dessert before we even were served all our main courses! WTH? That's a first, never happened to me.   I will say that the sangria is pretty awesome here and the pear-ginger martini was pretty outstanding. Only reason why I'd ever come back, the drinks. But then again Angela made a good point that you can find better in Vegas if you looked hard enough. Yeah, probably so it's a question of whether I would go out of my way to come here just for the drinks. Nope.  So I'm really, finally done with this place. I was done before they moved and now I'm done again with this place.

oewioI5jeD8uHlYx5SdmgA.text: Incredible, I annihilated the Chicago Beef Bocadillos and finished off with some coffee and the Gelato Trio. Service was quick and clean. Atmosphere is a definite two thumbs up as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gelato Trio: Chocolate, Vanilla, Pistachio. Triumvirate of flay-vah.

HRwTJKplcdo4SMQrqwNGUg.text: Very cute place with great tapas.  I would definitely recommend it as an option for something off the strip, and the prices are good too.  The only reason I give four stars is because the food does not all come out at the same time....so some people have to wait longer than others and not everybody eats at the same time.

X9O4oMYG4wGvGJzY8L0XJg.text: This place was pretty good, it's more like small appetizers but wow such delicious taste. Would most def go back!

28s0pdQ-TIUsiywR-D2A4A.text: The food is terrible. It tastes either frozen or just not good at all. The only reason why to go to Firefly is for the dancing/ambience. But as far as food goes 1/10. The seafood is probably the best thing to get here.

7AUsb414LX6L5s6nGCq8oA.text: An authentic Spanish restaurant outside of the strip?  This place is soooooo good, service is great, the wait time sucks, the menu gives you a lot of options, prices are very, very fair. Better than the expensive restaurants on the strip that offer very limited menu options.    This place is always packed, that says it all.

dLQT3KDRsHwOzjRtOCoEMw.text: Food was amazing and very reasonable. Happy hour from 3-6pm then 11pm-? You can get a pitcher of mojitos for $18... prob 6 drinks worth. Bacon wrapped dates are to die for $4. Tuna tartare was incredible. We came to the restaurant 3 times during our 4 day trip, it was that good.  The only thing I ordered that didn't blow my mind was the beef salad. It was good, just not on the same level as everything else we ate.  Servers are very attentive and super friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries with this amazing aoli
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates

hMeqvATDxpGmeau1_APuew.text: I was seeking a unique eating experience off the Strip but special for a day trip to Vegas. My Special Lady Friend hadn't ever had Tapas and Yelp was recommending Firefly so I thought we'd hit it.   I'd been to a couple of Tapas places but looking on the app I've never seen such an extensive menu with so many types of Tapas to choose from such as Chilled, Seafood, and Meat and Poultry.   The space is pretty amazing with the romantic atmosphere and these awesome images of Flamenco dancers and Spanish art all over the walls. Great for something romantic or friendly or just stooping in for lunch on a day trip to Vegas. I'd love to come check it out on their Latin Night. The bar is a very stylish installation that should be a wonder when the lights are low.   Have individual captions on the Tapas that we ate. Our favorites were definitely the Bacon wrapped dates that had a nice, rich sauce to go with it, the Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms, and the Serrano Ham and Machengo Cheese. Each portion is sizeable and great for two people. The Ahi skewer was actually pretty meaty and nicely packed with fruit and a great garnish that completed the dish. I would have loved to try more of what they had on the menu.   My one complaint might be that during lunch rush our waitress disappeared for a bit but the bus boys and her fellow waiters made sure to help us out as best they could.   I'd totally recommend this place and would happily visit again for lunch. Many more Tapas to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano Ham, Machengo Cheese on toasted bread. Flavorful and above and beyond an adult lunchable I totally enjoyed every bite of this Tapa.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Wrapped Dates in bloom
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms were very flavorful and had that unique Spanish flavor to them.

QkG2QVofRaw0QBRaLrbZ8g.text: Delish menu and good service. Trying to stay away from bread, but Firefly has the most delicious sauces you have to eat a bunch a bread to dip and soak up the sauce- so if you're on a diet- stay away from here!! Too much temptation.  I drank the red sangria- it's sweet and goes down very quickly, but not the best I've ever had...   Food is scrumptious.

rT8s2WME5BBb077kBWvN2g.text: Nice atmosphere. Excellent customer service. Its a Tapas Bar...small portions appetizers. Just a handfull of full dish/menu. Ordered the beef skewer...wow tasty. The hubby ordered the petite sirloin.he was happy with his choice.  Just FYI: on the pricey end...but its worth it...at least for me

QrpTuJNshkCvH4Vy2wQmcA.text: I would definitely return to this place.  Very good service and clean.  The food was good.  We had the grilled octopus,  ceviche and empanada. They were all delicious.  I had never tasted such tender octopus.  I'm not a fan of it,  but here is was really good. Ok,  now the ceviche was bomb!!! It was just perfect. The empanada was kinda spicey for my taste.   But my husband liked it a lot. I had a white sangria that was very tasty. Is a tapas place, so yeah, the portions were small.  But overall, we had a good experience here.

rBcrZgGN5HiX89avGcrw7w.text: We had tickets to see a show at Westgate and wanted to grab a bite before the show. We had eaten at firefly years ago when they had an anthem location, but had not been back since. Based on yelp reviews, we thought we would give the paradise location a try. When I was about 15 minutes away, I called for reservations but was told that we couldn't get a reservation until 730. Clearly this wouldn't work. I asked about walk-ins. The young woman I spoke with told me I could have a 15 to 20 minute wait. I thought this was worth the chance and so we went. When we got there we found the restaurant nearly empty and had no problem getting a table immediately. Not sure why the hostess was so discouraging on the phone. We decided to order the chicken and mushroom paella ($24) with chorizo (extra$4) despite being warned that would take about 40 minutes to prepare. No problem, I nursed my beer and 40 minutes flew by. The paella was it worth the wait. Could've used a little more chorizo, but that's a minor complaint. Huge portion. More than enough for dinner for two. We've already made plans to return for dinner with friends in about two weeks.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zal5M2A9lIP_-wOGA0ILtg.text: Great place for group dinners, especially for work/tradeshow.  Close to main convention center.  Service was quick, sangria tasty...

a7Xxxw2a-YSK-xO0pljphA.text: During our trip to Vegas we ventured off the strip to go to Firefly.  At the end of the trip everyone said it was their favorite place out of all the restaurants we went to and I have to agree!  I made a reservation a week ahead of time for a party of 6 and they called the day before to confirm. The ambiance is dim lit, energetic, loud and fun!   It's the perfect place to go to with a group because you can try a little bit of everything. We ordered and ate family style and everyone seemed to enjoy it. All that was left was empty dishes! Some of our favorites were the stuffed dates, baked goat cheese, and the steak and mushroom skewers.   Out of the 6 of us 5 were sharing the tapas and 1 person ordered an entree. The tapas came out all at once, but our friend with the entree had to wait 15 minutes before hers came out so that sucked since we all felt bad she didn't have her food at the same time as everyone else. We could have clarified a bit better when we ordered. Since the tapas came out all at once I'd recommend ordering in courses especially if you are ordering half the menu like we did. The service was good and only got a little slow at times, but they were slammed so its to be expected.   In comparison to all the restaurants on the strip we visited, the food at Firefly was better and it was a lot cheaper since you aren't paying for the celebrity chef's name.   We also had fun with the GIF maker on the way out!

sSjt9_9gdL7n3UAmigTg7g.text: Absolutely excellent.  The food was well paired with complementing Ingredients and contrasting flavors. Very Creative.  For being tapas the portions were ample. Definitely try the ceviche and the scallops.  Their salads are excellent too.

WeyrCvlSIjLf-5OsSrun7g.text: This is a MUST try restaurant when visiting Las Vegas! They have a live salsa band and a dance floor of to the side of the restaurant. The restaurants looks and feels sexy inside with the decor.  They had a long list of tapas categorized by proteins an also had paella's to share. My friend and I started our food adventure with the tomato soup and mini grilled brie sandwich ($7.5). the brie threw us off because were expecting the traditional grilled cheese flavor, yet it was good. The ahi tuna skewers ($10)were also a big hit with us; mango, basil, ginger-soy glaze, house pickles, and salsa verde is what this dish was mixed with. At this point with the, skewers, the soup and the complimentary bread they gave us we were getting a bit full, so we decided to share the delicious ribeye. A 14oz. ribeye with Firefly fries, aioli, red wine sauce and cabrales bleu cheese cooked medium rare ($29) was just the right thing to have. The meat and the pitcher of red wine sangria ($31) were complimenting each other perfectly.  If your into salsa dancing and great food, this is the spot to go. A lot of attractive people were around and both the restaurant and dance area are open late and is not too far off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Tuna Skewers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious sangria

a_cqSjY84AfjwfI1LFOkBQ.text: I've wanted to come here for awhile, but for some reason it took me three years to make it in. It won't be another three years before I return. The food and service were great when I dined here for lunch last week.  There wasn't a wait for a table when we arrived for lunch on a weekday. I'm sure evenings and weekends are a different story. The ambiance of the restaurant is cozy and I could see this being a great spot for a date night. Our waiter was great about refilling drinks, checking in frequently, and getting food to us as soon as it was ready. There weren't any delays in getting additional orders placed.   I really enjoyed every item that we ordered. The menu offered a nice variety of dishes so everyone will find something they are sure to enjoy. All of the plates had a lot of flavor and I was impressed with everything I ate.  Roasted Beet & Persimmon Salad- the largest serving of the items we ordered, several really great flavors that came together well, loved the pecan crusted goat cheese and beets Stuffed Dates- my favorite tapas I tried, bursting with flavor and the texture was perfect Padron Peppers- one of my favorite pepper dishes I've tried, salty in a good way Empanada- serving includes two empanadas, the outer pastry was delicious and the sauce on top was great too Chicken & Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms- simple, but delicious Manchego Mac-N-Cheese- addicting, this was really yummy and was tastier with each bite, one of the heartier tapas options Warm Persimmon Cake- yummy, a moist bread pudding with delicious raisin gelato on top, a delicious dessert for sure  I'll definitely return and bring my husband for a nice date night!

PyDqnzHNPvHWKqyZzp1Czw.text: My wife remember coming here a while back and so she said we had to go.  Happy she made me because this place is great!  Definite bang for your buck. We ordered the paella and almost killed it lol, definitely serves 4!  We also got some other tapas that were very good.  For dessert I got the chocolate tres leches cake. Yummy!!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Paella... u need more than 2 for this thing!

fr6TOj0YHbhhK9t0CXjOyw.text: Arrived for early dinner with a party of 6. Luckily we got there at 5pm and Happy Hour goes on till 6pm!! We ordered 4 Sangria pitchers and wow where they amazing!!! We also ordered the stuffed dates 10/10, chicken skewers 8/10, Fires were a 100/10 !!    Service was amazing! Waiters picked everything up right away  so don't leave anything unattended lol Will make it a point to come have some sangria and a few appetizers here more often, the vibe here is great, the decor is amazing and just a really great spot to meet with friends!

a7cxfMhIt3vrTCNrfyCCew.text: Nice restaurant, great service, but food was mediocre. It's open late night which is awesome. Just personally I've had better tapas for the price.

ga_cSLjlqKJkoahse1FCcQ.text: All five of our senses are triggered.  Starts with the hearing, sight, and touch; continues with smell and taste.  Having an eye for art, interior design, and food presentation will be a bit of indulging.  With a strong preference for noise to drown out a hectic week, the task can be satisfied within the walls of Firefly.  All of the other senses will just follow.  Allow it... by starting with a Ginger Smash, Island Mojito, or a Pear Ginger Martini at the bar.  For the remaining flavor senses, manipulate them with a cool selection of tapas.  My faves are as listed:  Mushroom Tart - comfy smells appetizing Seared Tuna - wonderful highly recommended Calamari - pretty good nice with the sauce Grilled Octopus - soft good flavor, missing sticky rice hahaaa (no picture included) Bacon Wrapped Dates - stuffed with an almond WOWtastic! Baked Cod - good flavor but DRY (get it right next time) Beet Salad - salty... why?!!! (otherwise healthy)  There were more tapas ordered by others in our group of 11 people.  They had a good flow going with servers delivering them to our table.  Best to make reservations way ahead.  Even with a reservation it took almost 40 minutes to be seated after our reservation time at 8pm.  This restaurant rocks!  Friday night Salsa dancing happens in the side room past the bar.  Didn't try it; just letting people know in case they didn't yet.  Cuz no - not everybody knows everything.  4**** stars even if it was a little chaotic.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari, Bacon Wrapped Dates w/almonds, Seared Tuna, Mushroom Tart
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Art

TXlK9PAjV0BK5kicOy3hJA.text: Right on! Knowing that Firefly Tapas reopened was fantastic news to me. I used to frequent their location on Eastern at the base of Anthem over the past years and when they closed, the dark clouds covered my blue Firefly sky. I have not had the opportunity to check out the Paradise location but when I was given the opportunity to on Friday night with other Yelp Elite friends, I jumped on it.   The vibe is pretty busy, sexy and swanky. The amount of people who were there was like visiting a popular New York restaurant on a Friday night. It was wall to wall humans but due to the size of the location it was better than said NY location. Although we had reservations, we waited at the bar for our table. It wasn't bad because I got to catch up with friends and drink a Ginger Smash. Excellent pre-cocktail by the way.  We ordered tapas. Lots of Tapas. Shared those lots of ordered Tapas. One thing I have always liked about the Tapas experience is that you can just try a bit of everything. Can one get full from trying a bit of everything, of course one can! I have always enjoyed their bacon wrapped dates. When they first closed I was sad, so sad because I have not found Bacon Wrapped Dates that even nail Fireflys. The added smoked almond does it for me. Most places don't add the almond so it just mushes. The ham and cheese Croquetas, stuffed peppers and beet salad are also a fabulous choice. I recommend those for tapas  ordered. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu, so fun to explore Spanish style tapas here.   I hope to come back down soon, there are a lot of tapas that I want to try or revisit!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared tuna skewers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed peppers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates... A must!

66Dn9RyVV2yXhpItAkMVOw.text: For 2 of us, we ordered Empanada (7.50), Machego mac and cheese, Steak, shrimp skewers, bacon wrapped dates, stuffed mushroom chicken.   Meat skewers: cooked very well and had a lot of flavors  Bacon wrapped dates: crispy and declisiuos   Empanada: It was really good but hard to justify paying 7.50 for one empanada.   Machego mac and cheese: nothing special, tastes like mac and cheese to me   Stuffed mushroom chicken: yummy and juicy.   We also got a Flan dessert with a crispy waffle like roll for our anniversary and it was yummy.    The complimentary bread looked really good from the looks of it but it tasted stale.   Make sure you make rsvp.  I saw a bunch of people waiting when we left (around 7:30pm Saturday).    I would come back to try their ham sliders, and paella.

zVW4LepKYXh7fEqAAQWhnQ.text: Let me start off by saying the customer service here is pretty great and the food is even better! We tried the calamari, artichoke toast, empanadas, pulpo asado, mussels, Tierra y mar skewers, the fries, the bacon wrapped dates, ceviche of shrimp and paella! For desert we tried the flourless chocolate cake it was bomb, the gelato trio, and lemon berry tarts. Everything was delicious! The drinks are really good! If you're in town I definitely suggest you try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke Toasts Firefly Fries
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari

MU0WuAxys_yxX3RVa7U8Ag.text: I can't believe I have not reviewed this place yet, especially because it happens to be one of my absolute favorite places in Las Vegas. Mainly because it is so consistent in so many ways that I completely appreciate.   Ambiance-whether it's high noon on a Monday or midnight on a Saturday, Firefly always feels great accommodating, welcoming and prepared for your presence. The music is gentle during the day and a little bit more lively in the evening (which seems to mirror the general  joie de vivre that's present). Even the outdoor seating has its own sense of charm about it. Well, except for in the summer when it's just downright hell fire hot, but that's not the fault of FIREFLY.   Ease-Whether you are by yourself or with a party of 10, they never seem to have a problem finding a place for you to sit while also giving you great service competently and efficiently.  Choice- Because It's a tapas place you get a wide variety of Foods to choose from which make it easy to accommodate all kinds of taste palettes. There is also a full bar within the restaurant that is only slightly separated from the rest of the room but you can eat at the bar if you like.  Delectability-More than any other restaurant I've ever been to, Firefly has inspired me to try new things each time I come. Everything from the tuna tartare to the lamb chops, from the chicken salad to the paella, from the roast beef to the escargot, and from the mac&cheese to the patatas bravas; each  has been a taste treat I'd easily repeat.  Oh, and their Sangria is a MUST HAVE!!  Adaptability- dressed up or dressed down you will feel comfortable here. Whether you come from a formal event or just want to throw on something comfortable and run out for a meal, somehow you'll feel appropriately dressed in this atmosphere  Parking-even when this place is crowded there is always ample parking, which I appreciate. They also have free valet.  Last, but not least, The wait staff and hostesses are most charming and efficient. I have felt seen and welcomed with every visit.   FIREFLY is a great place to experience while you're in Vegas, so make sure that you do. If you happen to be a local, it's a great place for you to bring your friends that are visiting Las Vegas because it's always a winner! (and it's open late!) I just went last night and already I'm eager to go again.

ciYTeLOMHhni-YLCF1nGnw.text: One of my favorite places to come when I'm in Vegas! It's usually super busy, so be prepared to wait! The most recent time I went was around 5:30/6 on a weekday. It wasn't too busy so our party of 3 was seated fairly quickly.   The menu had plenty of options - it's a bit overwhelming so we had a hard time deciding what to get. Everything looked so good! Some of the highlights of what we ordered: Tuna tartare - came with taro chips which you can ask for more if you run out. Steak and mushroom - two skewers of juicy steak with mushroom covered in magic sauce. Go for the medium rare!   The service was excellent, and the food came out very fast. Will definitely come back again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jeGkCPFsDNUlDuz0-ojEmg.text: I just LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! Always have for years. I bring friends and family here.  Tapas are amazing idea for a family like ours.  We love to try different things and this is the place to do it. They have so many choices!!! Drinks are great too.  I always opt for their sparkling sangria. Sooo good.  I only wish they never closed their West location :( PS. I didn't know they do Latin nights on Fridays (maybe other nights too). It was a lot of fun to dance outside and just let loose.

rVj9CIANjq4yZqwKUvsgIQ.text: Lovely atmosphere! Great variety of options! I ordered the Shrimp Ceviche, the octopus, and the mini filet. My ONLY complaint is that my filet was cooked well done, when I ordered it Medium rare. I ate it anyways . Flavors were spot on and service was terrific. Please be sure to get the octopus!!! Wish I had ordered it first!!

ZuO0b0hKCOLFbrQlLdxsvg.text: Go here with friends and order everything. As a trio, we ordered nine meals and it was perfect. We got to try everything! I don't think I could pick a favorite- the sparkling sangria was amazing. Go and enjoy Vegas... the real affordable off the strip Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

loX2PJw78Kg1e7i1qc_B0w.text: I was really looking forward to going to Firefly given all the good reviews. However, the food was average at best. We tried multiple dishes. The tempura shrimp lacked flavor. The Mac and cheese was just ok. The chicken skewers would have been better if there wasn't a cream sauce on top of them; it was unpleasant. The patatas bravas was a bit soggy. Additionally, it's pretty loud so it's difficult to hear conversation.   We did enjoy some of the dishes... The filet was awesome! And the flourless chocolate cake and seasonal veggies were also very good. We were seated easily. Our server was excellent and the food was out quickly. The support staff was also good about running food and picking up old dishes. Prices were reasonable.   I wouldn't return but maybe we just picked some dishes that were subpar.

tPQvKIazDeQ_j3Xs8y3aOQ.text: Excellent food and service was great. Wrap dates was exquisite and the paella was the best. I truly recommend this place if you want Spanish tapas.  It was noise.

0MvL_gX-R591I_pM3zALAQ.text: This restaurant has been around a while and is always a great place to come.    To start off they have a great happy hour. On this occasion I did not go for happy hour but for those considering it i would highly recommend.    This place has a tendency to get busy so if going for dinner I recommend making reservations beforehand. There's a great staff that made sure to keep drinks full throughout dinner and service was prompt.  The restaurant is a little loud so just be aware that is can be a little difficult hearing people at your table if you have a larger group.    The sangria is a must for this place. I prefer red but all are good.  Get a pitcher, it's worth it.  Food is great and for a tapas place the dishes are quite large.  On this night we ordered the paiella which I have never tried here before.  You must put the order in early as it takes around 40 minutes to prepare.  It is a large dish and serves quite a few.  I got the chicken one with chorizo added. I'd probably recommend getting the seafood version instead as this is how the dish is traditionally made.  The bacon wrapped dates are also a must.

RpFsZCG2RVNY30HpXupT1Q.text: We love this place!  The abundance of flavorful opportunities available to the palate, all on one menu - is delightful!  The service is phenomenal and the drinks are delicious.  Hurry and get here before the crowd arrives.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tierra y mar skewer

s-zsvHr9uH3AMSUHlf-WfQ.text: B+ : Patatas Bravas - just like any potatoes with cheese, but it hit the spot though  B: Shrimp Ceviche - meh  B: Avocado Montadito  A: Camarones a la Diabla - I love the spicy and sweet sauce  A: Baked cod - a lot of flavor  B: Huevos Estrellados - I did not like the tomato sauce on the potatoes, go for the bravas for potatoes  A: Cheesy fries - can't go wrong  A: Scallops are good  I like this place because it's easy, food is decent and I love tapas.  But then again, we're in Vegas, I want fine dinning :)

MADY3vu7Dz3yq-ZjUz7awg.text: My girlfriend and son brought me here for my birthday dinner. It had been years since I had eaten here and I was so excited.  We showed up about 5:20pm for our reservation and were seated right away. Our server asked us for our drink order and told us that we could make either the red or white sangria sparkling. We decided to go with a pitcher of the red sparking sangria and boy did it not disappoint. It was delicious and had the smallest chunks of apples and fruit and that made it that much better in my mind.  The server gave us a small plate of bread with honey butter to start and man, was it good. That was a nice touch. We used the bread later in the meal with different sauces and with just the butter. Delicious!   For the food, my son ordered the fish sticks and firefly fry's. He loved the fish sticks, it came with an order of two and a spicy tarter sauce. He loved the sauce so much he asked for more to eat with his fry's.   My girlfriend and I ordered the stuffed dates, lamb chops and the apple manchego salad. It was all SOOOO good.   For our second round we ordered the tuna tartar, garlic muscles and escargot scallops. The flavors were mind blowing!!   Lastly we rounded it out with another order of stuffed dates and albondigas meatballs. We all enjoyed the meatballs but the stuffed dates.....there are no words to describe how good those are. By far my favorite part of the meal and girlfriend enjoyed the tuna tartar and escargots scallops the most.   We had a really great time, service was excellent and very attentive. The servers checked on us often, refilled our sangria and picked up empty places quickly.   I cannot wait to come back and try more of the tapas and have a pitcher of the white sangria.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food menu
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and honey butter

2h1739AIkrPwTAl8DK4D8w.text: Delicious food.  We had a big party and order family style a carried of entrees and appetizers.

5E71Sna-NvHa8wmZvnYlrQ.text: We have hosted two team dinners here for the last two years (groups of 40+). Fernanda was professional and prompt in her emails. We had separate/private rooms for our events. The food was good. We have had both the Firefly menu and their sister restuarant Tacos&Beer menu at both our events.   The firefly menu was eclectic. The tacos&beer menu was decent, although the portions were slim. Our party of 40 ate through all the taco meat, churros, and chips.   Overall the venue worked well. They allowed time for set up and the area was clean. The staff was extremely friendly.

ko36P7OoTvwMLyGdUfmgqA.text: We always love Girefly!   The tapas are delicious and the drinks are great.  Today we're enjoying happy hour.

RnqL5G1N0DVi5XvrUbL1AQ.text: Aside from it being busy and loud, this restaurant was awesome. The food was tasty and drinks were really good. They had a separate gluten free menu and tons of options for vegan, vegetarian as well. Didn't make it to dessert, but they had several that were GF.

tEaiFQqQ5uNhLMehiDlCIA.text: Honestly one of my go to's when I'm in Vegas! It's not right on the strip - you can usually get a table and if you go with a group it's so fun to try all the wonderful tapas and all the drinks are so amazing! You haven't failed me yet  If I find my pics from the last time I went I'll add to it on my IG@aprileatz

z63qP4KQJM-L5XEZgH0_yw.text: I was on my last leg with starvation by the time we decided to go to this place, and was somewhat worried the food would not be expedited quickly enough for my growing hangriness.  However, upon arrival, we were seated quickly (it was just passed 3:00 p.m.), and seated at a small candle lit table. It was a very laid back atmosphere, but with an intimate feel due to the dim lighting. Despite the hour, there was a nice amount of patrons enjoying both their company, the drinks, and the tapas.    The service was a bit slow initially (it took a while for our waiter to come, and our water and bread took even longer).  However, after that hiccup, our server was mostly attentive.  As a side note, the gentleman serving our waters and food was a bit brisk and curt in many regards.  For example, he mumbled the entree being placed on our table, and the cups and plates were not thrown at us, but was not placed on our table in a very polite or gentil way (especially for the setting we were at). Anyway, I surmised he was just having a bad day or just has a more standoffish nature.  Who knows what has been his life experiences after all? Anyway, he managed a smile at the end with a bit of eye contact.  So maybe he was just a timid creature.  In any case, I grew accustomed to his disposition through our late lunch dining, for we sat for a while.  So now coming back to my hangriness which had by now transformed me to a desperate withering mess, I threw aside the substantive drink menu (since I don't drink), and scanned the main menu.  The menu lived up to its tapas name, as there was an extensive list to choose from.  Scanning through the menu for no more than five minutes (which is not my style), perhaps due to my ravenousness (not a word, I know) or maybe wonderful menu options, but I knew with conviction what I was going to order. Not only for myself, but for my husband as well (It must have been the hunger, or the menu, or the grumpy server, who knows?). It was a first ever!  So here it goes:  Bread and butter was complimentary.  The bread was a nice combination of soft and crusty.  The butter was soft, creamy,  and slightly sweet. It was a winning pair.  Tuna Tartare-  it was a nice mound of tuna mixed with avocado and infused with a sesame dressing that hinted some spiciness.  The taro chips was an unexpectedly great companion to this little entree.  I was very pleased with this particular dish.  Veggie Empanada-  I was a bit disappointed that it was just one( cut into halves) that came to the table. However, it wasn't too lonely looking as there was a small mix European salad, lightly dressed to accompany it. I think it ended up being a great contrast to the empanada.  The crust was crisp, and slightly greasy, but the salad saved it from being too heavy and oily. The filling was rich and savory, with the perfect seasoning.    Seafood Paella- (which is why we sat for some time. It takes 40 minutes to prepare as noted on the menu and reminded by our server)  I've never actually eaten paella (only with my eyes), but this was pretty good.  It seems the flavors become more and more developed with every bite.  I'm not too big a fan with overly moist rice, but this was very pleasing.  I enjoyed this dish tremendously, and so did my husband. Incidentally, if you are a seafood aficionado, you may not thoroughly feel sated by the amount on the dish, nor the minute size of the little creatures (I had to squint at one of the clams as I daintly extracted the little guy from the shell).    All in all, I really enjoyed this place!

JYMMximYxNV1ClUCGbF01w.text: I came here on salsa night on a Friday with a group of girls. The salsa scene in Las Vegas is nothing like California. Men hardly ask women to dance. Men watch and stare at the girls and seriously keep to themselves.   This is a pattern I've noticed at many different salsa clubs in the city. On this particular night, the outdoor patio was where all the dancing was happening and my good looking coworkers were basically dancing alone or amongst themselves. Come on guys, get a grip. It's salsa...just ask instead of staring and watching.  Drinks are good and service was bomb. The interior restaurant vibe is super cool as well. I'll definitely go back to try their food and one more shot at the salsa scene here.

Htt_-qOzpwBUZGtCEJxeVw.text: This is a locals place and people who come to Vegas so much that they're kinda like locals.  Most of the "action" happens at the bar (which is pretty big).  Food is small plates and if you want the best deal, come here for happy hours.    You'll find the food wonderful.

BsfBtnAjL5G2P4y9_XLNag.text: What a find (thanks, Yelpers!) This place earns top honors on a multi- week, multi-state trip. Ambitious but reasonably priced selection of a remarkable array of tapas items. Portions generous by tapas standards, and the quality of each dish was outstanding, from ingredients, to preparation, to presentation. This place knows it's stuff and the wait staff is well versed. 2 ridiculously good lamb chops for $12, bacon wrapped dates with blue cheese in a wine reduction sauce for $6.50,  a generous serving of Ahi crusted Tuna for $10, spicy filet mignon salad for $11. We went twice, 4 the first time, 6 the second everything each of us choose off a menu sporting a huge number of mind boggling good things was delicious.

gv-hf_0CvekaUwhj2V9gWg.text: I love fire fly, if it was a little cheaper would get 5 stars, took the girlfriend on a date here and we were both very happy with the service and food. The bacon wrapped dates Mmm so tasty. If locals get discounts I would be returning quite often .

zdsGA-OJkFBy7KpMZHkUMQ.text: Paella was over seasoned. Staff was so rude staring with the hostess and the waitress. Price was good. But I won't come back.

8p399WFnEcgUPkYn_ZuqAg.text: Amazing service. Great food, get the stuffed dates it is divine. I had my food in less then 20 minutes. Food came out perfect as ordered. Server was polite and had my drink put within 2 minuted. Would come back again any day!!! Love it here great atmosphere!!

SaWxsqBh9YC07NdXKykq6Q.text: Sangria and lamb chops at 1:00 a.m. in the morning, baby.

20rDbQ7o3vEUFiP0oEhD1g.text: Unimpressed by everything.  The Sangria was good,  not great and all of the food was super heavy.  I would not go back.

MM_j7LrvfRqX5GhMaYlCAA.text: Went here on a recommendation of a friend and we're so glad we went! Great priced platters and my favorite was the sparkling wine mimosas. We bought a pitcher it w as so good! Great value for what you pay, we received great service and will definitely come back again. My favorite was the shrimp diablas and the bacon wrapped dates!

jMUhK4yl85zhywXmr2vMzg.text: Walking into the new location, it just didn't feel like Firefly. There was no squeezing up to the bar, waiting outside, or squeezing you way through the place on the way to your table.  It certainly lost its coziness.  My friend and I had a lengthy discussion noting all of the differences and how we didn't know how to feel as 'it's just not what it used to be'  Then the bacon stuffed dates came out, and all of a sudden, it felt like Firefly again, and we started to appreciate all the improvements including the significantly larger space and improved decor.  Food and Booze were still as good as ever.

J-R2IW1joz6oFcz2Jh1euA.text: After a long day of working in LV, my husband and I wanted a quick, delicious meal. Firefly happened to be right down the street. We were greatly surprised with the yumminess that was had. Bacon wrapped dates, artichoke toast, salads, chorizo-chicken skewer and can you say "Sangria"!!! I tried all three varieties..... Like candy! We will definitely be back on our next business trip!
