ccheMPpBESVF-XVrCcIy_A.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! If you come to Vegas, you must try Firefly. It's super cute and the food is SO good. My favs are the apple & manchego salad, the bread and butter they give you, and the mushroom and filet skewers. Everything I've ever had is good, so you really can't go wrong. If I could give it 6 stars, I would!!!

1yHLiosQXuLcxofM5vIoyA.text: I haven't been here since they moved and I always enjoyed Firefly. A 30 min wait on a Friday was not bad and we were taken to a table within this time frame. We sat and it took  a bit for a server to come over so we made some food decisions before ordering a drink. Finally ordering a mojito it was brought back to the table with the worst sour taste to it. A new one was made with no issues and it was a little better.  -The food itself was up and down. The fries are always good and the Serrano ham and cheese plate was excellent. The clams with chorizo were bad, the clams weren't cleaned and there was grit in the dish along with broken pieces of shell. The Tierra y mare skewers which are my favorite were so salty I wiped them off with a napkin! just a nightmare. - service may be the worst. Waiting on drinks and trying to reorder food is like waiting in line at the DMV but with alcohol. Most of the staff was busy talking to a friend who sat at a big booth and sipped water for an hour while other parties waited to be seated. It was nice to see someone was being waited on.

mQeP51Q3DEyE8A2miOFBwA.text: shared a few small plates, the food was great, the white sangria amazing, the date was aweful. lol Thank God the restaurant was fantastic

txsLFMiXzX-Herf6Gk9MvQ.text: Best Tapas in town! Every time I come to Vegas I have to stop and enjoy the food! Best lamb chops ever!! Stuffed peppers to die!! Just everything is delish!! Come you won't regret it!

GqkDLzcjP3Eh2_efgw1biw.text: I stop by this restaurant every time I go to Vegas. Never a disappointment. I love the tapas (all of them) and the service is always excellent.

CwTJOix06mqpURCx1t3PoA.text: Service on point as usual and the food is amazing.  Keep up the great work and hopefully we Las Vegas we see another location again.

P4RCaVBglXSfcMdgtlo6Dw.text: Good menu, decent prices, service can get a bit bogged down during peak hours. Well worth a visit, just aim for an off hours visit if you can.

DgUvu48VqnYnOAtWXmo6gQ.text: DIVINE!!! Best Tapas EVER, ties with the classy stuff in Barcelona!!!  And I've seen a few, trust me!!! DEEEVINEEEE!!!

htAj5yAttwmw52hvF2zA4A.text: This place is amazing! The waiter we had was so attentive and even moved our menus to the side for us to have extra space on the table. The pitcher of red wine sangria was delicious and just two tapas were enough to fill me up. I had the apple machengo which was a green apple type salad which was delicious, and the ahi tuna skewers which I highly recommend. The atmosphere is calm yet infused with red everywhere and the music is just the right volume for having conversation without yelling

afXE0-7xfmxsr914N8hMjw.text: Oooooooh my god! The food is soooooo good! Atmosphere is great, service is great, food is great what more can you ask for. This spot is a absolute must if your in town.

Yah3JhvxWNvCt821XcSZDw.text: Thank you yelpers.... I was in the area and was looking for a good meal.  Yelpers directed me here and it was OUTSTANDING!!!  Service was great and the food was the bomb.  Waitress recommended most of our dishes and she knew her stuff.  Highly recommended.

gGEGiAKu7vWswFbOwA-FQg.text: Server was excellent. Busser or server assistant was terrible. My cousin came to visit from Peru. I wanted her to try one of my favorite restaurants. I asked the busser to take a photo of us (closest person at the time) and he was the rudest!! He seriously gridded his teeth and took the phone from me with out saying a word. He acted as though I slapped him in the face.. Last time I checked you're in the service industry, to SERVE! Like I said my food was great, server was great but the bussing staff is terrible. He just made us feel uncomfortable the entire time. Took every single thing off our table with out smiling or making himself friendly by any means...

fu9woKfD1dfvoOWTOY1fNg.text: Good food. Good atmosphere. Good service. The tapas are the best. I would go back and eat here every night if I could...

nhVxqjrQCKD30sUAG5yG8g.text: Yes, you are reading this rating right 4STARS for Firefly.  At the end of this review I will explain why I did not rate 5STARS  With all the negative publicity that this restaurant has received it's time to put them back in the good light.    I was recently here for a team meeting, and I have to say that I was very impressed. This new location is AWESOME, valet parking in the front and ample parking in the back.  Hostess booth as you walk-in just like the old location but the update in the new location is now there is a WAITING AREA.  Helloooooooo, no longer do I have to wait outside, in addition to the waiting area the new bar area is big enough to sit and have a drink and not be elbowed by other patrons.    RESTROOMS - clean, clean, clean! and more than 2 stalls (sorry just keeping it REAL)  DINING ROOM - OMG, amazing you can actually walk through the restaurant w/o saying the following:  - "oh, I'm sorry"  - "excuse me, can you scoot your chair in please"  - "it's hot in here, is the AC on" , etc  Big parties can be seated and accommodated comfortable.  Firefly now has a extra room for private parties, that sits off tot he side of the dining area.  BAR - The bar is SUPER, more than 5ppl can sit at the bar now.  If you and friends want to chill at the bar and sit together, you can.  Open bar area, it sits kind of in the middle of the restaurant.  PATIO - couches outside, more of a lounge area now.  FOOD -   - STUFFED DATES: yummy! yes indeed, dates stuffed w/ blue cheese wrapped in crispy bacon. (I don't even liked blue cheese, but i KILLED those stuffed dates)  - MANCHEGO MAC&CHEESE: when you can see the grease of the cheese along the rim of the dish, know that you're in for a culinary delight.  bubbly cheesy goodness, mac&cheese comes out w/ that crunchy cheese top. you know how you throw food in the oven set on broiler to make it extra crunchy...YEP, and that's what come to you table. mmm, mmm, good  - ALBONDIGAS: juicy moist meatballs w/ melted parmesan cheese sitting in a bath of tasty tomato sauce.  NO really, the sauce is on point, I wanted to take the bowl and slurp but I didn't want to look like a fat a$$.  - VEGGIE EMPANADAS: crispy flaky dough, you hear that slight CRUNCH when you bite into the empanada.  the veggies are not all mushy or hard for that fact.  its a nice balance, it comes drizzled with some kind of sauce that matched very well  - STEAK&MUSHROOMS SKEWERS: um YEA! medium rare, i don't what type of steak but it was tasty.  it reminded me of filet mignon, it was so tender, when I pinched the steak to pull of the skewer it just slide right off.  If you are a mushroom person, then this dish will make you very happy.  They do not skimp of size or flavor  - BEEF SLIDERS: DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! no extras needed, don't ask for for any ranch, no ketchup, no mustard, no NOTHING. EAT AS IS, beef is seasoned perfectly, cooked medium rare, you take a bite and your teeth just sink into the beef.  OH MY GOSH, i'm getting hot over here..oh i forgot I'm still writing a review  GO TO FIREFLY'S you will not get SICK, I PROMISE.  They have cleaned house in there, I did not see any of the OLD employees there.  I was a regular at the old paradise location, I was familiar w/ all the workers at the old location.  The NEW paradise location is NEW all the way around.  The food is still GREAT   NOW, the reason why I did rate 5STARS is because of this one problem: With a new spacious restaurant and bigger restrooms there is still NO TOILET PAPER in the bathroom.  If you're a girl, go to the bathroom with a friend just in case you walk into the stall and it is out of paper.  "hey girl, can you hand me some rough ass paper towels please"  I'm just saying.....  Check out the NEW FIREFLYS on Paradise, it's good.  A good place for anything

YCm_YG9_aMLcFu15TrKbkw.text: Been wanting to try this place for a while now.   Deducted 1 star because it took a while for the hostess to realize their was people waiting by the stand and it was confusing. Most of the night people would just walk in think ing they could just sit anywhere or were actually looking for the hostess.   4 stars for the food and ambience. Very trendy, but somewhat casual atmosphere. This is definitely a "Date Night" Restaurant. Gets loud with large groups, so you may need to speak up with whoever you're with. The service was awesome! Our waiter was kind, he broke down ingredients and flavors in a lot of the dishes and helped determine some of the tapas we may enjoy. I ordered the Sparkling Red Sangria, very good. They have a lot of space for large and small groups. I noted one booth had a curtain with it, so even if you wanted to have a more intimate dinner you definitely could.  Favorite Tapas include Camarones Al Ajillo, Firefly Fish Sticks, and the Baby Back Ribs  You can easily do quite some damage at this restaurant and you're bill will reflect that. Walking away, I paid close to $75 on the bill for 2 people. So you can only imagine what you can do with more food and drinks.  All in all a good experience, and would like to return.

rCseUtNh34kgpIGmqKy54w.text: First time here. Was hungry as hell and didn't know what to order. But our server Rojelio made AWESOME suggestions. We left it up to him to bring out what we had. He had a great helper Jazzey who made sure our plates were taken once done. Waters were refilled really quickly. This is what we had... Mango ribs... tender. Sauce was over powering Bacon wrapped dates...delish  Tuna tartar... my favorite Ceviche... good amount of lemon and came with these hand fried tortillas Mac and cheese... ehhhh Marinara sauce and a glop of cheese in the middle. BOMB with the bread Surf and turf skewers. Tender. Was excellent combo with the steak shrimp and sausage. Filet mignon on a bed of spinach and fried onions soooooooo tender We had a few more thing but we were starving from being out on the strip. Overall. This would defiantly be a place to visit again. 6 people. $150. A crap load of dishes. Awesome service. Quickly served. Food was prompt and hot. Thank you for a great meal. Sorry no pics... like I said. We were starving:)

c128lqJdUdc5HXTwlGGFSQ.text: Great spot! Portions are larger than your average tapas that's for sure. I was starving and got full 3 tapas. The Ahi Tuna, Shrimp Diablo, and Grilled Octopus were delicious! I had about 6 cocktails and they were all amazing!   The food comes out super fast! e9OiyEthZpycpSC6WTjiew.text: The food is amazing. Pick it and it's great. Seriously. They're good at everything.  Bacon wrapped dates, ahi stack and petite filet are the bomb. Get the infused vodka on the rocks to drink.  Off the Strip location is perfect for relaxing and getting away from the craziness.  Omar, is the Man! Great and verrrry personable bartender. Seriously, just do it and you'll thank me.  Oh, and tell Omar or Athena that Rick sent you.  You're welcome.

vJZ6el4xP7Bz8xAuy8GAdA.text: I am so confused by these raving reviews. This place is pretty but the food was terrible.  Prices are now twice of what the pictures of the menus on yelp show.  The now 33 dollar pitcher of sangria tasted like rotten fruit, boxed wine, and the cheapest brandy.

wLweZgAlSHNVrA9gfGbq2g.text: I have always enjoyed Firefly from the many years I've been patronizing this business. However, now that they have released a Vegetarian and Vegan menu I am ecstatic about dining here all over again. The atmosphere is always fun and inviting, the food is delicious, and the alternative menu has many great options for those who are meat conscious.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Uz4BA12DV0GMmjEMMQKRgw.text: I've never thought to go off the strip for food, but I'm so glad I took the recommendation of a friend and came here. The tuna tartare was AMAZING and the bacon date bites were such a surprising flavor. Definitely definitely coming back here and dragging all my friends off the strip to make a stop.

S4ZScEN-a53uW6_Q2pHuCA.text: I am not quite sure how this plays get so many high reviews I definitely know that a lot of my friends liked it it was probably my very first experience with Tapas  We ordered several dishes one that particularly was delicious with the fags but I know we ordered multiple items I wasn't too crazy about the place because of the menu but I know that I hated the location I think that's the worst part but at least there is parking  And the service was definitely good It's not a place that I would visit on a regular basis

9Uzef-2sPYe4TwgqGpubQg.text: We live in a BIG little town. To be able to go to a bar/restaurant that attracts so many tourists and still be able to call it your local, speaks volumes. The food is fantastic and the drinks are not easily matched- anywhere else in this town.  Let's talk about the staff: Where to begin- Omar,Danny, Daniel and Mariano - they all bring a little  something different to the table.  I cannot pick a favorite because they're all so GREAT! Danny makes a mean cucumber Bloody Mary - Omar is famous for his fun personality and mixology skills. ( this guy will make you a GREAT drink ) Mariano - ( Dimples ) and Danny of course .. you're all fantastic!   Don't miss a trip here!

A98F7lhg4uqSmUk8lwcF_g.text: Solid small plates and a nice patio. We were there for lunch but would love to come back on a Friday night for the entertainment. Nice to get away from the strip and find a decent restaurant.

ABLgEZsPPd6lk5pSbYHyBA.text: Went here for a friend's bachelor party and we were rolling pretty deep (like 20 of us). I was appointed to order for the table and was very glad to. We got 13 different tapas (3-4 sets of each) and some paella. The paella was OK. If you get it, get the seafood one. I've had some pretty good paella and it set the bar really high. Make sure to start with their Sangria (I got the red). It was delicious! They say they marinate it for a minimum of 3 days and it definitely shows. So smooth and bomb. Pros: + Restaurant had a nice ambiance + Friendly staff (the owner came out and even bought us a couple rounds of drinks for the bachelor party). + Waiter was knowledgeable about the food + Huge selection of tapas to choose from (could make things difficult) Cons: - Not exactly on the strip, but worth it for a nice dinner. Food highlights: + SCALLOPS "ESCARGOTS" - these scallops were amazing!! My favorite dish here!!! They were cooked in the escargots container thing and the garlic herb butter hit the spot so well. Definitely get this!! + MANCHEGO MAC 'N' CHEESE - super cheesy but very delicious. Can never go wrong with mac n cheese + CHORIZO CLAMS - clams with chorizo in a sweet and salty sauce. I believe it came from the clams and the the chorizo. + Lamb skewers - tender and did not have a gamey taste to it + CAMARONES A LA DIABLA - big shrimps cooked to perfection. nice and crunchy with a sweet and spicy chili sauce that complemented it very well. + STUFFED DATES - bacon wrapped dates... crispy bacon wrapped with dates inside. + TIERRA Y MAR SKEWERS - shrimp, filet mignon, chorizo sausage. AWESOME COMBO!!! enough said. I'd definitely come back to this place. Just make sure to come with a decent crowd so you can order a bunch of tapas. Here's a pic of our group: yelp.com/biz_photos/fire...

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bachelor party dinner.  Thanks, Firefly for shots of patron!

uZKSWx_HC121xglj3Wh3kw.text: Went here with my girlfriends!! So yummy! My favorite is the scallops!! Yummy . We are definitely coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PmW8UNTBhcULImu1iA5H9Q.text: Excellent Tapas, service was awesome and the atmosphere was great.  We had only eight of the many available Tapas and everyone of them were flavorful and cooked perfectly.    I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys great Tapas and at a very affordable price.  We'll be back!

06rN9C4UKMYuCbMKmf0u2A.text: Fireflys knocks it out of the park for sure.  Their staff are their key to success.  Their staff where friendly, energetic, and took care of our party very well.  We had my mothers 60th birthday party (8 people in party) , and it was beyond memorable.  Food was amazing and the drinks where tasty.  I had the seafood paella which was perfectly cooked and I finished it all (serves 2-4).   Loved it and everytime I go to Vegas I will have good times and great food at FIREFLYS.  Thank you.

jHh4p_6tmVYOAdeDA-NIqQ.text: A friend of mine that used to live in Vegas highly recommended this place to us and boy did it not disappoint!! We ordered a pitcher of Sangria and it was absolutely amazing. Then we followed that up with two plates per person and split them all. We could have easily tuned that down a bit but all the food was super delicious!!

cFOvKzusNTLwur_0ZvJg7w.text: Great food and even better service ! Patrick at the bar gave us awesome recommendations and kept us entertained - wish we would have gone earlier in our trip because we would have gone back to try more tapas!

4LUkiQ1Ac16YkXcS0HC5Vg.text: I was excited to try Firefly because of my love for tapas. Overall, everything was decent but not good. I think because I've tried some great tapas places in both SF and Portland. Firefly did not come close. The flavors were bold as tapas should be but it did not feel authentic. Something missed the marks. However, it is a great place to come with a big group and only a few minutes drive from the Strip.

DUoJ7PUKCCyLV2VAtS20bQ.text: We were coming out for a late dinner tonight and knew the restaurant would be closing at 2pm. As a courtesy to the restaurant, we called an hour ahead and told them we'd be arriving at 1:30, and asked if they would mind seating us and taking an immediate order. They said it was fine. So we drive across the city, excited to eat at one of our favorite restaurants, only to find out that they would not seat us once we arrived (30 minutes before closing time). We informed the hostess that we called and she said it was her that we talked to, to confirm the reservation. She then went on to to explain that they decided to close early because they changed their mind. They did not bother to call us back. They were unapologetic, and could care less that two loyal customers had just driven across the city to eat there. It felt like they just spit in our face. I'm familiar with the restaurant business so I know it's not just the hostesses fault, but management is to blame. I'm disgusted that any restaurant would do that to someone. SHAME ON YOU FIREFLY. I'll be leaving this review on every outpost and review site that i can find. Hope it was worth it.

XAlh1i56fb4Qy9hql1FLUQ.text: A hidden gem in Vegas!  The service is impeccable and the portions are right on for tapas.  The tuna tartare is a favorite of mine.  The sangria is a definite hit.  You see it on almost every table.  I highly recommend Firefly* on your next trip.

2zVEardgXLWjxN_xAj1FgQ.text: Bacon wrapped dates - were just ok I've had better and the peanut inside threw me for a loop thought I was chewing on a bone   Mussels- were very good! Tangy and perfectly sauced   Tierra y mar skewers - amazing steak cooked to perfection flavors meld together with the green salsa   Grilled scallops - not too great had a very fishy taste to them which seeped into the potatoes when your food all taste the same as the main part of the meal it's no bueno.

D3DxyKSGhX4AfxBxA9jhJw.text: After doing an extensive search of restaurants with private rooms, we settled on Firefly for my mom's 80th birthday party and dinner for about 20 guests. Setting up the reservation, menu and contract was a simple process. The room was great, we had our own private bartender and the food was fantastic! All for a price that was very competitive. The paella, meatballs and dates were a few of my faves--delicious! The service was excellent! We had put together a 6 minute video for my mother--she had a bit of a hard time hearing it so they turned off the music in the entire restaurant--on a Friday night--for the 6 minutes so she could hear the audio. That was an awesome touch--great food, great ambience and great customer service! I would completely recommend Firefly and we will definitely be back!

teHtGfrUHBW8A1lennM8mA.text: OMG. I'm going to talk about food. I just had the BEST Pulpo Asado. Without a doubt the BEST Pulpo/Tako dish I have ever had. I am a foodie and I have opposable thumbs therefore I am making this food texture comparison the Pulpo was like veal. 'Like buttah'!!!!!!!

OFa2_PBsD8d8kqAMPjgppQ.text: Loved finding this unique and tasty restaurant off the strip for our vacation! The food was a  pleasant twist on the authentic flavors. Since my husband has taken trips to Spain this was a real comfort food trip for him.   Be sure to try different tapas and share them in the standard Spanish tradition. We also enjoyed the Paella. A must for Vegas.

muZa1FicEQeTzjUv5aJjRg.text: This is seriously an amazing Tapas restaurant and the ambiance is just perfect for a date or a group outting.   We ordered the civiche, dates, melt in your mouth baby back ribs and for dessert we had flan and the nutela banana sandwich bites.   The service was speedy, efficient and simply perfect.  We had a main server and a runner whom both provided us their names and recommended dishes based on what we said we liked.  My friend actually asked for an iphone 4 chsrger and the waitress was kind enough to let us use her charger & she even watched it for us while it charged.    This is a great place to go before heading out to the clubds or bars. You can enjoy small dishes and get a littls buzz going before paying $20 for a drink in a popular club.

mahQjO9duTRLaDOQTocutA.text: Everything was off to a good start with the food until the mussels and clams. Then the service went south. Hmmmmm, if it wasn't for the tuna tar tar I wouldn't have been happy.

XxROw7DDZnintWvwSwuR_Q.text: We had our wedding reception in one of their private rooms for 35 guests.  We chose the Tapas banquet  ( stuffed dates are DELISH) and the premium bar. We had the room for three hours.  Everyone and everything was beyond compare.  The food kept coming  the wait staff was unobtrusive.  Bar was great.  I cannot say enough about how great Fernanda was to work with.  I'm sure I made her crazy.  All of our requests were met.  All in all a great experience.  Our guests are all saying it was THE BEST EVER!  Thank you FIREFLY.

u1CJ2xHQvsB_KHE2NeA2aw.text: AMAZING DELICIOUS Seafood Paella!! The only downfall was we didn't see the note on the menu that it took longer  for the paella to come out( I guess for cooking time), so as we ate all the other wonderful scrumptious tapas, we were all stuffed by the time the paella was served. It looked so delicious we all had to try it (stomachs protesting) and man it was soooooo delicious! It was by far the best paella I've eaten. The seafood was not overcooked, rice perfect, wonderful spices! All the tapas we ate were delicious! The staff was very attentive and friendly. My cousin and I even got a 3 piece dessert because it was our birthdays!! Will definitely be coming back here on my next trip to Vegas!

LBOai8Xd2iu2Z8lapf38og.text: Everything we ordered was absolutely fabulous. Food was served very quickly, excellent service. Loved the atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Randie and Fred do Tapas at the Firefly.

fumdAPZYCPHeIgB7jmVd1w.text: We absolutely love this place!  The food is absolutely fabulous!  We had several meat and seafood dishes and they were all amazingly delicious.  The ambiance has a very Spanish air to it which is very charming.  The service is also excellent and accommodating. The drinks and food menu is very extensive and authentic to Spanish cuisine.  Only a hop and a skip from the strip and plenty of parking.  We'll definitely be back on our next trip!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely bar
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanish decor is beautiful
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious and mouth watering Spanish bread pudding

WVSesuq1JPrvn6v5ZYaT9g.text: Used to come here all the time but waited after all those people got sick. The new place is better and bigger visual wise. The firefly fries and stuffed dates were on point! The sangria is the same and I had two glasses. My sliders had chewy meat so I gave up on those and my boyfriend didn't like his chicken empanadas. He got ahi tuna and he ate the whole thing and like it! We got the peppers and they were delicious! We got the dessert platter but next time I'll just get tres leches. Coming back again .

AcbKVDulMGieZN5nDZRlzg.text: Excellent tapas dishes; we had 5 different plates that were all equally delicious. They have a honey & almond butter with their bread that is unbelievable. Atmosphere was really nice too - noisy but you can still have conversations. The service was awesome with the dishes coming out one after another, giving us time to enjoy each one. Would highly recommend.

Tn_Ao68cVrtld5ShUrTk0g.text: The place is nice, the food is okay, a bit pricy but tolerable. I would come back only if it is for something flashy and fancy but not quite satisfying, like catching up with this ancient friend from high school, whom you've not seen for 20 years since.......high school.

n4GEdNx9CiKzcUd9zTaJCQ.text: Overall it's still firefly even with the scare that happened. I came here the other night and ordered a few dishes , it's still really good just like it's always been there was a few minor changes to each dish. The server was the only downfall to my experience here. Overall still taste and has the vibe of firefly.

hhuU4RumE_xsqADj353pKQ.text: Wow! We were there last night and the food, service and ambience was fabulous! Only here for a week and I hope to hit Firefly again

IUqtwf3h-82qGf1sDx3TPw.text: Get here, any way possible. Worth the walk if you have to! Delicious food, attentive staff, great ambiance. Potions were big, much more than we were expecting with tapas. Best food and lower prices. Will come back every time I'm in Vegas!

TFhUFqTbbBRH43Ki165kNA.text: Seriously good. The way to eat. Try a few small plates and all will be good. Bacon wrapped dates, Tuna tartare were awesome, one more, what shall it be?  The Sangria is the bomb.

iyKyT3J2TmHd2lrNFgcf-A.text: Perfect place to get a good meal and get away from the casinos.  Good fast service, lots of great appetizers.  Ceviche, skewers, spicy salad and patatas bravas were plenty for two people

tSCvcD6bWnjq2HHuMpd9TQ.text: This is seriously the BEST TAPAS EVER!!! Definite must! Everything they brought out was better than the last. The fries, tomato basil soup with grilled Brie cheese sandwich, the Mac and cheese, the scallops, the ribs. AMAZING!!!

daBV_rn_x_feMC-MArZmLQ.text: Writing this review while still in Firefly. Yes, the tapas ARE that good! It is only matched by the impeccable service we got from Pepe and crew. Great food, good fiun, overall awesome experience! Nuff said...

T4WY0PSi5uTgIRjQ_CucIw.text: I love this place, every time I come to Vegas this is a must locals joint to visit. It's tapas style food, and almost everything on the menu is excellent. The sangria here is also excellent and a must-have.

O8TxXmyRwIIFLiReDyuJXA.text: Food is awesome...and the Sangria is the best I've had in a long time. This is a total hidden gem being a couple of blocks off the strip. Payless, get better food and drinks!

eCKjWYjJ2qzS2rECWuVYng.text: My favorite place off the strip. I had the red sangria, bacon wrapped dates, mac n cheese, lamp chops, and empanadas. ALL were very good.

7UQdk4ton1WgSY1JAcjaRQ.text: Yummy food and variety! Caters to both vegetarians and nonvegetarians. For nonveggies, I recommend the grilled scallops, bacon wrapped dates, chicken empanadas and the chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms. For veggies, the patatas bravas, mac n cheese, and the parmesan fries were my favorite. Those fries were just amazing - very well seasoned! And the red sangria was better than the white but definitely not the best I've had. The ambience was great - djm with red and black decor, which matched perfectly with our bachelorette party attire theme of red and black :) only downside was that it's off the strip and it was a pain getting a taxi from there. May want to get a taxi number and call them in advance.

tTsUB36DnNnqy9GKFdPFwQ.text: Love this place when coming to Vegas. Great food, prices and atmosphere. Know they recently had some issues and closed a location but I'm sure they're even better now.

DeB7TNxh27TSsJDxNZ_TAw.text: Being a big eater, I thought a tapas restaurant would not be for me.  This worked got me I was way stuffed.

ULWA1JTrK1x5hsX9gCh8UA.text: Firefly never disappoints, obsessed with the firefly fries and their chicken salad is one of the best. Nahum was our server he was very kind and attentive.

W5FLFGg9v69kA7sVtubSUA.text: Tapas but really better than I ever had in Spain. We were a group of four and each dish was the perfect size to split between us for individual portion tasters. We ordered two dishes each. We were all starving when we came in and left with full stomaches. This is my second time being here and it's been excellent both times. Get off the strip and come here. Totally worth it!!!

v-WouWSZtmvpQ1sZ0W6buA.text: love this place. ate there 4 times on recent trip to Vegas. the tuna tartare with the sesame topping is my favorite  but all the food is good and a good value. went to jaleo as well on the trip which is also tapas at the cosmo and spent 4 times as much and thought the food at firefly was better.   my wife really liked the tomato soup and grilled cheese with bruyere cheese the free bread is amazing with the almond butter.   criticisms:  some days the tuna was fresher then others and some days it was cut a little sloppily. ask people if they want more chips to start because its never enough.  the stuffed mushroom didnt seem to have alot of flavor for having chorizo in it. needed more salt both times imo.   the stuffed almond dates which have always been one of my favorites seemed greasier then past years when ive come  all the meats and kabobs were awesome. cooked well. good portions. staff was friendly

ENyZIJGQ7iiarCtscW854A.text: three words...absolutely freak'n awesome! The bacon wrapped dates are fantastic, and the red sangria was fabulous! Great place.

aaqd5lisr-60R3U2J_0RtQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants here in Vegas!! I always bring my guests here for their sangria and yummy tapas.

Qcixp4jxDS_FI4uYGEqMsA.text: Ten years ago, I lived in Madrid for a year or so. I got real used to the tapas bars in the city. Though it isn't authentic, it is Delicious! I tried the pulpo, bravas, tortilla espanola and paella. All if it was perfectly seasoned and we'll presented. A must for every las vegas excursion.

7hxJlJhRmRpEFkOTGXqQOQ.text: great and more spacious new location on Paradise just feet from the old one.  Great tapas style dining.  Every one of some 10 dishes we tried was very flavorful and well done.  Just order a few at a time so you dont go overboard.  Outdoor area available.  Friendly hostess, waiter and staff.  Will go back.

Zk8vHmcDlg2bO7H6A7VilQ.text: The food is amazing! Best tapa definitely the camerones de la diabla (name may not be correct)! The service is awesome. Great experience overall!

j9D3aRrBrqF2MnCZcC66rA.text: Nice atmosphere, nicely decorated, good music but a bit loud, wish they stuck more with the Latin music, it was only about half the tracks, otherwise the songs were a bit random, nothing bad though.  For a drink I tried the cherry mule, as I suspected it was pretty sweet but good flavor, would have preferred a little more ginger beer. For food we tried the baked cod which was fsntastically amazing. Albondigas (meatballs) were also pretty tasty. Chicago beef bocadillos, something went horribly wrong with this, one slice of meat was downright terrible, tasted really old with a bad texture, not good at all. Petite filet was pretty good but I've had much better, was good flavor but not super tender. Not sure the mushrooms and cream cheese paired all that well either but it was good overall. Chicken skewers were good but underwhelming, not what I was craving.  Service was excellent, didn't feel like bringing up the bad price of meat but I'm sure if I did they would've handled it.

zfKYfWI6QIAE9fuifxqhzA.text: This was a wonderful Tapas restaurant not far from the strip.  The food was fantastic and the service was great as well.  The stuffed dates were to die for!  The sliders were probably our least favorite of everything we ordered (and we ordered a lot :) ).  Can't wait to go back on our next trip!

WqAwrdCOFvVZ-tMXvwDi7w.text: i liked the new location.  sangria was excellent as usual.  we had an assortment of tapas, too many to recount.  the food was excellent as usual.  we sat outside on the patio which is bigger than the old location.  i enjoyed it.

eARtt-JH_OuemP6iKcvUAg.text: I had a great experience here. I came here around 1230 on a Saturday, and it was not busy at all. My waitress, Irina, was superb. She was very friendly and attentive so excellent service there. We had about seven different tapas, including the chocolate/cherry bread pudding (delicious), bacon dates, mushroom pastry, ceviche, beef salad, and sangria (red and sparkling). I've had better tapas before, but overall tasty dishes and great service.

AVF0iOxM2u5tRYwExKPTCA.text: Good food, nice staff, allergy friendly and a cool decor. I really enjoyed the octopus and the ceviche, really good portions for being tapas.

kjsH6vDlbVj4cCu5z3c1bA.text: This is a mixed review, the food was great, I ordered the mushroom tart and the chorizo clams. Both were great, especially the clams which were full of flavor. But the service was bad, they mess upmost of the other orders, and we're slow and inattentive. The water tasted off, as most likely they used the pitcher for something else, and did not wash it.

8wuKJ4sIVwfD3Q7fTZ1IWQ.text: I have been to many restaurant in Las Vegas, but Firefly I would have to say is one of the few that has made me feel as comfortable and extremely happy with the service. Not only did I love the food, it is the perfect place to come and hang out, relax and be with friends and family at any time. Extremely great service, great food and the prices are not expensive at all. I love this place and will definitely be coming back very soon. Highly recommend it, not only is the food good they also have great drinks and the happy hour is the best!!! You can tell management work hard and love their work place.

oI6K2pdwnJL5T6f0EG-nSw.text: Wow!  How have I not heard of this place before.  I the bacon wrapped dates, among other things.  It was amazing.  The staff is really friendly and attentive too.  I'll be back!

FFRPQo0yChL83WEJ_HIaUQ.text: Super great food, and service. Free bachelorette shots! Sangria was amazing. Authentic espresso. You can't go wrong!

WdP5DN3u89gG30TochvR6A.text: If your in need of lunch and your at the convention center and you can't  eat convention food. Walk here, takes 15 minutes as a casual walk. Small plate tapas menu. Sangria is served. Same side of the street as the convention show

8OdvST_lUMDDadECcOQ_Hg.text: One of the most lively and exciting restaurants in Las Vegas..the food is wonderful...the service is excellent...the atmosphere and ambiance is beyond compare...love the place

MKw68J8jquXnfV3IZp9yag.text: Very tasty food and excellent people management! We had a booking for 20 people, and as soon as the staff noticed it was a wedding party tequila shots were suggested :) The waitstaff were very patient when dealing with a large number of people and their separate orders for food and drinks. The food itself was delicious and very reasonably priced.

NaX02iHWPpb4rkvXuyCWFw.text: Great place to have tapas food just great I love there bacon dates and sangria  and calamari and like there new location.

IcZMuZu6nDyW36bR-AGH0A.text: Yes, this place has had its health issues (or rather one giant Godzilla-sized ISSUE). You are either going to get over that, or not. Having worked in the industry, I can confidently say that a place that has undergone such public humiliation is not going to drop the ball again. I am sure this place is now cleaner than one of those crazy decontamination suits in Outbreak. But, unlike that movie, Firefly does not suck. This place is the bee's knees. Try getting quality tapas at such a very reasonable price elsewhere - I dares ya! This new location (about time!) is much larger and nicer than the last joint. The once overly packed patio area is now open and spacious, and the same goes for the interior. The cramped bar has been traded for a full encompassing rectangle of drinking goodness. And the food lived up to the atmosphere. The bacon wrapped dates are a stalwart, and not to be missed. My only knock is the bread. I have never cared for it - hard and flavorless (closer to a cracker than bread). Although, it could be a blessing in disguise, as skipping he bread leaves plenty of room for countless small plates. Hopefully people start coming back and filling up the patio again, as it would be tragic for Vegas to lose this local dining icon.

8v2oM1BI-LDjRhJz5--vWw.text: Nice restaurant with good food. I love the grilled oysters and the garden-variety salad. Next time I'll use a Groupon.

EQb0AvtbxONzSPagk1fLIw.text: Only for adventurous eaters. Don't go if you don't want to try something new. I'm tempted to take away a star for the crowds and the noise, but I don't want to hate on them for being too popular. Five stars. Great prices for what you get.

9_Nq1YjA87JBGqLBHu3tuQ.text: My husband and I were in Vegas in October and couldn't wait to go back to  Firefly! When we heard they shut down we were so bummed. I just loved the atmosphere at the old location. We always take our friends  whenever were in town. I dream about the pardon peppers and bacon wrapped dates. We had no problem getting a table around 8:30 or so on a Monday night. The new place seemed almost bare it's so much bigger. We sat across from the kitchen next to each other looking into the kitchen thru the swinging door. Not what  we had in mind . I hate being to close to the kitchen traffic. We decided to move to the bar. It's a really nice addition. We were the only ones at the bar when we sat down. By the time we left it was 3/4 full. Restaurant appreciation night I believe. We always order red sangria but heard the white was really good. Our bartender offered to let us sample it . We still went with red. 2 of us will down a pitcher!  We are in Vegas you know! We were brought some yummy bread and omg! That butter is the best stuff ever! I forgot about the butter!  We ordered our usual , 1 order of bacon wrapped dates, then pardon peppers, such wonderful chile flavor not spicy a little salty, I believe they are flash fried, but I think the order was a little smaller than it use to be. They are so addictive. I found 1 place in Denver to get them but not the same  restaurant vibe. We decide we need more dates and then the cream cheese stuffed peppers. The sauce and cheese and peppers! Yum! Our bartender told us about the garbanzo beans. We had never had them roasted in the shell before. We liked them.  And then more stuffed peppers! That was our fav. Dinner in Vegas as always. Just sit and graze. Every bite was a party in my mouth! The bartenders were on top of the water and plates and very friendly. The manager stopped to see how everything was and we chatted for quite a while.  He was eager to hear our comments. When he found out we were in the bar biz in Denver he even gave us the locals discount! That was a really nice thing for him to do. I can't remember names as it's been too long. I should have written this sooner.  But life happens.  The food is as good as ever at the new location.  The atmosphere in the dining room I'm not sure I'm sold on. Something's missing. The kitchen really stands out too much. It's just really open for everyone to see. I missed the intimacy of the old place. Will we be back? Absolutely! If it's warmer I'm looking foreword to sitting on the patio! You guys do a great job!

NwBDMV21BVcn0mY1qzZtxA.text: GREAT SERVICE! GREAT FOOD! The manager Eduardo went above and beyond out of his way to make sure we had a memorable dining experience. He felt a little bad bc there was confusion when we got sat and it took a little bit too long for our server to get to us. Thank you Eduardo for everything I have a new found love for this place.

VobmtZKi8Kg3M9JGvvq7Og.text: I was disappointed by this restaurant -- it did not live up to the reviews.  It is True that this is an affordable tapas restaurant, but the food was just ok.  It wasn't horrible.  But nothing was really a wow.

xJFbw7MhpWV7Ci-L5U0rlw.text: Came here early on a Sat night before a show at Brooklyn Bowl. Arrived around 6pm and although the large dining room looked like it had space, we opted for bar seating and found seats immediately.  The tapas here are at least twice the size of a normal order and easy to share. We enjoyed a bottle of wine, the bacon wrapped dates, pork empanada, clams and chorizo, the octopus, and the lamb chops. Every option was cooked to perfection and delicious! We made the mistake of ordering a little too much just because of the portion size being larger than anticipated. It provided the substance we needed before a night of drinking at a concert. The icing on the cake.. our wine and feast were all for under $100!  I think I just broke $100 with a $20 tip. We will definitely be back because the service at the bar was fantastic, the food was on point, and because there is so much more that we would love to taste from this menu.  Off the beaten path.. and well worth it!!

qTxXAypgggO6LkgQe7CKYQ.text: Full flavor tapas off the Strip so it's about 50% less cost than a casino restaurant. Service has always been attentive and prompt. Really enjoy this gem. Portions are very fulfilling and artistic. Highly recommend.

PJDWaZqt6j4VJ1pDUCWmkA.text: great eats. such a great afternoon of food with friends. service was great. super fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7nT0PXiSoKu_0MmkXld7MA.text: The food and service is amazing!  Great ambiance too.  I highly recommend this place!

A3N7WimMKASqzuQzXW58sg.text: Food was amazing and the music was great. I would recommend this place to who ever loves a friendly and happy atmosphere.

2_xL9R99eBIGKc_MO20p7Q.text: Wow it was none of the best meals ever. By far the best was the ceviche, Diablo shrimp and the mango ribs outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche

XHLSunjkj9rsDgKFkg9OFQ.text: Enjoyed this place!  Group of 10 people had wonderful time.  Varieties of tapas dishes and drinks were excellent.  Must try the bacon wrap dates!!

BGiTb6wb1ZWm9IuKPZmzNQ.text: I dare you to name something that IS NOT good here!!! Ok, maybe the paella isn't in par with Miami, but still darned good!!

IVdbL2ANn9lcfVasXAHO6g.text: Awesome girls night out or celebratory dinner spot! Food was AMAZING. Very small tapas portions.. I could've eaten 5 by myself easily lol. I'll definitely be back!

SUX24qbDzz65xToRCRUsAg.text: Nice atmosphere not far from Stratosphere hotel. Quintessential tapas menu with thoughtful dishes and nice flavors. Fair prices and good service. Still doesnt top my favorite tapas place in Massachussetts but still a nice experience.

0vseruffJfBQqYirA5E80Q.text: Oh man....this place is delicious. We visited as part of a package deal, and had VIP seating with all you can eat and drink. We were able to try a lot of their different dishes. EVERYTHING, was amazing. Our waiter was so nice and on top of things. Loved the food and the overall experience was one of my favorite parts of our trip to Vegas.

ZpuCBLnl0ayNJoXNP-vMaQ.text: My review would have been a 5 star rating, but their night time salsa dancers pissed me off & ruined my good time.  First, let me say that the red sangria is the best I've ever had!!  Truly amazing!  Our party of 3 finished two pitchers (it would have been more had we not been "forced" out).  It was SO noisy inside with little acoustic material to absorb sound so we asked to sit on the patio. It was a beautiful fall night!  We had the dates, shrimp ceviche, tuna tartare, baby back ribs, skewered meats, and caramel flan.  All the food had a rich flavor, and everything tasted very fresh. The sauce on the ribs was sweet yet savory.  Everything was perfect until the salsa band showed up. Girl #1 started moving tables to make room for dancing by dragging the metal tables across the floor. It was so loud & the pitch was so high that it hurt my ears....like nails on a chalkboard!  Seriously?!?!  There were still 3 tables enjoying their meal!!  Then girl #2 approached each table & basically told us to leave because they were going to play music & dance. WTF?!?!  After telling the server that I was upset, we paid our check.  When we arose from the table, these people had all their band stuff around our table & we couldn't even exit the area!!  SO RUDE!!!!  Had the manager approached us earlier to let us know what was going on, we would have taken our group inside to drink more sangria. But instead the server kept apologizing.  So we just left.   If I do return to this restaurant, it will be for the food & I will NOT get in the way of the rude conceited self-absorbed salsa people. Just plain ridiculous.

oehMC4IUigJPQn1fxBKyYQ.text: Had family in town and was looking for somewhere that would really hit the spot for everyone. I  am so glad to have found another location for this restaurant as the location nearer my house was closed. Firefly has always lived up to my expectations at their now closed Summerlin location, I was extremely pleased to see it carried on in their Paradise location. :) The service is attentive without being overbearing, the food delicious! We left full and happy! Please open in Summerlin again soon.

kK9anPaQxWlkQ70u0K4APA.text: Probably the best place to eat not on the Strip and the best tapas my family and I have ever had.   Ambience: (4/5)* My family and I came in at an awkward time (around 3:30PM) so the place was practically empty and I can't say how it gets later in the evening. The lighting is also very dark and it was hard to read the menu.   Service: (5/5) Our waitress/hostess was super nice and very helpful in offering recommendations since the menu was so huge and there was so much to choose from. In addition, they brought out the food in just the right intervals so just as you finished a plate another one would come out.   Food: (5/5) Try as much as you can because we ordered around $200 of food and everything was delicious.

z_MB8v_m_6wlt7fu8Gki9A.text: Always outstanding. They can get busy at times, but worth it. Grab some Sangria and relax.

YmADw2N13zmgzxZlBpcwSw.text: Eh.   I used to adore this place. If I was able to Yelp Firefly years ago, I would've given it four stars.   I've been eating at Firefly for over ten years. I brought my boyfriend there last night because I used to love the cozy, intimate atmosphere and great food, and I wanted us to have a cute date night before he flew back East.   It turns out the restaurant moved (to the old Z Tejas Grill building down the street?), which is a much bigger space. The atmosphere is gone. It's now a busy, loud restaurant like any other place in Las Vegas. I realize that the old Firefly was popular and always packed, so I see the need to expand. They just lost the charm in the process.   I suggested we order the Serrano sliders, mushroom tart, and Manchego mac and cheese, because I've had them before and they were always great choices on the menu.  I felt like even the quality of food has changed, because I wasn't really impressed by any of the dishes.    I gave Firefly two stars due to the fact that they changed so drastically, and not in a good way.  The food was not terrible, but it wasn't as flavorful and visually appealing as it was in the past. The mac and cheese was excellent, but the sliders and mushroom tarts were bland.  The chicken empanadas were boring and the lemon tart dessert tasted like mass produced tarts defrosted and topped with a few berries and whipped cream.   I doubt I'll ever come back here and that makes me sad.

A0sTcsOhos4pvQLao4ewvw.text: The food is simply great. Every time we go to Vegas, we make a point of visiting this great restaurant. I can say I had tried almost all the items on their menu and there was not one item that I didn't like.  Go for the tapas plates and remember that sharing is caring !

PBQyb7Wo7EJMR9Rj97_EcQ.text: Amazing ... A culinary orgy for the palette ... The tag team style service keeps the food coming including killer Garlic bread almond butter and homemade green olives ... We ordered bacon wrapped dates with an almond inside (awesome), fish sticks (mediocre) ... The mushroom tort, stuffed peppers, chicken and pork empanadas were epic ... I LOVE this place ... A must return for me ...

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

El-BsVuzUYhBXHKmg8i99Q.text: Located just South of the Strip, Firefly on Paradise has become an essential stop that brightens the already ecstatic Vegas experience usually felt by yours truly.  This place oozes Vegas in all senses. From the dim lights above, to the bright lights around the bar and along the walkways, the banter, laughter, cheers, showoffs, care-nots, great service and what matters the most, GREAT food.    The wait was (and usually is) relatively long as we entered the packed house. It was just my sister and I.. that being the case, we noticed a couple available stools bar-top and nabbed them on the (fire)fly. It's not necessarily the case in ALL restaurants with a bar, but I noticed that because there's more action here, you'll probably get an attentive bartender, prompt service and  a quicker food turn around time.   Spanish tapas / small plate style.. Ladies and gentlemen, this means you'll be eating more than one dish tonight!    First dish that was placed before us was the chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms.. though quite small in size, they definitely pack a punch when it comes to flavor.. probably because of the chorizo.  Second, Serrano Sliders.. mini burgers with Serrano ham, bleu cheese & crispy onions, cooked Medium rare; Not sure why we ordered mini-burgers.. they played the 'void' filler until our next dish arrived. I enjoyed the bleu cheese, but asked for medium rare and they came back to us a little too well done.. dry & crunchy. They happily replaced them and got us a new order within minutes. Very nice service.  Third, Steamed Mussles.. steamed in white wine with an heirloom tomato, garlic, herb butter with parmesan crustini. I'm not even a fan of the things, but the Mussels were the best tasting seafood item that I've had in a quick minute. It's really the sauce that made it.. the best way I can describe it would be the equivalent to a creamy Alfredo, minus the pasta. It masked that 'fresh out of the water' taste, which I don't mind.  And Fourth, the item that stole my heart.. the baby back ribs covered with an out of this world BBQ mango sauce. Fall off the bone tenderness covered with a sweet finger lickin' sauce that'll have your tongue and lips slurpin' and smackin' through every bite. I'd get a full rack of these alone. Straight up, yo.   Our bartender was on point; we were continuously checked on, had our waters refilled, if my beer was low another was offered (this is how you keep me here) and aside from the slider mishap.. everything here was tasty and the atmosphere sparked the perfect start for our night. We'll be back to explore the rest of that menu!

_yj4dXsOuiFfS57ZLuZEeQ.text: This place was delicious! Our waiter was sloooowwww but the food was so amazing we didn't care too much.  Our favorite was the steak and mushroom skewers. So incredibly tender and the sauce was divine!  YUM!

lDFI3ylKUD9oI_VQ2KoeTg.text: We have eaten here a couple times and have thoroughly enjoyed it. This time seemed a little lackluster. Service was quite slow this time. Didn't seem like the quality was quite the same.

CEx-3gdjXNCQaLnePhqpqw.text: So I love Tapas.  I have had them all over Spain and South America and I have become pretty picky.  Sometimes my wife and I, and sometimes friends, really want to go out but we don't want a full dinner.  That has been hard in Las Vegas because we haven't found a Tapas Bar we like here.    I am happy to say we finally found one we liked.  My wife and I really enjoyed Firefly.  Great selection, great service and atmosphere.  We will definitely be back.

zAnQFTAyJy2QBpwCYv9_nw.text: Solid food all around! Ordered 7 dishes for two people which included two that were deemed 'smaller' plates.  It was still a lot of good and could have definitely gone one or two dishes less but overall solid.

UHpJuQI5FIFnM-2dKMJAlA.text: When I first came in the hostess had a bad attitude, sat in the bar area and waited almost 25 minutes until I finally called the manager over to the table so I could get a menu and a drink. I normally love coming to firefly but today wasn't one of their better days hopefully they will get it together in the near future

i3sjKXCYwyXupfDus48-fg.text: The tapas are the perfect size. And the variety of options is excellent. We ordered the garden salad, lamb chops, and stuffed dates. Even the kids liked the food (no burgers were ordered!).

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ETMaHpL3AKPOrLfhhJCtjg.text: I haven't been to this restaurant in years so this time I went to a wedding reception. The new building is nice as well. The reception was set up outside on the patio area and was well decorated. The staff were nice and even though I'm not big on tapas food it was served as different samples and some things were very tasty. I was pleasantly surprised this time around.   The one thing that stood out is the parking is in the back of the building and there are signs to lock your cars and hide belongings. Maybe there have been car break ins??? Not sure but it was a concern for me.

3Ep2923UzVYHzK_O3A0wCQ.text: This is one of few Yelp reviews I have ever done... FIREFLY IS AMAZING! We were seated outside and our server Alejandro was fantastic. He provided great recommendations and was very attentive.  We were there for an early happy hour dinner on a Friday night. We had Mojitos, Red Sangria, Fire*Fries, Stuffed Dates, Albondigas, Veggie Empanada, Serrano Ham Sliders, and Stuffed Peppers. I can't stop telling people about the great food. Every bite was better than the last.  Highly recommended for a great meal and great service  at an affordable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CPhkH3wbEDX8oETJTm-NdQ.text: Central location, great vibe, large patio and vast menu, this place does have something for everyone - however, you have to know to ask when it comes to special diets.  Only after we ordered their Firefly fries with cheese on the side and my friend stated that I was vegan was I offered the vegan menu..and our server was vegan. How did she not think to offer it from the start? Yes, there is a menu that features vegetarian, vegan and GF options. I've suggested they offer it to guests when giving the standard menu. Hope they run with that.  Think they'd have a lot more people talking about their attention to dietary preferences.  So from my humble vegan opinion you should have the artichoke crab cakes and heirloom carrots and go from there if you are still hungry. Both are amazing and my non-vegan friend even agreed.   From my humble beer lover opinion they have a nice selection of drafts and of course their sangria is kinda famous in this town.

UmstOBDr4VFPXEjJ6sEE1g.text: The food and drinks were fabulous!  Background music was loud, wouldn't recommend for a first date. Or maybe...

tzOssO00sqFSND_53KWWZA.text: My first time ever dinning at a tapas restaurant was 2012 here at FireFly, and now we're back in 2018 to enjoy another world- class meal on a small plate. By far one of the best places in all of Vegas. My favorite item on the menu is their bacon wrapped dates. The sweet and savory sauce, coupled with a sweet crunch is a dish that tantalize every taste bud in your mouth and send your body through an endorphin overload. Prices are great and the atmosphere is great for dates. Must visit location everytime you cone to Vegas.

9wDZtk9S9McEjt9diG2d3A.text: Celebrated a co worker's birthday dinner here. Spanish tapas that was a fun way to try the large menu selection. Overall, great service that accommodated large party (13+) and the food came fast and furious. Fan favorites were paella, tuna tartare, bacon wrapped dates, and many more!

BLPlbufUSV0FTk7xu5uTHA.text: Firefly is a great spot to go to with friends and family. I've been here numerous times, old and new spots. The new renovation is great and spacious with a private room, great for big dinners.   I've tried numerous items on the menu from Apple and Manchego Salad, Garden Variety Salad, Ceviche of Shrimp, Tuna Tartare, Stuffed Dates, Tomato-Basil Soup, Veggie Empanadas, Firefly Fries, Ahi Tuna & Chicken Skewers, Banana Nutella Sandwiches, & Chocolate Tres Leches.   Most of them were 10/10, besides the Veggie Empanadas. The cheese sauce drizzle didn't do it for it. I rather of had it dry.   Firefly knows how to take care of their customers. They even set up a long table for a big party of 20 for us even though we were seated in the back corner separated. Special treatment to make their customers happy equals 5 stars in my book!

5aT7QuYThAV1IK_hJJqnKw.text: Went here not too long ago. We were celebrating my graduation & my friend's birthday. We ordered the pasta, chicken skewers, empanadas, sangria, chicken with fries, & flan for the birthday girl. The sangria was strong enough for my liking. We ordered a pitcher. This might just be the best food I ate while in Vegas.

1Q7MlaxFoNAljZmyMr1t6A.text: I love firefly and it's a great place for girls night or a lively happy hour joint.   We called to make reservations and we were seated within 2 mins of arriving. The ambience is calm (unless you come on Latin Night) with dark lighting giving it a nice intimate feeling.   We ordered several different items but like everyone else, the all time favorite is the bacon wrap dates. If I could choose one tapas to have for the rest of my life, it would be these, but I would probably become overweight extremely fast!   It's a great restaurant considering majority of the items are small allowing you to try more food items at once. They also have larger entrees which are just as good.   The only downside to this place is parking. Parking is so limited it forces you to valet and sometimes valet is full! Please note a few years ago they were shut down due to health concerns, but I have yet to experience that. Fingers crossed that I never do!!!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6EtWnpf6GJuCDMOV47iO6w.text: Finally tried this spot after hearing good things from several people. Started at the bar while we waited for a table as they didn't take any same day reservations. We had just enough time to finish our drinks before our table was ready.   There are so many options on the menu I suggest you start slow and order a few dishes at a time. The stuffed dates, and the Tierra y mar skewers were my favorites of the night! And the sangria pitchers are a must for the table...sooooo good!   The waitstaff was super friendly as different people came around dropping off and clearing plates throughout the night. One thing to note is that the food comes out in whatever order it's ready in. One dish we ordered the first time around was the last to come to the table and we almost thought they were going to forget it! But it was worth the wait.   I'd definitely go back to try a few more things we didn't have room for and for that sangria!

e9jsDX2koctMsgUis44O0Q.text: Very nice place, great food! But the one if the hostesses was really rude, she has straight hair. On 1/19 she was wearing the shoulder cut out dress. I hope she fixes her attitude. Overall had a good time.

R36mj1zBRdoES0z0MydUAA.text: Never before have I had such an enjoyable experience and stimulation of all five senses! The food was amazing, from Tapas to after-dinner coffee & desserts... every piece of me was happy! I highly recommend this restaurant! The wait staff was super attentive and attractive, while the restaurant itself was full, clean and fully festive! Dinner is meant to be experienced like this... visit Firefly Las Vegas TONIGHT!

DPDieOXWnz19iGR_Q02fhg.text: Fresh tasty food and they deliver with grub hub. The ceviche shrimp is tasty and so is the empanadas.

OyL_dtAs9QcrA8Jq6zOVAQ.text: The food is TO DIE FOR!!  Our busser was amazing. Honestly he paid more attention to us than out server. I wish I could of just tipped him. Besides that my visit was good.

6SKZd4pNnETnCDT5zV8elA.text: What a great little (big actually) tapas place just off the strip.  They have a wide selection of sharing plates and a large drink selection.  Although the place was busy, it is a large open venue, that is good for large groups.  The prices are very reasonable and very close to the strip.

-CBgkMsSM9ms3WiP-s37lg.text: We really enjoyed eating here. We were a group of 7 for a bachelorette party and they did a phenomenal job of keeping our table well stocked with food and alcohol. It seems like they were well equipped to deal with a large group and keep everyone happy. There is something for everyone (including people with allergies and vegetarians).

mtTPZeOp0bHWRIw-5VljGA.text: All the positive...  Unless you're in Espana, great tapas are hard to come by--BUT not at Firefly!   This is a go-to spot in Las Vegas, especially since it is located a little away from the chaotic strip (and there is parking). I visited Firefly both times I was in Vegas since my cousin who is a local introduced it to me. My go-to's are the tuna tartare w/ taro chips, bacon wrapped dates, and ham and cheese croquetas. The gelato was nothing great but I would recommend the flourless chocolate cake for dessert! The portions are small and don't leave you feeling gross after eating--which you don't want to feel like when you're in Vegas heat and going to be walking around all day/night. You just get a good taste of everything.   Not so positive but still ok...  The chicken-skewers here are nothing spectacular, and my friend ordered the sliders which I thought were average--but I'm not a sliders fan to begin with. I'm not a fan of the sangria here but it's also partially because I've been making my own sangria. It seems like the fruit hasn't been properly soaked in liquor, more wine needs to be added, and they could def use more variety of fruit besides apples/oranges (cheapest fruit you can find -_-).    Overall, I'm such a fan of the tapas I listed that I would come back anyways esp for a midday lunch or light dinner. Cheers!

iMddJEfGTndlmxIZKIstAw.text: Beautiful restaurant and attentive staff. But watch out, this is a hot spot! You'll have to wait for a table. Don't worry, it's worth it!

93zE1Lic2oCb3aqu5c7scw.text: Everything we had was amazing. The table ooh'd and aww'd with every bite. The bread and spread alone are wicked good. I can just eat that alone and be happy. Seriously. Any way, what did we order?  1. 2 pitchers of Sangria (one white, one red) Both tasted good! Comes with infused apple pieces.  2. Bacon wrapped dates. These are off the charts! Crispy and extreme flavor! 3. Manchego Macaroni and Cheese; the best cheese to use in this dish - so decadent! 4. Tuna Tartare  with Taro Chips; this is really good and refreshing. Tasty! 5. Steak and Mushroom skewers. I wish I knew what kind of sauce they use for this cause it's fabulous!  6. Ham and Cheese Croquetas - manchego cheese again! Yum! Some thought it was a bit salty; but I love salt! LOL. 7. Baked Cheese; whoa! Didn't think I'd like it, but I loved it! 8. Firefly fries; great combo with the Sangria; carbo load while drinking! Plus their fried to perfection and has a great seasoning! 9. Paella! Whoa! We got the seafood one and it was a great ending to the rest of our tapas! It was able to give a sampling to 7 people and everyone loved it!  You can't go wrong with anything you order here. Everything tastes so good. I have brought friends and family alike here, and it is ALWAYS a winner and becomes a favorite to all! Go now!

heIZDFTxZqTQJ-jn9XCMwg.text: We held a 40 person rehearsal dinner for our son's wedding recently.  The food was excellent, the service was beyond expectation and the atmosphere was conducive for a relaxing good time.  Somewhat nervously, we made the arrangements over the phone sight-unseen with Regina & Fernanda and nothing was less than promised.  Regina was onsite throughout the event and was very hands-on to ensure that all went smoothly.  The Firefly Tapas Kitchen is highly recommended.

KsqOoOBtL3qKuj5oD9pGKw.text: A few friends had recommended Firefly to me so thought I'd give it a shot. Soooo glad I did! The service was amazing... Joaquin was our bartender and server. He was so knowledge and provided us great service and great drinks! The food was very good as well. We had a few appetizers and the paella.. Everything was on point! I would definitely come back!

GFr0uAXXIcFTIiOoNCz06g.text: When friends visit from out of town and we are looking to bring them off the strip for something a little different we often find ourselves headed to Firefly. There is something here for people of nearly all tastes and as others have mentioned all of the Paella variations are excellent. The tapas are small and relatively inexpensive allowing even a smaller group to sample an impressive variety of dishes. Definitely worth a try.

fMRudb1wl85dDLnweyP-XQ.text: Went here for a bachelorette dinner and was not disappointed. All the food was delicious, drinks were good. Sangria was a bit sweet for my taste but we had a complimentary pineapple shot at the end that was delicious. I will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas

YqqmjQZclF0PpwDyRneUgg.text: I am so glad I found this place on yelp. Stopped here for dinner before heading back to Orange County, and the place blew our mind. Went with a group of 5 people and we ordered a bunch of tapas to share family style. Everything we ordered was on point delicious. What makes this place even more amazing is the service they have. The entire Staff is so happy to serve. They greet you with a smile, they serve your food with a smile...everyone here is so happy. Definitely will be stopping by every time we're in Vegas. We had the fried calamari, Mac and cheese, tuna tartare, firefly fries, Tierra y mar skewers, mushroom tart, muscles, and beet salad. Along with the free bread they serve with almond butter. Awesome! Best place we ate at during our Vegas trip. Love love love this place! Must try!

VthaJiR-79BQ3-fqM9mYMw.text: I came here this past week with my coworkers while we were visiting for a trade show. I have several friends that live in Vegas and love this place. Also checked out the yelp reviews and saw the raving reviews. After 11 hours of walking and working, I was SO EXCITED to get my tapas and sangria on.   I WAS SO DISAPPOINTED. There were 4 of us and the waitress suggested we each order 2 dishes. 8 dishes came out and all 8 dishes were sub par. All the proteins we ordered were either over cooked or over salted. All the veggie dishes we ordered were uninspired or under seasoned.   The saving grace was the sangria. The red sangria here was amazing. You can definitely taste the fruit coming through the wine. so yummy! Maybe if I had a couple more glasses before the food came out I would've enjoyed the tapas more. The ambiance here is also really cool and casual.   I'd probably only come back here for drinks and bar food.

cvf_1wzyoadIk4InVX9k0g.text: Always have and always will come to this place.   Went to the old and still with the new. Tapas all around with yummy sangria. Doesn't take look to be seated but I do highly recommend reservations because it can get busy and expect to wait. If you didn't make reservations, don't worry, there is a bar where you can sit and enjoy a glass or two of beverages.   My hubby and I love coming here. This is our must go to every time, so highly recommend it.  I will be coming here in the next few months so I will try to take some photos before we devour it.

0Vh-6shBEFGDUPVnLj88_w.text: Always a delightful dining experience! Tasty food fantastic service. Our server was so on point he had the good decency to ask each of us if we had any food allergies before taking our orders which is very rare but welcome! Food was prompt but the fries were quite soggy (only negative) still a favorite.

-aV2-vuxXIJFycYD5RFexQ.text: Amazing food.. And when I say amazing.... I mean absolutely amazing! The service... Well that is just icing on the cake. Every time I come, we are treated with the most amazing service I have ever experienced. Every server is on top of their game as well as super personable, attentive and friendly. Today we had Samantha and like usual, we were not disappointed! She took care of us with a friendly smile and quick efficient service. We are always bringing our friends here, introducing the "amazingness" that  IS Firefly.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread with specialty butter
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates

tigA5_Vq7-iwpguBCv7CfQ.text: Beware!!!   Please note that this is -by far- the one & only one star review among the others (all of them are 5 stars & I don't like to make negative reviews. But this one, deserves it)  We found this place on Yelp and checked their menu. Then we walked there like half an hour. We found out that their actual prices are more than 30% higher! (Some are even more than 40%). We asked why & they blamed it on Yelp that they had no control over changing the prices on the system and offered 10% discount. We just left the place as we didn't like their approach to their customers. Then we found out that we were not the only ones who are misled.  There are lots of quality options in the area with great taste & worth the price.

rUHyXckiSylc61NZf5SyYw.text: Great food and service . Mario and Gerardo were incredible servers. Will be back again really soon Recommend highly

XfwN-XzM-ATpphuFZe0ydA.text: Dates wrapped with bacon. And lamb chops.   Heavenly and I would go there everyday if I could.   The bartender was super nice and polite.

Ss5XnPqbiiNK1-qLM_YXcg.text: It's the bomb and Alberto is the best! He is amazing! The food was great, clean restaurant and excellent service

lDDlNWcSxAWCqK0msTps5w.text: Firefly has always been a favorite of mine but we recently had our after wedding dinner there and it was incredible. Fernanda was the banquet contact and she made it so easy and was so flexible with our changes. Manuel and Omar took care of us once we arrived. My only criticism might be they did their jobs too well. The tapas came out very quick and everything tasted amazing! They were also great with the bar service. I couldn't have asked for a better place to host all of our family and friends.

Hr0dgiAY0lRhvAmMLT9nDQ.text: I really look forward to eating here whenever I'm in Vegas.  The flavors all complement each other so well in everything I've tried! The servings are definitely small but it won't break the bank to get a few options and enjoy what they do best... The food! Do yourself a favor a skip the buffet and give this place a try!

Ay_6IUcPmG7ijLnFcsohnQ.text: We needed a late night place to eat dinner after we saw Blue Man Group, and this place fit the bill, as they were open until 1am on a Sunday night. Fresh made tapas, and we ordered enough for the whole table of four. Our server was kind and attentive and plates were cleared quickly. The food was delicious, and we tried a large variety of dishes. Each dish was large enough for everyone at our table of four to get a portion. It makes me want to return for paella. The Red sangria was also delicious. Of note were the empanadas, Albondigas and shrimp diablo(?). Disappointing goat cheese dish. Lots of manchego (sheep cheese) dishes, including their take on a mac and cheese. If you like tapas, and even if you've never tried it, this is a good one to seek out.

LX3s5cSPqCB5fs3fI6fE1w.text: You must try this place!!  The sparkling sangria is you die for.   I couldn't stop drinking this.    The tapas; 1) artichoke toast  2) bacon wrapped dates. You have to try these.   3) tuna tartare melts in your mouth and the chips are so crispy.  4). Order the Paella it is worth the wait.    We had the mixed Paella.    This place is a must come and eat while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria.  A must!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sparking sangria.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare.   Delicious!!

SBqgpA4V19WQ6IE0AkQh-A.text: The menu is HUGGGEEE for tapas. Surprisingly 4 dishes was way more than enough for my friend and I. We came on a Thursday night and it was really busy as there were only two servers in the entire restaurant. As busy as it was, our server rang in our food rather quickly because our dishes came out right away!  We shared:  - Warm Spinach Salad - Pretty tasty dish! But we could've done without as we enjoyed the other dishes way more! - Ceviche - So fresh! Be sure to ask for extra chips, it's not enough! - Mac and Cheese - Pretty tasty but also pretty standard compared to most other restaurants.  - Babyback Ribs - The meat fell right off the bones and was so tasty with their mango bbq sauce.  I'd love to come back the next time I'm out in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and Cheese
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche

ygIg5NhFnv9hvVnegMzHuA.text: Wish I could give 6 stars!  This place was recommended by multiple people and with only 45 minutes notice got our group of 20 adults and kids seated after a basketball tournament!  Amazing!  They worked with us to create several smaller checks to make it easier to figure out our large groups bill and did a phenomenal job at getting us all our food and drinks.  Now for the food.  I have travelled extensively in Europe and this rivals some of the best Tapas I have ever had.  There is literally something for everyone including kids.  I had the figs, two different empanadas, the pulpo and spicy salad.  The figs and pulpo were unbelievable and the empanadas were cooked perfectly and just re right spices.  I sampled the chorizo stuffed mushrooms and shared the seafood paella and can say the only negative thin I can mention is the paella was slightly more salty than I prefer.    Overall, an epic meal that when combined with the service and laid back no rush atmosphere will be remembered for ever.

AcKxSzcNDCmRkP9D3l01pA.text: Well I love Firefly what can I say, food is delicious we had Camarones a la Diabla, the empanadas, croquettes, ham sliders and a Seafood paella plus wine and mojito and everything was only $73!!! The server was great, fast and courteous. The place was very busy and the music was on point. The only thing that needs work on is the Hostess service, very rude and uninviting specially the one with the very curly hair, like girl please you should work at the DMV!!! Well don't let that little detail discourage you, the food is amazing and the paella worth the 45 min wait!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood and chorizo paella! It worth the 45 min wait!!!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig empanada! Delicious

9qtOfMXdFw4KD92EFSMTgw.text: This place was extremely busy when we ate here. We had their signature homemade fruit infused vodka which was delicious. We ordered mushroom montadito, machego mac n cheese, baked cod, lamp chops and petite filet and tres leches for dessert. All the food with the exception of the mushroom dish was absolutely amazing! We loved the lamb it was cooked to perfection. The cod was a bit too garlicky but the desert was amazing, mac and cheese, and filet were very good!! Would return, even though service is a bit slow due to the busyness.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GJ3iOrqSccajvzzQOv7yoA.text: Very good food and drinks my favorite was the mojitos. They have a variety of flavors to choose from. The chicken skewers are amazing the flavor is just wonderful!! The only thing I did not like was the service was very slow and our sever would take forever to check on us I had to go to the bar to order my own drinks because the server wouldn't show up.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skewers, Apple manchego salad,

a-OAkrboWmVbAR0jOQOCzg.text: Fantastic place to eat in Vegas. Really 4.5 stars. Food was delicious and very reasonably priced which in Vegas to get those two together is great. Had several different appetizers and main dishes. Since my Spanish is no bueno will not even attempt to put down what we had but it was all very good. Nice flavors and everything was done to perfection. Will definitely go back maybe even this trip it was so good.

z787OFwfwwACjOIDMTVVkA.text: We went here with our two boys (13 & 10) who are great eaters on a Tuesday night. We had made a res. which was good because even though it is a big place , it was very busy .  Our waiter was nice and our food came quickly . We loved just about everything we ordered.  The octopus was particularly delicious, as was the mushroom toast, the artichoke toast and the stuffed dates.  Fun place with tasty food!

DR5tlEIkjyvASDGfS_dp6g.text: If you are ever looking for a late night light bite then I would recommend this restaurant. I usually sit at the bar for the late night happy hour. The bartenders are usually fast and attentive when there is a newcomer. Menu has lots of options so if you are overwhelmed, the servers are quite knowledgable and will lead you in the right direction.
