I totally recommend the avocado toast which is topped with heirloom tomatoes! Not heavy and just right.

vun5L6gW5g0-ZuplavZEAQ.text: Came here for a family style work dinner which can always be a risk. All of the food brought out was plentiful and delicious. We started with bread and butter for the table, but the butter was far from average. It was sweet and slightly spicy. We then moved on to a salad with hearts of palm, oranges and feta which was decent. They also brought out chicken breasts with interesting seasoning, but the real star of the show came later. We had a seafood paella which was incredible and contained plenty of fresh shrimp, mussels, clams and artichoke hearts. Lastly, we closed out with filet mignon medallions with blue cheese and crispy onions. Dessert was a chocolate cake version of a tres leches cake that tasted like German Chocolate cake. Very tasty, but i can't wait to come back and try more tapas!

EQplRzcb7QnYHTbZOE4SpQ.text: Very bad experience the food was not good. I had the stuff dates and it tasted like bbq sauce it was not what I had ordered before. I also ordered the tamarind margarita and it was so strong I could not drink it. When I told the server he still asked me if I wanted it to go. He never once offered a different drink or anything and he still charged me for the drink. This place is a joke I would not go back and it is very sad because I use to love going to eat here.   Update!!!! I went back a couple of weeks after my review and I must saw they went above and beyond what I expected. We tried the apple salad and it was amazing I must say the whole experience was great. I definitely recommend this place for a great date night like me and my boyfriend did. Thank you to the manager he was amazing he made sure everyone was having a good night!! I will definitely be back again!!

kH2Ljx1nYMUgllM5seZT5Q.text: First time visiting. It was very good, we tried several dishes. The dates with bacon and blue cheese are so good, but so are the filet mignon-shrimp-chorizo skewers. Our kids had the Macarroni and cheese and the ham and cheese croquetas.   Very different kind of food, but good!  The desert- lemon berry tarts were great!

OjtEUyOlbi01Twf1_OCJrw.text: This place was great! I have celiac disease (gluten allergy) and had an entire menu of dishes that could be made or were free of gluten. Service was incredible and prices are very reasonable. We thought we were going to pay al least $50 per person (we were a party of four), we were surprised when the bill came up to $117, we had food left over and we all got drinks.   I wasn't able to try to it but my friends said the butter that came with the bread was incredible. Also they had croquetas that because they are breaded I was not able to try it.  Notice the purple stick on all the meals says "allergy" is to show that someone on the table has an allergy and they prepare the food in a different part of the kitchen to prevent cross contamination.  I highly recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dates wrapped in bacon with blue cheese
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant stuffed with goat cheese

fjX8IAeKNp1qNRdsi5nM-w.text: I found my new favorite place in Vegas. I couldn't believe how impressed we were with the quality of food. From the Filet to the Scallops to the baked Cod. It was all delicious! I'll definitely be back. I wish we had one in Orange County.

JLj7NLCtRyf7Y429GoZdpw.text: Firefly is awesome! The varied selection of tapas is top-notch, as is the flavor of the many tapas my party and I tried. We ordered about half of the tapas on the menu and we found them all delicious. The sparkling sangria is delicious as well..strong yet fruit at the same time. The butter that accompanies the complimentary bread is, in all honesty, finger-lickin' good and I wish I had the recipe! Oh, and the desserts are just to die for! We ordered the dessert platter which included the caramel flan, chocolate tres leches cake, lemon-berry tarts, and passion fruit cheesecake. To say that these deserts were exquisite would be an understatement!   The service was great as well, zero complaints there! The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is that the atmosphere was not what one would think one when thinking of a Spanish tapas restaurant. We expected it to be more lively and vivacious but it was more quite and mellow than we had hoped. Still, I highly recommend Firefly!

Pq-nYK1lh9f-qvN6zNwx1g.text: Outstanding food and service!! It was really unexpected but I have to extend my thanks to Alejandro and his team for making tonight great. We had a party of 10 and we were here to celebrate a friend's birthday. I would love to come back here again. My favorites were the Stuffed dates, tuna tartare, Pettit filet, mushroom montadito, chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms! The seafood paellas are to die for! I thought it was a generous amount especially if you are ordering other tapas. Sangria and mojitos are on point. If you want to have a good time with great food, give firefly a chance!

QlGnQbHHZf1xqW_ZAg4gWw.text: I would definitely recommend the tuna tartare and the camarones al ajillo, both very tasty.   We ordered the petite filet and although the meat was very tender it was missing flavor.

aYGlvXg43ggcZnB2nRsSug.text: Wonderful spot to come for some delicious tapas, in a casual setting with fantastic servers. We've been here multiple times and we've always been completely satisfied with our experience.  Reasonably priced, live music (sometimes), and good sangria. Our faves are the bacon wrapped figs, Serrano ham sliders, calamari, mussels, empanadas, and patatas bravas.  Paella is awesome as well, but beware, it's HUGE. Great to share for a large table, but for two, you're going to be stuffed if you order the paella and two dishes of tapas.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

odN9JjlRwhd9vz9Q826K_A.text: Came here as a farewell Sunday brunch to reflect on all the poor decisions we made over the weekend in Vegas. And it was also my mom's birthday.  I live in LA, where "tapas" are like $20 each and you get a serving that looks like a Costco sample. I was hesitant about coming here but I wanted to try and be a good son for once so we tried it out.   The menu is HUGE. Lots of options that made the decision difficult so we just said funk it and ordered a bunch of stuff. Avocado toast, chilequiles, steak and mushroom skewers, calamari, a couple other things I can't remember, and the chicken mushroom paella. The paella was decent, nothing groundbreaking, but all the tapas were DELICIOUS. And affordably priced for the generous portions. I was surprised. We didn't really need to eat the paella by the time it came out but we're American so obviously we didn't just stop eating when we were full. Come on.  Service was kind of bad, but the waiter made up for it by offering a complimentary espresso and a flan for my mother. I didn't eat any, but my mom said the flan was amazing. Now she's inspired and sending me pics of her in the kitchen at home working on her own flan recipe. Thanks Firefly...you inspired a new chef.

EpEvLInThqfs-zgMsa3ikg.text: Love this place! Delicious food! I go as often as possible without embarrassing myself! Wonderful sunday brunch with live music too!

pP2dQFtN4ddg-IA_HdMkBg.text: Come here for a party! LOL It was my first time having TAPAS and I came with 20 people.  Quite big location, I love the inside decor it's dimly light and has a red ambience to it. There's a huge bar in the center if you prefer ordering drinks or some small dishes asap. Servers were very friendly and accommodating. I was worried that since we had such a large group it would take a while for all our orders and it was a busy night but, absolutely no complaints! All food came out on great timing and was fresh and so delicious. I didn't get to post all pictures of everything I ordered because it was so good everyone ate it too quickly.  **I recommend the stuffed dates & manchego macncheese #perfection  Their paella is also very delicious! Order that first because it takes 40 min to cook and serves between 4-6 people.  Overall it was so much fun for a birthday dinner/party  10/10 experience  I'll definitely be back again with more friends, probably during their happy hour from 3-6

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy crispy fried calamari
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manchego mac n cheese!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tender pineapple baby back ribs

-kwt-3-dha3yjrDvh55zjA.text: Food was excellent!  We had a group of four and all of us equally loved our food.  We were, however, extremely disappointed in the service.  We asked to be away from the noise as this was a reunion and the hostess was extremely rude about our request.  The server was not friendly, did not engage in conversation, did not come and check on us nor refill our drinks and we had to request another server to find him to bring us our check.  We will return for the excellent food and prices but hope our next experience with the hostess and wait staff is much better.    Five stars for the food, one for the hostess and waiter we had.

YIGRv15CPz_8jErbxLNVTQ.text: I go to Firefly every time I come to Las Vegas, which is a couple times a year. Service this last time was adequate, in the past has always been fun and flirty with an attractive and attentive wait staff. The place is always noisy, so don't expect an intimate conversation!  So many great bites to choose from, some of my favorite are the Ahi Tuna Skewer, Steak & Mushroom Skewer, Baked Goat Cheese, Camarones ala Diabla, and Camarones Al Ajillo. The Stuffed Dates are usually my top pick, but they skimped on the goat cheese and the dates where tiny and dry this time. While the Flourless Chocolate Cake with raspberries was tasty, it was not moist.   I'll definitely will be back again soon, just hope they tweak the shortcomings I noticed this last time.

g753TnJe2V6Dt_fWo67qaw.text: This place was great and an incredible value. The tapas were excellent and the menu was extensive. The tapas weren't traditional Spanish tapas (at least as I know them) but everything we had was delicious. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella and banana sandwich

Yw-Tj2ZNzKZPfnqjySeB0g.text: The Tapas are really a great size, the ambience is very chill and they have music going all night long. Great place to go and have drinks with shareable plates. Extra plus that they are open until 2am for food. I had the Mac and cheese and it was really cheesy and good.

EPRO48zoU1oRay4ic3qvBQ.text: Off-strip, but a quick drive/cab ride. Happy hour is a great deal.  Not particularly fancy, but reliable well-priced small plates. Pretty much everything is good, fantastic cocktails, and beautiful covered patio. I'm a big fan.

ZRxiwhN07muEFfIY6D_kBQ.text: Great tapas! The bacon wrapped dates everyone talks about is a MUST! Sounds strange but we ordered a second order after the first was devoured so fast. Everything was exceptional except for the paellas. At roughly $25 a pop we thought it'd be delicious. It was too saucy which made the rich soggy. The seafood paellas mussels and fish were both way over cooked and the chicken and mushroom one was not spectacular.   Service was great. Go with and group.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of 1/2015
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartar. Good

7h3ITz0-n6gjopeLWuHSGg.text: First timer! Great place to get some drinks and some appetizers. The food is very tasty. Friday nights and Saturday nights are very busy and it's hard to find parking but other than that the place is very upbeat and is great for a night out with some friends

6JuhIZrvGL7xDoLTfiUhQg.text: I still like the original Firefly best. But alas, they moved on to another Paradise location, pretty much next door to where the original was. Sure, it's bigger and newer. But it's just not the same. The prices have dramatically increase over the years. Most tapas have gone up $2-$3.50 each. So it's no longer as cheap as it once was. But nonetheless, it's still a decent cost-quality trade off. So, in other words, the food is tasty and the prices ain't bad (even if they are steeper than they used to be).  And while I miss the old place, I do have to admit this newer version is quite nice. It's just intimate enough, just dark enough, just decorated enough, etc. And the bar area is huge and really nice space. Fair warning: Happy hour can make the bar area quite crowded. I also really like the patio area too.  The service we experienced here was fabulous. Very attentive and friendly.  The menu has just so many good items. The flavored mojitos and sangrias are all amazing. And I've never had a bad or even so-so tapa here. The stuffed peppers and mac 'n' cheese will forever be personal favorites. And then there's the steak and mushrooms skewers, the petite filet, the shrimp, the mussels, the gazpacho, the dates, the meatballs... It's all good eats.  So yeah, it's still a top Vegas restaurant for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

csoEHYfgZbhgHA69GREhiQ.text: Usually when I make a trip out to Vegas, I am much too intoxicated to eat anything at a sit-down restaurant but it was my friend's birthday and his gf suggested this place and I'm glad we went! The menu is tapas style with various small plates to share family style. They also have entrees if you're the kind of person who just doesn't like to share :)  The paella takes about 40 minutes to prepare so you should order that right when you sit down as you look over the rest of the menu. We opted for the mixed paella for the table. Everyone ordered various things and honestly, EVERYTHING was delicious. I have no complaints. I had the petite filet as my main entree and it was DELICIOUS, only $15!   From what I remember from tasting everyone's tapas, the shrimp, stuffed mushrooms, ahi tuna, chicken and rib eye entrees were ALL great! I hope I can come back soon. The menu is so extensive, there's prob around 50 tapas to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed paella
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet

RIPdorYMy7y1OeF_ZxU9_w.text: Good eats great service and sangria was refreshing...decor a bit outdated but so what?

usX9aYf6HyJYsJWJrUk36A.text: Really fun, good food- and a nice throwback old atmosphere where you expect a mob guy to walk in. We came here on the way to the airport, and it was good.

mfR3Vq-plP0RkzSsqHzxMw.text: Great restaurant for tapas. Went here for a birthday party and service was impeccable. Will certainly return!

OVcph9Ba1nuHeAOibew8Bw.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. My wife and I have been coming for years.  We arrived in Las Vegas and went straight here for dinner. We had the stuffed mushrooms with chorizo, stuffed dates, manchego cheese / apple cheese salad, ceviche and camarones diablo. All delicious and reasonably priced.  The drinks are refreshing and delicious. I started off with the Passion Fruit Mojito and ended with a Watermelon flavored mojito. Both delicious but entirely different flavors. The passion fruit sour and watermelon sweet.  The waiters and waitresses are very knowledgeable and service was impeccable. Can not wait to come back once visiting Vegas again.

bnd81l14wX3O4xENMwhhsQ.text: Generous portions, delicious recipes, masterful preparation, and great drinks! This was our first time here and will certainly not be our last. From the moment you pull up, you know you're in for a treat. Off the strip? Yes. Lacking the glitz you seek in Vegas? Not at all. The best part is that you get a great vibe minus the pretentiousness of the strip. Highly recommend ordering something from each category to get the full experience. We had roasted eggplant, calamari, surf & turf, ceviche, and and and.... too many to list and all delicious! Our personal favorite was the ceviche. Perfect acidity and delicious pops of avocado and bright onions. The margaritas are so obviously homemade, without the unpleasant sourness of the bad mix so many bars try to pass off. And you MUST MUST try the sangria!! They let it marinade for days before you get it and it shows. Perfectly balanced flavors of fresh, bright fruits. All in all, everything we had was extraordinary and we can't recommend it highly enough. Thank you, Firefly, for such an outstanding experience!

4qUm8Cb-2_Kpc7CynSnpmA.text: I never actually went there. I called because Yelp showed it was very busy. I asked if they had a waiting list I could put my name on or reservations. She said you have to check in there. I explained I had a disability and cannot stand. I asked if there was seating for people waiting. She said yes but they would not make sure I was able to sit. I again explained that I wanted to come but that I cannot wait. She suggested I go elsewhere then. Her tone was very rude. She certainly has no empathy for people with disabilities. It is a very poor reflection of the establishment. I do not plan to go there now.

lnC3JtzKY6znaxmUqNyEdQ.text: Honestly one of my favorite tapas places ever. It's close, it's convenient, the food and service is good, and the prices aren't bad. Unfortunately, their old rep is preceeding them, but I've never had food poisening here, and neithet have any of my friends or family.   The happy hour here is great. The pear martini is delish. Not too sweet. I really like the sangria, I usually get a pitcher. Sometimes two. :P  The boqueronea are toasts with anchovies, avacado, and lemon drizzle. Super super good. Nice and fresh. Not too heavy. The roasted eggplant cannolini with goat cheese is also quite good. I'm a sucker for goat cheese. The beet salad is probably my favorite. Also has nut crusted goat cheese.  The stuffed dates are probably the most popular dish, and for good reason. They have an almond inside with of course...goat cheese. So delish. These are pretty rich, however. Stuffed peppers have mozz and cream cheese. It's like jalapeno poppers but fancy.  I've also had a few of their salads, the steak one is my fav. Just look at the menu. You'll know why.  All in all, a great place to come after work for happy hour or before a night on the town.

n4W0TEwdCFZocdnK9nf53A.text: So good and fun!  We had 3 kids with us and decided to go on an early dinner and everything we got was good.  We ordered the meatballs twice.  The filet was not pictured.  Here's a list of items we got, mushroom tart, octopus, scallops, tomato soup, meatballs, empanadas, tuna tartare, and chicken skewers.  Definitely will go back and recommend to anyone who enjoys tapas.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S8LCWBieHyKjIC5Coxr9Hw.text: Delicious Sangria and food! The paella was superb. Service was perfect. Prices were great. We would definitely come back! Come here when you're free.

pXRwH2HWTWYO4dp4aMPdXA.text: Tapas have never tasted so good in Las Vegas. My reasoning is, why should I spend $$$$ for the smallest tapas I will ever get on the strip? Granted there are delicious and amazing tapas restaurants on the strip, but FireFly is kick ass!   The food! The food is delicious every single time! Incredible portions! You get your money's worth. The service is great and they make sure you're doing alright. I like the decor a lot. There's a reason there is over 1,000 review for this place.  This is what you must order: the bacon wrapped figs, the tuna tartare, the shrimp ceviche, the empanada, camarones al ajillo and go for a dessert!   This is my second 5 Star Las Vegas Restaurant review. I am very fortunate to have the means to travel and enjoy incredible restaurants.

PnkJGW6Q2k0Goq79XWvbFw.text: Stopped for a quick drink.  Asked for a recommendation.  OMG. The spicy cucumber martini is amazing.  Cool and hot at them same time. Lol.  Very nice staff.  Nice appetizers but I am not hungry.  A nice stop in a darkened atmosphere inside or go outside to the patio.

mNiKaiddReBUq9TlBaKnGg.text: Good portion + tasty food. My favorite dish was clam + grilled bread. But my food was already cold by the time it was delivered to my doorway. I will go visit the restaurant next time.

fKFzxuvJpctdpLowR4LAzw.text: I always take my friends and family to FIREFLY. When I lived in Vegas, it was a great date night place and I am missing it now!!!   The sparkling sangria is perfect. I love sangria and this one is sweet and bubbly, great on hot Vegas days! Get a pitcher and enjoy your surroundings, plus it will get you feelin' good as your delicious tapas come out.   The must-haves:  Bacon Wrapped Dates-everyone likes these. EVERYONE. I don't like bleu cheese and the little pieces in this make the dish stand out! GET THEM.   Anchovy toast things-Boquerones? I probably just butchered that. Anyways. THIS IS MY FAV!! I know I know, anchovy whaaaaat!!!? But for real get it. White anchovy on toast points with avocado, roasted red peppers and a lemony sauce....it is SO GOOD. I didn't want it, my date insisted, and it's now my favorite dish. A balance of seafood saltiness and creamy avocado...omg yum.   Manchego Mac N Cheese- I'm a lover of all things cheese and this is great, baked on top which just enhances the texture.   Stuffed Peppers- cheesy, creamy, and fried onions for crunch. Love this.   Nutella Banana Sandwich Dessert. Explained itself.     The ambiance is fantastic, the drinks are strong and delicious, and the pricing is great (especially for Vegas), and service has always been very helpful and friendly!

CHdmfjlvVQy5I7AmJXHzDw.text: (3.5 stars)  Firefly serves the purpose if you're looking for an alternative away from the strip and want a casual bite to eat. There are PLENTY of options on the menu to keep everyone happy!    On our plate -  * Veggie Empanada - crisp, flaky and flavorful. * Warm Spinach Salad - with artichoke, red pepper, pine nuts, feta and a dash of lemon. The slightly warmed up spinach gave the salad a nice body and the addition of pine nuts added a great crunch.  * Baked Goat Cheese - can't really go wrong with baked cheese! Ever. This was creamy and melt-in-the-mouth delicious. * Shrimp in lemon garlic butter sauce - the sauce was good, but the shrimp did not absorb any of it and seemed to be tossed in it a few minutes right before serving. * Grilled octopus - very disappointing, the octopus was chewy and didn't taste fresh at all...the sauce lacked seasoning as well.   Service was friendly and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked goat cheese
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and herb butter...on the house
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veg empanadas

Q0CUWyKa1eqMgumbTlPvbA.text: The best food I've had for quite a while. Every dish that we ordered was delicious and it's a great setting for large groups. I would definitely visit this restaurant every time I'm in Vegas. I'm from the Bay Area in CA, wish they had a restaurant there too.

PvwsXpuy2wXjooxABkBang.text: Rick Harrison of Pawn Stars fame recommended this place, and he was right! Everything here was amazing, and we loved the tapas approach. My wife enjoyed her favorite-ever steak, the petite filet mignon, and I enjoyed a wonderful Firefly burger. Everything was full of flavor, from the diablo ketchup all the way to the bread pudding for dessert. This is a very upscale-feeling place where you can be comfortable dressing casual, too. Magnifique!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Petite Filet Mignon

5vGel01EcX1H4Rb-KCGzDQ.text: Our last meal in Sin City, and worth the build up, especially after a week consisting mostly of pampering and partying.   Much needed when your friends need some space from the blinding lights of the strip. This spot was recommended by some local friends, and we're glad that they have prime taste. Super hip, and not as gimmicky as most tapas places can be these days.  Vegas fall weather is the best weather. so try and grab a table outside. A little vino won't hurt either, it's more Spanish that way.

m2aK4X6FCNi-VXMoOI3fZw.text: Love this little slice of heaven! My boyfriend and I were visiting Vegas and we wanted to try all different foods so we ended up here. It's a short trip from the strip and very worth it. The food came out like lightening! Super fast, and super good. I love getting a whole bunch of little dishes to try. We also have a pitcher of their Sangria and it was delicious. Finally, the service was fantastic. Everyone was really nice to us.

whISzuDw1TBEi8WeL1WyCQ.text: We had read that this place was vegan friendly so when our friends suggested we meet there for dinner, we made reservations. So glad we did. They were very busy. No parking available in the back, had to valet which was free. My husband and I like to order different plates and then share them, so the small plates here just fit us perfectly. We had bacon wrapped dates, clams and chorizo, lamb chops, grilled octopus, and mango BBQ ribs. My vegan son had the lentils and veggies and the tomato bread. Everything was hot, tasty, and served just at the right time. The staff was busy but very friendly and provided good service. Dessert was Nutella and banana for hubby and coconut sorbet for our son. The place is very very loud   but it was packed with big parties celebrating birthdays so understandable. The food and service are both high quality. We will go back to this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chop and lentils

5Cq0AO2cQwX1pjfzLK-5TA.text: I was pretty happy with this choice, and I'll definitely be back.  Great selection, fast service, and excellent food.  The wait staff was very friendly and attentative, and the restaurant was clean.  We got the shrimp cerviche, which was excellent, the burger, which I'd highly recommend, the stuffed mushrooms, which weren't plentiful but were definitely good, the caramones a la diabla which was excellent and the Mac and cheese which was solid.  I'm definitely excited to come back and try some other stuffs on the menu.

vbtr1A2BgJR6OFbAMdnmQw.text: Best in town. Olive tapenade, duck rolls with cherry hoisin sauce and my personal favorite: blood orange mojitos. They keep the drinks flowing and the customers happy. Cant go wrong with anything on the menu!

eyvcj-yeRCjj-l0mcXBJ0g.text: Came back for a second visit with good recollections of fine tapas.  Beyond wobbly tables and broken chairs,  service was different with a variety of waitstaff kind of throwing dishes in from all directions. Food was fine although it tended to be sweet and mostly meat dishes. Most notably I had no idea this restaurant wants to be a nightclub with pounding house music making it impossible to hear the waitstaff or carry on a conversation with our friends,  which might have been good to know.  We ate quickly without yelling at each other and went somewhere else so we could talk over drinks and dessert.

VI-WPsnQCm-0T0ThPai-lg.text: Great place if you want to get off the busy strip and go to a place that's not crazy overpriced. It's usually pretty packed here even late at night past 9 PM. Food is solid and service is good as well. Their fried tempura fish is da bomb and so is anything with shrimp. Their steak tapas is pretty good as well. Try to sample as many small plates as you can since the portion sizes are smaller.

UJ82CfWF-PlJsGdz6o61Ug.text: Luv luv luv the food. Flavors of dishes were great. Small portions so order an appetizer or extra dish.

5ArF6Vb953DgpcXA1jqlOg.text: My wife and I had our 25th Year Anniversary dinner here.  The coordinator was very attentive to our needs.  The dinner turned out amazing.  Our guests couldn't stop telling us the food was very good.  The drinks were tasty.  Thank you to Ana and the staff.

yYeb75F53taxY2U5usA_Qw.text: I have been here about a half dozen times and the food is AMAZING.  I met two colleagues there today for lunch and, as usual, the food was sooooo good.  We ended up staying for another 1-2 hours to collaborate on some work "stuff" and the staff could not have been nicer.  Our server, Roberto, was wonderful.  Very attentive and just a really nice guy.  I don't love the location, but when I'm in that part of town for work, I always try to go to lunch, happy hour or dinner there.  It's fantastic and reasonable!  Can't wait to go again and try some new dishes.  Hopefully, Roberto will be my server!

52MNz2AcI2_tH-zq6_n2yg.text: Amazing food and drinks! We went here with a large party and everyone was able to find stuff that they liked, the took into consideration allergies, and everyone loved what they ordered.  The ambiance was nice and it was a highlight for our vacation!

zBNPs3oEctDdVh7rMypAiw.text: This place was simply amazing! The environment was awesome .. they had a little photo booth inside which was pretty cool and the paella was to die for.. will definitely come back again anytime i come to Vegas

6UTtftMtoKaZnPgTdklDzg.text: Firefly is a great place for tapas and drinks! They're famous for their red sangria so I recommend getting a pitcher of that. It's my go-to drink! I have been here so many times and I just haven't gotten a chance to write a review. I order probably 6-7 dishes every time I'm here. My top favorites so far are their bacon wrapped dates, mushroom tart, tierra y mar skewers, scallop "escargots", steak&mushroom skewers, and their camarones a la diabla. The bacon wrapped dates is a nice blend of sweet and salty, with a dash of creaminess from the cheese crumbles. I can have all 5 to myself, honestly. The mushroom reminds me of cream of mushroom soup over puff pastries. It's so delicious! The tierra y may skewers is a little bit of everything from shrimp, chorizo, and I think some beef. The scallop "escargots" are exactly what they sound like, they're scallops made how escargots are normally made on the escargot platter with the butter herbs. The butter herbs is so delicious. After eating all the scallops, I enjoy dipping my bread in the butter. For the steak and mushrooms, it's steak and mushrooms! How can you go wrong with that. The camarones a la diabla are shrimps in a somewhat sweet and spicy sauce. It's to die for. I also love dipping my bread in the sauce. Maybe the only reason that I don't write this review is because it makes me hungry! Haha.   The service is very subpar. In all honestly, they should just hire more employees because it takes long to get your order in, to get more orders, to get a refill or anything. Plus the guys are not very pleasant, but oh wells! Can't expect 5 start service from such a busy place. Parking sucks so maybe just bring a couple dollars for the valet? And it's a very noisy atmosphere so don't expect to go here for a quiet dinner. Definitely try this place out.

cMdKOzzy_Ta2TmnVvG2pjQ.text: I made a last minute decision to come here for dinner before going to see Vegas! The Show everything was really good! I started with the shrimp cieviche followed by the summer vegetables & stuffed mushrooms. I really liked the ambiance too very inviting & seems nice for a date just hanging with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed mushrooms &amp; summer vegetables
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cieviche

hRNmKdC_Nd02LJnA9KbcUA.text: The sangria is still the best in town. The albondigas, warm spinach salad and dates were superb! Service was fast and the staff was friendly. I definitely recommend this place.

QJIkEHOSo-17uibaxx1GeA.text: Went to a friend's birthday gathering at Firefly's new location on Paradise. Disappointed. Best example was the potatoes brava. They were slimy with a spicy but otherwise flavorless sauce and globs of what seemed like mayo from a jar. A feint shadow of the fabulous potatoes brava at Julian Serrano, which have a gourmet tomato-based sauce and light creamy aioli.  The service was also frustrating. We were in a booth with about eight people. The curtains blocked people on the ends of the table from sight, which meant waiters never bothered to ask us if we wanted anything else. We had to get up from the table and seek out the waiter several times.  This is huge place and in terms of quality this is like the chain restaurant of tapas places. For a little bit more Julian Serrano, in Aria, is orders of magnitude better.

khF4JskLxYV1XVHt_CufqQ.text: Tapa style but MEGA portions. Left very full and satisfied but some of the food was just MEH. Ordered smoked salmon bagels, manchego mac n cheese, spicy beef salad, stuffed dates, firefly fries, mushroom tart, tierra y mar skewers, shrimp tempura, chicago beef bocadillos, and lamb chops. Salmon bagels, fries, and stuffed dates were really good. The rest was overcooked or bland but at least we were full...

hSVMCwvtt3JnKBQnNcZpxg.text: Lots of variety and great food. A group of 4 visited and tried the servers suggestions as well as some of our own choices. The bacon dates and Diablo shrimp were our favorites. Lots of flavor and a great meal.

FfjisSncxE9cAciC7Ut6mA.text: I went with a party of 8 during their happy hour last Friday night. (Monday-Friday from 3PM-6PM). We had an excellent server named Pepe, who I will likely request again in the future. He always had a smile on his face and was very attentive given the size of our group and that it was a busy Friday night. I have a shrimp allergy and when I was disappointed that I couldn't try the tierra del mar skewers, Pepe offered to make one of the three skewers all beef so that way I could have some. It came out on a completely separate dish which makes my allergies happy. This was also great for my boyfriend since he loves shrimp but usually doesn't get to order it due to my allergy. We also ordered their truffle fries and albondigas (a staple every time we visit) as they never disappoint! We then tried the ham and cheese croquetas which were great but were just very small - 3 pieces each about 2 inches in size. I probably will not get those again. Lastly, we enjoyed 4 pitchers of the red sangria, half priced during happy hour. The sangria is, and has been, the reason I keep going back and back!

2LJgichIOk7MeTu17P9w7A.text: We chose this place (long distance! I live in WI, my daughter in AZ) for a cocktail reception after my daughter's wedding strictly based on reviews and price. So glad that we did! This was a wonderful experience for us. We had about 35 people and the coordinator (I wish I remembered her name) was amazingly helpful and got us set up in a banquet room, with a separate table for the wedding cake, and spots for everyone to mingle and eat. Kept checking in with me to make sure all was good. We had three appetizers (so yummy!) and an open bar. The bartender Miguel was super great and took food orders for a few people who wanted a full meal. All the guests loved the food, the atmosphere and their experience. Most of all my daughter was happy! Thanks Firefly for helping make her day as special as possible!

34kTDprVFGlhXpVyZnoN3Q.text: I've eaten at many fancy places on the strip, but we decided to try a new place based on reviews. This restaurant is very unassuming upon entering; did we make a mistake? The food was AMAZING, the service was great, and the prices were even better. If you are looking for atmosphere, this probably isn't the place for you....but if you are looking for amazing food.....you NEED to try this place.

HryXbB2WFui4fHLWNzz9Eg.text: Best mojitos and sangria in Las Vegas. Friendly and helpful staff. Food tastes great. Good happy hour specials on drinks (half off pitcher of Mojito is my favorite).

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavored mojitos are worth a try.

l6JIPxWG3TU9RHZulKvCZg.text: This is the best tapas restaurant that I've ever visited. Every dish is perfect. Standouts include the mac 'n' cheese, the empanada, the stuffed dates, and the stuffed mushrooms. They also serve a killer red sangria.  The prices are a steal, ranging from $6 to $13 per dish; the entrees cost more but are still very reasonable. While the restaurant is located off the strip, it's just a short taxi ride away. And the restaurant itself is roomy with a charming ambiance. My husband and I make an effort to visit every time we go to Vegas.

3RkrjDnl0Q7Uaiw14duuQQ.text: Delicious! If you're looking for something to wake up your taste buds you must go here. We've been here several times and enjoy many of the different tapas. I suggest trying the croquets, bacon wrapped stuffed dates, manchego Mac and cheese, albondigas, & empanadas. Those are just a few of the amazing dishes they have. They are priced just right for all the food and have excellent atmosphere.

56WlMQn0516Z_pMw9NzbIg.text: Ate at this new location once before I moved, but I used to frequent the spot that closed due to problems and have been to the Sahara location, this one is better. Firefly is awesome for drinks w/ friends, a date, or whatever. This place does tapas right. Many interesting choices and great cocktails.   There's quite a lot to choose from, so you'll probably be back again. My favorites are the coconut mussels, fish sticks, and tuna stuffed peppers. There are many other notable items, including hot/cold options featuring shrimp, beef, chicken, fish, etc. Their drinks are the best I've had. I'm a beer girl, so when I order sangria or a pomegranate mojito, you know something is up.   Prices are reasonable. I love the ambiance and the service is always good here. It's better here than at Sahara, for some reason, so come here if you have the option.

kRta1qUvxpDYF_TXJR3yYw.text: Not only was the food great, but the service was magnificent. Food came out quickly, and soft drinks were refilled constantly. Will definitely return.

Ts6R310sWVhfc44qIKp5_w.text: I have been to the old location on Paradise a few times in the past. I thought over time it became overrated. When they moved to a larger place I thought maybe the food would have improved. Not really. I still think its overrated and the tapas are slightly above average.  I am sure I will be back a few times because my friends LOVE Firefly. The next time I eat here I will most likely get an entree instead of tapas.   PROS: Tres Leches chocolate cake              Chorizo and clams              Great place for a group to try many different dishes.               Ribeye Steak and truffle fries (entree)  CONS: Spicy Beef salad - the salsa verde didn't mix with the other ingredients              Pulpo Asado - the octopus was good but the tomato, paprika lemon vinaigrette  didn't mix.               Lemon Berry Tarts - the berries were good but the tart cups taste like they came out of a  box.

qn3vSgX3PY_Xk387wf5sMA.text: I live in California and needed to arrange a wedding rehearsal dinner for my nephew.  His fiance had suggested Firefly.  She said the food was great and she and her family enjoy it.  I looked them up online and and came across the event section, I sent a quick email for someone to call me.  That day, the event coordinator Regina Simmons contacted me.  We corresponed via email text and by phone.  We were a party of 35 and were able to have the private room in the back.    On our way to the venue I sent Regina a text that we were on our way.  Once seated our waiter, Jesus was on it.  We had water bread and drink orders.  Oh did I mention that I left all my centerpieces there and Regina and her staff decorated for me.  She even ordered linens and napkins to match our rustic chic wedding decor.  Everything looked beautiful.    Within 10 minutes of settling in, BAM!!!!  The food, oh the food.  We had artichoke toast, the bacon wrapped dates, salmon toast, beef and chicken skewers and the diablo shrimp.  Everything was delicious.  The service was awesome and the food amazing.  The value was definately there.  Parking, use the valet parking, it's FREE!!!!!  When we were leaving, the place was bumping, it was a great vibe and great mix of people.  I will definately be back on our next trip.  Can't wait to try new items. (Will definately order the bacon dates again)  Thank you Regina and the Firefly staff for making this event special and memorable for my nephew and and now new wife.   Gracias por todo!

RJj61pAk1aoXbhdMwt0KGQ.text: I usually really like Firefly because the food comes out really quickly which I love, and it was delicious.  The issue came when we tried to ask for our check.  Our waitress seemed to have one whole side of the restaurant plus tables outside.  We had to ask for our check twice.  Then waited for awhile before she would come back to get the check.  In the meantime one of the people I was dining with had to leave.  10 minutes later came to get my cash payment and then 20 minutes later I was till waiting for my $87 of change.  The other three people I was dining with had to leave so I was now sitting alone and the waitress still did not come to bring my change.  I finally flagged a manager down and asked if I could please get my change because I had been waiting 20 minutes.  No apology, just said the waitress was having issue with another table.  Brought my change back in two minutes again saying the waitress was having issues with another table , I said I understood she was busy as it looked like she was waiting on half the restaurant.  She just looked at me like I had two heads. Brought down the mood from what had been a fun dinner.

_k-me4jsqpuxGTIINhx56A.text: Just had an absolutely wonderful anniversary dinner at Firefly! Apple/Manchego salad, mushroom tart, firefly fish sticks, and the petite filet. Topped off with a complimentary flan desert. EVERYTHING was spectacular. The apple salad was fresh and crisp, fabulous palate cleanser between meals. Service was on point, hostess, busser, server, everyone was friendly and attentive, but not intrusive. Overall great experience and we will definitely be back on our next trip!

JjE9n385lqacseWGF6BBWA.text: This place is beyond jaw dropping because of it's amazing food. Every time I come to Vegas this is a place which is a must!

nc0E3K6IKk0dmBspSMUMog.text: Excellent food excellent service excellent atmosphere! I'm super picky and I am super happy with this dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy@firefly

-5jAR9GTP7AEvr3XQS0phw.text: So my future sister-in-law made reservations here for her bachelorette dinner on a Saturday at 7:30. We arrived at 7:30 or 7:35 and were seated at about 7:45. The ambiance was nice and I as digging the vibe. We were seated and were kind of discouraged right off the bat when the servers were around our table but no one came to introduce themselves, ask for our drink order, or if we wanted to start off with any of the tapas. Thirty minutes later we flagged someone down to ask if we could order drinks and food... And had to flag people down for another thirty minutes afterward. The restaurant was quite loud and busy, but other tables were being served and we were right next to the server station and bar and couldn't get anyone to take our order! After I explained that it was my sister-in-laws bachelorette the staff became more attentive. The saving grace was most definitely the food and mojitos. The bacon-wrapped dates and ceviche were amazing, as well as the pork empanadas.   All in all, the food and drinks were delicious but the service leaves much to be desired. We are visiting from the east coast and my future sister-in-law was bummed that we were being looked over on what was supposed to be a fun evening out. The photographer that snaps a picture of you while you're trying to enjoy your food really brought us down a notch too. She then comes back later and tries to sell you the photos for $15 apiece... What?!? It really cheapens the entire experience. I get that it's Vegas, but there is a time and a place and it isn't while we are eating.

MRVc-P1ivPmtgUfF0noMzQ.text: We came here almost every night during our stay in Vegas and the food was absolutely amazing every time. There wasn't any dish that we did not like (and we tried a lot of them). The staff is very friendly and attentive and even on the most busiest nights dining here we seemed to have gotten all our food VERY fast! They waste absolutely no time when it comes to customer service. Well done!

W4dAHsplXnMkptsTW60hFw.text: I love tapas so I can try everything. This place has fun, noisy atmosphere, good sangria and very good food. Best for a small group

picaxy3xQlvYoNxDrdPTxw.text: We were invited by friends for dinner (party of 6 for tapas and drinks) We were seated right away. Our friends chose to sit on the patio, so I didn't get to see the inside. The patio faces a busy 6 lane roadway with no real view, and no garden between you and the street, only the sidewalk. The waiter never brought my drink. We ordered loads of tapas to share which ranged in price from $8 to $12. The dated wrapped in bacon with blue cheese were delicious, but overcooked. The steak and mushroom skewers were such a disappointment - ordered medium - they were tough and were fat and gristle, so we left them uneaten. The calamari was good, the roasted vegetables were mushy and flavorless, the veggie empanadas were forgettable but served on a nice bed of greens that we all enjoyed. Then there was the ribeye steak - we ordered it medium rare, but it was so rare no one ate it and the steak knife they served it with wouldn't cut the steak! The shrimp tempura, the shaved steak sandwiches and the big pasta bowl were the favorites. The shrimp tempura had enough shrimp for 5 to taste and also was on a pile of vegetables tempura that were delicious. The steak on the sandwiches was hot and tender, served on delicious fresh rolls, with a chopped cold vegetable relish topping and we cut them into 4 generous servings. The pasta was angel hair with a red sauce that was just spicy enough to perk up the taste buds without burning them. The food was served hot as each dish is brought out as it is ready, so no one really ate at the same time.  Plates were not cleared, so we ended up with piles of plates, and they never offered us clean tasting plaes. Our friends had a pitcher of peach sangria, which they reported was delicious. I was in it for the company, and some of the food was good, but I have no desire to return.

j4l-GvOxmJf-XHPGSczWUg.text: Awesome happy hour! The mojitos are always amazing and the atmosphere is awesome, one of myself and my friends favorite places.

L5uzT1n1ZqwsR1Rj7O0Hrw.text: We went late, sat at the bar. Our bartender was nice and helpful with our questions. Sliders and chicken tinga empanada were highlights. Would definitely go back.

i71WvKXuKkPGZ9Inz3M61g.text: Wow, first time here in all my years in Vegas and I must say very impressed.  Great drinks all around and the bartender was definitely and expert in his profession.  I'm sad I didn't came on an empty stomach as the food that kept walking by looked fantastic. I will for sure be coming back for a full experience.

UIVISHqVMobjPBvbEaVa1g.text: Tasty and relatively inexpensive tapas with a bit of a locals vibe yet close enough to the strip a tourist like me could make it there. Certainly worth trying out if you want some tapas.

QFlMzlbRC8Xu8oKTtuZr-w.text: I have been going to Firefly for years.  It was recommended to me first by a close friend that worked in the restaurant industry in Vegas as a locals place. I went to the original location one block away and since the move, have been to the new location a few times now.  I make it a point to visit this place each time I visit Vegas on business or pleasure.  I recommend this place to all my friends, family, and co-workers.  On my recent visit on 12/28/13, my family (4 of us total..kids were 10 and 14) enjoyed:  1) Red Sangria - Get a pitcher(s) of this stuff.  It is the nectar of the wine gods.  It is a perfect blend of sweet and tart on a hot or warm day and compliments all the dishes they have well.  2) Tapas Style - Since moving to the new larger location, they changed their menu and added more flare.     - Tomato-basil soup and grilled cheese is light, flavorful, and refreshing.   - Shrimp ceviche is cool refreshing, seasoned well and balanced in flavor.   - Stuffed Dates had a smoky bacon wrapped around a semi-sweet date with an almond inside.  It was a great combination of flavors and the crunch added a nice texture.   - Firefly Fries are a large portion of garlic and parmesan goodness.   - Manchego Mac 'n' Cheese was the kid's favorite.  Fresh and homemade with real cheeses.   - Chicken Skewers was another kid's favorite.  There was a roasted garlic cream that added some good flavor to the chicken.   - Serrano Sliders were really tasty and tender.  We added some of the onion straws it came with as a garnish in the slider to kick it up a notch.   - Merguez...my wife doesn't like sausage but this lamb sausage was great.  Not very gamey but a good rich tasting meat complimented with red peppers.   - Lamb Chops - It was like eating candy...it was lamb as it should be with a base of seasoning that brought out a slight pleasant sweetness.   - Camarones a la Diabla - Shrimp in a spicy sweet sauce.  Hands down one of the best dishes there.  The sauce is so good...ask for extra bread for dipping.   - Desserts for us consisted of our favorites...flan and tres leches cake.  The flan is traditionally made and the flavor of the custard has an almond taste to it...the tres leches cake is moist and sweet to eat.  3) Service - The servers, runners, and bussers were fantastic.  Our drinks were always filled, table was clutter free, and our server checked in at the right moments.    4) Ambiance - The new location is much easier to get in and out of.  The decor and layout of the restaurant was very open and relaxing.  Overall...great job on the new location and new menu!

EqdE7wsRjpMdLfq7QV9OEA.text: Just a short walk from the strip and so worth it!! Tapas were amazing as was the sangria. The best thing on the menu though was the bacon wrapped dates in red wine reduction sauce. I discovered this place on one of Rachael Rays episodes!!!!

fiZkfxE7fNHVvwAbsBsIoQ.text: I came to this restaurant with a large party (over 15 people) they initially did not want to split our check but after struggling to find a way to pay and 35 minutes later, they took 20+ minutes to split checks and bring the bills to us. This did not include the time it took to get back change and receipts. The service was not very accommodating but the food is excellent. Only come here if you have a small party

7rgau17JeLAzN2KSDCv6mQ.text: Love the scallops, shrimp a la diabla, cheesy potatoes, ambiance is great and staff is attentive. If you ask for bread it comes with garlic butter.

l2q1p__mQhzsumBGCU5qjw.text: My husband and I spend our summer's in Vegas. We have been coming to firefly for years. The new location is bigger and very nice. Our favorites include the tomato basil soup and tuna tar tar, and for dessert we love the tres leches chocolate cake! We have tried probably 3/4 of the menu and those are must haves!

jIe_OUXCinSYZ_ChDZCL3A.text: Truth be told, I was disappointed in Firefly on Paradise.  The place is always packed, and the smells from the outstanding were amazing, but the eating experienced left a lot to be desired.  I had a hard time even getting a table - tried a couple of days - and then I was seated but only outside in a corner.  Waiting times for service were longish, and then a couple of dishes I was served were obviously made ahead of time and heated at the last minute, and the inside of the food was still cold.  The dishes were modern yuppy fusion and not traditional.  All in all, there is a lot of flash and not a lot of substance.  I will not be coming back.

Pfdwcve6ufp3VM595udzFQ.text: Went with family and ordered a variety of tapas. You can't go wrong with any of the tapas. This place is amazeballs. Chicken tinga empanada for the win.

hqA2puEeLPq0_rt_3niqDw.text: Excellent food and service!  Visited this place based on the reviews on Yelp and I wasn't disappointed. The service was quick and the food was great.

bTB1WOBmskdR4QDMyYtBxA.text: It hadn't impressed me. Its good, thats all. Its more appetizers than main dishes, and the plates didnt come together, my boyfriend was done before I even started.

nhtmGvyIrTSmI7DPVXQYjw.text: Just had dinner here and holy crap totally worth the walk from the Strip. It's a little out here so take a cab, but it's all amazing. We had the Cevacha, fish sticks,  mac and cheese and papas bravas and they were all fantastic. Extremely well priced for the portions served and good service, fast and efficient and our water always came quickly.  Also had mojitos and sangria,  both delicious and strong enough.  Great atmosphere,  a little loud but very nice.  Absolutely Check it out I will come back when I'm in a Vegas.

pC9xq9sP9_3W1Tfmk1A24w.text: One of my favorite local spots here in Vegas great service! sangria and mojitos are a must please go check this spot out.

9U0tV7t-9JlM7IMkUptPNQ.text: Service is great, drinks are good, food is only ok. Stuffed peppers and dates are the best thing there. However, the entire restaurant smells like an old dish rag. It makes me wonder how clean things are...

INtHaob9L34BwZQJzhhiGw.text: Found the place a few years ago and every time we go to Vegas we always stop and enjoy some lunch and sangria! We usually order 4 plates and share, the staff is always very pleasant!

MAmX9mu6PcOTuDmMDsftew.text: As I write this I believe this is the last Firefly left in the area. It's a shame because the ladies absolutely love this place and it's always a winner for date night or nights out with friends. Tapas is a lot of fun, and this location is in a newer building with tons of seating and not far from the strip. The Firefly name has unfortunately been marred by multiple restaurant closings from the health department, so they've gone from three or four locations down to only one. It's a little pricey, but you plan to spend a little and you won't have any surprises, and there are plenty of great menu options to choose from.

Y0m_2qY98Pme7S_UWQzUaw.text: We had 4 tapas: Mac n Cheese $9, Calamari $10, Veggie Empanadas $6.5, Tierra y Mar Skewers $11.  A plate of bread which came free was super delicious.   Tierra y Mar Skewers was the best among 4 menus we ordered. The server was very friendly, atmosphere was nice but a bit noisy.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tierra y Mar Skewers $11
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n Cheese $9

UyzNJhy-DCSsDsHgE_CJWw.text: My favorite place to dance in Las Vegas! I've been coming here for years and it never fails to be a good time, especially if you love salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent service the mojitos are fire! And Omar kicked ass!!!

gi8gvL-37IAVHWbU5KTUEg.text: The Burrell's love Firefly. We love the bacon wrapped figs and the Paella. We used to come when they were in the old building but they are still great, if not better in the new building. Can't wait to come back!

049JKGf074YBz_ycYrmliA.text: Great Food, Great Service and Great Ambiance. We were in town for a conference and went to Firefly with two couples and was very impressed with the service and the quality of the food. Definitely a great place to go out to eat that was not expensive. Definitely a place we recommend.

URz1bbhy-pcOz1mSUfP5Rw.text: The firefly in vegas is awesome!  Cool place to eat tons of appetizers and I recommend anything with Shrimp!!!  Great drinks too!  Very cool place

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xJ1oRpxMxyRd24qmijTbuQ.text: Firefly never hesitates to impress with their menu and service! Last night I brought a group of about 40 colleagues from all over the US for a private event. Ana did an excellent job making sure that we had everything we needed prior to the event, and was very conscientious about the guests who had food allergies or dietary restrictions. Every dish was phenomenal - they have won the hearts and tummies of my colleagues! Neo was our bartender, and was so pleasant to everyone, and made some great drinks. Marcos made sure that we had what we needed, and did his best to keep up with clearing away what we finished, and that nothing was wasted. This has become one of the Vegas team's favorite places!

w79K9gaY4NLNSC4WKFdJBQ.text: The tapas here are amazing, my spouse and I are from out of town and we try to visit Las Vegas in a yearly basis to see family and friends. This is a must go spot for us every time we are in town. The sangria here is to die for. The goat cheese fish was rich and the sauce added the right amount of acidity to cut through the richness. Most plates come with enough to share between 4 people. I recommend this place all the time to friends and family. See you again soon Firefly!

8Yfy7_gMuA7stRyAbNE_TA.text: Delicious sangrias, and a very creative tapas menu, everyone we told about Firefly said it was their favorite place! From the The cab attendant at the hotel, to the cabbie, everyone raved about it, this is definitely a much loved which even the locals enjoy. It's a nice looking restaurant, not over the top like most other places in Vegas, service was friendly and the food was excellent.  We tried: - Artichoke toasts - Stuffed Dates - Roasted Veggies - Patapas Bravas - Empanadas - Steak & Mushroom Skewers - Ham & Cheese Croquetes  Everything was delicious, the only one we didn't care for was the Baked Tetilla (Chorizo & cheese fondue) but everything else was excellent. I would love to go back next time I'm in town.

cPVd5CIr0QFNtG94YNkwAQ.text: after years of coming to vegas, i finally was able to try this place out.  i don't know why i didn't come here sooner.  i for one, love tapas, and this place nails it right on the head.  the food, service, atmosphere was great!   we ordered the following below:  stuffed bacon wrapped dates, artichoke toast, rack of lamb, Octopus with spicy tomatoes and potato, and stuff mushroom.  The best items were the artichoke toast.  omfg.  it was like little bits of heaven.  do yourself a huge favor, and get this.  the stuffed mushrooms, is something you can skip.  not too appetizing.    this place has a fun vibe to it.  i heard that some nights they have a live band come in and play.  call ahead and check. so come down to firefly and order yourself a sangria and enjoy your night.  They also have free valet for your car.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus with spicy tomatoes and potato
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo stuffed mushrooms

FxPwVbQLJ_ATSzHVL2xbxQ.text: Prices are a little steep for tapas, but then again portions are pretty decent. The drinks are strong and good. I had the muscles and the portion was huge! Also delicious.

FXieAFHg0Q1tWWQdeJI9NQ.text: Got here only a couple of minutes before happy hour ended absolutely love the red sangria pitcher for $18.00 like 6 drinks worth easily... ordered the tuna... calamari... and filet mignon everything was delicious. Will definitely come back just wish they had music for ambience lol

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J_1f2gP9JFjk6-L9rgSj2g.text: Ok.... So I have told about this place time and time and time again  Finally went and was. It disappointed   The bacon wrapped dates...are a must order fir anyone.... Ohh man I want to go back after writing this..  Also the shrimp Diabla the sauce amazing..  Sangria amazing red that is   Service was great..  Will follow up with more details

I2zF3VgZJVfWDzj22MXPXw.text: This place is my go-to when I'm in Vegas. I've also eaten at fancy places on the Strip, but I'll take Firefly over them! I've only had their tapas, drinks, and Big Bowl salad, but everything has been amazing. For tapas, I've tried: mushroom tart, chicken skewers, petite filet, stuffed dates, ham croquetas, apple and manchego salad, garden variety salad. Each dish has been beautifully presented with a tantalizing combination of flavors. Their sangria and Fly Mule are awesome too! Really, I don't think you can go wrong with anything here. I'll try their paella sometime, but can't seem to get away from the tapas!

Q5THdz2CTbCnfxBnP4wRZQ.text: Very good but not the best tapas I've ever had.  Actually had good service for a group of 9 and the restaurant was also pretty busy.  Though all the plates we ordered were good nothing stood out to me as fantastic.  The drinks however were fantastic and those were the most memorable of the night.  Especially the espresso martini which was mind blowing.  Location is a little off the strip but not more than a 5 min Uber ride away.  Nice to get away from the Vegas prices but this place is not cheap by any means just more of a bargain than anything on the strip. Would return!

DeM3quqyPVLfO_dK_jUL3A.text: Omg amazing customer service and amazing food!!! Great portions! Everything on the menu was so amazing!!!! Definitely coming back and the music was great amazing ambiance. Definitely a long wait but totally worth it!

CCVhuTdW8AY5HPezv_vZ2A.text: I love this place for their sangria !  I would always hang out with my husband to have drinks . Tonight we came for dinner . We had a bad experience with our sever,  Irineo . He would talk to us but was always looking away , was in a rush to take our order .  But our busser Jaime was very attentive to us . Brought us water , was always around to see if we needed something . While our server was sitting down at a table. Which I believe was his friends table . Didn't care to come around at all . My husband and I are also servers so we know how this industry is . I wish we could have more people / servers like Jaime, that's are very humble and care about customer service !

xJfTXQ9prQC1VCBCP5bJGw.text: First timer here. Walking in and getting seated was nice and easy. Luckily we had no wait. We ordered the Tierra y Mar skewers which had chorizo, shrimp, and steak. Definitely recommend it . Our second mini dish was the empanadas. We were a little disappointed with it. It's only one small empanada cut in half. The meat was okay in flavor just wish it contained more than just meat. For drinks we ordered sangria and a raspberry mojito. Over all food was a 4 out of 5. Reason I'm giving only two stars is because the service was not what it should have been. We had to keep waving down our server and our plates were never picked up until about 15 minutes once we waved down one of the hostess.  Also hostess did not seem happy to stop and see what we needed. After wards the person that came to help us and bring us the check was very rude and just dropped the bill off with out saying a word or looking at us. Really wish we could have been treated better . ALSO I mentioned it was my wife's birthday and not once did they even say happy birthday.  REMEMBER customer service makes a huge difference in a persons visit to your business.

3qk5WbjdLIAqO2IkQ4mwyA.text: I really like this restaurant. The environment was pretty relaxed but elegant. The appetizers & drinks were great and price was reasonable.   I suggest if you go with a group of friends (like we did) we just all ordered and did it family style. That way you all can try everything on the menu :)

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Birthday Playhouse bro Lowell. 12/10/14
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Birthday Playhouse bro Lowell. 12/10/14
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Birthday Playhouse bro Lowell. 12/10/14

o9OXM-0fbPtNhooEnc1wCg.text: The food is always great! I love options and it's so easy to be pleased with the many many options on their menu for small bites.  And their sangria really can't be beat. I've gone there for the last 12 years and it's never disappointed.

Ios0rO52S0f0WjzMfFOlUQ.text: I have no idea how many times I have been here but, every visit has been worth it. Always, and I mean always, start with the stuffed dates. The menu variety hits every palette, so you cannot possibly be disappointed.  Shrimp ceviche was amazing. Tuna skewers....amazing.  Tuna tartare.... I believe the word my wife used was "orgasmic"..... nuff said.  Go here.

3JIIZQbYOF_IHOM4utMpFA.text: Hell yes to Bacon Wrapped Dates! Heck yeah to the Beet/Pear/Goat Cheese Salad... AND to the Scallops done Escargot style.  Eh on the Tuna Tartare; a little too stringy for my taste; but yummy to the tarot chips.  Oh! and the Sangria, steeped for 3 days, is fantastic. Little edible pieces of fruit vs the 'here's  half an apple' you find in some pitchers.  Lots more to try, we'll definitely be back!

ZEnXL2kUAHrDrOGMP_33tQ.text: I enjoyed two trips to Firefly while visiting Las Vegas recently for a conference. Our group of three had an especially pleasant experience on a Friday for lunch. Our group of 8 found the restaurant to be surprisingly loud on a Monday night, but maybe that's just Vegas at night. Both times, though, the tapas were yummy and the service good.

MJQ25HTvx2e2lue4cab1CQ.text: Have always enjoyed the food here, and this time was better than I remember!  I love that it's tapas/small plates, all reasonably priced, so I can try several things without being overly stuffed.  Great place to go with a couple friends so you can all share and just try everything!

fSAtPbaZH8THDK8Y0f1PbA.text: I have been a fan of Firefly restaurants for several years now but had never been to the original location on Paradise.  Finally made it (apparently it is now the ONLY location) and I was not disappointed.  The ambience is sexy, the drinks are tasty and potent and this is THE original place for tapas!    Many other restaurants began offering tapas menus following the late 00's economy crash, but nobody does it as well as Firefly!  They offer something for everyone, whether you're a vegetarian or a carnivore, and the food presentation is interesting and unique.    Basically, tapas style is like ordering appetizers.  But these aren't anything close to your traditional "loaded potato skins and chicken fingers" appetizers!  While Firefly does serve more traditional entrees as well, the tapas is where it's at for the ability to sample multiple items.  I can't think of a more fun destination for a night out with a group of friends.  The mojitos and sangria are delicious, as is the food.  And if you are splitting the bill, you can really get a lot of bang for your buck here!

wi4UAfHx3LBligzxb9ZFwQ.text: Edgar Sanchez (manager) knows how to take care of the Las Vegas locals which is rare these days. The suggestions for a combo of flavors was spot on. And our server was fast and efficient.  Definitely return visits are coming, especially for the Sangria.  Mike V SLS Las Vegas

vHxIpTHgNXBK4rMHdCK-Gw.text: Very good! The two $$ is a bit deceiving as it really depends on what you order. Fortunately I loaded up on freebies at the Embassy prior to visiting here so was able to stay in the two $$ range but if I went hungry, it would have easily been in 3 $$$ territory.  Still very good food but parking was a bit of pain.

OkMwJTkqk-6FFtJ3wWXPHw.text: My wedding party ate here after the wedding and this place knocked it out of the park!  The tapa's plates were nothing short of incredible.  Having 12 different people order different plates made it a smorgasbord of incredible diverse tasting foods.  The tuna tartar with sesame was to die for, smoked salmon on tiny bagels was divine.  I don't think a single plate was over $10.  Service was nothing short of exceptional and very patient with our guests that needed help with the tapas philosophy.  Eat here when in Vegas!!!

0zHy3odSQD09EZZ0ieFyRQ.text: Firefly Tapas is the dance experience everyone is talking about at City Hall. Many professional dancers promote Firefly for Latin dancing over the weekend while working downtown around the law offices Monday thru Friday. Friday nights, crowds are invited to dance. Latin Night with fine dining surrounded by art. Last night, our party celebrated downtown at Dinos, Atomic Liquor, but went straight to Firefly Tapas to dine, dance and feel the sophistication of the warm fires burning around us. Firefly had what the other bars lacked - Dining - Eating great food, laughing with cocktails, wine and a menu starting with gazpacho, grilled shrimp ceviche, all with tapas in baked goat cheese, fondue, roasted vegetables with chorizo, asparagus, zucchini, and blue cheese or cream cheese. The scallops baked in garlic butter, the clams served with white wine. At our last party for the night, we were able to relax next to great art or dance with abundant energy. These were experiences we could not have at the other bars we visited Saturday night, well by that time it was Sunday morning; but the champagne was still sparkling next to merguez, lamb spiced sausages, babyback ribs and marinated grilled meat skewers of steak and chicken. Parking in the back or valet.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aq-A-pvQb7wdKTobk18Szg.text: I love this place!  The tapas were delicious! Each was so tasty. We ordered four tapas and shared (there were three of us) it was enough to feed us all! We will definitely visit again and again!

vY50lY4w0lA-oVMiHxf5CA.text: I have been to firefly a few times already. Last night we arrived at about 915pm were seated in less than 5 minutes inside. The pitcher of sparkling sangria was a hit and if you drink enough you get a nice buzz. The lamb chop was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. The civiche de camarones is seasoned to the absolute t. Just the right amount of acid. Definitely recommend this restaurant. You can dress up or dress down either way you fit in. My date enjoyed every dish we selected which made for a nice date. Look forward to returning for another pitcher

CZzeagXwfotFwX5Ex5JSjA.text: Went here during a girlfriend's bachelorette dinner. It came recommended to us from some other friends as a perfect spot for a larger party such as ours, 15 loud girls. The location is definitely NOT strip, the clientele will also let you know you are not on the strip. Once we got over this though and sat down at our table we soon forgot where we were and focused on the expansive small plates menu they had. To be honest, it was a bit overwhelming but our server was happy to walk us through popular items and recommended some great items.  The list has something for everyone and prices that will save lots of cash for drinks, club entrances and whatever else you might spend your money on in vegas.   The decor was lacking a bit in my opinion, and at the time we were there the bathroom was under construction so we had to share time with the guys bathroom (ladies in, guys out, ladies in, etc. . .) it was interesting for sure.  Overall, knowing how good the food is I would go back. It worked out for our large group as well, but if you are looking for a True vegas feel then this isn't going to be your spot.

YbjqqWxj5eVFAl2G4rowfQ.text: Food is amazing, even the bread! Order the shrimp diablo, bacon wrapped dates, chicken & chorizo stuffed mushrooms, and I can't forget the patatas bravas!!! I eat this every time I visit. It's a must each time I'm in Vegas!!!!

XgyDiXlDgmkZ5X2A6thlbw.text: The value for the price we paid was great.  The food is good, maybe slightly above average.    We ordered calamari, eggplant roll ups, mac and cheese, scallops, ham croquetas, salad.    The calamari was good, not greasy, rings and tentacles..sauce was served.  The salad was good, but as I write this, I can't remember what was in it so it was not memorable.  But I do remember that I loved the salad dressing (vinaigrette of some sort).  My husband liked the croquetas, but croquetas are not my favorite thing, I'm not fond of the gooey center.    The scallops had some sort of burnt taste to them.  Kind of reminded me of burnt garlic.  They were cooked well, but ruined by that burnt garlic taste.  Maybe something stuck to the grill and then stuck to the scallops.  I find that inexcusable.    Eggplant roll ups were quite tasty, I wish the portion was larger, or we ordered another plate.  Eggplant with goat cheese, and very little tomato sauce.  Over all good.  The mac and cheese was made with manchego cheese.  I think manchego is best eaten on its own, or with fruit.  I didn't like the mac and cheese, but I think that's my personal taste and not the dish served here.  I like mac and cheese more traditional and creamy.  Again, just an opinion, not a knock against the restaurant.    I'd go back to try other dishes, but I think I'm spoiled with previous experiences at other, authentic Spanish Tapas Restaurants.  For example, Emilio's in Hillside, IL.

J2rj7CN1txJNGjACgrIF3g.text: No words to explain this restaurant. food, environment, and staff are great. we had the Pulpo Asado, ham and cheese croquettes, shrimp a la diabla and tomato and basil soup and a many many cups of water due to a wild night in Las Vegas..

cSZ8gEzvBJigVIbzdeYHBg.text: Great food. Loved the atmosphere. THE SERVICE was fantastic. Highly recommend. The shrip with diablo sauce was amazing. The mussle sauces was good. The clams were very good.

Y78gAEE4C0JPGAc5AFNb9A.text: Wow!!!! Just wow!!!! We got 5 things but 2 were by far the best. The Ceviche of shrimp and steak and mushroom skewers are amazing!!!!! For sure get them or at least one.

BzqHb6qloXRcDDDGjdYmHw.text: FOOD  Artichoke points- very good, light flavor (order) Ribs- tender, but meh (skip) Mushroom toast- puff pasty with a nice sauce, big portion (order) Dates- good (order) Calamari- standard (skip) Shrimp, a la diabla- good sauce, shrimp cooked well (up to you) Tierra y mar- very good cuts of meat, chorizo is quite tasty (order)  ATMOSPHERE  We ate on the patio, which was nice. Good music as well.  SERVICE  We did not wait at all on a Sunday at 9:30pm. There were three waiters buzzing around. Good service. Ribs took 10-15 minutes to prepare.  PRICE  We were a party of 4. Without drinks, including tax, the bill was $73. With tip, we paid $87. That's about $22 per person.  OVERALL  I'll be checking out other places first, but I'll find my way back one day.

nbZydjVcp-JtX0kUXfi_qw.text: I've been there only once, and that was as part of a group luncheon.  But, the food was terrific and the service was even better.  There was a total of six folks in our little group, and everything was so perfect, I picked up the check for everyone.  Few places make THAT kind of favorable impression on me.

z90GpNNdzDCsKy0kcpMqaA.text: I was visiting Las Vegas from LA, and was trying to find a good restaurant that wasn't a severely overpriced hotel "experience" where I would end up paying $50 for a mediocre appetizer.    I found this place from the Yelp reviews and after glancing at their menu thought it looked perfect.  We went on a busy night but we were seated quickly and given plenty of attention from our waiter.    The food was incredible.  Creative combinations and it was fairly enough priced that we could order 6 or 7 different things without feeling the sweat of the final bill.  I didn't have a single dish I didn't think was worthy of coming back for, and as we were on our way out the manager greeted us and asked about our experience.  After telling him exactly how much we enjoyed the food, he invited us to come back tomorrow and try some flights of their new dishes on the house.  Our schedule was already pretty booked, so we thanked him and declined, but the gesture was really nice.  This will be a permanent stop for future Vegas trips, and if they opened one in Los Angeles I would be there in seconds.  Skip the money-trap places surrounding the big hotels, this is way better.

qJzUj87FCTxeOpgQQm2Agw.text: I've been here a few times in there new location and old. The atmosphere is always busy and loud but makes a good environment for fun with friends or even a first date. The central location is great for pre dinner drinks or food before you go out on the strip. The bacon wrapped dates are a must try! I'm also a big fan of Serrano sliders with crispy onions and bleu cheese. Yum! Order firefly fries on the side and you are in food flavor heaven.if you're a seafood fan I recommend the chorizo clams. I've tried most of the menu and everything is very good. Service is always good.

TA1h3ex4yF4knmgCHx1zeQ.text: My wife and I, hosted a small wedding reception in their semi private area.  They handled the event with exceptional service by their staff.    I would recommend the venue for this type of event.  The only downside was that I happened to chop down on an olive.  I expected it to be pitted, and I found it to have a pit.  Unfortunately, my tooth was not receptive.  Firefly handled it in a very responsible and professional manner.    Great time was had by all.

ctVlnukbe-a9OHkUAWbbCQ.text: The new location behind its old location is perfect! Still same spot basically with more room and better service. I love the tapas and the atmosphere and i have been goin to firefly for 6 years now. The food is always great and i leave there full and satisfied. And you get alot for what u pay for. The desserts also are so delicious. Enjoy

9M0yvPAkkc93wmC_YZLhcg.text: Great tapas. Great spot for a date. Had the burger and some chicken tapas and mixed skewers. Delicious.

KoSO9Gk5EJaL_Fod01BuKQ.text: Nice place inside and good food selection but they have the slowest service ever. There were around 20 people in the whole restaurant and our to go lunch order took 40-45 minutes. The excuse was that it got busy all of a sudden, lame. It's Father's Day on a Sunday and I can't imagine how much slower it'll be later on. Another party walked out to the front to pay their bill because they had to go and their service was slow too!
