bvqIa_TFjNmUv2Tn-5-N6A.text: Hands down my FAVORITE restaurant in Vegas.  Love everything about this place - the ambiance, the food, the service - all great.  Give it a try next time you are in Vegas!  You will love it too!

qjCewtGw0dDfOdpA2T7O0Q.text: Love this place! Every time I visit Vegas, I make sure to have dinner here. Huge selection of great food and spirits!! I have been here when it has been packed and when it has been slow and received great service both times.

xY34d6TJdhep2K912WgOYg.text: My favorite place to take people in Vegas. They have something everyone can like, and its a lot of fun ordering a bunch of stuff that everyone can try. Great fun and great food.

Ow9ws0YrPNnXSUZM5pWcMg.text: Excellent service and the food is amazing I come here a few times a month with my girlfriends and it never changes. The atmosphere is great. I always order most if the same food. Stuffed red peppers to the steak and mushroom skewers are all fantastic

MU8Ao2uWGbt9fvYw5s3n3A.text: The star in LAS VEGAS. There is great service, wonderful food, super friendly staff, and a warm, welcoming environment. Try the pitcher of red sangria.

HZqGc2LlywvyIKFnZh8DGA.text: Super good Tapas! I love the rack of lamb, wings, cheese plate just to name a few. Quick friendly service with incredible ambiance. Updated lighting and hoppin bar area!

WnZTpxQfBtau6mDrP2RIMA.text: This is my "go to spot" off the strip each time I visit Vegas. It's rare to find a gem on the strip so why not look outside the strip. This place is marvelous. Their old location was about 500 ft away and that's where it was love at first bites. Tapas style makes it easy to have a variety of flavors and share amongst family and/or friends. There are many choices to choose from that consist of seafood, beef, veggies, and much more. Some of my favorites are the ceviche, stuffed mushrooms, tuna tartare, tomato basil soup, tierra y mar skewers, baby back ribs with mango sauce, the pork chops are a must, and the empanadas with roasted pork are yummy. Whatever fulfills your pleasure, I'm sure you'll find it here with the endless choices. The table set up is the perfect setting that gives you plenty of room to work on multiple plates at once. The atmosphere has a romantic setting for date night during the week. But the beat picks up Thursday through Sunday and the place gets a little loud, but that's what makes this place a great experience. The staff is great, the vibe is trendy, and music sets the tone for a wonderful evening. If you want to avoid the larger crowds, I suggest to visit during day and the food will be just as delicious as it is at night. Also, if you're staying anywhere on the strip, you're a short $8 taxi away from most hotels on the strip. Oh yeah, the drinks are amazing too and you must try the red sangria. I better stop here and leave a few things for you to discover yourself here at Firefly.

Cgf6QijbHm0Izqhg7v3fFQ.text: Firefly is an awesome restaurant. The tapas are incredible. The petite filet was awesome as well as the stuffed peppers, the steak salad, the ham & cheese croquettes, the green bean summer salad and the Nutella dessert!!!! The service was incredible. AqPW1MVOkcsjgZPcW_lIxw.text: This place is awesome. The food, the ambiance, everything. I would definitely recommend the Chorizo and Clams - so much flavor! My boyfriend and I had fun picking different dishes. They have a very large menu but everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Firefly is my new favorite restaurant!

ZAn_6lXWKUsdXwNbXT3z2A.text: Food was great!  Stuffed dates have changed my life!  Service was a little sad.  I had pre arranged a set menu, the wait staff did not seem to be aware of the arrangement.  They rarely came to the table to check on us, we had to track them down for refills and we had to ask for things multiple times.

76pGk-EbU36ycNC0FEIxwQ.text: Needed a late evening light meal after getting to Vegas. Found that Firefly was near my hotel, which is near the Convention Center. The food was very good as well as the service.

gN7gOVQiiLCevH9k1kVy5A.text: I go here every time I come to Vegas. It's a great local spot without all the annoying drunk tourists. Unbelievable service and food.   I highly recommend the stuffed dates. Sweet dates stuffed with Bleu cheese and wrapped in bacon.  The shrimp ceviche is amazing. Good portion, too.   Get the clams with chorizo. So good!

Qd6BDvmugAOeTCjbZPFO-Q.text: One word to describe this place is "WOW"!!! Hands down one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.   So Friday night in the City that never sleeps...we are looking for a nice place to go have dinner...we start Yelping and find this place. Best choice ever.   We were at the Venetian so since it's not really on the Strip we took a Taxi...8 minutes later we arrived.  As soon as we walked in...I'm already loving it. The hostess was very nice. She said the waiting time would be about 25 min, but I think we waited less than that.   We seat at our table & wow! It's such a Happy Feel-Good Place! Great ambiance...People dancing. Everyone seemed in a great mood, happy vibes! Feel good music!   Our server Mario was amazing very attentive...also there was another girl that would bring the drinks...my boyfriend had like 5 Iced Teas as soon as the glass was empty she would bring more!   Our food! Yummmm! Everything was delicious! My boyfriend had Tuna Tartare & Roast pork Empanadas and he said they were delicious! Attention Vegetarians! They have a Vegetarian Menu!! :) I had "Crab Cake" & Stuffed Peppers... so delicious!!! We also shared some Firefly Fries...so yummy!   Price: Not expensive at all...for all the delicious food we got (pics attached) we spend $63.27, we also had 2 coffees, 1 Mojito & 1 Iced Tea.  5 Starts for Firefly!  I'm definitely eating there again next time I'm in Vegas.

cJeaNe4Pyj8bgvJ0vFPwgg.text: Customer service is still good but whatever happened to the food quality? Disappointed local here.

hq0SuU2LkR6sPpWEAesloA.text: With so many food options in Vegas, it is really hard to pick a place to eat. If you are looking for a wide variety of tapas and small food portions, then look no further than Firefly. Parking is very easy because the restaurant has its own free private parking lot. I was able to grab a table near the bar fairly quickly and the service was very friendly and accommodating. They have TVs with sports games at the bar section.  Menu: There are so many options that they just make your head spin, but thankfully Yelp highlights were very helpful. Tapas are priced between $6.5 to $13 and you can easily spend more than $40 per person here.  ***  Complimentary Garlic Bread with Honey Almond Butter: Oh wow that butter was really great and it had such an unique flavor. It was so good that I had to ask my waiter about the butter.  [Meat & Poultry Tapas] Steak and Mushroom Skewer (grilled filet, roast garlic cream, red wine reduction - medium rare, $11): Decent steak, but sauce was not super flavorful.  [Meat & Poultry Tapas] Lamb Chops (2 chops, red wine reduction, sauteed lentils and julienne vegetables - medium rare, $12): Meat itself wasn't too shabby, but both lamb chops looked slightly overcooked. Sauce for veggies tasted slightly salty.  [Chilled Tapas] Tuna Tartare (marinated ahi tuna, avocado, sesame dresing, taro chips - $10): Tuna tasted pretty fresh with a slightly spicy kick and smooth texture from avocado. Sauce wasn't too salty and this was the best tapa of the night.  ***  Great place to share food with friends and families in Vegas. You get some hits and misses, but overall I didn't really have horrible tapas here and I had a pretty positive experience here.  P.S. - You get 5% cash back if you sign up for the Yelp Cash Back. I pretty much signed up on the spot via the Yelp app and saved few dollars!

SKShYCILyg47ByOpKqJDUw.text: We love Tapas and found this place one evening when visiting Las Vegas.   The dishes were delicious, unique and tasty.  Perfect for two to four people to share. The service was on point, everyone was attentive to filling water glasses(never got below half full before getting filled again), dirty plates removed quickly, and food brought out in a timely manner.  The entire waitstaff works together to ensure your experience is beyond one you have never had anywhere else.   Drinks were on point as well.  We ended up coming back to Firefly a few days later with another couple because it was a great experience the first time.  We were not disappointed.   Definitely try this place.

If I could have it delivered to Indy I would order right now. The restaurant had a lot of families but some nice little areas you could hide in for a date night. Spanish decorations and a large bar area. From the menu they can happily cater from vegetarians to carnivores to picky eaters.

Especially if you're planning to come here on the weekends because their will be a wait i promise you.  For being in Vegas, the prices here are great!  Every dish here is tapas styled so definitely order to share, a must get is the paella.. absolutely delicious!  If you're debating to try this place, do yourself a favor and make the reservation! DQmC5sFfjAg6m6Vg3_qkhQ.text: This is the best tapas restaurant I've ever been you. You are able to try multiple dishes without getting too stuffed. We made a reservation to go here yet I think you could walk in and still get a table. Atmosphere has this dim red lighting and not too loud. Nice place for a romantic date. Speaking of dates order the dates those were the best things there. The other dishes we great as well. Also not too expensive for about 5 people it's came to $100 and divided with each person not too bad.  Top dishes: the bacon wrapped dates, smoked salmon, petite filet, mushroom baguette, and the chicken empanadas.

rkBgbMShHDCF8Pl4B6rz8A.text: Another great experience, fast service, awesome servicing staff and delicious appetizers. I meet up with friends from out of town today at Firefly. We sat on the patio to enjoyed a smorgasbord of appetizers. We had a pitcher of Sangria because why not, lol, the Wrapped Dates are amazing. We also had the Firefly fries and the dipping sauce is perfect, my favorite are the Smoked Salmon Toast it's just a little peace of heaven with every bite. The Bruschetta with Mushrooms are scrumptious and that sauce is perfectly creamy not to watery or thick, just right. I don't recall the specific names for the appetizers, yet there was one other yummy item we had. It was small squares of potatoes, one or two eggs sunny side up and bacon, there was a hint of hot sauce and it could be a hearty meal all on its own. The Sangria was really refreshing and my water glass was never empty. We spent about 3 hours nibbling and catching up and time few by.   I wish I could have gotten the Server and Runners Names today, but they served our small party on the patio today at 11:30am. I want to thank them for being very attentive at times the service we never had to ask or needed anything else due to them being intuitive with our needs.   Thanks again. I shall visit again for some more Smoked Salmon and Ahi Tuna bites.

zpYgPhxfYCTRiBmhZPAbcw.text: GOOD LUNCH TAPAS  We stopped here for lunch but were not really surprised by the flavors.  They start you off with cold bread and garlic butter, which wasn't really our thing... We're more of a hot-bread people.  FOOD: The "Patatas bravas" (7) were not as spicy as expected yet they had good flavor. We tried the "Camarones a la Diabla" ($11) and they had good taste. The "Stuffed Peppers" was another good selection.  SERVICE: We were disappointed to get our plates at different times, even though we ordered everything at once. When we asked for more tapas, it took an awful lot of time.  Wi-Fi: GOOD! Cell reception with AT&T is awful around here and you'll want to use their Wi-Fi network.  Definitely won't visit again unless I REALLY want some good sangria, which I'm sure it's easy to find within a casino.  #ruizmedina #fireflytapas

3CBKRGQo_9pfmEpv0ZJcIw.text: Had a very nice dinner here.  The presentation of the food on point.  Sat at the bar which was being remodeled and made it hard to hear my server.  Will go back as soon as they are done with the construction.

tEri_SLw66vap4dFg2LyHQ.text: I fell in love with this place...  When driving up, it looked empty and there was only one car in the parking lot.  Then we realized the parking was behind the building...  We walked around still wondering if there were people inside or if we'd be the only ones there for dinner????  We walked in and I'm so happy we did, it was packed.  The vibe was great, the decorations was great, the music was great!  Now let's get to the food.  It is tapas, so it made it great for sharing.  The food was absolutely delish and I will definitely come back again to try more dishes.  If we're weren't so stuffed I could be just kept ordering.  The need empanada and salad we're so, so good.  The ribs just fell off the bone.  The croquettes we're, ok I'm going old school, the bomb dot com!!!  Hahaha. The fries were the beginning of our meal, and my daughter would not let them take the ate until she had the very last fry, so in saying that...  They were pretty darn good!  Off the strip, well actually, right behind the strip, so prices are decent. The reviews are pretty on point.  Give this place a try when you're in Vegas.  You won't regret it!

CUCgjj5u83tyQmOPZxzVVQ.text: I haven't been here in over 5 years and I'm glad I came. The menu has been updated and almost everything I had was sooooo delicious.  We had the scallops, ahi tuna skewers, heart of palm "crab cakes", roasted veggies, anchovies in toast, firefly fries, grilled octopus and potatoes, the seafood paella, mango sorbet, and chocolate tres leches cakes.  The stars were the ahi tuna skewers )which tasted kinda like steak and had an amazing sauce), the roasted veggies Brussels sprouts, sweet potatoes, and carrots. They had a nice lemony flavor, and the grilled octopus and potatoes.  The fries, scallops, anchovy toast, mango sorbet, and tres leches cake were also very good.  The seafood paella however took the longest and was so over cooked, bland, and mushy that we sent it back.   But everything else was so great. We spent nearly three hours there and had great service the whole time. Will be back.

O7PFBs-Tl_lJC8GITCqy8A.text: The concierge at our hotel recommended this restaurant and it did not disappoint us!!! Very friendly service and the food is so tasty!! We ordered the shrimp tempura, mushrooms, chopped chicken salad, steak and mushroom skewers, and heart of palm crab cakes . . I really enjoyed the chopped chicken salad! All were delicious!!! Prices were reasonable!  Would definitely go back!!!

-DMKPCad6MnycLn_NBgi_w.text: Very good tapas, had the white Sangria Pitcher which was delicious with a good kick. Our waitress was very knowledgeable on the menu which made our experience an easier one. We sat in the outside patio which was ok. Overall good experience do see myself going back.

ld6CXBxjcv3l5E1DYKCBXA.text: I cannot believe that I have not left a review for Firefly yet! I have been coming to Firefly for over 6 years now and always have a great experience. The food, the ambiance, and the service are consistently excellent! This is the restaurant I always recommend for people new to Vegas, and so far everyone has thanked me for this recommendation.  As for what to order...I always get a pitcher of red sangria, to share of course. They start you off with complimentary bread and sweet almond butter, which surpasses any other buttery spread I've had. Most of the menu is tapas style which makes the meal even more enjoyable because it is possible to have a little taste of everything if you want. My absolute favorite dishes are the artichoke toasts and the vegan "crab cakes." YES, they are VEGAN FRIENDLY here! Lately, I've been getting their veggie paella. It's delicious, huge, and contains the most perfectly cooked artichokes within it. Back when I did eat meat, their stuffed dates, sliders, and fish sticks were my top picks. For dessert, you can't go wrong with the Nutella sandwiches or chocolate cherry bread pudding.  Do yourself a favor, and give Firefly a try if you haven't yet. You can thank me later!

eC2RmjKJSc5CyowdpfBO8A.text: This place gets a big thumbs up from me! A great place to share food with a group of friends. Just to name a few, we got the bacon wrapped dates, tuna tartare, mac & cheese, and more! The tuna tartare came with taro chips, which were very light and complimented the raw tuna perfectly. I was hesitant about trying the bacon wrapped dates, but it was one of my favorite dishes of the night. The saltiness from the bacon paired well with the sweet juicy dates. Firefly is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!!

Zum8YClWNpYp26sYM2tWsg.text: I came here for dinner on a date. I have to say, Firefly have crazy good food, excellent service, awesome alcoholic beverage. One of the best in Vegas, and we've eaten at what were claimed to be the best.

tgK3YRVhKufk2h2wvOAPwQ.text: I really like this place and have been dozens of times. Happy hour is good but limited, wish they would add more items or switch them occasionally.   I love the  Apple and cheese salad Ribs Chicken skewer  And many other things. All small plates (tapas) so ideal to get 2-3 things and maybe share few things.   Don't get the fries, they're SO bad! How can you make world class tapas but serve terrible French fries is just silly to me. I guarantee almost 50% of the fries get thrown in the garbage, the owner should be ashamed they haven't been removed or fixed.   Great service almost all of the time, rarely been unhappy with they. I have brought groups of 10+ without reservation a few times and got seated and served reasonably quick.   I'll be back for sure.

F5TYyzg9aYUB0qLEM_6mCg.text: Love the small plates and lively atmosphere. Wait staff attentive and professional. Tasty,  great variety. Had the short ribs.. delicious... the potatoes average... meatballs good.... salad was a good change from meats... avocado toast.. meh.... chocolate tres leche cake..yes!  Would try again.

dr8aLlL8piaOP4ncxOOnqg.text: I went to Firefly for my best friend's birthday the other day and I have to say the food and cocktails were really top notch. I ordered the scallop "escargot" and the tomato basil soup paired with a grilled cheese sandwich and both were excellent.   The only unfortunate thing is that this place is super pricey and since they are small plates you can easily spend an arm and a leg here.

ZdT9pZGizXWgQ8Ofxrh1uQ.text: Well worth the drive!! Each dish was better than the last and service was great. Endless choices for yummy shareable plates. Fantastic drinks selection as well! Only negative is parking (or lack thereof when it gets busy)

sWXT-O46RlUDhQWguiL7pA.text: Great food great value. Would go again for sure. Oh and get the dates. Prob a couple orders, just saying. Also we did a big group dinner here and the deal they gave us was amazing and were very accommodating.

zS-eeZ2OgD03S1PArnkTVA.text: I picked Firefly while on a visit to Vegas because of the reviews here, and it did not disappoint. Here's what we had:  Tuna tartare: perfectly seasoned, great ratio of tuna to avocado, nice portion size.   Green salad: Fresh, crunchy, fantastic dressing  Meatballs: Flavorful, rich but not too heavy  Chicken skewers: moist, and tasty. I wouldn't go out of my way to get this since it's not special in any way, but it was far from bad.   Petite filet: Our favorite! High quality piece of meat with just enough sauce to bring out the exquisite flavor. The mushrooms, fried onions, and potatoes were perfect accompaniments. Really delicious.   Service was prompt and friendly. Really great experience.

ESgI0baQBqsvmIM4YQLIFQ.text: The food and drinks were very tasty and refreshing. The environment was upbeat and friendly but the music a little too loud for socializing if your with a group of friends or a date. Most of the staff seemed attentive and friendly but some no so much, unfortunate one of the not so much was my server, but I would give this place a second chance.

lCC9XwdU21X-eRK1VhwNdA.text: I ended at this restaurant because the staff at Tacos and Beer were complete pricks. I am glad I came to this place. I tried the camarones a la diabla and shrimp tempura tapas and they were delicious. The a la diabla shrimp were the best. I also had a mojito. The staff, especially the host, was friendly and professional.   Great place!

gkhbzsL1DWM5ZcwVpe8mFQ.text: Very nice Tapas place! We (5 of us) were there for happy hour and got a pitcher of Sangria an a bunch of the happy hour tapas. The pitcher only cost $18 and there was enough for all 5 plus refills for two people. I would highly recommend the stuffed dates, very amazing.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fn6c-dz5cMRiCTh156EyPA.text: In town for a conference. This was a short distance from the hotel. The best tapas ever!!stuffed dates. Croquettes, empanadas. It just got better and better.  Out waiter Mario was attentive and helpful. We may have eat there again tomorrow!

82jyiYByot5fi-_xOEC3Ig.text: Firefly was delicious! Usually tapas are a no-go for guys, but my boyfriend seemed to like this place. The portions are fairly generous if each person orders about 2 plates each to share. Here's what was memorable:  Bacon Wrapped Dates: Salty, sweet, juicy and the crunch of the almond inside the date. This was delicious. I could've eaten more of these.  Tuna Tartare: A nice cold dish to contrast with the other things we got. The tuna was in generous chunks and the taro chips were light and crunchy.  Pulpo Asado: Tender octopus. Not overcooked. Full of flavor from the ingredients cooked with it.   Scallop Escargot: Think of how escargot (snails) are usually served, but with scallops instead. So they're soft without the chew usually expected with escargot. Generously sauced with butter and herbs, it was easy to want to use the complimentary bread to sop up the sauce that remained with these scallops.  Mushroom Tart: This was unexpected, but it's mouth-watering. I thought this might be dry because of the puff pastry, but surprisingly, they were generous with the sauce/mushrooms so it's not savory.   Making reservations on a Saturday night is a smart move and highly recommended.

d57IFCO0T_jqeaM5Ju136w.text: Yummy food, great ambiance, terrific service. I will be back!  Loved all dishes, but the apple manchego salad is DA BOMB!

_oVTVtuS64uo6poAYyLMPg.text: I really love the paella and sangria, the place it's a little bit noisy but good... and decoration it's

LYXW3GMCIAAlYEcB031zjw.text: Yes.  This place restored my excitement for Vegas.  I don't gamble.  I don't care for strippers.  I don't care to drink free booze until I black out and wake up with a face tattoo in Thailand.  I just enjoy good food and people.  Wanted to stay off the strip to avoid all the meaninglessness so walked to this tapas place near my hotel. Bellied up to the bar... group to my right were bartenders and waitresses from the strip on their day off, laughing out loud and having a great time .  Guy at my left was a chef grabbing some food before heading to work.  Bam.  You know you got a solid place.  Everything I had was amazing (Stuffed dates, pork empanada, eggplant cannelloni, petite filet).  Bartenders on their game and very attentive.  Just a great place, bottom line.  My new favorite place in Vegas.

ypq6g0UgZ-sMy776TZWbfw.text: [note: if i could give 2.5 stars, i would. alas.]  pros: great ambiance, lovely outdoor patio, good service, relatively inexpensive, free valet  cons: the food. bleh. my sister and i ordered the chicken skewers, spicy beef salad, summer veggies, and patatas bravas. everything was bland and flavorless except the potatoes, which were so spicy they were practically inedible. the spicy beef salad supposedly contained filet mignon but the beef was grey, dry, and chewy. it was also topped with a dumptruck full of crunchy wonton crisps that were all stuck in the thick, gloopy dressing so i couldn't just push them aside. i was pretty annoyed bc these weren't listed anywhere in the description on the menu. i have special dietary requirements and if i had known they were on the dish i would have made sure to order it without. i wound up sending this dish back. (our waiter did take it off the bill without me specifically having to ask though, which is always appreciated.)  service: 5/5 ambiance: 4/5 (it was just a skooch too dark and i needed my phone flashlight to read the menu like an old lady.) food: 1/5  if you're looking for delicious tapas in Vegas i'd recommend Jaleo over Firefly. yes, it's significantly more expensive, but the food is light-years better in quality.

qZ9jt_mgxh81JPCmHp_UqA.text: Got the Mac and cheese which was delicious and filling. This place has small appetizers and off the strip in Vegas. Don't get the chorizo mushrooms too tiny. Overall good outdoor patio and vibe

RkuaUdiVKpgaXABXGXFj3A.text: The place is great, the music is great, prices are great. We came here last night around 11:00pm and everything was good until we ordered the paella. It had lots of hairs, long hairs in it.... we we're pretty full, but we could've eaten more. We sent it back, however the manager came to our table and said: "Just so you know, I'm going to take it off the check but back in the kitchen no one could've drop a hair there" she didn't apologize, in the contrary, she insinuated that we, as customers, put the hairs on it. We thought it was very offensive. We were ordering lots of drinks and by that time we ordered a bottle of wine... We were there to eat well, spend money and have a good time and it was just offensive to hear that. Even if we could've been "those" type of customers, she should've just apologized. Very disrespectful. Our server was really nice and came back and apologized for everything, which was the only thing we wanted to hear.

DpGu51oOqk6U8gLPeeTFBg.text: This was a great choice to dine. The food is great and the staff is attentive and very pleasant. They have really good selections on the menu I don't get back home in Memphis.   The atmosphere and music really enjoyable. I would give it 5 except for noise from patrons; some at the bar are extremely loud and practically screaming. Otherwise, I love this place.

I specifically specified chicken and he brought me pork and tried to deny it. Thankfully he brought out another. The food was very good, but I was not happy at all with my experience here.

WFsaXR7OksZk8yWCbrlORA.text: Neo and the entire firefly team made our wedding reception absolutely amazing. Food and drinks were delicious , service was top notch  we had reserved the private room and they assisted my bridesmaids with set up and were more than flexible . We ordered the three course meal and everything from cheese platters, filet Mignon , paella was perfect . Prices super affordable ! We live in Texas but def want to come back to eat at firefly again

HjYhCo_M6tdrTHU9Wcc4ew.text: Visited this place without a reservation, upon arrival the wait was estimated 1 hour for table for two. It was a Saturday and prime time for dinner. We got lucky and found a spot at the bar. Our server was super cute, and sweet. The pitcher of sangria is huge, wasn't able to finish it, which is not a complaint by any means lol. Tuna tartar is fucking amazing, great quality. Ham & Cheese Croquetas were crispy on outside and super cheesy and delicious. Calamari was cooked to perfection. The Tierra y Mar skewers:shrimp, steak, sausage was filing and great flavor. Apple and manchego salad was refreshing, but not my favorite. We ordered the stuffed dates to finish, so damn rich in flavor and delicious. Service was quick sitting at the bar. My only complaint is their restroom situation, it's located through the kitchen and it was super confusing I just decided to hold it. Would dine here again, so much more to sample.

XJDkPKQ6wggATEznMQPW1w.text: Meh. Not memorable or remarkable. Missed its mark on the service. I felt that our server didn't even want to wait on us. All of our food we ordered came out at the exact same time except for one hot dish. Will not be coming back or recommending anyone to go here. Save your money and go elsewhere. Very cold welcoming and basically set the tone for the entire evening where I just wanted to pack my mediocre tapas and just leave even though I wasn't full or satisfied.

i5gRt5K0jdMs94sf-g4Obw.text: Just went for our 5th meal here! Still loving it! We ordered 11 dishes, 2 beers & 6 cocktails for four people. We were all stuffed and happy. The. I'll was $175 before tip.  Try the New Girl cocktail!!!  Blood orange mojito, amazing  Fly-tai, mmmmmm Bread and butter, loved it Calamari, crispy and delicious Fish sticks, a touch over done but tasty Tomato bread, interesting... A bit soggy Papas, OMG soooo good! And spicy! Tortillas a la espanola, a bland waste of money  Overall, we REALLY enjoyed our meal here. The atmosphere is very pleasant (although the tables for two are far too close together. I did not enjoy listening to every word of the other people's conversations) the service was fantastic until we asked for our check so we could get to our show and the waitresses disappeared for a while. I will definitely be coming back soon to try some more dishes!!!

w5vVLxkSviFYk6MzAbbx8g.text: We decided to go here with our party of 9 people for dinner on a Saturday night and I am so glad we did!!!! We arrived and had about a 30-minute wait which was fine as we just had cocktails at the bar. I tried the infused vodka on the rocks and it was fantastic!!!! When we were seated we ordered a bunch of small plates. We had the following plates:  Apple & Manchego Salad - Great mixture of crunch and flavor Baked Goat Cheese - AWESOME and so mild in flavor Ceviche of Shrimp - So flavorful Veggies and Lentils  - for lentils that lack flavor this dish was packed with flavor  And then we all kind of ordered more for ourselves to share with our dates and I tasted/ordered the following  Tuna Tartare - So fresh and delicious Manchego Mac 'N' Cheese - WONDERFUL Petite Filet - one of the best filet's I've had!!! Cooked perfectly! Chicken Skewers - Flavored so well!  I have to say everyone in our group/party loved every plate of food! Service was also great. One thing I did like is dishes came out randomly which worked out perfect!  I cannot wait to go back the next time we are in Vegas!!!!

nxFFKkm4EQW9kuLJepv6Cg.text: Maybe they should change the name to phoenix cause this place is reborn.  Its nice to see spot like Firefly bounce back from the whole Salmonella disaster last year. Yes people got sick from the food here, will it happen again? Nope. In fact they have a food safety consultant and its probably the safest place in town to eat.  I've been slacking on checking out the new location but I finally got to stop by a few days ago. The new location is a building over from their original spot but is probably three times the size. Its a large stand alone building with a big patio, massive bar, and plenty of space for diners and large parties. The new spot captures the look and feel of the original Firefly while expanding a little and establishing itself as its own restaurant. Across from the bar is an open kitchen viewing area/bar which should ease some concerns about food handling and safety.  During our visit the service was spot-on. Our server and bussers were on top of refills and had some great recommendations. Keep in mind that the tapas come out in waves not all at once. The food thankfully (unless you had the limited edition Salmonella flavors) is the same. During this last trip we had the mac n cheese, chorizo and chicken stuffed mushrooms, bacon wrapped dates, and chicken skewers. We also had the chicken and mushroom pallela, kind of like a gumbo without the shrimp, this thing can easily feed 3 to 4 people. All of the dishes were as delicious as before and I recommend checking out all of them. I think their raised their prices on the pitchers of mojitos but its still worth it especially if you are stopping by during happy hour.  Its great to see people give Firefly a second chance, and I commend the restaurant on making some substantive changes.

Btdjm0cRMREgsPTCC39EVw.text: As a first time trier at a Spanish Tapas Restaurant, I thought this restaurant was better than I thought! The portions were reasonable, but a bit pricey to me. However, the quality of the food was good! I wasn't much of a fan of the mac and cheese we ordered, but the bacon wrapped dates were so good and I don't usually like dates!  If you order the paella, it takes 40 min, but if you order a bunch of tapas, it won't seem long because the tapas come quick and in the meantime while you eat them, your paella will be ready!  As for service, they really do a good job filling your glass of water and taking away your plates!

Mmxc64Zw_SNvnGbHh83F1A.text: Best service! Drinks are never empty as their very aware of your experience. It is very clean, the servers are very hospitable and has a fun atmosphere. I recommend a pitcher of red sangria!!!! I always get the tres leches cake. No else can make it this good! The bacon wrapped dates are a must!!! I honestly love their new location as it's much roomier and more fun place to visit. Thanks Firefly!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Have to get the red sangria, bacon wrapped dates and tres leches EVERY time!

P3ncFZR81mtnylk_rmyO_A.text: I really enjoyed Firefly. I went for dinner with a co worker and we really enjoyed our meals and the atmosphere.  we got several small plates and all of them were good.

fK-M_YKF0vFwDr51QBCm8w.text: 3rd time in 3 years when I visit vegas.  Always great food and decent service.  Dj and dancing Friday nights on the patio

TDIs4vBBV0cE-qGHdXGNfg.text: Wow! If you are in Vegas, definitely come here.   Hubs and I had an early dinner here on a Saturday and it was amazing! The apple manchego was fresh and light.  Artichoke toasts were good as were the stuffed dates. The weakest thing we had were the scallop 'escargots', they were basically a vehicle for the garlic sauce, but they were still tasty.  Great atmosphere! Friendly service! Come!

bupYliyiW6Dz_JTkOXG9rQ.text: Oh my gosh, SO good! I got the bacon-wrapped dates that everyone was talkin' about and they are orgasmic! I also ordered the shrimp ceviche - yum! The avocados were so fresh. Lastly, the veggie samosa, which was decent, not great. My boyfriend got the filet mignon sliders; I had a bite and they were so tender and juicy! His machego mac and cheese was just alright; that kind of cheese is too mild, in my opinion, for mac and cheese. A very enjoyable out-of-the-ordinary meal for Valentines Day! We had to wait for a table, but that's to be expected given the holiday. Service was pretty good; they were very attentive. I will probably be back!

lxDEemCPMNbzvlrwwKWqtQ.text: I love Firefly! I've been here a few times and I always make sure to eat here anytime I visit Vegas! This place never disappoints! The food is always on point and the atmosphere is phenomenal! Tapas are one of my favorites and they are very well done here. Lots of different options to chose from ranging from veggies to chicken or steak to seafood and just about everything in between! The red sangria is DELICIOUS AND REFRESHING! Can't wait to go back!

UtqooaybRrry6fetjSxHpw.text: Another Vegas favorite! Service, food, drinks, atmosphere, all fantastic! They gave a huge variety of tapas, pick a bunch and share! Also if you use the Open Table app, reservations are worth 100 points!   The champagne sangria is delicious!  Get a pitcher!

uZP0SIAQKPB--3gmsK-Rmg.text: The atmosphere was so fun and the staff were really funny and did a great job. The food was delicious!! So happy that we chose to go here!

ReAX-eP-2qE05LTREDJO2A.text: This place is mostly for locals only and it's off the strip. But any can will take you right away. The quality & taste of food as well as service is excellent and the price it's super cheap. It's Spanish cuisine and mostly tapas so there's plenty to order and taste. Portions are reasonable to sample and share. Try the chorizos, tortilla espanola, figs w bacon. There's plenty cold and hot tapas to choose from. Also try the sangria. At the end of the men you will leave full, happy and without breaking the bank.

MIOtFq5mf0l9rwGUFVmkjg.text: Cool ambiance, and always cute ladies here. Tapas are pretty damn good. I haven't tried one thing that I didn't like yet however haven't came and been really hungry. Ribs bomb, Mushroom puff pastry thing delicious and I don't even like mushrooms. Steak with potatoes and mushrooms good Drinks are solid.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Babyback ribs with mango salsa

CfI9zRriSMhj1JOabExmDg.text: Came for happy hour.  Got the chicken skewers and empanadas. Delicious. Skewers came with asparagus and potatoes. Empanadas came with a small salad.   All felt like enough food for a single meal.  In total $14 before tip.

xAp4J7YRmDPTv8QaGQUkcg.text: THINGS I LOVED  Artichoke Toasts: (hearts, aioli, basil, pepper) I couldn't get enough of these. Definitely do yourself a favor and order yourself a handful...for yourself alone lol Very generous chunk of an artichoke heart on a little soft toast. Really thought the use of a non-toasted piece of bread was genius.   Stuffed Dates: (bacon-wrapped, smoked almond, red wine reduction, blue cheese) Like candy for adults that kids would probably enjoy too.  Scallop "Escargots": (scallops baked in garlic-herb butter) Don't be fooled or worried, depending on how you feel about snails, but there are no escargots in this dish. I believe the name comes from the traditional escargot plate it's served in. Either way, it was delicious. That garlic-herb butter, I must have the recipe. Very balanced, not overly buttery and a beautiful blend of herbs.   THINGS I LIKED  Baby-back Ribs: (mango BBQ sauce) These ribs are better the next day. Either I coincidently picked the one rib that wasn't off-the-bone tender that night or something else but I thought the flavor was subdued. Not the next day, full of flavor. (Maybe I had so much to eat that my tongue got flavor profile overload?)  Paellea Mixed/Seafood: (shrimp, mussels, clams, calamari, chicken or tilapia, chorizo, and vegetables) We ordered both the mixed and seafood. Only difference is the chicken or tilapia. Honestly, I don't think you'll even notice because it's not like they give you large portions of either meat choice but the paella also was not that great when I ate it at the restaurant but the next day it was a recovering hangover's best friend. I will say, it says it feeds 2-4 but that's if you order this and only this. We ordered thirteen different varieties and multiples of each plate so by the time the paella came out, 40 minutes later, we didn't even finish one paella plate and we had a group of 12.   Camarones a la diabla: (shrimp, sweet and spicy sauce, grilled bread) Flavor was good but very strong. I would pair it with rice if I could.  Serrano Sliders: (mini burgers with Serrano ham, cabrales blue cheese, crispy onions) Another good drinking/hangover meal.  Sangria: Flavor and wine-full lol  THINGS I WOULD PASS  Tuna Tartare: (marinated ahi tuna, avocado, sesame dresing, taro chips) The tuna was fresh, I'll give them that, but you'll definitely need to add a little citrus juice to kick up the taste. To me, served as-is, it was on the mellow side with the star of the show being the taro chips. I didn't know you could fry taro root.  Steamed Mussels: (steamed in white wine heirloom tomato, garlic, herb butter with Parmesan crostini) I would definitely pass on this dish. A bit lackluster and the mussels are so small. For almost 10 bucks, it was disappointing.  Ham and Cheese Croquetas: (Serrano ham, manchego cheese, aioli) Filler food. You should order something else with more flavor than waste space in your stomach for I say. They weren't bad, just tasted like potatoes.   Chicken and Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms: my least favorite order. No flavor, all I could taste was mushroom. Boring zzz  Firefly Fries (parmesan, herbs, aioli) So SALTY. Could not eat more than two but other people liked them.

syhXC70BhM2yeQYtM20_0g.text: Oh my GOD the dates!!! OH MY GOD THE DATES!!! If you see your mama slap her! OH MY GOD THE DATES!!!! The stuffed bacon wrapped dates are that good!!!! We came across the place by accident on our trip to Vegas. We were driving by & notice this place. We decided to Yelp to view reviews based on the reviews we decided to give s try. Best decision ever! Our server Gabriel was excellent. He recommended the strawberry mojito a definite must!  Service was superb! If you're in Vegas you must stop in.

Bsxm4XIu1KEaFVA3OkzMKw.text: I have had tapas in a lot of cities and this place did not disappoint! The menu was huge and the food was amazing. Having dinner at Firefly was a great way to spend our first night in Vegas. I would have to say out of all the places we ate in Vegas, it was the best. We will definitely be back next trip!!

It would probably be better to shoot for something else. Our server, Carlos, was excellent. We'll most certainly be dreaming about those dates until we're able to make it back

KGL4oy9rthliwAnhNA21dA.text: Our uber driver recommended and he was right!  This was a great restaurant which my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed!    The camarones diablo was to die for, as was the pork empanadas!  My husband loved the dates wrapped in bacon!  We also enjoyed the sliders-superb, delish!

u0vsojcl0dk6oVz_T44YaQ.text: Firefly is an excellent choice as they have a variety of dishes to choose from and they are fast at serving!  There is something for everyone's taste. Love going with a group of my friends when here on business!

bWup5aM2T0KyAsLRsd0U5Q.text: This was our first time here and we came as a party of 3. We ordered the mixed paella, and it was fantastic! The paella was more than enough for the 3 of us. I also ordered the sangria, and it was very good. The waiters were very attentive and friendly. The customer service was excellent. The atmosphere was nice but there was loud music playing so it was hard to make conversation. Nonetheless, I would highly recommend this restaurant.

qtmLgCRy3xzUpA_sZfbdhA.text: The steak skewers are very rich tasting.  The caramel flan was delicious.   Pricey but an interesting array of flavors that will quench your overall cravings.

9L_YXWj1vfc5Ct9B_nor_Q.text: Went here for happy hour for my husbands birthday.  We sat outside on the patio.  It was a beautiful day.   We got monitors and sangria to drink. Yummy!!!   To eat got a bunch of tapas. The stuffed pepper bacon wrapped dates and steak were amazing. The other ones certainly weren't bad at all. We cannot wait to go back n

Y0kNg7Vzk9VvfG1iDZMr3Q.text: I always order the ceviche whenever I come here, deff my favorite! My fiance is obsessed with the bread they bring to the table while you wait for your food & I second that! Another item  I would say to not hesitate to order is the white sparkling sangria. irdBkmNvyi0I2GGbRUICyg.text: Good is delivered fast. Order as you go. You cant go wrong with any item on this menu. Firefly rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mission accomplished.

D0R_RWUrT2kMt9PYxNnfGg.text: Any time I go to Vegas, I eat at a Firefly location. I am a sucker for tapas and they do a great job at it. The wait staff really made us feel at home and was very patient with a few members of our party being late. The food is amazing, the drinks well stocked and the atmosphere is sheer fun.  Looking forward until the next time.

7V9r1BmoNOuVmtqonILs_g.text: Gross... I saw my server outside smoking and walked straight back into the kitchen... I  Watched him take plates to be served out to the main room without washing... Good food is one thing, bad cleanliness is another.

Z2E_BLl43LRrk8f0Iqa7EA.text: i'm a big fan of firefly I love the food, the cocktails, and the atmosphere. The food here is tapas style so small plates. The prices per plate run from $5 to about $10 dollars each with a few larger priced entrees such as the paella. Their also known for their sangria and I personally recommend the sparkling sangria over the other two.   The atmosphere here would be considered trendy and tends to be on the loud side but as long as you know that going in its no problem. If you go on a friday or saturday night expect service to be a little bit less than stellar because of the sheer number of people in the joint.  Some of their stand out dishes would be the bacon wrapped dates, the ham and cheese croquetas and the manchego mac & cheese.

RlskQvSovSfLhfcWx4N6jA.text: Not as good as I had hoped it would be. Paella tasted like there was far too much tomato paste, and we didn't get one crispy piece of rice.  We would have made our server aware of this, if he had ever come back to our table, besides to ask if we got our bill after we had already paid. It was also a let down that the old scallops were off the menu; new version was not as good. Other apps (dates, stuffed mushrooms, beet/pear salad) were just OK. I've had my fill of Firefly.

V2lzctXOGChC5EktuEybMw.text: Tried this place out with my wife. Seemed nice and I really wanted to like it. Our waiter was absent for the duration of our dining experience. Bread was stale and tough. The blood orange mojito was highly recommended to us so we decided to try it. For $30, I thought it would be savory. Unfortunately, it tasted like some juice mixture I made in high school. It was barely drinkable and tasted like bottom shelf liquor. Not worth the money. The food was just ok, for small plates, could have been better. I just wish the service had been better to reflect the food and create a better experience for us.  Menu is very boring and the ambiance is very pretentious.  This was the last time I visit this place, sad to say we you need to move on...

1V7LlgPXLhmlpW688aBU1Q.text: Arrived when they were opening.  Odd, funky smell from old mop water thankfully dissipated before food arrived.    Bartender spent too much time talking with her boyfriend, so drinks took Way Too Long to be delivered, and we were sitting next to the bar.    Waiter and back waiter were friendly and attentive. Small plates were hit and miss, but I would give it another try.

Ja5gClQPTuQe0IhqViNJ_A.text: Still the place to go. Food & Service at the bar are great! We love the ambience and has nice music. The dates have always been my favorite and my girl loves the scallops. Finish the night with chocolate tres leches!

FttbU-LHloFvR00g6xNzPw.text: Fantastic tapas, great service, delicious drinks and a cool atmosphere. I am definitely coming back here. I would recommend the blueberry as well as the original mojitos. As I said, all the tapas were delicious but the Tierra y mar skewers take the cake. These were my favorite! The salsa verde ties the flavors of the filet, shrimp and chorizo together. I could simply go there and just order these and the mojitos and be a happy camper.

tdOXiT8aM8ocZRPF1iRrHg.text: this place gets really busy, definitely make a reservation before you make the trip to vegas, cant just pop in when you find it on yelp. The quality of the dishes was pretty hit or miss, and since its vegas, everything is overpriced. great place for a big group birthday dinner or something, but it is a bit off the strip and it probably wont live up to your expectations.

TvV3NYfNDl57uvot50QVvQ.text: A friend of mine was in town and I took her here based on the yelp reviews.  It was my first time as well and I had high expectations based on the reviews.  This place did not disappoint!  The food and the drinks were fantastic!  We ordered a pitcher of sangria to split.  So yummy!  I just kept drinking more and more....They have this amazing garlic bread to start, with some sort of sweet butter.  AMAZING!  It was addicting and I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing.  In addition, my friend and I ordered the firefly fries, steak and mushroom skewers, and ham and cheese croquets.  All of the dishes were phenomenal.  They have a lot of different options for tapas and they all sounded so good but we had to stop after 3 since we were getting real full.   The service was also great.  Our server always came by to check on us and our glasses were always filled.  This place looks to be a great place for groups to eat and drink together.  We came around 7:45-8pm and were seated right away.  It wasn't too busy.  However, as the night went on, it seemed to start getting really busy and louder around maybe 9pm with a lot more groups.  Something to keep in mind.  I can't wait to come back here and take my husband so we can try some more tapas (looking forward to trying their paella)...and so I can drink more of that delicious sangria of course ;)

dJnFLFMUTuf6O3o-KaleeA.text: Ate there last night with couple of friends. Food was excellent. The service is excellent. It's a tapas house so everything is a small plates serving. But the serving sizes are just right share with three other people at the table. We got six different entrees they were all good I could particularly liked the shrimp tempura but all entrees were good

mGaF-UXEBkuOKzwkkBeOwA.text: Probably the best food i've had in Vegas in years. Not blazingly authentic in the dishes, but the spirit is good. We were lucky to get sucked in on a dinner with the sales guy and some customers, so a lot higher budget than normal. Still exceptional. Good service, great food.

R3yTV6UFHGeiSkBvim00Sw.text: Food wasn't the best. Decent but not spectacular. Fun lunch with small portions to share. Chicken skewers were flavorless and steak was very rich. Restaurant was real dark, service was slow, but price wasn't too bad.

3AgT45u-DQE97YTday_FnA.text: The chef is amazing, the tapas and drinks are wonderful! Specifically the mango mojito, cucumber martini, chicken empanada, apple and manchego salad, garden variety salad, lambchops, andtomato soup. The dessert platter was great as well!

2aNbA_JpSSnI4PRzZOSgSg.text: We went for a bachelorette party and ordered 6 tapas and ipaella, flan. The best was apple and manchego salad and is a must try cold tapas. Rest all the other tapas which we ordered were really good. Would like to visit again for apple and manchego salad

MtB5kzgst0c6_sVqNfCi4g.text: This place lives up to all the hype. Came here with help from yelpers. On a Tuesday night around 7:30 the place had a decent crowd. Restaurant was full. We could've opted for a table pretty quickly but decided that the bar was where we wanted to be.   Bartenders were pumping out some massive carafes of mojitos and sangrias. We both decided on sangrias (amazzzing)... Not overly sweet. Everything on the menu looks great. Unfortunately we tapped out after 6 dishes. Top pick by far was the bacon wrapped dates but you can't go wrong with anything here.   Ambience is perfect. Great for small or large groups. But if you're coming with a big party be prepared to wait. Service could've been a little more personal but it wasn't bad. That would've made it 5 star otherwise. Thanks yelp for the help,

aBdqmuB82-jFsKymhhwDpg.text: Absolutely delicious all around. I ordered the bacon wrapped stuffed dates, the pork empanadas (came with a little side salad), and the chocolate cherry bread pudding, along with a rose mule to drink. Everything was perfectly prepared, the staff was friendly and the price was very reasonable. If I ever come back to Vegas, I'll be back!

l1gVbe7RprwyFmpa3Qv5NA.text: This was an alright place.  Review is as always only based on the food.  The parking was complimentary.    Bacon wrapped dates: soaked in sauce and hence made the dish soggy.  Bacon was somehow over cooked and yet the dish came out lukewarm.  Empanadas: pretty heavy and salty.  The sauce on the outside is probably unnecessary as the dish is already flavorful.  The empanadas breaking was cooked well.  Serrano ham sliders:  a little salty as the ham itself is already flavorful.  There is a spicy kick that is offset well by the bleu cheese.    Chorizo clams: broth is great.  Still  n the salty side but you get some more bread to dip into the broth.  Worth it to just be able to dip the bread.  This was enough food for two people so not bad  3.5 stars: I probably wouldn't come back often but the price and food was fair and service was pretty good from the waiter

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano sliders

SK7kyhO53DscWrTQblSHsQ.text: The Lamb Chops Were Very GOOD and the Prices are GREAT. Service was Wonderful. Menu has alot to choose from

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chops were Very GOOD prepared to Ordered

SgmYM61td5zmyux2Ze97bg.text: This place was great especially if you want something off the strip but still tasty. I recommend ordering the paella before everything else so that it comes out as you finish with your tapas. The paella was the best that I have had stateside and for $26 we got a steal with the seafood paella. Incredibly cooked and seasoned.  The tuna tartar was amazing, incredibly fresh and if it was just me I would have ordered 2 and would be done with my meal. The scallop escargo, which is basically scallops cooked in the escargo style of heavy butter and garlic was also well done buy I wish the scallops were better.  The music was also great but could be turned up a bit to help drone out the other conversations and because it by itself is very nice.   The best part is that this place isn't too far from the strip, like one mile off las vegas blvd. So it wasn't crowded but still tasted good. We were full but we weren't vegas buffet style full/dying so we could still go get drinks and gamble without the food coma feeling.  We will be back soon.

4-43lREx0y1xzzzZlsZ5uw.text: Great food but bringing out individual plates is hectic when they are busy. They brought out some of the dishes really late even after we kept telling the waiter. But overall the food was delicious (recommend the empanadas)

a5YNOa4IID9CdXSgcTr_pQ.text: We had a dinner for 20 people and the food was absolutely amazing. Everyone in the group raved over our choice.  A must try is the bacon wrapped dates. We had a six course meal served and the timing of everything was perfect.  Great job Firefly, we will be back!!!

Dxr8YwKm1EmA6iUlsPuE3A.text: Food is good server is good except for the hostess's, seems like they don't even know what customer service is. They are very rude. Went there 3 times already and they never welcome you or smiled at you, the last time we were there I had to wait so long to be seated I ask the the lady why they been seating people before us and she can't give me the answer she just told me she didn't know what happened like seriously.

3Xse2k8MtYGQ4nQI6FYfrQ.text: 3.5 stars for food. We had ceviche of shrimp, padron peppers, scallop "escargots", petite filet, seafood paella and banana nutella sandwiches for lunch. Our favorite were the padron peppers and petite filet. My medium-cooked filet was surprisingly prepared to perfection, really tender and juicy. The scallop "escargots" was good as well but the portion sucks. Both ceviche of shrimp and seafood paella were way too sour and tasted bland. The banana nutella sandwiches were OK, looked better than it tasted.  All in all, reasonable price with average food. Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella Sandwiches, ok
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Paella, meh
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite Filet (medium), good

hSBTh7Jh9WWXf9WgX1XVAw.text: My family and I stayed at the Fairfield next door to Firefly and decided to try it since it was walking distance from our hotel. So glad we did! We had the baked goat cheese, the stuffed peppers, the veggie empanada, and the chicken skewers. Everything was delicious. The garlic bread and honey almond butter they serve you before your meal was also delicious! Would definitely return again since there are so many other items we would love to try. The staff were very attentive and kind. Restaurant is very cute inside and very busy for a Tuesday night at 9:00p.

VO-YNtb5P5cUyNWXtOXRTQ.text: I've been to Firefly before, at their smaller location a few years back. We were in town for the weekend for Mr Olympia and to celebrate our post-wedding bachelor/bachelorette so i wanted to come back and try their new larger location.  i made a reservation for Saturday at 8PM and we drove up right at that time. They had our table all ready and set up with no wait time at all. The restaurant is definitely much bigger and nicer than their previous spot.   I absolutely love sangria so naturally, the beau and I ordered a glass each of the red sangria ($7 each). Some of the others in our party ordered the mojitos which I tried as well.  Both drinks were delicious and refreshing!  For food, he and i had the chicago beef bocadillos, chorizo plate and huevos estrellados. i'm a meat eater, give me lots of protein...and all the dishes we had was perfect! i also had a little taste of the dishes my friends ordered which included stuffed dates, chicken skewers, steak & mushroom skewers and baby back ribs. OMG, i was seriously in tapas heaven! the portions are much bigger than what you'd expect too so be prepared to share!  we really wanted to order the paella but knowing it would take a long time to prepare and we had to places to go, we decided not to order it this time.  the service was good, the food delicious, the drinks strong and made to perfection. it was absolutely one of the best dining experiences, especially with good company! Seriously, this is the one of the best places to eat off the strip!

fSLII0lr6wfpkIkaP3hXMQ.text: One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas for food quality... you would not believe the price. The service is amazing, everything our waiter recommended was on point. The food and drinks were brought out faster than our go to breakfast establishment. Don't be deterred when walking by with the noise or appearance, the Back has a quiet area. This place is sensational. Also the mojitos are banging!

a5yFy9EydnWG3H8SatiCCw.text: Yordan was such an amazing bar tender!! Super helpful with new drinks and made the drinks perfectly!!! Come check this place out!! You won't be disappointed!! Awesome food and yordan recommended there stuffed dates!! Outstanding !!! :)

KFDxFKh9YO6rw3ORuI-BfA.text: Great atmosphere, great selection of delicious tapas, nice and attentive staff, affordable prices. Kind of love this place! The eggplant cannelloni was incredible!

Dm4N9fYRAaDEwh1EYdXXVg.text: First experience with Tapa dining and it was delicious! I felt the freshness of the food was excellent and it was cooked to perfection! The aoli served with the fries and empinadas had just the perfect mixture of mayonnaise and garlic. Can't wait to cone back to Vegas for my second experience with Tapa dining!

ElGGbFH6tYEdRxnT8_I4Vg.text: Amazing food and great service!! GLUTEN FREE OPTIONS ARE AMAZING!!!!!! So happy to have found a place in Vegas that has a stellar Celiac friendly menu!!!

atwoDsdMLwoUdFqKdRRJZA.text: Some of the best tapas that I have eaten. Everything we tried flavorful & delicious. The stuffed peppers, the baked goat cheese, the tomato basil soup, the artichoke toast were all perfection. The caramel flan was poetry. Wonderful meal.

csOB_anIaHikNcJg1cky-A.text: We had been thinking of trying out this place for quite a while and we finally went. I could have lived without eating here it was just okay. The food was fine just nothing spectacular, the service was fine as well just nothing impressive overall. It was super loud so it was difficult to converse with our friends. I do recommend trying to bacon wrapped dates if you come here, though. Those were really good but you only get a bite since this place is tapas style. Nothing bad to say about Firefly but just nothing impressive about it. They do have a bar that we did not try anything from so perhaps they have some awesome drinks to make up for the place.

y4qHIjI3NvGmZBrdix2BUA.text: One of my favorite and best restaurant in Vegas.  The shrimp ceviche and bacon wrapped dates are amazing!

qLz2MWza4A-X-eihkP6o7A.text: My husband and I were visiting Las Vegas and decided to try this place. No regrets, food was and drinks were unique and great.  We were initially tuned off by the greeter at the front desk, Katya, she didn't even look at us once while "helping" us.  Very rude. However our bartenders, Jordan and Maria, made up for her bad service.  The two of them were friendly and extremely helpful.  They are both personable and made our visit worth it.  Will definitely be returning to this restaurant!

ieEaG2UIRq2xvaDYhA7Qkw.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant to go to for a good dinner! The food quality is always amazing. surprisingly this place is very affordable, especially if you order many tapas plates to share at the table. The apple salad, filet bites and spicy shrimp are some of my favs paired with their house sangria. The vibe and atmosphere here is always relaxing. Candles lit, red themed, music playing (sometimes a live dj). This is the best vibe in Vegas for dinner/date. The patio is really nice and calmly lit. There's free parking in back or they have free valet. HIGHLY recommend Firefly. Quick and friendly service always!!!!

DM6cUI2awU5F3BGayXCXQQ.text: Probably should be 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't allow 1/2 star.  Should be three $$$ instead of $$ since by the time you order enough tapas to be satisfying, you've probably shelled out $30-$35/person.  Interesting dishes. The almond honey butter was amazing. Tiny portion size for the price - one could easily eat 4 $10 tapas and still be not full. $6-12 for 4-6 morsels of food - the scallop escargot ($11) didn't even come with 6 smallish scallops but 3 smallish scallops cut in halves. The mixed seafood paella ($26) has lots of chicken (every other bite) and maybe two clams and two small mussels and lots of rice and little other discernible ingredients.  Loud and lively attractive scene. Not a place for quiet conversations.  Probably worth trying once but for us experience was somewhat underwhelming primarily due to the the stingy portion size. You can tell the tapas were light on costly ingredients which took away from the dining experience.

E_snvqaGVw92hTIIideZ_Q.text: This was my first time at Firefly while visiting Las Vegas and I will definitely be back. The highlight was the Mixed Paella which had seafood l, chorizo sausage and chicken and it was very flavorful and filling. It was enough for our party of four to share. Keep in mind that everything is served tapa style. We also ordered the Red Sangria which was delicious! We got a pitcher of the Sangria at happy hour which ends at 6pm. Some of the other tapas we had were the Scallops Escargot Style, Bacon Wrapped Dates, Calamari and Empanadas with Pork. I can't complain about anything we ordered. Service was excellent and we even got a free photo post card given to us!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oE9vpxbTUAYXQL-IaGESpw.text: A team favorite! Great for large groups. The food is fast and delicious. There is something for everyone.

VyvGsiablK1SUUsEtRwzAg.text: What a great restaurant! Decided to try it out and so glad we did! Such s great menu! I love the idea of small plates this way you get to try many different things! Their stuffed dates are too die for! The prices are pretty good too! Looking forward to taking a bunch of people and trying more of their yummy dishes!

G1CYIhTEjTiE44_mULcdXg.text: Great recommend Yelpers! Start to finish everything was delish! The restaurant while needing a lot of upgrade was clean and comfortable.  Ordered too much, not so different from most Tapas lovers, but glad we did! Notables are all the empanadas, lychee ceviche, mushroom tart, Moscow Mule, and Old Fashion Bourbon. The cocktails, not surprisingly cost about as much as the food so beware of cocktail choices. Otherwise, Firefly* is definitely a great place!

oaNjRa5DXbDmQB-CQTilGA.text: This was a totally unexpected surprise I happen to use Yelp and read the reviews and I am happy to say that all the reviews made this Experience worthwhile... not only is the food awesome and the menu pretty diverse but the staff is phenomenal I wish I could remember everyone's name.. so I gave it five stars for the food and for the service

Ht1YS00k-zjkOM-q-kPTTA.text: Great place, cool vibe delicious food! I will definitely try this place again. Service was great also!

gwIfeJXbo8gptFWEMfghFg.text: The food is just amazing. We had a party of 20 and the accommodated us last minute. Let me tell you about Ivan our waiter. Such great service and he handled our entire table so fast. We told him our limo was coming in a hour and a half and he responded. Food 5 star. Service 5 star. Drinks 5 star. I'm coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kw2KOjIwKphNy10-5EfORQ.text: Love the food here . We have been planning to come here for so long and we finally got to try it . All the food and drink selections are amazing !  Service was great and we would come back again !

fm1UC69OfkVDxwZ8dJw88w.text: Oh hell yes. Tapas! Tuna tartar, sangria, creative dishes that will give you a taste for real culinary experiences. Broaden your horizons and go here, try 10 things and enjoy the fun atmosphere. Thank me after you've had a great meal. Jim. FrontRangeJim.com

AFzJVnWPbpmrJZYbtTz60g.text: I chose this place for dinner for a bachelorette party, so 8 of us all dolled up came stomping in and had a nice big table. Service was friendly, but not that attentive. We often had to ask for water refills and our server disappeared many times throughout the meal. Needless to say, we all enjoyed ourselves. Food was delicious, and we ordered a ton of different dishes so we could try them all. I do have to say though that about half of our party had stomach issues a few hours later, which I'm chocking up to just eating too many different things. The food was pretty rich too.  Bacon-wrapped stuffed dates: i hate dates, but these were SUPER tasty. Only got about 5 of them per order though  Scallops: I'm also usually not a fan of scallops, but these were cooked perfectly and the polenta underneath complemented the seafood well.  Mussels: Tasty! Good. Not delicious, but not bad.  Chopped chicken salad: Tasty! Good. Not delicious, but not bad :D  Baked tetilla: basically cheese fondue. I looove me some cheese and some fondue, but the cheese had a weird rubbery consistency after a bit  Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms: LOVE! So good. Mmmm  Petite filet: It was kinda rubbery meat. The steak was a disappointment  Meatballs: These were pretty good, I'd order them again  Paella: A couple of the girls in our party had been to Spain before, and they said the paella here was better. Delish!!  For all the food we ordered (we ordered multiples of the above dishes + a few I forgot to mention), dinner only came out to about $30/girl. Awesome!!  They're off the strip so you avoid the wait, the long lines, and the overpriced food. But they're also really easy to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some overcooked fish...
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood paella

c4DYVyIqu_7JPFPxG6rHxQ.text: I haven't been to such a nice restaurant . The food is quick to get to yourtable and the waiters are active, quick to clear the table, the bread and butter keeps coming. Me and my fiancee will continue to show up here . It wasn't to full but the overall service was great. The bar seems like a cool way to head if you like that type of thing. Will return soon

geQe3rkOUjQ3qMD0vQsVuA.text: Everything here is great. I had a fillet of beef dish (small plate) it was perfect. The red sangria was amazing. The bacon wrapped dates were great. The French fries and the apple and manchego salad, and the ribs... better than most places that claim to specialize in ribs. Fall off the bone in a mango BBQ sauce that was not too sweet, just right  Finish with the desert platter...   It's great, one of my new favorite spots

dH1MJnlKsr0clCjRXd9Z2Q.text: Perhaps i ordered poorly... or perhaps I wasn't drinking while eating. Probably the latter... yep definitely the latter.  Best thing I had was the bacon wrapped dates. Also it was enjoyable watching the two couples at the table in front of going to the bathroom every ten seconds... ya know... for stuff.  The rest of the food here was adequate and not worth the price. And as many reviews say... it is extremely loud! Once again due to all the alcohol consumption. It is also very dark... great place to take an ugly date.  The service is great, and I don't really know what else to say about it. Great ambiance minus all the noise. Our reservation was for ten but they let us in at 930 because there was no one in line. A lot of people have said to get a reservation which I suggest... BUT if you want to go earlier you might be able to sneak in... to the bathroom and do blow.  THE VERDICT: Go?! I can only suggest this place who have money to burn. Which i do i burn 1 dollar bills for heat. There is such a VAST variety in vegas (how bout that alliteration?) that if you are there for a weekend you should definitely go to other places, because there are a lot of delish places. oh and to the prostitutes at the table in front of us... make the powder breaks a little less noticeable.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg on top of potato, best dish
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato basil decent

OfTyRa93U95toB1okhvXXA.text: We were driving by trying to find a restaurant n found this one... it was amazing from the appetizers to the main course. Customer service was over a 10 . Very friendly waiters. Will defiantly make it our place to eat everytime we come down from LA.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6jEtVbpFbzpM-L6rvwzvng.text: Garbage place... trying to give it another chance, after the salmonella infestation... and they fail miserably  How can you serve cold fries, frozen stuffed piquillo peppers bland steak skewers and zero service.... Is time to close the curtain Firefly

zAf5fuTPmOgLw4M127-dvg.text: My husband found this place on the whim while we were in Vegas. We took our friends there and had the most amazing meal! All the dishes were bursting with flavor, freshness, and heat! This place isn't on the strip so parking was a breeze. Will be back the next time I'm in town. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. The reception could use some work but I'm judging this place on the food so I would override that mishap. Don't forget to order the paella in advance 'cuz it takes ~40 mins to make. You won't be disappointed.

gCcTVu8NxD6DbY6Rro0BWQ.text: This place is the bomb.   This is the best food to money ratio in Vegas.  I can't recommend it more highly.   In a town with high end food for expense accounts and high rollers this is the real deal for real people.  Excellently prepared food, a great staff,  flipping off the chain flavors!   I'd stay an extra day to eat here again!   Damn!    Get the Bacon Wrapped Dates!

CY4BXdx6jjmREx7utYuwQg.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants in Vegas! Try the camaronnes al ajillo, you will not be disappointed. Prices are very fair for the quality of the food being served. This is not a place to leave stuffed without spending some money. It is rather a place to eat quality food.

M1V9uz8q9q5CpwvZvhCDEw.text: Food was amazing but very small portions.  The night life is very busy here so if your looking for a place to come hang out this is a must

vtORvpY9yiXauJgkBsYjLA.text: Well rounded menu, with many different options. I ventured in for lunch, based on their Yelp reviews and I wasn't disappointed. The portion size was nice, as one dish was plenty for lunch. I ordered the steak and mushroom kabobs...delicious!  This would've a great place to go with a big group. I can only rate the one dish I enjoyed, but I can't wait to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Mushroom Kabobs

eL4CVtPGCyx74jDImw2a8g.text: I have loved this place since I moved to Las Vegas in 2006. Everything I've ever ordered has always been delicious. My favorites are Firefly fries, Firefly fish sticks, Spicy Beef salad, and steak and mushroom skewers. It took me 4 years before I tried the bacon wrapped dates. They are amazing and a must have!! Sangria is the best I've had anywhere. I love all 3 versions: the original, white, and sparkling. For dessert, try the banana Nutella sandwich!  The only downside is that I live in the NW and this location is just too far to visit often. I wish the Sahara location didn't close down. So basically, my only complaint is the location.

R3k6oUm7im6CHtN3zIwY6Q.text: This was my first time at the new location and it was great! We went for a family get-together and although the table was very small for 4 people, we made it work. I always get a pitcher of sangria to share with the table and it's always amazing, definitely recommend the red wine sangria! All of the tapas are amazing, I can't get enough. To top it off, the atmosphere and staff are so accommodating, helpful and very knowledgeable. My husband has a gluten allergy and they were nice enough to spend time explaining ingredients so he was sure not to have an allergic reaction. We are often limited because of his allergy, however he was still able to enjoy several tapas and even dessert. Great new spot, much bigger and so pretty inside!

MEFt6HbX6EVwNU4n61zziA.text: The food was mediocre at best and the service was slow. We had to have a member of our party help the waitress separate the checks so we could get them right. Sangria was good. That was the only upside

AMQUDZQ9VaOoWLVCaQdQug.text: Great Spanish tapas style restaurant. Food was great price atmosphere  and cocktails great also .  Must visit place in Vegas.  I'll definitely  be back. Even on a Monday night.  It had a good vibe.

HWu68JGOiVV6TCkdTTMlqA.text: Great bar with huge liquor selection. He tapas menu is also huge which I live and bow tapas should be. You can order alot of different dishes to try. Prices have gone up and the portions are bigger. Even their dessert menu had plenty options. Disappointing that they early happy hour is only on drinks and not food. Only their late night happy hour includes food.  Lamb chops were good with a nice rub...didn't need the sauce and the sides it came with. The anchovy toast were really good. The lamb sausage sucked! Dry and very gamey, needed more herbs. Tuna tartare was very good. The octopus wasn't as good as the 1st time I had it.
