Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartare
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops

3bQFrjGa_XRC_ozo_z2kUA.text: First time here and I was impressed. Off the strip it is a favorite of the locals and its tapas style dining is a great opportunity for a group to try several of their tasty offerings. Everything we ordered, and it was a large selection, was nicely prepared with this restaurant's own signature highlighted by subtle variations. For a Tuesday night it was unbelievably busy and that is a testament to its ability to tickle the palate.

cbAp8hta9TeO__n4OJo2DA.text: Firefly is an absolute must if you like tapas. Perfect setting for groups, dates, or just flying solo and the food/drinks are out of this world. You can't go wrong here so make sure to check it out!

rZhp71ZpuEx4FiFoXaK9PA.text: Amazing yummy appetizers.. Make sure to order Bacon wrapped dates. The lamp chops and steak were also very tasty. I don't remember the other stuff unfortunately. Our waiter was very nice.

fsiaPpUm8rKeiGx3U_1E8w.text: This is still one of the best places to eat in Vegas. Had like 10 appetizers. Too many to describe individually, but all I can say is that it was all amazing. From the sangria to the food to the dessert. One thing make sure to make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U6garG2X-e3lWYiVBPedNA.text: Went here mid day and ate at the bar. Great friendly& fast service. Tapas were top notch. Truly a gem off the Strip. Will be back next time we are in Vegas.

X1o15IptdcROiKj7uRZ8uQ.text: Like this place a lot. When visiting try to keep it simple. Bacon wrapped dates, albondigas, patatas bravas , etc.  get a pitcher of sangria and enjoy your evening!! They moved down the street from their old location so now there is more room and you don't have to wait for an hour to get a table. Still it's busy, so plan to show up lil early.

rhBb5M1dGdWm34L6kt0mZQ.text: I love tapas in general for variety, but i felt like out of everything we ordered (grilled octopus, tuna tar tar, cod, skewers, crab cakes) it all tasted like the same sauce of some sort so it got boring fast. The drinks were good though! :)

L3K1xJO8DNYKIt7wN8ewcg.text: What can I say bad about my favorite Las Vegas restaurant?   Oh- it is so busy no one goes there anymore.  Seriously, make your reservations in advance.  And it is noisy place, mostly due to the fresh Sangria that hoes down like water on a hot day.

sfCFlb8p2By388nlPlIFGA.text: A lot of fun... Good vibe.  Always a little crowded ... Staff has a lot of energy.  Get off the strip and enjoy firefly.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muscle romesco

rSMffHNGL5zIhiv2ajG5mg.text: We have eaten there a number of times in the past but will never return. Dishes were dirty and a few of the food items were cold including shrimp tempura which I have never had cold. We told the waiter but all he said was ( oh, it's cold ). Never offered to make good on cold items. They also are expensive for the product you and then charge 20 % gratuity for four adults and two children. We will never go back. I can see why the health Dept closed them

bCiJfDYuxKivGKEtAa5dhg.text: I came here with my boyfriend on valentines day, It was pretty busy so good thing he made a reservation.  I had never been to a tapas restaurant before but it was pretty cool. the restaurant inside is very nice and cute, service was great, and food was also very good. We ordered the chicken and mushroom paella to share, and then a handful of small tapas plates. The paella was delicious, it did not look like traditional spanish paella, but it was very good! The tapas plates we ordered were also good, the do seem a bit pricey for such cute tiny plate though.  The only thing i didn't like was our table, it was the half booth on one side and then a chair on the other side, which is fine, but the table (that was for 2 people) was so big i felt like the people next to me could hear our whole conversation because my boyfriend was so far away.  Overall firefly was a great restaurant and i would recommend it. Im sure we will go back.

LGXGfDvpTTjfD-m-zRDLJA.text: i have mixed feelings about spanish tapas places in general but i did have a really enjoyable meal here. my friend and i each had a sangria, red and white, and both were really good, not too sweet, and shared the following:  tuna tartare, roasted eggplant, spicy beef salad, grilled octopus, lamb chops, and empanadas. everything was really good but a lot of them were on the salty side. my favorites were the octopus, which was super super tender, and the tartare, which is almost always my favorite anywhere it's good. this one could have used more avocado, but that's just a personal preference.  one complaint i have about the place that's not really a complaint is that the portion size is huge - the biggest i've ever seen with tapas. it just made me sad because we had to order everything to try it, but couldn't finish everything. as with any tapas, a bigger group is better. regardless i would have liked to see smaller portions at slightly lower prices, though the prices are still really reasonable.  the service was good and the place was just a normal seeming restaurant atmosphere wise. this is only the second tapas place i had tried in vegas and the other was the fancy one in the aria on the strip. this is way better!

hvbLuUzw6IqnhyzcTTV1Zw.text: So many options, but there was only so much room in my stomach to try them all. Had the tuna tartare, stuffed dates, steamed mussels, & the lam chops aka $40. Not too shabby on the pricing.   Before I get into the "imo" of the food, I have to recommend the sangria ($13/pitcher). Probably the best sangria I've had so far. Sangrias tend to either have too much alcohol or just be too fruity, & I don't know how they make it here, but man oh man the balance was just perfecto.   Okay, back to the food. The tuna tartare was okay. My favorite about this plate was the taro chips. Those are some tasty chips. But, I have had better tuna tartare. I am not a dates fan. And although this taste wasn't particularly for me, everyone who enjoys dates in my group loved them. But if you don't like the texture of dates--yeaaaah, don't try this one. The lam chops were okay in my opinion. I've had better lam chops as well. Not sure if it was the texture, the taste, or just both but the sauteed lentils & julienne vegetables were just not doing it for me. The star of all these plates were the mussels. Be warned, this is not a tapas plate. They are very generous in portions with their mussels, but it is nothing to complain about. The sauce just had my taste buds exploding with flavor. This is a must-have for mussel lovers.   I would compare Firefly to Cheesecake Factory, but a more elevated version. I would've been happy with just the mussels & the sangria all night long. For a group of 17, I did expect a bit of better service, but I guess we can't have it all now can we?   Eat on.

DKAvGJsKvZ0xJYITT78vFQ.text: We came here for a very early dinner before we hit up the Strip and it was a great idea because not only was the food amazing, but it was also happy hour. I had a Cherry Moscow Mule and it was nice spin on the drink. It was definitely on the sweeter side which was enjoyable.  If you're looking a pre-party meal, I would suggest this place. I was not full in anyway after the meal, but I knew if I was going to have 21+ later that night, I would still have enough food in my stomach to keep me functional. However, if you're looking to chow down, I wouldn't recommend this place because the portions are fairly small and for three girls, we pretty much cleaned up every plate. For that reason, I would put this place at more of a 3.5.

pVHJJ9O-GpDJI_xPr56OEQ.text: Almost everything we ordered was delicious, and we ordered around 15 tapas. This place is a gem, especially for overpriced food served at big hotels in Las Vegas. I hope Firefly on Paradise will stay True to their quality and continue serving delicious food. Next time we are in LV we will definitely come back with our friends.  The only negative is Citrus Bliss drink ($10) -- they have to improve their cocktails if they expect people to order more of them. This one had very artificial taste, as if they added dry 20 cents mix to it so we just put it aside. In house made white wine sangria was fresh and tasty, but I would prefer it with less ice in a pitcher.  The amazing thing about ordering tapas is that you don't have to commit to a huge meal which can be hit or miss. Instead, you order a lot of different tapas for the table and have fun sampling differed food. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche of shrimp
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Bagels
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly fries

yBV_eGep0lfrAQyPEFY6_w.text: paid lots of money for ok tapas and burnt, dry shrimp on our paella. I also thought it was impossible to screw up a screwdriver but Firefly proved me wrong. Meh. Find something else to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood on paella was close to being burnt and dry.

OldsfYG82oCTfpfs5SeBqg.text: we come frequently to this place, excellent food, environment and the service/atention of Irina is the best. She always is ready for help us and give us an excellent service  Irina you are vey kind and sweet.. mulumesc!

20mY-bD0nK_TYSS7TPFALw.text: My husband and I visited here last night. The entire experience from beginning to end was perfect. The girls at the front desk were polite and helpful, the waitress, other servers and manager were incredibly attentive. Drinks were lush, especially my cocktail. I cant remember the name of it but it had mezcal and kahlua in it. The food was incredible; tasty combinations and huge portions. We shared 7 plates between us, not anticipating the size but demolished the lot. The stuffed dates and the roasted heirloom carrots are a must. The petite filet and the chicken skewers were also awesome. We cannot wait to go back and try more of the menu.

jcsu8PE6WGteAUYSRDGqxg.text: We booked a large party at this venue. They were very accommodating and the food was excellent. The wait staff was very attentive to us. On our way out everyone was complimenting how great the food was, none of us disliked anything that was presented to us. We weren't sure what we were in for but our expectations were define my y surpassed. We really enjoyed the continuous flow of food. They even told us if there was anything we didn't like or wanted more of something they would be glad to swap it out. Really great experience and would definitely revisit them on our next trip to the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very cool vibe in the bar

FF-coPew-WYRwHVIQiVdPw.text: BEST FOOD IN LAS VEGAS?!?! Every plate was full of rich flavors. Made you want to order more and more!

xXUOG_wbq64WFqpjxFluxw.text: Totally stumbled upon this place by accident...And what a fortunate accident it was. The watermelon mojito was refreshing as it was delicious. I was torn on what to order but our server helped with narrowing down the decisions. Pear &-best salad, chorizo plate, and the mushroom pastry were more than enough to satisfy.   The location is close enough to the strip to make it an easy enough venture but far enough away from all the noise and hustle n bustle. Loved the outside patio seating that provided plenty of shade and cooling fans with mist.   I definitely need to come back again...with more friends and a bigger appetite. The dessert menu is calling my name!!

kbYFwyxunBQpmm2i_tAEOQ.text: Been here multiple times, and everytime the service is great, the food is fantastic and the sangria is light, not too sweet, thirst quenching and will get you buzzed. Never. Fails. I've tried multiple items with everything always being so tasty, however I do remember last year when I came I tried the veggie paella and it was not delicious. But again, paella is supposed to have seafood and meat, so that was a lack of judgment on my vegetarian friend who ordered it. So I forgive Firefly for that one and blame my friend. Ok back to last week. I ordered the clams, and it was so tasty my mouth is watering just thinking of it. Steamed to perfection and soaked in a broth with chorizo. Simply amazing. Roasted veggies were also amazing, as well as the pasta bowls. Our table ordered 3 of them and everyone who tasted it was in awe. However, it's alot of pasta; I don't think we even finished 1/2 of each one of the orders. All in all, you can't order wrong here ( Unless you get the veggie paella) and the sangria is one of the best I've ever tasted. This place is always on top of my list to visit when in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate flour less cake
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini cheesecakes

oDHWObKpNtiXIqeV0GOzgQ.text: Tried this on a whim. It was wonderful. We ordered several items and split them. Everything was great with an exception of the fries which were just good. We look forward to going back and exploring even more of the large menu they offer.

9ioKLsZ8Wxoq7W-ue6Y5yA.text: This was a great stop to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.  Great atmosphere and patio was adorable.  There was a great variety of things to choose from. super for sharing and trying new things. The servers and staff were very attentive without being pushy. A great find!

Ud01EQT-oA3ekkFYEGn59Q.text: Jesus was great. The manager was very engaging. All the food was delicious. Party of 11. The girls really liked the pomegranate mojito's. Will go back.

bc_Q9o-_g9MsVXh0ZRUv2Q.text: One of my favorite places! It's tapas so it's a fun small plate to try different things and share. The pomegranate mojitos are my favorite drink, why get a glass when the pitcher is cheaper! The stuffed mushrooms with chorizo are amazing. I also have never liked blue cheese but being stuffed in the dates is a whole new spin and melts in your mouth. The paella is also very delicious with many ingredients but it does take a while to cook so order first. Latin night is always a good experience and can't wait to go back. The almond butter served with bread is unbelievable.

r3kEBi8S3w-GcYSOi2Chxw.text: Love this place   There sangria is to die for  you can't go there and not have sangria it's the best. The infused shots they have are yummy!   I always get the ceviche and there mac and cheese both are super delicious! Everything there is good don't think I've had anything bad!

lEODVWOFPGVX0Nooxy418Q.text: Great restaurant with a variety of hot, cold tapas, beverages and a friendly staff.  We had the chicken empanadas,a little spicy kick, but flakey crust and great sauce.  Shrimp ceviche was fresh and tender, lime marinade and fresh herbs was great.  Grilled spicy octopus was tender and smokey with a little kick of spice - yum..sangrias were ok...

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled spicy octopus
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp ceviche
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken empanadas

kZzxFWuHHZKbF6-u5DpRKw.text: Food is good, but service is kinda a joke. I feel very disappointed for coming back to this place. We sat down for a while before our server approached us and we barely see that person through out rest of the dinner time. We had to ask someone to refill out water and that person never returned back to our table.  One server stood close to us once a while to watch a game that was playing on the tv which located right above my friends head.  Asked for the bill and took forever to get it. I feel like we spent most of our time just waiting around for someone to serve us. We did not enjoy our time at all. I'm very surprised to see this kind of service here. I will not recommend it to my friends and family.  There are many places in Vegas that provides great food with great service. I would not come back to this place again.

IqjgtnvifkbWpBiZlaug3g.text: Mixed paella was very good. Would've been better if a little crisper. Octopus was tender, eggplant with goat cheese excellent but needed more sauce. Overall one of the best tapas places in Vegas.

JSV6MBKNH9U1YfLh2PKOFg.text: I am a little torn on this one. I love tapas because I can never decide between 2 or 3 things, but the price seems a little high! I recommend the Chicago beef bocadillos, stuffed dates, and the apple manchengo salad.   Their sangria and mojito pitchers are the best bang for your buck but are still a little overpriced. One pitcher of sangria is $30. If you have 3 people, I guess that isn't that bad.  Overall, it is a great place to hang out and get some food.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QGW8A3RCvRBFehKuzFvqAA.text: I didn't hear about this place's "storied" history until I had already been here and decided I loved it (for more info, read the 1 star reviews or google it). Lucky me - I may not have ever come otherwise. This review is only for my experiences, which have been top notch.   That being said - this is now just about my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Very reasonable prices, a great selection (i haven't had anything on the menu that i didn't like - and Ive had a lot), and fantastic service.   Highlights:  -Tortilla espanola -Shrimp ceviche -Tierra y mar skewers  Come here with a group that's hopefully not too picky, and try as much on the menu as you can until you can't eat anymore. The waiters are very happy to help you through this process and make suggestions for you too.   Cool atmosphere and an extensive beer and wine selection on top of all that. Tapas + Rioja + sobremesas = happy Kurt G.   Also - the bathroom smells like Sweetarts. Not sure how i feel about that yet, but thought it deserved mentioning.

LNXnNVEbWLnmZpbr_DY5aQ.text: Let me start by saying Pepe, my waiter is the best waiter I've ever had in my life. No kidding. This place was already a favorite of my mine just because of the food but the service was amazing tonight.  Pepe kept my glass full, ensured there were no food allergies, really just went the extra mile. Hands down great service. He said he inly serves on Friday nights. .. not sure why though because he's great at what he does. I'll def be requesting his section going forward.   Food is delicious. Worth the wait every time to enjoy this great food. Red sangria is my favorite, order by the pitcher, it's a better deal and ur going to want a few glasses!   Thank you Firefly for great service with Pepe and delicious food!

ytdiGvuEYUVgJBimXrgU0Q.text: Always great. I've been going here for years and while the atmosphere has improved... the service and food is still great. Love, love, love this place. And the Rib-Eye is fanominal.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly fries. Dip &#39;em.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hidden gem. Discovered a few years back, there no going back. 14oz Rib Eye with blue cheese and firefly fries. No chance at desert.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant canolli stuffed with goat cheese. Always excellent.

I1w287e4DEDcGmSQWLBxww.text: Loved it!  We were a party of 4 (business co workers).    Seated quickly and attentive service  Food was very good.  Believe there were 12 different dishes between the 4 of us and all were good  Definitely recommend the dates and tuna

YHp6DS7ilp6huOEkJ_Yazw.text: I like Firefly regardless of their 2013 Salmonella outbreak. Yes that was horrible, but it's been 2 years. Plus, this is a brand new restaurant and it's time to get over that.  Some friends and I came for dinner one night before seeing a show. We ordered a pitcher of red sangria, which was delicious. It has fresh cut up fruit and brandy, yum yum. It's safe to say I had a nice buzz going on after a couple drinks. Firefly is all tapas, or small plates. These are good for sharing which is why I like going with a group. My favorite thing on the menu is the stuffed dates. They are wrapped in bacon, and stuffed with blue cheese. Fun fact, I don't even like blue cheese, but the combination of these things is AMAZING. Do get these, and thank me later.   To be honest, I can't remember too much else because that brandy got ya girl feeling randy, or something like that. LoL. If you haven't done so, give this place a shot, I think you will be pleasantly surprised.

A62ZL1fvo3VD6CSG01T0pA.text: Been here twice, once a year for annual company dinner. We got package that they prepared.. food is absolutely yummy. The place is packed, I think maybe planning ahead to this place is a better bet. They have bar as well. I completely forgot to take the pictures of the food coz I was so so hungry, but nevertheless this place is worth to try.

v3QPbmjeAQZdf9_H-36-FA.text: Firefly is a good Tapas restaurant.  The restaurant is quite large, so it's not too difficult to get a reservation.  Also, the service was fast enough, and the food was enjoyable.  There was nothing that blew me or Mr. Riches out of the water, but it was a good Tapas meal.  This is more a spanish tapas restaurant.  We went with a large group, so were able to try quite a few dishes.  The stand out for me was the diablo shrimp. Out of all the dishes, it was definitely the best!  If you are in Las Vegas, and want to venture slightly off the strip for some reasonably priced good food, give firefly a try!

-Q-QPGCSlH9RHBGx9bBHLg.text: Hype wasn't real.   The food here is supposed to be Spanish (fusion) but a lot more like American. I tried several dishes and they were all just ok... Nothing stood out. The sangria was grossly watered down.   You would enjoy coming here with a large party for drinking purpose because it's more like a quantity over quality place.   If you are looking for real Spanish tapas in LV, Jaleo at Cosmopolitan is the better option. Don't be fooled by the stars on Yelp.....They are fake anyway.

0qpfTThpviaNiBTOqyoRNg.text: I wish I could give this 6 stars. Everything was incredible. The complimentary bread and butter was enough to swoon over. Then my waiter alejando  was so attentive and made sure my moji tos never ran out. Mac and cheese was great, veggie empanada was better, skewers were delicious. Watermelon is better than mango. Amazing dinner!

3IDVYGrUfv3zUAAQN1lL9Q.text: My favorite Vegas brunch joint!! Everything is soooo good! The paella is to die for!!

FTwe_pbxia8ggpZosPcSig.text: After 30 minutes waiting we decided to take one of the bar tables and keep ourselves busy until the 45 mins to 1 hr waiting was over and we could get a table. We were 4 bar tall tables with 2 chairs each. 2 of us took the chairs and 2 were standing. Before we could order drinks someone came and told us we can't take that table without ordering and it's not our turn yet! There were 3 other empty small bar tables! For a Monday night we decided it was not worth the wait in a place where we couldn't even get a drink when waiting and left.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy busy on a Sunday night!

ano8VdmuPFzfxXBjjfcqaA.text: Firefly was awesome all the food we ordered was delicious. Each dish served had its own authentic taste, every bite was superb and for the price it was off the charts. Wish we had one of these in Hawaii, I'm glad it was the last meal I had in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon with sauce
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango guava bbq ribs

XgmKb3TUFzmE1Inw61F9mQ.text: We made a reservation for my first time here. Arrived 5 min before reservation and was seated 5 min after reservation time. We ordered the fried calamari, Chicago beef bocadillos, and the mixed paella. The bocadillos were okay, too salty for my taste. The paella was delicious! The rice was cooked perfectly, and I loved the flavor of the dish. The service was excellent. Had refills before I could even ask! I really appreciated the attentiveness and friendliness of all the servers. Only downside was that the atmosphere was very loud with the music, and it can sometimes be hard to hear.

mUp__RU-N1sLRQidOnIUcg.text: So this is their new location, the other one on Paradise got closed down because their food had salmonella.   The new location looks fabolous!! its really nice and intimate inside and the bar is really pretty. We went here for a birthday party and they served the red sangria, omg to die for. Really good and lots of fruits. They also served artichoke hearts on sourdough bread really good. Bacon wrapped dates omg this is the best thing i ever tried. So yuumy. they also order the beef kabobs, the meat was really tender and not chewy. For dessert we had the tres leches chocoalate cake. OMG OMG!! seriously..First time i ever had a tres leches cake and omg i freaking love it. You have to try it.   The waiters were really good on making sure my water was full and to take the dirty dishes away. Really good service and i would deff recommend this place.   Lets just hope they don't close down again.   FYI the Firefly in Anthem is closing because they got a C grade. YIKES!

jOEVKzAkSgaG9KzUpA6Lbw.text: I hate when I get a recommendation from Yelp for a good restaurant and it's actually bad. No flavor, nothing I ordered was good. Ugh!

OdsqjTVr3WnJebORmsM_lg.text: My favorite tapas restaurant! I always have to go here when I am in Vegas. Food is amazing! Here are my favorites in order: - Stuffed Dates - Manchego Mac & Cheese - Tierra y Mar skewers - Scallops Escargot - Stuffed Peppers - Pork Empanada - Mixed Paella (although this is a hit or miss because sometimes it is too salty.. ask for lemons) - Baked Goat Cheese  Sangria are better than the Mojitos here. Get a pitcher!

1nI_dW1NLlk1EPsuq33BFQ.text: This place is great. The service was fantastic. we came with a large group for one of my friends birthdays and they gave a round of shots. We also did the bottomless mimosas and they have a dude playing the guitar and it is great. The atmosphere is fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The brunch menu.

AaCu9_iIWLLB0YQCh6rIoQ.text: This place has probably one of the best mojitos in town. I am not a big fan of cocktail drinks but I constantly crave their mojitos here. Especially during the summer time. The strawberry one is really good. Food here is pretty good too. The portion sizes are not really that big considering their prices. I do like their complimentary bread and butter. Sometimes they do "forget" to serve it so make sure you ask for it. I love their fries. The menu has a pretty good selection of tapas. Not a lot of entrees though. I honestly haven't tried anything from here that I did not like. I just wish that their portions were bigger or the prices were a little lower. Try this place. And do not forget to try any of their mojitos. Outside seating during the summer time isn't bad either because they have mists to keep you cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry mojito.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread and butter.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant with goat cheese.

2oQPKjwS4w1Y9OmX4qB32w.text: This was as good as the best reviews here. No disappointment ,everything was perfect. We had the bacon wrapped dates, superb, the baked goat cheese, couldn't get enough. The fish sticks, wow. Sangria cool refreshing and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7EpmvhgiZL50m7ZBv-fPzQ.text: Can I just say this is my absolute favorite place! I recommend it to anyone and everyone! The red sangria is life along with their happy hour! From 11pm-2am Monday- Thursday and Fridays they have Latin night!! Definitely recommend!

rGgRbqf_ybFlFSHj95rgcw.text: This place is great! Fast, delicious and good service   Highly recommend the sangria, albondigas, boquerones, and stuffed figs.   Empanada was good.   Tuna tartare was okay, as well as the gelato.

00gQ4KOG7vYOgQiTs4yClg.text: I did most of the happy hour menu there with my mom, I think happy hour is from 3 to 6 Mon-Thursday. Everything was $4 to $5 on happy hour menu. The shredded apple salad was delish! Veggie Empanadas were crispy and yummy. The complimentary bread looked amazing, but I am watching my carb intake. The sauces were were flavorful. Overall I would recommend this place!

do3CLFpBtrCyd9gK7oDeRA.text: The food was great and was really surprised how flavorful and fresh all the food was.Im a picky guy and was quite hesitant to try this place out.When we arrive our car was parked quickly by valet and we were seated promptly.My girlfriend and I enjoyed everything about the mean except out waiter was training a new guy and never really came around,however we were fortunate enough to get a great busser who picked up all of the servers slack while he was flirting with his coworkers. We'll go back for sure and I look forward to trying more from their menu.I do recommend this place most certainly and had it not been for the waiter making his shift his personal social hour this would be a 5 star review.

LnPRYOpp3MhbB6-hl_0snA.text: Food was just okay, service was lacking (only saw our server 3 times), we ordered hot appetizers and most came out cold or luke warm at best, the sangria was very lacking and had maybe a tablespoon of fruits to compliment the drink, and finally the mixed paella the dish that can make or break whether a True Spanish restaurant is good and it came out burnt and the flavor was lacking all the foods flavor in fact was just okay, we walked away disappointed.

MhphNn2vQdgi-_zT-OU1ZQ.text: Food was very average here. The ambience is good. The Tapas were good, the rice wasn't that great. I enjoyed coming here one time.

ynL8rJgimZuYv6vAK6PS4w.text: Really great restaurant off the strip. Diverse menu, tons of flavor, reasonably priced. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

xDCpq2esum0Xk9DnTXON_g.text: I am going to be thinking about the meal we had here for awhile and crying because there is not one near my house. Flavors were amazing. We ordered about 12 dishes and all were so good. Food came out fast and staff was great.   SO FREAKING GOOD!!!

6mrQNWSau1pr8wSth_c-Bw.text: TAPAS, amazing, just simply fantastic, delicious, so many to choose from tapas. The stuffed dates wrapped in bacon were the most spectacular, delicious thing ever, camarones a la diabla oh my word. Just simply delightful, we were embarrassed we kept wanting to dip the bread in the sauce, it was the perfect amount of sweetness and perfect kick of spice, the most wonderful shrimp a la diabla. The Chicken and mushroom paella is new, different, but a very well made, and delicious paella, never tried anything like it, very tasty and flavorful. We pigged out here, literally, we had 4 tapas, anything you choose will be amazing, plus paella, and Sangria. I am definitely planning on coming back here, most definitely, our waitress was very kind, sweet, and welcoming, very helpful also to when it came to tapa choosing.

hWk-AJt1Eax1Ip4uFh8uaA.text: Every single plate is a hit! I cannot complain about this place. I'm originally from Los Angeles, CA and every time I come to Vegas I make sure to come to FireFly.

VzJsTjN2Wrv876BFbYQKxQ.text: The tapas were surprisingly good, and they are open late.   If you're staying close by (as I was), it's worth checking out.

dhdESzHJLg0UrYZeAnLpNw.text: I was very hesitant on going to their restaurant after what they have gone through in the past but I did go after all. The food was good but the service was not and I was kind of disappointed but at least they offer nice variety of drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aqjw9bbdGvzSdtlE2jQHzA.text: This place was highly recommended to be by a few people, and I had really high expectations. The bad part about high expectations is that most of the time they are not met. However, Firefly went above and beyond, and I absolutely loved it.  This restaurant serves Tapas, which is basically small plates and/or appetizers. Our table decided to just order a bunch of these small dishes and share them all, which was nice because it would have been so difficult to just select one! Everything we ordered tasted fresh and amazing, and have AMAZING flavor - from the stuffed dates to the mac n cheese to the tuna tartare. For us, they brought out the dishes one by one, so we were able to focus on one dish at a time, passing it around the table for everyone to serve themselves. It is quite a different experience than most restaurants, but I definitely enjoyed this method. We also ordered a pitcher of Mango Mojitos, which we SO yummy. The mango did not taste artificial at all.   The atmosphere of this restaurant is pretty modern and artistic. We had a unique dinner because we were able to experience both the inside and outside seating. At first, we chose to sit outside because there were beautiful round fairy lights, and the inside seating seemed a bit to dark for my liking.  We really loved sitting outside, until the thunderstorm started! We were quickly moved inside, just before the large amounts of water soaked through the thin cotton overhang. The inside has a great ambiance - dark and candlelit - but I did like the outside more, before the storm obviously.   The staff was very accommodating and helpful, especially when we had to quickly move inside. They said "grab your drinks, and we will take care of the rest". It was very nice of them to brave the storm outside which got crazy pretty quickly.  Our server was also very friendly, and was helpful with our questions about the menu. This is amazing quality food for not that expensive, ESPECIALLY for Vegas.  I don't know if/when I will be back to Vegas, but if I do, I will definitely be coming here again!

MDTDG7e_smOfODGAJY1HzQ.text: This restaurant is awesome! Great place to eat and have drinks. They have a beautiful bar with a vast array of liquor to suit any taste and seats plenty! The substance of the food menu is filled with flavor and caters to a wide range of vivid tastes, and the price is excellent for such high quality food! Totally recommend for anyone looking for a great meal and cool atmosphere,  perfect for friends, family or dates!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry Mule!!! Refreshing serving of good times!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just one side of the bar...

QQhOigmWLbJM6X9wP9Cqqg.text: Now my new favorite place to eat!!! Ordered a few items and all were/are AMAZING! Ambience and service were just as amazing as the food.  I can't recommend a favorite dish because they were all equally delish! We ordered the Lamb chops, Smoked salmon bagel, Goat cheese toast, Skewers (Fillet, mignon, shrimp, chorizo), Mushroom tartar, and spicy calamari...can't recall if we ordered more. MUST TRY!

bilpQShg2OgRJMH5tI4xYA.text: Everything on the menu sounds delicious so it was so hard to chose , started of with camarones a la Diabla , they were not spicy at all mostly sweet but still tasty , followed with scallop escargots , so good but so hot! I burn my tough because I didn't wait . For main corse I had the lamb chops and my husband had the petite filet mignon and we finished off with the chocolate tress leeches cake . Everything's was great but I do have to say that the menu was overwhelming with so many options . The good thing is I can keep going and try something new every time.

p2Exrtly958H6md46DDnpw.text: Amazing food. Great service. Bacon wrapped dates, lamb chops, garbanzo beans, mushroom shrimp steak skewers were all awesome! The food came out insanely quick as well. Wish there was a location in Houston!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BAzOZrAUk5NVcqo4tzw_yg.text: Initially, I ordered their chopped chicken salad and tierra y mars skewers.  The food took maybe fifteen minutes to come out. The first of my two dishes that came out was the chopped chicken salad, regretfully. What they produced before me was a large white chunky glob of mayonnaise. I proceeded carefully with my fork and made an attempt to identify the dish put before me. What I found were chunks of canned chicken,  shreds of endive, and grapes. The dish was composed of more maynonaise/dressing than of its distasteful counterparts, much too overdressed. This was no salad at all. I returned it to the kitchen. (1/5) Would not recommend.  I later placed an order for their garden variety salad: romaine lettuce, spinach, orange, feta, dried cherries, pine nuts, sherry vinegar, and heart of palm. The orange and dried cherries lend a nice natural sweet component to my dish, which I thoroughly enjoyed, especially since I had selected water for my beverage. This salad is priced at $7.50. What initially attracted me to their aforementioned train wreck of a chopped chicken salad I returned, was the fact that it came with a protein. I added grilled (actually GRILLED, not out of a can, like the first dish) chicken to my new salad for an additional $3 or $3.50 bringing my salad to nearly $12 grand total. Eh, should be $9.00 at most. (4/5)  The Tierra Y Mars skewers were great. The tapas includes three skewers, stacked with filet mignon, grilled shrimp, and chorizo. (5/5)

KWwgBy4y2eCsoryXVrAljg.text: Delicious! Just stick to the drinks and tapas. If you are on a budget and want to feed a large group then order the big rice entree, however the flavor is not great and is the reason for only 4 stars.  I came at dinner on December 18 2015. It was great to have come.

D8paPDiRqA_tyjj29I3ulg.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Came to Vegas this past weekend for a weekend get away and I finally got the chance to try the place out. A lot of friends have been recommending this place but I never got the chance to go due to Vegas shenanigans I would always get caught up into. lol.   Every dish we ordered was delish and their sangrias are to die for. I wish they were a bit stronger but its okay I'm just going to have to order my own pitcher with a straw next time ;).  Service is great and the staff are all super friendly. We must of ordered like 10 different small tapas dishes, a paella, and a pitcher of sangria and the bill came out to be about $125 for 5 people, SUPER REASONABLE!!! Unlike that Spanish restaurant they have at the Cosmopolitan, which was way too overly priced with super duper small portions that didn't even taste good. But its okay lesson learned, just go off the strip to Fireflys for your Spanish fix.   I'm making sure every time I'm in Vegas to pencil in Fireflys for dinner. Ah! Cant wait to go back :)!!!!!

xUK9Y_Kt_KMYgflS_orN6w.text: Best Vegas Spanish tapas I've found. I went at night and it happened to be happy hour so a lot of tapas and drinks were half of. Would highly recommend and can't wait to go again.

kTy0cj77f8ddCDbV7lNriA.text: Awesome service and atmosphere. The menu is deep and diverse with something for everyone's taste buds.   Took a group of six for lunch today. Everything was amazing. I especially liked the beef skewers, the and the artichoke hearts. We sampled 7 dishes and ordered a total of 10, since we doubled up on the skewers, the artichoke, and croquettes (so amazingly good!)  The sangria was also great. Overall I would highly recommend it

QPc1BsgN5nY3KMSLErsHJA.text: This place is excellent! Quite a mini hidden gem for me. Is off the strip on Paradise Blvd, but only a few minutes drive from the strip. Firefly is known for their tapas and their sangria is DELICIOUS!   I ordered the "Ahi Tuna Skewer"- The seared Ahi Tuna was cooked perfectly, and the presentation was nice. There's two skewers and there's pineapple bits in-between every ahi tuna cube. The pineapple and tuna goes pretty well together.  The sangria was AMAZING! I had two glass. So good. It was not too strong yet not too light. However, my girlfriend got tipsy drinking it. Funny. It's really good though. Definitely recommend others to get it.  The ambiance was nice. Dimmed lights inside. Service was great.

rCpvLJbU8Y6sdr4lVc54iw.text: Amazing experience! Will definitely come back. Enjoyed all tapas plate. Wife came back for lunch after our great dinner we had.

4tAKfTtqceKOwkQSVelrcQ.text: Finally made it to the new location, still the same menu with a great selection but the quality of the dishes has really gone downhill.   First off, happy hour only has drinks discounts, food items are always regular price. We came in for dinner, and ordered several things. The signature bacon wrapped dates, unfortunately had a cold center and was not baked throughly, which is an indication that the kitchen was rushing and not paying attention. The other thing I did not like was the serrano ham sliders. The filet mignon patty was definitely not filet mignon, I can taste the difference, also there were pieces of bones AND chewy tendons in the patty that I had to spit out. Yuck! Also, I was informed by our waiter that the serrano ham was grounded into the patty, which I couldn't taste at all, probably due to the tiny amount of ham that was put in.   Service was very nice,  but I'm really disappointed with the food.

The EXCELLENT: - mushroom tart - steamed mussels - camarones a la diabla - scallop escargot - tuna tartare  The GOOD: - stuffed dates - patatas bravas -  The OK: - tierra y mar skewers - manchego mac n cheese - pork Empanada  strawberry mojitos are made with the fruit, however the mango is made with the syrup, per suggeston from our waiter, thank you for the honesty!  the sangria is probably 3 times stronger than the mojitos just to give you an idea though..  wow i would definitely come here again, with a party of 6 or greater so you can all try the different dishes!

P-x_XRXofilLY_FVobonNA.text: Horrible food and service....Lisa was our waitress, 1st we ordered a bottled she brought us regular, we had to wait...which is ok accidents happen, I ordered a hot tea,  they brought an assortment, the person I was with ordered tea also, Lisa dropped off an empty cup and didn't bother bringing the assortment to them until we asked, filet mignon skewer was tough, overcooked...we didn't hardly eat it, we got chicken fried bread , forgot what it's called very tough and old, fish cod was tough we didn't eat that at all, manager took it off, just terrible all around...

KQ9n07SWw5d3gITHYs_7cw.text: This place is amazing. Every time my wife and I are in Vegas, we have to come here. We usually start with the Red Sangria which is delicious. We then go with the calamari, lamb chops, chorizo and clams, shrimp tempura, etc. There hasn't been an item on the menu that I do not love or would not try. Good food. Loud, but that means the place is lively. We converse with other people about the food and get excellent recommendations. Not to mention the excellent staff. They are both courteous and professional. We love this place.

This was shared between 5 hungry people and we are stuffed. If you are in Las Vegas drive to Paradise just south of Sands Dr. and try Firefly. You won't be disappointed!

68Eh8BEBlXEfSVSeN8wpHA.text: After looking at their menu online, my boyfriend decided to eat dinner here for our monthly date. We didn't have a reservation, but the hostess seated us fairly quickly considering the fact that it was busy. We ordered Apple and Manchego Salad, Stuffed dates, Scallop Escargots, Camarones a la Diabla, and the Seafood Paella. The food was delicious! vOl2C9gkvBbZObgunZDA1w.text: So far I've found three places in the country all named firefly. All unique and amazing. This lives up to the name. Craft cocktails. Awesome apps and small plates. Well crafted menu that changes seasonally. Worth a stop. For sure.

4ZtZJ7_BYw0uATzQBht8KA.text: Firefly is located off the strip, cute trendy decor. Prices were normal not crazy as you will see on the strip. I got a glass of red sangria ($8) it was very good. My husband and I got 4 small plates and it was enough food for dinner. Dates were amazing (very small portions) eggplant was good, tri meat skewers were good and which came with steak, shrimp, and chicken and stuffed mushrooms were Average. This place doesn't knock your socks off but doesn't knock your wallet empty either! Our bill was around $35 without our drinks.

IfbGtGuVjcEC9dhaBeXn-A.text: Firefly is a more than competent tapas place with a lot going for it.  The decor is comfortable but perhaps a bit dark - nothing special.  And the service is friendly and very prompt, maybe even too prompt; if you want your dinner paced, you will have to do it yourself (see hint below).  But in every other respect, Firefly excels.  Every item on the menu that we tried was very good to excellent.  No misses at all, and some were really outstanding, most notably the baked goat cheese and (believe it or not) the Chicago beef bocadillos.  The San Gria was above average too.  The menu is large and has a wide variety of selections.  You will want to order 20 or so, but two per person is enough for an average appetite.  The prices are quite reasonable, with a typical plate being well under $10.  Go hungry.    HINTS: 1.  Reservations are really necessary. 2.  From the time you order to the time you get your food will vary from a few minutes to about ten.  Each plate will be brought separately, so you really need to share.   3.  To pace your meal, order one or two dishes, sit around eating and talking, and when you are ready, order a couple more.  They are fine with you doing this.

cc3Fzt5ETj9_MFri48fHGw.text: One of our Las Vegas favorites, celebrating our anniversary~dessert on the house.  Thanks to our awesome waiter Nahum

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lCgnx2Xd3e-_VfZq91dNHw.text: I love the small tapa dishes here! we were there as a party of 7 so we got to try so many different dishes. To start off the service was very warm and welcoming. Both the red  and white sangrias are sooo good! I also recommend the empanadas with the chicken or the veggie, the apple and manchego salad was aaamazing!!!The only one I am not a huge fan of was the chicken skewers it was a bit dry. We put in 2 orders of the mixed paellas, of course we definitely did not finish it so we took it to go. We were staying at an Airbnb, after the 7 of us came back from partying tipsy, tired  and starving late at night ... we just heat up the paellas in the microwave and they are the perfect comfort food before going to bed!!

I either really like what was ordered or I don't care for it at all. But overall a good spot to eat with friends

FBLA44NGA_rjoYppaNBpUw.text: Came here with the family for New Years dinner in Las Vegas. Food was delicious and plentiful! Something for everyone. Been to the one in Sherman Oaks, CA and both are awesome spots for dinner or just drinks. 5 stars!

8WIEaM9kc3YDOZKqBh71EA.text: PRICEY.   I came her because ever since I was in college everyone raved about how good this place was. It's been 8 years since and I have to say the price definitely outweighs the flavor here. It's tapas style where everything is a appetizer and you order a bunch to share. We order about 7 dishes and really only enjoyed 2:  Mushroom Tart Lemon Butter Cod   The rest just wasn't worth the $8 price point. For example, the chorizo mushroom cap was literally 4 small BUTTON mushrooms.   Extra star because service was good.

H_h3v82rxIHayrYr1IyjRg.text: Seafood paella was amazing as was a tomato soup. Great place where locals go. Close by but at the same time far away from the Strip overload.

jBBXoSiIv9G9e3w-VjsqTg.text: The food is fucking amazing!!! So brace yourself for a little wait. It's worth it! The banana nutlella sandwich is life changing!!!! The stuff dates is heavenly!! Don't bother the entree, their appetizers are awesome, order a bunch and fill yourself up.

pbRZze0L3CVTfGPOBhaYCw.text: Came here for brunch with friends and let me just say: get that Croque Senora! Much good. Very wow. Even came with two tapas sides (apple salad and patatas bravas were the ones we opted for).  My friends insisted that their standard tapas must be tried, so we did a combination of brunch dishes and tapas, which was a fantastic choice. There was not a single item that did not taste good. Even the complimentary bread with butter was bomb diggity. I especially enjoyed their scallop escargot, which came out piping hot, silky soft, and swimming in little pots of garlic herb butter. The ribs and goat cheese plate was also delicious. By far the best tapas I've ever had.  And did I mention the absolute BESTEST sangria ever?! Because if you've been looking, this is where it lives. So come for the Sangria and definitely stay for the food.

bT9KNLrkAFtWmRluZB6dkA.text: Delicious food and beautiful atmosphere. Loved the dancing lounge. I lived in Vegas for years and didn't know about this place until now. It's definitely my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.

HjXBI_IhkYeTOy8i02pFsw.text: Firefly is my go to place for a late night munch.  FRIDAYS: Friyays are Latin Nights! They move the table and chairs out on the patio deck and make it a dance floor. There is sometimes live music from a band or just a loud DJ playing the best of Latin music. It gets really cramped and full on Latin Nights. Parking is hard to find because people love to dance and drink!  FOOD: Their tapas menu is amazing! Bread and sweet butter is served complimentary with a sweet butter(bread can be hard if you come late at night). My favorite dish here is the Mac n cheese. It is prepared with small shell pasta, yummy cheese, and baked to perfection. I LOVE the Mushroom Tart here because it is a dish you can't find anywhere else in Vegas. It is a flakey dough with a mushroom sauce on top. If you want more mushroom dishes, the stuffed mushroom is also really great. I would recommend more dishes but honestly their menu is pretty big so your best bet is to be adventurous and order a dish from each section of the menu since it is tapas:)  DRINK: They have a full bar offering whatever you're craving for the day. So you can even go here for drinks if you're not feeling hungry.  ATMOSPHERE: This place has a really great Latin setting with Latin music and Latin food. Great place for a date or just to hang out with friends.  TIP: Be careful of your own sensitivity to foods. Latin foods can be raw because that is how the food is supposed to be prepare (many customers complain when they get sick from raw foods but it's not the restaurant's fault).

Q-ciMlqeSwhuUr5E46ODEQ.text: Our Saturday night dinner reservations fell through and instead of battling the lines and wait on a weekend night on the strip we went here. There was no wait for two at 8pm. Friendly service. Nicely priced and well made tapas. We ordered the sangria and 3 tapas: bacon wrapped almond/dates with a red wine reduction and blu cheese-which was flavorful savory and sweet, Shrimp Diablo which was good too-it ha: the same wine reduction base as the date tapas but with added sweet spicy chili, and we had the chorizo, shrimp and beef skewers with a tomato/chimichurri sauce that was also delicious. If you like flavorful and thick saucy dishes to dip your bread into this is the place. It was crowded (lots of large group celebrations), lively and loud and we had a wonderful time! We left full and happy!

Kv9-IUMZjzP_Jd8H6EpuCw.text: OMG ... everything about this place was on point!!  I had bookmarked this for my trip to the Sin City and looking forward to it, so I was concerned that my expectations would be so high that I might be let down.  Um, negative.  We took a cab over to Paradise and have found our new favorite restaurant in Vegas!  From the ambiance, dark and trendy, to the food, rich and delicious, this place did not miss a beat.  The mac n' cheese is a must if you love mac!  And the stuffed dates ... om nom nom.    We didn't have any issues catching a cab back either, as the hostess station was accommodating with this, too. We will definitely be back!
