8EUmh4gMNeVXEfgX7t9yFw.text: Delicious food. Every dish we got was fantastic, especially the bacon wrapped dates and the croquetas. We were there during a happy hour, which made the bill even more reasonable. Can't wait to return.

1yFaQ4OhFZPj1img1M2iQg.text: There is a reason firefly has almost a near perfect rating with over 1k reviews... it is awesome!  Tapas restaurant with a full bar; I can't recommend this place enough for groups. We have been there a couple times before and last night's stellar experience was on par with our other visits.   Go with a group and order a paella or two (recommend the mixed paella with all the seafood, chicken and chorizo in it for $30ish it is a great deal because it can serve up to 4 people) to start to share as a table (they take 40ish minutes to make, so order it first thing) and then have everyone pick out a plate or two to start with and enjoy! The sangria is pretty good, not the best, but an awesome value at $33/pitcher. Another favorite appetizer of mine is the petite filet, they cook the steak perfectly and the accompaniments and sauce is tasty!  Give firefly a try for your next get together or celebration.

O1NwTFDLtjdCDlMWDBxuYQ.text: On Fridays they have a Salsa Dancing Event on their Patio that starts at 10:30pm but this event is not a formal event. The Security Staff who was on duty last night 10/05/2018, was reserving tables for his advantage to get a Kickback Tip under the Table by People going there. The Patio is Small and you can only fit so many People. I have been going there for years and I never had a problem until they put Security People who subcontracts. The African American Security keeps arguing with me so I said: You are harassing customers, Do you want me to sue you? This Patio is not a High End Club Patio to have Reservations on Tables. The Dining is fine but the Patio Event Security Sucks!l

e4tku7RdngOdNel31fo-Kg.text: If I need to take one star out is Due to the fact the Dish is h u g e and you cannot enjoy the incredible taste the chef offers. I tried almost 15 different place each one of them was delicious . The top dish for me was the Tuna tartar. But really it's worth the price. They Have Parking as well. For free. That's a rare thing in Vegas.   Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

On_NkCUbd-lNmbAwYazUag.text: My boyfriend and I went for Valentine's Day and had a great experience. It's our 3rd or 4th time here and each time has been a solid 5 stars!!! THIS PLACE IS TOP NOTCH AND WON'T DISAPPOINT!! We have been when it's slow and busy and even when it's busy the wait for dishes isn't bad. Reservations *highly recommended* in the evenings!   Tierra y Mar Skewer is PERFECT!! The steak is tender, the sauce is tangy. I hate shrimp and it's still delicious! The sausage completes the dish!!!   We've had the apple and manchego salad as well as the chopped chicken salad and both were unexpectedly delicious. The apple and manchego has a delicious, tangy bite.   My boyfriend got the Beef Wellington, which was one of their specials. I wasn't the biggest fan but it's not really my cup of tea. He loved it and it was only $15! Great way to try a dish and be able to do smaller portions.   Ceviche of shrimp is the last dish I'd recommend. I'm such a snob when it comes to ceviche and Firefly's is always delicious!!!   Lastly try the damn passion fruit mojito! I usually don't care for flavors in mojitos or margaritas but passion fruit is the way to go! We got a pitcher this time because of the deliciousness factor!   If you are scared to try something, look at the yelp photos! It helps!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped chicken salad - pleasantly surprised!!!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche of Shrimp is another delicious plate! So tangy!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington was a Valentine&#39;s Day special

v8a2jjmXBy569ud8A1fZcw.text: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. Always reliably terrific food in an atmosphere that is perfect for any occasion. Love it!

g11nHBRf69i35PyvncsnKg.text: Firefly is amazing! I came with a large group so I got to sample 10-15 different dishes and I did not try a single thing that was anything short of incredible. All of the meat was cooked to perfection, and all dishes were so flavorful that I wanted to keep eating even after I was completely stuffed. On top of the amazing tapas, the desserts were some of the best I've ever had, especially the flourless chocolate cake. Our large group was wonderfully taken care of by the staff and we loved our experience!

CSHQgrHLC2xXhSuFi6AItg.text: I lived in Madrid, Barcelona and Malaga. Whatever I ate at Firefly wasn't Iberian, tasty or authentic. Maybe they should call it fusion cuisine instead. The service was good and they have an extensive list of wines in addition to a full bar. I'll give it another try and vote again. But for now I'll base it on my last visit.

Z1Ec4eeqqU3u-pQWOx-2Yg.text: Took my grandma here for her birthday the food was so good and the service was great doesn't take long for entrees to come out and big enough to share thank you for the awesome time

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rFmCus6lGy6hVBv8FJrLuw.text: This is my favorite go-to spot in town, whether your starving or just want food to pick at while catching up.. this is where you wanna be! The flavor here is on point  their drinks are so bomb! My favorite is the passion fruit mojito and their red sangria! I always order the petite filet because all the flavors in one dish is to die for! Their firefly fries are one of my favorite, always yummy to have on the table to everyone to pick at.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite Filet- topped with fried onions, sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms, sautéed spinach, and butter! MUST TRY for steak lovers.

9mWZVVeJ3aD4254KkANElg.text: Went to this Tapas Restaurant on Sunday night and was pleasantly surprised. The food was on point, everything tasted amazing and the staff was incredibly nice. Definitely would recommend this to anyone in Vegas.

pMJSJoeavnIrsD1hjlNsuw.text: I was not impressed this visit. Had the paella with the red sauce. It Was over cooked. Rice was mushy and the seafood was very chewy.

gXd5jsz0p03W08thfWLuVw.text: this is my first time at Firefly and in my opinion the ambience was great the crowd seemed to be having a fantastic time the service was respectful punctual and consistent I would definitely recommend this place again and again the food was amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1st time @ Firefly

9CXIgeJCx6ogp-82Sl5LeA.text: Nahum , Gabriel nd Marco are amazing at the firefly restaurant ! We had a bachelorette party here for lunch nd the tapas were great . The sangria will get your party started and the great service will make your day ! Love it !

bUO48PFHSvW71nzgNdju7A.text: I was really excited to try this place out after checking out the menu. The decor is quirky and artsy, and I saw rave reviews about some of the dishes and the sangria. I was with a large group for work, so we literally ordered the whole menu. Here's my takeaway.   Hot: Tuna tartare, artichoke toasts Mild: Shrimp tempura, camarones al ajillo Cold: Ahi tuna skewers (not great flavor)  My favorite parts of the meal were the sangria and the dessert. Not that alcohol and dessert being the favorite part of a meal would be surprising, but that was definitely the high point of the day. The cheesecake and the flan was great from the dessert platter, and the banana nutella sandwiches were delightful.  Based on the prices, small quantities of food, and bland flavor, I probably wouldn't put this high on my Vegas to-do list. There were definitely a few plusses for me, but overall it was a bigger miss.

CmpuHOn1OHIu7Epgz7GmGg.text: A MUST for me every time I'm in town! Absolutely LOVE this place. Always a pleasure coming here, from environment to servers everyone if so nice and fast!

BbevsZryBZV9H-9usaJgOw.text: Very good service and flavors. A full menu. Perhaps a bit noisy.

r3Ub3S0v_LQec-9pnW0nEA.text: tapas and sangria are always a good time! love the ambiance and bringing friends here for the first time. they have all loved it and returned. the new location is quite larger but still has a great vibe!   a few of my favs:  apple and manchego salad (green apple, manchego cheese, smoked almonds, lightly dressed)  stuffed  dates (bacon-wrapped, smoked almond, red wine reduction, blue cheese)  pulpo asado (grilled octopus, potato, tomato, paprika-lemon vinaigrette)  albondigas (meatballs in sherry tomato sauce, parmesan)  chocolate "tres leches" cake  this is the perfect spot for a date, birthday dinner or just catching up with a friend.  highly recommended you can't go wrong here!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Dates

p9o4Ubd3f8UlA5f_mcJpow.text: Unprofessional stuff. For example: we order sparkling water it came later than food cause they forgot, than they brought bottle with only one glass. Food was ok, but we ordered skewer medium well, it came bloody. Very loud inviroment. The wine glass was sticky on the outside. I don't  know, just whole dinner experience was ruined.

KfsQlii0rAaKj0fC3xZs4g.text: Very nice tapas restaurant.. food is innovative and tasty, great cavas... I only took one star out because of the noisy environment inside.

mEWshcPSdm084LjmNdQxJQ.text: Wow! This place was a great find!  I had been told by my coworker to check this place out if we wanted to escape from the Vegas strip for a little while and this place did not disappoint! Incredible tapas, the perfect portions to share and the most delicious sangria! The bacon wrapped dates were amazing and I had the cheese fondue dip with chorizo that was out of this world!  You can tell that this place is filled with locals and it is such a great break from the intensity of Las Vegas. The atmosphere is fun but not overwhelming and filled with cigarette smoke. Our server Neo was wonderful and so attentive even though we had a very large, distracted group. When I'm back in Vegas I will definitely stop by again!

8ZfkXRjLs5ffiY6-Fiw9gQ.text: I honestly come to Vegas all the time and had no clue this place existed. I am so happy my friend took me here. The server(Mario) was very accommodating to the allergies in our group and super nice. The tapas are so delicious. My fav was the Mac n cheese and the firefly french fries. Basically anything with cheese was super sexy. Def coming back.

G_A-bji0SpNssGAqy2RnAQ.text: I've tried this place a few times for the happy hour, then dinner with a group.  I cringe when someone suggests it.   why: 1) service was consistently crap (full house, but not crowded).  2) food was overpriced. 3) they will push alcohol, no matter if you or someone in your party has had too much.   Want a DUI? go there.

D3ICN4iTgr4D5goH_QEHlw.text: Seriously unbelievable.  Not only was the service spectacular, but the food was outrageously delicious.  The chorus of ooos and ahhhs from our party every time a new dish was tasted was almost ridiculous, but it really was THAT good.  There was a sizable wait when we arrived, but we easily found a few seats at the bar.  Definitely a good choice!  Our service was spot on: the bartenders had amazing recommendations for drinks and tapas, and they took great care of us.    The highlights of our meal were the shrimp diablo, clams with chorizo, chicken tinge empanadas, white sangria, and the apple/manchago salad.  I've never been so impressed by a salad before!  We had a slight hiccup when a bug flew into my glass of sangria, but our bartender wasted no time and replaced our entire pitcher.  Above and beyond!    A wonderful restaurant, spectacular food, and top-notch service.  We will be back!

fX3QspgUtDmoMRixgFdpFw.text: Haley gave us incredible service tonight. Friendly and attentive. Easy on the eyes too.

zS73EVaAizdvHN9zQCUv1A.text: Having sent two weekends in a row on business in Las Vegas I had the opportunity to explore a number of the finest and also most expensive restaurants in the city.  What a total surprise and pleasure it was to dine at the Firefly.  A reasonably price restaurant with nothing but the freshest and finest food. If not for a personal friend, who also happens to be a manager of one of the better hotels in Vegas, I would never have had to pleasure to experience their excellent food.  No wonder my friend said that the Firefire was one of his favorite places to dine. Firefly is absolutely great and the tapas are amazing. Nahum, our server was so charming, informative and very friendly.  I felt like everyone there was dedicated to making our dining experience perfect. If you are ever in Las Vegas this is a must stop.  It is just bit off the Strip but well worth the time.

4R2jITvTVt0jU9Q0spoYkQ.text: We did not wait 40 minutes for paella. We waited only 35. Anyway, I enjoyed it and left with a big round belly. Definitely not for four, maybe three, considering the paella were actually finished by two of us. :) The only complaint I have is the noise level. We could barely hear each other across the small table. What can you say? Happy crowd.

iKyPv04SvpRqjdBqbsG_sg.text: Great food!  Bacon wrapped Dates live up to their reviews as well as manchego Mac and cheese. Awesome!  We also had the Diablo shrimp, mushrooms and steak. They were also very good. The server was perfect as well. Kind, helpful, but not overbearing.

2i3bDhbkaK__W1b06qcMjw.text: Love this place. This has been the go to place when no one knows what we want to eat and just want something consistently good. We have been coming here for years (the original location and this place combined) my favorites are the ceviche, stuffed dates, the all the skewers, and Padron peppers. Honestly tho anything you order from here will be good, not once have I been disappointed. The best of all is the red sangria. It is a must try. The service is always consistent, and very friendly people.

9Vu1aerBiJ_yUtHu3wrsPg.text: This place is just amazing!! Our server Roger was just fantastic! The service from all the staff was great! I can't wait to come back!

HZKi7ZuLHfewQCJlymEVuA.text: My husband and I came here on a recent vacation to Las Vegas. We have never been to a restaurant like this before but it was a fun experience overall. The atmosphere was rather loud for us and the tables are so big that we could barely hear each other. The food was delicious and we got to try a lot of different types of things. It was a really nice place but we would not go back.

jcmfXxokp8w2gppfoMC38w.text: I can't really rate the food, but the way we were treated was terrible. We walked in tonight, understandably there would be a wait, since we did not make a reservation. The hostess said it would be 15-20 min for 3 people. Our party of 3 could handle that. About 45 min later, we saw plenty of people get taken back to be seated, we asked about how much longer they thought it would be, and she said oh umm you guys are next. She then proceeded to take another party to there seats. On that note, we decided to leave. Very disappointing as I am sure their food is tasty.

Z5LrYZ9fiUZd0aB54ozebA.text: WOW!! So good! Everything I tried was great! Service was great and they had a gluten free menu!! BONUS!

YaLdL-Rbfvr4ow_mlNgAIQ.text: Friendly, fast service and pretty good food. Spare offerings for the price but you pay for ambience.

4oqVMCB378zwncIhFC367Q.text: Been wanting to try Firefly and so happy we finally get to.   First off, drinks - The sangrias are delicious and refreshing. We got the red and sparkling sangrias and the sparkling is definitely a winner  Bread with almond butter - The almond butter was soo good! Creamy with a little kick  Bacon wrapped dates - Must try! Sweet and salty combo was great! Theres a surprise nut in the middle.  Tierra y mar skewers - sooo good and tender with a chile verde sauce. Comes with sausage, filet and shrimp  Scallop Escargo - Garlic butter sauce is delish I wanted to drink that sauce  Steak skewers with gravy sauce, Yum!!!! Meat was very tender and flavorful  And last but not least Paella - Very tasty and plentiful. Flavor is good and it has a little heat.  Service is really good. Servers are nice and attentive. We'll be back here every time we're in Vegas!

a0pvbwGqWVfOBLzKvj3gjQ.text: I love this restaurant! The food is excellent. For a Celiac like me, it is a wonderland. The fries with Parmesian and herbs are cooked in a designated gluten free fryer. So many other foods to choose from! The Gf menu is huge!!!

vnLvioo312BWkfFX86PTyg.text: What a great place for a large group party. I came here for a friend's rehearsal dinner and had a fantastic time. We had the private room and 'it was just cozy and intimate.   I enjoyed the various tapas that were ordered. The highlight for me was the chorizo clams, mac n cheese, and the steak. That steak hit the spot. It was cooked a perfect medium rare. I don't know if I was famished or just jet lagged but that steak was gooood.  The sangria was very light and very dangerous. I shared a pitcher with my friend and we totally destroyed it. I went with the sparking white sangria and later on the classic red. Thank goodness for cab service!!  The service was spot on considering how many people were present (about 20 ppl).  I had a great time with my friends. I highly recommend it.

vToabQXjeU4x2pesJbgOXg.text: Really good food. Came with a groupon( 30 for 50) We ordered the Garden Variety Salad, Spanish tortilla, fries, meatballs, ribs, chicken skewer, pork empanada and garlic shrimp.  They forgot to bring us the ribs, but we were so full by the time everything else came that we just didn't say anything.  The salad was very good, very refreshing.  I'd totally get a salad here because you need the acidity of the dressings to break up the other proteins you order.  The sauce on the tortilla was WAY too spicy for me.  I had to send it back and have them remake it.  The shrimp were too spicy as well, but I just picked off the red flecks of pepper and that was ok.   The service was good, if not a little rushed.  There was no rhyme or reason to the way the dishes came out.  We didn't drink so can't comment on that, but the food was great.  The complimentary bread was delicious too.

bXSLFe7kJGsyP4GETtgMOw.text: Firefly is my go-to restaurant in LV. I'm never disappointed. The staff is great and there's nothing I've ordered that I wouldn't order again. Yummmmm!

5RqcDjtgsNm2o5dErMqBjg.text: My friend Karen recommended this place, it was fantastic!  We ordered the manchego mac-n-cheese, patatas braves, vegetarian empanada, and the stuffed red bell pepper.  At first, I thought having one empanada wasn't enough, but with the other dishes combined, it turned out I couldn't eat another bite!  We also ordered a pitcher of their delicious red sangria.  What I also liked about this place was there were a lot of vegetarian options, which I usually don't see at a tapas place.  We also ordered the spicy chickpeas, but it never came out.  I'm glad it didn't because, like I said, I was full.  I would love to come back here and try more of their dishes.

YNllkjne78UEUuf7cBPVNA.text: I love this place! I love the smaller portions. The dates are my favorite! It is a little loud but the food makes up for it.

oRhTMoa5QHV2PweG8hxWjQ.text: Firefly is one of my favorite off-strip places to have a great variety of food and excellent drinks. Pepe, Vanessa and Alejandra really know how to take care of you and make you feel like a rockstar!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sangria for days!

dJBsQ-zY9smHw99gK7Px3w.text: Right off the strip, this place is a great place to get a meal away from the over priced, commercialized eateries on the blvd. They have a great selection of tapas, a full bar, and plenty of seating for large parties.  I tried: bacon wrapped dates.  AMAZING calamari-pretty good, but the dipping sauce could of been better. Ahi tuna tartar- with bits of avocado.  Sliders- tasty! Machego Mac n cheese- probably the best thing I had there. Spicy beef salad-I wish they used other greens beside the iceberg lettuce, and the beef could of been more tender. Sangria- good, get the pitcher!

tZLCFKCmLImdvtwMjgF1VQ.text: Delicious vegetarian experience! So glad we finally tried Firefly! I had scoped out their menu quite a few years ago and don't recall as many vegetarian options as there are now!  Every bite and sip was flavorful! We started with sparkling sangria and infused vodka martini. Perfect drinks! We had the veggie empanada, grilled cheese w tomato soup, lentils w veggies, manchego mac n cheese, and baked goat cheese! All flavorful! What I love about tapas is there's always room for dessert. Don't miss the chocolate tres leches cake, yum yum and more yum!  Our server was patient and caring. The runners and bussers all efficient and friendly. We've already added it to the list of places to return to next time in Vegas.

VbsMHlzhMu4W0yS5uAMuYQ.text: Overall food was great! So much different types of food and well we were brought  here by my friend because he LOVES the sangria...and boy he was right!!! I usually get headaches when I drink sangria, but for some reason I didnt get one when I drank it.  My friend also mentioned that their servings were a bit bigger than what it was before thus the priced increased by an average of $1.   Tried the chicken and mushroom paella, ahi tuna skewer, steak and mushroom skewer, manchego mac n' cheese,  spare ribs,  baked scallops, shrimp tempura, and escargot.  All BOMB.  The service was good... but there were lull times of waiter for the come  but when he did come, he was nothing but polite.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Mushroom Paella!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manchego mac n cheese!!

IeY4ugPtDmC53dVGTL9-qQ.text: I'm so happy that Firefly moved and didn't close. I have loved visiting this place as long as I've been coming to Vegas (long time). Their Padron peppers are my favorite menu item and they did not disappoint today! A full plate of peppers flash fried with lemon and sea salt was $5.50 - a really unbeatable price compared to anywhere else. We also had fries with Parmesan seasoning and that's the only plate that at all disappointed me. The serving was very large but the fries were soft and not crispy, even though they were skinny and browned. Lots of yummy shaved cheese though!  Husband enjoys the ham and cheese croquetas ($5) and had a soda also (coke $2.50). I tried a new plate this time and went with the chili, lime garbanzo beans (in the shell!) ($4.50) I didn't even know they came in a shell (but it makes sense) so I asked the server what they're like. He compared them to edamame but these little pods were much more difficult to work the beans out of. I liked them a lot but they were a lot of work for too little reward.   The new restaurant is wonderful. Much bigger and still a great location. There is parking in the back, but if you miss the driveway on the way in, be sure to not park in the subsequent parking lot, as we were told they are happy to tow you.  $25.41 for amazing tapas for two

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh garbanzos in the shell with chili lime and sea salt $4.50
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite stop in Vegas. Padron Peppers at Firefly $5.50
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly fries

4eh3fmmSNRZx-Sb7LSBLDw.text: This place is definitely a favorite of mine! When ever someone asks for a good place to go or i have family or friends visit this is the place i recommend. The environment is beautiful! You can dress up or down for this place. Service is wonderful, food and drinks are DELICIOUS!!! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE coming here!!!

d3FWP_9SxemxvH1LDu1jlw.text: Wow, what a fun restaurant!  Being from out of town, I was told by many people to take a little adventure off of the strip and go try it out.  What a great decision.  The menu is tapas style, which is basically my favorite thing in the entire world.  I mean, you can get so many different flavors and varieties (each at around $6 or something) all while appreciating the ambiance and fun atmosphere!  Our table ordered the big bowl salad to start, followed by the stuffed dates (AMAZING! GET THESE!!!), spicy beef salad, manchego mac 'n' cheese, ahi tuna skewer, camarones a la diabla, sliders, chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms, merguez, firefly fries, and we all shared the seafood paella.  Everything....EVERYTHING....was wonderful!   This sounds like a lot of food, but keep in mind that it is tapas style.. Between 7 girls, it came out to be like 2-4 bites per dish!  They were perfect for sharing!  Also, our server was spectacular and everything was served relatively quickly, given the restaurant was packed!  Oh, try their blackberry and raspberry infused vodka and/or a pitcher of the blood orange mojitos.  Trust me, you will love.  This will be one of the first stops when I go back to Vegas!!

vjR-5XDxIcmpJIhughLLiQ.text: Delicious food for a really reasonable price! I love coming here with friends. It's such a cool atmosphere and the service is usually great. Get the pitcher of red sangria! It's nice and refreshing and a bit strong. I was feeling it after the first glass lol my favorites here are the stuffed dates and the chorizo clams. We ordered all sorts of different plates and a mixed paella. Everything came out accordingly so we always had food on the table while waiting for the paella (they let you know it's gonna take about 30 minutes.) They also gladly brought us more bread and butter when we asked for more. The paella and the mushroom puff pastry was a bit too rich for my liking but it was still good. We had a great time here. We left feeling super full, satisfied, and a little tipsy ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates. My fave!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria! So good!

yrhhxoDpfvHQpwOEy6lHpg.text: Having been to their former location just a block or two down the road, this new location is much much nicer and slightly more upscale. The space is huge. On a Friday night this place gets very crowded. Nice ambience but can be very loud so forget about talking to the other person sitting across the table from you.   The food quality is about the same as the old location. I asked for a red sangria, mushroom tart and firefly fries. Honestly, I remembered the red sangria to be a lot better from the old location. Delicious fries. I wasn't too crazy about the sauteed  mushroom on top of popovers.

jqaHFUJ5dg-OvitfLZq7Qg.text: We chose this restaurant based in the Yelp reviews. The first plates we ordered were the stuffed dates and ham&cheese croquetas. The dates as mentioned numerous times on Yelp were great and I don't like blue cheese. The croquetas were okay. They were more like a cheese stick and I wouldn't order them again. Next we ordered chorizo plate and chicken skewers. Chorizo plate was good with thinly sliced cold cuts, mini pickles, and capers. The roasted garlic cream sauce on the chicken skewers was very tasty. The assortment of vegetables with the skewers was also very good. Lastly, we ordered the flan and flourless chocolate cake. Both deserts were very tasty and we would order them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skewers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo plate
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham &amp; Cheese Croquetos and stuffed dates

AsklobYHnCN72Qh0HAbxCQ.text: I came here for a nice, fresh, cold brew and some tapas and sat at the bar. The ambiance I thought was nice. But I must say, at least compared to Minneapolis and Seattle, the tapas served here are rather mediocre. Beer selection was poor. The tap wasn't working we were told. I guess Vegas is not considered the beer capital of US and for Vegas, maybe this place is considered better than average. Probably not coming back. The nice girl who worked at the bar was nice and friendly though.

eX81GDjS0ddQJGiB3aN_Aw.text: Enjoyed this place - awesome food, friendly, courteous servers and prompt service..... this place is highly recommended! Would definitely come back when I'm in LV.

7p0kAJPVIITfYtnJBRCR7w.text: If you want a 5 star meal at a reasonable price you HAVE to stop here for dinner. We went down to Vegas for my wife's birthday on a foodie bender. We ate at some of the "nicest" places we could find (not trying to be snooty, just dropping a benchmark for everyone) Firefly was our favorite spot on our four day adventure. The service was outstanding and the food...ohhhh the food...  We started at the bar with the house infused vodka..I knew we were off to a good start when it hit the lips. I initially thought there couldn't be any vodka in it because it was so smooth and at six dollars, I guess I was still in the twelve dollar mind set for hotel rum and cokes.   We were quickly seated by Irinia Omar, who became known as the Tapas wizard. We're passive aggressive in the fact that we like to order a few dishes and then have our server pick a few. There were four of us just to complicate things a little more. Some servers balk at this and are very hesitant to offer their opinion, let alone make the final call. After a few quick questions Irinia smiled and headed off. Then the onslaught of food began..the tomato bread followed by the tuna tartare, and chorizo plate set the stage in the chilled Tapas department, then the fun began. The stuffed dates, baked goat cheese, grilled octopus, spicy shrimp, scallops, empanadas, and lamb chops were to die for. We regret we didn't try at least one Paella (that was our choice ) but by the end when the desserts came out it really didn't matter.   At this point in the night after the onslaught of tapas and a few samples of the cocktail list, we were now in a battle against the food. We had to almost force down the desserts, the tres leches and bread pudding won.   The manager, Jon was very personable and friendly and made sure our group was taken care of and was overly apologetic when a group of twenty seated beside us quickly grew to the unplanned group of thirty and we volunteered to move tables to allow everyone to be seated.  Jon runs a very clean and efficient restaurant, and is quick to jump in and make sure his customers are enjoying themselves and are full.   If your in Vegas and you want an awesome and unique meal put Firefly at the top of your list. You won't be sorry. I would put Firefly up against ANY of the other "well known" establishments in a food off any day.

AGicnTXTJ4zp_82-JdijpQ.text: Cool little tapas restaurant, came in a large group for an event.  We had a private room which i though was weird that the tables were all squished in together, yet the room could have accommodated more tables spread out.  But it turned out fine and everyone had a great time.  We had the "Tapas Banquet" Toasted bread, Olives and almond butter artichoke toasts -  artichoke hearts, aioli, basil and pepper  Stuffed dates - smoked almond, red wine reduction, blue cheese wrapped in bacon Baby back ribs - with mango BBQ sauce patatas bravas (spicy potatoes) - Roasted potatoes with spicy aioli steak and mushroom skewers - Grilled Fillet, roasted garlic cream and red wine reduction. camarones a la diabla - shrimp in a sweet and spicy sauce. Chocolate tres leches cake.  My favorites were the Mango BBQ baby back ribs, i didn't taste any mango but it was definitely really tender and fall off the bone, and the BBQ sauce was delicious.  Bacon wrapped dates, smoky/savory and sweet at the same time too.  I think my favorite of all was the spicy potatoes, so good, i love a good tangy aioli and especially a spicy one it went really well with the potatoes, I'd put that sauce on a burger or even their fries any day of the week.  At first bight its really hot, but it wasn't the kind of hot that multiplies as you eat it.  I think as the dinner went on i got used to it so i just kept eating more and more of it.  So good!  Service was great, they explained everything and offered to take pictures of our group, refilled waters and drinks promptly.  Im sure everyone had a really good time.

7pRQF13AVTsu8V_ho3iuPw.text: Man, it seems quite out if place for me to drag this restaurant like I am about to do (because they have so many positive reviews and were able to do something right to get the place re-opened)...oh, well..here is my experience..  Friends and I went this past Saturday night to celebrate a bday. The mango mojito was amazing...the drinks were all delicious and the bar staff were friendly despite being busy. We got our booth and started to order plates to share..some were better than others but I especially liked the fish sticks...very meaty. So, we are just chatting at this point and I go to put my arm up on the back of the booth when I see a full grown COCKROACH (NOT A WATER BUG, A ROACH) crawling FROM the direction of the kitchen and along the wall. We all shriek (involuntarily) and call the waiter over. He sees it and tried to kill it but it crawled down somewhere and he moved us to a center table. Of course, we are disgusted and shaken. He brings over the rest of our drinks from the table and tries to bring the food over..I was like..."no we don't want that now."   The manager was called over and began to spin a story and try to do damage control. We told her we appreciated it, but our experience was ruined and we would not be paying full price (in my mind I was thinking we'd pay half and that'd be fair). They said their place is pristine and gave us a tour of the kitchen after 20 minutes of telling us we could  (if it was as clean as she swore, why did we have to wait so long?). The floor was sticky, there was clearly a second kitchen, but she insisted it was a hallway (lie, we saw servers coming from that area with trays and trays of food all night).   The meal ended up being on the house but we still tipped our waiter because, after all, he just brings the food. As we are exiting (not making any sort of fuss), the hostess rolls her eyes at us when we say good night! Really?? This is a FILTHY freaking restaurant and you have some ill feelings towards some dissatisfied customers? Some nerve! I have gone to firefly when there was a location in Henderson and enjoyed myself immensely. I WILL NEVER EVER EVER DARKEN THIS RESTAURANTS DOORWAY AGAIN. It was filthy, and their staff are (obviously) poorly trained!   Hostess tip: just smile and say good night! We tipped you anyway, and clearly you did not deserve it.

X5m8kca0-qH-3U1B4wrgZA.text: I've always loved this place because I love sharing and talking about food. Tops: red Santeria: light fruity, yet strong... order a pitcher, you'll need it! Pork empanadas... amazing and tender! My favorite go to is the toasted goat cheese dip and bacon wrapped dates! Savory and rich! Outdoor patio is great and breezy!

dsZHShxOwIVW-g1R9RP5OA.text: Firefly is a vibrant little tapas restaurant that's great for large groups. We were treated to some nice, cool fall weather on the outdoor patio. The menu has a huge selection of tapas, broken down by hot, chilled, meat & poultry, and seafood. Their eclectic food choices are matched by their drinks menu with numerous types of cocktails, beers, wines, and sangria.   With a large group, we were able to try a bunch of their most popular tapas. My favorites included the ahi tuna skewer with mustard-ginger glaze, the ham and cheese croquetas, and the manchego mac 'n cheese. The firefly fish sticks were a bit over-fried. For dessert, we tasted the banana-nutella sandwiches and the trio of gelatos. Nothing special that couldn't be store-bought and made at home.   All in all, Firefly is a nice place to grab a drink and some food after work, but I imagine the value to be better during happy hour 3-6 PM or reverse happy hour 11-1 AM.

45nK6lsjFc5FNjW9BL4D4Q.text: Awesome  Service and amazing food, in in town for a conference and wish they could bring it to the Bay Area.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZiKAgMy5ThTqREjn_-SXXA.text: This is one of the best tapas restaurant we have been to. Best quality for a price that won't hurt. The place was perfectly clean and the decor relaxing. We also appreciated so much the service: Roberto helped us with the menu, as we are french, and he suggested exactly what we needed. His helper, Jesse, was also good and kind. Don't miss this place and take a little break to eat and rest from the madness of Vegas. Thanks for this great moment!

8Rxbiton22hIHcPW-_phCw.text: Had firefly cater an event for my company. At first they were a little tough to get ahold of but last minute they really came food (otherwise I would have left a 5 star reveiw). The food was amazing, the service from the delivery crew was amazing as well. The pricing was pretty good too!  I would use them again! Everyone was very pleased!

MIum8oMFzN1ln_XEQcmJVA.text: The food was amazing and delicious. Service was exceptional as well as the drinks. Mojitos were stout!

J2rWc0nsyNxuOPPgPbsRJQ.text: Food or Familiarity  If we could give zero stars We would, if based on food alone All precooked bland flavors Save the filet mignon and tomato basil soup  In fact the only reason for the second star Was to express  How kind and inviting the staff are  They even messed up sangria The whole point of sangria Is to make use of average wines A box of rubbing alcohol water and old fruit  If youre looking for tapas Julian Serrano at the Aria

L7iD732evyyY0kLxsBPS3g.text: Maria & Chino were awesome and took care of me! The strawberry mojito was perfection and fresh! They had an extensive gluten free and vegetarian menu. I ordered the baked tetilla, stuffed dates and stuffed peppers. It was mild in spice, but still delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito

WrW-wrdHo3eKtxJqS31d1g.text: SOLID.   From LA, and we have choices. This place rocks. Great atmosphere, amazing food.  We only had a party of two, but Best for groups of four or more so you can try more of the amazing tapas plates.  Hello Nutella banana sandwiches. Lamb chops, steak and mushroom skewers. I will miss you when I leave :)

L5nlOY8KagDqmgkxn_dLPA.text: We went here to celebrate my birthday dinner. Was recommend by my aunt! My husband and I have never tried Spanish food. We are both very picky eaters! But we absolutely loved this restaurant for its service and food. We ordered the ham and cheese croquetas and the seafood paella! They were both so delicious. We would most defiantly return for the food!!

P-VMLRghzGpddO9zPsSWRA.text: Great place, really happening.  We found a spot in the bar area.  It was around 7:30 p.m.  and it was crowded.  We had a few tapas, I loved the stuffed dated and one of the stuffed peppers.  Also the steak tapas were really good.  I ordered a Ginger Pear martini, very nice.  This place gets pretty loud, but still fun.  Service was good, my husband loves this place, he brings people every time he is in town, so it was my turn, haha.

H6mKsWDRlUx36LsGQDhyMA.text: I knew the vibe was bad ass when I walked in the door...Music and people laughing and handsome waiters just taking care of business...It's relaxed loud and if you want GREAT FOOD  and superb service this is that place...The chefs definitely know what to do on seasoning and marinating the meats. Just one small thing and that was the empanadas were really small however they did not disappoint..I will be coming back as a regular..I want to try the entire menu..Thank you for the great attitude and making me and my daughter and son in law feel we were valued!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

63QFFZdFclDXmutJ8dNspQ.text: My (now) husband and I had our reception dinner at Firefly and I cannot say enough great things about it.  We planned our entire wedding from across the country, so we put our trust in the 5-star yelp reviews Firefly already had. We were a little nervous booking a dinner for over 30 guests having never tried the food, but in this case, the reviews were absolutely right.  HUGE shout out to Fernanda! She totally put us at ease, helped us make our reservation, choose our menu, answer any questions, and everything in between. She was super helpful, got back to us quickly, and adjusted the contract to our needs. We wound up having a few more guests than we originally anticipated, and they were more than accommodating.   When we arrived for dinner, they had a private room set up for us. Fernanda was actually there with Regina and Neo; they all took really amazing care of us the entire night. Every single tapa was top notch and the drinks were amazing (sangria and mojitos were especially fantastic). People are still raving about how great the food was, even the few picky eaters we had with us. My sister, who doesn't eat seafood, actually came up and went "OMG did you try the shrimp?!". That says a lot! Firefly also allowed us to bring in our own cake (they recommended an amazing bakery, Freed's), set up a table for it, and brought it to the back to cut and serve all the guests. Everyone's drinks were full all night and we all left extremely satisfied.  I want to come back to Vegas just to come back to Firefly! It was the best meal we had our entire trip and the staff is amazing.

vxbpth447-kNwSl2BO_4Ag.text: Did not disappoint! Wide variety of tapas, and you can't beat the white sangria. My favorite has to be the bacon wrapped dates. Delicious! Plus we hit it at happy hour, so they were only $4. Actually the happy hour menu is perfect, so arrive before 6 to take advantage. Our favorite waiter, Alejandro, came by to greet us--nice touch! Although our waiter (Naum) really hustled to keep us happy. Prices are very reasonable unless you eat as many portions as we did!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W8rxFhn_oz14B9XCIftHyQ.text: I've eaten here twice, both times my meals and service have been excellent. There's a ginger pear martini that you need to try! I was dining with a vegan and pleasantly surprised that there were plenty of things we could order that everyone in my party of 3 could enjoy. But the item worth raving about is the carrots. Carrots? Yes! The carrots! We ended up re-ordering more carrots during our meal because they were the star of the show, they ate more like ribs than anything else, deliciously roasted in a BBQish sauce. If you do anything here, get the carrots. I promise they'll blow your mind. Patio seating during the evening (in the spring) is lovely.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrots
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YQsgAUAl7DbdhwAvZWggJg.text: My 300th review and a local Las Vegas favorite! I have to say I've only ever been to this location and not any of the others in the past, but I've never had any type of problems. This most recent time I came with my boyfriend and parents for an early Father's Day celebration. The location parking kinda sucks which is my only reason for a 4 star rather than 5 since it's so hard to find a spot when it's busy.  This time we ordered quite a few different things. My favorites were the steak and mushroom skewers, stuffed peppers and stuffed mushrooms. Their bacon wrapped dates are also very good. Don't let the word tapas fool you as some of these plates are pretty large portions.  I also have to recommend the red sangria, so good! They don't skimp on the liquor either.

zEvY2gw_8dMK05YGH79jDg.text: Didn't  know what to expect visiting this place. However the staff was friendly and seated our party immediately. The waiter recommended the Paella and it was amazing. The atmosphere was great and the waiter was very attentive and accommodating, he took the time to explain the dishes and refilled our drinks continuously. I think I'll be visiting again.

j6J87DkOIy3J4g17Cx5sPA.text: I love this place sooo much we got macaroni and cheese with bomb fries and ribs and mini sliders it was amazing  and i mean it when i say it i really recommend it for anyone even kids it has great service and really recommend it a lot!

w2aOjS2AbzblEdKYY0fAuA.text: Food was very good, we all liked trying different things. I have been before and got a good group to come this time.   Service was very slow. Drinks came on time but took us an extremely long time to get our check and get out.

9VfwqpSLqZYoiiVuW9wdpg.text: First off, parking was a nightmare. I would avoid this place Friday to Sunday for dinner. Yes, there's free valet but they park your car like they're playing tetris.   Next, the food. The food presentation is great as is the ambiance, but most of what we got was jusy OK. Based on the price point and parking experience I probably would not be back. Yardbird was better.   *BACON WRAPPED DATES: sweet and savory bites of heaven. A MUST TRY.   *STUFFED PEPPERS: good flavor just a bit much on the cream cheese.   *FIREFLY FRIES: you can get these fries at McDonald's and sprinkle Parmesan on it. The Parmesan melted together and was difficult to distribute for taste.   *FIREFLY BURGER : we asked for medium, but it was pretty much med rare. Nothing special just your average burger.    *PAELLA, as others have mentioned - order first as it takes like 30 to 40 min. It was good, but unfortunately we were pretty much full when it arrived at our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PAELLA COMBO
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly burger, asked for medium got medium rare. Tasted average.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed pepper. Too much cream cheese

vyGjCdu8VrHrIHzg5Txb-Q.text: Our first time visiting Firefly was amazing. We were greeted and seated promptly. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. We ordered the apple and manchego salad, mac n cheese, patatas bravas, heart of palm crab cakes, chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms and the steak and mushroom skewers. Our favorites were the apple salad, mac n cheese and the steak skewers! Everything had great flavor and the bread was also delicious. The Fly Tai cocktail was very light and refreshing. I would definitely recommend Firefly and can't wait to visit again!

3Q5fvpgEBD5SWvgVC1_rnw.text: Never got to try the food. Went with a group of 5 and was told 20 minute wait. An hour later ask us if we want to sit outside. It's 100 degrees outside no one wants to sit outside after waiting an hour. Meanwhile a group of 3 is sitting at a table set for 6. The restaurant doesn't know how to manage hosting.

4HDWDFSqgw5L4AeTvj0NjA.text: 304. I rarely go off the strip for food, but my friend raved about this place so we met up here. This was his first stop after driving directly from California. #Commitment.  All of the tapas that we got were tasty, but the real highlight was the stuffed dates. I don't like dates, but they were decorated with so many other things that it didn't even matter anymore. The dates were wrapped with bacon and topped with blue cheese with a sprinkling of some red wine and smoked almond somewhere in there. It was an explosion with every bite.  We also ordered a pitcher of sangria because it's a tapas bar, who doesn't? I didn't take it too well though. Ended up with a bad headache. It was probably too sugary for my brain.  Sounds like this place can get packed on the weekend, but we went during off-peak hours and it was pretty empty. Parking wasn't an issue either with plenty of space behind the restaurant. Definitely would come back for the tapas, but I'd probably go elsewhere for drinks.

SBw1HenVl5V80wOHi9CKIg.text: If I was a local I would visit this restaurant once a week at least !!I came across this gem restaurant purely by luck was driving aimlessly looking for our hotel and saw this place and decided to  on a whim and boy am I glad I did!! I had the octopus was simply on point my BF had the shrimp  ceviche and was perfection wash it down with a great strong Mango Mojito .. i'm glad we discovered this place at the beginning of my vacation and will be back ...because the menu is quite big I will try other ones , I  vote this place BEST TAPAS in Vegas simply all around winner with great service and extensive menu to serve all taste WOWwhoever thought that butter mixed with honey  siracha and crush almonds might be good Was A genius

KB4DQ6OwIxRb3GfBPbkr0Q.text: The food was good although the portion sizes are small by design.  My complaint is the automatic gratuity.  As is typical with large parties the restaurant under staffs the table and the service is poor; however, the restaurant still tacks on an automatic gratuity, in this case 20%.    I find paying an automatic 20% gratuity on poor service very annoying.  I don't blame the wait staff but the restaurant management for under staffing large groups.  If you plan an event here you should consider a pre-event meeting with the restaurant management regarding either providing sufficient staff to serve your table or dropping the automatic 20% gratuity.

rPEC1o_dD5U3IfhaD4N4og.text: This place is perfect for everyone but especially gluten free folks!  Over 50 options including 5 desserts! It's a must for anyone coming to Vegas!

g-zQAJoD6F1gZRPWbtmesA.text: I came here for a late dinner on a Thursday night and was seated right away.  The restaurant has indoor, outdoor, and bar seating.  To start I had a cucumber martini made with Bombay Sapphire which was delicious.  For my meal I had the bacon wrapped dates after seeing so many positive reviews on Yelp. They lived up to the hype. I also had the pork empanadas. Yum!  Fun atmosphere, great food, and good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber martini

kNXef1euRFaVZthk9lo1QQ.text: Found this restaurant on yelp while looking for a Tapas place.  We were not disappointed!!  The portions were good sized and the prices very good. The noise level is very high but if you can handle that get your taste buds ready for some really good food!  The lamb chops were our favorite, cooked to perfection with a delicious sauce will definitely order those again. Also tried the apple and manchego salad, very refreshing and light.  The Tuna tartare really good and fresh, the ceviche yummy, light and citrusy.  The ribs very meaty and and ample portion.  Will definitely go there again and very surprised how low our final bill was!!!!

T_Ukv-b5aTYp5XTbLqNTxQ.text: I've had a craving for paella for the longest time.  We decided to go there and the service and food was excellent.  The only thing I recommend is to order your paella ahead of time.  Mine took over 40min to come out.  We spent long time waiting after ceviche and gaspacho.

qpIidIIFfBEZxZsNZhZvqA.text: I'm not saying this is a good thing, but Firefly is the first place I've ever gotten drunk!! The food was incredible here. We ordered several tapas and a pitcher of raspberry mojitos. I would love to tell you all the dishes we tried, but I don't think I can remember them all. I know we had a vegetable empanada, an apple salad, mini steak sandwiches, baked goat cheese and diablo shrimp. Each dish was wonderful. We will definitely return when we head back to Vegas.

tDZhrxlr3fAY-UPU0JN-Tw.text: This restaurant came highly recommended by a friend. She is beyond a fan. This restaurant participated on the Epicurean Affair we came to all the way from Florida to attend.   She came with us on this visit and ordered some of her favorites for all to share. I had tried what they offered at the Food and Wine affair and I looked forward to try more selections. Everything was great. I especially loved some skewers I had and the sangria!  I wasn't too crazy about the bacon wrapped dates, which seem to be their specialty.   Service was phenomenal, and the restaurant is a mixture of funky and eclectic. Lots of colorful artwork. Lots of mirrors. It is a great place. We didn't get entrees, just tapas. I would definitely be back.

7pFBUQ4vQA9BE_rX7dYb6g.text: Great place for a date night it was very romantic dim lighting along with a candle. Service was great food took some time but it was great and fresh. I will be coming back!!

k_pgdwbq59fdzBUjfJKASg.text: Went here by myself while working a show in Vegas. I usually don't do restaurants alone, but had never had this type of food.  It's a popular place and a Little too noisy and dark for me, but I would definitely come back.  I was waited on by 3 different people and never left waiting and had some bread and flavored butter that was a great appetizer And I didn't expect it.   I had the pork empanadas and the chicken  and chorizo stuffed mushrooms ( my wife would've loved).  Everything was good and I topped it off with a couple of Long Island iced teas.  A little expensive for the lit , but they were perfect.  I didn't try the stuffed dates this time, maybe next time.  Also I might try the warm spinach salad.  Was just the right size with 2 dishes, I was not over stuffed and the waitress Elena C was great.  This was the first time anyone ever asked me if I had any allergies, so that was impressive!  Great job Elena!  She even separated the drinks on 2 separate tabs for me, what a gal!

fzbW8zk4SK87OIqgtJweWg.text: We came here full of expectation, but the whole experience was a disappointment. We were seated at a side table. The place is loud even it wasn't full. The tables are close to each other. We had a hard time picking and the waiter didn't know what to recommend, felt like he was randomly saying dishes. We picked a few and they were all pretty tasteless and small portions. None stood out and we were disappointed with the food.  We had the eggplant with goat cheese, escargot like dish (please stick to escargots, this made no sense), tuna with chips and another I don't even remember. The stars are for the tuna as that was really good but nothing that blew me away. Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only thing that was good, the tuna. Delicious chips.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot  inspired dish but don&#39;t bother

qc9VT1zySPaUdbevaCWVlw.text: I absolutely love coming here. I've been several times while I was visiting Vegas. The service is amazing but the food is even better. The stuffed peppers were my favorite thing I got the last time I was in. Not to mention the sangria. I recommend people to go every time someone tells me they are visiting Vegas.

OI_EVvoCK3LZmZGm6G5s4A.text: firefly once again satisfies our ever whim. Nahum served my girlfriend and me with candor and professionalism, and of course the food and red sangria were all amazing. flavors,  textures,  ambiance... fantastic!   it was only in the 90s yesterday and cloudy,  and sitting outside with the misters was all very pleasant.   do see if there is a Groupon... ours was totally a steal. and let your server know if you've been a loyal customer! they very much appreciate years of love,  and happy reviews.   and did I mention the sangria was on point?

24BH14xqhoR7qEH4X419tg.text: Went here for a friend's birthday. Haven't been since they closed down the original one across the parking lot.  One thing that struck me is how big Firefly is. It's a huge establishment which is nice. I feel the new location is much bigger than the old place. This is a definite plus.  Drinks. I did not order a fruity drink (like sangria or mojito) but I saw people order them. The mojitos are drowning in mint. Barely any drink in there. That was a downside. The beers on tap though are actually pretty good. You would think they would only specialize in mixed drinks, but they had some nice Belgian Tripels on tap that really packed a punch.  Food. The bacon wrapped stuffed dates are what you get. Get a couple of orders. Quite possibly the best item on the menu. Fried Calamari was okay, they give you a bunch. Bit chewier than I wanted it but it was still good. Empanadas were okay, nothing special. Tierra y mar skewers were very delicious. This is the one with filet mignon on a skewer along with some other tasty morsels. For dessert, the flan was fantastic.   Service. Just like many other restaurants, there seems to be a communication issue with servers. You'll have a server take your order (dates), then they'll disappear. Another server will come and take someone else's order. That person's order will come out before yours. You'll see another server, ask about your order as another server is walking aimlessly around asking every table if they ordered dates. This just happens so often with every order. Luckily, all my food arrived without much trouble but I can only imagine that other people's meals aren't so lucky. The positive is that every server was very nice and was trying very hard.   Overall, I like the new location better. It's bigger, better atmosphere and the food didn't make me sick.

SXfdxes3MqNN3i-4A2_K3g.text: Bring Firefly to NYC! ... Or maybe don't. I like having secrets gems out of state. Their happy hour is TOP NOTCH. It's off the strip but so what? So much variety and it's all half off! Lowkey spot, cool ambience, AWESOME DRINK/TAPAS MENU! Def make this a stop for happy hour!

7yVuQozSQmP2Z-m2poDiEA.text: Excellent small plate meal with unusual choices allowing sharing and tasting of a big variety of offerings. Despite being a very busy place(noice level is only caveat) the dishes arrived quickly and wait staff very efficient and friendly.  All dishes were carefully prepared and original in flavor and spices. Really nice dessert selection.. go for it!

uqoP6PkDd2i_iESjrsgh2w.text: The tapas in LA area are much more flavorful. Why is this one 4 times the price? Oh wait never mind...  They tried to make a pimento kind of butter with their bread but it was more than a little sour. I don't know how. We ordered our food and my  ceviche tasted like old fish and was also pretty sour. My veggie empanada was a really weird combination of things thrown together that tasted old. And the paella, although cooked fresh, was not very flavorful.   The servers kept ignoring us, although I wouldn't think a table of 9 is easy to miss. When they took the orders, we did ask ahead of time to split it 3-way for it to be easier. When I told her my order, I said the ceviche and veggie empanada... When the food came out, they gave us an extra plate of tartare and said I ordered it. When I said no and repeated my order, she insisted I said so, even though my eating buddies said no as well. Even more so she avoided our table, and then the new waitress came over 3 times to fill 10 ml of water (it was about an inch tall in the glass). But even then, when we told her our needs, service came really slowly (I believe water girl isn't supposed to do more than fill water and run small errands)... Probably because the other one didn't want to help us out.   I wouldn't come back here again. I can't stand mediocre, overpriced food. We each ended up paying more than a buffet per person (except for the two girls who didn't order).

YLyKO60l7MBmX2oVcgRCQQ.text: Very nice Spanish restaurant. Beautiful decor. Great service, waiter even ask you about if you have any allergies. Never ever j remember that somebody ask me about allergies in restaurant. Everything we ordered was delicious. Stuffed dates with unusual kick of bacon, nuts, cheese and reduced red wine but absolute delicious, must try. We also had spicy beef salad, ceviche of shrimp, baked tetilla ( melted tetilla cheese with sun dried tomatoes and chorizo), and mixed paella . Everything was delicious with enough spices. I hate over salted or over spiced food. They had just right. We were told it will take about 40 min to prepare paella so we ordered it first with drinks. Plates with tapas were brought at perfect intervals, as soon as we finished one, next was coming. I would recommend to visit this place off the strip about 2.4 miles from Caesar casino.

GgImwc3MzP6FbPv47_IuwA.text: Excellent place for tapas.  Bacon wrapped figs are delicious.  Cool vibe, after hours place to wind down and complain about the shit you had to deal with today...

NUMyExOLO4JavDGDZ4mZZg.text: This is the best kept secret in Vegas. Great food and amazing service in the BEST of atmospheres. Do not miss this gem while in the Sin City!  Ask for Haley or Athena for the time of your life!!! Craft beer I haven't had the pleasure of trying yet, paired with the finest tapas! Amazing taste and affordable pricing! Great company with knowledgable bartenders! Every flavor mojito you can imagine made to order! Very well known by locals for their Sangria!!! We love Firefly, come see for yourself!!!

2i6wIO7a5PNZXBdIhHYwuw.text: I had the bacon wrapped dates, scallops escargot, steak skewer, and manchego Mac n cheese. It was all good, but nothing made me overly excited. I would love to come back again with my husband or friends because the atmosphere is nice and we could all share.

YttqRGTtGXjJ90MnKNQ6yQ.text: Everytime I come to Vegas I tried to hit up this spot very good tapas here I'm not a drinker but the people at our table we're having sangria they look absolutely delicious

KFJ1Z-8YjImnj1NgvUkdqg.text: Superb, wonderful, magnificent. Yes this is as good ad it gets. Not in any way shape or form is it pretentious or snooty. Went for breakfast slash lunch and ate more than I should have. You get a bunch of small plates ( me and the wife) we ordered calamari, steak & mushrooms, lamb sausage ( only dish not worth it to me) but everything was first class the service was superb. Be back yeah for sure.

1RP5qG_2cgY97Qcaoi9iZg.text: Awesome food. Took off a star for the service. Takes forever to get a table, to get a menu, to order food. Food came out soon enough, however some things were forgotten. Took forever to ask for a check.

f2TT-XltGOWWNKqq2-Ji_A.text: Last minute decided to try this place out with my boyfriend and our friend. The service was great, super nice waiter. Ordered our foods and drinks and it was out pretty quick. It was all so delicious! Especially loved the stuffed dates. Going to be back when I'm in town.

vtRNEhw7ReHs6PzMdRg4iw.text: Ahh! One of my favorite places EVER.  Every time we come here I get Sangria.  They have red, white, and sparkling.  They are all delicious, but I think sparkling is my favorite.  **Half off pitchers of sangria during happy hour!  They bring you complimentary bread with almond butter.  AMAZING!! Seriously. I would order this stuff if it wasn't given.  We always ask for another order.  My top 3 tapas are the firefly fishsticks, the ham & cheese croquetas, and the salmon toast.  I was really excited for the parmesan fries, but they aren't very good.  I have tried them twice and both times they were soggy and bland.  I also really like the babyback ribs (with mango BBQ sauce), the lamb chops, the petit filet mignon, and the fruit & cheese platter.  My boyfriend loves that they have Pacifico here.  He loves the stuffed peppers, bacon wrapped dates, and the tierra y mar skewers.  I like that this place is tapas style that way we can get a wide assortment of food.  I'd suggest getting at least 3 dishes per person as they are pretty small.  We have tried a couple desserts here but weren't very fond of them.  Last time we tried the flan.  We have had the banana nutella sandwiches twice and both times they were made differently.  The first time they were delicious.  They were fritters stuffed with bananas and strawberrys in them and nutella on top.  Last time we went they were literally nutella sandwiches, which we can make at home.  I don't know why they were different.. Maybe because the fritter styled ones were at the Sahara location?  But no more desserts for us, we'll just stick to the tapas.  Service is usually pretty good.  The food comes out as it is prepared.  We will continue being repeat customers.

BL0J_Xfx-xcEseiDcZPf-g.text: Hey in life everyone deserves a second chance. I remember before moving to Vegas I read an article about a restaurant that received the worst nightmare it could have as an establishment. Like everyone else who searches a business on Yelp, of course we look for the negative or 1 star reviews. Aren't we all entertained by bad press? Fast forward my friend randomly took me out the first week I moved here.to a salsa night. The meals that night were pretty fantastic I must say. Loved the Sangria and all was well until my friend mentioned about the history of the restaurant.. then BAMMMM! In my mind I was thinking "No F*in way this is the restaurant I read about in the paper?!... You bring me HERE!?" Good times. Any who, I've been here maybe a handful of times since then and I haven't been disappointed thus far. Most of the time I don't order myself so I can't give any recommendations except for the awesome sangria and comped bread with orange butter. There is a latin night on Fridays and it's pretty neat. I prefer the old school salsa dancing and they play a few here and there but it's mostly merengue, cumbia, and latin electronic music (it exists folks). I'd definitely go back.. sometimes through failure companies can figure out what went wrong and ensure it doesn't happen again. Business is going well.. so either they got it together or we just love Firefly to not care!

4Z68V3rH3S3jVCTnG3sCaA.text: Love the new location! Clean & modern. Great service, the dates and steak salad are my favorite dishes.   Only reason for 4 stars is they don't offer a medium size plate- just small bread plates and they are too small. Also, under out table the area was wet and dirty from the previous customers.   A nice change from the busy strip!

pnclHRpAlncP6D6GsvuNQA.text: Wow! So just a few things before I get to the food-  1) The customer service was great! I made reservations for 13 about a week in advance since my company had a conference out here in LV; and they were able to accommodate it easily. With a large group, and a loud/happy group of people, all our servers were FAST, answered all our questions, and made sure we were well taken-cared of (probably b/c they knew they'd get a great tip). Food came out super-quick and their water / beverage replenishment was on point!  - We were also celebrating one of our co-worker's bdays and they were able to keep the cake in the back and bring it out to surprise her after dinner!  2) The Food: again, WOW. I haven't been to a spanish tapas restaurant in awhile, and this made me just want to go everyday! The food was fantastic. With such a large group, we were able to order a good variety from the menu, and honestly, everything was great!  - Just to name a few favorites: Tuna tartare, ceviche, bacon wrapped dates - We also had the seafood paella which was very delicious BUT there were parts of it that was way too fishy - which made me worry & wonder if they washed the seafood since I haven't tasted anything so...."seafoody" (& I'm not even that picky and eat lots of seafood). BUT again, since the service and EVERYTHING else was so great, I couldn't knock off a point for this but thought it was still important to mention.  3) The Sangria: Saving the best for last - oh. my. SO GREAT. The end.  Overall, awesome experience. Thanks to the employees that waited on us! They were so fast and ensured our drinks/water was always replenished! I will be taking my fiance here when we return to Vegas next month!

-R1JmnTPFaqMbH6BF-qswg.text: Tapas Style restaurant, killer mojitos, good music and a kick-ass happy hour. When my wife and I go to Las Vegas this place is one of our stops. Do yourself a favor and give it a try. Specially during happy hour

E5Aw6JqXDpfGs8C4XVSWQw.text: I like this place! Delicious food and very good service. It has perfect location and free parking  Pretty full usually so get reservation before, specially weekends.

hfLVPUf2ubR8XiV6G26DHA.text: One of my favorite places to eat tapas! Great location for Vegas locals or visitors on the strip. Half off sangria pitchers during happy hour, my kind of place! I've been a variety of times and have too many food favorites. The cheese and fruit plate is a perfect starter to share. If you're looking to warm up there is a delicious tomato basil soup cup with a mini Brie grilled cheese sandwich. The bacon wrapped stuffed dates are top notch!  Friendly staff, decent pricing, rarely ever a long wait, easy to share and pretty quick service.

aKyzP2KEAt88GoCcQvPJ9g.text: Came here on a Sunday night with some work friends and we all had such a great experience!! The service was great, the food was so delicious, and we'd highly recommend this place to anyone! Pricing of the food, in my opinion, is fair for what you get as far as portion size. Highly recommend their Mac and cheese as well! Overall, great experience, 14/10 would recommend!

N-9xAUIol5ibR_sTeS4BFA.text: The food here is absolutely amazing. The portions vary in size but are very fulfilling. The stuffed dates are a must. Ceviche with it's great vinaigrette is yummy. Thirsty, Sangria is delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3CEKC60gOysmVb1KawJeVg.text: Firefly is alway my favorite place for tapas! None of my friend dislike it once I introduced Firefly to them.  They don't take same day reservation, and it's easier to park if you come like 5pm.   Employees: my waiter is so nice and patient, we took little long to order, and he always come back and make sure we are ok on the menu and refill the drink on time.  Shrimp tempura: I love this dish so much I constantly order it, it comes with very decent portion, the shrimp size is amazingly big, the they fried veggies are so tasty, I like to dip everything in the sauce that comes with it.  Baked cod: The seasoning is on point, and the sauce goes perfect with the fish, the crispy on top of it give this dish different texture and joyful for mouth.  Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushroom: It comes with 4 in total, one bite of it you will taste everything together, the meat juicy is drizzling down, it's amazing.  Camarones Al Ajllo: I love the jumbo size shrimp, its mouth full. The garlic sauce underneath is haven, I asked extra break just to dip the sauce from it.  Chicken Skewers: The presentation is nice, they have squash grill underneath the chicken skewers, the chicken taste tender, but is just difficult to take it out from the stick.  I'm a regular customer of firefly, I will definitely come back again. Good job!

BLr-KMZMxL5jujd-4H9kcw.text: Came to this place on a weekday night, it wasn't as busy since we went in kinda early, was greeted right away and our server was very nice; always made sure we were good and made sure our foods were cooked right. I like almost everything we ordered except for the steak skewer. I think they could have done better with the steak to make it more tender but other than that, everything else was great especially their bread.

FxmGlWt2KAAJZcqKJVzQew.text: Love Firefly! We eat here at least once every time we come to Vegas! I would recommend the apple and manchego salad, chicken skewers and flourless chocolate cake.  We had a pleasant surprise when we came to eat lunch on a Sunday and got to experience their fabulous brunch menu! The banana beignets and lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious!

RjIe3lCf2fr4Xf20v2LAyQ.text: The last time I came to firefly was at the Summerlin location many moons ago. Came back to this location and I must say it was awesome. Love the vibe and atmosphere. Food was amazing. Tried the bacon wrapped dates, it was a great pair. Paella mixed had a lot of flavor. Very very big to share with at least 4-5 people. Also tried the pulpo Asado, the octopus and potatoe had a lot of flavor and I was very impressed with this one. Octopus was actually not rubbery. The only downfall is parking. Come early or I would suggest Uber.

HM5dyQWlQKyoXeDftoOg9Q.text: Las Vegas is known as a culinary hub for a reason -- no matter what worldly cuisine you're craving, you'll be able to find a place that has it. I've posted plenty of reviewed for Asian cuisine, but this time around I'm going to Europe for this review. More specifically, this is a personal food wish of mine that I'm fulfilling! Driving home from work, I've always driven by Firefly on the route home, but I've never actually stopped in until fairly recently.  Firefly is a Spanish restaurant that specializes in Spanish fare -- though they have paella that several people can share, their real draw is in their tapas, small plates or appetizers that can range from hot to cold, meat to vegetable, and everything in between. It is these tapas that I will be focusing on for my review!  Of course, they bring out bread for snacking on while you wait -- though the real surprise was in their butter, a light honey and almond affair that made the bread itself very irresistible. And again, their taps are broad enough in range that you could get any combination of them and have a complete meal! As I came in during happy hour, I ordered tapas from both the happy hour menu and the regular menu.  The photos I've included in this review show the wide range of food I ordered -- particular highlights include the petit filet mignon ( so tender and flavorful ), the apple and manchego salad ( surprisingly light and perfectly sweet and savory ),  the ham and cheese croquetas ( crisp, very flavorful, and VERY addicting ), the pork empanada ( rich with deliciously flaky pastry ), and the chocolate tres leches cake for dessert ( so good! ).  One may recall that Firefly was in the pews a while back due to a food poisoning incident, which admittedly made me apprehensive about coming in to try the food in the first place. I'm happy that I came in despite my apprehension, though -- regardless of what one orders you can easily find something you'll like on this menu. Do yourself a favor and come here! You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite Filet -- 5/5. Tender filet, great garnishes; this could easily be a separate course by itself!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Tres Leches -- 5/5. Rich, sweet, indulgent, and a great way to end the meal!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas. 3/5 -- the sauce was good, but the meatballs were so-so...

eS4Ih2IK704T3UlNu4C9GQ.text: FireFly  Just had a great dinner at @fireflytapas  Had a few of their Tapas plates. Enjoyed the Fish Stick with a small salad. Then moved to the Lamb Chop with lentils. Accompanied by a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and finished it with a chocolate cherry bread pudding. The service was excellent and I 100% plan to dine here again.   Service: 5/5  Food: 5/5  Would I come back? Yes

jkGVpECDYFPnLPETfJWDDA.text: I want to give firefly more than 3 stars! But I can't. We were a party of 9. While the wait was only about 30 minutes for just us, there was def. confusion at the hostess stand about our tables. Service was fine -- quick. Food was average.   Bacon wrapped dates and the roasted red peppers with mozzarella cheese were favorites. The garlic shrimp was also good. I didn't prefer any of the meat dishes we ordered.

FpiVdLgD13hfRqN5rsmrrA.text: Made reservations and when we arrived we were promptly seated. We opted for the bar top in lieu of a booth and it was perfect!   Our waiter was accommodating and knew the menu in and out and gave great suggestions from each of the menu sections. He was prompt with our drinks too! My friend is preggo and wanted a fun mocktail so he brought back something she loved without alcohol.   We only ordered 4 plates (he suggested 2 per person was the norm). Pork empanadas, the bacon wrapped stuffed dates, artichoke toast and a meat skewer   I don't like dates but the waiter said they were very popular so I dove in wanting to plug my nose just in case they were disgusting and wanted to spit it in my napkin. Buutttt....they were freakin awesome!! The almond in the middle was a nice touch!  You've gotta try these!!  Artichoke toast - i love artichokes and sauce and the aioli was yummy.   Empanadas - the pastry was not doughy, it was light and absolutely perfect!! The pork was tender as well. No complaints at all!  Tierra y Mar Skewers - Loved these!! There was grilled shrimp, filet mignon, chorizo sausage on the skewer and topped with salsa verde - makes my mouth water thinking about it again.   It was pretty loud in there but it didn't both us at all.  Parking I read is hard but, we didn't have an issue, although we did come on a Thursday at 6:15. By the time we left the lot was full.   There are so many other things I want to try on the menu so I'll definitely be back to explore more.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Erk9yuXD455vFsX0So-8Yw.text: random notes:  Many tapas options.  The plates are on the large side of small plates.   Busy on a Tuesday at 7:00, but no problem getting a table without a reservation. Full bar.   Complementary bread.   I had the chorizo clams and tierra y mar skewers --shrimp, filet mignon, chorizo with salsa verde.  I swear, chorizo counts as a vegetable -- trust me.   Service was good once someone noticed I was there -- not quite that bad, they were busy.  Wine Tempranillo matchbook -- 9 oz pour! Light but maybe a blackberry note...totally did not go with the food I had.   If I lived in Vegas, this would be a great place to go after work for drinks and appetizers.

fdHpa5lRcnxxPdPti2ZC1A.text: Plenty of parking spaces.  Nice Ambient interior.  Servers are very helpful and funny.  Food was fabulous. Many tapa plates were ordered, such as, scallops, beef, pasta, and even a seafood paella    The seafood paella can feed a family of 4-5.  Yes it was that large!  I had a great dining experience here.  If you have not Been to this restaurant I definitely recommend.
