hbl5rL_DFgw3U8SMJrj5Fg.text: So many good and reasonably priced plates here. The staffs were very friendly and good looking. Went three times while on 5 days stay in Vegas because of its attractive menu and good service. You might have to wait for a while on weekend nights though.

ZrOrR3aLr-8LZg0aDkl_9Q.text: Great location, near the strip. They have a fun selfie booth inside to remember your experience, random but fun!  We started with the red sangria pitcher- only 33$- and very tasty! Four of us decided to share a few tapas-  "Crab cakes" - be mindful that the "" here matter- these are vegetarian and have no crab. Oops! They were okay in flavor, different.  Calamari - lacked seasoning, just eh  Tierra y mar skewers - these were AMAZING! Shrimp, steak and sausage with a verde sauce. The plate comes with three skewers, I could've eaten 3 whole plates!  Seafood paella was good and big enough for 4 to share (with some to spare). Good flavor, but takes 40 minutes to cook, so if you want it - order early.   Overall good location, good food and drinks and a cool atmosphere.

aLqUTK_AicwC_FZ3l5dUKw.text: This place has some great Tapas. Good for large parties and even small groups. It is quite loud here - the ambiance is nice, no overpowering music. However, because they always have large crowds, it can be hard to hear your table mates.  The food is good - the have an extensive menu for both food and drinks. I haven't tried everything, but we ALWAYS get the paella.  This time we got the chicken and also the seafood. Both were delicious, cooked to perfection.  To drink, we have the Sangria - it's got a good amount of fruits in it and hits the spot.

iuH_E4om0Zll8Ta-CxPwFw.text: I enjoyed the tapas here which were reasonably priced for the potions. Customer service attentive and the ambiance good for a group setting.

hNtAhL-sIAs0DuElgFKqLw.text: Now, I used to be OBSESSED with this place. But since the many changes over the years its not my go-to tapas anymore.  I usually come here for happy hour with a few co-workers and we order a few snacks and drink pitchers of Sangria.   The food doesn't blow me away like it once did. I did try a few new things recently but only managed to snap a photo of the scallop escargot. The butter was delicious but the scallops weren't really pan fried so it was lacking texture for me.   I also don't come here during convention season so they won't see me again for another 6 months hehe.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop Escargot.

btvzds4iL0JvsLORIAOvGg.text: Small bites and they are all good. I believe the recommendation is that you order 2-3 dishes per person. I've been here numerous times and never had a bad experience. Great Spanish wines, sangria and a full bar. Food wise make sure to order the empanadas and pretty much anything else on the menu will be awesome!

TOWZlP26fcxS02MQ3NvZzA.text: So I have to update my review because I'm blown away. Aldo was the busser and he took care of us so well. He was completely on top of our refills and clearing our table and he took our order a few times. Thank you so much Aldo for redeeming firefly for me. The food was also fantastic as always but really tonight was all about how fantastic Aldo was.

DYwOnINNErhob8L4aSzH7w.text: The tomato bread was amazing and the Serrano sliders tasted so good. Every thing I had was delicious.

FaCllibKDiEidKnt8ZdiUg.text: Mediocre food, super fast service, good sangria.  Unimpressed with the four dishes we had. Lamb chops were good. Polpo overcooked. Again; very fast service. Fed and full in under an hour on a Friday night.

9mHIYryqvS9fOucE8D94Ew.text: We were looking for a decent place to dine at midnight. It's Vegas, so I figured there had to be something open. They served tapas until 2am and had excellent reviews, so I initially thought it was perfect! However, I came across multiple articles on how this restaurant just couldn't get it together with health inspections and multiple cases of food poisoning. I was skeptical, but I still decided to take the risk!  We ordered the firefly fries - good for a big group to share, but not worth getting for 2 with all the other options. The Tierra y mar skewers with salsa verde was "ok" - I wouldn't order it again. It just wasn't special and I've had better. The manchego mac n cheese gave me a mini heart attack with every bite, but those basked pasta shells were delish! The chicken tinga empanada was excellent, but it left me wanting more of it! The camarones a la Diabla had a real sweet and spicy kick to it. It tasted like it had quite a bit of siracha. It was tasty, but not my favorite.  The last item was the bacon wrapped dates. I do not like dates, but these bites were little pieces of heaven. Sweet and salty, with an almond crunch in the middle. I still couldn't believe how good it was. I don't like dates, but I liked these! It comes with 5 per order, so perfect for 2-3 people.  The evening was topped with the trio of gelato - vanilla and chocolate were good, but not as good as the pistachio flavor! Love love love! We also ordered the chocolate tres leches cake to go. Our server said it was a must have, so I wasn't leaving without it. Hopefully, it's still good tomorrow!  I gave this review 4 stars because of a couple things, the hostess wasn't very friendly (our server was good though) and there were so many options on the menu. They should really cut it down and focus on the items that are really good. Not everything we ordered was that good, I will only rate a restaurant give 5 stars when ALL the food is excellent.   I might go back next time I'm in town, in depends how good this chocolate tres leches cake is.

0cewBfE8SF3Eq3Wf6zqOBQ.text: It is good! Food is delish tried mushrooms, Mac and cheese, scallops, and lamb chops. Service was super good and very professional. Can't wait to go back!

H29IJJqjKydhk8AghSUt0w.text: delicious tapas!! the food was amazing and so was the ambiance of this restaurant. Great for date night, so intimate and some-what dark inside. Great place for dinner and drinks OFF the strip

_r0aGKrJD-gPBwrqmPdW8g.text: This is my favorite place to go for drinks and appetizers. On Fridays the paradise location has salsa nights. It's a plus to get to see people dancing and having a good time. Love the stuffed dates, apple salad, empanadas and beef sliders. You have to try their sangria, they offer a white and red sangria. They have different flavored mojitos which taste amazing.

vz71aNSoabfwg0ez5rBZ6Q.text: Been here about 6 or 7 times in the last 12 months. Unfortunately it's been slowly getting worse every time I go. The last time was the worse. The food was cold/lukewarm the drinks watered down and we were basically told it that's the way the dish/drink is prepared. Even though its something I'd ordered many times. The rest of my party had been there independently of me and felt the same way some stating this would be the last time. The service was not at fault and she did remove an item from my bill I could not eat. But the food quality unfortunately as not as great as it once was.

Al85OZ607e94r8dZ3LwYpw.text: Hands down, my favorite place to go to in Vegas for a nice dinner. Swanky atmosphere, good service, and great food. Their pitcher of strawberry mojitos is my fave!

MF_97NQFQnUu2qGsPVt7aw.text: The new place is very nice. Great bar, great staff, great food. A good variety on the menu. TVs in the bar and a good Happy Hour.

4FmTZWRTQszao7kRh6LzTg.text: Place is great, food is awesome! Great service ! Don't listen to the bad reviews from long ago! This place is awesome

govFD0ySNyjB-aBQD2hDWw.text: Read great reviews about this place but wasn't so impressed. This could be because it was not very crowded night given the off season. Tapas were good. If you're thinking of ordering entrees, the her roasted chicken is really good and flavorful (decent quantity too).

N45uNCwDIGM6Z_QVBF4fEw.text: We picked Firefly for our 11/12 wedding reception, as this was frequently one of our favorite places in Vegas for dinner, and they had a nice banquet room, big enough for our party (45 people). I communicated primarily with Regina to set everything up. I'm a project manager, so I tend to over communicate, and communicate frequently, and expect the same in return. Sometimes I would have to follow-up for a response, which made me hesitant at times, but on the day of the event, it was clear that everyone (including all of the vendors) had communicated just fine, and Regina had everything set up perfectly. Our other vendors included a DJ, Elvis w/ Showgirls, & a Desert Bar. We had a bar set up in the back for our guests, and we thought they did a great job separating the rooms for cocktail hour, dinner, and dancing. The best part, Firefly's food! It did not fail. I was nervous that if we had a lot of food, it would come out cold, and slow. I was wrong. It came out hot, and quick. The only complaint from my guests were that they wish they knew what was coming out- as they ate a lot in the beginning, but didn't realize how many courses there were. My Grandmother wasn't a fan of the food (very different for her!), but they were so nice to make her some ribs with no sauce, and she was happy. All in all, we were very happy with our event at Firefly, and I was glad I didn't need to worry about a thing! Thank you!!

TaMWeoASVXkjDGaKF6qy7g.text: I always come here with a group of my friends because we are big fans of their sangria! This place accommodates big groups with convenient varieties of tapas available. From my past visits I have never ordered an actual entree because I'd usually get full off of their tapa's menu but my friend ordered a steak entree, which was pretty big and presented nicely. The food is okay but in my opinion it is on the pricey side for certain items you get. The environment is a bit dim inside setting a relaxed ambiance. The first time I came to their restaurant it was hard for me to see others in my group on the other end of the table because it was so dark. However, the other times I came after, the lighting was better. Customer service has been okay, they are nice and try to get our orders in as quick as possible. The wait is pretty long but Firefly is always busy so it is expected from this type of business. I have been a consistent customer for the past 4 years since they moved locations and each visit they get better and better.

d4CJKeJR9Grhs1p-hUk5sw.text: You will not be disappointed when you hit this tapas place off the strip.  Food and service is outstanding.  I highly recommend to people who are not too hungry and are looking for some snacks and spirits.

zn2SuGzoLUExB_31uqbLgw.text: I recently used Firefly for my wedding cocktail reception.  We did a destination wedding with only 18 of us, so I wanted somewhere small, with drinks, and food for after the ceremony before we all took off to party on the strip.  This place fit the bill perfect.  The Food - It was amazing.  We only had the passed appetizers, but if this is any indication of their menu, then omg we are definitely going back for dinner the next time we're in Vegas. We had the bacon wrapped dates, the ham and cheese croquetas, and the steak and mushroom skewers.  Everything was delicious!  Our guests had nothing but good things to say about the food.  The atmosphere - The decor was nice and fit the theme of the restaurant.  Everything was clean and well presented.  The area where our reception took place was private and well decorated.  The staff -  The staff were awesome.  Everyone was polite, attentive, and very professional.  When we arrived at the reception there wasn't any seating or low tables.  I asked one of the staff if we could please get some chairs.  We got a full seating, I was so thankful as we had people who needed to sit and ladies in heels looking for a rest.  Booking our space was easy.  We worked with Regina who was friendly and responded to my emails quickly.  We were able to make last minute adjustments to the reception due to last minute changes with our guests.  Why 4 stars.  I held back a star due to how our reception ended.  As we were winding down staff started coming in and moving tables, clearing our cake, and bar service ended.  The clean up went on for about 10 minutes before the staff came over and very politely asked us to please wrap it up.  Our reception was from 5:30 - 7:30, and I checked my phone thinking we must have gone over our time.  It was 7:20 when I checked and I estimate they began cleaning up around 7:10.  While not the end of the world, I was a bit miffed that time that I had paid for was basically shorter than I expected as staff closed our reception down about 20 minutes early.  Again, not major, but if I were to ever do it again I would make it clear I want my space for the full time.  I still highly recommend this place for dining or an event.  I know that I will be back when in town again.

PQgXBv06xoYzECkq9M5ypA.text: My friend David obrought me here this place it was amazing irina was our server and the food was so tasty

b_kAhi5twUdLBLlzJZ8BkQ.text: Best tapas restaurant in las vegas.  I can't get enough of Firefly and you can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  If you want to impress your gf, wife, date, etc., take her here next time you're in Vegas.  It's just a few blocks from the strip but worth the drive.  It can get pretty crowded during dinner time, so you might need a reservation if you're not prepared to wait.  I highly recommend their bacon wrapped dates, even though the portion size on this particular dish is pretty small.

hm0wHLzqbBKKUBvVmllDJA.text: Seriously, I love this place every chance I get to go.  The Red Sangria is excellent, if you want to drink alcohol and enjoy the taste too.  I love the bacon dates, firefly fries, albondigas, and Tierra y Mar.  The food was quick, drinks were 5 stars, and the general manager Carlos was nice enough to allow us to use both of our groupons.  Service was excellent and the food came out fast.  Will be returning hopefully some time soon!!!

FK88JwJlhrEb-P0yaU-jJw.text: As a previous reviewer wrote  "Stuffed Bacon Wrapped Dates - 'nuff said!"    The food is great  The prices are right  The service is great  We had about 8 different dishes from the dates, chicken skewers, stuffed mushrooms, filet, empanadas and a couple others for $65.00 + tip.    Everything tasted and great and everything was little different with a unique taste.  Well, worth the $14 cab ride.   We will definitely return when in the neighborhood.

Sb7ivsdui1uZSX8yKLkxTw.text: We had a small event in a private room and it was just perfect. Food and drinks were great and the staff was fantastic.

pQxhR8tR_danosnDlc0ALg.text: Besides the blood orange mojitos? The creamy garlic sauce, the lamb chops, the French fries that I normally wouldn't eat except these are the bomb....the grated cheese.....the salt used.....the service is usually excellent and let's talk about the vibe......phenomenal from the energy to the decor!

3aj9hbi73aA-TQfm4SIjYA.text: Every time I'm in town, I make this a must eat or die place.  I can forgo all the places Hawaii doesn't have to make time for to eat here.  And it's because I'm so in love with this place!  It's perfect for groups or dates because tapas are the best thing ever!  I have tried a lot of things on their menu, but not everything.  I hope to try everything, but there are so many choices!  And of course you have to get your favorites, too.  My go to favorites are the empanadas, baked goat cheese, chorizo clams, to name a few.  I'd probably list all the stuff I've tried, if I could.  But yes, I still have to try all.  Go with a few friends and have each person pick a couple so you can taste a variety.  I mean, hopefully, everyone would pick different items!  And the best thing to drink is the sangria.  Tapas and sangria are so awesome together.  The sangria tastes great and isn't watered down or bitter.  Trust me on this even if you don't care for wine, get the sangria!  Normally it's just a couple of us, so we've never had to wait for a table.  I know if you have a large group, you should make reservations.  There is ample parking and the service is awesome.  Kind of random though, when a person just drops food and takes off.  They normally tell you what it is.  But with me, I normally forget what I've ordered and I'll sit there wondering, did I get this?  But usually it is something I've ordered.  Rarely do I get someone else's order.  Service is always quick and friendly, I just love it!  I can't wait to return to Las Vegas to come back!  I need to try more items!  With Sangria!! Yay!!

o08EDzXQg39eeXadw5584A.text: Awesome place. Food is Spanish fusion and they don't forget that the key thing is not the "food origin" but to make good food. (Service is also great and they do offer True Spanish wines)

EIZgVW5BeMcAkKUmQ-GIWg.text: YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY TAPAS!  Chicken Tinga Empanadas must be the food of the gods! Such delicious crispy exterior, flavorful and tender chicken filling. NOTE: a single order is only one empanada.  Manchego Mac n' Cheese is another winner. Ooey gooey cheesy Mac with a crispy top layer.   SIZING NOTE: this is a tapas joint, so dishes are small. Go for 2-3 dishes per person for a comfortable meal size :)

HotoJGDT_d8JEPti7p94_w.text: This tapas restaurant has amazing food. Value is great, the choice of tapas is fantastic and all the ones we tried from gaspachos, bacon covered dates, apple mangego salad, firefly fries, ablondigas were unbelievable. We also had brunch tapas and came back twice! Best food in a long time, not to miss. Will try next their other Mexican restaurant! Congrats to Chef Villanueva and his team! Great service as well. A big thanks!

PctUc-kEhkp-p3VcbzI8ag.text: Love this place! Mango margaritas, sangria,  great tapas! I really havent tried anything that tasted bad. Wait times sometimes are long but the food make up for it!

S1gNzQTjyODlZqfXA4bb2A.text: absolutely amazing! my husband and I came for drinks/tapas and we will definitely be back. the seating was comfortable and intimate, excellent food and quick, friendly service.

NSDTJKTikr0158VaQs3BgQ.text: I have to jump on the 5 star bandwagon here.  This was a great place with outstanding Tapas and we experienced very good service.  we loved the bacon wrapped figs and the hot and spicy shrimp were very very good.  I don't put out the 5 stars too often, but this earned this big time.  And the service is was very good.  We sat down with a reservation for 2 at 8pm on a Wed, the place was packed.  At first nobody came and I thought that some of the comments about the service (negative) were going to come True. But our waiter came pretty quickly and ended up being a super great guy. Even showed us the recipe for a few of the dishes.    Off the strip and worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xS72pfHNqeSMPG5v81iYyg.text: SO in love with Firefly!   I know this place catches a lot of crap for it's mistakes in the past BUT Firefly is actually one of the better restaurants in Las Vegas these days (in my book).   I love the atmosphere and energy at Firefly; the service is always great and the food comes out quick. I take newbies to Firefly all the time and it really is because the food is so creative, flavorful, and impressive.  I have a ton of favs at Firefly that I typically order but am never disappointed when trying something new (lots of options on the menu).   *Things to note -Infused potato vodka with lychees and berries..YUM.  -Pitchers of Sangria are perfect for a group.  -Manchango & apple salad- looks plain but full of flavor.  -Any of the empanadas are delightful.  -Salmon bagels are excellent  -All the skewers are tasty, especially the shrimp and ahi.  -Tomato basil soup with the little sandwich is great comfort food -BACON WRAPPED DATES are a must-do.  -Flour-less chocolate cake   And I have yet to try stuff off the brunch menu but will sooner than later (especially the lemon blueberry pancakes).   -Unlimited mimosas and bloody's on Sunday for $20

8W6ovoRfSE9He_8JH_7xhQ.text: Came here for my bachelorette party and just had to return with my fiance...I mean husband. Lol. We just got married last night and over 24 hours later we finally come out of our hotel to have a romantic newlywed dinner.

on_Mn_R9Hgs9jSm25OWz5w.text: I love this place! I have been a few times now and it's one of my favorites. I do have to say, I feel it's geared more towards young adults. It's pretty loud in there, but it's very fun! I'll keep going back!

5ZLwmko4TDfVSrUV_kNNow.text: Fantastic food, great staff.   We go there once a year when we visit Las Vegas. The Tapas are fantastic, just order tapas with Sangria and your evening will be perfect.  You need to try this place !

AAATFeTqonW5AB7FGldkFg.text: We went at 5:30 and took advantage of the remaining 30 minutes in the happy hour which was totally worth it. Pitcher of sangria (red) regularly $33 for $18 - very tasty and strong. Solid and large selection of tapas. We ordered the Gazpacho, Pulpo asado, Camarones Ajillo, Huevos estrellados, Veggies and lentils. From the happy hour menu we had bacon wrapped dates, veggie, cx and pork empanadas. Personal favorites are the pulpo and empanadas. It's off strip, which was nice break from the hustle and bustle.

8IUvHl4bDdPbSYO_LLBzhw.text: Visited Firefly on Sunday for a friend's early birthday celebration and the food was AMAZING.  He is super picky, almost childlike, but ordered four tapas meals.  He ate everything,  as did the other two of us,  for a total of nine (maybe ten) tapas; plus he ordered bottomless mimosas. The food was SUPERB! To commemorate our travels and forever remember the wonderful experience we even bought wine glasses.  The food was so good,  we went back on Tuesday but unfortunately being wasn't an option,  the menu was limited and the bananas beignet that I fantasized about weren't an option.  We each agreed if ever traveling to Vegas again,  we'd return,  but only for brunch.

j_Zwocdq2ttuakvnKz0Img.text: I haven't been back to Firefly in years because of the crazy salmonella outbreak that happened at their two previous locations. If you don't know what happened, there used to be a location in Henderson and one where Tacos and Beer is right now (same owners). There was a huge salmonella outbreak in the Tacos and Beer location that made a ton of people sick and hospitalized, including some friends of mine. The health department then checked their Henderson location and it had to be shut down because of the health grade.   The only reason why I came back was because my friends wanted to go and it is conveniently located near our office. I ordered the Firefly burger, which was actually pretty good. The fries were a bit under seasoned but the burger had really good flavor. They have a vegan menu here too if you're into that. I didn't order sangria because I had to go back to work. I won't be coming back just because I'm still not over the whole salmonella thing, sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly burger

NB2fXlzhJt_H4MR_isRWMQ.text: Must try Lamb chops, warm spinach salad, shrimp, & veggie empanada.   GREAT atmosphere.   Light & refreshing

TMfnl5PYQTgif2I7hiilGw.text: Firefly has amazing Spanish food, sad it closed its Summerlin location the menu there had more but the location that is still open is clean the staff is friendly and attentive. Order your paella first thing it does take time to cook also ask for it to be extra crunchy, and order the stuffed dates!

wUqniS_GImROpqJRf17ArA.text: Pros: Food is pretty good Large selection Lots of vegetarian and vegan items Moderate pricing  Cons: Loud, definitely have to increase your voice level to talk to the person across the table from you Some dishes could be executed better   I came here with my friend on a Thursday night and we were seated within five minutes though the place is filled and booming. One of the most immediate things we noticed was the volume of the setting. We chose four tapas plates, albondigas, empanadas, scallops escargot, and heart of palm "crab cakes."   The albondigas which are a type of meatball in a tomato sauce with cheese were delicious and warm.   The empanadas, which was really just one cut in half was good, but maybe a little heavy. I understand that it is an empanada, but I've had empanadas that are lighter and airier. The pulled pork with the cream cheese and the aioli on top was a little much.   The scallops "escargots" were good, they came in a pesto like sauce with a lemon to squeeze over. They were good, the flavor was spot on but... I wish they were seared more for a crisp outside, they didn't have much of a crust at all, so I was slightly disappointed.   The palm of hearts crab cakes was vegan, really just a mix of vegetables seasoned with old bay and served with a mustard aioli which was quite citrusy. These were good, but not necessarily crabby except for the old bay and the shape of them. However, they were still tasty.   Overall, I'd return, but I'd likely try some of their other dishes, which isn't a problem because they have a huge variety. Our bill was $36 for four plates.

Fi0a2Fy4U2Z3qksX3r8--w.text: This new location is much larger, cleaner, and better overall than the original service. I'm glad I gave it a try because I k ow I was hesitant to.   Bravo, job well done. You earned my patronage back.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor seating.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New and improved

CUF5_cgcc10GXub0UQ3kHg.text: The food was amazing! Outstanding! Simply delicious the shrimp ceviche was just out of this world good.

FoeFJ0RKAmqAfE6dC7X0ww.text: The sauces are the stand-out. This place has beautiful , flavorful, different sauces for the dishes. Nothing is hashed out here; every dish was fresh and plump, except when it was shatteringly crisp. We ate here twice; sangrias are fruity, mojitos are refreshing.

22SnHYyUy-H9X0rK6eJ3qw.text: I literally go here every time I'm in Vegas for the bacon-wrapped dates. They are perfection. If you want some quality and sharable food, you have to go here. It's just a mile down from the Convention Center, so it does get busy when tradeshows are in town, but it's still possible to get reservations same day. It's a nice change to the steakhouses everywhere. :)

rxDcTAAFpU8j2i_3lFkT1g.text: This is a Las Vegas favorite that has been publicized and pretty well overrated. One of the only things really worth having is their sangria beyond that I like their fries and that would be it. Service isn't much to really rave about. It's always packed with annoying college kids and has so much bad rep when it comes to health code violations you will always worry about it every time you go.

ycRbR4abeK4ZNXtwGXWveA.text: This was my first time back to Firefly since the relocation. I know it was a hot spot at the other building, but I really hated going there because it was so cramped. And parking was a pain in the butt.  I'm very impressed with the new building, it's spacious and very nicely decorated.     I heard some things about the previous location being closed because it was unclean, but I felt really confident eating here, everything was 'sparkling clean'. The waitstaff was pleasant, and very quick on service. And for me (as it always was) the food was just amazing.   We got a pitcher of the blood orange mojito as suggested from friends, but It was to strong for my taste and over priced. We will stick to the good stuff in the future (Big firefly sangria fans here)    Our favorite  things to order from here are the Bacon wrapped dates (YUM), The mac n' cheese, the sliders, and the stuffed mushrooms. My bf is obsessed with the stuffed peppers also. Im not a cream cheese fan, but I take his word they're good. Also tried for the first time last night Tres Leche   The reason for the loss of a star is although its delicious I feel its a tad over-priced. Still, doesn't keep me from coming back though ;) (just not as often)

6Cu05v7U2yK1HQO1cnJDHw.text: Came here with a group of 11 girls for my cousins Bachelorette; Food and service is amazing!! Loved it can't wait to come back to vegas to eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GqIP2jZrdvRSd1TPBCgh8A.text: So good!  So many choices!  The wait staff was friendly & efficient.   The kitchen was so prompt getting tapas to our table!  We were with 2 friends and tried 8 or 9 different dishes - and enjoyed them all.  Also had wonderful mojitos that they prepare by the pitcher full !

BvJHrYinh2dDiTSoW0czVQ.text: Great place that is local. Found a long hair, manager addressed as well as server. Scallops were over cooked. Other than that good food good price.

8OhIV56fMztRr0pcS8tqvw.text: We went here on monday 03-09-15 at 8 pm with a group of 20 people.   Food and service were great.  We had the house sangria and some mojitos both were fantastic.   The food was good but the flavors were not quite as exciting as I had hoped.  I will definately be back.

c8lWERVTgTTFcu2j4t88Wg.text: After great hesitation following the mishaps of this restaurant involving the health district, my hubby and I decided to return.  The variety of foods are still amazing.  My favorites are still the warm spinach salad, artichoke toast and empenandas.    I am a BIG Mojito fan and decided to stray away from the original Mojito and try the blood orange Mojito, sure glad that I did... Super yummy and refreshing.  Staff were kind and attentive.  We will definitely be back, with the expectation that there will be no further issues involving the health district.  The reason for four stars is that due to one of the restrooms being out of order, both males and females had to share one restroom.  Before entering, I had to check with the hostess to ensure that the restroom wasn't being occupied by the opposite sex..

B-clQLCIPf69KEfGifyr1A.text: Really liked this place.  Service was good.  Really worth it to get off the strip and have a nice meal without the whole strip experience.  Tapas selection was good.  Good for kids, assuming they will eat the tapas.

JsB5J1-5M86Au7eobDgzAQ.text: We arrived around opening time and made a reservation for an empty restaurant haha.  The server was super nice and answered all our questions.  We still must have ordered wrong or ordered why too much food because half way through the meal I felt super gross and greasy.  Most everything was good but super rich.  We could have gone with less dishes recommended by the server.

foleNfiloyY4fCZcrtxaYQ.text: Oh man.... this new building and location is amazing. It's huge! Relative to the old location that they had overgrown years ago, this place is the size of Costco. But the best thing is their food is still nothing short of Yelp 5-star quality. Service is solid to! While I do miss the old location in terms of number of parking spots and small cozy feel, this place is much more suited to the amount of volume they do.

vgficKDr9DQOvu6R5M5ArQ.text: Used to love this place so much but the quality seems to have changed quiet a bit and they got rid of some of the best dishes and don't have many vegan options.

lz6b1-oSvcJb_TIw6NK4pg.text: I LOVE this place.  I am probably the only person in the world who does not eat bacon, so I have never tried their bacon wrapped dates...but apparently, they are to die for.  I always get the stuffed piquillo peppers and artichoke toast.  I love the steak and mushroom skewers and veggie empanada,   I had to deny them one star because they changed the way they make their blood orange mojito.  I was told by the manager this was due to to people complaining that it was too sweet.  Well...if you don't like sweet, get a regular mojito.  They made me a new one the "old way" but it wasn't the same.  This was a year ago.  And although I have returned several times since, I have not ordered the mojito so not sure if it is still the new and unimproved version.  It would also be nice if happy hour included food too...but their tapas are reasonably priced, regardless.

XRQlIu0ikQkuTsH1Msn1pQ.text: Before I had ever moved to Vegas I saw a food network special on firefly and I always said I'd visit Vegas for THIS local spot. The next year when I moved to Vegaa I rushed down to Firefly and it has NEVER disappointed. It is one of my top favorite local hotspots. If you love tapas this will soon become one of your favorites as well!

2IM6tn351dgHQbQjbQhMEg.text: Despite their horrible reputation.  I've never been sick here and I love the Sangria and petite filet mignon! Salsa night on Friday is so much fun.

ejvFR2m0mTN_QxcZ0LQDfg.text: Great service and even better food. Two kids and three adults and we loved everything with not a single complaint. It's off the strip but not too far and that's kind of a plus anyway! Delicious.

XacdZjw9UPlaFWZ9OHF9fg.text: I had higher expectations of this place and was a little disappointed with the dishes we ordered.  The Garbanzo Beans with spices and the shells still on them confused me, I wasn't sure how to eat this....chew and spit out the shell?  We did order a spicy shrimp dish that was the most simple of all the dishes and yet the best it had nice flavor combinations.  The Red Bell pepper dish that was stuffed with Manchego cheese was tasty but I think just going the chille Relleno route would have made this dish better it was too tart with the bell pepper.  Than there was the Clams in a tasty broth with chunks of sausage in it, that was really good just a tab bit too much sausage flavor as it took away from the clams having any flavor at all.   We also ordered a Safron type of rice that was wayyyyyy to overpowering that flavor was stuck in my mouth all night.  I'm thinking we ordered wrong and there was possibly way better dishes on the menu than what we choose.   I would give this place a 2nd chance but probably at a different location.

24Uek_Rlx1uimmimMsoUjQ.text: Came here for lunch since everyone recommends it. Now we see why. Great fast service snd amazing delicious food!

1rO-NZFtgjzkf4FPQmvO7w.text: Super tasty Spanish restaurant.  Ordered 4 or 5 tapas to eat while we waited on the made to order paella.  Everything tasted so good.  Inside seating is quiet and dark, and outside is lively and fun.  Best part is they are open late.  My friends and I went around 1am after doing some late night Fremont street exploring.  Highly recommend!

ykcB5rn3juL2fPL4CSH4PA.text: Excellent place for tapas !   Came here on a Sunday and ordered off the Brunch menu !   Definitely enjoyed the food as well as the atmosphere!  Will be back again ! Thank you :)

WDSWMvMlYfGvjFH5vo6oXg.text: We came on a Friday night. It was a Latin night. We both ordered the spicy beef salad. The beef was seasoned well and the dressing was amazing! I couldn't enough!

NYBOBNsCrJ3MmAjd6Z5a9Q.text: This is an easy restaurant to rate 4-stars.  We discovered it through the reviews of other Yelpers.    The service was excellent, food very good, reasonable prices, unique dishes, nice atmosphere, easy parking.  It's where the locals eat, as well as the folks you see performing for you on the strip.    It's where you will spend half of what you will spend on the strip, and get double the quality.    We would check this restaurant out again next time in Vegas.

LRWrZ5KTiC3Ku2sNIsmyBQ.text: Finally ate at this new location, twice in one week.    Happy hour: Monday-Thurs 3PM-6PM, Fri 3PM-5PM.  The night I came here with a party of about 25 people it was a disaster.  Food was great but service was horrible.  When I say service, I mean only the waiter.  Drinks took forever to come out, refills bahh, food plates remained on table as more food was being served, and we never got bread.  Can't split checks, come on upgrade your system.  - 2 stars.  Came again for happy hour with just one other and the food still tasted great.  Bacon wrapped dates still delicious, mango ribs still killed it, firefly fries, sangria, everything was just as good but with better service.  - 4 stars.  If I ever come back, it'll probably be for happy hour.  And I would definitely recommend Firefly's for one of Vegas' best happy hour option.

5X8OykLCFK4TeLXv262D0w.text: Okay the food is good! Not the best I've ever had but it was good. Waiters seemed a little freaked out because I was with my potential sugar daddy. They were still attentive and nice. It seemed pretty average tho. I sat outside in the patio and they had those fans that have mists or whatever. And you know it gets hot in Vegas lmao. But yeah nothing too special to be honest with you guys.   The salads were good, I'm not a salad girl but I'll f*ck up a salad there for sure. The empanadas have a freaky texture but they're packed with flavor and I know you're asking hey why is this place average tho ..  Listen up it just didn't wow me like I thought it would.

7_TXmiAFCydkNH2rL_l3DA.text: We went there last night ..... We call first to se if we need a reservation the girl over the phone was super nice *****+ Jessica I think was her name . We got there sat at the patio  nice ambient.  We mentioned that we gave a Groupon  .. Well I use those before always is a funny reaction with the server but not there we got super service!  The mojitos strong  and nice flavor  We try 9 diferentes tapas all delicious but we did not like one of them they replaced with out a question . THANK YOU JESUS ... that happen to be the server name  Even the mgr was nice and friendly . Great great experience ..

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My on surf and turf creación

QVPrxce-rdHgkh6Mr0bnMQ.text: Came to Firefly for our last meal in Vegas before returning home to NYC.  On a Sunday night there was a wait which speaks highly of such a restaurant.    Atmosphere: Typical tapas place.  Not a complaint at all, but don't expect anything above and beyond in terms of atmosphere.  It looked like a nice date spot. In fact we sat next to a couple on a birthday date and honestly it looked perfect. They even had a private photographer who came around and took photos.  Food: I feel like we ordered a ton of stuff, ironically my favorite dishes were the roasted vegetables and the grilled peppers (not sure what they are actually called). I've been back for over a week and I'm still thinking about those peppers, they were the perfect blend of sweet (not spicy peppers) and salty.  My other favorite dish was the scallop "escargots".  I must admit, they did a fantastic job with this dish.  The presentation and flavor was spot on.  Firefly escalated a scallop dish in an inventive way that I have never seen before, and I always appreciate that.  We didn't drink or have dessert so I can't speak on either of those topics. I would definitely come here again.

THisD_NjOuZcPIPeUzoZOw.text: Great sangrias! Great vibe.   This is a great place to get away from The Strip. It's got a mix of locals and travelers. It's more laid back and not crazy feeling. So I like the vibe. It feels like a not-so-crazy Happy Hour. The lamb chops were good. Paella was average. For a Spanish-style place, I expected better paella. Bacon wrapped dates were great (but isn't bacon wrapped anything)?! I love their sangria.

eVGD2_Kqt0-3mbajVq3kGg.text: Coming off a bad dinner at Wicked Spoon buffet at Cosmo the night before, Firefly made us wonder why anyone goes to the buffets on the Strip. Parking was free and plentiful behind the restaurant, although rush hour traffic made it a bit difficult to get to. We timed our visit to take advantage of the Happy Hour specials and had the inside dining area to ourselves at 5pm on a Wednesday.   We started with a beer and a sparkling sangria ($5) which was both strong and sweet! We got several of the $4 tapas specials to sample and share including the wonderful French Fries and some rather standard little Meatballs. The "must try" Stuffed Dates were delicious and I am craving that sweet-salty flavor combo now as I type. The blue cheese really makes the dish. The Apple Manchego Salad was light and flavorful and went so well with the other heavier plates.  We saved room for dessert as the Chocolate Tres Leches ($7) stood out to me and the Chocolate Bread Pudding ($7) caught my husband's eye. Both were delicious and he finished the bread pudding, but the Tres Leches cake was definitely meant for a crowd! Mmm, all of that for only $40 plus tax and tip!

EfCrT2M0w8rwPEhCRWKlkw.text: Huge fan of the regular tapas and desserts. Tried the brunch today and was so disappointed. Patatas had no flavor, eggs Benedict was dry, mimosa over priced, the home made strawberry jam wasn't just impressive. Will stick to the regular menu.

Zmg-EO6be6fW80_gZ3xFig.text: I came here with friends for restaurant week. I liked the busy, dark atmosphere, the food was good, and my friends seemed to enjoy the drinks.   I enjoyed the mixed paella, though I wish the seafood portion was a bit bigger as compared to the rice. The tapas I tried, albodigas, shrimp diablo, dates stuffed with almonds wrapped in bacon (so good), and shrimp ceviche, were all good but nothing was so outstanding that I would make a return trip.   I'm glad to have tried to the place at least once. The other members of my party seemed to be having a good time, and so did everyone else in the restaurant.

OHI9OrnOJm5g1No8v3plzw.text: Best damn Tapas in USA and bar none best servers, service and Atmosphere for Lunch or Dinner. Great for Couples, Families, Friends and Business trip.  Have never had a bad dish and reasonably priced so you can order 6-10 items!! The best!!

eGeA_Bt4nQ_GXfQIGc_1SA.text: My friend and I went here for happy hour and had some really great tapas and pretty good sangria. Our server was friendly and attentive, and he helped us pick some really good food. Four regular tapas plates plus dessert was more than enough and the price was pretty dang good. The sangria pitcher was both tasty and generous. We especially recommend the carrots!

p_Zuu4YdNOH4pBO26wadRA.text: Shrimp Ceviche - delicious.  Fried Calamari - lightly fried and the spicy tartar sauce was yummy. Firefly Fries - came with parmesan cheese on them and an aioli sauce on the side, heaven. Garlic Bread w/ sweet creamed butter - bread was soft and the butter was mixed with some sort of spices... sad when we finished the plate. White Sangria - sweet and tart, not disappointed.  FINALLY Dessert Platter!  Caramel Flan - I HATE flan, this one changed my mind. Did not have a rubbery consistency which is what usually turns me off. Lemon Berry Tarts - sweet and tart, perfect. Lemon Berry glaze on the tart was delicious. Mini Cheesecakes - creamy and came topped with a strawberry. Yum. Chocolate Tres Leches Cake - amazing.  Food was so delicious and the service was fast. Irina was our waitress tonite and her busboy was ON HIS GAME. our glasses for water were rarely empty more than 2 minutes.  I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS. Another bonus perk is that it's a quick walk from the Fairfield Marriott

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. See the review to check out what we ate

wgRm31mNhxAM2NtHT3eiPQ.text: Favorite restaurant in all of Vegas. We've made trips to Vegas planned around eating here. The service is always great. The sangria is amazing! Happy hour prices can't be best. The best tapas are the bacon wrapped dates and the croquetas. Their chocolate tres leches is delicious! Definitely venture off the strip to go here!

HIsOrOgROXZEOQLkbieeKA.text: Very fun and lively place for a late dinner with loud music and great people watching. Tons of large groups with bachelorette parties. We had a late night dinner @ 10 PM and ordered a pitcher of red sangria, stuffed dates, skewers, firefly fries and other tapas. The place was very busy on a Friday night so different people helped with our service. We were seated next to the kitchen and can hear all the hustle and bustle.

79OU3WSYd2kRXBW2GovKzw.text: Goodness on a little plate, or two, or three.  I had the Tuna Tartare and calamari; both are great.  Service was great, very helpful and suggestions were on point.  It's off the strip, so prices are reasonable and not crazy busy.  Would go again, just to try more plates.  Cheers and enjoy!

iXSqtKqGPtBAXAvQ59QE2w.text: I'm one of the lucky ones...  I ate here twice back in the day, and never had an issue or any negative repercussions.  In fact, we really enjoyed it.  Now, I'm simply afraid to return...

ZSh5cJsc0p40rJE1LnQa7w.text: Like most people I was a little nervous to consume food here again but I also think once an establishment has been caught doing the unsanitary things that they are guilty of that that they are now on their best behavior.  Firefly's new space is larger often making it look like it doesn't ever get crowded.  I also appreciate the fact that unlike the old location you can actually have conversations here without yelling or feeling like you are sitting on top of each other.  I have now been here for a private function in a back room, sat at the bar for apps and drinks and most recently for a birthday celebration.    I've never had a problem with service.  The dates used to be my favorite but this last visit they just seemed watered down and I don't think I will order them again.  The mango ribs, however, are a must order.

Qlb5iwdy26_D2VfAW6j8lQ.text: Great for a large party. Good food, loved the dates, sangria, everything we had was really good!  Days later our group still talked about our experience there!

au0fuJMeK_iO_PViiNSLjA.text: Came here with my friend who is a local in Vegas. This place seems to have a few delicious choices on the menu. Bacon wrapped dates, escargot, mac n cheese and much more.  They offer a great variety of tapas and drinks. Good place to meet up or hang out with friends.

xPAxZT2ToW-KZJSFMW8Pqg.text: Pretty good food!  i just loved the ambiance of this place.  The portions are a little small, so you have to order more dishes to be full.  But if you just want a light bite to eat, this place will definitely hit the spot.

wTvsQgT891uKd2h4G_IVZQ.text: Amazing! Came here for my birthday dinner celebration and had one of the best meals ever. Great food, drinks and vibes. Highly recommend and will definitely be back. Our sever, Eder, took amazing care of us and made the experience all the better.

7SDyRt4ClSk_GHt_amUBUg.text: Great place! Food is spectacular. Favorite tapas dish is the bacon-wrapped stuffed dates; just amazing! Everything we had was really fantastic.  - Bacon-wrapped Stuffed Dates - Tomato Bread - Baked Goat Cheese - Chicken Skewers - Albondigas  So good!

wkhK-V_BSON0xzVbB70Q0w.text: We came Friday night around 6:30, and there was no wait. How lucky are we!! We sat down and Alejandro took our orders. He was friendly, courteous, and helpful. We ordered the seafood paella, lamb chops, bacon wrapped dates, and the shrimp cervici. The dates were a bit too sweet for my liking. The lamb chops though tasted perfecto!!! Yummm.... The paella was cooked great but a huge portion and it came after the tapas with good timing.   All in all its a great place to be and the service was excellent thank you !!

5sJ139Bwy7zE3bSjoKe9TQ.text: Came here during the week and had great service all around. The host and our waiter had great customer service and anyone who dropped food off at our table were very friendly. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is fantastic!! It's been a while since my husband and I have been down here so when we went it was the exact same delicious food! Can't wait to come back again real soon!!

2wNzDONqEW67yZ0nVM8ndA.text: I don't know what to add that hasn't already been said. Great food, very attentive service, and plenty of tapa options (some authentic, some more of a latin fusion, but all delicious). We didn't have a plate we didn't enjoy, and lets not disregard how reasonably priced everything was!   Recommendations: Chorizo clams, tierra y mar skewers, & stuffed dates.

UoFY3rR3DqX3YCgRkiU09g.text: This place has been my favorite place since they were in the smaller building just right next door. I am glad that they have moved to a bigger restaurant. Being that this is me and my now husband favorite place to eat, we love the atmosphere, but of course the food and the RED SANGRIA.  Being said, we just had our wedding reception there in the patio area. The outside is very nice, the hanging light bulbs, the red and black walls, everything about it made my reception amazing. Ana, Alejandra and their staff was amazing.  Instead of ordering per person, we ordered from the tray menus. We ordered about 5 trays for each 15 different tapas. My guests loved the food and they got really full and the food were still coming. LOL. But they were able to take to-go, which is good, so food doesn't go to waste. Plu, our 4 year old son has severe food allergies to all 8 allergens, they were able to accommodate that and my son loved his baked chicken.  I also was able to do my own kind of decorations, i was also able to hire a DJ, a photographer and a photobooth without going through there vendors. I had a Sweethearts table, a guest sign in and Cake and Sweet Bar. By sketching out how the tables are going to be set up, i was afraid it was going to be tight, but it wasn't...i was able to have a decent size dance floor and still had space to walk around.  I didn't want a big normal wedding reception, I wanted something different, and I am glad I chose this place. For anyone who is trying to do an event, nothing big or extravagant, I recommend inquiring with Fireflys.

kHvJN1Omab4zDnjehs6Ecw.text: This was an excellent tapas option, with reasonable prices and delicious food. Additionally, they have a fairly extensive gluten free menu, which was an added bonus for our party. The atmosphere was great for a dinner before a night out on the town. Must-try dishes include the ever-classic bacon wrapped dates, the ahi tuna skewers, and the ribeye. Additionally, I didn't try the paella, but the sangria was decent.

sIxgrDM13Y-ADe4FVnW90g.text: Neil our server was really attentive and friendly. I'm only giving 3 stars because the food was just ok. I felt like every dished lacked something. It was alright. Nothing special. Met up with a friend. we got two cocktails, the fries, meatballs, and apple salad off happy hour. I ordered the tuna tartare off happy hour. It was good, but like I said nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ky_hLpcDmBYLQPOzS_wxQA.text: Been here several times and never had a bad meal. Friendly, quick service. Great atmosphere. Decent prices. I love Firefly.  Update:  I've been here many times now. Everyone I take here loves it. Every meal I get is great. The only issue is that it is PACKED on a Friday night. It's awesome.

3ZoYv-3QCWzASkNzQra9NA.text: I've been a regular for many years & I enjoy the food & the fun vibe of the place every time I go. Yes parking there isn't the best but I've had worse. It can also get very busy which is annoying but that means it's popular!  The food is amazing & sharing small plates is always fun. The service this time was excellent! Two hot Latinos, always fun! The pitcher of sangria always gets me tipsy & I try as many things as I can!  I also want to comment on the usage of the color red here, it's super sexy!  I wouldn't do a business dinner here because it's always loud but it's great for everything else!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yah! Mushroom tart, bacon wrapped dates, ham &amp; cheese croquettes!

khocUIAuvgWtu1a_3QOkBQ.text: The chicken empanadas are so good! The place itself is a bit small and the ceilings are low which make it very loud inside. We could barely hear each other talk but the food was good!

4wmhV-SI6maTGyt1-Ncc2w.text: Probably one of the greatest secrets in Vegas! I took 16 people to this restaurant it's off the charts. The food is unbelievable, the service Exquisite, the prices so affordable, and the atmosphere sexy and exotic. We loved it every single one of us you have to go to Firefly on Paradise because you'll go back every time and we are from Colorado and California.

jE78Jn4hkVY8BXNzcRHo3g.text: So damn good. Great for a date, party, or family. Service is amazing and the environment is killer! Huge vegetarian menu....i can't what to go back.

H3PfQuqe8ygKom-I-MOwow.text: Great spot to try out if you're in the strip. They serve small Spanish appetizers (tapas). A little overpriced but they have an amazing ambiance.

q-UiHFm91OnW237fyTxU3g.text: I was skeptical to come back here, but my friend was insistent on getting tapas. I thought the food was okay, but it wasn't mind-numbingly amazing and mouth watering.  AMBIANCE: 4 - I'm not gonna deny that this is a really nice venue. It is dimly lit with very organized tables inside. Also, they let you sit wherever you want to. With the dim lights, and sitting with my best friend "alone" in the lounge--it was pretty romantic haha! The whole place is very lounge-like, and actually pretty comfortable.   SERVICE: 3 - As with many places, the service was pretty good in the beginning, and got slower and worse towards the end! Most of the food came out fast, but some of them came out an hour later than the rest!   FOOD: 3 - I don't have any food that I really want to shine a light on. None of it really popped out at me or was really amazing that it was worth mentioning. Probably the best part of the meal was my strawberry mojito, which was pretty well done!   I'm going to say this as a generalization, because this happened with all the dishes we ordered. The food taste was average to above average. But, with every dish there was major problems such as really dry meat, it sometimes tasted off or not right, or the cheese that they used wasn't as luxurious tasting compared to the rest of the dish.   In conclusion, it was good, but it wasn't great.   Lastly, I don't wanna be one of those people, but I think I should mention this anyway..My friend and I both got stomach aches not long after we ate. I had never eaten there since 2010 or 2011 and my friend had never eaten at Firefly previously.   My real complaint is that they should have kept the Firefly on the west side open instead of this one!

LQ9U9bW7mmwVPMNgJCgtIA.text: I hadn't been to their new Firefly location since the whole health department incident, but I got a Groupon and thought I'd role the dice. Wow, am I glad I did!  The new location is very nice!! It's not as dark as the old location but dim enough for mood lightning. The waiter, runners, and busser were on point! Dirty plates taken quickly, we were regularly checked up on, and the food... Whhooooweee, the food!!!  We got bacon-wrapped dates (a must), chicken & chorizo stuffed mushrooms, tierra y mar skewers, and calamari. All were soooo good!! We also got a sangria pitcher that was delicious!   We were stuffed but opted for the passion fruit (lilikoi) cheesecake bites and the lemon-berry tarts. Both were amazing. The passion fruit cheesecake may have been my favorite all night. I'll def be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the four chicken &amp; chorizo stuffed mushrooms
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts - passion fruit cheesecake on the left, the remaining 1/2 of the lemon-berry tarts on the right

ByoTyUIpP1KrOOj0_4p2Aw.text: This location is working hard for your business! The servings are generous for tapas! The mojitos and sangria are excellent! I highly recommend all of their dishes as I've tried almost all of them!  Don't forget to use your bread to soak up the tasty sauces from the plates!  Nahum in an awesome server! Thank you!

PqLExm-mJuEtrpYXxIjHyQ.text: Food rocks, quick service, great patio. Wow.  I love when I find great food and reasonably priced. Fresh salads. Had the grilled octopus,  lamb chops as my favorites.  The lady had goat cheese stuffed eggplant as her favorite.  Bacon wrapped dates were ok. I don't live in Vegas, but have this bookmarked because I will be back many times.   I don't write many reviews,  but Firefly inspired.

e35wajhluN9Tgm7kP_UkXA.text: Went here for a late night dinner. The service was great and fast ! We got about 6 items and honestly.. the bread was the best part. Food wasn't horrible just not what I was expecting. Calamari was poorly cooked and my sweet potatoes on the chicken skewers were uncooked. This place has a lot of buzz cause the environment is great

3LdliHQPuM7GdveotezMTg.text: Love this place. Tapas amazing pitchers of mojitos great bargin. Oh look, plate empty and pitcher empty because SO good. Highly recommend.

y4U3VeR2MQ99CUf8jDu07A.text: I was there for an event which had a buffet. I really liked almost everything about this place. The patio is huge and was perfect for our large group. The food was very good, especially considering that it was a buffet. The drinks were good, but a little overpriced. There are cheaper places to drink in Vegas! I would try their happy hour if I went back. (3-6pm)

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H10Rr8iolFrIjgJs3AsQ3w.text: If you are looking for great food, drinks and music, this place is it !  The service is exceptional and the food even better. Gabriel is the best., attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rNXMGq4nFL-kWNuoow7sfQ.text: The Bottom Line: One of our favorite places to eat in Vegas, proof positive that there are hidden gems away from the Strip.  Try: Tomato Bread Tomato Basil Soup Seasonal Vegetables Veggies and Lentils Patatas Bravas Firefly Fries Baked Goat Cheese Flourless Chocolate Cake Red Sangria Mojito  Pro: Excellent date night restaurant. The lightning was just right, the service was fast, friendly, and knew when to check in or stay away. The small plates make conversation easy, though you may end up talking about the food a fair bit. Everything seemed to be designed to complement each other.   Con: Ordering tapas can strain the budget, but... this is worth it. Treat yourself and someone else. :)

gliecnszkCaOx8-HSoyfTA.text: I came in for lunch and sat at the bar since I was on my own. The bartender greeted me immediately and got me a drink. Since it was my first time I asked her for recommendations. Everything she suggested was delicious. I was by myself, so I couldn't get much, because this is a tapas place so it would be better to go with a group, if possible. The three tapas I got were the apple manchego salad, the tuna tartare, and the manchego mac n cheese. Omg! The salad was so refreshing, the tuna tartare was delicious, a little spice and I love that. A little more avocado would have been right up my alley. And the Mac n cheese, total guilty pleasure. You can never go wrong with Mac n cheese. I will be back, soon, to try the other dishes.

4dTc3-TtJVtPhXibRNJBmQ.text: Amazing food! Whenever I go to Vegas this is a place I frequent!! Great food, great service! Thanks for being awesome

r7qhFCKW5yWkh2p81owdeQ.text: Rejoice celiacs - gluten free heaven has arrived. A HUGE GF menu. Choices!!!! And good choices. Tried 4 delish tapas. Would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal veges - sweet potato and Brussels - delish!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple manchego salad - YUMMM
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant cannelloni - YUM

ZcqDYCnxIkCI3QADsX6feA.text: Finally a place I can order several plates and not be judged.....   I like tapas restaurants because you get a little bit of everything and you don't need to order five huge meals to get it. The idea of tapas is to get people at your table to share so you get to experience several dishes and that's exactly what we did.  They started us off with their sweet almond butter and bread. This was complimentary and the only problem was I couldn't stop eating it. The sweet almond butter was addicting! I think I filled up on bread.   We also ordered off the tapas menus:  -The Apple and Manchego salad: Green apple, Manchego cheese, smoked almonds, and light dressing. The salad was light and refreshing if you want a healthier choice. It was good but nothing memorable.  -Veggie Empanadas: Spinach, mushroom, artichoke, herbed cream cheese in a pastry with red pepper aioli. They were served hot and crispy.   -Firefly Fries: Parmesan, herbs, and aioli.  I'm not a fry person but I do prefer thin fries when I eat them. These actually were my least favorite.   -Baked goat cheese: Goat and garlic cream cheese, tomato sauce, pesto, and toast. This was the groups favorite dish. I thought it was great for cheese lovers! So cheesy and delicious!   -Mushroom Tart: puffed pastry, herbed cream cheese and mushroom sauce. This was my favorite. It was rich but also had enough carbs to make me happy!   I also tried The New Girl drink which was house infused Vodka, cranberry, hint of Jalapeno and mint. Delicious! I loved it!   All these tapas dishes were pretty big. They probably run on the bigger side of most tapa plates.  My friends ordered two main dishes:   -Firefly burger with truffle fries   -Clams   Neither of these interested me but everyone seemed to love their food, they all were very happy. It was very busy on this Friday night so it's probably a good idea to make reservations. We came in with no reservation and waited about 30 minutes.  This place was very busy and the atmosphere was fun. There were lots of people at the bar, loud music, and I even saw people dancing. No frowning allowed in here!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly burger, mushroom tart was yummy and truffle fries were just ok.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet almond butter was delicious, go cheese was delicious, Apple slaw salad. And the new girl drink was my favorite!

TD3Rl0ONwBZXrf4Y26Aqfg.text: I really love Firefly for birthday or special events. The atmosphere is very loud and exciting. Great for large groups ordering tapas or meals for sharing. Or sit at the bar and have a few drinks with a date before heading out for the night. Saturday nights is Latin night in their private room inside the restaurant, I've never been but I've heard great things about it. They change their menu periodically including ingredients on options that have been around for awhile. I absolutely love! Their Red Sangria, at $9 a glass your better off buying a pitcher for $30 and sharing. Be careful they are strong (to my liking).   The food, tapas style, is very good! They have a ton of seafood options and of course you must have the Firefly fries, they are very garlic-y so bring some gum. I recently tried their Ahi Tuna skewers, they were decent and not too filling which was perfect to start the night with.

F7LgBWXASi5WLAFDvTZtLA.text: If you are going to add gratuity automatically (and then tax the tip... that's a first) maybe actually provide 20% worthy service and not have rude bus boys and servers who ghost us.

KUHEzSSXGKo3gMJQhkGS7A.text: Amazing small plates. Cocktails were right on point. The desert ( tres leches cake) is just out of the world.

RiDmVFBExS99ySRP6brMAQ.text: Pleasantly surprised by their tapas . Chicago beef bocadillo was flavorful .. delightful! Loved their Tierra y Mar skewers , the sauce in it was unique to me . My family also loved the petite fillet .. the sauce and the veggies with it really complimented it ... their free bread and butter was also amazingggggg.. it's made of honey , butter, and almonds . We couldn't get enough of it. Service was ok. Their photo booth doesn't work . Paella was a bit lacking for us ... specially me, because I was in Spain earlier and I couldn't help but compare The ones I tried there to Fireflies . But there's a reason firefly is called FIREFLY TAPAS. Go for their tapas !! Oh and also , for the sampler plate .. the one I liked there was the passion fruit cheese cake . Patatas bravas also was in the same level as the ones they have in Spain .

yTqZwOw8LuLn0pNlFeXnCA.text: Fire fly was on FIRE tonight! I always love the atmosphere especially on the weekdays around dinner time it's not as busy and you can request a booth for just two! The sangrias are amazing and the red one is my favorite. The ceviche tastes so authentic to me it's so limey and good! I also got the lentils with veggies which are delicious as well and the tomato basil soup is great so is the baked cod but they put too much fried onion on top next time I'll say light on it or non at all. The customer service is great he kept making sure we are good!! I highly recommend this place! I heard they have great brunch I need to try it sometime!

hrrBiwtNltwISg9DBeQi6A.text: This place is just awesome. The food and the vibe here are always good.  I've been here on multiple occasions. This place just never seems to disappoint.  Nicely decorated interior. Place was packed. Nice vibe. Very loud. Very large interior with small tables and booths. So be sure to make a reservation.   Service was good. The waiter didn't balk at our massive order for two. Be careful though when ordering the Paella. It takes a long time to cook.  We ordered the entire menu it seemed liked:  Combo Paella - Bomb! But takes forever to come out. Order in the beginning.   Stuffed Dates - Fire!  Tuna Poke with Chips - really good  Serrano Ham - really good  Fruit and Cheese platter - So good, I don't know why it's on the dessert menu  Beef empanada - Fire!  BBQ ribs - Fire  Lamb Chops - Bomb!  Han Croquettes - Would have been good but were cold  Fried Calamari - Good  Ricotta cheese served hot - Fire!  Steak/Shrimp/Pork skewers - So Good  Mushroom Pastry - Ok  Bread pudding - Really Good  Nutella sandwiches - ok  Ice cream - Really Good!  Red sangria - Bomb   Overall a great place

iA6ghqHJJX39_zzNs8RzTg.text: This place is never a disappointment the apple and manchego, pork empanadas and croquetas are always a must! It's a great place for date night very intimate place.
