Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nXFMouJ4eXEE_VJmYDgLAQ.text: best tapas and food and hospitality. I was overly impressed on how delicious everything was and the customer service deserves beyond 6 stars.  Manuel the manager and Roberto were just so wonderful to us and our party . it was an overall enjoyable experience . the food was so delicious and the service was impeccable. the tres leches, their cocktails, the sangria, and all their tapas and the main courses were absolute perfection. it was so hearty and delicious. each bite definitely had you wanting more . the bacon wrapped dates are addictively delicious.  the art in this venue was also just beautiful.  it was overall the best thing on my trip to Vegas this birthday of mine. it's a great place overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. delicious

gJdkcioLZ0Tjx2G8yjqZXg.text: Another one of our Vegas favorites.  I'm a tapas junky anyway.    Huge menu with lots of variety and quickly served.  The bacon wrapped dates are always my favorite.   But I haven't had anything here I haven't Liked!   The paella takes longer, but they warn you it will.  It's well worth the wait, and rather large so best shared.  Attentive professional wait staff and a lively bar scene.    You can sit outside if the noise level bothers you but the atmosphere inside is fun.   A definite go to, but you'll have to take a cab!

wZSKPo6fQrN0PZbsstDHnA.text: I don't recommend.  Food is disgusting. Staff is always so rude  I will not return nor will I recommend

1NJ-Twmm2N9bKuSgx5pSkA.text: Awesome!  They have a separate menu for vegetarians. We ordered patata brava, mac and cheese, empandas, Fries, tomato bread and roasted carrots. Everything was so delicious.   Drinks- 5 stars Service- 5 stars Food- 5 stars  Location - very easy to find Place- No/little wait time around/after 9:00pm.

xLUu6XtVfazQWbkE3w0MBg.text: Consistently good! I have been here twice and both times it was a great experience:)   The first time was on a date for a full sit down dinner. The red sangria is amazing..I really wanted to get a pitcher but was driving (next time I'll uber)! Got two plates out of every category on the menu and it was plenty for two people including desert.   Came back again for drinks and small appetizers before our actual dinner reservation! Sangria still just as good and so was the food. The highlights were the bacon wrapped dates and the eggplant!   Would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great tapas dining experience!!

829WeL3bxoQavN5Bfn66RA.text: Another Vegas restaurant that I was excited to try given the great reviews. But I again left pretty underwhelmed. It's a pretty big space but also busy so a reservation would definitely help. They also seem to be stricter about being on time, we were 10 minutes late and they had marked us as not shown up on open table. So just keep that in mind! Below are the dishes we tried.  Shrimp ceviche - shrimp was over cooked and it was way too much lime taste  Empanadas - good but wasn't amazing. Would've liked more than just one empanada  Stuffed peppers - a bit too much cheese stuffing. First bite was good but then got a bit sickening  Fried egg on top of potatoes (forget the name) - also was okay. Good taste but nothing special  Lamb chops on lentils - favorite dish. Would order these again  Overall if you're looking for a great taps joint I would say this missed the mark for us. We did also have a pitcher of mojito though and that was very good and boozy!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Peppers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chops
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woman adas

SEUYyUQtmurhYTC9TtNCPg.text: Delicious food.  We were still hungover so only tried the sangria but didn't finished.  Seasonal salad: good flavor and texture. I just needed veggies.  Lamb chops: winner. Good flavor. Cook to order. No gamy taste. Over bed of lentils that was very complimentary and flavorful too.  Filet mignon: cook to order. Good flavors with some roast potatoes I think.  Mussels in a creamy tomato sauce that was so delicious I was dipping to the complimentary bread in.  Calamari: pretty standard but among the better calamari I've had.  Seafood paella: good for 5-6 people of u are eating tapas. Good flavor and plenty of seafood. Does have a bit of a kick/spiciness to it.   Overall good experience with excellent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Paella
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chops

QyU913Lt0ZH84RqVRYm0xQ.text: Firefly is a great place for a fiesta. Great drinks and food. Patio is nice. Fun atmosphere. Party environment without all the typical asshattery you find around here.   It's located pretty close to where I'm at. Many people around me say they love it. They know what they're talking about. If you're with a group it can get pretty squishy inside. That also goes for the patio. Happy hour is actually a little less crazy. The later it gets the busier it gets it seems. Even late into the night. The happy hour has some great prices though.   A good place for getting crazy while staying classy. Fantastic drinks and also good food. Fun times.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good Drinks

gPIOizTouTgp2Iqv9QmEhQ.text: The food here was pretty good. The portions were that of your typical tapas. Small portions and the prices are a bit high. I've heard this place is popping during dancing time and it definitely was packed during the dinner hour.  The service was great as the server was making sure we had enough water since we didn't order drinks. The one thing we found comical was if the plates weren't stacked the bus girl would only pick up one plate.  I would go back but to try other dishes but mostly during happy hour. I believe you get more of what your money is worth going to happy hour.  I'm definitely looking forward to seeing what it's like during dancing.

XHPr6jfjzSTm6UWPu-oUfg.text: Perfect tapas place. The food comes out REALLY fast. Great ambience and a mix of a date place/group gathering.

B48mJ0wIMkt4KkrY8STT9Q.text: Best mojitos and sangria in town! Great local spot for Spanish food and cocktails. Excellent alternative to the strip restaurants with Spanish chefs like Julian Serrano and Jose Andre's.

jPRdFZCbTsT9mOAESIN_2w.text: What a beautiful and fun place! The vibe was amazing, soft music, and the place was packed when we got there at 6. Be sure to make reservations if you want a table, my friends and I sat at the bar.   Seafood paella: Delicious, savory mouthfuls of rice and seafood. The shellfish was not gritty at all, the rice perfectly cooked seasoned with so many different herbs and spices. It'll leave your tastebuds tingling! The dish can feed up to four people, it's huge!   Salmon Toast: Delicious! Nicely smoked salmon with a nice surprise. It packs a little punch, and there is a touch of citrus, which leaves you happy. I could eat ten of these lol.  Passion fruit mojito: I loved the fresh mint, and I loved the slight hint of passion fruit. But I didn't get a lot of alcohol in mine.   Not featured in the pictures, are the scallops and the chorizo stuffed mushroom. Both were wonderfully cooked to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Paella
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Toast
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion fruit mojito

IF0ND-vGdEID0TNFZsPpyA.text: Never disappoints, I can never come to Vegas and not Come to Firefly... from the outside you would never know, that your experience would be of such an elegant Spanish style with a twist of modern. The restaurant is gorgeously decorated with replica's of my favorite Spanish oil painter " Fabian Perez", with a romantic dim light to accompany it. Shortly after your seated they serve you complimentary bread and butter. Now as for the tapas they are to die for, some of my favorite's that one must try are:  1. Dates wrapped in bacon with blue cheese crumbs sprinkled over them....  The petite Filet Mignon topped with grilled onions,  The clams in this delectable coconut base, lemon grass and ginger sauce.   Shrimp Ceviche,  These skewers that had filet mignon, shrimp and chorizo (can't remember what they're called, Lol) And  Their lamb chops If you enjoy fine quality dinning and your in Vagas, it's a must to stop by for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Ceviche of Shrimp, complimentary bread and butter
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tierra Y Mar Skewers Tray
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams and short ribs

ymUqSSdRnXrLTGtkW_HDMQ.text: I've not been to this new location on Paradise and I have been remiss. The food is #%&$@ incredible.   We pull in and discovered the parking in front is solely for those with the hanging blue sign so you will need to park in back. We walked in and my mind screamed, "this place is huge and way sexier than their previous Paradise location ".  The place was packed at 730pm so reservations are recommended.   We sat at our dining table for 8... I say this because it was a table for eight and not two tables smushed together. Anyway, Alejandro was our guy but he had a team of 4??? helping him deliver the tasty Tapas as we ordered more and more plates during this grub fest...and refilling our drinks and clearing our empty platters, glasses and stuff to keep the landing strip clear for more food and cocktail arrivals.  The service was impeccable. Thank you Alejandro. Also note, we were a big group that ordered a bunch of stuff. Two of us had to leave early to pick up show tickets. Alejandro was very helpful to provide us with separate checks.   I had the warm spinach salad and I forgot the name but it was a mushroom toast with this incredible sauce poured over it... here it is... dang...  $10 Mushroom Montadito [toasted baguette, shitake, oyster, and button mushrooms, roasted garlic and herb cream, chili oil]  And this...  $7 Warm Spinach Salad [artichoke, red pepper, pine nuts, feta, lemon]  Vegetarian fare that will blow your senses away with their flavors, textures and scents.   It's the kind of menu where you can close your eyes and point, and you will select something that will make your eyes shut with pleasure and as you fight not to utter an eff bomb of delight.   Support you local small businesses.   Enjoy this place!  Oh and I didn't order them this time but the Bacon wrapped dates... dang

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken empanada didn&#39;t last long
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMGGGG this is like reminiscing over an amazing lady.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fried got the salmon toast. She loved it.

fNLOAh2oABduYdV6Fjww3g.text: We recently went to Firefly for my daughter's birthday. I brought in a cake box that had little cupcakes in it. I was abruptly INFORMED by the hostess that there would be a $2.00 fee (per slice) to cut my cake. I explained to her that there wasn't a cake in box, and that we wouldn't be needing anyone to help us with it. She told us that she needed to check with someone to make sure that that was okay. I was pretty put off by this whole interaction, and honestly made to feel like I was doing something wrong. You have to "check" with someone before even seating me and my guests? How about saying something pleasant like, 'thank you so much for choosing us for your celebration, will you be needing us to help with your dessert?'   I completely understand when a restaurant would rather have you choose their desserts than bring in your own, but keep in mind that I also brought in a party of 6 who ordered enough food and drinks that I shouldn't be hassled about bringing in something special for my daughter's birthday.

udk6N4IjnP4BPwmMW1Z-Xw.text: This place was walking distance from our hotel and had really good reviews so we decided to check it out. Because it's a tapas place, each if us decided to grab 2 dishes each to share among the group.  Great food: meatballs, mussels, skewer, 'crab cakes', complimentary bread with tomato butter spread, fries.  These were super yummy and I would order them again. The price was decent for the portion and it was cooked well.   Not so great food: avocado toast, lamb sliders, escargot, octopus, clams. These were definitely not worth the price. The taste was either bland or just wasn't appetizing.   The sangria was amazing. We gulped that down within minutes.   Service was good. Overall, I don't understand the raving review as price was a little pricey and food was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#39;crab cakes&#39;
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus

PZ5FyTINKwbri-w4q4Js-w.text: Visited Firefly over the Memorial Day weekend, as one of my friends is a local. Had a pitcher of the red sangria to share between three (approximately six glasses) which was phenomenal. Split the truffle fries, chicken empanadas, tuna tartare, and Mac and cheese. The chicken empanadas were my personal favorite and tasted very authentic. Next time I'm in town, I will definitely try the mussels.   Service was great and very efficient. Would definitely recommend for someone who is looking for small bites off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly Fries (truffle)

dsNtKJHmDlxTBmpSCAE8tw.text: SPOILER: this is a complaint (in case the one star didn't give it away)  I used to come to Firefly to eat almost every chance I got in my late teens. After the salmonella outbreak, I just went back for the dancing and occasional sangria on Friday's.   Last night totally blew! I would think that after closing down two locations plus upsizing, the restaurant would be better service-focused.   We arrived at 11pm. There weren't available seats at the bar, so we opted for restaurant seating. We ordered our drinks at 11:15 and they didn't arrive until 11:40. No apology from the female server. No apology from anyone. On top of that, she delivered them one at a time. After sometime, she was no where to be seen, but we got another server (I wish I got her name!! She might be Russian or Ukrainian). She definitely stepped up the game. Thank you!  My preference is to get up and walk away from terrible, but when you're not paying the bill, I guess you just take it *insert shrug emoji*.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile D&#39;Arbol ; back left corner table

y0FN04zro_ZKFHK4kvfGBg.text: It's been a long time since we've eaten here but it is still as yummy as before.  A few blocks down from its original location but still has a great vibe.  Food is tapas style and we ordered our go tos  Tuna tartare super fresh and light   Stuffed dates are warm and sweet. Smoky and tangy  Fries.  Herbed with Parmesan   Apple manchego salad is our fave.  Light refreshing and tangy   Lamb chops.  2 per order served with lentils  Calamari. Meh. Oily  Shrimp tempura.  So crispy and light  Beef salad.  Tasty   Octopus was tender until it got cold and then it was chewy.    Flourless chocolate cake. A bit dense

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our fave Apple manchego salad.  Refreshing
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly herbed fries
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates with blue cheese and balsamic.  Yummy!

eaFgmcVDe4WmH4RCuMJ5DQ.text: Great overall experience!   My favorite was the Apple and Manchego salad.   Great service except I think I offended a man by speaking Spanish. I thought I was being kind, and the woman that brought out pitchers of drinks just poured it into our glasses without mixing, so all the yummy fruits were at the bottom of the pitcher.   This is a place you definitely want to bring friends. It was a bit loud inside, so a bit difficult to hear. Loved the artwork.   I'll definitely be back, and no worries I'll stick to English next time.

VQMPEuJrjg1251CuyXUdew.text: I've been to Firefly a few times over the year on business and always during lunch. This was my first time for dinner and it's a different atmosphere. A little louder, certainly more people watching...but the same great food. We love small plates since we're chronic "sharers". Gabriel provides friendly and fast service. It's really a mystery how everything comes out so fast, do tell how many folks are back there cooking. A great Cucumber Mojito to start and it just got better from there. Pork empanadas, stuffed dates, stuffed peppers, Serrano ham and Manchego cheese plate, ahi tuna, and finally chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms. It's a little off the strip, but totally worth it. Stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Empanadas
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Dates

Glxq1aMbnsw-qqVacslmiw.text: We visited Firefly tapas on our weekend trip to Vegas - what a refreshing time to get off of the strip!   The food, service, patio - everything about our visit was absolutely amazing.   Our waiter was beyond friendly and tentative to our questions, additions and menu recommendation requests. We never felt like we were waiting for help and never had an empty drink glass.  The food came out so fast and each plate was more delicious than the last. We tried the Salmon Toast, complimentary bread, lamb Ffilet, a spring salad and empanadas. Every bite was loved.  The patio was adorable - plenty of seating and no wait at 7:30 on a Saturday.   I so wish Firefly was in Milwaukee - this would for sure be our go-to restaurant. I highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Toast

sIbMeBuqhWuo_KL_wXLOjA.text: Great atmosphere and the food is amazing. The cocktails are also pretty impressive with my favorite being their flowery twist on an old-fashioned. They also have Fernet Valle, which is almost impossible to find here in Vegas!  Only downside is the prices. Be prepared to shell out at least $100+ for two people!

lBbmuLe7Nouet3RsVS0jRw.text: Excellent Sangria! Cool atmosphere! Good place to go for a first date! The food was alright..some tapas better than others! Probably go back with a date...

RB6cT7DBQg0wg9PHORiu7Q.text: Some of the best in Town! I could eat the bacon wrapped dates all day! I love the selection at Firefly, but the amount of delicious food makes it difficult to not order the same things every time I go back. The lamb chops were perfect and they had skewers with shrimp/filet that were packed with flavor! I also recommend the tomato soup, which is served with Fireflies take on a grilled cheese sandwich. It brings back childhood memories in a classy way. Firefly is a great place for a date, night out with the girls, or celebration with friends. The atmosphere varies from fun to romantic,and that's what makes it such a classy place to be! I'm a wine drinker, but I will say that their white and red sangrias are both delicious

DUeLEaXVJyAe28QvRzsNeg.text: Nothing says "I love you" like great tapas and sangria. Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almonds in a red wine reduction? They were a damned fine start.   Who'd a thunk Mac n cheese at a Mexican themed joint would be good, well it was. Correction it was great (especially after a wee pinch o salt).  Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates?  And our starter was the manchego and apple salad. I wanted a big bowl of it. It was lightly dressed with chopped, toasted nuts atop. I am going to make that at home - twice.  Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates? Maybe?  Go. Have fun & eat like a local in Vegas. Bring some friends and sit in the gangster alcove in the back.

mlxH7rMhh_SueP0Yfr-ASw.text: Excellent place to have some delicious tapas!  I love coming here with a few friends and ordering a bunch of items to share.  Order a pitcher of their yummy mojitos to drink with your food.

o1RTRdFLtcF5MK2hn3h16g.text: Love, love, love this restaurant. Had one of my bachelorette party dinners here a few weeksn ago and I couldn't have been happier. The food, drinks and service were all really amazing!!! Thank you for everything!

eN7YNlRz8RomN5gDOnwu9A.text: Excellent place for lunch or dinner. It has become my go to place when in Vegas. Great sangrias and great food. You'll love the tuna tartar; highly recommend the pulpo asado and chorizo clama. Looking for something bigger than their tapas, they also make an excellent paella. There so much positives I can say, but just go try it and see for yourself.

XheLbpYywFnhdmof2N_UUg.text: A must try. The best food in town. I could eat it everyday. I wish there was more locations so I didn't have to drive far.

k9SyupySEFVYwHIKhyEl4Q.text: the place itself is nice. date night ambiance. food is very flavorful and great for sharing amongst friends. they had a dance floor outside that looked fun. only bad part is the parking situation and getting in/out of the parking. not enough room for all the people that were there. come early to get a spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas. So good!!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tempura. Shrimp was a bit over cooked but flavor was good
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork empanada. So flavorful. Very yummy!!

mKYGRdG2UGVMu_3OnEf8QA.text: Overrated.  Went here for dinner on 10/30/13.  I had a few things, including the mushroom tart - tart was cold, but mushrooms were warm.  When food is not served at the right temperature, then I'm over it.  The garlic cream cheese stuffed peppers sounded better on paper than they did on the plate.  The cream cheese completely separates from the pepper when you cut into it.  No bueno!  The best part of my meal is the garlic bread and sweet butter.  That was good!  Restaurant is dark and very large.  Self-parking in the back.  I was put off by the large number of kitchen workers taking their break outside of the restaurant that backs into the parking.  I also didn't like seeing the numerous servers inside the restaurant all chatting with one another waiting for something to do.

LRbS4jTZtUBjQrJfMEhU5Q.text: Love tapas. Love Firefly. Sad the other locations are closed. Will always and forever adore their bread and butter. Red sparkling sangria was my new venture this visit, and I really liked it. I always get the bacon wrapped dates... and then will indulge in a second order. I am a fan of their spicy shrimp tapa... can't remember the name of it but it's  sinfully good. Great place for casual business dinners, or girls night out. The border of swanky and casual- and I have found Tapas to be one of the best ways to have a social dinner. Can't wait for my next visit!

B2pY62HexDMO-AHnKPoLVA.text: The best Mojitos I've had in a while! The food was very good and so was the ambience. Small shareable plates. Bacon Dates were my favorite!!

7Pn6frd4PBykTyf-k3pHvQ.text: Very tasty food, and great service. Portions are a bit larger than most tapas, and each new dish prompted me to try another.

TZ66pPkqeogRd-aud3uj3Q.text: The original had a bit more character, it was aged and awesome. Locals knew this whole in the wall that was sooo cool and hip. The new place is new, bigger and the food is just as good and on this Tuesday evening it was packed. Yeah for Firefly. I hope they can add more locations again in the future.

FCIVZKVuh4tFZb6j6MvcLQ.text: Went for my 30th birthday with a group of friends and family and this place far exceeded all expectations. The food and service was phenomenal. The staff was very attentive and went above and beyond for service. The bacon wrapped dates are amazing! All of the food was exceptional. No one in our group left hungry or unsatisfied. The atmosphere is great, the evening was so enjoyable. There is not one thing I could think of complaining about. This was just a great time and I would highly suggest this restaurant  to anyone.

CQFKOBSB66Wld70DoJ1bUQ.text: Make your reservation now! This place has spoiled me for food. Everything we ordered was delicious and memorable. This is a foodies paradise.

ZLUCkFn7uvKXXw3nZW5rtg.text: Best meal I've had in a long time!  Service was great.  My friend and I sat outside on the patio and it was so fun, the ambiance was nice.  Our order came out one dish at a time --which was great because we were able to enjoy each tapas and not feel rushed.  This is an great restaurant and I highly recommend it.

v6wkD90MrzY9kBe53p6vEA.text: The dates are amazing. Sweet baby Jesus the pork empanadas were one of the best things I have ever eaten. The service was excellent. Also they serve PITCHERS of mojitos. Any flavor you like. Local friend recommended and it was phenomenal. Affordable and less than a $10 cab ride from Bally's.

N9Cfd3_egJYdRUfQV8KO2w.text: I've bn coming to this bar/restaurant for many years.  The food is great & the bartender Daniel is the best .. Actually the whole staff is great ..

6PaBbJSGzPKy0Wt0QKttbg.text: Amazing bacon wrapped dates... And finished with chocolate and curry bread pudding. Great service, very friendly and attentive.

5aPxiVAPi0fLxFpnnHEdDw.text: Did not disappoint!  We kept passing Firefly and being intrigued.  Their Sangria is flavorful and devine.  We ordered a wide selection and loved all.  Not a traditional paella with saffron, but rich and delicious anyway.  The butter for the bread is incredible too.

G15wLHixV-41BgMu1q9UxQ.text: I really loved eating here. It as a last minute decision and definitely worth it. The meatballs were unbelievably good and just melted in the mouth. The ribeye was phenomenal and the sauce on it was excellent. I would recommend going here. I will be going back next time I am in Vegas.

c7s0RKBexVbcYvMvrhG97g.text: Going by Yelp reviews. We chose this restaurant. We had a wonderful dinner & great loud & happening atmosphere. We love tapas and this place has something for everyone, even the in-laws who had never been to a tapas place. I definitely recommend this place. Thanks for great time & dinner while visiting Las Vegas!

BI6fqqhOgcCVmhWNtPnz2A.text: Dinner just took way too long. The food was good but it was not as great as it used to be. Things were either way too salty or not flavorful enough. The white sangria was way too sweet but the strawberry mojito was delicious.   I used to love the papitas bravas now I would have to say my favorite is the manchego mac and cheese. The service was sooooo slow.

oHVXRD-WRHSGKNudy3rtsQ.text: Best Tapas restaurant! Tuna Tartare is my favorite!

RmAwrMnkY7LJQfBgCTLE9w.text: The tapas were very tasty and they have a bunch of choices for people with allergies.  The paella wasn't spectacular but the tapas made up for it.  My only complaint was that it was very loud which made it difficult to have a conversation.

f2WPjY68U69EOxp2Ug6BJg.text: I love Tapas but this place wasn't very good at all. The only thing that was good was the bacon wrapped dates and those are pretty hard to mess up. We ordered a variety of dishes and the meat dishes were dry and the salad was bland. The service was horrible. We had to ask for water twice since they never brought us anything to drink and barely even saw our waiter. We had to ask the person clearing our table for our check. Won't be going there again.

YLu_aE7H2shv7B0skI7hJA.text: Gooooood foood! Great atmosphere good for group get togethers or even a date :) and also excellent service

AS7KEQMWh5aZ1nSqsX4ZFA.text: Firefly made my wedding meet and greet amazing!! Carlos, Lalo, Jesus, and Gabriel made sure we had everything we needed!! The food was awesome and the drinks were even better!! Make sure you check out the bigger and better Firefly on Paradise!!!!

d2_5vbMUsPKK_YiffTI1wQ.text: Definitely a tummy pleaser ! Firefly has yet to disappoint me on my birthdays or even just group gatherings with friends. Besides the delicious tapas, the ambience is set to perfection . It reminds you being at a family get together plus the music on Latin nights makes you want to dance the entire time .

_0JA-Q6KRSAVLBLS_3KIVg.text: Greqt service from Arturo and another guy. Very attentive and I was happy every minute. Great food!!! I'm so happy and I'll so be back for sure!!!

-X2d5-Lv4lRiIDvDgdMZ8g.text: i like this new location a lot, it's more local to the strip, spacious, and trendy/intimate than the Westside location that they moved from. they have an outside patio seating area, or you can sit at the huge bar in the middle, or at one of the half-moon booths or tables.  there's a strongly Spanish and seductive vibe which i'm definitely diggin' - the intimate lighting, red tones, spanish dancers and bullfighter paintings adorning the walls, the uniquely patterned wallpaper, i love it all.   definitely a place you want to bring someone special or a Ladyfriend you're trying to impress. good times will be had over their tapas, calamari, sliders, octopus (my favorite), bacon-wrapped dates, etc. the cocktails are on point as well.  -salud!

m0FH_mDtm-AA_DZoBkICbA.text: we were in Vegas with a few friends and we were looking for somewhere nice and relaxing to have a great and tasting dinner. we found firefly on yelp,read the reviews and saw the pics and I was convinced.. We made a reservation which was super convenient, we were seated within 15 minutes..place has a very trendy vibe,bar area was very appealing,and it is more on the louder side but it's only cause everyone is genuinely enjoying themselves... We ordered a few beers and a pitcher of sangria,very very tasty and refreshing.. We ordered tapas, our faves were the ceviche ,and lamb chops= super yummy.. The reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 was the service, our waiter seemed to have forgotten about us by mid dinner. Overall a pretty good experience, and I will definitely come back when in town.

zZsV0sWwhhq7VK-MlzOvDw.text: Great food. We ordered a variety of selections and it was all good including the deserts

coeDXd2ijejByMksr6T7sQ.text: Most of the dishes were fine. Not sure why all the 4-5 star reviews. The best thing was probably the stuffed dates. The kitchen forgot our order and we didn't get our food until 40 mins later. That sucked.

uCgiNVOMEt40CxvXMbgbzw.text: Smack dab beside our humble hotel, Marriott version, the Firefly was a taste and cultural treat. Tres leches were a wonderful ending.  Best way to finish was watching some salsa dancers on the front patio. So cool!

dXjShkythO2vJ4wjw_0YGg.text: Food is great, but the wait was horrible. And it is LOUD in there. You can't hear across the table. They served food to us in sperts over an hour period. So a couple of us didn't have any food while others got theirs and finished and had to wait for us. The plates are so small that you can only share a tiny bit. Food tasted wonderful though. It was 2 hours before I got my food. Not a fun experience.

B55rLjSwmzzevy4v2tUZQQ.text: The bacon wrapped dates were to die for. Those are worth making a trip to vegas for. Overall a very good alternative to getting food at the strip. You can have a really nice meal and not feel like you're spending an arm and a leg.

UpyFfaa9yaz0LKxMb9Ps-Q.text: Great food! We tried the steak and mushroom skewers, the patatas bravos, the shrimp ceviche, the sliders, and the stuffed dates. All were good and surprisingly the dates were our favorite. Also, the best service we have had over the 6 days we were in Vegas!

2um8g9lb1TSlBluc_xYLpw.text: We had a party of 15 and service was great, very attentive waiters water and drinks are always filled. Food was delicious definitely coming back for more!

AhTCvIs4lV3sNmS4d7mphQ.text: Those of you who know me or have read my reviews know that I generally only review a restaurant for which I completely disagree with the average reviews on Yelp.  I figure a great restaurant with 5000 reviews praising their establishment doesn't need another similar review for someone to wade through.  This is not one of those occasions.  I suppose I should have seen the stale, tough bread as a sign.  If I did, I chose to ignore it.  Overall, the food was hit-and-miss.  The apple manchego salad was nice - light and refreshing.  The ubiquitous bacon-wrapped dates were fine, the recommended shrimp, chorizo and filet skewers disappointing and the also-recommended grilled octopus just terrible.  Neither seafood option was fresh - the octopus was tough and tasted off, with a miss-matched sauce and generic potatoes.  The filet was fine, but the shrimp were frozen and in short supply.  The chorizo almost non-existant.  My real issues here are with the restaurant in general.  This was, by far, the most unimaginative, pretentious, poorly-executed and disappointing tapas restaurant I have ever been to.  The menu is just plain boring.  Come on, this is tapas!  Give me something exciting I've never seen before.  Give me crazy combinations and flavors.  At least give me something simple done perfectly.  I know this is Vegas, but off-the-strip Vegas.  House music?  Really?  An entrance like a steak house out of the 60s?  Pretentious waiters and bartenders who would rather talk to each other than their customers?  I have heard about this place for years, had friends recommend it and was anxious to try it.  Maybe it just can't live up to the hype.  Don't waste your money in town where great food is everywhere.  It's not worth the drive.  It's not worth the money.  It's not worth eating here at all.

aYVfzWmSircN1Db4bIhStg.text: This place is amazing!! This is a staple when we come in to town for a Vegas vacation!! I know there was some drama with a health issue. However, I am a huge germ freak and the new location is great and the staff is wonderful!! I love this place! I wish we had one in Minnesota!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another winner!! Lamb chops and sausage!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy! Bacon wrapped dates!

JYJ50ueNeU8ahmE_qzQKpA.text: I have nothing positive to say about my experience at Firefly on Paradise.  The service was the most awful thing ever.  I was in management for a Forbes rated the hotel for a long time, and I would be seriously embarrassed if my team ever acted like this team.  We were sat at a table outside, and then we were left for 20 minutes before anyone checked in on us. During this time, all the tables around us were being serviced. I watched the waiter check in with several tables. 25 minutes into this experience the busser brought waters, and the waiter came over. He didn't say Hello, he said what do you want to drink. I was expecting some type of reason why he was ignorning us. The paito wasn't that full.  He took the order and left.  During this time the manager was walking around the patio area.  I also watched the manager of Firefly mingle with what appeared to his friends and several other tables except ours. During this time, the manager made eye contact with me four times (I was giving the look of hey how's it going can you please assist me), but he failed to do anything.  He started to walk our direction, and I was about to speak up to him, but he turned his focus to a table full of young women. The service should be the focus, I can understand if you are speaking with your guests, but this was not the case.  He continued to check in on what appeared to be his friends and tables full of young women. Each time he did this he was chatting it up for several minutes.  We were still waiting for our drinks at this point about 35 minutes into our experience. At this point, we had to walk up to the bar to get our drinks because no one returned with them.  The manager also was at the bar during this interaction and failed to say anything. We mentioned our experience to the bartender and the manager could have said something, but he didn't.   Overall, the waiter seemed mad he had to work, and the only person who was doing anything positive was the busser.  We asked our busser at one point to get send over the waiter so we could order another round.  The busser walked over to the waiter, and the waiter disappeared for several minutes before coming to our table.   During this time, the waiter made eye contact with our table, and then walked away. I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt, but I then watched him walk inside and stand by a curtain. He wasn't doing anything for a good five minutes, and then he finally came back out, went to another table and walked away.  I had to wave him over, which I hate doing, because it is rude, however, there was no other way to get his attention.    Eventually, our food came out, and the waiter continued to be short with us.  The food was good, but the service at this place was awful. I think the thing that rubbed me the worst about this place was that the manager failed to step in and show any interest in our situation. He seemed consumed with talking to women rather than doing his job.  This was my perception last night.  I hope everyone else doesn't experience this while you are at this establishment. Maybe it was an off night, either way, the service was horrible.  The only reason we didn't leave was because our friend loves Firefly and it was her birthday.    I also witnessed several staff members on their phones, I can't believe this place...get your standards in with the rest of this city!

xaCorNhqr3K92l1d6pxACA.text: I have been, and taken numerous groups of family/friends, to Firefly at least a dozen times throughout my life. Most recently, however, was the crown jewel: my brother, his best friend, his bf's wife, and I, truly enjoying ourselves. Yes I have had better sangria, but FF's version is delicious, refreshing, and compliments the food well nonetheless. I cannot live without their mussels with chorizo, bacon wrapped dates, and camarones a la diabla. Our service has always been outstanding -- a couple of visits were a tiny bit more frustrating than others because we had to flag down servers, but those incidents were few and far between -- and we always leave feeling really satisfied as far as value is concerned.  So what prompted me to write this? Man, haters gonna hate. I suppose that's the beauty of Yelp, and America in general I guess. But seriously? I find it highly ironic that there is a petition circulating to shut down all Firefly branches. ABSURDITY. I'm no math teacher or anything*, but Firefly's aggregate rating goes into the 4 star range, which for hundreds of reviews is pretty impressive. I've delved deeper into this situation and found that many have claimed that Firefly's owners refuse to adhere to any standards of cleanliness or sanitation, and Firefly's owners responded by hiring a consultant specializing in health safety. I don't know who to believe -- the strange minority stepping in because they know so damned much, or the overwhelming majority of people who are pleased with Firefly and believe it to be a True Vegas gem.  I adore you, Firefly, and so does EVERY person I send over. Don't ever go away!  * Note: I actually am a math teacher

O-jMz0kN32C-7wLae5odFQ.text: Nothing bad food wise, but nothing to bring me back. Mediocre service and food. Asked for salt and pepper....get it?

-k_nz9GwapeolM1DHoGdBQ.text: Great ambiance. Great service. (Even the manager came up to my husband and I) The FOOD IS AMAZING.  Ribs, fries, seafood...all of it!   If you are staying on the strip, you have to get here to eat. You won't be disappointed!

They were a little chewy and the sauce could of been better. For the most part service was great and the food was good! I will for sure be back the next time I am in Vegas!

rRXOsGMiC6JwOIZUtsbjgQ.text: I came to Firefly for my 21st birthday, and it was one of the best meals I've had! (I could be biased since it was a pretty important milestone though.) Standouts include: Gazpacho Stuffed mushrooms Tilapia Skewers -both steak and chicken  Ironically, the raspberry mojito was my least favorite part. So much for my 21st, right? 9KwxSoKg_arRCpoFJwqiGw.text: What a bad experience!  Fireflys has been one of my favorite places for about 4 years now, even after all that occurred with the closure and allegations.   This time 13 of us went out to celebrate my friends bday. 1st they brought out all the food except my boyfriends, which arrived 10 min later. 2nd my boyfriend almost chocked on a piece of metal. He treated us like if we wanted the meal for free (we didn't even ask for anything). He never apologized however proceeded to tell us that the sangria is filtered 3 times. I don't care!! Hello! 4Lxekqwce9tWkx5ARtjNBA.text: Overall a very good experience here at Firefly. Traveling solo (no co-pilot!), so grabbed a seat at the large bar. The tapas menu is expansive, with many cold, veggie, and hot options. Very solid drink options and I chose wisely with the red sangria--not too sweet w/excess sugar and fruit--it was a perfect mix, just right.   My tapas selections were spot on:  Pulpo asado (octo, potato,tomato, paprika-lemon Vinaigrette), the Chicken Tinga Empanada (fried and good), and the Mushroom Tart puff pastry (served warm--herbed cream cheese) in "gravy". The pulpo plate had a lovely coordinated flavor and the mush tart was a light, creamy journey to loveliness.  The tapas and sangria were vehicles to the holy-land:  the Chocolate Tres Leches Cake. Do yourself a solid and share this with a pal or two--they will love you for it   I had the honor of devouring this symphony of flavor all on my own.   Service was attentive at the bar--friendly and no nonsense. Grab some friends, some drinks, and have fun at Firefly.

sflMYvWZ6K8SFiGjbmMZLg.text: I usually love firefly. And I go here quite often. But this time the service was terrible! Me and a couple of friends showed up to eat around 2:30. There was only three other tables there so it shouldn't have been a problem. But our server was not attentive at all. Her name was Jatziry. We heard about the sangria summer special and the carafes being 50 percent off if we mention that to her, so of course I did, and she stated that I "had to mention summer sangria" and that it was only for the glass and not a pitcher. It clearly said that on fireflys facebook page and I showed it to her but she paid no attention to it. Didn't get a manager, nothing. I brought it up to her again and she just ignored it. My friends and myself felt like she didn't want to lose out on a tip since it's normally 33 bucks a pitcher but damn she shouldn't judge especially since we're in the service industry as well. This makes me not want to go back to firefly because of the shitty service.

rWe9i6wpcWtkp3NKQvLTyA.text: This tapas restaurant is really very good. They have big selection of dishes, and of the ten or do we tried, everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned--ranging from the warm spinach salad to the boquerones to the pulpa. One great thing is that they are fine working with even the most limited diet restrictions--our server checked on dishes and made sure everything was up to par for me. And she did it all graciously, which isn't always the case at restaurants.   The wine list was a nice treat, with a range of inexpensive Tempranillos and Malbecs, a change from the spendy wines everywhere else (if I wanted overpriced wine, I'd never leave Anchorage). They had a delicious sparkling sangria, too, which is never heard of before.   I liked the atmosphere: dark, comfy, and great Spanish art all around. The music was fun. The space was big and accommodating.   I'd love to go back when I can eat everything again. My one and only criticism is that the flavors of what we had and what we're on other menu items was a little one-note, without much expansion beyond red peppers and garlic, both of which are good, but a little variety for the palette always helps.

n3OLkGQAUhzWAsng-Muw0g.text: Beyond excellent!  Everything was delicious and eye candy as well.   Lamb chops were remarkable as was the Pulpo. I can't wait to go again!

tcqDWw7J5-TJoh-lO10Haw.text: Delicious off strip meal. Mrs and I have now been a couple times and enjoyed it. It's easy to get caught up in ordering too much but just go for it. The food and drinks are amazing. Highly recommend the mojitos by the pitcher, and if you can get there for happy hour they are only $18.

wCURfKe-SpGggGjUqS8fLQ.text: First off, the watermelon mojito is the best mojito I've had! I went with a group of 7 people, we ordered a ton of different things & I loved everything I tried! Definitely try this place out if you haven't before!

zmJNKQf2SGrdIpS2mkOkug.text: This was my first time back to Firefly since they moved down the street. I have to say I love the change! The restaurant is bigger, more open and it looked like they had separate dining rooms for larger parties. It was super unfortunate what happened a few years ago with the food poisoning but don't let that change your mind about dining here. The food is still amazing but their prices did go up a few dollars per item. This trendy restaurant has always been my favorite Spanish tapas go-to. The flavors never disappoint! I love their tuna tartare and artichoke toasts but tonight I tried some new dishes. The smoked salmon bagels and scallops were a great pick! Larger than expected and a flavor explosion in my mouth! The only reason I can't give 5* is because the service is still amiss. Our server was friendly but he did forget to put in half my order. When the food runners dropped off food, they literally drop it and run away, instead of taking pride in the dish and announcing what it is. Our drinks were also always empty. I would understand if it was a Friday night with a 45 minute wait, but we came in on a Monday night around 9pm.  I watched bussers look at our empty glasses as they walked by, and servers huddled in groups on the floor.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop &#34;escargot&#34;
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken salad

SevRta7Bpn5kCUG6wcdm0g.text: Out of every place we've eaten at on our 2 day stay, this has been my favorite. We ordered: -Ceviche of shrimp - Stuffed dates -Tierra y Mar Skewers - Calamari  -Scallops escargots  - chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms  - Seafood paella   Everything was delicious. Not a single plate disappointed.

pgIOdB72ur62XitCPrEPRA.text: This place is always on point. Been coming here for the past several years and service never cease to disappoint. Food always good and bar tender Omar always takes care of us. Would recommend to anyone.

8xAhmaUncf61Ipf8sDjF2g.text: Overall good experience. Restaurant was a little noisy for our group but the service and food were pretty good. The ceviche, steak and mushroom kebabs, roasted mushrooms on toast, and some form of avocado toast were all very good. The tartar and meatballs weren't bad, but I would pass on the potatoes bravas and shaved beef sandwiches. The food came out pretty fast and service was quick except when it came time for the check (it was very busy though)

ZhHeSfC2xIKqLfobt0zFlw.text: Must must must stop when you are in Vegas!! I could eat there every night for 2 weeks and never eat the same thing that's how good this menu is. Have been there several times and continue to go back. Friendly staff good service. Don't miss this place!!!!!!!!

YM9yYy83O8zn-AcQyrBi2Q.text: Great restaurant good food good service the only problem is it was very loud in there For those who never been to a Tapas Bar don't order more than three tapas Per person three tapas is a lot of food we ordered five tapas for two of us and chicken and mushroom paella but we couldn't eat the paella as we were already full oh one more thing there is not enough parking in the so you have to go to the back and it's a long walk.

CGIVuReuykZrf5q-cXmUpQ.text: I went here with a friend. We were a little apprehensive at first in light of the recent history.  Their menu is quite amazing.  We ordered a lot of small dishes including Serrano Ham and Manchego Cheese, Padron Peppers and Firefly fish sticks and several additional dishes.  We were both impressed and satisfied with our meal.  We are both looking forward to our return.

wd97mFmVbhIE8mU_VBCTYQ.text: Omg...this place is amazing! Every plate was better than the last! My favorite was the petite filet, followed by the scallops escargots. Not one of the dishes was bad at all! Go early, this place gets busy but is well worth the wait! We will be coming again!

xtCoCv7ZcAFDhxBjuaowrA.text: My husband and I came here for the first time on Saturday. The ambience is very trendy and had a nice feel to it. Our waiter was very friendly and the food was so delicious. Only downside was when I asked the server who brought me my food for some extra bread he stated "Only one per table" and left. It seemed like he just didn't want to get it. He came back multiple times asking if he can take our plates when we weren't even finished yet. Not sure what happened there but we definitely didn't feel welcomed. Would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for him. Our waiter later came by and without even me asking brought out some bread since he noticed we were getting low. Wish I got his name but he was super friendly and courteous. Would definitely recommend this place, just keep an eye out for that rude server.

N4mDjLjn86-rpxojqNbI8A.text: For something new and not so over the top yet stylish, this is a great place.  Met some close friends here for dinner and enjoyed the food and ambiance.  Try the warm spinach salad and stuffed dates - very tasty!

2AGsLES5TYji_mcvObTUZA.text: Firefly is excellent for groups as the small plates makes it easy for sharing. On the expensive side, the atmosphere is mellow and beautiful with drapes and low lighting. Service is personable, authentic, and quick. Our waiter Carlos was extremely accommodating to our gluten intolerant friend, made sure to tell her everything that had gluten in it. He also ensured her that the items that are gluten free do NOT share the same equipment as gluten items. She was able to eat without fear.   The bathrooms were a bit horrid, but that's depending on the guest, if you catch my drift.

5MLPK18QQamKyMpsYTIKxw.text: Wonderful selection and very satisfying  Great atmosphere and great music outside to dance off a great meal!

-phKklvp7AJyf0vbUbIbzg.text: A bit off the strip, but that is where a lot of the good places are too. This one of the good deals, and especially check out their happy hour. It is an easy drive off the strip,  about 5 minutes away from the madness :)  The restaurant itself is spacious and the servers are very attentive. They even helped out finding a glutenfree alternative for my friend.  So, happy hour here includes a lot of the good stuff on their regular menu, Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates? The squid was not that good but the fries, the meat balls (watch out they are very hot), the huge baby back ribs, salads, bread and what not.    The portions were huge and the servers were always around making sure we were ok.   Absolutely reccommended but remember, do not compare to expensive high end restaurants. Still, they are not that different from Serrano at Aria when all comes to all.

dto2W_2oYBJGujTF_6zF-Q.text: The sangria is excellent!  Get the pitcher. Everything we ordered was fabulous.  Service was also great.  You will enjoy.  Shrimp, ceviche, octopus oh yeah and the dates wrapped in bacon are awesome!!!

dg-sJhVkW1F3vUaFdbQRRg.text: The ham and cheese croquetas are delicious!! We go often. Good food and reasonable prices. Their mixed paella is a must try.

RJubWKHicyHlslSdAIh8Bg.text: Firefly is such a cute spot. Very quaint and relaxing. Came around 4PM on a Sunday and got seated very quickly. They give you a choice of sitting at the bar, outside, or inside.   We chose  to sit outside since it was pretty nice outside considering Vegas never has nice weather lol ((I hate the weather here.)) Outside seating area has fans and light bulbs hanging from the ceiling.   They start off with bread and almond butter. My expectations were high since all the reviews raved about it, but the bread was pretty hard and didn't taste fresh and the almond butter was a bit too sweet.   We ordered firefly fries, calamari, mac n cheese, and the ribs.  When they brought the fries out, my eyes lit up and I swear my pupils turned into hearts. The portions are so big and they put the perfect amount of Parmesan cheese (some places are so stingy with that lol), luvvvvvv fries!!!!!!!!!! You can never have too much fries. If you think otherwise, we can't be friends. Ever.  The mac n cheese was really good at first, very unique flavor. The tomatoes on top make it even more flavorful. However, halfway through I had to stop eating it because it was way too cheesy. It's either that or I was a little tipsy off my red sangria (which is yummy, btw!)   Calamari, yum! So crispy and well portioned out.  The ribs....... R.I.P to those. They were devoured in about 5 minutes.   Service: Quick and attentive.   All in all, would definitely recommend!

I don't think I've tried anything that I didn't like.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  Nice environment.

f2YPa6JelyxlCh3LOI_27Q.text: Ordered an UberEats delivery from here and every single thing I got was amazing

OnuQE7xXSt_yzdB3cFvbAQ.text: This has been one of my faves since I first moved to Vegas way back when! I live in Cali now, but as soon as I cross the state line, Fire Fly, is one of my first stops. Where to begin . . . The service, Naum, is the man with a plan!!!! He is the best and always on point with the most excellent service and attitude. The sparkling white peach sangria (pitcher) is a must have and we drink every drop of it, even eating the blue berries too!   Now let's start with the food, I have had 90% of the menu and everything is delish! My faves hands down is: camarones Diablo,  fire fly fries, filet mignon slider, lamb skewers, empanadas, calamari, ahi tuna, paella, Mac n cheese, and the stuffed dates! You cannot go wrong here. Nice atmosphere, music, food and people! Cheers!

llHM8-k_a5QULXpzaNCGBw.text: Tried to go there yesterday afternoon and upon arrival the chick that was opening was super rude, so we bounced. No acknowledgement, no "hey" or "hi" nor "thanks for opening the door (as she was carrying out a sign)."   We've gone to firefly several times over the years and their customer service has remained iffy. The food is good, but the service is shyte.   Firefly, we like your food, but your hostess' have remained problematic over the years.

BPuzOXF7Ix3uSt9h3Dx_ZQ.text: I work in fine dining and am a self-proclaimed foody, so I'm not ignorant when it comes to judging food. Everything was delicious, the sauces that complimented every dish were excellent, and flavors were layered expertly.  The stuffed dates (wrapped in bacon) were exceptional.   Service was professional and attentive. Atmosphere was both casual and classy. A very nice experience.

1pyVEjEhhqnachLkOoDI6Q.text: I come here every time I visit Las Vegas, when I lived in Vegas they were my favorite tapas restaurant and they still are! Reasonable pricing, great service and excellent food!

Ex5eBq-kePXa6m-n3qrQeg.text: Overall a very terrific place. We went for dinner yesterday (a Tuesday) and it was pretty crowded. Every table had people at it, which is always a good sign. When we arrived, my group of 3 was seated immediately. We each ordered 2 plates per person of tapas. Each tapas plate was unique and served rather promptly. The filet in my opinion was the best. We each got dessert as well, and my only issue with the restaurant was that we each ordered an individual scoop of ice cream. I think the waitress tried to play matchmaker and put 2 of the scoops together in one bowl and another scoop in an individual bowl. This made everyone feel very awkward. Overall though, the atmosphere and experience was pleasant. It was pretty affordable too, it only cost $72 for all 3 of us to eat.

fBe4V6CDT5bhqw4iuGhhpQ.text: We hosted a dinner during my sister's bachelorette weekend and it was amazing!! Everyone was so helpful and the food was amazing!! The stuffed dates and sangria were my favorites! Thank you!!

AR70KTKtcZYI5g-EFTT6wA.text: I had the best grilled scallops, grilled chicken.....topped off with excellent chocolate and cherry bread pudding for dessert!!  Great bartenders tonight taking care of everything!!  This place is HIGHLY recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate and cherry bread pudding!!!

RnNbatpJFFurLxvRVHLjHQ.text: Loved the place. Service was wonderful. Told my son about the place and he was very pleased with the food and service. A little loud for my liking

V0YLGnz9-Kfc3XUS7myKzA.text: Order the stuffed dates ( bacon wrapped, smoked almonds, red wine reduction, blue cheese)  Camarines a la diabla was perfection.  The chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms needed more kick. Chicken and mushroom blended out any flavors they were aiming for.  Seriously, just start at the top of the menu and start working your way through. I'll be back for round 2,3,4,5,etc.

BvJUO5fQmzAforO3Topqkg.text: I love this place! Lets start with the bread with that amazing butter that I just can't have enough of. Then I ordered the  stuffed dates: I could eat 100 of those. Camarones a la diabla, that sauce goes good with anything I used the sauce to dip my fries. Stuffed peppers: ok.. Sliders: soooo good!! Croquetas: like And for dessert a tres leches cake, I know traditional tres leches cake and I've never seen a chocolate tres leches but it was good. Definitely coming back.

88A5kQMlFt0OhBVvs4AQAg.text: We arrived a little before the late happy hour time, but since we asked information about it the waiter was so nice to give us the HH menu and wait until the clock struck the hour to take our orders!  The ambience/atmosphere is pretty cool, I liked it. It is a perfect place for a couple or for a small group of good friends. The service was good, fast and not too oppressive. The only negative note to it is that at the end of the meal the waiter took my husband's glass away before he had actually finished his beer!  Anyway, I'm giving 5 starts also because of the food: it was really tasty, fresh and well prepared and presented. We tried a few tapas - some of them in HH too, GREAT deal! - and the empanadas were probably the best, so give them a try. I enjoyed my red sangria as well.  The place is a drive away from Las Vegas' center, and that means it isn't crowded. Thumbs up!

wFBH2kAy86U8bCU2dDwvog.text: Nice, dim ambience for date night or drinks with friends. There's a large number of items to choose from so everyone should find a couple things they'd like. As with any tapas place, the plates are fairly small and the cost adds up quickly. Be sure to remember there's a parking lot dedicated to the restaurant out back.

B-h0Nl3k1Sdl_UJs91eujA.text: ***Firefly is a decent and not too expensive alternative to the many overpriced Las Vegas restaurants on The Strip; unfortunately, there are some mediocre tapas here to go along with their good tapas and service was poor on my visit***  The Strip is filled with overpriced restaurants that churn out mediocre food.  Whether you are going to a fine dining restaurant or a cafe charging fine dining entree prices, chances are you are going to leave the restaurant feeling like you did not get much for your money.  Off The Strip though you will find more local spots and more bang for your buck in good quality and not outrageously pricey restaurants like Lotus of Siam (some may find Lotus of Siam pricey, but it is nothing like the Vegas fine dining spots charging sometimes twice as much as what that restaurant would cost in Los Angeles or other cities).  Firefly is off The Strip and it is a local spot.  It is a longstanding tapas restaurant with a huge following and maybe even a bigger menu.  With the big menu, it is not surprising that some dishes shine while others underwhelm.  Here is the rundown:  (Anchovy toasts with avocado) I liked these toasts.  It was nice having the flavorful anchovy as well as the creaminess from the fresh avocado.  (Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with blue cheese and smoked almond, red wine reduction) The bacon was crispy and the date was sweet and I liked the blue cheese.  The crunchy almond was kind of odd and I did not like the red wine reduction--unnecessary and it kind of made the bacon wrapped dates overly sugary and soggy if you did not pluck the bacon wrapped dates out of the dish as soon as they came out.  (Camarones a la diabla, shrimp, sweet and spicy sauce, grilled bread) The shrimp was nicely cooked and plump and the sauce had a good amount of heat (a little too BBQ sauce-like though)  (Artichoke toasts, aioli, basil, pepper) The artichoke hearts were good--not as good as the anchovy toasts but still satisfying.  (Heirloom tomatoes, burrata, butter lettuce, basil, balsamic vinaigrette) The heirloom tomatoes were surprisingly juicy for not being in season and the burrata was very creamy (almost as good as the more expensive burrata at Mario Batali's B&B Ristorante in The Venetian / Palazzo).  Unfortunately, the butter lettuce was drenched in balsamic, which made this good green into nothing more than decorative garnish for the plate.  (Empanada with pork, red pepper cream cheese and aioli) I am not familiar with empanadas, but I thought these were good.  They have several other types of empanadas available.  (Padron Peppers) These flash-fried peppers had a nice light outside skin and some good heat.  They would be a nice addition to many dishes.  (Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms) A surprising amount of heat.  (Albondigas, meatballs in a sherry and tomato sauce with parmesan) These meatballs were average stuff in a simple tomato sauce.  I would have preferred freshly grated parmesan to the melted parmesan cheese here (which felt like it had been melted a long time ago and had been sitting around for a while).  (Camarones al ajillo, shrimp, lemon and garlic butter sauce) The shrimp were fine, but I thought the lemon, butter and scampi-like sauce was just okay.  Still, it was not too heavy or oily (I think many would like it).  (Steak and mushroom skewers, filet, roasted garlic cream sauce) I thought these were average; the meat was a tad dry.  (Fried calamari) Standard calamari.  Desserts were satisfying.  The caramel flan had a good flavor and the right texture and while the ice cream did not have an incredibly creamy consistency, the portion was generous and the flavors were pretty good (chocolate, vanilla, pistachio).  The chocolate tres leches cake definitely had the expected moistness of a tres leches cake as well as a light chocolate flavor.  Prices were reasonable.  The food was decent and you do not have to pay the outrageous prices that you have to pay on The Strip.  Service was poor.  The staff was pleasant and the food came out at a quick pace, but the staff was not attentive.  After putting in our order, the staff was pretty non-existent so getting drinks and water glasses refilled and receiving the bill took way too long.  Firefly has a dark and loud atmosphere.  Firefly is a good spot if you want a decent meal in Las Vegas but do not want to pay the typical outrageous Vegas prices.  It reminds me a lot of Long Beach's Cafe Sevilla in terms of menu choices and the quality of the food (though that Long Beach restaurant has much better service).  Firefly has its own parking lot (I believe it might be valet parking though).

IuD4TQKXlqdkY9btODoJuA.text: The food was amazing the service was impeccable when we got there the manager Carlos greeted us upon our arrival and had a hostess Seat us then Neo our server was very descriptive with his suggestions  he suggested the mac and cheese which was ammmaazzeebbaaalllss and the tuna tartar needles to say I will comeback as soon as I get a chance 2

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zhPqI7k_Z3BPqFyPP-lUgg.text: Our review looks like most of the other 163 not recommended ones hidden at the back section. Ready, hit and miss has become more on the miss side. This trip was special as we drove over for wife's birthday. We come to LV every month and eat here every time. It was @ 10:00 pm and we were seated next to 2 tables of 2. Our server a Ukrainian girl came over after say "15 minutes" and took our drink order. Never told us her name, failed to describe sangria, left to get drinks. About that time both couples on each side told us here is where the fun starts. Twenty minutes later she returned with one of the two drinks. She said I'll be right back. I said wait we want to order!  She took our order and again split. Now 40 minutes into this celebration she returns with the drink. I asked how do we get bread ?  One of the bus boys brings out "cold hard bread". What seamed like days, our food comes out and she drops and tried to split. I ask her if we could have warm bread. She can only give us what is ready in the kitchen. I explained we have dined here at least 35 times and have never been told that. A busboy returned with warm bread. She never came back to see if everything was ok, if we wanted to order anything else, or need another drink. We had dessert and left thinking do we ever want to return again! Walked into dark scary parking lot in back to find our six week old car smashed in the back and broken tail light. Go ahead hide us in the back so no one can see us.  Just like you will never see us again.

kjZENh3OyoSyjB_wt22hlg.text: Great place for tapas! With a bottle of Estrella or glass of Cava I'm reminiscing Barcelona. Sure there are some tapas far from your typical Spanish flare but they did a great job with the selection. My 2 faves from my 1st encounter: boquerones and the beef & mushroom skewers.

Z856Z_Nvhp5KpneD52ALjw.text: Amazing food! Enough for easily three people to share! We stopped here on a whim and were blown away by atmosphere and food. The portions are tasty and filling. We tried four small plates and the main entree of rice, chicken , mushrooms, veggies. That plate took forty minutes to make but the others started coming out quick and hot. We were starting to get full when the main dish came out! Great place I will be back!
