Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels in sauce yummy

zXbjL1pB6OQjtypTdn1ukQ.text: I was here about 2 years ago with a large group of friends and I wasn't impressed by the food at all nor the service. The service was slow and of course with large groups they either forget your order or missed something.

y374miYHHS9HgZ9RZaTPyw.text: Great food ,good service but the noice level was so bad we could not have a proper conversation. Will I go back don't think so .

0130c4u1MNdXH_5h7yklAQ.text: Amazing experience.  I have to go to vegas every year for a work conference, and Firefly will definitely be on the list of must-visit restaurants, for me, right there next to Nobu in terms of awesomeness.  We tried about 15 dishes, the sangria, and cocktails.  All were quite amazing, especially the food.  From the ahi tuna skewers, to the manchego mac and cheese, to the petit filet, lamb chops, and much much more, it was all rememberable and amazing.  The most enjoyable  dishes for me were tuna tartare, the manchego mac and cheese, ahi tuna skewers, and the flan :)  Lastly, value wise, it is extremely affordable.  We went with 5 people and were shocked when the bill came because we thought we would have done much more damage.  Can't wait to go back.

lyheHM3lCxRq9xIAjmcapw.text: I have never heard of this place before and after coming here one night with a group of friends I left thinking, "Why haven't I heard of this place before?!" We came here for my friend's birthday before hitting up the club and you know what? I really liked the idea of having tapas. Because I mean, who would want to go out after a full meal?  Anyways, I only ordered the Firefly fries and Chicken and Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms. Even with the small selection I chose, I was not disappointed. They even serve this bread with this sweet tasting butter which I could not stop eating! I even soaked them up with the sauce for the Camarones a la Diabla which someone else ordered.   I really wanna go back and try more things on the menu. I wished I had tried the dates that everyone says is to die for! I'm definitely going back soon.

4-dmuk-9UU3VGd2SG4-ZZg.text: I wouldn't go back. I don't mind overspending when the service is really good but service for me was way below average. Don't even think about ordering a steak if you happen to love steak sauce because they don't have any. I'm not sure the scallops were in fact scallops. $11 dollars for 6 small white squishy flimsy somethings but I'm not sure what.

E7sfEWAT8jLR7v_SV-TVFg.text: We come here every time we're in Vegas since we have discovered them several years ago. This is our third time here. Bacon wrapped dates, albondigas, tomato soup, tuna tartare, and Serrano ham and manchego crochets. All delicious.

c8ZtV57YWamuP4yCqyhjXQ.text: Story Time - My bro and I were in Vegas for 3 days of golf. We asked the concierge at the hotel to recommend a restaurant in Vegas, not necessarily on the strip. He gave us two to pick from. Battistas battistaslasvegas.com - "Italian Food" and Firefly "Tapas". We navigated to the Strip and ended up closer to Battistas. The smell of the food was great, but there was no ambiance and having Chablis as the included wine was not working for me. So, I pulled my brother out of there pronto and we drove to Firefly. When we arrived at Firely, we walked in to ambiance and vibe. Yes, this place had a buzz and I knew I had made the right decision. No wait on a Monday night, yeah. Our server was excellent and somehow we merged our picks from the great tapas on the menu for one of the best meals I have ever had. From memory, the following were our choices. Heirloom Tomato Salad - One of the best salad dressings (the cheese they use in combination with the balsamic dressing was out of this world good). Risotto Stuffed Peppers - Amazingly simple, but just the kind of Tapas I love. Ahi Tuna with Mango on skewers - If there was a flaw in anything, the mangos were a bit unripe, but it was still really good. Lamb Chops - Small lamb chops. I do not each red meat, so this was for my bro. But, I am not religious and had a nibble, they were amazing and the sauce was great. The garlic butter with the bread was so good, I have to mention that too. The food was so amazing, we came back the next night after playing 36 holes of golf. We were a solid 40 minute drive away, but the food was so good, we had to come back. Unfortunately, we tried to broaden the orders and made a few choices that were not as good. Gary ordered the fried calamari, but in hindsight, it is always good and it was not something that stood out with so many other amazing choices on the menu. In any case, if you are in Vegas, you gotta visit this great spot!

gGX1o3Q_Mg81zP8pLrXXbA.text: Food was delicious and they had a lot of vegetarian options as well. Very quick and friendly service! A very good experience overall

M07o29xgPx9oRShx2OpbhA.text: Do yourself a favor and order their sangria. It's great. That alone was worth the "off-the strip" uber fee. A friend, who lived in Vegas at the time, invited us here many years ago. We had a great experience then and it's still great now. The tapas style menu is not too small and if you choose right - you can have a very yummy experience. I'd honestly come here for the sangria alone.

HwFlmU1Z05ENjbGdMZt-Bg.text: Small tapas plates style restaurant. Food and service are both good. Would come back again. Not far off the strip and worth it. Got tired I eating on the strip with overpriced and low quality this took care of that. With a try.

C-p7kcA4NELR1IqFLPC3kg.text: Bacon wrapped around your dates!?......end of review. Came here with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday, the choice was perfect, elegant, clean, affordable and with a menu so intensive anyone would surely find something to their liking. I had the fried calamari, pardon peppers, the dates wrapped in bacon and the paella which was very delicious and loaded with seafood. The peppers were medium to mild but you may end up with a very spicy one, but as Forrest Gumpzalez once said "life is a plate of peppers, you never know which one is going to burn you". I asked the waiter if they could fry the calamari in tempura mix instead of their regular mix and they did which means that everything is made to order and not frozen ready like other places do.  I also ordered the sangria and a mojito and they both were perfectly done, a harmonious mixture of fruits and wine made this sangria one of the best I tasted.    Service was great..at the beginning and then it slowly became nonexistent, but to be fair I think we might have overstayed our welcome. I blame it on the sangria.  Tip was included on the bill as any establishment would do for parties of 8 or more but we added some more to cover lingering fees. Great times and great food will surely keep me coming for more and if you keep on making good drinks as good as your dates wrapped in bacon, you'll definitely have me wrapped around your sangria for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le faux le reve at le Firefly
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picasso at entrance.

B8QA1iTPQHoSxQAnvhH8Ug.text: This place is awesome. We had reservations for a Monday night and were promptly seated and asked what we wanted to drink. I had an amazing ginger pear martini that was out or this world, and my date had a mojito that was also impressive. I was disappointed that they ran out of pear puree for a second ginger pear martini, but ended up having a mojito myself.  The food here is some of my favorite in Vegas. Favorites included the plate of Serano ham and Manchego cheese, steak and mushroom skewers, and lamb chops. Also good was the veggie empanadas, grilled scallops, and the chorizo plate.   The atmosphere is good, always have pretty decent customer service, and the plates are priced well considering the quality. You will need a few plates per person so it can add up, but you definitely get what you pay for. Most people I know really like this place. I did come here in summer 2013 and it definitely improved from the first visit. I would come back again no doubt.

aLGRGl79eAHEmwr0JyvWAA.text: I was extremely disappointed with everything I ordered. I measure a restaurant food quality starting with the bread. Butter was frozen. Bread hard, dry. Cerviche was marginal. I ordered chorizo, shrimp, steak skewers. Flavor was marginal and chorizo was hard to chew, shrimp was chewy. The only thing I would say is that I ate late at night and perhaps the kitchen was getting ready to close. I will not come back. The bartender server was really good however.

fhQHiZUM0zhVRvYXcW2pIA.text: Great value for the price. Many options to choose from. Service was excellent. Kept the tables clear of dirty plates and always there when you needed them. Flan was amazing too.

ZO5PLA_uK2g-bqdxEE-3Yg.text: Firefly is always a must for me when visiting Vegas. Great food and good prices. The atmosphere is very cool and lounge-like, with low lighting and great music playing. It's right off the strip, but it's more popular for locals, so the vibe is laid back.  Now for the food!  The salmon toasts, veggie empanadas, and calamari were excellent! I went with my sister and a friend, and we ordered 6 savory apps and 3 desserts to split, and we had plenty of dessert left over. I absolutely recommend the mini cheesecakes and lemon berry tarts for dessert, and the goat cheese and eggplant cannelloni as a starter.   The house shandy is an excellent choice of drink; they mix up the traditional beer-and-lemonade cocktail by taking a light Belgian beer, mixing with fresh strawberry bitters, and adding a bit of Amaretto to top it off. So refreshing and so delicious!  We always hit up Firefly before a night on the strip; it's a tradition now to make it our first stop to kick off our annual Vegas weekend.

-GmLcdUPIQvMpD8jqyfPjw.text: Id give a 1 star if the food wasnt so delicious here. thats why im giving two.  The service was horrible. came here for a going away party last week and we were sat in the middle of the room at a long table. My boyfriend and I were a little late so we asked the hostess if she sat any big parties, who ever she was texting on her phone was obviously waaay more important then we were so we found our party ourselves. once at the table it took us 15 minutes to be able to order drinks. I ordered my usual scotch and soda, never being asked what scotch i wanted, but i assumed they would just give me their well scotch. was i wrong about that... but we will go over that once i tell you about our bill.  our drinks finally arrive about 10 minutes later, i ordered water as well so i reminded the server when he dropped off our drinks. Our water never came, even after reminding him a 3rd time.  The food was amazing, as usual. We had the heirloom salad, padron peppers, artichoke toasts, ceviche, ahi poke, and we split the spicy shrimp. (i obviously took a break from veganism for a night) The heirloom salad is freaking amazing, ive never had such a great salad.   Once getting our bill, we noticed i was charged for Macallan 12. For all my scotch drinkers that are reading this, it is a crime to mix Macallan 12 with soda.. If you cant just drink it straight, just admit to yourself that you are by no means a scotch enthusiast.  And with a price of $14 (i think?) a drink, we werent too thrilled. On top of everything the tip was already included, and we werent told this. So for horrible service we ended up tipping double.   On our way out the same hostess was still on her phone texting away. If we didnt live in Veer Towers and were so close to this location we would never return. You would figure with all the bad press this restaurant has endured they would step up their customer service.

XCbL1afrdlL4jr3fIZOj5Q.text: Excellent service from Neo! Food is flavorful , ambiance pretty chill. Sangria delish . Mushroom tart a must try ! Paella tDF

pH6o6w0pK5soqHWR-wYJSw.text: I brought a visiting girlfriend here not too long after this location moved and I had to come clean with her about the place's summer debacle with the health department. I saw her eyes pop out of her head, but she calmed down once I reassured her that this venue came back with a clean bill of health. And let's be completely honest - after a complete PR meltdown with a grip of guests falling sick, the place can't afford another screw up, so it's probably more paranoid about sanitation than a mom in a daycare center.   We came just in the nick of time for happy hour and grabbed a couple of glasses of sangria before ordering usual staples like stuffed dates, shrimp ceviche, and steamed mussels. All a big win in our book, plus the service was fast but not at all rushed. Firefly is a great place to grab a drink and a few small bites, or to order a lot of dishes and sample everything. You know, European dim sum!   Parking is a bigger fiasco than it was at their original location in that it is now a small lot in the back, so consider yourself warned!

waYcg4ujc-ACkkXvgOAHlw.text: My husband and I have an arrangement where we alternate who plans Valentine's Day each year. I have even years and it was my turn this year. So, upon doing lots of research, I came across this gem. I have been missing paella like crazy ever since I had the opportunity to study abroad in Spain and wanted to introduce it to my husband since I knew he would love it as well. I am happy to say that I finally found a place that can handle my craving for paella. It was delicious! The atmosphere was amazing as well. We are now seriously considering making this restaurant a Valentine's Day tradition xD

RRGgljtykuJicpGr4mK0pA.text: Came her for my cousins 21st bday, it was so amazing! The food was so good, we ordered so many different things, and there wasn't anything I tried that I didn't like. The highlights for we were the filet and the chicken empanadas. The red sangria was also very delicious. Our server, Eder,  took amazing care of us! It's for sure a must go for dinner!

sudxzlnwq415iVvA9hHhMg.text: Had a great event at the Firefly last week and it was AWESOME . First the place looked great they set us up on the patio.   The staff was more than attentive, (Thanks Carlos and crew) glasses were never empty. The plates never were not full. We finished one thing and the next came. Special requests didn't slow them down. The paella and shrimp were so so yummy.  Please if you are in Vegas try the Firefly

LF_IYQiy4VZ35uJDTCykqw.text: One of the best secrets in Vegas! My favorite restaurant in Vegas. You order A bunch of appetizers and share. The Mac and cheese, calamari, ceviche, steak skewers, and best of all... The stuffed mushrooms with chorizo!!!! Order a pitcher of red sangria and your in heaven. A must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sangria!!! So good

rRDeu_IFyaQJIfBA609xRg.text: Love coming here for a tasty bite that doesn't break the bank like most restaurants on the strip. Be prepared for a hefty selection of tapas options.   I really like the apple and manchego salad - a nice combination of tart/sweet and salty.  Mac n cheese is a tasty choice as well. Of course, you have to get the bacon wrapped dates. Just don't freak out when you find a hard thing in the middle - it's just a crunchy almond.   Fries were meh when I went - they weren't freshly fried.   The best thing about this place is it's open until 1am for those late weekday parties.

LIicMuDcHkurYofKRZF10A.text: Amazing food!!! Came here on a Monday night date night and couldn't be more happier that we chose this place! The ambience is great and the food is delicious! Yum yum!

UU8lhHvGkupAiM_mvnL67g.text: Ambience is great. Good I was not surprised. I was expecting authentically Spanish tapas and you can always tell by their tortilla espanola, it was fair quality. I would recommend for drinks, the sangria is pretty good and one glass got me buzzed.

DUcnBFKYDU5vw7RP9E71aA.text: Great menu! Lots of vegetarian options.  My husband had scallop "escargot" which he said was delish- and it sure did smell it.  He lived his tuna kabobs too.  They had a lot going on that looked really good.  I had veggie empanada.  Amazing!  And I was pretty full after that! But I still had veggie "crab cakes" and OMG I need to learn how to make them! So good! We had a blueberry mule and amaze balls!!

3VPO2ov1Un8l6QgJB_u_Qw.text: I visited Firefly a couple of weeks ago and it was amazing! But I ordered the Paella today and I didn't care for it! The rice was really mushy and it was very bland. Overall though I love this place!

Q1EwuRwjdKS7tta940OgSg.text: Firefly is a large old fashioned restaurant.  It's dark inside with candles on every table and the seating is crowded.  The restaurant is very apropos of Las Vegas because once you're inside you can't tell if it's day or night, like the casinos.  They serve tapas (small plates), cocktails and some dinner entrees.  I came around 3 pm for a late lunch and to take advantage of their happy hour menu.  The happy hour menu is priced at $4 or $5 for each small plate and seemed to include most of their popular dishes.  I ordered firefly fries, bacon wrapped dates, meatballs, chicken on a stick and red wine sangria and water to drink.    I was served bread and flavored butter to start but the bread was so dry, dense and stale I couldn't eat it.  I was surprised when my food arrived because the bowl of fries was the antithesis of small plates, the portion was huge (they were also some of the best fries I've ever eaten) and the dates, meatballs and chicken were much smaller than traditional tapas more in the line of tiny amuse-bouche.  The dates were in a delicious red wine sauce and the cream sauce on the chicken was so good I was thinking of ordering another plate.  The meatballs and sangria were average but still good.  The food, with the exception of the bread, was all very good and $4 or $5 per plate was a fair price for quality and portion.  However with regular menu prices of $8 or $9 per plate and the suggestion that each person order 2 or 3 plates to share, your appetizers and drinks get pretty expensive.  And if you think a few plates are enough for dinner I think most people would leave hungry.  The restaurant is a little too dark, dingy and old fashioned for me and the service was just OK but I thought the food was great...the menu prices on the other hand I thought were very high for the quality, portion size and ambiance of the restaurant.

aYdsxbtFKqFgN2QMIF_Csg.text: Amazing food to start a great night out in the city, we always go here before going partying. Very good wine selection too.

byMkZjmYZhypim0FlAp-qQ.text: From the time we walked in, it was just off. We have been coming here since before the move and without a doubt, they should have stayed where they were! The hostess was underwhelming when we bothered her and she had to lift her head to greet us. We were taken to our table and had great service from our server, the expeditor and the bus people from that point on. Ordered our drinks (I, a wine and my husband tried the fruit infused vodka martini.). Mine was fine and his came out in what looked to be a sampler size martini glass. It looked half empty and we both took a sip of what tasted like a watered down fruit drink. It had absolutely NO flavor. Sent it back and got an IPA that was fine. Ordered everything I always get with my favorite being the Apple/Manchego Salad which was delicious, as it always has been. Bread and butter was good, but missed the olives. Guess that went with the move. Shrimp aLa Diabla was just ok. Not the same zip it always had and the shrimp was a bit over cooked. My go to has always been the lamb chops and YIKES, what a disaster they were! We each tried cutting it and left the whole plate. The idea that we would have sent 2 things back in one visit was too much! We overheard our poor server having to take care of someone at the next table that was complaining and just asked for our check. She looked at the full plate of lamb chops and never said a word. We paid the bill, tipped 20% and asked the server to take the chops back to the chef/cook and have them try to cut into it. She apologized, thanked us and never came back. She acted as though it were an every day occurrence. We won't be back and we were frequent visitors when we are in town.

QdNh9Kl6No9EvLXt0csFVg.text: This is a really solid value just a few blocks off-strip. I've been here a couple times over the years. The first visit was on the suggestion of a local. Their cocktails are spot-on and available by the pitcher. Their sangria is good without being overly sweet, and their passion fruit mojitos gave us a nice afternoon brunch buzz.  There is a huge selection of tapas and plenty of vegetarian choices which makes it easy for me to dine with a group. The only one I haven't liked is the tortilla espanola. All the others have been quite tasty, especially the empanadas. I would definitely make a repeat visit.

hNv8VhQCsaYFF6GKrySxuQ.text: We were so excited to try this place. What an utter disappointment. The food we ordered was brought out cold, apparently because they were waiting for the toast for one of the dishes. None of the things we tried were that great.

Bu8l4fhCRA7Z5DpyPHgWHQ.text: I couldn't take a picture because I was too busy shoveling food into my mouth. The apple salad and steak skewers are a huge hit. My mouth still waters thinking about it. Plan on being stuffed when you leave. This place is the best.

4HgvwYy5ak5pqmXl1oHpwQ.text: Let me begin  informing you that I am from Las Vegas and am a Chef in Las Vegas so I know I'm not crazy! Came here with a group of friends, friends with different food requirements. One being gluten free and the other Vegan. Once we ordered our food our server came back and told us that our food will be right out BUT because 1 individual was gluten free everyone's food was made gluten free....wtf???? I don't think I've ever eaten at a restaurant  that forces you to be gluten free because of 1 persons order! Her response was that they take allergies serious and there's also a option to sign a waiver to eat there......wtf??? I have nothing to say about this. Get it together fireflys!! Youve already been  closed down once by the health department. ..... I'm not done ... 3 items on our bill was doubled! Bacon wrapped dates came out burnt , had to get up out of my seat and find our server for bread and butter...needless to say, sounds like the kitchen was ready to close. Stop being lazy! This is food we're taking about .theres  no shortcuts!

yU6Oy_PwNEoKwiDpnbo2vA.text: We were here, again, in between appointments and everything was awesome as usual. My only complaint would be that sitting inside of the restaurant doesn't feel as classy as it did sitting on the nice patio. The booths/tables seem older and just don't match with the quality of food. This time we tried the stuffed peppers that were great as well as a chicken dish that was just amazing. My lamb rocked, just as it always does!

cv8e9N-WFRIXgpHTLfh3jA.text: Loud and very busy - however, if you want to escape casino crowd, this restaurant is conveniently located on Paradise road, within walking or short taxi ride distance from many hotels on the strip. Very good selection of drinks, from sangria to signature cocktails. Food is served tapas style with lots of tasty options. Bacon wrapped dates, baked tetilla cheese, empanada - everything was very tasty. Service was friendly and prompt. Recommended.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dVVYdTH4ohTglcnuurZ_uw.text: This restaurant is delicious and is very cost effective (especially for Las Vegas standards). I actually came here by myself while attending a conference and liked it so much that when my boyfriend joined me for the weekend we went back here. The Chicken Tinga Empanada is amazing, should be your first choice tapa! The patatas bravas are classic. Got a strawberry mojito too, which I would also recommend. Ambiance and service are good too...aka you should definitely go here for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Mojito

dNyuX7d6CSvNWw6edtlbsg.text: Excellent small plates. We had baked cod, lamb chops, vegetable empanadas and tomato soup. Everything was great. Great service at 1:15am too. Lots of music outside with dancing. Fun place!

OChcP6-fVbNkZPwsti2VDg.text: Everything was Delicious! When we come back to Vegas we will definitely stop by again! Came by for a late night dinner with friends.

GSNGt9auuFtBjTILxBFLOA.text: I love firefly. Everything is so tasty. I love the dark and red ambiance. It's such a great date night spot. Or group dinner with friends. Late night happy hour. It never disappoints.

nRoHWmVq37vmJPmTCmbsVw.text: Food is not bad....Food is actually good. However my "EXPERIENCE" as a whole was NOT a good one!   First thing we were asked after sitting was "Do you have any food allergies? " I understand the question because I do have some, however it should not be the very 1st thing you ask your clients when they sit down.  Now I know my food allergies and reactions the best.... not these waiters. I felt like they forced us to get certain things set aside or given to us on the side instead of how it should be plated. There are things I am allergic to but only in its raw state....like fresh cherries for example. However, sweetened cherries or a cherry vinaigrette I am totally ok with. Why did our waiter see me take a bite of salad that had Cherry vinaigrette and ran to tell me not to eat that?  Oooh and then a girl who works there comes out with a waiver in her hand that I had to sign that basically states I had eaten something that I knew contained something I was allergic to. And this was smack in the middle of my meal. It was so not a pleasant experience and even though the food was good. I don't think I'll ever return.  So apparently this place was most recently ( on 5/24/18...and its public record) in trouble with the food commission for not swapping out a pair of gloves and/or washing their hands before dealing with a client who had food allergies. This does not mean you have to treat your clients in a way that makes them uncomfortable.  You need to learn a better way to deal with these situations.   And now I wonder....if the proper thing was for them to have given me a copy of the waiver they made me sign. Shouldn't I have a copy of any paperwork they can and plan on using if there were any legal action necessary?   Now our waiter was great. No downfall to him. Not his fault. And he brought me the best Cucumber Jalapeno Martini but I won't go back.

CKZh-jP23f-kmBLbaT1NMA.text: G Service was great but the food was mediocre. Had the bacon wrapped dates, beef and mushroom and some beef and sausages. Probably wouldn't go back.

mPJp57mwdHAA_4yc87ajwA.text: Love this place and the menu!  Only been here about 4-5 times.  After having lunch there yesterday we realised we need  to go back more often so we can try about everything on the menu. So happy even my 75-year-old mother loved the food there!

pYje_tVT--Q3iw3WytMw7A.text: First off, this place is not on the strip. We went here for a reception after a wedding. We were placed in the back reception room where there were some high tables, a couple low tables and a few chairs. We had 40 people.  They set up a bar in the room and because the wedding party did not opt to have an open bar we had to pay. $10+ per drink... During happy hour!!! Weak ass drinks to boot.  The food was good but tiny. I mean really freakin small... Like one bite type of stuff. It was good but for what the bride and groom were charged, total rip off. I recommend finding something else for tapas. Unless you want to go broke. Kinda gross dirty building too.

qDnb24LRG20kdZz66GSOHw.text: Excellent food and beer!! Stuffed peppers, chicken and steak skewers, and the Ham and cheese Croquetas were all excellent! Evil Twin on Tap was outstanding too!!

zxmfgHQ3S8dR4LDfsHARIQ.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas I always try to make time to come to Firefly.  This newer location is great with lots of seating and dark, nice decor.  Great Spanish tapas at reasonable prices, right off the strip.  A few of my favorites are the stuffed dates (2 orders please), patatas bravas, empanadas, ham and cheese croquetas.  Sangria is a must!  Early and late HH has some nice selection tapas for less and of course great deals on the sangria.  Come early or late, or you'll probably be waiting for a long time.  Always a fun time at Firefly!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella and assorted tapas

3Zo1svtUkAT24jJHFr_Ahw.text: Omg food was seriously DELICIOUS! Great Service, outdoor patio was spacious and nicely lit. Sangria was definitely a 10. Definitely a place to try if you want to share and try different flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CLGUdauNkucn_PvfEDR8MA.text: I ordered 4 different tapas plates and they all were delicious. Scallops were well cooked and all the sauces were good. Artichoke bread was really a nice surprise, well seasoned and topped with basil which just complements the dish well. Only thing was that's the food came out slightly delayed, too far from one dish to another but granted, it was very busy night. I will be coming back!!

pQE7VuWXzNZdbwNKYRf2Ag.text: Seriously GREAT food. Awesome service. Waitress and bus man were on it. Prices reasonable. If/when I come to Vegas again I'll come here for sure. To die for dishes include: Stuffed Peppers and Garlic Lemon shrimp.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

406J6k8Wf-KorRGaE7PG7g.text: The first time I visited Firefly was in 2013 for a wedding reception and I had the best time munching on the bacon wrapped dates and downing mojitos.  So when I was planning my high school's 20th reunion, I immediately thought of Firefly, a hip, super fun place to have a great dinner and hang out with friends.  From the initial email I sent Regina with Banquets to payment at the event, the whole deal went without a glitch.  Communication with Regina was a breeze and she answered all of my emails quickly.  Our group was small (under 50) and from out of town so naturally many of them were skeptical with the salmonella incidence and health inspection violations and closures at their other locations.  But I kept close communication with Regina and paid attention to the REPUTABLE recent reviews of Firefly on Yelp.    The affordable all you can eat banquet menu included their starter, a choice of 6 tapas, and "chocolate" tres leches cake for only $30 per person.  Out of their extensive selection, I chose the most popular based on yelp reviews:  artichoke toasts, stuffed dates, baby back ribs, patatas bravas, steak skewers, and camarones a la diable.  We decided on a cash bar that they set up in our private room and we added on unlimited soft drinks for $2.50 per person.  The room charge was $200 with a minimum $1000 food and beverage.    Our room was set up with one row of tables which initially seemed a little crowded, but turned out fine.  Our crowd mingled for about 20 minutes before I asked when the food would be served and they told me as soon as we were seated.  We sat down and like magic, the food was ushered in by the trays.  As expected the dates were a favorite, but people seemed to love the artichoke toasts, ribs and shrimp as well.    They are located minutes from the strip and parking in their lot was plentiful.  Our group had a great time and having it at Firefly was awesome.  Highly recommend Firefly for your banquet.  Excellent service from start to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our group seated at long tables in one of their private rooms
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate tres leches cake
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. steak and mushroom skewers

-pA07ACY7sBmaKbfve22dw.text: Never disappoints!!! This place never seizes to amaze me! The food, the service and not to mention the staff! I've taken numerous groups and friends to this location and it's always such a treat to see how much everyone enjoys it. I've never had a dish I wasn't impressed with. Thank you Firefly for making it so easy for me to share this little gem.

EB310KSbc4L2xGYNDRRwog.text: Great food! We stayed on the strip and went looking for good food that wasn't an arm and leg. This place did not disappoint,  we got three drinks and four tapas for less than $90 not including a tip.

HWQvTGvCKdxluzmS4BxwTg.text: Amazing food and great price! The happy hour was awesome and the best part is that it was longer than an hour!! The server was super friendly and we had a great conversation with him. Great experience all together.

1NrYm0dbqkiV-QUlC0oqTA.text: A must stop for us every time we are in Las Vegas!!  5/5 Customer Service Always welcoming, always ensuring our cups are filled with water.   5/5 Food I can't say enough about the delicious food! Prices and quality are always great. Our go to's are always;  Ceviche ; super limey just how I like it. Big chunks of avocado and shrimp. Just delicious.  Shrimp A La Diabla; sweet and spicy and just the best. The sauce is thick but not overwhelming. We usually get two of these dishes as my husband and I don't want to share!   Tierra y Mar: Yum yum! Chorizo, shrimp and filet mignon skewer with a salsa verde drizzled on top. Another must have a must order 2!   Bacon wrapped dates: I don't need to say anymore. Get them.   We had our toddler with us this time so we explored beyond our usual 4.   Mac & Cheese: This was a large portion and just so so good. I know you can't really get too crazy with Mac & Cheese but it just tasted different, ans super cheesy. Our toddler loved it.  Albondigas: He really enjoyed these too! The spices where perfect and not too overwhelming for a toddler.   See you next time Firefly!

gGDDiKUrWrodJchlKNC9hg.text: If you want the best Bloody Mary's you have ever had in your life, go see Daniel Chino (the Russian) at Firefly. Please don't wear him out though, because he is my favorite Bloody Mary Maker!! Omar is also fantastic...pretty much every bartender here is on point. Become a regular and they will absolutely take care of you. No matter what other Firefly establishments may have done, this place is by far on point. I love their Happy Hour, I love their appetizers, I love it all. Come here over and over and over!

tfN6HedXOBLhTlpG2rr0Lg.text: Came to what it used to be my favorite place in Vegas.  Had go get up and physically go ask for a server to give me water, my food got cold because they brought it all the same time. As I am writing this it's been 20 minutes since I been done eating and no one will get my check.  Service went down hill here, even from the hostess up front having an attitude about sitting me and my wife down. (They used to be friendly).   - Update; a manager (seemed like a manager, skinny lady with short hair) came to grab the check and I told her about shitty service and she just ignored it.   Don't come here ever.

iiBOMzJgC-85-7raEXxVsg.text: Their Happy hour is absolutely amazing. Their mojitos and Sangria are off the charts! 10/10 would go again

MR5wiA59keSzRsf5YMv0Ug.text: Great food and I love all the options. Not too crowded on the weekends but I would still recommend a reservation. We didn't try a paella but we shared plenty of tapas and that Pan con tomate being the tastiest!  I do however miss their old quaint location.

xDqCfMKSZ059k0e2ln1Ncw.text: Delicious!! Went with a group of friends and ordered maybe like 8-10 dishes? They are all small tapa dishes and they were great!! The only thing is if you order the paella it takes like 20 mins to cook, which they inform you. Since we were in a time crunch, we didn't order that. All the tapas were great, but the best ones were the skewers-- I think we order 2 different ones and both were so good! The empanadas were also really yummy. Service was attentive and atmosphere was relaxing.

P5IRbBLK5Z93o-4PiEx_OA.text: We were in Las Vegas for a week. And our first day we ordered Uber food in this place and it was absolutely delicious. So two days later we had to come back, but we wanted to eat in the restaurant. We had an amazing time. The food was delicious, service was amazing. So I can say that from 6 days that we were in Las Vegas we came 4 times for dinner. That means a lot.

6UUrBrzWZHeehc2jH38MhA.text: Loving this tapas restaurant on a lazy Sunday afternoon in April - sat on the patio and took my time enjoying a book, beer, and several tapas. The beet and roasted pear salad was perfect for a very warm day. Vegas is so crazy on the Strip, this location on Paradise Road is a welcome respite. The Tiera y Mar tapas was excellent - shrimp, filet mignon, chorizo with a salsa verde - great flavor and fun to eat, although it would be nice to offer to take them off the skewer to avoid a meat projectile. Complimentary side of toasted garlic baguette with almond butter was a great filler between course. Server Mario and staff were very friendly and efficient.  I'm guessing this place is quite busy and hectic at night, but daytime is the best choice.  Great outdoor patio for al fresco dining. I'd return on my next Vegas trip for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiera y Mar skewers with salsa verse sauce.

UG_Z9oI5TPWgpoQkNSybMQ.text: After hearing about Firefly on Paradise for years, I was happy with my first visit and can't wait to return. As the other reviews have stated, this is an excellent spot for group outings as well as intimate dates. While my wife and I enjoyed our meal, I'd suggest going with a group so everybody has a chance to try a wide variety of tapas.  My wife and I decided on an early dinner on a Sunday night and booked our reservation through Open Table on Yelp, which was easy and convenient. We arrived and were seated immediately. It was still early for Vegas, so the restaurant was not fully buzzing yet.   Our server Nahum greeted us and he was terrific throughout the dinner, as were the additional servers who promptly removed empty plates and refilled our drinks. Nahum explained some of Firefly's dishes and offered a few recommendations. We went with a few of the more popular items and since we'd had our share of meat during lunch that day, we went with dishes that were not meat-centric.  The tapas we tried:  The stuffed dates were outstanding and lived up to the hype. I was a bit weary at first, thinking that the bacon wrapping would overwhelm the date, but it was used more for its smoky qualities and the almond center was a nice way tie in all of the flavors. Highly recommended.  The fresh garbanzos were a nice snack seasoned with lime, chili, and sea salt. It was the first time I'd had them served in their shell; it was similar to munching on edamame, but with more flavor.   The Firefly Fries were shoestring potatoes topped with parmesan and herbs and served with aioli. I didn't think they were anything extraordinary, but my wife really enjoyed the comfort food quality they brought to our meal.   We both enjoyed the manchego mac and cheese, which was made with baby shell pasta instead of elbow macaroni and topped with a tomato-pepper relish. It was rich, creamy, and mellow.  The camarones a la diabla were more sweet than spicy, with the shrimp cooked perfectly and served in the sauce along with small pieces of grilled bread.  Surprisingly, the tapas filled us up more than we thought they would, so we intend to return to sample the other dishes as well as their popular sangria. We did, however, leave room for dessert and devoured the chocolate tres leches cake. It was a perfect ending to our dinner.  Note: it's unfortunate there's no sort of dress code at Firefly. It's a nice restaurant, but when diners show up looking like they just returned from their hotel's swimming pool, it ruins the atmosphere. I'm reserving my fifth star for a future visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate tres leches cake. Perfect way to end dinner!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manchego mac and cheese. Rich and creamy.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly Fries. Parmesan cheese, herbs, and aioli.

NPteBBEJ37tU3C6NFTxfew.text: I have been to numerous restaurants in Las Vegas, but Firefly is my favorite. It is off the strip, but very close, so well worth the trip.  First, you should order the sangria. Delicious! The menu is primarily made up of small plates, or tapas. There is a large variety of selections, from salads, to chicken and steak, to seafood. Most are prices from $6 to 11 each. We have been there numerous times, so we've had many of their offerings, which are consistently excellent.  In our most recent trip, we were served by Alejandro and his assistant, Roberto. Both were personable and attentive. They made great recommendations, which helped us, even though we have been several times before.  We started with the plate of serrano ham and manchego cheese. Served with bread and sun dried tomatoes, it was a great start.  We followed this up with the pardon peppers and pork empanadas. Both were great. The pork empanadas were cooked perfectly and tasted terrific.  We followed these with an order of the Tierra y Mar skewers (skewers of shrimp, beef and chorizo) and another order or sangria! When we asked Roberto about his favorite dish, he suggested an order of the camarones a la diabla, so we ordered that, too. Both dishes were outstanding!  Without saying much, the second pitcher of sangria was better than the first.  All in all, another outstanding experience at Firefly. If you go to Las Vegas, this off the strip gem is not to be missed!

kVN_7lkCs_EObxMkpPesew.text: We had a large group at this amazing restaurant and our experience was EXCELLLENT! We had two top notch servers taking care of our large group. They went above and beyond the entire night. Many thanks and KUDOS to Neo & Marcus. I've been doing large group dinners for over 20 years and can't say I've ever had anyone as spot on as these two guys. I'll also add, all the food we had was great, but the Paella was over the top DELISH!!! Will definitely repeat, again and again. I highly recommend for any type of group event!

mEzJnFH2T6D1QzFod-hLSg.text: Just get the skewers and skewers an more skewers! Tappas style restaurant. Went in on a Thursday and was seated right away. The sangria is very popular here, which I am usually not a fan of because usually it's too sweet, but it's a great balance between fruit and alcohol here. I'm already a fan.

TDsOJzMQcuIzwzXcYoXybw.text: This place was above and beyond our expectations! The food was incredible but the service was even more fabulous. They were incredibly accommodating with our special request, and the manager even came out to check on us. We had the fried calamari, delicious and a healthy portion, the croquettes like Amsterdam! The bacon wrapped dates are to die for, the scallops in garlic butter amazing and my Moscow mule was just what the doctor ordered! We even got to try a dessert sampler which was over the top. Highly recommend checking out this place it's delightfully non Vegasy.

u025UCEsln7UYRisGd3A5g.text: My group had lunch here while at a conference.  The only reason this isn't 5 star is because the food came out in no logical order.  Some of our party were done eating before others got food.  Two people ordered the same thing that came out at different times.  Really not a big deal to me, but 5 star takes perfection.  Wait staff was polite and accommodating.  The food was really, really good.

5LmM5FDdnECA31DKVF8ZnQ.text: This place is fantastic as a couple or in a bigger group.  Great tapas, great menu of either adventurous or more standard choices.  Reasonably priced.   Suggest you order a couple and then keep adding on because you get full pretty fast.   With so many new and different dining choices in Vegas I always tell myself to try someplace new, but every trip I find myself back here.  Never disappoints.

xjgPaCgEKgIS-Z81RJ460A.text: Disappointed. After reading the reviews it was a let down. Food was just ok and service was poor. I would suggest going to a different  place.

GD8UB5WHu0SBglZSgC7Pbw.text: Mmm first night in Vegas my cousin took me here. We got a lot of plates which are small, so it's easy to share and get a lot ! We got goat cheese which was  hot n delicious !  Scallops in garlic sauce, pork empanadas, ceviche and the apple salad are all a must !!! The cocktails are pretty good ! I forgot the name of the drink but one had a shot of Jalapeno juice !! Mmmm!!

QLwZ1tMKJ5_ZRcWteod7zA.text: While driving on Paradise Road on the way to the Cosmopolitan to check out China Poblano 2 weeks ago, I saw this resto's and it immediately reminded of when my co-worker told me about this place. So, I made a u-turn and my wife and I ate dinner her instead. We had the following:  Smoked salmon bagels $9  Patatas Bravas $7  Fried Calamari $10  Ahi Tuna Skewer $10  Chicken Tinga Empanada $7  Vanilla Yogurt Mousse $7  First of all, we were told that this is a spanish style resto with emphasis on tapas. All of the food tasted pretty good. The bagels were great mostly bc the bagels were toasted perfectly and that caper dill cream was pretty tasty. The patatas bravas was pretty much an elegant version of roasted potatoes. I wish the friend calamari came with a acidic sauce like a tomato-based sauce bc eating it with tartar sauce can get pretty heavy. The Ahi Tuna Skewer was the best tasting dish for me. The ginger soy glaze on it actually reminded me more of Hawaii than Spain.  The Empanada was pretty good...light and fluffy and not greasy at all. Im glad it came with a side salad. The vanilla yogurt mousse was ok. It was like not as heavy melted ice cream mixed with fruit. The crispy sugar cookie sticks that came with it were probably one of the best cookies i've ever tasted and made a good dipping partner for the mousse. Overall, I would say this place is pretty good. I'll be back to try their paellas and update this review....

w4cIxjz3Op9U6JdELzBx7g.text: I've been here countless times and I've never had a bad experience!  Positive - Great atmosphere. Great menu choices. Seriously, try them all! Good sangria, too, both white and red.   Negative - A bit pricey. Service can sometimes be a bit slow.

RpbWgPl_nNuAeQ2oBE6hvg.text: This is one of the best tapas places I've been to. We walked about 30 minutes to get to this place, but it was worth every step. It is not directly on the strip and appears to be more of a local spot.   Service was perfect. The food was perfect. Portions and timing was perfect. The sangria (we had the red) was a complete pitcher and not filled with ice....that was good. ;)   I didn't feel so guilty with my over consumption of food and wine after we walked back to the strip after dinner.    This is a fabulous find if you are not afraid to venture off the beaten path. We will definitely return on our next trip.

SYjW3eHiN8PgbMeHwvtC4Q.text: Excellent experience. First time doing the Tapas thing and was not disappointed. The food and drinks were perfect and I would highly recommend it.

XmNko9U6WY78g2DsMkivNw.text: This has always been one of my favorite places in town, despite all the bad press.  The food has always been great, the service wonderful, and the 3-day marinated sangria (as well as the pitchers of mojitos) goes down WAY too smoothly.

TLu7EPesH7E-dihD2SO2uw.text: My girlfriend had been dying to try Firefly for quite some time and kindly decided to take me for a belated birthday dinner. We were able to make reservations through open table via the yelp app (very cool and super easy)! Based upon reviews of Helpers and friends Firefly was surely a place that would please our curious appetites. The service we received was attentive and extremely helpful. Our server had us stop ordering after we selected 6 items suggesting that it may be too much food for 2 people. I had a craving for a cocktail and order the Cherry Mule. It was such a creative take on the Moscow Mule with the twist of adding the St. Germaine's lovely flavor. Thebread and butter was absolutely a great pairing. The butter was sweet and the bread was slightly salty. Our server recommended the figs which we loved! They were stuffed with candied walnuts and sprinkled with cheese as well as a great lightly drizzled sauce. Next were the tuna tartar & ceviche. The tuna tartar was accompanied by fried taro chips and not only did it look good it was also very filling. If I had to pick a favorite of the Tuna Tartar and the Ceviche, then it'd be the ceviche hands down. It was so flavorful and refreshing! The next item was the spicy beef salad and item did not disappoint with its slight kick and yummy dressing! We decided to try out the Diablo shrimp and octopus. Of the 2 dishes I'd recommend the shrimp over the octopus since octopus seemed to have too much going on. We decided to add another dish for good measure. I must confess that Chicken AND Chorizo was my absolute favorite dish!!!! What an amaze combo of tastiness!  To end our meal we ordered the gelato trio and chocolate trees leches cake. The chocolate tres leches cake was ok. I've had better versions in Santa Ana and at other establishments, but the Gelato Trio was spot on!

EoqtXIJ9yC-dA5HSI_pwxg.text: Was there for an early evening snack and drink, the four of us split some appetizers and a couple pitchers of red sangria. We sat o. The bar and the bartenders even though busy where very attentitive and pleasant. The food was good and tastey though i felt the portions couldve been bigger. The drinks were yummy, sangria was sweet. They have latin night on friday nights if thats your thing.

Ahm2iOAx7497tDThqcjGLw.text: Great food, nice atmosphere! Very personal staff along with good customer service. BEST sangria in town!  A nice place to share good company and good quality food from all around the world. Definitely give this place a go if you haven't already you won't be disappointed!

l5Ijq8tXyJApLywhb6Mwfw.text: This is a not a bad stop for an appetiser or a drink but it can be expensive to make a meal if it. The lounge is upscale and they try to impress. I'm personally not a fan of the food or the prices.

6cPiH53SwBZD8lgSwFt6Tg.text: Firefly is my absolute favorite tapas restaurant in town.  Took my family here while they were in town and they loved they experience just as much as I always do.  We all have our favorite dishes but some of our faves were the ham croquettas, baked Brie, stuffed dates and Serrano sliders.  The sparkling sangria is also fabulous.  Great social restaurant to enjoy small bites with friends, family or a date!

2plTCws95dU10rQi7q8hRw.text: This was so good! I was feeling a little chilly, so I had the tomato basil soup. I was not disappointed!

jTOiPe3gnWz8qx96ZOtfIw.text: I had found this place via Yelp, and meanwhile a friend sent along a list of "10 best Vegas restaurants", and they were on it! I definitely agree they should be! This was really good. We ordered 4 tapas plates for 3 people, and each of them was memorably good. Generous portions for tapas, delicious. Ample parking. Attentive service. There was road construction in the general vicinity, but that amounted to a minor annoyance (especially since I wasn't the driver).

ezDESO8kqrIGAcKOmLBdUg.text: My wife and I love this place. We frequent this establishment a few times a month. Great dishes and great drinks. The atmosphere is awesome too.

RzKRoQwJm_Qh01kI-sVyWw.text: Read the reviews on Yelp, and decided to give it a try.  Glad we made reservations.  Place was packed mainly with many groups and some couples.  All the food was delicious.  Our waitperson, Irina, and her main helper, Jesus, were attentive and personable.  5 Stars to them.  Only negative was the noise.  It was hard to listen and talk.  Would have rated it a "5" if the noise level wasn't so high.  We had the chicken & mushroom paella (if you like paella, make sure you order it as soon as you sit down - takes awhile to prepare), beet salad, warm spinach salad, merguez (lamb sausage) and chocolate tres leche cake.  It makes my mouth water, just writing this down!

JENaFrwJMJRf_gc0aEpIrQ.text: :D :D :D 1) the Tres Leches cake 2) and infused vodka - enough said!

cS5wYaq4wrcpGA180fKH4A.text: Even though firefly used to be a traditional local spot,,,it has become I've of the most talked about tapas restaurant in vegas. I have gone there so much i don't even need a menu and now.. Either do u!   Bacon wrapped dates  Mac n cheese Beat salad Mushroom tart Stuffed peppers  Steak and mushroom skewers  Duck spring rolls   My favorite... The sangria! Your welcome and enjoy!!! Xo

RjNtCm9LEK2V8P0ySKdTog.text: I love this Firefly! I always get the Firefly Fries, which are delicious. Tonight I got those, with the Petit Filet and it was boooomb.com! And my dinner partner got the Mushroom Tarte, which he really enjoyed and the sliders which he thoroughly enjoyed. They did much better than usual with their customer service; our drinks were constantly refilled, even after we paid. Very professional. Although, the hostess was a little rushed, and no one was waiting and she didn't hold the door open for us and left us both with one menu. It was about $20 each for us and we got 4 tapas with two drink. Ps. Their butter on their bread is AWESOME & their butter on their steak...

G0V6payFGBt-5sbWcIM49A.text: I had my wedding dinner at firefly on November 2015. I had a total of 35 guest, and let me tell you people it was the best choice I had  on taking them to Firefly.  Not only the food was delicious but the staff was greattt... they handled all my 35 guest very well..lol.. I wanted to thank the staff that took care of us on that night... thumbs up for you all..  Love it love it

VvxEru1KQbSVtmNjsr7oyg.text: Firefly is my go-to place! I love the stuffed dates, apple cheese salad, and the chicken skewers. The food is consistent and the delicious bread and almond butter is always complimentary.   I don't, however, recommend the paella because it is more like a risotto than paella. The flavor is good, but the texture is not what you would expect with paella. Maybe they are just rushed the day I had it.   Prices are very reasonable.

aDtbqqTSxPUfh6SRvsOkiQ.text: Here is the deal folks : come here for tapas only!  I mean, that's it! Not paella, not for the hostess service, not for trying to get most of your tapas together.   Fill up on tapas. And the sangria will not disappoint.   Five stars tapas are as follows: stuffed dates (ON POINT - I mean seriously on POINT! ), merguez (couldn't ask for better lamb sausage - savory with right amount of spice), empanada (NOT the the chicken tinga), chicken and chorizo stuffed mushroom,  juevos estrellados (it has really good spice but only order to get full...carbs will help fill you up)    They have outdoor misters if you want to be outdoors. Noise level is fine. Not too rowdy at all but I went on a sunday evening around 8 pm so you be the judge.   Plenty of parking but can easily get here by taxi from the strip for under ten bucks (like 8 bucks) - note that we came from Wynn.   One of the better tapas places I've been to. Really really good food. :)

J2080VA4t6OqlcM2GEFyjA.text: Ceviche of shrimp was my favorite tapa here. From there on we paired the Firefly fries, Firefly fish sticks, and Serrano ham sliders together for a full meal. The ham sliders were actually more like hamburgers but were the better off the three. Four dishes and we were stuffed. Felt a little expensive but they are tapas so we knew what we were getting ahead of time.

HvZBADLt-RWvcU13TaRZeA.text: Love, love, love the sangria & the tapas!  Very nice bar where you can dine solo. Stuffed dates are a favorite! Red sangria much better than white!

m-DWVYCqWy1cud0GRnmGpg.text: A friend of mine and I found a groupon for this place and decided to come here for lunch. Upon arriving she had told me about their salmonella incident. This of course scared me and I told her I did not want to have lunch here anymore, but she assured me that the new location was fine and that they had really good food. So I gambled with my health and we decided to come anyway. Sure enough the food was delish!  Stepping into firefly I noticed the environment was nice and clean. The walls were painted with warm, dark tones. The overall atmosphere was pleasing. You even had the option to sit outside, but with the sun beaming out we decided to enjoy our meal inside where it was cool.   We stuck with the groupon and ordered multiple tapas and not one of them was a disappointment. My favorite tapas would have to be the mushroom and steak skewers and the smoked salmon toast. The steak skewers were tender, juicy, and flavorful. And the smoked salmon toast..yuuum! Their dishes were served with abundant flavors. And before I forget to mention, their firefly fries are really good; the dipping sauce served with it really compliments the fries.   The servers were also nice. I never had to ask for a refill because my cup would already be filled. I would definitely come back to try their other tapas or entres.

AWUPlXN_jZGiXrJrfukGIQ.text: Awesome sliders, heirloom tomatoes with burata cheese, padron peppers, cod and Spanish red wine!  Server is beyond super friendly and service awesomely fast!  Ask for Alejandro he is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ask for Alejandro!

ByShx3FBaCMimIlq9BRJ0Q.text: One of the best stops off the strip in Vegas! A must stop for amazing food, quick and awesome servers.

Ahu4GpqXu2HoRDsSD3AiLg.text: Ok I haven't been to the firefly in years so let's just say I was tapas intoxicated after my dinner.  Even my children were food sleepy.  It was an excellent experience for my family.  Every dish was in point!

jvRynyhKKKt8yXgQZZfPIQ.text: Dreadful. Tapas are not meant to be mass produced. Dates, chicken tinga empanadas and baked goat cheese were good. The rest were truly mediocre ... pulpo, papas bravas, garlic shrimp, pork empanadas, etc. skip this one !

CcSn9NhxObxyDA4HK15Lkw.text: Great tapas place, they have a large menu including cold tapas, hot tapas, seafood tapas and meat section they also have large plates like the rib eye with large side of Parmesan fries my favorite tapa was the Tierra y mar skewer (surf and turf or combine skewers) with Spanish sausage shrimp and filet mignon with tomatillo sauce on top, pork empanadas are so good and bacon dates are delicious! Serrano ham with cheese and the plate of chorizos is also really good to pair with wine this time I seat at the bar Joaquin Maria and chino took care of me they're really nice their service was quick and they make very good drinks thank you Maria for the recommendations on food thanks Daniel (or chino ) for my old fashioned was on point (bomb bro) and Joaquin I have no words to describe the amazing drink the one you just made for me thank you buddy!   Oh btw it was a drink with mescal, cilantro, bourbon liquor and other secret ingredient

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Joaquin making a special drink for me!

c3kxpQ1XlomH6R1mfzWFTA.text: Fantastic! Went for lunch, can't wait to go back for dinner. Service, atmosphere, and of course the food were all top notch.

VU3HlkhDpTUhOUmTDLUlLw.text: Even in a place with so many great restaurants, this is a gem. Amazing food. Good service. Bit noisy, but with conversation, no doubt about the food.  Tried: Albondigas (meatballs): 7/10 Padron peppers: 8/10 Ribs: 9/10 Merguez: 8/10 Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms Chicago beef bocadillos

7ctDdoP96JXEm_ja7aS52A.text: Love the food here and the eviroment, however the staff sucks! They took forever to get out orders and refilling our drinks. Service or taste for me.

30FUY9gJOIXgu-z5KOfNjg.text: Made reservations for a bachelorette group of 21 here and the food did not disappoint!! Our waiter was attentive to our needs and time restraint since Magic Mike was our next stop! The food was amazing especially the seafood paella at the end!! Will definitely come back!!

m5WEtmHKaZK43xQvpjQ7EQ.text: Service 1/2 a star+ food 5 stars= 3 stars  The reason I even gave this 3 stars was for the incredible amazing food.  The service was horrible.  I understand its Vegas and when servers are charging gratuity for big parties at some point they dont care because they probably won't see us again. Its sad but True. I will recommend this place to friends when they want amazing food but will always warn about the service.  Salsa, Merengue, cumbia, Bachata dance floor outside.

q2IFY8LuHTYgXGQguD7TZQ.text: I like this place, the service always been good,flavors are well balance, nice presentation. Sangria is well prepared, a little sweet, a hint of vodka. Sitting at bar is always my favorite spot... You can see the whole place and get faster service.

TgjdxK7bSLRFW1ncjcZxtQ.text: My favorite bar in Vegas is firefly! The food and drinks are DELICIOUS! My only problem is they don't offer any industry discounts! My friends and I always debate Firefly or Blue Martini and we usually end up at Blue for the 40% off drinks with a work badge. Come on Firefly step it up a bit! A small discount goes a long way ;)

yvJ0qFAQSqeBETW9l0G9GA.text: excellent service and great tasting food.  just came back from Spain and I must say their tapa dishes taste better then few restaurants I've tried in Spain.  ordered  tun a tartare--love the taro chips  stuffed dates  baked cod  scallops escargot  chicken chorizo stuffed mushroom  desert platter-------amazing! love everything on the platter!

ndwfLMLR35-HeHqCOzwVQA.text: Love this place the food is amazing the staff is even better!!! Very personal super friendly my kinda place to get a drink and relax!!

TpHcvwMtjClK02MrKJwFSQ.text: love love love coming here!! firefly is always a favorite when I come down by the strip. the tapas are a great price and SO yummy. my favorites are the apple manchego salad and the stuffed dates. their mojitos are bomb too. Daniel was my bartender today and he was awesome! He even invited us back for their Sunday brunch :)

Jmffq7fnaYzM8JSGSQOdIg.text: The ambience was appealing. Whether you'd dine as a couple, in a group or solo, it has appeal for all. The prices were fair across the menu. The service was ideal. Our waiter took the time to answer our questions about the unfamiliar dishes on the menu and he gave adequate suggestions based on our tastes and food familiarity. We ordered all Tapas for meal. 6 different types, a couple that were house specialties. The white anchovies and stuffed dates. They were superb. A pitcher of White Sangria was tasty and accompanied all of our Tapas selections which included lamb, beef, veggies, seafood and chicken. Everything prepared had excellent eye appeal and flavor and each portion was comparable to the price. We shared each Tapa dish evenly. The warm bread kept coming. Because it was our wedding anniversary a wonderful flan was comped by our superb waiter. We came home to L.A bragging to our friends and family about our new food spot in Las Vegas. We will surely return there.

bNO3txX2vAaThxMGlhLUsw.text: We are visiting from out of town and this place was great.   Food was superb.  We ordered six different items and they were all excellent.  There was a 30 minute wait so we ended up sitting at the bar.  Servers were on itn. Very helpful and the food came out quickly.   Would definitely come back!

lFvVa9_Tn_EqbOVZxwdXKA.text: I'm from out of town and I went to Firefly on behalf of a friend. Let me say, hands down, one of the best spots in Las Vegas. The service was impeccable, the food was beyond words and the sangria... Wow. Not only was the atmosphere amazing along with its food and drinks but it's priced at a perfect amount. Such a special place off the Strip. Carlos, the owner came to our table, introduced himself and even sent us an exquisite dessert platter. I was in Heaven. Thank you Carlos and to your whole team at Firefly. I will be coming back and bringing more guests!!!

oNIJuEgTEeonYV7dsmGXTQ.text: camarones a la diabla is a must! i literally did not let the server take my plate away...that how much i loved their sauce.

0QL7HhYNKYK3DvpY-SXWHg.text: Funky atmosphere,  great food at tapa portion size. Would dine again for dinner and plan to dance the night away afterwards.

A6PWGVe5RfT06w1hP7bgAw.text: Very good tapas.  We went with the Tuna Tartare, Stuffed Dates, Patatas Brevas, Mushroom Tart, Fried Calamari, Grilled Scallops, Albondigas, Ham and Cheese Croquetas, and Serrano Sliders.  It was a great meal that my wife and I shared.  My favorite was the tuna tartare, my wifes favorite was the mushroom tart.  All the food was great, aside from the calamari which was overcooked.  The service was great and the staff was all very attentive to our needs.  We really wanted to try some dessert but as you can see we went all out for our main meal/s.  I definitely will come back to this place next time I am in Vegas.

HjcquhfOEtEhz9Df2aGFRQ.text: Really good small plates with Latin flavor. Clams, chorizo, dates, fish, mushrooms, chicken and so much more! Each one delicious. Go with a group and order two per person. Fun and tasty. The price is very reasonable too!

TxI9VVhjxeyBCTtKTISWVw.text: This review is long overdue!  My boyfriend and I visited Las Vegas for the first time last Valentine's day.  We stayed on the strip for all of our dining and entertainment.  On our last day, we were getting ready to drive home and had to go to the outskirts to fill up on gas, when we passed by this restaurant!  We were both hungry and saw that it offered small plates, tapas, which was just our style so we decided to go for it!  I can't remember what we ate, but it was SO yummy!!!  I am so happy that we happened upon this cute little place, and the next time we're in Vegas we're definitely going back!!

hvk-slyRn64MC_B2yoJbKw.text: Now that it has moved, I must write a new review. I just love this place! I am sad that I have moved so it is out of my way so I can't make my weekly happy hour trips, but I have been able to visit a few times and I have had great experiences. The food and drinks were just as good as the old location as was the service. I love that the new location is much bigger and more modern, although I do miss the dark romantic ambiance the old location had, but the bigger the restaurant is that means the less of a wait so I'm happy about that! Also, valet is a HUGE plus as the last location's parking situation was horrible. Some of my favorites I order every time I have been here and never disappoint are the stuffed peppers, pulpo asado and camarones al ajillo (garlic shrimp, I may have totally spelled that wrong but at least I tried LOL). Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

XQYZ0Ukt5DKTDpPhflzBZw.text: Thanks to Alejandro Garcia and the chef our trip to Firefly was enjoyable and delicious! We ordered the escargot, the huevos estradelldos, the skirt steak, calamari, empanadas, petite filet, tuna tartar finishing up with the flan and tres leches. Everything was perfect and we can't wait to come back!

qfTRcKds43pFIXeHW47hQg.text: Can't say enough about this place. Amazing food. Great experience. Affordable prices. Excellent drinks..

wpl83-Lpvr6A3DAYckvtdg.text: After FireFly had their little health code shut down i thought I'd never be back, but they turned it around and have the best Sangria and awesome tapas for cheap which make for a great meal. The stuffed dates and chorizo stuffed mushrooms were most memorable dishes of the 10 or so we tried. Every dish was quickly served and  flavored to perfection. if you've never been its amazing and for return visitors the newly remodeled Firefly makes for an impressive venue for a date or just a casual hangout with good friends. awesome job!

kvYvUe8l-DDkD-imixqxEA.text: Amazing!  A great experience. Food and service were exceptional.  Do yourself a favor and skip the overly priced Chef themed restaurants on the strip and get to Firefly.  Order anything that sounds good and you will love it!  Shrimp diablo, apple salad, petite filet, scallops, bacon wrapped dates all phenomenal!  The only thing that was just ok was the pork empanda.  Had sangria and flan for dessert.  Great.  Love this place.  Will be back.

3BPeGrsAgmTW-o_0rV6CxQ.text: omg this is the best place I have ever eaten. every dish was better than the last. great drinks. great service. I go back everytime I am in town.

xEDrsvvNe4kqfXwIlh34dA.text: Loved the pulpo asado, bacon wrapped dates and tuna tartar. We are going back for lunch tomorrow to try more. There were mostly locals there, so we think we found a gem near the strip. After dropping $40 for two in the food court at Caesar's on nasty-tasting crap, this was a very pleasant surprise!

7Rq5KGF4Db1ZSRrpeM8Apw.text: We were staying at the hotel right nextdoor so it was very convenient. We had 2 pitchers - one of the white chardonnay sangria and the other was mango mojito. We also had some tapas - stuffed bacon wrapped dates, artichoke toast, tuna tartare, firefly fries and ended with the passion fruit sorbet. IT WAS ALL SO MINDBLOWINGLY AMAZING. Service was fantastic, we never had to pour our own drinks. They were very helpful and extremely friendly as well. Everything was very reasonably priced as well! It wasn't cheap cheap but it wasn't exorbitantly priced either, I would definitely return next time I'm Vegas!!

1C_NgfYKhm1ApfA-gMET3w.text: Great food, the best blue berry mojito ever, we got ceviche, tuna tartare, and tierra y mar ,,,, to die for, I love the lemon berry tart, but my bartender suggested the new pumpkin bread with vanilla ice cream,,,, it was excellent ,,,,, all the Staff was so friendly ,,,, from the hostess to the busser , servers and thanks to the bartenders ,,, Omar, Tina, Danny for the great  service,,,!!!!, you guys made our night !!!!

Z_ZY7sf7Uk4KTmjs0WVz-w.text: Literally every dish here is fantastic.  Service is fast and attentive.  Sangria is a must.  Can't go wrong with the empenadas, Serrano sliders, bacon wrapped dates and much more.  Definitely will be back.

YqSEdicaAQMZ5TGv1zN0zw.text: Amazing tapas place! If we were to eat this on the strip we would probably expect to pay twice the price and felt it was well worth it. Definitely worth the drive.

-HUgnIbaj1OCZB1dErSW8Q.text: Why has no one forced us to try this place before? Truly amazing food. We had 6 different plates and dessert. The service was great too. We don't live close, but worth the drive.

_QOHyanQu3FPGur8xtktzA.text: One of my favorite spots in Vegas to go eat, drink, take a date. Great food great staff

fOYr1qdVa-tQXLryQ968LA.text: Yum! My favorite late night stop. Firefly never fails at making me happy! Food is flavorful, drinks are perfectly balanced and the ambiance of the restaurant is sexy. Happy hour is also great.

8upNECMEglEats6FRg38Hg.text: Firefly...there is no substitute for this place.  Bacon wrapped dates, Sangria, Tuna tartare, filet skewers...this place never disappoints.  Be sure you say hi to Athena at the bar - she rocks.

2ggIAPy7nrQ9oqZd7TogIw.text: So good!!  You have to try the bacon rapped dates. They don't sound like they would be tasty but it's my fav dish there.

nWRUNrwF5UMzHMnaQ6pU9Q.text: Got here for the first time with my girlfriend.  The best thing I can say about the place is the service.  If you come here for a date I suggest don't. It is very loud.  We ordered the fried calamari tapas and the eggplant rolls with goat cheese.  I think the calamari was too salty and on the other hand the eggplants roll were too bland.  We also ordered the seafood ipella.  That was ok it had the flavor.  I suggest to come here with friends and have fun not a one on one on Friday nights. With friends you can make as much noise as you want and drink.  Like a local bar almost.   I give it a 3 out of 5 because of the service. I think it was great they were always on top of everything.

a2Yp3LVpYFg0UD-MWkdzPA.text: Loved the food! Delicious!! The ambiance was fabulous!! So glad we heard about this place... We Loved it! Everything was top notch! Will be back again!

XwlI4BEbfPSZ5USzGnFG4Q.text: A pleasure as always! We've been back every year with CES and love this place.  Amazing stuffed dates and patatas Bravas and tuna tartare.  Good sangria too!  Really very good! Friendly service, reasonable prices. Will return again next year!

_T3gV6Hlr0GSzqo5B5HOPQ.text: amazing food! seriously! so damn good. the service is also excellent. cocktails are delicious! BEST TAPAS EVER!

aiJQIUPNsIU6-oxH95UcJw.text: After so many years, this is still my favorite place. The food is amazing and great customer service from my favorite waiter Alejandro. Highly recommended!!!!

LJ6uMHCyXVpyzMTeUzKXRA.text: I really love firefly!! I've already written a review but I feel the need to write another!   I went in the other night and received a free pitcher of sangria, complements of the owner for my loyalty!   The food here is always top notch and I must repeat: the Sangria is so delicious- easily the best Sangria in Vegas, and it's definitely in the top 3 best sangrias I have ever had (and I've had A LOT of Sangria!)  If you're looking for a fun restaurant, with great food, excellent drinks and good service, go to Firefly. It's one of my favorite places in Vegas

bcKEJHqELzHrBhY5A5Sm-g.text: We got the mushroom tart & the petite filet. Both were great. The Petite Filet was surprisingly big (and amazing). Can't recommend highly enough for Tapas!

kBFdTLpl1Cul3AHpnuOAUg.text: I absolutely love this place! We celebrated my birthday here a couple nights ago and everything was so delicious! Some of my favorites are: manchego salad, bacon wrapped dates, camarones a la diabla and you have to have the tres leches for dessert!

nqgfAoZOqEcXC_m9sQMvEw.text: This place is amazing! My girlfriend and I lived in Spain for 4 months so we are always on the lookout for good tapas. We recently came here with a large group of friends and loved it! The sangria (white and red) were delicious. We will definitely visit this place again next time we are in town. The service was quick and friendly. And it's not too far off the strip.

SXCxtCOBAUwiChAKTZpyww.text: This is our first dinner stop whenever we arrive in Vegas, especially now that Firefly is at their new location.  We like the variety & quality of their tapas along with their white Sangria to wash it all down.

g-Dt1RfqpbLMghSAYrKvKw.text: Great meal with my friends. Cheaper than expected,  more delicious than we planned for.  Each dish offered a new texture or flavor. Wait staff was friendly, accommodating,  and happy to serve. Come here for a good dinner!!!!

ND5Y6W_6ygZ4pf6HjHln9A.text: Excellent food, friendly staff, fast service, what more could you ask for? I think they've really stepped up their game since they had issues and moved locations.

nHSbH6B9lILUxqC67l7-Gg.text: Firefly had amazing food and great cocktails. My favorite dish was the bacon wrapped stuffed dates. The bread and butter they bring out to your table is amazing as well as the stuffed peppers. The service was great, it was a little loud, but not too bad. I would definitely come back for tapas.

zY-jv9ILQWRAgIoyKtIOzQ.text: I really don't know why this place has such a high rating. The food wasn't good, everything is like homemade with a lot of oil or butter, don't go here to attempt to eat healthy. Quality of food was prob the worst I ever had.   I'm not trying to be mean, everyone was really nice but I just don't understand the food ....    It's not even bar food... very confused but I guess a lot of people like it

nNucnjAo0DlSTcdKf0cfMA.text: My friends and I decided to come here for lunch and I'm glad we did. The food was amazing!! We had the octopus, potato, and combination paella. I guarantee you won't be disappointed.

b9egL3FqjXuiDjQZfNXxgg.text: This is one of my favorite places of any cuisine in the city, hands down. Outstanding food, service, and ambience. The ahi tuna skewer, pork empanadas, paellas, and the dessert platter are to die for. Overall, Firefly excels in all purposes; dates, family, friends, or just a casual drinking spot. A+++!!!

vi1Hsqn7YXOr3B6eTXnQjg.text: ** meh**  The good : - Tapas mean a huge menu with several affordable tasty options - plenty of bar seating  - great happy hour menu with affordable options including some of their most popular meals  - tasty sangria   The blah: - wasn't impressed with the bread and almond / mango butter too many flavors on the butter ' the bread was cold and the butter was like marble. Didn't care for this  - apple salad was the only edible thing but BEWARE a lot of their meals have almonds in it . So like clearly If you have a nut allergy this isn't for you - didn't care for the flavor of the dogs wrapped in bacon - meatballs were forgettable

lfWqzEnCC4bfGgUnp25RHg.text: Yasssss! Love the ambiance of this place! The food was fantastic, and service was very good. Firefly is on my list of great restaurants. Thank You!

sqJLbkvxS3PzkhC3SjyT_A.text: First time here..Waiter was excellent food was amazing ... recommend the mar y Tierra skewers  camarones a la diabla the sauce is awesome  and chorizo clams to name a few... the sangria is delish.  Must have in Vegas will have to come again.

KvHoNNuJichXL2Sk1htjXw.text: Everything was average. My favorite dish was actually the croquetas. Everything else was good but didn't amaze me. Some garnishes and bread were cold and hard maybe because I came during late lunch hours. Drinks were good.
