EauVy4Bs5h3FJps-P0YYig.text: Our favorite tapas in Vegas! So good we stop in even when driving through to get takeout. Best is the chorizo and clams. Great camarones and skewers.

-XJ6ZVHoL1thR9DmIO9usA.text: Too good.  I am not even out of this restaurant as yet, and I am dying to write my review.  They way they have played with the spices on each entree is amazing.   So glad I came here. :-)

fRfqfvx39aOB13TUNr07Ig.text: One of my favorite places to eat at in Vegas! Ever since I had my birthday dinner here a few years ago, I've been coming here every time I go to Vegas. I love tapas and was first introduced to paella and tapas on a Barcelona trip 2 years ago. Before then I never really knew what tapas were lol. My favorite things to get are either the shrimp ceviche, paella, tuna tartare, pulpo asado, steamed mussels, scallops, empanadas, or camarones al ajillo. The seafood here is super delicious and the sangria excellent!  The paella takes awhile to make so if you're gonna order that, put your order in with your appetizers. Weekends are really busy here so make sure to make a reservation or there's first come first serve seating at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my favorite birthday dinners ever! Paella sangria and tapas

yrJLQWj3FSWrf8atJgyIDQ.text: Shout out to L.C. for another great suggestion for some savory tapas!  We met up on a Friday night for my first go at Firefly.  Luckily we were seated in a nice comfy booth because the place filled up really fast.  After eating here I knew why.  When dining with my Yelp friend I knew I would be trying a lot of food and stuffed to the gills.    Upon putting our food order in, the food just seemed to roll out of the kitchen quickly and efficiently.   We started with the Chopped Chicken Salad.  It certainly wasn't the type of salad I was expecting but it was enjoyable.  The salad scoop was surrounded by endive leaves which made for a lovely presentation.  Plus it made a nice chicken salad 'boat' for consumption.    Next I tried the Stuffed Dates.  Holy Buckets. It was my first time having dates with dreams of having this hot tapas again.  The bacon wrapped date with smoked almost and blue cheese was divine.  Since we were all sharing I couldn't eat the whole dish as much as I would've liked to.  To appease the men at the table, Chicago Beef Bocadillos were before us.  The shaved beef sandwiches were topped with house made giardiniera.  The beef was tender and full of flavor.  The giardiniera just made the sandwich better and earned a thumbs up.  The pork stuff Empanada was also a good choice.  I wish there were more on the plate for sharing like some of the other tapas but we all still had a little taste of hot pastry.    Of course we can't skip dessert when they offer a Dessert Platter.  Flan, chocolate tres leches, cheesecake and a berry tart make up this delicious sampling of treats.  The chocolate tres leches stood out as the star on this platter.  The cake was soaked in goodness that you just shouldn't pass up.    Service was ok as our waiter seemed to disappear for lengths of time.  I was guessing because it was a busy Friday evening so I might try another day of the week for my return visit. I left full with a smile.  See you next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Platter
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicago Beef Bocadillos
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped Chicken Salad

SmY3PbNxxyBqa29XUgms4Q.text: Great sangria and great happy hour! We came here with a large group of friends and were accommodated quickly. We were over 15 and I was surprised with the quality of service we received. We did not wait a lot for our food or  drinks. Everyone on the table each ordered different things and the food came promptly.   I ordered the empanadas (delicious), fries (big basket!), Mac and cheese, croquetas and chocolate tres leches cake. All the food that we ordered was great. The only one I did not love was the Mac and cheese. It tasted fine but not something I would order again. My personal favorite was the empanadas. The dessert was also very tasty and could be shared with 2 people.   Like I mentioned, the sangria here is really good. We ordered pitchers for the table. They have 3 options but I only tried the red sangria. This is a place I would definitely come back to especially during happy hour.

1g4mcyk2JEf__FWsTAaOQw.text: Wooooooow!!! First time going here I must it is sooo delicious and the Sangria was very good. We all orders different tapas and we shared it among us. The Tinga empanadas must try. Can't wait to go back.

iwmykXfObMTCXOBVUIOdeA.text: Amazing!!! Just got off the plane from the other side of the country and was starving. This place was recommended by my flight attendant and I was pleasantly surprised. Great sangria and beer options. They had a wide variety of tapas options at fair price. Everything was delicious. Come here if you are ever in Vegas and you want some local flair!

vLnyGgMfe4fNmC1jMPBEcA.text: Worst service I've ever received here, and it was for a special occasion  but the food came quickly and drinks were delicious even though the water glasses were always empty and we were left on the patio while the waiter maybe went home and we wondered if we would ever get the check.   Of course I'll be back, I love this place. Too bad my friends had never been and were not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

njoTWlm3ZvrOBafKU6cWXQ.text: I made reservations for 6 for birthday party at 6.30pm (Friday). We got seated today in a cute private booth.   I love their ambiance, trendy, and dim with lots of Spanish arts on the wall. Outside seatings looked very beautiful.  The waiter suggested their winter Sangria that has pumpkin and cinnamon. It was tasty. I ordered Chorizo clams - the clams were very fresh.  Camarones Al La Diabla - the lemon garlic sauce was flavorful and the shrimp was plump.  The place is great for big groups. It was very loud and packed with big parties celebrating birthdays. Not a place for quiet conversations.  My friends enjoyed their food. If you let them know it's your birthday, they give you a complimentary flan.  The service was top notch. We sat there talking for a while and they didn't rush us.

MHrF7t_uWAnEkAs2vkFGsA.text: Firefly is definitely worth going to. The food is great quality and the service was prompt. These are tapas so I'd recommend 2-3 plates per person if you are hungry. Recommendations- the octopus was delicious, the steak and mushroom skewers were great and the dates super yummy! The tuna tartare was a good size and good quality but I would pass that up if you are trying to decide.

q4wwY-2kIwNBnPOlkHWyEw.text: All I wanted was a delicious meal. Thanks firefly! ..and lucky me to have stumbled in during happy hour. The albondigas were full of Italian flavor, cheesy and only 4 dollars. Such a steal. I also had the hot spinach salad it was fresh and everything went together perfectly. Lastly, I had the tierra y mar skewers. So much goody on such a small stick. There are so many options that have mbut attention I look forward to revisiting this place. I also tried their berry infused vodka. I dont typically like sweet drinks, but this was smoothe and almost tasted like straight grape juice. Bartenders were nice and attentive.

MEi9SO0VCb0EBJSZ93AxlQ.text: This was the best meal and the best service we had in Vegas (and we've been here for a month!). Lots of great options for meat-eaters and vegans alike, quick and caring staff, overall an awesome experience. Try the roasted carrots and the pork empanadas!

NaZmmJmbjqQ5yfhUFIjwSw.text: It was our first time to try Firefly. The food choices looked all great and different. After we ordered several small plates each they came out in no orderly fashion. One of us had all of our plates and the other person had none. I ordered a glass of wine that never came so I asked the waiter and he ran and got it.  We were enjoying our meal and I patiently waited for my empanadas when I realized I better ask in there whereabouts. Once again the waiter ran to get them.  Once I received them I was a bit disappointed because the were burned around the edges, which left about two bites of empanada because they are small.  Lastly the oil used to cook the fish sticks was past its prime because the fish stick color was an ugly darkish brown. No good. For the foot version the service could have been better. The food is very good but attention to detail would help.

-sMBEKZimJFoNF00VDaV2g.text: We had a tough day so we treated ourselves to dinner at Firefly and were not disappointed. Our service was impeccable and the food was great. I highly recommend the ribs. They were my favorite. By the time we finished our pitcher of sangria we felt much better.

tuSUmYZjEVB1E0ud-KXkhA.text: After our wedding at the Flamingo, we came here for our reception. The food is spectacular as well as the service.   Fernanda and Regina took such great care of us before and during the reception, making sure everyone was taken care of.  Paul and Neo, our servers and bar tenders of the night, also deserve high praise for their efficiency and attentiveness.    We began outside on the patio for light tapas.  Albondigas, the stuffed dates and artichoke toast kicked off the night.  Multiple trays of each were passed around to the guests, enough where I could have filled up on those had I not known what else was to come.  Although I loved all three of these starters, the albondigas were my favorite.  They were tender and juicy and full of flavor due to the Parmesan and sherry sauce.  The guests raved about the stuffed dates which had a perfect balance of sweet with the red wine reduction sauce and savory with the blue cheese.  The smoked almonds added not only another element of surprise to the mixture of flavors, but a nice juxtaposition of texture to the dates.  My mom and aunt's favorites were the artichoke toast- a perfect amount of salty crunchiness from the bread with a generous piece of warm artichoke on top,  Honestly, as I am writing this review recalling the food, maybe all three were my favorite!  To accompany the starters and the meal, we had an open bar. Being on the patio we had a separate opening to the inside bar that only our guests could order from.  No waiting at all.  I enjoyed the sangria, pretty much all night.  Both the red and the champagne sangrias were filled with fresh fruit and both had  unique flavors.  The champagne sangria was a little sweeter, perfect for dessert, while the red accompanied most of my food.  Regina brought out pitchers for all the guests to enjoy on top of whatever else they wanted to drink. Fernanda, Regina, Paul and Neo did not skip one beat!  Now on to the meal...We were moved to a private room inside.  The only downfall was that there was only a black velvet curtain separating us from another party and at times they got a little loud ( as did we I am sure).  But other than that, Firefly set up a private drink station for us to continue to order drinks from.  We began the meal with Toasted Bread, Almond Butter, and Marinated Olives.  That almond butter was so sweet; being married to the saltiness of the olives made this, again, another tantalizing combination.  Next was the paella. I have never had paella before, but now I am a paella believer!  It was filled with seafood and pork - just a whole lot of stuff! Many guests filled their plates with whichever meats they liked best. We also enjoyed the ribeye and the herb roasted chicken.  The ribeye was nicely cooked, especially in the inside if you like your meat more medium.  It was more cooked on the outside.  The sauce was reminiscent of the red wine reduction form the stuffed dates.  The herb roasted chicken was tender and we were served both white and dark meat.  As a side, we had the firefly fries, and damn that aioli was addictive.  A few guests admitted to eating multiple plate fulls of the fries the next day.  To end our evening of food, we got to savor the Chocolate "Tres Leches" Cake.  Moist and delightful, it was a perfect end to the perfect meal.  We also ordered a wedding cake from Freeds which was delivered to Firefly.  It was one of the most flavorful and delicious cakes I have every had - I recommend the almond flavored cake.   The night was coming to a close, and we all had such an amazing time.  We were supposed to be out by 8, but our speeches went a little longer and people lingered a little longer.  The staff did not rush us out nor did we feel pressured to get out.  This wedding experience was pretty close to perfect, a word I don't use too lightly but used repeatedly in this review.  The only thing I wish is that there was a Firefly in the CLE.  Much thanks to Firefly: Fenanda, Regina, Paul and Neo!

JpkHnpMdCoxfcs8QwJAVnQ.text: Very special place ....the food is amazing...great for catching up with friends ...atmosphere is great ...beautiful design...and great service.

jUE3dvrWTVWpeoGhEohXxA.text: We came here to celebrate my sisters 30TH birthday! they were super great with us bringing a cake for her. They cut and served it for us. The food here is pretty good! i just wish they brought out our dishes in pairs or all together, since we were a party of 6 we ordered multiple dishes but we all didn't get to try the food at the same time. not a big deal though. We sat out on their patio which is great! covered and with fans and cute patio string lights (my fav) I would definitely recommend this place! check it out if you're ever in Vegas!

G0n8CyJWFVzzV2WW1GuDEA.text: Ive only been to 4 tapas places in my entire lifetime, this one was memorable! We celebrated a bachelorette lunch here and the girls liked sharing the different plates we got. For me, The highlight picks were the paella, mac and cheese and egg and potato (i forgot the name!) The environment is nicely deco'd and theres a lot of seating. Customer service also good! Great tapas place to try in the area. I take one star off because they didnt have reservation slots through open table at the time i needed.

TnPL7FWGsr21EmqeJumC2g.text: From the atmosphere to the food, I LOVE this place. This is like one of those secret off the strip places that you treasure. We brought a big group in during the Furniture Market. Our table wasn't ready so they let us hang in the bar. We had a blast! The SANGRIA here is amazing!!!!!! We then were seated and ordered TONS of plates -they were ALL delish! It is loud and a little crazy in here but I can't wait to bring other people here!   Well done!

eGsamj0c4R4md_qqF4G_xQ.text: Firefly is perfect for groups, but definitely make reservations!  Firefly's ambiance is high-energy and a bit romantic, as evidenced by the dim lights and curtains dividing areas.  We made reservations for 8 people at 6:45 and were seated right away in a booth that comfortably fit all 8 of us.  It was especially nice because we were seated in a little nook that gave us privacy, and more importantly, a quieter area so that we could actually hear each other.  Disclaimer: I am not a sangria connoisseur, so my taste is not very discriminating.  I ABSOLUTELY LOVED the sparkling wine sangria; I regret not getting a pitcher.  It went down just like juice.  It is on the sweeter side, so beware if you like a more mild sangria.  As for the tapas, I had the tuna tartare and the petite filet.  The tuna tartare was pretty bland and rather oily, however, I was impressed with how fresh the fish was!  This was the first time I had tuna tartare, so maybe that was how it was supposed to taste, but I would not get it again.  However, I loved the pairing with taro chips (disclaimer: I may be a little partial because I am from Hawaii) because it was a little different and made up for the oiliness of the marinade.  The petite filet was DELICIOUS!  It was cooked perfectly, moist, and soft.  I absolutely loved the red wine sauce, as well as the fact that it came with mushrooms!  It is a must have!  My friend had the firefly fries, which I heard good things about.  However, I thought it was also rather bland and oily, and did not eat too many of them.    All in all, I would definitely return for the sangria and because of all of the enticing tapa options!  There are so many other tapas I would love to return to try.  Additionally, I didn't save any room for dessert and the banana-nutella sandwiches are calling my name!  Firefly is perfect for groups of friends to catch up!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare - fish was fresh but overall dish was a little bland.

SjYxpvXL9hAx5AEacwCdeA.text: Firefly, this hurts me more than it hurts you.  Trust me on this.  I live in Southern California, so Vegas is like our back yard playground.  For the past few years, I have raved about Firefly; this semi, off-the-strip restaurant that didn't have a celebrity chef's named attached to it that still offered innovative and delicious food.  I would recommend this place to all of my friends and I initially gave them a 5 star review.  But a lot has happened since the first time I fell in love with Firefly.    (1) The were shut down for Salmonella poisoning (2) They closed down their first location (3) Moved to a larger, new location (4) Food quality went down the toilet  I took my husband to Firefly and all day, I had hyped up this amazing restaurant ... the "best tapas" I told him. Oh man, the disappointment was equivalent to that of a kid finding coal under the tree on Christmas morning.  The food was salty and mediocre. There were some dishes that we didn't want to finish -- and these are tapas, small plates.    Also, service was sub par.  They appeared to be slammed with guests or under-staffed.  It was difficult to catch the attention of any server and had different people serving us each time. Who was our waiter again?  Honestly, like I said before, I mean it when I say that it hurts me to write this review.  I would love to have Firefly back to the way that it used to be.  Somewhere, after the Salmonella poisoning and the move to their new location, they seemed to have lost their good taste and service.    There are so many other places to eat in Vegas-- don't waste your time here.

32zcUXoZutVZfOSVtcmtqA.text: The curse of small plates is; you always want to eat more. Combine that with a (my) large appetite and and my size 48, 20 pants are starting to look wider than tall. Samantha and Jesse, our wait crew, worked in perfect sync to fill my gaping maw. I must have looked like a baleen whale feasting on its catch, as I unmercilessly shoved boquerone after boquerone into my face hole. Plate after glorious plate was delivered to my table, the kitchen became a revolving door of delicacies, one could almost hear "Yakety Sax," (the Benny Hill Show song) playing in the background. I simply had to refuse desert, lest I explode like some character from a Monty Python skit...

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boquerones were awesome

uuM8MTlhqechs2CgFZcSNg.text: When the most recent health inspection debacle revealed the same offenses (food handling, contamination, hand washing) as inspections in the past, it sent a message. It was a blatant disregard for the public's health and safety. It stung more because I was very adamant about forgiveness and continued to patronize their restaurants after the salmonella incident. I've never had a food poisoning issue, but now it felt like a gamble to dine with them. I've made a choice to not support a business that has repeated offenses of this nature (regardless of what they claim is not their fault) based on principle.  My recent visit was prompted by the celebration of a good friend's graduation. We joined her and her family on their vacation to Las Vegas (I had forewarned them about the events). In any case, our dining experience was mostly pleasant and I was admitedly excited to eat some of my favorite dishes again.   The hostess was kind enough to accomodate our large group in one of their semi-private dining booths/tables with drapes (although these proved difficult for the servers and bussers since they had to constantly move them to reach the table). Everyone was really friendly, but service was just okay. Several times we were searching for our server or anyone to come to our aid or just replenish water.  The food was still as delicious as I remember. My favorites being the Stuffed Dates, Firefly Fries, Paella (mixed), and Pork Empanada. The only disappointment was the Tuna Tartare, which was also an old favorite. But overall, I enjoyed my meal. Also, I really liked the Chocolate Tres Leches Cake.  So, the food is still good and service is okay. Doesn't change how I feel about the business and their owners. Dine at your own risk.

MGQOHTanwWoIcyOfpL2tCQ.text: Amazing!! Tierra y Mar was Bomb!!  Stuffed dates are a must!!  Lamb Chops are a slice of heaven!  Red Sangria tasted like it was made with sprite. No bueno.  Desserts are not worth writing about.   Service was OK. Though they offered us a free dessert, i think it is important to be notified in advance if there are long wait times. I like being checked up on and my server really checked in.   I gave this 4 stars for the amazing food and unbeatable prices!!

G3q2SB7bHUF4gnnEzfHCXQ.text: I love all about this place. I always order from tapas menu. Yes, it is tapas but it will fill u up.  I almost try all their tapas menu, moving forward to the entree soon. As of their cocktail, it always good.

OrFL7idp2KBifaK6eEly7Q.text: We went to this restaurant with a large group.  We ordered the sangria and a bunch of tapas to share. The sangria was actually sweeter than I usually like it. The vegetarian paella was to die for!!!!!! The spice was one of the best I have recently tasted.  The patty as bravas were spicier than I have had, or am used to and were not my favorite. The stuffed mushrooms and empanadas were good also!  Tortilla espanola was an average tortilla.  Overall the restaurant had a really fun environment and was super crowded. I can see why so many people like this restaurant and continue to come visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

39IVePHLe1-USc-Z9k0SZw.text: My friend and I went to Fireflys for a cocktail or two (wink wink) and food. First of all, out server Andrea was AMAZING!!! She had great suggestions on her faves and we ordered them!!! The Mac N Cheese was cheesy and full of flavor. And you could never go wrong the Stuffed Dates.  We will definitely be coming back...thanks Andrea for the great service!!!

IsI9_Z-KXT_KHeNuTDn6FA.text: I can't believe that before this weekend I have never been here. The food.... is AMAZING. Everything has so much flavor and just melts right in your mouth. We ordered so much food and there was not one thing we didn't like!   We were a party of 12 with no reservations but were seated within 20 minutes. Staff was friendly. The vibe was amazing. Would definitely come back and recommend to everyone!

xlDgA4u7xUYuQF8suufB6w.text: Ummmm... racism is wrong. I don't like writing bad reviews. Before I start, this review is not about the food -- which was excellent. The one star review is about several members of the staff.   I was there on my birthday, dressed up in a pretty dress and my guy friend was wearing a nicely pressed button down shirt. I'm pointing this out because the staff treated us like we were filthy street people. The staff was literally fawning over every table around where my friend and I were sitting -- yet they were beyond rude to us. At least four times they tried to take plates away long before we were finished, brought the check before we asked for it and while we were still eating, then trying to take the plates away again while there was still food on them! Two nearby tables had the opposite experience. The waitstaff was attentive, smiling, and even engaged in polite little chats. I thought maybe they were the owners or friends of owners... until I realized the waitstaff was being that way with almost every single other table! They were being NICE to them!  Here is the sad fact: My friend and I are not Latino, sorry but there is no other way to say it. We are white people and there were only a handful in the entire restaurant. VERY DISAPPOINTING to be treated that way because of our skin color. As delicious as the food was, I will never go back to Firefly.   It was when we were leaving that I realized what was going on. Here is why: someone had accidentally left a car key near the front door. So I walked it over to the bartender who wasn't even taking an order or making a drink -- he looked at me with a quick little nasty expression, then ignored me. All I was trying to do was return someone's lost key. I had NO other interactions in the bar area while at Firefly, so there was zero reason why the bartender would give me a dirty look.

l8sH9pqYPdw3Ie858FV6iw.text: Love this place, my favorite dishes:  Papas bravas, croquetas. Friaday night: Salsa music do you can dance all night. The only thing: they no bring the food to the terrace on Friday night, you have to purchase at the bar, and it could be inconvenient.  Service is good

9oOxcNANNdKEkLc1nIXswQ.text: Not bad for a tapas place I guess. We got a seafood paella, stuffed peppers, potatas bravas, empanadas, and stuffed eggplant to share. The paella was quite delicious; good flavor and a lot of food. The tapas were just okay, nothing to rave about. Prices were fair (paella was $26 for 2-4 people, which isn't bad at all), though tapas were on the pricier side. I would give this place 3.5 stars for the food, will bump up for good service.

4wSNwQb4LsehjQK0TMQpcw.text: I love this place.   The ambiance is great.  The Apple and Manchego salad is my favorite.  They have delicious Mojitos and Sangria and tons of other cocktails.

-Dqvqb7HjanptF-T1eU7bg.text: I haven't given five stars to any restaurant. Ever. This place is fantastic! Especially for the price.  I sat at the bar and my waiter was so attentive, friendly, helpful, and knew the menu well. I went solely off his recommendations. When he found out it was my first time there, he was very welcoming and enthusiastic.  I had the stuffed dates...amazing. It's a small plate, but I guarantee you won't want to share! I also had the petit fillet, which melted in my mouth. I was bummed that I didn't have more people with me so that we could try more food....but those two small plates filled me up!  I will DEFINITELY be back!   PS If you have more than one in your party, best to make a reservation...it was packed!

4xRGUMOPz9vU--ZIXgCQHA.text: Yup... it's that's good. Steak and Mushroom skewers in a red wine reduction sauce Camarones Diabla Bacon Wrapped Dates Apple Salad Empanadas Sangria  But the biggest plus... for anyone staying on the strip and eating in those expensive hotels is the price. Extremely reasonable for the quality of food. Best deals can be found by getting into Uber and getting off the strip.

OmY7YXMMPyp9n77issDagg.text: Excellent food. So many different types of  Tapas to choose from.  Your palate will enjoy every bite. I will be back the next  time we visit Vegas.

nwFn-9TFTq0ll5Y8XrH85Q.text: I have been coming to firefly since the old location down the street. I have not been back to the new location in a few years but it didn't disappoint. Everything was good and quality was also good. The paella is amazing and worth the wait since it is made to order. Prices have stayed the same over the years but noticed that sangria pitches got smaller and more expensive. Best to come during happy hour for 1/2 prices.

WUIrLmTVi6kcYDtw6abuig.text: Wanting to catch a bit after a long day of traveling and not much was open. Their late hours led me me. From the decor to the food, to the ambiance, to the service, it was all absolutely amazing. This is a MUST everytime I'm in Las Vegas!

bMmdY2zbwIz4piDSqpnOdQ.text: Gluten free friendly yippee they have a huge menu for us!!! The food is so delicious and it comes out hot!!! The red sangria is the bomb!!!

7Ej4jr0HeQkMSzEWClc-9Q.text: Worth going out of the way for!  Food is excellent and comes out very fast.  Try the flavored mojitos.  You won't b disappointed.

Ey7Tlck67u3_1h6GGoECMg.text: They have a very extensive tapas menu and the service was great. Omg surprisingly their red sangria was delicious especially on a hot day. If you want the paella , order it early. We had the seafood and it was good, lots of seafood. The dates bacon wrap was a tad bit salty. The potatoes with chorizo was super salty, you truly need a bowl of rice to scarf that down. The shrimp glazed with sweet and sour sauce was typical , nothing interesting. Felt like I can buy a sweet and sour sauce bottle at the Asian store and just stir fry it with the shrimp.   I truly enjoyed the scallop escargot , pesto and bitter were so yummy!!! Must order !! I also enjoyed the apple salad with manchego cheese and smokes almond, very light and refreshing!

C8upUw2GBaKBg_RVcXLnzA.text: My girls and I, after a long night of work,love to hit up Firefly! Such a good happy hour! The red sangria is my favorite, we always get a pitcher! (Okay maybe two) At night we don't want something too heavy so we love the tapas idea! MY Faves are the bacon wrapped dates, stuffed mushrooms, STUFFED PEPPERS, and the manchengo Mac and cheese is a guilty pleasure! The ambience in here is great, I feel like someone is about to bust into the room and start dancing salsa! The waiter that serves us I'm so mad I forgot his name but you can't miss him he looks like a Telenovela superstar! Just yum! (Wait the food, the food is yum) Overall love it here!

-DsogP3LbjUPwmlQ8CgBCg.text: Everything about this restaurant keeps me coming back. Their dishes are phenomenal! My favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, the lamb chops with lentils dish and a jar of red sangria for endless refills . Also, they turn the outside patio into a salsa dance floor every Friday between 11pm-2am. Go check it out!

hJMQQ6rGn20BxHghrLLHIA.text: A great starting point in Vegas. The Tapas are outstanding. The drinks even better. Sit at the bar while waiting on a table. Great Mojitos (Great Pours!!). The process is just order once you finish the selection you made as these are small portion dishes. Would suggest starting out with the warm spinach salad, then onto one or two of the different tapas. So stop by this place before you explore Vegas.

n2oreFQchlOZiDBIcohdsA.text: Nice place, great vibe, loud , and the food well the 4 stars are for the food, it is tasty but the meals are  small.

jExF8V3yD266jJ7VXLWS6g.text: Great food love the sangria! Happy hour before 6pm is always great since the majority of tapas that I order is on the happy hour menu plus the sangria. I love the Tuna tar tar, sliders comes with shelters and blue cheese if you don't like that then let your server know and also read INGREDIENTS it's very annoying to hear people around us that they didn't like a certain thing. Service was a bit slow could use some work on faster paced but our server was very attentive when he did arrive.

9QgpeuYCf5D4TeLzBr25yA.text: Firefly has a lot of potential, but is short on the customer service. I made a reservation for 7:00pm and received a phone call that if I was not in the restaurant by 7:02, my reservation would be given away. Well, good thing I like to be on time. In fact, my husband and I were at the restaurant by 6:45pm. We were then told that we had to wait until closer to 7 to be seated. Understandable. Until I noticed about two to three parties without reservations being seated before us. What's the point of making a reservation??? At 7:02, when we were walked to our table, we passed about 10 empty ones...um, ok. The three stars is for the food. It's good. Service, not so much.

8tVyRperQ8dC43dlws4fAQ.text: They lose a star for the service we received from our waiter, Ivan. He was disengaged, unfriendly, and seemed annoyed which put a damper on our reunion with our friends. The drinks were high priced and not good. No one liked their drinks. The pear ginger martinis were syrupy sweet. We asked for spicy margaritas and there was no heat at all. BUT, the food was AMAZING. Huge selection of delectable tapas. The croquettes were delicious and everyone's favorite. The stuffed dates were little flavor bombs. The clams with chorizo were amazing. We asked for more bread THREE TIMES to sop up the sauce and never got it. Eggplant around goat cheese was delish. Chicken tinca empanadas were good. Our least favorites were the stuffed piquillo peppers and chorizo stuffed mushrooms (which needed a sauce). I would come again for the food but if we got service like we did last night again, I would never come back.

F7L88ZYhipH2VwMKli4l4Q.text: It almost saddens me to see all these other reviews for it leaves me with no new accolades to shout.  My daughter had her wedding reception at Firefly on Saturday night.  We'd pre-selected our choices of appetizers and the dinner to be served.  The service was beyond exemplary.  Regina coordinated the tables, the serving, the bar.. Neal kept a smile on the face of all our guests with his maintaining the desires of the thirsty.  I'm sorry I did not get the names of the other servers but I do thank them all so very much.  Now the food.  Wonderful.  We ate and ate and our guests all were thrilled with everything.  It was such a great evening.  The room was perfect and I had a great time.  Thank you so very much for your part in making this day so special for all of us.

sW0QjeQ-30IySsaUxuW6AA.text: Time and Time again!! This place is always outstanding ! I've been coming here since they opened their original location and I have never been disappointed. Tonight was no different . Brought 4 friends ( one with a corn allergy ) who have never been here . They loved it all as much as me . Special thank you to Neo our waiter and Jaime our chef who were amazing. Paid such great attention to us and her allergy . Can't wait til next week , cause I'll be back for more as usual .:  Gracias !!!!

vSRyq0B4o7uaxWTpsf6CdQ.text: Great atmosphere, even better food!  The scene: Loud and busy Sunday night for dinner.   The Staff: Courteous and knowledgeable.  The Small Plates: Divine.  From the outside the place looks a little corporate with neon signage, however the food is not. Our dinner consisted of a giant pitcher of red sangria, stuffed dates, eggplant cannelloni, meat skewers (can't remember exact name), roasted pear and beet salad.   Everything was delightful. Easy bite has great depth and flavor, and was made with love.  Desserts we had were the mini passion fruit cheesecakes, and the cherry/chocolate bread pudding. Both we above average.  I suggest making a reservation in advance, it is well worth it.  Enjoy!

iFALISYYB7r2IK4KAatqfw.text: It seems to be that everywhere you go, tapas is the hot new topic. Small plates are awesome. You can have as many plates as you want, and variety makes us all happy. You don't have to order 1 dish and be stuck with it. If you order one wrong dish, you at least have 3 other ones that are good. Tapas is shareable, and at one sitting, you can easily have tried 10 different dishes. For those saving money or not too hungry, its a good way to save money and just get snacking items. It doesn't seem like tapas is going away anytime soon. Firefly in Las Vegas, not too far from the strip. They have some of the best tapas in Vegas, and the atmosphere is very relaxing. Stumbling upon this spot, I could only wishttp://www.dinedelish.com/wp-admin/edit.phph it were on the strip, inside the comforts of a resort.  Their stuffed dates were on point. Wrapped in bacon, the salty and the sweet was working perfectly together. Also stuffed with smoked almonds, it gave it a nice nutty flavor as well as a good crunch. A sprinkle of blue cheese made everything round out nicely. When you are talking about tapas, stuffed dates is automatically in the conversation. The ones at Firefly were nothing short or spectacular. The red wine reduction was a nice touch to the stuffed dates. This is a must order when you are at Firefly.  The filet minon sliders were surprisingly tasty. Topped with blue cheese and fried onion straws, the sliders were rich. The fried onions gave it a good crunch, and the cheese is what gave it a nice flavor. If the cheese didn't do it in the flavor department, their south western style sauce topped it all off. With filet minon being the patty, you know it was going to be soft and juicy. The patty had a nice crust on the outside, and the inside was juicy and not dry at all. This was a perfect little slider combination.  My favorite was the tierra y mar skewers. Skewers with grilled shrimp, filet minon, and chorizo sausage was a perfect trifecta of flavors and textures. Drizzled with a nice salsa verde on top, each bite was perfectly different on its own. The filet minon was uber tender and though it didn't have a lot of fat, it contained so much flavor. The shrimp was grilled to a nice crisp and was a match made in heaven when eaten with the chorizo. Everything seemed to work together in this -- as if the shrimp had the beef's back, and the chorizo had the shrimp's back. Obviously, pork chorizo sausage can hold its own. This is a must order. Maybe a double up would help so that you can have your own plate.  Firefly was awesome. Despite not being on the strip, it isn't that bad. Basically a block behind the strip, it isn't too far off. The food is done right and the tapas allowed me to snack on the cheap. Yes. All that was a snack, not lunch. All kidding aside, Firefly is the place to be if you want small plates. I went during the day so it was quite mellow. I'm sure it gets somewhat rowdy at night as it turns into a lounge after hours. Either way, you will get your tapas the most delicious way possible.

36i_fRDtmpYOWd_fQ2fn9w.text: Since moving to Las Vegas 6 months ago, I have gone here more times that I care to admit. I have tried almost everything on the menu and am NEVER let down! This is a great place to go with friends because everybody will find something they like on their massive menu. It's affordable, easy to get in even on a weekend night, and just an all around great atmosphere. Plus you can sit outside at night under strings of lights and heat lamps - it really doesn't get better than that!  Menu Highlights: Stuffed Dates Mac n' Cheese Stuffed Peppers Serrano Sliders Padron Peppers Baked Tequila Tuna Tar Tar

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Cod w/ lemon, garlic, butter and fried onions

5bhMa9B-HK-ztB_zBud5ew.text: We're just passing through Vegas and picked this one because a pro TV foodie mentioned it. Punchline: We just ate the best meal  in ages. Very deep menu of hots, colds, meats, seafood (about 15 of each). The preparation was waaaay up there: fresh, spot-on seasoning, great accompaniaments. Nice sized portion. And value-priced. The service staff (especially Nahum) was helpful, enthusiastic and made sure our order was promptly served. We ordered 5 dishes and a glass of wine at a laughable price. This gem is not far off The Strip and worth a detour. .

ocwPBOUbm-FR5mAVYIykMA.text: Firefly is by far the best place I have ever eaten at in Vegas. PERIOD. It's a hidden gem visited by many locals and a place where you can practically order anything on the menu and not be disappointed. Living in Los Angeles, whenever I happen to come to visit Vegas this is always the first place on my to do list. The food and service are exceptional and always consistent. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of food!! This place is perfect to come with family and friends.. Considering that it's a tapas style restaurant everything could be easily shared and leave you completely full and satisfied. Make sure to call in advance to make a reservation as the place gets very busy late in the evenings.. Especially weekends. The crowd favorites seem to be the stuffed dates, ceviche, baked goat cheese, tuna tartare, firefly fries, and the Camarones A La Diabla! I can't even get started with the Garlic Bread that they serve complimentary once you arrive.. HEAVEN! If your happening to question coming to this restaurant don't even think about it for one more second! Just go.. You won't regret it!

g5W143kmc8-CrZAY4qZOAg.text: What a great place!!  Let me just say the service was exceptional.  The food delicious we tried so many different ones it was great would definitely recommend it to everyone and try everything we just about did!!

GCZEcbZ1vOyIWpCFvi7syQ.text: This place was delicious. They just didn't have any of the beers I wanted. They said they ran out of my selections. That's why I only gave 4 stars.

b8xxuuFPm9Gf5CjatTIpng.text: All time favorite restaurant in the world! They moved but just a few doors down. Great new spot. Happy hour is to die for! Still have the amazing filet mignon mini burgers but are called Serrano ham sliders. Rico our bar server was very nice funny and helpful with a few tough choices. Haven been here in 5 years because we live in Seattle but cannot wait to come back! Cheers!

UDMnPJvU5No0mqb9Rh1Grw.text: Customer service, food and drinks are always excellent. Every time we visit Las Vegas we make it a point to have dinner here. We recommend it to everyone that visits Las Vegas. My husband is very picky when it comes to everything and he always walks out raving about this place so I know they are doing things right here. This place is so good he signed up for a Yelp account so he personally can give it 5 stars (very unlike him).

dTKdsIsCA_qTpcSL7qpuRw.text: one of the best bargains in vegas. great food. great service. we were seated close the door which may have been the reason it was quite hot. other than that it was perfect.

fFLUiure4aahd7jUxC0_5g.text: I like it. Good selection of tapas and everything I've tried is very good. They currently have half off sangria. $3.5 per glass!!

66xyfpSa59GaUuUAIyVtLQ.text: Our business group found Firefly a couple years ago at the old location up the block on Paradise and fell in love with it for entertaining customers. The food and service were outstanding, and the Tapas theme great for having a fun business meal. The place was noisy, but you could still hear each other. However this trip to Firefly we found the restaurant had moved to a new and larger location just about a block up the road, however the building has low ceilings and terrible acoustics, making the once passable noise level for business unacceptable. Also, the tables are really small, so once you seat six or more people, and they start bringing Tapas, there is simply ZERO room to put the food! Unfortunately we will now sadly not return for business meals, but will always go for the Bacon-wrapped Dates!

wX7UbO8luCYqp7BLHGaAMQ.text: Great food.. Service was alright. Everyone helped us BUT our server. It took 20 minutes for a shot of alcohol to get to our table. Other than that nice place and atmosphere. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday.

Su0d5X9OO73M4uoEwYV4IA.text: My favorite place for Happy Hour!!! The bartenders are entertaining, and curvaceous.  If you don't believe me just ask for Haley.  Food and cocktails are not the only thing that is appealing for happy hour. Stop by and see for yourself!

x1tp0V7Y5UvjOwxvqKPmZQ.text: In the land of buffets and assortment of restaurants this is truly a hidden gem. there is only one word I need to use to describe this place - yum!!!! It is a little bit off the strip but definitely worth a try. Everything I tasted was delicious and mouthwatering. Also the service was pretty good and I would definitely recommend.

HuvBzRu_8BZYi4rnFgEhog.text: My family and I ate dinner at this "off strip" restaurant on a Saturday night.  The food was really good, and we had a lot of fun trying new things.  Our bill for two adults and one child was only $50, and that included one beer and a dessert.  We would definitely go here again the next time we are in Las Vegas!

gI34jkVgDLMMkoAHs2dEeQ.text: Amazing food, amazing sangria. Lobster corn dogs blew my mind. Definitely try the place

2NIfJMlJExwm8b8GYZ3R7g.text: Came here 2 years in a row during CES. Great tapas, everything we ordered was excellent. Stuffed dates were to die for.

xXlDr1TrfA16q35yg-nSnw.text: Very good place to eat great food i love "camarones a la diabla " and lamb chops" the staff is very friendly the manager chuy was very helpful and ill definitely recomend this restaurant to everybody.;)))))

X2xVc9ANOqKf3maj_D4CYw.text: Firefly was recommended to me by a bunch if buddies but I never had time to make it their! Went on a Saturday night, and instead of waiting for a table my girl and I sat at the bar! The bar was slammed pack, but thanks to a combination of bartenders and barbacks great service, we had a straw in our mouths drinking their amazing sangria in less than 2 minutes, and food started coming out within 5 minutes! Everything was great, from the drinks, food, service and an overall great atmosphere! Can't wait to go back again!

BiRhQZ68W00sTKEWP5G9QQ.text: Best Sangria I have ever had.  Nice change from ordinary Las Vegas chain restaurants.

jTBaAwc6JFZac3jng4zURA.text: love everything about this place EXCEPT the music and crowd can be quite loud at times. tapas and sangria's always amount to a great night. love love love that the month of July is half off sangria's.

Jp_eTAWpFKAc0KEX7jC6-w.text: I heard about Firefly from the Food Network and boy was eating here worth it! We had several tapas and they were all delicious! Especially the stuffed dates....YUM! My 7 year old grandson couldn't get enough of the dates, and also really enjoyed the BBQ Baby Back Ribs with Mango BBQ sauce! We will definitely eat here when in Vegas again and it should be on everyone's must try list!

frV8xJzFA34W40ZEdPB40Q.text: Went here on a trip to Vegas and man was the food good! I love Tapas but usually always see a $100 bill each whenever I go. Not here!  All the tapas are $4.50-$8 each and the drinks were reasonable too. The result - 6 items and drinks for under $50 for the two of us!  We had: Chicken Empanadas - my favorite dish, flakey and full of flavor; a lot lighter than a typical empanada. Excellent.  Tuna Tartar - not the best tuna I have eaten but for $8 it was decent for the price  Bacon wrapped almond fig - okay no the official name but you will see the one I am talking about it. If you like bacon order it. The perfect blend of salty and sweet. Has a bit of blue cheese and a balsamic type sauce. Very good.  Apple and Manchu Salad - really awesome. a light and yummy summer salad. I love the fresh green apple cut julian with the almost-blue-cheese.   Garlic bread with almond butter - the free dish was probably the most unique. I need to know where they got the almond butter from because it was like nothing I have ever tasted. It was galic meets peanut butter, but not. It looked and spread like butter but tasted creamer. So good.  Dessert - Gelato Trio - 3 excellent flavors: chocolate, vanilla and my favorite the pistachio.  Sangria it was the sparkling white one aged for 3 days; very good for a hot summer day  No this wasn't the quality of San Fran tapas but it gets 4 stars for being cheaper than eating at the Olive Garden and excellent food. I will be back on my next trip to Vegas.

X19wjizIANy6vmKJa_Cb1Q.text: This place rocks!  Great hot fresh food every time which comes out relatively quick.  My 2nd time at the restaurant and 1st time at the location.  Always an excellent choice to visit.

M22Jik3Jz3WKEgWP_crThg.text: This place is one of the top spots in Las Vegas, anything in the menu it's to die for just to name a few...the empanadas, chorizo stuffed mushrooms, the steak and mushroom skewers, camarones a la diabla and the list can just go on and on and to end up with the dessert the tres leches cake, I can't wait   to go back, good thing I am local and can go anytime I want...

YlZqP-ZM2HrOtGw6luPugA.text: "my endless love!"  I visit Vegas almost as often as I change my undergarments.... seriously! We have been there twice this month and visit Firefly each and every time!!  I am vegetarian, pushing vegan and there are TONS of yummy creative options for me! With a few modifications, there are even MORE options! My boyfriend is a full-fledged carnivore and this is a place that suits us both.   His favorite: the Rib Eye. My favorites: The empenadas, the artichoke toasts (with or without the aioli!), the green apple salad and the lentils (though they do need a little salsa/sauce).   We always sit at the bar.  Service is not the friendliest in the land or the most attentive but it is definitely not bad. Actually, in about the 2 years we have been going there it has improved. But there is still the occasional empty bar and we have to flag down the bartender even though there is no one else around.   I encourage you... please do NOT go here. It will be too packed and I will be super sad if we cannot find a seat! This is my place, MINE I tell you!

re0VhPcjsWiJX7MQLW9xcQ.text: This place is always impressing me. I went and they were doing an art sale. our servers were so attentive it was fabulous. the food exceptional as always. the chorizo stuffed clams were to die for. of course we ended with the chocolate tres leches . thanks for a great date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red sangria !!!!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate tres leches
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In the midst of a meal.

k7pJLgBgq-chSDVC1hnErw.text: Our favorite spot in Vegas. Went there for my B-day dinner . we were 18 ppl.  Great food, great sangria, great atmosphere but most of all the waiter Mario,  Very efficient, he kept our table clean and our gasses full.  I strongly recommend this place !!

85BhI7Uh41Hmf86As4vQuQ.text: This is my go to place for visiting family and friends.  Fire Fly is perfect for a meal or just a nibble.  Tapas places are plenty in Vegas but none can hold a torch to this best kept secret of our city.  The menu is affordable and delicious, the drinks are made with love and respect, and the Staff can hold its head high!  P.S. Date Night Must!!!!

613kEtticIj_I0cxZ6z8hw.text: Sexy modern Spanish tapas restaurant not far off the strip. Great place to slow down and enjoy the company of a group of friends or that one special friend. Wide variety of tasty tapas. You won't find chicken fingers or nachos on the menu, so if you don't know tapas look it up. The empanadas are excellent. Friendly attentive servers.

1CpgxxkKH3y7MnbsjkHZ0Q.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere, good service and below average bloody Mary's. Try the stuffed dates!

9cZg3yNVOxXVxBPcH1-FHA.text: I should've reviewed this place months ago, as I visited way back in January. I was in Vegas for 5 days and this was by far my favorite restaurant and I will be back the next time I'm in the area. Heard about it on Yelp and realized the hotel we were staying at our first night was right next door so I made a reservation (btw this is a couple blocks behind the strip but worth the detour). We ordered the Stuffed Dates, fries, and beef bocadillas. We may have had one more item, but I can't remember. Everything's was great although the little beef sandwiches were noticeably bland. The True MVP of our meal was the pitcher of sangria we ordered: BEST. SANGRIA. EVERRRR!! I still day dream about this stuff. The atmosphere in here is completely appropriate for a special occasion, date night, or evening out with friends. My BF had never had tapas and since he's a big eater I was nervous, but he also loved his time hear and when he found out I hadn't written a review he scolded me, lol. It was his birthday and I had made a note on my online reservation. I was dog tired from our flight and we were stuffed so I had completely forget and was ready for the bill when they came out with a birthday flan for him. I'm not ashamed to admit that I fought him for the last tasty morsel. Great place.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday flan we got.

BDLYvbZOpAm6EiMwOQoFBQ.text: Wow, just super good. I got the Diablo shrimp, potatoes (papatas), mixed salad with dried cherries and mandarin oranges. One point! Service is really great as well, constant water refills and great guidance through the menu.

ZdHkM4gEXXLa43ary-NZUQ.text: Hands down.......Best Tapas Ever. Took a chance on this place based on the reviews. Gambled and won big!!!! Had pork empanadas, Tierra del Mar skewers and a nice rib eye steak.  Staff was attentive and friendly.  Ambience was cool. I will be back for sure. I definitely  recommend  this tapas bar!!

P_mD89J_GYGujy2T94fwww.text: Delicious! Tons of options, for vegetarian and meat eaters alike.   I went there on my first adult trip to vegas, 2 others had already been there and strongly suggested we go, and all 6 of us LOVED it.

IkL16v_XlGdNLCEd5-6E_g.text: SANGRIA, SANGRIA, SANGRIA thats all I really have to say. If you don't go for the drinks then go for the bacon wrapped dates. They're the best in Vegas.

f-TbxjnJV9KPYxwR9TuP6A.text: I'm happy the place is bigger and there's actually parking!   I Wish the service was as fast as it used to be.... They get your order and that's about it... Not good with the follow up service!   Slightly disappointed they switched their shrimp cerviche order!!! And things are now even smaller.... I used to love their bread and now that's even different!   Oh good luck getting a refill!   I just want to old firefly service back, this is too commercial for me.

idYRyeab__vKSdEtB16dQg.text: Ive been here more times then I can count for business dinners.  Always consistent and always amazing meals.  Tapas give you so many choices and bites for dinner.  We ordered wine this time ...  2nd bottle recommended by staff was better than the one I picked.

P-jVmCWqbHDhhvWEC8yFgw.text: Average food, portions were large for tapas. The service was okay, but all the servers were pretty cold and unfriendly. I wouldn't come back here.

NP1J_xbfbQThOuWtkfddAQ.text: Just behind the strip is the street Paradise. Along this street sits this restaurant called Firefly. Tapas, Paella, y Sangria plus a lot more. Firefly has become a must visit anytime I'm here in Vegas. The small plates are always my go to. With so many options they have something for everyone.  I do have a few favorites, "huevos estrellados" and "scallop escargots" are at the top of my list. I do try new plates when I'm there, the goal to at least try them all once. I'm sure anyone who goes will also have favorites. So take some time off from the strip and enjoy some great food.

zIyn2BVk-fJwvOFoecr9rQ.text: Well well well firefly has done it again!  We came here for my sister in laws bachelorette pre-party dinner and Eduardo was Amazing!! We had such an amazing dinner great service and great food !  Thank you FIREFLY

UtbWbyZNzf1zxqbkK_X0EQ.text: Went their last night for the white party and had a great time. A lot of people I haven't seen in a long time. I always order their red sangria and again it's was great. Fast and friendly service at the bar even though it was a very busy night!

kV54ZcD02h6PCjsL8fjT5A.text: Ehh.. I guess I kinda like this place. They got some cute little tapas and a so so wine list. When I got no place to go for my wine nights, I will return~

I0petX2ZbOza25qDFvCIdg.text: Food was amazing; superb flavors and presentation. Service was friendly and attentive. Atmosphere was inviting and cosy and modern.

WNrjtHpV75aWsP3xBHccxw.text: My wife and I went here on a Sunday Afternoon. It was actually less crowded then I had expected but we made a reservation in case. The goat cheese was delicious as was the Filet mignon and the Chicken Empanadas. The stuffed mushrooms were not the greatest becuase they were a little dry, but overall the food was great!  The blood Orange mojito was a little sour to my taste so I added some club soda which made it better! Overall decent lunch place

QLMP2yoFzsokTb1K9ugYvQ.text: Finally made it back for my two favorite items here at Firefly. 1 is the Mango Mojito and next is the order of the stuffed dates then shortly the Sangria. Mission accomplished and then off to my next adventure. If you have time try the tuna tar tar it is so refreshing

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Mojito, my favorite!!!!!

tNXW1saGxWVPOdwkDOZV1A.text: AMAZING, blown away, just amazing. I live in New York and I dream of the apple and manchengo salad! I cannot wait for my next visit to firefly and I am so excited!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zvVH5JZc_6Sy_JgZFekrIQ.text: I've heard about firefly & its previous demerits with the health district which is why I was reluctant to go at first...but I'm so glad I changed my mind! Coming in at around 10pm, our small party didn't end till around 1am. This is definitely the place to not only eat, but get a good conversation in.   TAPAS are amazing. Our group ordered several small plates to try it all out! Our dishes included machego Mac n cheese, stuffed peppers, Apple & machego salad, firefly fries, camarones a la Diabla, etc.   I don't eat bacon, but many others have loved the bacon wrapped dates (I wanna say it's called chorizo or something).   It was all so good my mouth continues to water. The apple and machego salad was different; definitely worth trying! The camarones a la Diabla were fancy, loved the sauce/dressing. I could go on and on about the stuffed peppers and the garlic cream cheese that was stuffed inside...but even then no justice would be served.   For dessert, us 4 girls ordered the dessert platter and that was more than enough to try their best sweet items. Flan was definitely the best!   Bottom Line: TRY what you can. It's delicious. It can get ridiculously busy, but they are open late.

iuiW-ljphGBcOjn62b3Efg.text: When in Vegas, Firefly is a must especially for happy hour! Lamb sausage, pork empanada, albondigas, Apple salad....oooooohhhh....I wish they had a Firefly back home with the same prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You gotta try the Chocolate Tres Leches!!!

lvv3J9o3GbFd1MSjLGONig.text: We were here for my BFF's birthday. I really like the food at Firefly but just like the Sahara location, service here is bad. It's just a tad bit better here. However, parking is impossible here. I had no choice but do valet on a Friday night.   I asked for a white sangria and a glass of water as soon as we sat down. I got my sangria but got my glass of water a few minutes before we left...that's 2 hours later! But then again, we were a big group. I can tell our server was really TRYING his best.  I noticed they added more items on their menu especially desserts. My Firefly faves are Firefly fries, bacon-wrapped dates, sangria and steak and mushroom skewers and a few others but I only ordered those last night since I wasn't too hungry at 9:30pm. I did get some calamari and chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms from my friends. We also got a rib eye. It was huge and comes with fries for only $20, wow! Last night's fries were super oily though.  If you get the fries, get double aioli...it's yummy! You can't go wrong with their sangria...either red or white. Just get a pitcher and leave happy. I don't recommend the Nutella dessert and I'm a huge Nutella freak...it's something you can make at home. Pretty much everything on their menu is delicious, trust me. Just have the patience for the service and pray they won't have another health violation scare.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gambas al ajillo
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef empanadas with extra aioli
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Sangria

EYNrhCh7PgQhQtJfzHWb1g.text: Excellent food, nice casual environment on the patio (we came during the day, I can't speak for what it's like at night!), friendly service...this is a definite stop if you want a casual dining experience!   We ordered the mac and cheese...seriously, the best I've had! The calamari was super yummy, the garlic aioli fries were amazing, and the chicken skewers were super tasty! Even the free bread that comes before the meal was delicious, it was like soft but flaky garlic bread with a really good sweet butter!

a0ax5_F3JzhALH7y_jfaxQ.text: Amazing!  Wonderful food, great portions, and spot on waiter. I regret not getting our waiter's name, because he was truly a great guy and made us feel really comfortable and taken care of, without being overbearing or pushy.  We ordered: stuffed dates, ham and cheese croquettes, tuna tartare, firefly fish sticks, boquerones, and baked goat cheese. Fish sticks were okay but not too special; everything else I would definitely order again.

AqnK-0ivP65xGaslbwXxyg.text: Loved the food, hated the service! Starting from valet attendant to the hostess, the kitchen staff was more attentive & friendly than our waitress. We ordered the ceviche (which was on point), camarones a la diabla, seafood paella with chorizo, and a pitcher of sangria. All of which were DELICIOUS!! They just need to work on their customer service skills.

o67VYHQD4BTvWx0fPzYfKQ.text: Probably my favorite place in Vegas! I love their mojitos and sangria! I must order one of these drinks whenever I visit or else it isn't really a complete firefly visit.   I have tried most of their small plates but I think my favorite would have to be the dates! They taste almost like candy! They are a must try when you visit!  I also really like the eggplant with goat cheese. I mean, who doesn't like goat cheese?! It tastes like heaven.  The fries are always a good option especially with a larger party.   The escargot scallops are also divine. It's not actually escargot just cooked in an escargot tray. It's made with lemon butter and garlic sauce. Need I say anything more?  The dessert platter is also a must try. So many desserts on one tray-trust me you'll love it! The dolce de leche cake is out of this world!

cmCUvUczbZbxmO6erAjLjQ.text: Tapas not bad, a bit disappointed in their paella Don't understand why firefly can get 4.5 stars on yelp.  Recommend spicy shrimp and ceviche shrimp tapa :)

qXH84O-RxPtcKBJQtTxOiA.text: Our favorite restaurant in Vegas. Come early as it gets packed. Went with my wife and parents last week and had an excellent experience. We ordered Tapas to share and all were great. Shrimp tempura. Clams with chorizo. Fish sticks. Mixed meat skewers. One other I forgot. Stella on tap and attentive service. Reasonable check. You can't ask for better.

IaDW4bvVQew5VZGXAReIoQ.text: Finally got to try this place out and it was SOO GOOOOOOD. I forgot my server's name but he was very helpful. The service was great as well.   Breakdown of what we ordered:  - Bacon Wrapped Dates: Yes, listen to what everyone is saying and GET IT!!   - Petite Filet: the meat was so tender  - Tierra y Mar: it was good, the salsa verde was amazinnggggg  - Apple Machengo: so refreshing & the cheese was so good   - Shrimp Ceviche: AMAZING  I definitely recommend coming here. It's inexpensive. I def want to come here again the next time I visit. I want to try the paella! The table next to us got that & it looked amazing.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tierra y Mar

BxPktNGuH1ZKNHIVMXxNrA.text: What can I say? In 12 years of going to Vegas, this is my favorite place to eat! And the funny thing once I bring a friend with my, next thing I know, they are bringing their friends and clients there to eat! if I am in Vegas for a week, I'll probably eat there twice.  So many amazing dishes on the menu. And the sangria is the best!  In fact, if I did not live 2700 miles away, I would eat there once a month at the very least. I live in a little town called Waxhaw and what my town needs.. is a Firefly!!! Hey Firefly, how about opening up a Southeastern location in the coolest little town in the Carolinas? Please?

LGQGpNvMOxLFIS-_0P0Wlw.text: Great location, close to the Encore. Great outside seating area, super friendly and accommodating staff. Tapas were good with a great array of choices. Wine selection was limited although vast. I wasn't familiar with a lot of the options and the staff could not describe the wines. Still a keeper!

AitkJnpZs-GVQI9qrFPGpg.text: I don't write many reviews; reserving my opinion for only the best or worst experiences. Firefly ranks among the best. Highly recommended, and if you don't try the bacon-wrapped dates then either you're a fool or you hate bacon which is essentially the same thing. The flavor explosion is life altering. Pair the pulpo asado with a Rogue hazelnut brown; it's a surprisingly exceptional flavor combination. Cheers!

2Cu8-QBcU9aemyUyFtX4JQ.text: Omg what a fantastic treasure! I'm vegan & my girlfriend is GF & a carnivore. ;) We love to share food but can't always do so. This wonderful restaurant accommodated is both. We had the vegan paella, fries, so many delicious items, clearly labeled. Wonderful servers. Just an amazing experience. I literally went here three nights in a row! They even brought us olives when they knew we couldn't have bread. A++ service!

sgTs82FwPTre71V0_bs1_w.text: ALEJANDRO IS THE BEST SERVER EVER! His service is exceptional and he has a great personality. He made my first experience wonderful!!!

0pQzccatDULP-DTP1D4N-g.text: Hubby and I met up with some friends for a birthday dinner here. We had a reservation, but still had to wait for our table in the bar area which is pretty common on a Friday or Saturday night. The bar is big, busy and can get crowded. They have several options when it comes to hot and cold plates to share. We tried and shared several dishes from the menu and most everything was well liked.   Garlic Bread with Sweet Almond Butter - This was brought at the beginning of the meal and it's oh so addicting! Very very good.   Ham and Cheese Croquetas ($6) - Serrano ham and manchego cheese. These were tasty! Comes with 3 croquetas. Why oh why couldn't you put 4 on the plate to even things out? Lol. They are a decent size and best eaten right away while hot.   Roasted Beets and Persimmon Salad ($9) - Star anise, mixed greens, pecan crusted goat cheese, beets, persimmon and balsamic-pear vinaigrette. The greens were a tad too salty on this dish, but everything else was very good.   Mushroom Tart ($10) - This was a well liked dish at our table and now we know to order more of it next time! It came with 4 puff pastries covered in a delicious mushroom sauce and it also had some cream cheese. Everything melded well together and I wanted to lick the plate.   Stuffed Dates ($6.50) - You get 5 bacon-wrapped dates each stuffed with a smoked almond in a red wide reduction and sprinkled with blue cheese. This is one of the most popular items on the menu and with good reason. The stuffed dates here are some of the best that I have had and even when I see Firefly at Bite of LV or some other event around town I have to stop by and grab some of their stuffed dates. These tasty gems shouldn't be overlooked when ordering from the menu.   Baked Goat Cheese ($8) - Goat and garlic cream cheese in a boat of tomato sauce that's drizzled with pesto and served with toast. My hubby really liked this dish while I didn't like it much at all. I personally didn't taste any garlic it was just plain cream cheese. I did enjoy the bread that came with it.   Stuffed Peppers ($8.50) - 3 good sized Spanish piquillo peppers stuffed with fresh mozzarella and garlic cream cheese on a bed of tomato sauce and topped with green onions and crispy onions. This was a very good dish and well liked by others in our group.   Serrano Sliders ($9) - 2 mini burgers with serrano ham, cabrales bleu cheese and a side of crispy onions. These sliders tasted great, but where was the ham? I'm not sure if the ham is mixed with the burger and then cooked or if it's supposed to be slices on the slider, but there was no visible ham or none that could be tasted in the mini patty itself. Still tasty regardless however with serrano  in the name I would expect more of a piggy flavor.   Someone in our group brought a birthday cake from a local bakery and the restaurant had no problem slicing it up and serving it to us on their dishes after our meal. Service was good and the menu is priced fairly. Definitely a great place for large groups.
