-im68ULJh_Bvc_X1f1fJhw.text: Great place for any occasion. Very friendly staff that is always willing to make suggestions. Can't pick a wrong dish! Everything is ridiculously GOOD!! Even if it sounds like something u won't like try it. I was shocked when I tried the date  . And they have great happy hr deals and reverse happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella sandwich!! I&#39;m in LOVE!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates

aBJSZ_bfm6STqT6k0jP7jg.text: Called to pick up the seafood paella an hour before going to pick it up. It still wasn't ready when I went to pick it up. Had to wait another 20 minutes until it was done.  Apart from the waiting, the paella was delicious and enough for two people. Firefly did not skimp on the seafood and their tomato sauce is delicious.  The bread was delicious and fresh. The sauce to go with it is buttery and fantastic.  I would highly recommend trying their food. It did not disappoint.

SP1gUTttI06Lk4-ZWrdukw.text: Dates were pretty good, little too sweet for my taste but well prepared with bacon.  The fruit vodka drink was nice flavor but I think they forgot to add the vodka as didn't taste it at all and I usually feel some effect drinking a shot size, but not this time.

lNc2E8wmQdJ4XNIf-1jqQw.text: Excellent Tapas, everything we ordered was fabulous! Must give it a try. The cocktails are excellent as well.

iTT1Ht2Li290nvZLcB8pNg.text: Loud!  Very loud.  parking in the rear.  Great bar staff!  I was very happy sitting at the bar and ordering from there.  As for the price, I mean, it's Tapas...  It's not going to be cheap.  It's also meant to be social and shared.  I had some pretty typical dishes (apple manchego salad, stuffed dates, croquettes, and the shrimp ceviche)  They were all very good but I fully admit that I didn't stray too far from my likes.

EsQ8JrJG_YS2S7-XBK2Czg.text: Firefly is the best tapas restaurant in the world!!! The entire menu is incredible, they even have an entire vegan menu!! Obsessed with this place!

tnfToDuJuPXX44PcrCNjyg.text: It was all just meh. The service was okay.tge drinks were ok. The food was ok. Nothing that makes me want to come back. We had the dates, the avocado toast, garlic bread and the goat cheese dip. The goat cheese dip was the only thing we really enjoyed.

xGWpOrFHGuBKP6d_ShhgFg.text: Tasty tapas. Not authentic Spanish tapas, but tasty non the less. What the heck is in the butter they serve with their bread? SO GOOD! I normally always pass on bread and butter, but this was yummy & addictive. The food was good, the prices were reasonable especially for the quality of the food, and the staff was friendly and attentive. It's off the strip but worth going out of your way to stop by.

tH2wBBJrjxUpdX3hRfq4Ng.text: I can't express in words how amazing this place is. I just had my wedding reception there on November 3. The food, drinks, ambience, staff, service, everything was amazing! Thank you so much! Firefly will always hold a special place in my heart!!

s5jX8w_eh0AbCVtatdFYdQ.text: I loved this place! The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the wait time to sit and the wait time for your food are a little out of hand.   *Tip* Before you read the rest: If you're looking to try the Paella, order as soon as your butt hits the chair. It is to die for, BUT you have to wait 45 mins while they wait!   We went to Firefly for Valentine's Day, and it looks like we weren't the only ones that had that idea. We had to wait for about 45 min - 1 hour to be seated. Not bad for a popular restaurant, I guess, but definitely longer than I'm used to. Especially since there was just the two of us, not a large group.   We tried a chorizo plate ( i forgot the name of it :( sorry)  It had an over-easy egg on top of chorizo and potatoes. It was warm, and spicy and the runny yolk was just icing on the cake.   I did order the Paella and it came sizzling in a plate. It was the best Paella I've ever tasted, almost worth the wait. It was seasoned just right. I was so full from the other tapas, though,  that I ended up just tasting it and taking the rest of it home.   Order the sangria! i got the white sangria. It was white sparkling wine, peaches, grapes, oranges. It was sweet and refreshing and with just the right amount of alcohol to make waiting for my paella bearable...

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella. Order right away! It takes 45 mins, but totally worth the wait.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes, chorizo and an egg. Simple, yet tasty.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White sparkling sangria.

fasSMKewRDhQTpzkpY5TnA.text: I really don't get the rave reviews about this place. To me the food was mediocre at best and way overpriced!  I tried a couple of the tapas including the steak and mushroom skewers, Mac and cheese, this baked egg thing and the stuffed mushrooms. Each dish was tapas sized and looked pretty but it didn't taste that great to me at all.   The Mac and cheese was not bad. Very creamy rather than cheesy actually, but it wasn't special or great. The beef skewers were wayyyyy saucy. The whole plate was covered in 3 types of sauce. Although presented nicely as the sauce made pretty patterns, the skewers weren't that flavorful and the beef was chewy!  The egg thing was a super disappointment. It had the same roasted red pepper garnish as the Mac and cheese and beef skewers ( how lame.. Same garnish for all your dishes?) with a piece of potato inside?  It was very flavorless. The stuffed mushrooms were ok. I've had better. The mushrooms were good.. the chicken paste they stuffed it with was kind of weird.   It's a nice big place with nice outdoor seating and a full bar. Service was good, ambiance was good, parking was good. Everything was pretty great except the food haha. I will not come here again unless someone chooses to eat here for their birthday. :(.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak skewers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed mushrooms
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese

lboW_hiOMHUcp-NXaDpVkg.text: Small plates. Yes. Large taste also yes.   I got the gazpacho. Cold tomato soup. Very different very tasty.   I got the stuffed peppers. A little spicy but great taste. Fried onion rings on top with cream cheese in the middle. Good combination.   Congenial atmosphere. Attentive wait staff but not over bearing.   Recommended.

shXf6qjybYaLuncSTz1XvQ.text: Fabulous! We have wanted to eat here every time we visit Las Vegas and we finally ate here. The food is amazing! We went during happy hour and enjoyed some of the Happy Hour Menu offerings. The Apple salad was my favorite but everything we ate was great. The waiter, Roberto, was very attentive, explained the menu, and checked on us frequently. He was a prime example of a waiter. We definitely will eat here during our next trip.

a8Y30o8JW-5paKXye-gLOg.text: Long overdue review. Came here in Feb during our trip to Vegas. This was the one restaurant that I was dying to try in Vegas. So I made the BF drive here straight from the airport, even before we checked into our hotel.    Firefly sits in an unassuming location off the strip. I didn't expect it to be so big inside, but I guess everything is bigger in Vegas (or is that Texas?). Anyway, came during late lunchtime on a weekday, so the place was pretty empty. The menu looked so good that I wanted to order one of everything, but the BF convinced me to start with just five dishes first, probably a more sensible approach.   Here are the dishes we tried: Stuff Dates - my favorite dish! To be fair, I rarely met a stuffed date dish that I didn't like. The combination of the soft sweet dates, crunchy salty bacon and the stinky Gorgonzola cheese is just heavenly.   Lamb Chops - oh how I love my lamb chops. I always try order it when I see it on the menu, even though most of my friends can't stand the taste of lamb (whatever, more for me). The chops here were seasoned well and perfectly cooked. The accompanied lentils and vegetables made me feel healthy, despite the fact that I just inhaled two lamb chops.   Stuffed Peppers - not a dish that I would normally order, but I am so glad I listened to our waiter and got it here. The peppers had just a hint of spiciness and provided a perfect balance to the creamed cheese. I still think about this dish today...   Shrimp in Sweet & Spicy Sauce - shrimps were well cooked, I didn't really taste the spicy note in the sauce, but it was a good sauce nevertheless   Tuna Tartare - the most average dish among the ones we tried. I didn't think the tuna was very flavorful, although the taro chips were good.   Trio of Gelato and Chocolate Tres Leches Cake - oh that cake, it was what dreams were made of, so fluffy, so moist and so chocolaty. I would marry it if I could. Or at least date it for as long as I can without the BF getting jealous. It was sooo perfect. The gelato were good too, but, they were like the jealous bridesmaids next to the cake.   The service was a little weird, our waiter was extremely attentive in the beginning with recommendations and water refills. All five of our dishes came out in extremely quick successions, I understand the place was pretty quiet, but they could've slowed down and allowed us to savor the food instead of rushing us. Our small table was covered in plates in the span of 10 minutes. Also, our waiter disappeared once we've put the dessert and coffee order in.  I had to track down another waiter to finally get my coffee. Moreover the coffee came in a comically small cup, it was more like an espresso cup. I would normally take off a star for the weird service, but the food was soooo good that I am will to overlook it.   Overall, I highly recommend the place, wish they would open an outpost in NYC!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Tres Leches Cake
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of Gelato (chocolate, vanilla and pistachio)
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare

LSM6UZXtc0q4z5G4q4qJpg.text: This is my favorite restaurant of all time. Unfortunately I have moved away from Las Vegas but I try to go at least twice when I visit. Bacon wrapped dates, firefly fries, sliders, steak and mushroom skewers, lemon berry tart & banana Nutella sandwiches are all must haves. Plus a pitcher if the best sangria ever. If I could give this 10 stars I would.

vtUwwzZebzXaDYIk9GTXzA.text: Great tapas joint off the strip. We make sure to hit this place every visit to Vegas. Be sure to get the dates with almond and jamon (Spanish prosciutto) - awesome dish that I crave.

cKXMnmOIlQGizGVVMtMCyA.text: This is a hidden gem in Las Vegas! Located at the end of the strip on the far side near the convention center, I had no idea this place existed until I was invited by friends. We showed up around the time of happy hour and I quickly saw the place fill up!  (There is valet which is complimentary aka tips only, so that's helpful when it becomes busy)  Our group decided to order a bunch of tapas, small appetizers, and share those as well as some pitchers of libations!   I decided to stay with my go-to: red wine. However, I did have a taste of the sangria and it was delicious!   My favorite tapas were the shrimp ceviche which was fresh and served with crunchy chips. Also, the parmesan fries were crisp and hot. The chicken skewers were tender and came with roasted veggies.   I loved the ambiance as Firefly had in and outdoor seating and rooms for large parties like ours. My only caveat was that the servers weren't quite privy to large parties, it seemed. I should've brought cash so that I could check out quicker, like most in my group. But, I thought that most people these days used cards to pay. I ended up waiting over 30 minutes to get my check, give my card to the server, and then another 15+ to actually sign my check to leave.

eN9pYzl58Ef37aKBxu1Q5g.text: I love tapas! So any chance I can get it, I go get it! We ordered the eggplant dish amd it was such an explosion in my mouth! I love it! Order everything! It is so good! Place is dark inside and I wished we could have witnessed the belly dancers or music but we came on an off night. Staff are attentive.

pvKrhF77Uu9DvC99_3c0ig.text: Firefly was an amazing experience  Pros: 1. All of the food tasted amazing and came out in a timely fashion  2. Our server Elena and Jazzy was attentive and efficient  3. There were no tables inside, but the outdoor sitting area had fire pillars to keep you warm (see picture)  4. The bathrooms were clean and had around 5 stalls so there was no line for women (always a plus)  Cons: 1. Our entree came out before a lot of our tapas which was weird for me  2. The blue cheese on top of the steak was a bit much so if you don't love blue cheese ask for it on the side  What we ordered: 1. Scallops Escargots (hot tapas) 2. Lamb chops (hot tapas) 3. Roasted Eggplant Cannelloni (hot tapas) 4. Stuffed dates (hot tapas) 5. Chicken and Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms (hot tapas) 6. Blue Cheese Ribeye 7. Flan (not a huge fan) 8. Chocolate and cherry bread pudding (delish)

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

143lFUNFBcr8xYB8s4LY4A.text: This place is amazing. Being from the east coast we have tons of Spanish Tapas places but firefly gives their food a different touch. We were a large group and ordered about a dozen different tapas. Everything we ordered was delicious. The camarones al ajillo had a more spicy touch than spanish people are used to and i loved it. Great atmosphere with great drink selections and spanish beer. The manager Eduardo was extremely gracious.  I will definitely be going back and recomending to friends. By far the best place we ate during our recent Vegas trip.

rZ6LlrvmkXnRrGdUQXT3fg.text: Delicious!  We loved every dish that we ordered from the beet salad, warm spinach salad, spicy lamb sausage, to the chicken and mushroom paella!  The timing of the dishes was perfect, which is so important with tapas.  We would definitely go again and will be recommending it to all of our friends!!

Jvm8QHJwnPIOyzLiyw8oZQ.text: This is a PHENOMENAL place to hang out for brunch and some sangria or a light dinner before a party or for a bigger dinner, just a great place. The food is phenomenal, the service is amazing and after having a dispute with a credit card (that turned out not to be a dispute but a mistake on my part) the management was phenomenal with trying to work with me to solve the non-existent problem.  I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

SllZaVWxtuI9P3UyOdPQOA.text: This is a great Tapas bar!  They have a nice wine selection and many different tapas to choose  from.  The server was very helpful, but when I asked him what was good, well he seemed top like everything on the menu.  I can see why, because everything we ordered was very good.  I guess our favorite was the apple manchego salad, but I think you can't go wrong.  Great service, nice atmosphere, we will definitely return.

6-co08qIN9VsYgdvu83khA.text: Great ambiance and value for your $. Best strawberry mojitos (made with fresh fruit) and the portions are excellent. A must try if you've never been

qKw7--yq92VUx9ZxTXqeQw.text: Great tapas good mix of locals and tourist always busy I would recommend the sangria or diablo shrimp

6veR3uWP7RH2iQjTuNH4Jg.text: Amazing dinner! Food tasted fantastic, great portions, great atmosphere, good beer selection, very prompt service even on a very busy night! The GM even came by several times to make sure everything was ok - what a great guy. Will definitely eat here again!

6peAJ9awhYqxk4nnHYS7Pg.text: The tapas are delicious. We had a mishmash of sorts, the bacon-wrapped dates, the chorizo/chicken mushrooms, the tinga empanada, the mac and cheese. Everything was delicious!!!! Can't decide which is my favorite, but everything was great! The drinks were good, too!

pyclANWVvQQ9tb95UOcWfA.text: Went for lunch, service was great, & food was so yummy! Had stuffed dates,  Apple salad, calamari, & scallops for tapas, & shared a mixed paella. Already too full, but the desserts were calling to us, so we had the tres leche cake & bread pudding...oh boy! So delicious! The service was very good & pleasant. Not crowded at lunch, but I imagine it's probably not the case in the evening. Such a nice change from the casino scene.  Go try!!

8vsrzlh9xSlIbVtdh27Niw.text: Place is outstanding! Great for groups! Bacon wrapped dates are to die for. Tapas portions are small, so order more than one of each. Every meat option they serve is incredible. Nice to get off the strip for a really delicious meal and some peace and quiet.

bUiyvoUnby16HS7MFEAD9Q.text: We have been wanting to try this place the last couple times we've come out to Vegas..   We had three adult diners. Really wanted to like this place but we all came away thinking it was just OK. Very noisy. Could not really even converse with one another. Our waiter, Ivan, the hostess, the manager and the rest of the staff were great, very professional. The food was not bad, nor was the pitcher of sangria. Its just that nothing was great

OR6yA7VMf3T1s-dHsvSIxw.text: My husband and I were looking for a great place to have either a light dinner or tapas and a few drinks. The drinks and food are not only fantastic, our server Nahum was amazing! His recommendations were right on and his service was excellent considering we'd order each appetizer one at a time before deciding what we wanted next. The only note is if you are looking for a quiet place to have a romantic dinner this is probably not for you as it's a little loud inside the restaurant...it didn't bother us at all, but a warning if wanting a more intimate setting. The prices were great as we had 2 drinks from the bar each (so 4 total) and 4 small plates and our bill was only $65, a completely great deal in Vegas!

xbdBafLBOZQLM0CF-hQs1Q.text: amazing food. bacon wrapped dates. filet mignon perfect. diablo shrimp and sangria all amazing! great food great drinks amazing service!!!!

7MzTDIWXsa_V42ZTAkmY_Q.text: My girlfriend and I come here all the time and the service is awesome. Omar, Luis and Patrick are the best bartenders we've come across!

2s2kJ-VdfZsyCSg1KOO17A.text: Went last night with some coworkers.  It was my 3rd time to Firefly in about 1.5 years.  The food has always been really good but last night the food wasn't that good.  It didn't taste fresh and was frankly pretty ho hum.  I hope they get their groove back.

jpnSHiMhKtFEAs8DmHvxWw.text: Food was good, but service was aweful!!! The server was impatient, and did not bring what was ordered. She literally sighed when we asked questions about the menu, and said " we should let her know when we are ready", without answering any question we asked.   I won't go back.... Not worth the trouble of crappy parking, bad location, and horrible service! Too bad, potential, but horrible execution.

dXrcdT6ULLvYdAUO0DDnBg.text: We ate at the old Firefly location several times when we visited Las Vegas three years ago and I was eager to eat there again.  The new location is much larger and the decor was nice.  The tapas were just as good as I remembered and we really enjoyed our lunch.  We ordered a variety of items and enjoyed them all.  As always, the bacon wrapped dates were delicious and I also enjoyed the chicken skewers over a bed of roasted veggies.  We will definitely return when we visit Las Vegas in the future.

mLw2BkmV8AFNqWr2SZfxRw.text: The food and drinks were great and we are trying to have a great birthday  party. When we were done dancing we sat down and a couple came to us and  told us we needed to move that the chairs belong to them. The tone he used was rude and he was talking down and yelling us to move and get our of the chair. So we got up to avoid more conflict but he was still talking to us in a rude tone. Then his friend eas talking more trash and loud enough fIe me tp hear thsy she wanted me to say something again so she could hit me. One of ours friends  came to tell him not to talk to us that way he wanted to fight him and then his friend had more words and threatened us and continued wanting to fight. I went and got management and told him what happen.  Management  had  three people leave and the host for salsa dancing went and brought them back in after the fact. The host then goes up to us and told us to stay on one side of the floor or she was going to call the police. We went and got management to come to tge bar and they appeared to be in shock. I ask them to explain to me why host was allowed to do that and they were unable to explain why.  We spent over 1500.00 tonight and was treated  very poorly. The host who is not an employee of fly flies  choose to keep non paying customers over paying. The fact we were planning on spending more money before the drama over 2 chairs. We won't be coming there for another event we will spend our money at another location.

rKZK0K6bcYBl9Oa1tbf3hQ.text: Seriously...the BEST EVER! We are foodies and it's not often that I say I would eat here over and over! The flavors, service, relaxed atmosphere and options are phenomenal - can't even put into words! This is one of my most favorite places to eat! Must experience!!!

rktSovwjYpk1TEKnz_ZFQA.text: This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. The menu has a wide variety and since the portions are small, you can try so many different things. The octopus, grilled shrimp, petite fillet were among my favorites. Great ambiance!

IasLvCA1AusWkXHEFUPLog.text: Best Tapas Restaurant in Vegas (and elsewhere).   Food is delicious, service is quick and prices are extremely reasonable for vegas.    Worth ordering were the dates, diablo shrimp and the apple and manchego salad.

5TrzsWRCDo70ujn0oD6iYg.text: Food was good. Happy hour specials on beer and wine were decent. Over-all, a tad expensive for what it was. We sat at the bar, 2 people working behind the wood. The guy was ice cold, . a bit useless. He seemed to like to chit chat with colleagues/co-workers rather than entertain guests. The young lady working was quite welcoming, we tipped based on her service. I hope she doesn't have to share it with him. Not a bad experience but I wouldn't return on my next trip.

Mp0XFwTGXjQ7nEgmKpLUwQ.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a vegetarian-friendly place for a nice dinner while briefly staying in Vegas.  I did some web-searching and cross-referencing and Firefly seemed to fit the bill.  It was a Saturday night and we arrived at Firefly at about 8:00p.  After about 5 minutes we were seated on the heated patio that was beautifully strung with red and white lights and really just seemed to be an extension of the dining room.  Drinks were tasty: sangria and dirty martinis, and we were offered a nice crusty bread with compound butter consisting of schraicha, honey and almonds.  It was really good!  We ordered two cold plates and two hot plates.  The green apple manchego salad and pisto were real standouts.  All the plates were reasonably priced between $4 and $6.  For dessert: the caramel flan with almond biscotti was sized very well and tasted perfect! Not too-eggy and velvety smooth.  All-in-all a great dining experience.  I would definitely recommend this to a friend!!

D-39wDqugVpfbjr_3riPiQ.text: Amazing food. Everything was absolutely delicious! And better yet we were able to share and try everything! Would recommend this place highly

kTwDMYxWpCwku5daTx2phQ.text: This is my third Firefly review and of course third times a charm! I cannot find anything wrong with this concept. Tapas options are spectacular chilled, hot, seafood, meat and poultry. I haven't tried dessert because I'm usually full by then, but I can only imagine they are inspired.  Portions are a steal with prices ranging with smaller tapas $4 to hearty paellas $20. And believe me, you'll want to share that paella!! It's a lively place that I always think of going with a large group. But I must note, this new bar is large and the separation from the restaurant makes it comfortable to kick back with their sangria on your own as well.  The staff is friendly and attentive. The bartender is knowledgeable & smiles. And now this new space is bright, clean and inviting. I'm glad to see them bouncing back from the bad press they received from the shutdown.  After all, mistakes happen, and we all deserve a second chance! Wait to go Firefly! I'll see you again very soon I'm sure.

EQ28AtOZ9_aknJ7LeQ2B-w.text: The food here is great we order so many things every time we come here and are always more than satisfied! Oscar and Carlos are great servers, funny and easy going!

0UZJs7OADnQK1Iy9pYEogg.text: Tapas   Great bread that keeps flowing. Diablo Shrimp awesome. Sauce Chorizo plate. Good selection Steak salad. Had to get something green

nQh1D4sOjPXi4FyW_6SlUg.text: The 5 stars goes to our dinner and our server, which was absolutely wonderful. We were a party of five and ordered the chicken & mushroom paella, two pitchers of the red sangria (my favorite over the white) and several tapas. The bacon wrapped dates are by far the best I've ever had, the pork empanadas and roasted red peppers are also a standouts. All the others were great as well. Although we enjoy this place a lot, it was our first time bringing out of town family members here and they were beyond impressed with the food, ambiance and service.   HOWEVER: I must note that the valet parking here is RIDICULOUS!  It's like FIVE feet from the entrance. We initially parked in an open spot out front NOT marked for valet, only to have the jerky valet guy bitch us out for parking in a "valet" spot. So we backed out of the spot, drove about two feet and gave him our keys to valet....and he parked it in just about the same damn spot! I don't get it, but whatever. Wasn't thrilled about tipping him either, but the fiance did.   Definitely my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Despite the idiot valet situation. I think we would have had a better time if we weren't all put off by the valet guy. Lame.

IH2II8ZXpDblv1Cq7PDGog.text: We shared a total of 6 distes and Everything tasted the same. Looks like they use the same seasoning on all of their dishes. Not sure how ppl like this place, not authentic or even good tapas.

wSCbq3HErAUh-dd21Cfgog.text: Could be a 3.5, but I'll get to that in a bit.  Firefly is a nice place off the strip with a nice menu. We've done Jaleo in our hometown (it's a go to) so we venture away from the Vegas locations to try Firefly. The white sangria stood out as the best thing we ordered. With four of us we order 10 plates and they were all good - nothing to really complain about - but nothing that stood out. Nice staff. The mark down is for the roaming photographer who's running some sort of "you're on the rollercoaster at DisneyWorld and want to buy pictures." She took a few and then came back to pass along a 'free' photo and offerings to sell. I don't need someone selling me photos at dinner - it's cheap and...cheap. And, vaguely unprofessional for a restaurant. If the manager reads this, knock it off. It's awful. Ran about $125 for ten plates, a pitcher of sangria, and two coffees.

JNfMh8lS5a-JHAOOPi9xkA.text: I lived for another day...so their previous demerits should not merit on this review. I like their new location and the new feel. It's very dark, romantic (if you want it to be), and hip. They are filled with nicely designed booths for more privacy, and they have a private room which you can reserve for a big party.  I headed to the bar and of course you have to order one of their signature mojitos or sangria (by the glass or pitcher...if i were you I'd order a pitcher) as I wait for the rest of my party. Even if I was already late I was still early than the rest of my group. Anyway, I ordered a glass of the BLOOD ORANGE MOJITO. Then, as our party slowly but surely showed up, we ordered rounds of pitchered mojitos. This included the watermelon and cucumber mojito.   Here are my mojito highlights: Glass: $7.50 Pitcher: $30.00  BLOOD ORANGE: Lovely! It has that nice tart taste from the blood orange, and can barely taste the alcoholic kick. So if you want something with a strong cocktaily flavor with less of an alcoholic taste I would recommend.  CUCUMBER: This is pretty good too. Here, you taste more of the alcoholic flavor. It is a lighter mojito flavor wise. So if you're looking for something fun in flavor...probably steer away from here.  WATERMELON: While a pitcher or two of these bad boys may lead you to your own rendition to DRUNK IN LOVE (you can't help it since Queen B does say watermelon), this has a really light refreshing taste with a good mixture of that alcoholic POW. Definitely, one of my faves. In which we did drink the most of.   Food wise, we ordered a bunch of random plates in which a party of 7 shared. 4 pitchers and a handful of tapas plates later, our tab reached a good $300. So expect to pay a good $60 to $80 PER PERSON especially if it's at a dinner party.   Other favorite foods I like ordering here:  DATES CHORIZO SKEWERS SCALLOP ESCARGOT STEAK AND MUSHROOM SKEWERS SHRIMP CEVICHE MUSHROOM/CHEESE TART (this is really filling with a strong cream taste...which is usually a hit or miss with people so be careful)  Just name drop these choices and you'll sound like a regular here. Other than that, read everyone else's review on the plates.

3RQrK-MfbC4ase6RjGozFQ.text: I will keep this review short, simply and sweet.  I love this restaurant!! I wish we had one in California because it is down right delicious. Everything we tried was amazing and the tuna tartar was the best - I had TWO! This will be a MUST place to go to whenever I am in Vegas. I even dare say that it is a lot better than some high prices, high rise, five star restaurant's I've been to on both the strip and downtown.  But remember this is a TAPAS restaurant which means that plate sizes are finger food sized and not very large. It is a good place for groups but if you are all looking to stuff your face then this is not the place for you. If however you are looking for a sleek and posh restaurant with amazingly high quality food and flavor this is THE place!

0kbbM93OxycXBl9WTxUgNw.text: This place is one of my favorites! And being I was introduced by a friend, makes it even more special. Firefly specializes in tapas. Best way I can explain tapas are little plates personal size, of appetizers. It's so fun because you all order different things and you pass around and try. They also have an extensive drink menu...but since my drink of choice is diet coke with lime... I'll leave it at that . Some of my favorite things to try... first and foremost- bacon wrapped dates- seriously , they will change your life! I always order these! Loved the apple slaw salad thing.. The best review I can say is. Don't be afraid to try... get some items that you wouldn't normally eat! There is not a bad thing on this menu!! Also.. get dessert, I'm thinking it was the chocolate tres leches.... amazing!!!

QJqgG8S6GRydNrmupiU_rg.text: Love the new location on Paradise... as much as I enjoyed the original, they had outgrown it and were in desperate need of a larger space. The parking is not great in the back of the building, but outside of that this is a huge improvement. They fit plenty of seating and you don't feel like you are right on top of the people next to you as you were in the previous location.  Love that they have a full size bar now with plenty of seating. Food was as good as always... I have a very hard time not ordering the Serrano Sliders every time I go to Firefly. It's pretty sad actually.  Wish them luck with the new location and hope they learned their lesson and continue to monitor their staff/food more closely moving forward.

cqajipPxwbcOgoy3uxQ2mw.text: We had a wonderful dining experience. I would definitely come back and recommend to my friends while visiting Vegas. I did take the time to read previous reviews for ordering recommendations. Let me just say that everything I ordered was quite savory. We did start with the stuffed dates and paradise mojitos. Let me just say they were amazing. I also ordered.. Steak & mushroom skewers, baked goat cheese, spicy beef salad (I wasn't absolute fan ..but the rest the table was), mushroom tart (perfect) , chicken tinga empanada (yum) , baby back ribs (also not my favorite but very tender) , camarones a la diabla (loved) , and last but not least ceviche of shrimp (also very delicious.) I can't wait to come back. I wish there was the location in San Diego,  California. The wedding party I was with was very satisfied, we had a great memorable time.

JVYaeiBEc_PMhFfxoGhhIQ.text: Was not impressed with this place at all. Only reason I'm giving it two stars is because the stuffed dates were okay. I got the empanadas and it came with a single empanada that was cut in half. Not to mention it wasn't even good. The salad was soggy and resembled something you could buy from Walmart or McDonald's. Would not recommend and I'm not sure why it's rated so highly.

qK0hLYvlVcW7MA8LZCbcCg.text: Despite all the issues this establishment has had historically it has never failed to deliver when I've gone. I usually start off with a mojito but last night switched to mescal mule, it was delicious and hit the spot. Also steering away from ordering the usual chorizo and clams, we ordered the ham and manchango plate, scallops, tuna skewers, and apple and manchango salad. All were spot on and would order them all again. The scallops were decadent!  Love this place!

XoUmKRKo6mfo60U76CM6JQ.text: Wow! What a fantastic dining experience. We went here for the first time last weekend with my brother and sister-in-law and learned first-hand exactly why it is one of their favorite place to dine in Las Vegas. The food was stellar and the service prompt and friendly. This was my first tapas experience and I fear it may have spoiled me for anywhere else.   Since there were five of us and we all shared our selections with the rest of the group, I got to taste a wide variety of their menu offerings. It is hard to pick a favorite because everything was delicious, but I think I'd have to go with the stuffed dates if pressed to only pick one. I only had the white sangria but it was so superb I can't imagine the other sangria offerings would not be as well-crafted and delicious as the white.

Lpe7dra4WEFBVwSvHLmfdw.text: Great for Tapas and large groups, or any groups for that matter. You can sit at the bar or make reservation for a table (this place is packed!) and try different food options from the menu, most of them are around $5 and very good!. Loved the bacon wrapped dates and mushrooms and the eggplant, heck loved them all! It's a little off the strip so if this is your first trip to Vegas you won't make it here, but if you want to try something else and have some good food and good time absolutely bookmark this one!

exFAGn93xr9Uo4cEd3NfFA.text: Went 2x while in Vegas. Had almost everything on the extensive menu. They were fast with the food but it didn't taste like it had been pre made or sitting in a warmer. Very reasonably priced! My favorite dishes were the bacon wrapped dates, ceviche and potatoes.  Great choice for an off the strip late night dining experience.

pvgyuIhYKCp9quzgSfa-KA.text: Good for a tasty bite or a quick dinner date before dancing or a show.  The choices are nominal and they do seem to try to make everything up scale at an affordable price.  There have been a tish or two about the service and food safety standards at the previous location.  This is a much nicer roomier spot.  Honestly I haven't had any issues with the food ever.  I like it as a less formal dining option, decent food.  Service at this location is much better than the westside location.  Probably why that location is closing..  Sangria or flavored Mojito in a carafe pitcher is the way to go.    I recommend:   firefly fries duck roll  petite filet  stuffed dates tuna tartare tierra y mar camarones al ajillo lamb chops scallops "escargot"  Not too fancy, not shabby at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1MqR9OCJ6bpC-RkG-TPx_A.text: Sangria, Sangria! Along with many of the other places, Firefly is bomb.com! Definitely a place you can come with a party...to party. With awesome food, service and ambiance, a good time is to be had! No matter how many people you come with, you can expect them to enjoy their experience. Don't worry about ordering, everyone can order something different and pass the plates around. A favorite of mine is patatas bravas, veggie empanada, firefly fries, and mac n cheese. That mac n cheese I won't share. Get your own, you won't regret it. Along with the food, the drinks are tasty too. Can't go wrong with sangria. Red sangria is really good. If you plan to have more than 1 drink, order a pitcher. Service here, I hate to say, could be better. My friends and I were seated right away, but service after that was slowww. And we were sitting at the bar, where someone is always there. We ordered through someone other than our waiter, because he was a lil too busy. But other than that, I enjoyed myself. Fridays at 10:30pm is Latin night. Salsa! So much fun. I love watching the really experienced dancers. The fluidity of their movements is amazing. Some of them incorporating flips and special turns in their routines. And they all switch partners. Don't be surprised if someone come to you while your dancing.

Sgk9gOIIyyq5M41hH7erUg.text: I've come here twice and would recommend Firefly to others! It's about an 8 minute uber from the strip but worth making the trek to visit. The house made sangria is a must try! This is a tapas (small / sharing plates) style restaurant, which is great for any type of occasion. Tons of vegetarian options, but plenty of options for the meat eaters alike.

PSsycXN7dnupqOg_awPntA.text: Tried this place out for a vendor lunch while attending a local event at the convention center. Was hesitant as all we had heard was about the sick outbreak some time ago, but was willing to give it a try.   We were seated on the patio and the environment is great, but the food was not. We had 10 people in our party and no one was super excited about their lunch choices.   With all the amazing food places to choose from in Vegas, would not recommend or return to Fire Fly. Quality of food is not worth the price tag.

mfaclo3AZghKBTd7feqEiw.text: Food: 3.5 stars Service: 2 stars Atmosphere: 1 star  You will leave this place with ringing in your ears. It is as loud as a night club, which makes for a totally unromantic, get-me-outta-here dinner experience. Service was rushed and felt IHOPish. Food is nothing special, and when you can't hear yourself think, you don't really care what it tastes like. Sangria was too sweet. Definitely not worth going when there are so so many dining options.

I_XjxGCT7SqBv5KFmzpsgQ.text: We were soon hungry and found this place that serves paella and tapa style food!! Service was quick and had a bunch of food that we took back and ate at our hotel! The paella was massive! Saved it for later and it was still delicious! Come during happy hour! Great selection of drinks (try the mango mojito) and tapas are all very organized so you can decide very easily.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella !!!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tapas

OhXm7APsJKJKBLG7hvloOg.text: Our expectations were high after reading the reviews but our expectations were exceeded. Our experience was fantastic from drink to food to service by Alejandro.  We had 2 martinis that were GREAT. The Scallop Escargot was amazing. We shared 6 different Tapas and every one was so flavorful.  You will not be disappointed here and the patio is lovely.

mZKDIJVzsXY4nLYI0mH59g.text: We ordered Stuffed pepper, Patatas Bravas and Chicken tinga empanadas and they were fantastic.. I can definitely say one of the best tapas to try in Vegas.  Drinks?.. Do try their Sangrias (Sprakling and Red) ..

p-8ojtNQvaefI5Vk9McrLw.text: OMG. This place is rad. Get a little bit of everything--I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu. Good drinks, too!

_PMbo8IhRxxoG9KLU1kyew.text: 2nd time at Firefly... 2nd time amazed!  I laid off the happy hour sangria this time though... so I can actually remember something about the food to write a review.  Everything here is fantastic... for those not familiar with Tapas (such as my parents)... just think of it as a Spanish version of Dim Sum.   Ordered the usual:  Stuffed Dates - bacon wrapped... yum!  Some might find the flavor unusual however... each serving comes with 5  Roasted Beet Salad - have had better elsewhere... you can skip this and try something else  BBQ Mango Ribs - my favorite dish... very tangy yet has that mango sweetness... meat falls off the bone... dish comes with 4 good sized ribs  Firefly Fries - truffle fries = king of all fries.  comes with a nice dipping sauce as well  Stuffed Mushrooms - stuffed with some sort of chorizo... fantastic. 4 pieces per order  Seafood Paella - order this right when you sit down because it takes a while to cook... probably could feed 4-6 people... it's great!  It's quite on the peppery/spiced side (not spicy but you can taste a lot of different spices added).  Unfortunately it came last and we were quite full already and couldn't enjoy it.  Even the bread appetizer is delicious... comes with what I think was a jalapeno butter and olives.  I stayed away from it this time... but the Sangria is fantastic.  Especially if you get it during happy hour.... quite the bang for the buck... careful though... that sh*t creeps up on you!  Only reason this doesn't get 5 stars in my book is the music is way too loud and the service is a bit slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firefly fries
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed dates
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted beet salad

HK5hQwQmcGtGoC7VkBINow.text: I thought this place was great! The restaurant is huge, the lights are dim, and it's super lively (I liked it, but my friends complained that it was too loud). People were dressed anywhere from jeans to cocktail dresses. My group was impressed with the food. Mine was really good, but I'm going 4 stars because I felt like my shrimp (ceviche) and octopus were slightly overcooked. Not the best I've ever had, but it was good. The tapas selection was insane, huge variety and super reasonably priced especially considering how large the plates were.

Nxc-7JD3NUn3ULO1BTS-Cg.text: The food is 5 star, but the service is sub-par. Am I invisible? You're at half capacity!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food is 5 star. The service is sub-par. Are we invisible??

Mp3GurfAQvi4XXSlO4bnSA.text: My whole body awoke to taste the bacon wrapped dates. The fantastic flavor of the sauce enlivened my spirit and encouraged an illuminating conversation between myself and my date. Pun not intended.  With each bite of the petite filet mignon revealing more and more power of a red wine sauce, so too did each sip of the perfectly crafted mojito reveal more and more the depths in relationship that are discoverable through a layered and reasonably priced meal.  If you want your taste buds to envelop your body like goose bumps on a cold naked night, then eat at the Fly... and soar into one of God's kitchens.

BFmox-taGp6Bhgil4uCgcw.text: Service and food were great. I just hope this place doesn't become too busy every night!   The summer salad is refreshing and the petite filet was spot on.

I0kuSYkaHWGxJOzMwd6Pzw.text: The first time we ate here on vacation, we had the stuffed dates, warm spinach salad, chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms and Tierra y mar skewers. Everything was perfectly cooked. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly. The stuffed dates in the wine reduction are a must! The warm salad was amazing! We were not big on the chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms. It was hit and miss on whether or not there was enough stuffing in the mix.   We loved it so much we came a second time and ordered all the same dishes except we had lamb instead of the stuffed mushrooms and we ordered TWO of the stuffed dates (so friggin good!). The lamb was the first dish we had that we were not impressed with. We love lamb and eat a lot of it. This was tough and lacking flavor. The lentils that come with it were great though. The cook on the Tierra y mar the second time was off too. One of the shrimp tasted raw. Meat was tougher. I think it is probably different chefs on different nights? We were not as thrilled the second night.

bSjomaxQxokNEJJGHswh_A.text: when it came time to pick a group dinner for my bday, i knew i wanted to go off strip since i dont really get the chance to  ordered a feast for 10: -tomato bread -shrimp ceviche -tuna tartare -patatas bravas -stuffed dates -shrimp, filet, chorizo skewers -calamari -shrimp in lemon garlic butter  -albondigas -empanadas -chicken and mushroom paella -mixed paella -sangria  everything was amazing and glad everyone in my group loved it too

I86Lqkpmm_T1FjtOovlcNA.text: My first love for tapas started here in 2009, at the other location where it was always crowded and there was no place to walk. The old location was much more entertaining.  The food was great. Their butter is so good I can eat a whole tub of it. My husband still loves this place and like Pinball HF we come here every visit to LV.   I don't like this place much anymore because I have had better. They lost their touch. The warm salad is just warm lemon juice on greens. So plain. Should change up the menu, or go back to the old menu. Tapas is an adventure to me but Firefly decided to get married.   Four stars because he loves it and I think it's ok. Worth a try. All our friends now love this place.   They use to give out really cute matchboxes but not anymore. Boo.

xIx8PV4ba9Hb2xgpyIjvYw.text: Came late night with a party of 13 people called ahead and they had a table ready for us. Since it was late we were able take advantage of happy hour prices on a few items which was great, we ordered a few pitchers of Sangria and variety of tapas everything was excellent, the tapas that stood out to me were the may y tierra skewer, patatas bravas and my wife enjoyed the croquetas. Service was good and attentive would definitely go back

z9QrHzuJwoR87Y7SdbOYGQ.text: We are BIG Tapas fans but have trouble finding the real thing.  We found it at Firefly.   Great service from Eder and wonderful food.  The Summer salad features thinly sliced french green beans,  marinated in a balsamic dressing surrounded by halved red and black cherry tomatoes and a few dollops of smooth, lucious burrata cheese.  Delicious!   The Albondiga -meat balls in tomato sauce- doesn't sound exciting but it is irresistible.  Serrano ham and Manchester croqettas- sublime.  Crispy outside soft and delicious inside.  The red Sangria was perfect. We had other dishes and all were top notch.    The Flan was a spectacularl end to a perfect meal. Smooth and creamy and not too sweet. The tiny bit of lightly sweetened tart berries was just the right foil for the creamy flan.  I recommend Firefly wholeheartedly!

eFz5sTXvSF9KlpcgKOOlkQ.text: The ambience was good but really noisy. The food was definitely tasty but the quantity was not at all sufficient for a meal. We had to order atleast 2 plates per person. I liked their berries drink

R4NpdvaaYveyOSODAwqG6A.text: I ate here last week when I was leaving vegas and it was the best decision I made that week for food. Everything there is super reasonably priced and delicious.  We had the Mac and cheese which was amazing. The filet mignon was delicious too. The ceviche was to die for. The cheese plate was so so. We had chicken skewers which were pretty good. We also had the mango ribs which only half of us like but I really enjoyed them. The scallops were sooooo good.   I recommend anyone with a big appetite to go share a meal there and try a bunch of stuff.  This is not a place meant to have only one thing.

mLsXV39TYxOd2BrOGblRkA.text: Always a favorite place to eat when I'm in Vegas awesome delicious food and great atmosphere definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegas ....

Yqm4-1LPohDZyM-huiU6PA.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.   I came to Firefly after work on a Friday to hit up the end of Happy Hour and try some tapas I've heard so many great things about.  The Happy Hour menu only includes drinks, but included beer, wine, and Sangria, most for $5 or less.  The bar area wasn't too crowded for the time and day of the week and had a very low-light, intimate, Spanish-type of setting.  It was a great environment and had a very post-work feeling to the crowd.  This makes sense as the restaurant is ideally located right next to the Corporate sector of Las Vegas.  I began with the Sangria, and it was very good and highly recommended.  I also had a chorizo plate which was quite good but not as authentic as I was expecting.  I saw a bunch of orders around me and they all looked great.  I will be back to come for an actual meal in the very near future.  Most of the food sits at around $7-13 for tapas so it is highly affordable and worth a go if in the area or even for an after work stop.

SdwFESSdHk6H2r9wOE9bag.text: Great food and atmosphere. Excellent price point for Las Vegas. Attentive service. I come here every time I'm in LV for work.

dCbRtYhQ0N7FV5byloBb0g.text: The paella is so good. I got the combo paella and a bunch of other tapas, but the paella was the star of the show. Hubs liked it as well.

tcUegpenCIodm06uS-gtAg.text: It was okay at best. Very busy as it was a Friday evening. Food was okay, nothing that I ordered was rememberable.

TW6BzDuH9XVr1gUu5a-FWQ.text: Firefly recently started serving brunch, and I have been wanting to try it since they started. I finally decided to go to celebrate my 22nd birthday with some friends. The brunch was so good, and you can still order from the rest of the menu if you want. It is a tapas breakfast still, which at first I was a little skeptical about, but it ended up being great! I had their patatas bravas (Potatoes) and the carne asada breakfast taco. The tacos are like little street tacos, but they were SO good. I also tried one of the Pumpkin Beignets, they look a little bit like donut holes,  they didn't really taste like pumpkin, but they were still a tasty treat.   Most importantly, for brunch they have all you can drink (with a 2 hour limit), mimosas, sangria, and bloody marys. I obviously had to try all of them. The mimosas were very good, I am not a big fan of bloody marys while I'm eating, but besides that it was a very basic bloody mary, still tasty. Their sangria is always good, so no surprise there. I like to get the sparkling white, because I'm not a big wine fan. We definitely stayed the whole two hours.   Besides the food, the service was great! There were about 10 of us so we had a lot of people coming over to help. The manager even stopped by to wish me happy birthday which was very nice! I also got a birthday shot, great place to go to celebrate! I would definitely recommend!  *disclaimer: I had written this almost a year ago, and apparently forgot to submit it. I just noticed it was still in my drafts and decided I should still post it!

XAcA-QF2SqQLF-_Lhchn5w.text: Amazing tapas with a great late night happy hour. A little bit away from the strip but nice environment to get away from the tourists.

oJNR9kpp_q2sGSpH1ODupg.text: This post is overdue, it has been a few months since our amazing visit and this is still one of the most memorable places we have been to. The food was great, just the perfect size portions to split between 2 people and be able to try quite a few items.  The service was great, the atmosphere was great. Looking forward to going her again soon!

qdePXzCpMERIKEW_zRPSRw.text: Came here for dinner with my family & got seated right away. The food is good, were familiar with the menu. Service definitely needs improvement. The server didnt even greet us he just came over and asked if were ready? I thought that was kind of rude considering the restaurant didnt look very busy. I ordered the ceviche (as its my top fave) and it came out way after our 2 order of tapas. I didnt like that they drop off plates at the table and leave right away. I needed condiments and Im in the service industry myself, I feel like they could at least ask if we need anything else. After asking 2 people that werent my server about the ceviche, they finally brought it out. We didnt see our server much until we would look around. I know I'll be back because this is one of my favorite local restaurants. I just wish they improved their service.

xu4PQFcY60NYPudHI1i8TQ.text: Great place for Spanish tapas. Everything was very flavorful. I ordered apple manchego salad, chorizo clams, lamb chops, dates - all excellent  Great choice for a light meal of small plates. I would have loved to order dessert but was too full. Topped all off with a glass of dry CAVA

n_VAMmfoCImJgrgqtrb4Ew.text: Very impressed by their service. We had a big group of 90 and sat in the patio. The staff was amazing .

UHBeTCvC33J-OduwrXPVBQ.text: Absolutely amazing food and staff. Been here twice now and will come back every visit to Vegas.

r00Jod8gwir11VGhyMnpZg.text: Great location off the strip. Easy to find, plenty of parking. We went for an early dinner on a Monday night and sat out on the patio. Attentive service and fantastic food. We had the shrimp ceviche, croquettes, baked goat cheese and petite filet. Generous portions and this was more than enough food for the 2 of us.  Back again to treat my daughter and daughter-in-law for mother's day. Our reservation for 3 plus an infant was 545 on Saturday night. Although not a place you would normally take a baby, the girls just moved to Vegas and a sitter was not an option. They kindly accommodated us in a corner booth with plenty of room for the baby. (She slept most of the time and then smiled at & watched the staff bustling around). On top of the dishes from my first visit, we added the mushroom  tart, tuna tartare, lemon & berry tarts, stuffed dates. Again, it was all delicious. I tried the blood orange mojito which was so good I had a second.   This place is a gem. There isn't another restaurant I've been to twice in 6 months, and I'd go back here today. If Vegas locals aren't eating here, they're missing out!

F9_W1z_n8oOp849EZHmG_g.text: Chicken paella was mostly all rice, empanada was extremely oily, and salty and the pork stuffing was overcooked and dry. Service was ok, sangria was good.  Won't be back.

XNfhutDAEysc1Papzbd-gQ.text: Love their tapas! A huge selection to choose from, if you go early there is no wait, I was there at 530ish and went straight to a table. Service is always quick and food is good!

qChf3PrqSlnAbM5tZsV6gg.text: My all time favorite restaurant in Vegas! Great customer service and amazing food.  Order the sangria by the pitcher for sure.  The bacon dates are delicious but I've really never ordered anything I didn't love. You have to try the truffle fries, they are so good and great for sharing with the table.   Make a reservation, they get really busy on weekends or when there are conventions in town. The wait has been well over 2 hours before.

zHv2qAQjHNIxW6EN6kPqqA.text: Vegas is Vegas.  There are many ways to do Vegas.  Getting off the strip, even if for a moment, is a must for me.  This place, is worth leaving the strip for.  No lines, quiet, you know... a normal dining experience. Lets get down to the food.  It was good... Very good.  I have only been here once, so that is why the 4 out of 5.  We had the apple and manchego salad.  How can such a simple salad be such a great food experience?  It is... trust me.  Get it, enjoy it.  We had the mac & cheese, albondigas, and baby back ribs.  Yes, we got our food on.  The drinks were good too.  Go here.  Eat well.  Drink well.  Live well.    Decor: 3 out of 5 Food:  4 out of 5 Drinks:  4 out of 5 Service: 4 out of 5 Cleanliness:  4 out of 5

yOSoCZDzuflRGbXCDsWVQA.text: Ordered 8 dishes. Steak was over cooked then what i asked for. I am a chef myself so my critism is slightly high, but the food was ok. The shish kabob was fantastic, but as for the rest, not worth going back a second time.

HClh5BjHhZRjkb2uQTp_tw.text: BEST. FOOD. in VEGAS.   I recommend to everyone I know who travels here.   beautiful motif, great atmosphere. Food delectable. My favorite was the chorizo clams. I could have eaten those all day.

bHO3VaFuupnhzkLZab0ElA.text: Food is delicious!! Everything we ordered was on point. Soo flavorful and easy to eat. We shared everything and it was more than enough. Customer service is also very good. It was very very busy but our server kept checking up on us.  Would recommend to reserve a table since it can get very crowded.

3Afhgx6M5p2GwF-okZDYxg.text: You will never believe how good the food is here in this restaurant I've been continuously coming back to this front for years and I wish and where I live we also have this restaurant because it makes me feel like a complete my world of food  Also the part of the reason why I come to Las Vegas is to eat in here

YQDZ4zmT4rZksoUzMmfe1g.text: The service was excellent. I had the Gazpacho and the Ahi Tuna skewers. All were delicious. The restaurant is a little noisy but very nice.

P8iNbZYJHI01kVp4o4_-xA.text: I LOVE this place.... it's a MUST GO to when I come to Vegas.  This time I brought my girlfriends and we really went to town!!  We came here to eat an early dinner before our show.  Ordered about 12 dishes to share among 4 of us.  We could've done with just 10 as the meat dishes were huge!!  But we managed to eat everything plus down a pitcher of white Sangria which is a MUST!!  so light and refreshing!!  Food came out pretty steadily...  We started with the Apple and Manchego salad! SO GOOD - slivers of refreshing green apples and manchego cheese (which is light and not over whelming) along with chopped smoked almonds to give that extra crunch!  We then got the warm spinach salad - WOW!  So MUCH - perfect for four of us - very lightly dressed - loved the artichoke hearts and feta that came with it!!  We loved EVERYTHING we ordered.... their tuna tartare with bits of fresh avocado to be enjoyed with crispy taro chips!  WE LOVED their Veggie Empanada... I actually wished I could've eaten a whole one myself!  The crust was crunchy - with warm fresh veggies - SO MOUTHWATERING GOOD!! Then there's the mushrooms that were stuffed with chicken, chorizo and cheese!! so good... then you can never go wrong with their fried calamari!! :)  A nice surprise was the octopus!  had a bit of a bite - spice but the octopus was SO tender... grilled to perfection!!  Loved their lamb chops (we had to order 2 as each order comes with 2 lamb chop).  Had SO much lentils... was crazy - that's the one thing we couldn't finish... OH and their ribs - scrape off the bone deliciousness!!  OH and the other nice surprise was the Shrimp with the sweet and sour sauce... shrimp cooked perfectly but that SAUCE.. yes - wipe clean with the bread goodness and even dipping our calamari in the sauce was AWESOME....  Overall we had a GREAT time - rolled out of there... the one thing about service which was frustrating was we needed our bill so we can run to our show...  the waiter forgot and I had to chase him down after 10 minutes... UGH...  but other than that - great and fun place to get a variety of tasty tapas and DELICIOUS refreshing drinks!!  A MUST GO to place when visiting Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby back ribs
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna skewers with mango

IkJnKEBcllFD9oQBthq9bg.text: I love this place. I just really, really do. Not a bad thing on the menu but special kudos go to the bacon wrapped dates and the escargot-style scallops and the perfect bread and butter that comes with your meal.  Get off the Strip. Go to Firefly. You won't regret it.

jiEodWV8wL8xkqF-1t7PwQ.text: Always my go to for special occasions or big groups . Love this place ! The strawberry Mojito is soooo good and the firefly fries and comarones a la diabla ( shrimp diablo) are a must ! The place is cute and the service is good.

Uko6kUpqoxHpBNB_AbPvmA.text: Went to Firefly's last Friday night with some friends for the first time.  The food, ambiance and service was FANTASTIC!!!  Our server Jatziry made our experience great as well as the rest of the staff we were greeted by.  It was a busy time for the restaurant and our server took his time to go over the menu with us, suggested some great items from the menu and was constantly checking on us.  One thing I noticed about this restaurant was that all of the staff worked together. If we needed something anyone was willing to help us.  We will definitely be going back.  Loved their food and drinks!!!!

cBXMVOZZO7P-IBEi2ZyOLQ.text: Went on a Friday for happy hour. We are locals and have seen Firefly through it's up and downs and location changes. We consistently had great food and great service, but this past visit was horrible.   There were maybe 10 other diners in the establishment; slow time of the evening gearing up for the evening. Our waiter came by, took our order (4 tapas for 3 people) and we never saw him again. We had to flag him down for our bill; deciding not to even bother to order more food.  Food was ok, like a few other reviewers we thought they changed some ingredients and some of the dishes all tasted the same.   Regardless, it will be some time before we go back.

cWYZDgnTsi65miXGLJ3W2w.text: Great food and service. Got to taste many dishes and flavors. Nice wine list. Place to relax and kick back, but go early. Gets very loud later in the evening.

hKXypLg3Gt9Gf2YXUm4XBQ.text: Excellent food and outstanding service. My father and I ate here for lunch on a Saturday. We ordered a variety of tapas, six total, all of which were phenomenal. We could not pick a favorite. All of the dishes we received were impeccably spiced and cooked to perfection. Also worth noting is how incredible the service is at Firefly. We had a primary waiter but there are also many food runners and gentlemen refilling beverages. All of the employees were friendly, patient, and professional. Firefly is a True tapas experience I would recommend to anyone.

MIn55Ftt_w2crQC1hrt5HA.text: I came here for a birthday dinner this past week. We ordered a bunch of tapas for sharing. My favorites were the mushroom tart, tuna tartare, and the croquetas! The sauce from the mushroom tart was so delicious, it can be used as dipping sauce for the complimentary bread.

FqvyEGW9MSX3HFu3f0EQHQ.text: Firefly is a great off the strip tapas spot.   Huge restaurant and very lively. Crowded on a Friday night.  Service was friendly.  Artichoke Toast - $7 - Artichoke was tender and seasoned well.   Stuffed Dates - $6.50 - Salty bacon and sweet date. Reduction makes it really sweet.  Pulpo Asado - $10 - Octopus was grilled perfectly and really tender. Too much potato mixed in, made it hard to find the octopus.   Camarones Al Ajillo - $11 - Shrimp were plump and tasty. The lemon garlic sauce resembled something you would find in an asian restaurant.   Steak and Mushroom Skewers - $11 - The filet was so tender and flavorful. Mushrooms were placed evenly with the steak so each bite was perfect. The garlic butter and parmesan enhanced the steak but did not overpower it. My favorite dish we tried.   Babyback Ribs - $12 - Ribs were fall off the bone. The mango sauce was good but there was to much and made the ribs so saucy and sweet and hid the pork flavor.   Chocolate Tres Leches Cake - $7 - Chocolatey and moist cake.  Red Sangria - $8 Blueberry Mojito - $8 The signature drinks they have here. Good but to sweet for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table setting
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria - $8 &amp; Blueberry Mojito - $8
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Dates - $6.50

shrHlYk94vtJ6vVon1FmTQ.text: TLDR: decent prices, solid shrimp, limited selection, and horrible charcuterie selection  This place was worth a shot, but I think it needs some help with ambience. When you first walk in it feels sexy and intriguing, but the further into the restaurant you go the more it feels like just a dimly lit casual restaurant (NOT a compliment).   Nonetheless, the servers were pretty nice, and the dishes came out at a good pace. It was definitely a very solid dinner, if you count only the "easy" dishes. In other words, their kitchen is fine in terms of using skill, but for things like charcuterie where sourcing really matters, they weren't great.

rfPo3xljC-4b_vN9_sR-Fg.text: The best! A must in Vegas. Great service. Prices.  Food. Options. Love love love   You wont be disappointed

kXxhXM5DNsukB19FgGOsew.text: They served a paella for us at 1 AM. Where else would you find that? It was exquisite. Great service, and close to the strip. We're coming back on our next visit to Vegas. Thank you guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w5SHiANo5r40n6LvHiHVWg.text: I just had to try this place out when I was in ATL for the weekend and I'm glad I did! The service was awesome and the food was amazing. I had the mango ribs and they were delicious!! They fell off the bone with each bite. I also had a steak dish but I can't remember exactly what it was to be honest but it also delicious. It was a big crowd on the couch area but I sat at the tables by the bar. I dont know if you have to make reservations to sit on the other side but it seemed like it. Everything came out quick. Now I will say that the drinks weren't memorable.   The bathroom was clean and everyone seemed to be friendly. I will be back !

BJyjQztnirH0BpLszuhM-w.text: Fantastic food.  Wonderful service. Even though close to closing, food came out fast and everyone was  very helpful and nice. Only thing that kept the 5th star was some of the sauces tasted overdone.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella Sandwiches And Sorbet of the day
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite Filet

iOqQx_uqIwb9Hx7k94ISDw.text: Great atmosphere.  Great service.  Great food. Came here on a Sunday night to find out they had Latin music playing out on the patio. It was really fun. Dancing and great food.. what else you want?? Totally recommend.  Very relaxing atmosphere

IaY5UK5SIdv1SYaffG1NQQ.text: Our first time here was good We sat ourselves and although we saw plenty of people walk past us. We sat for 15 minutes without menus or being acknowledged. My company went to the restroom, came back and had to ask someone for menus.   After that. We didn't have a problem with everything else.  Food was fast.  The second waiter that attended to our order was quick and attentive along with the blond girl with black glasses whom I assume is the busser. She has good work ethic. We needed to get our servers attention because we wanted to order desert. She informed us that our waiter was busy but offered to pass down our order. Very much appreciated.   The 4 Stars was Bc how it started other than that The food was hands down Amazing

eW7lX7vGCZQYroYlEFpPyg.text: My favorite go-to place in Las Vegas. Right behind the strip. This place is a gem!! Tapas -- but great sizes and plenty of food options to keep you & your party full and happy. I normally order almost everything and I'm completely satisfied always.  Mac and cheese Tuna tartare  Baked goat cheese Ceviche Mojito pitcher! -- affordable and delicious  Green tea whiskey --- best shot of your life  Mushroom tart  French fries!!  The cod Patatas brava Even the effing Flan was good EVERYTHING!!  Eder was the best server. He went above and beyond with everything and made sure our party was A OKAY

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rRumD94Jfe9B1xjUnBEhxw.text: Mixed feelings about this place. While the food itself is pretty good, it is not "amazing" or good enough to justify the high prices & small portion sizes relative to the price...especially considering the poor customer service. If they knocked $2-$5 off each dish or increased portion sizes by 30-40%, I might not mind coming back.  Do not come here with a group or on the weekends! If you're with a group, they won't allow you to split checks so expect to spend a lot of time calculating the bill and have everyone bring cash. They say you can just use the ATM but it was broken when we went last Saturday.  Also, parking is a nightmare here and we, along with many others, had to make our own spaces along the wall.

jBKCV8Jhcmp0zSZoisqrzw.text: All I could say is the food was really good. The paella is a must try whether there are only two of you or a big party. We tried the chorizo, mussels, dates, lamb chops, and octopus tapas. They were all outstanding. However all of these wouldn't be as good without Arturo and his first mate. A big thanks to both of them.

UJD4uxaKCd3jlQShqhsu3g.text: What an experience!   First off, we decided to go on Valentine's Day, after we eloped, so this would be our special wedding dinner....having never been....I solely booked a reservation based on yelp reviews. The restaurant is beautiful! Black velvet wall paper, red velvet booths, perfect dinner lighting.  Even the staff's uniform is great! Everyone was so professional,  kind and attentive. The perfect spot for a special event! The beautiful manager offered us a complimentary glass of champagne and checked in on us a couple times, she was so nice! We decided to purchase the photos from the young lady taking shots of guests. She did an amazing job!  We got blood orange mojito and sparkling sangria. Both drinks were big, mixed exactly right and it was happy hour! Bonus!!!!   Our server suggested a tapa item from each section, we decided to get 2 of her 4 suggestions. We also got the special of the night YES! They were so good. Here's what we decided on: Boquerones, anchovies on toast w/roasted red pepper, vinegar, fresh avocado and greens. Delicious! Everything blended quite well... the acid from the vinegar was a perfect touch.  Bacon wrapped dates.  W/smoked almond and bleu cheese. I could eat a platter of these!! They were addicting! A MUST try  Eggplant cannenoli with goat cheese. Tender, thin sliced eggplant, creamy filling, light tomato sauce. Excellent   Grilled Octopus with roasted potato and diced pepper relish . I Love this dish. I don't remember the title of it, but it was cooked perfectly. I usually get octopus or squid and this dish was one of my all time favorites. Acidic, sweet, and a textural delight.  Heart of palm "crab cake" a vegan choice...very very VERY good. Over baby greens topped w an aoili, these cakes were prepared perfectly, lightly panseared, perfectly moist and very fresh.  Special was...Red Snapper and grilled shrimp over grilled asparagus w pomegranate sauce. Again, another fantastic dish. It was cooked perfectly, especially the seafood. So tasty!   We got the dessert platter, had a couple bites and took it togo since we were full. Every item was fresh. Chocolate tres leche was our favorite as well as passionate fruit cheesecake.  I Would absolutely recommend Firefly and we may go again before we leave Las Vegas, as there were many more things to try.

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heart of palm &#34;crab cake&#34;

QNpV_P80KYdP-vOGywf3oQ.text: If you come to Vegas, you MUST eat here. The food is absolutely unreal. I HIGHLY recommend their seafood paella and their empanadas.   Literally dreaming of the next time I can come back to Vegas so I can eat here.

YJAtJ_vAjVVnlOHzeHvDEw.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere, and always a pleasant experience with this place!  Highly recommend if you are looking for a really good tapas bar!

O6_y9CSoDbLZ1IRNclL4cQ.text: It could be SO much better!  Here's the formula:  Toast the bread  Replace the sweet butter with Olive oil  Make sure the bread with tomato isn't too cold  The fried onions and fried potatoes on the mini filet mignon should be crispier (they're not fresh)  Medium rare needs to be just that.  I expected the Mac and cheese to be thicker and more savory.  PS....ask for Gabriel, he's a great server!

XKD-VjaGRZAtnqNQMfPiYA.text: We came here last night and left REALLY impressed with the food! The service, on the other hand, was less than stellar.   We initially sat at the bar to grab some drinks before the rest of our party arrived. The bar was busy, but bartenders kept flying by for at least 10 minutes until 1 finally asked to take our order. We had the sangria & the tamarind margarita. The drinks were good!   Once our party arrived we sat down and scoured the menu. We settled on the shrimp ceviche, tuna tartare, Mac and cheese, and shrimp de ajillo (Friday in lent so no meat). All the dishes came out at a decent rate and tasted great! My 2 favorite were the tartare and ceviche. It was some of the best ceviche I've ever had!   Now, back to the service... Our waitress was mediocre, and the bar was constantly backed up to the point it took 20+ minutes for our party to get their 2nd round of drinks.   Thinking we could get our drinks faster, we started ordering them from the bar... However!!! Drinks took well over 30 minutes to come out directly from the bar. It was quite bizarre.   All in all, food was awesome, drinks tasted good but took forever to arrive. Salsa dancing was pretty cool too! We'd come back for the food & hope to have better drink service next time.

GSvdclilqiK8atRmX74NTw.text: service is good, I so wanted to try the paella but there's only two of us and I know we couldn't finish it  shrimp ceviche - I like it with the guacamole fried calamari - too greasy for me petit filet - the sauce is too salty, I like all the sides that come with it though Chorizo Clams - my favorite out of the 4, good flavor and texture

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche of Shrimp
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried calamari
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo Clams

fwX2EEugkAeOV_XITi6drQ.text: I wanted something different for lunch, and an exhausting search for seafood popped this place up on yelp. Good reviews, small plates, why not, right? A quick lyft from the strip, the restaurant looked divey and dingy, like it's going through a remodel. I figured if it was gross, we could just get some pizza or something afterwards. The hostess sat us down on the rear corner by the kitchen, and only a few other people were there at noon.  We ordered a pitcher of white sangria for $33. It was delicious, filled with fruit. We decided ro do a bunch of small items, 2 at a time, on case we didn't like it. First up was stuffed dates and white anchovy avocado toasts. Holy crap, that was good! The dates had a red wine reduction and were wrapped in bacon. A perfect single bite. The toasts tasted like ahi and avocado,  the tiny anchovies were succulent and tasted of clean ocean water. Next, we selected an eggplant roll, stuffed with goat cheese and served in a simple tomato sauce with green onions. Very creamy and soft, I liked it best smeared on the bread from the bread basket. We also got a chorizo sausage, shrimp, and filet mignon skewer, with a salsa Verde. So flavorsome, all the meats were the right texture. The grilled octopus and potato dish came next, and made my taste buds tingle- the octopus wasn't chewy, but had a meaty, almost steak texture. We also ordered hearts of palm crab cakes (which were actually vegan, no crab involved!) which were tasty, but not something I would get again. For desert, the vanilla flan with the almond cookie. Best flan I've ever had, I will dream of it! My husband also got the chocolate  cake, which was good, but not flan good. What I was most surprised about was the affordability. Our epic lunch, with a tip, was half of what we expected, but each dish is priced at about 5 to 14 dollars. We left stuffed, happy, and determined to return! Go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat skewers. That salsa Verde is life though!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LWdJrVXnYkJwzME_TXQ3jQ.text: Wasn't expecting to find such a great tapas bar in Vegas. It's off the strip, but well worth going a little out of the way. We loved everything we tried. The chicken skewers with veggies, scallops served escargot style, and bacon wrapped dates were all full of flavor. They serve bread with some kind of butter, almond butter if I remember correctly. It was different - my husband wasn't crazy about it, but I enjoyed it trying something new.   Even though we were satisfied from the three small plates, we ordered the dessert platter. It's a good value for the money if you like sweets. I wouldn't say any specific dessert blew me away, but I am glad we got to try several different things.   Our bill was less than $50 (before tip) for three small plates, two sodas, and the dessert - for Vegas stands that is a cheap meal, but nothing about it tasted cheap!
