9ZXxXRxsqZ_zjGKdac9VtQ.text: You will spend 30 minutes looking for parking. This place did not prepared for the amount of people that frequent this place.

kpLLcaRv0jdpKWCbmEuBHQ.text: Empanadas hands down are amazing! We had meatballs, filet mignon, ceviche and heart of palm crab cakes. The empanadas and meatballs were very rich. Ceviche was soooo delicious, my favorite part were the crunchy chips lol. Was not a big fan of the heart of palms, I won't say they were bad though, just not for me. Great ambience, great service as well. My boyfriend left my purse at the table and they kept hold of it safely. That was very much appreciated.

i02KPD1GFqLMQC9NUp9a8A.text: They have valet parking up front, but we didn't have any trouble self parking behind the building.   We were able to get a seat at the makeshift bar (looks like the real bar may be under construction) on a Saturday night with no wait. It kept getting busier and people had to wait for tables.   The menu is a little overwhelming with so many choices, but our server gave us recommendations and we enjoyed everything we got. We got the apple salad, artichoke toast, shrimp tempura, and meat skewers.

XDaOsmqT0hGw1yDAvf9Dig.text: One of my favorite restaurants and of course a locals fave as well. Came in tonight, we were a party of 6...and as usual everything was excellent. The bacon on the stuffed dates is always a little overcooked but other than that zero complaints. Great prices and everything is good here! Thank you Luis and the other staff for excellent service!  :)

tOrEFrVMzBvfsrs0yEY9fA.text: If you like Spanish cuisine. This is a must try in your list.  They have tapas which are small plates or shareable appetizer. They have seafood paella. It takes 45 minutes to make because it made to order. So super fresh.  I haven't been here since they got in trouble back in 2012. They used to have several location.  I miss going to the one in Fort Apache and Sahara. Wish they would open one in centennial hills we need more options in the hills.

yaUVA4bSKg9WOGvBMDIrMg.text: I first ate here about 8 years ago.. love how you order throughout the visit.. was so good

spktX9r9kVyghesArgCQ7g.text: This place is amazing! I came with my husband and kids.  We tried  Tierra y mar, chicken skewers, pasta with meatballs, and a petite fillet.  Every single plate was delicious! And excellent service, I definitely recommend this place.

jxJXpbp1aolNkMBJb2xg2g.text: We had one of the best nights of our lives thanks to the staff and management at Firefly! Last Saturday the 19th, our wedding reception was held in two of the banquet rooms. Not only was the room set comfortably for our friends and family, the food was amazing! Everybody said they enjoy themselves and I give full credit to to staff for making sure not a single plan was abandoned. My only regret was not getting any pictures of the food and drinks, but truthfully, glasses didn't stay fill for long, and lasts were cleared of those delicious tapas quickly!

4O-rxnPrkYn2HlDFk6basw.text: The place is very nice, love the ambience, very relaxing.. the food is great too.. we were here during late night happy hour, I highly recommend their red sangria.. great service too, we will definitely come back

w53K5cWlz20H4haq_RRW4w.text: My parents recommended firefly and have been telling me to go for a long time. Finally went last night and it was literally so good! Tamarind margarita was very refreshing. My bf got the banana fosters old fashioned, which was really good as well.   We ordered the ahi tuna, garlic fries, calamari and eggplant tapas. Their veggie paella is also AMAZING. Overall friendly staff & good ambiance. Can't wait to go back!

4R9OqAY6RpRyv1OJcCPyOQ.text: I used to come here years ago and thought everything was half off on happy hour. Came in today on happy hour & nothing was on happy hour or told about the happy hour. $28 sangria was the only thing discounted to $18. Never was told by the bartender or the 3 bartenders that it's not half off, which most people assume or the server bartender tells them. Empty bar, 3 bartenders horrible service. Won't come back. Back in the day it was good.

yLMUaM8NuQIP_GCRI_lNKw.text: I usually don't post anything about restaurants I've been to, but in this case I had to. The food was delicious and Mario was a wonderful server. We've never been here before and weren't sure of what to order. He suggested some of his favorites, we tried them and we're glad we did. Next time we're in town, we'll come back here for sure!

6PruYRUca3A36GFb0XJj9g.text: The portions are huge! We ordered a few because we expected them to be small, but we were stuffed halfway through the first ones!

KVHc545z-HioSqTKUmq1oA.text: I'm not one to review anything, but I have to for this. This place is amazing! Bartenders are nice and cool ass people. They got latin nights on Friday? Come on man; hot a** females? It's good stuff. I'd recommend this place to all of my friends.

lDpEv1cRGMIxFkgOWWIWVA.text: This was an excellent experience all around. Food was delicious and plenty of variety and plates to share. Eduardo the manager was excellent, professional, and attentive to our table the entire time. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone passing through Vegas -may it be couple or family- looking for a great reasonably priced place with good food service and vibe!

6BUuVaAHZhBTYk0Zg3stUw.text: Total redemption from the management team at Firefly.  Thank you Tabitha for reaching out.  Last night was no less than perfect service from Irina and staff.  I also tried the beet salad and the lamb chops with lentils which by the way is now one of my favorite dishes.  Thank you again for providing a great atmosphere and delicious dishes!

g35-hvgS39xHvXmbS0S8nQ.text: Firefly is my favorite place to eat right now.  We have gone for tapas and last time, we went for paella.  The paella is superb but more rich and buttery than I am accustomed to.    Order the clams and chorizo and get some extra bread because the broth is the elixir of life.  Pork empanada is another favorite from a large menu of small plates.  There is something for everyone in your group and sharing is the order of the day.  I always go when I travel to Las Vegas.

zMuQ767F945cfUwFoNjceQ.text: We discovered Firefly because it was the closest restaurant to our hotel. We were pleasantly surprised at the wonderful selection of tapas. My favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, tuna tartar, and the infused vodka martinis.

GKQIGdA2AEF1cPj5ZFY-BQ.text: We were visiting Las Vegas with family and friends to celebrate my wife's birthday last weekend...about 16-18 of us...and was recommended to Firefly by local friends who live in Vegas. The staff really took care of us, the service was excellent, the food was really good,decent portions for tapas style and reasonably priced. Our wait staff even came out with a birthday dessert for my wife and her cousin who was also celebrating her birthday. Would definitely recommend Firefly to anyone who wants to have some good food, a casual restaurant with nice ambiance and an overall good time. Thanks for helping to make my wife's birthday memorable.

XMuP6n-LHb3xQnQPbFCqog.text: Great spot for locals AND tourists! I've been to the one in Summerland and since it closed down was worried the food wouldn't be as yummy.... I was wrong! Tasted great as always! The tapas are def the way to go!! I also order the chicken paella, takes 40 mins but enough to share and it tastes amazing!! Patio has a nice ambiance and it's a great spot to have some sangria and hang out with friends. 4 star due to the slow service. Half the time you can't find the server!!

FfANTvI9UKgGkApSl9OT0w.text: Two stars for service.   Food: Fried calamari - too salty; Eggplant cannelloni - too bland filled with coagulated, low quality goat cheese; Seafood paella - more like rubber disguised as seafood - was overcooked beyond belief; Chocolate tres leches - cake on top of melted ice cream it seemed  Atmosphere: not a great date place unless you want to exercise your vocal chords via yelling at your date. Excellent bar atmosphere, chill and great customer service. Overall appearance of the restaurant is great.  Best thing they can do for this place, re-train their cooks or fire the ones they have. They need new cooks.   Overall, take your money elsewhere, this is VEGAS. You will find better.

sXfedQ1do4iZAF3h35TKWQ.text: Service was great as was the food.  It could have been a little hotter at times but overall a nice change of pace to the normal LV fare.

QjUkQY60yIwNc5y96A9IxA.text: Only came here for desserts, which was pretty good but the service was awful. Two servers went to the table next to us and asked if this was their order, they said no and we said we think it's ours over and over again. The servers immediately got confused and nervous. Finally, he put in on our table and I think he thumbed one of our desserts.  On the tab: Banana-nutella Sandwiches Dessert Platter  Yum to both. Enough said

bWyz6_m08Dn2gTmAeqxdfA.text: Tasty tapas restaurant off the strip. Their food is very good, especially the complimentary bread with the addicting honey almond butter! I could eat the bread and butter all day! Like more tapas restaurants, you'll need to order multiple items to get full, if that's your intention. The Sangria is recommended, also. There were 3 of us and we each ordered 2 dishes plus a pitcher of sangria. The sangria might have caused us to feel full but it was worth it. I ordered the skewer and the potato dish. I don't recall what my friends ordered. There is a dance floor adjacent to the entrance and it's a pretty lively place. I would recommend this restaurant if you want to get away from the strip.

CRDIh4mLCdmYskutHH76Ig.text: Love this place! This is the 2nd time coming here on my trips to Vegas. Delicious tapas. Highly recommended.

5NSKog-xMC-pXY6I9UrIBw.text: Great food clean environment, Antonio our waiter was amazing, very attentive. Delicious Sangria!! Filet mignon was exquisite.  My new favorite place!

fw5zbZetU9eH71bnP0V4mQ.text: My first impression of he restaurant was the service wasn't to friendly and couldn't  accommodate my request because I'm a vegetarian and I wanted them to hold meat from the dish but he repeatedly told me that it's not good with out meat and I insisted I wanted it made without meat. He finally go if you want it you have it but he's going to be nasty. The garlic shrimp and spicy potatoes and shrimp ceviche were the best thing on the menu. The clams hold the meat were also good. He recommended the mussels with curry sauce so we tried it and sent it back it so gross. It was a Mexican restaurant but the flavor of the food was Asian and Italian ( Diablo shrimp dish ). I probably wouldn't come back here again.

UfYjsqqBUTH_I19H8oZoHw.text: Came for dinner. Interior was very nice and server was friendly however we were seated in the middle area near where the kitchen is and the servers kept on hitting the back of my chair when they walked by. It happened at least 8 times while sitting down so I moved my seat and a server noticed and asked about it. I said it was fine since I moved my chair but shouldn't the servers notice if they hit something as well? Food was good so points for that but it's really unnecessary to walk so fast when it wasn't even a full house. Anyways my favorite dishes were the Bacon Wrapped Dates and Scallop Escargot. Everything else I'll take a pass on, even the complimentary bread was not memorable, it was hard and stale.

61Pnfdlh-EMxjja_rU-T9g.text: Food was perfect! Bar staff was super nice! Will come back next time I'm in town. Good place for locals.

WBWJ0mVUpn3ROHgAs0Q87g.text: Great place. Good food, good prices. The manager Eduardo is a total pleasure. I wasted money on cigarettes that I didn't get and he went out of his way to make it up to me without reimbursing me for my pack. Good times

x3H1jSTQYiAiaKlxeR45Ng.text: I came here because I'm one food borne illness away from my goal weight!!!  Okay actually I like the food here and since it is tapas style I can put a variety of things in my mouth.  Most of the time I come in here and drink a lot so I can pretend I'm a rich old lady and the Latin staff are my hot pool boys.  That's what I love about firefly's atmosphere!

hZcGIppiETNZ7ifdDLFwoA.text: Excellent service matched with delicious food means a place I would frequent if only I lived in Vegas!  The apple salad with manchego cheese, so crispy, creamy and refreshing!  Eggplant goat cheese cannelloni again with the creamy goodness. Bacon wrapped dates, why mess with a classic, these were our favorite dish! Chicken tinga empanadas, chocolate cherry bread pudding, delish.

K_OnKkrcbfNSHiqmoMtULg.text: This is our go to place every time we visit Vegas. The new location is awesome! Waaaay better than the old location. Seems like there's more room. Tables are spread out and spacious, not how it was cramped and cluttered before. Food is always good! I recommend checking this place out. Best tapas spot!

lLOJRbpk_-yCizu8hQtPpQ.text: BACON WRAPPED DATES!!! that is what you must have! the food here is delicious and the service is great. i love the atmosphere and my favorite drink is the sparking sangria. i can go here and stay for hours to talk and relax. i highly recommend firefly.  must haves again the bacon wrapped dates, the chicken salad, the sparking sangria, and the paella..enjoy!

ARsBaIeiyiOmVlZiYdp10A.text: I use to frequent the old location on Paradise quite a bit but had not been to the new location yet...I like it much better.  The space is bigger and every area feels much more open.  I didn't have any food at this last visit but we did have a couple of pitchers or Sparkling Sangria, still my favorite.  The ambience is great, love the music they play and will go back soon to have some bacon wrapped dates which are exquisite from what I remember.

Vf6s1pZFEUjC_ET4XR6fwQ.text: Larger location with a much larger patio. Service is much more personal and more attentive. The food is much better quality with bigger portions and the alcohol is flowing a lot better. It's obvious Firefly is trying to gain there customer base back. I will continue to be loyal to this amazing restaurant.

uIurPbZVuTPFDgoAANRC-Q.text: We asked for a quiet area for our business dinner and got it. What a fabulous meal! The food was exceptional and affordable. Scallops were perfect, dates were delicious, lamb was exceptional - I highly recommend.

w9Gq4bdOSEp2lgnjZKKfsg.text: Wow!   This place was all around fantastic.   We ordered the red sangria, which was lovely. It had flower petal tastes incorporated...that's a first for me. Never had that flavor in a sangria. It was great. We ordered a couple mojitos as well - they were good, but the sangria just blew em out of the water.  We were vegetarians and I went here after reading someone else's review that said they had vegetarian options. He was right on the money! It had a good number of vegetarian options - and they were willing to customize the almond stuffed dates to make em veggie-friendly as well. And all the dishes were excellent.  Honestly, I'd have given these guys 4.5 stars, but I rounded up cuz the food & drink were so good. The -0.5 stars would have been for 2 things :  1) for loudness. Try asking for outdoor sitting to help with that (it seemed quieter outside). There was a longer wait for outside seating when we went 2) When we did ask to move from inside to outside the waitress insisted that we'd have to close out our bill and then move and re-open a new tab. I get that we'd have a new waiter/waitress (i.e. I don't want someone else getting my tip?) , but as a customer, that should be transparent to me. They should have been able to figure it out between themselves, and leave me out of the picture.  Having said that, this place is a must visit for me now.. I'm going here (and asking for outdoor seating) next time I visit the area!

qQ9G-9CZmprJvdawvunaoA.text: Firefly was fine, but not at all amazing (contrary to its amazingly high yelp rating of 4.5 at the time we came). The sangria was excellent, and my wife got the steak and mushroom skewers and liked them a lot. But everything else we got was ehhhh

JJd3S_k66AGT6E0IeyYQmg.text: So I'm biased, despite the recent bad press here this will always be my favorite spot. The servers are always pleasant and knowledgable and the blueberry mojitos are on point! We came for happy hour and had a pitcher of blue berry mojitos, stuffed dates, baked tetilla, Serrano sliders, fireflys fries, diablo shrimp, and chicken rings empanadas. The empanada was one sliced in half so it was a small portion but the taste was delicious the pitcher lasted us the whole meal (and it was happy hour 50% off drinks) and our server was Gabriel and he was absolutely amazing I recommend you as for him

wJs5tp9mOg1EfA6Gn4HdwA.text: Wanted to try something different and avoid the overpriced touristy restaurants of the Strip.  This place fit the bill.  The food was excellent - so many different choices which was great because two in our party were vegetarian.  We did not have one thing that we did not enjoy.  My husband and I loved the Bacon Wrapped Dates and the Steak and Mushroom Skewers.  Our friends loved the Empanadas and Manchego Mac and Cheese.  We had a bunch of other stuff too - seemed like the plates just kept coming and coming!    We shared two pitchers of Sangria - delicious and just enough to get the warm fuzzies without being over the top.    The service was excellent and food came out promptly and at good intervals so we were never without tapas on the table...but never overwhelmed with too many plates at a time.  Just a great experience.  We will definitely go back again.

_p-TwipJQsBuTNhZGFTDSw.text: A local favorite that has grown to be known by tourist as well. I absolutely love this place. I've tried just about everything on the menu and never been let down. There are some items I simply wouldn't order again but I have never had anything I didn't like. The food comes out very fast! The fresh mojitos and sangrias are also delicious, if you have a group get the pitcher. Only reason I graded a 4 is because of the new location. The old spot seemed more authentic or...idk just a different vibe to it.

023Ky7e017TSsb1gIMgrwA.text: Highly reccomended. Great ambiance, excellent food, great service. This place rocks ! My 14 year old son enjoyed our dinner here immensely. The prices are very reasonable as well.

CzL_JzOYsUcfQOAlDGNQDg.text: Fun atmosphere. Good food. Free parking. (Free valet) They moved a heater towards us because we sat outside. That was very nice of them. Inside the restaurant at 7pm on Friday night was pretty loud. If you want to go somewhere to have a meaningful conversation you might want to go elsewhere depending on the time and day you go there. The food looked and tasted great. I'm definitely going back there again.

MFJNpo-So5INo2EA1FqJaQ.text: Great vairiety of food  This is a great off strip place to head to with a bunch of people  Nice selextion of drinks.    Cold beer, icy glasses  I especially liked the borqueraderos, or something like that.  White anchovies

IFmvbQjCE4unPqeOsldV-g.text: Outstanding!   We have eaten here many times for dinner and love it so much we wanted to have our wedding party here!  Everything was perfect for our group of 25.  Ragina is an excellent coordinator and Manuel and Fernanda were outstanding in taking care of us.  From beginning to end...we couldn't be happier.   Thank you Thank you!

_jcL9BQFf-7TyvBO9viamA.text: We flew in & were looking for something little to eat. We found this place & were excited to try it after reading the reviews ESP about the stuffed dates! We sat down & I bet it took a server ten mins to greet us. We were not only ready with our drink order, but our food order. I had their house infused vodka martini & my husband a Moscow mule. Mine was watered down, remade (I mean stirred as the server said) & then it tasted like cough medicine. My husbands mule he said was good. We ordered the stuffed dates, stuffed peppers, flashed fried patron peppers, roasted pork Empanada, & scallops escargot. The stuffed dates were fine, but not amazing along with everything else except the stuffed peppers....they were good! So I would not go back, but at the end of things they did take off my martini even without asking. I like that, that's the way you want a restaurant to do business! Of course we never did figure out who our server was...we saw three & never one consistently.

9ztdVoFRwd_okXkDKPlYnw.text: Great locals spot, I love anywhere you can share your food. I recommend the spicy shrimp, scallops in garlic butter, filet, dates and ahi tuna tartare.  I also love their blood orange mojitos.  Fun place to go with friends and just off the strip, without the price of the strip.

IFQmHnVJ3sJsmViIwX8TMw.text: The tapas were amazing. Good customer service. Food was a lil slow but overall fairly nice

fg6YEh_oN4U4jf0KIcJvUA.text: A lot of choices. Decent food. The stand out dish was def the bacon wrapped dates. Good spot if you want something off the strip.

3uEA2WwkAw90KJGSNSjH-g.text: Friend and I ate here while visiting from out of state. Just looking for different places that had offered lunch services. After reading the reviews on here we took the chance and glad that we did. The service was great. It was fast. Our waiter Mario had taken our order not long after we sat down and it was great that he kept checking to see if we were okay or needed anything else even after service was picking up. He was great enough to let my friend and I know that if we were to come back for dinner same night to come in early, make reservations to avoid wait time as to they do get busy. I would highly recommend this place if you are in the area.

u6-n5SaPyZRzX2w__BPRPw.text: Will keep this short and sweet. Great place to get either small plates or even an entree. Wanted to try to Paella but ordered so many of the small plates didn;t have room. I was with friends and we all ordered and shared stuff. We loved everything we ordered. Some small plates are priced ok and others a little high. I like this location over the old one. Much bigger, more room, nice bar. Will be a regular here.

SqDGhXbTGg1IYDkdaZ9PLQ.text: Food was good. We were with a group so it was great to try many types of dishes. The mohitos in a pitcher were terrible. We just sent two pitchers back.

3_kdl2UBscvw1dRzsxINEg.text: I'd always been a fan of this place.  We didn't get food poisoning. =D  I love the new location, bigger, cleaner, and nicer!  I'm so happy they opened a new restaurant and closed the other one.  Must try their sangria if you haven't yet.  Everything they serve is so tasty.

_KuF9o3OFyBNQLi-zONMSQ.text: Went to firefly with homies for a bday dinner. Have to say the customer service was on point with them constantly checking up on us. The food was priced well and came out fast. Definitely had some favorites but I feel like if you know what to order this place is bomb. Way better than overpaying at the strip. Would be back for sure.

ygOA5Uyqal0KPOwFhjJu6w.text: Even if you you didn't score 2100 on your  SATs , there is always hope that you can get a good paying job as a valet at even a mediocre place like this and maybe  earn   $ 60 K.a year.Ya'know this aint the Wynn or Caesars but of course they have a valet too even for this small lot. Just  sayin'. As far as the place, this is the new location much improved ambiance, further back from the street, bigger, nicer, cleaner than before. Same menu and maybe a little too friendly waiters. This is primarily a local joint , but visitors have caught on too. It's a tapas bar with some good selections; The standouts; Suffed dates: smoked almonds, blue cheese, dates and awesome sauce. Stuffed peppers: w/ cheese herbs Baby back ribs: fall off the bone tender Tierra Mar skewers ; Surf 'n Turf for us fogies- were recommended but  a bit too many things goin' on for my taste. Summer Salad with heirloom tomatoes- for Vegas OK - but not primo  by west coast standards.Greenhouse stuff , not the aroma you expect. The interior is full of options, inside, outside, bar, tables what ever you like. The best thing is that with a group of people everyone will find something they can own and get behind. Beers , or a pitcher of  white or red sangrias ,you can't beat that for  $ 28- The place beats the pants off the typical Strip crowd, it's easy, and can be quick or slow as you like. Great early or late- you could do a lot worse.  It's more about the company you 're  with than the restaurant IMO- this place will support whatever is you are trying to make of the evening.Salut.

71m5iSpYOw6L6inZ8VDWeg.text: We had a table for 20 on Friday night - it was a pre-party for our wedding the following day. Daniel was our server, and he was AMAZING! We ordered pitcher after pitcher of sangria and mojito (so yummy!). He was on top of everything the whole time. The seafood paella was the highlight for me - but the table was full of tapas and everyone raved about their food. It was my first time at Firefly. I will be back every time I am in town now. Fabulous evening all around.

EhSxkgNlvo-SC83H-z0_mw.text: LOVE this place.  everything we've ordered has been amazing.  we would go here every week if we lived close!  the new location is a lot bigger. there is also a large patio sitting area with some lounge couches too.  the last time we went we received EXCEPTIONAL service.  can't wait to go back, we want to try everything on the menu it is so good :) i honestly think it is my favorite restaurant!

usIl4sJFDDVT2i3drDUhuA.text: This place used to good not sure what happened. Lamb chops were flavorless, soup was bland, and the service was terrible. Gazpacho was the worst! Barely ate anything we ordered. Don't waste your money.

mjFFzT7wrOabPXWAwlq5Uw.text: This place is definitely one of the must go places in Vegas. All their dishes are small so you can try tons of dishes. You have to get the bacon wrapped stuffed dates and the sangria. The steak is huge a good portion and cooked to the proper doneness (medium rare)!! And they start you off on the best note with their delicious compound butter. Atmosphere is loud, fun and exciting! Staff was really good, friendly and helpful, even to my party of 15.

mN9NbqX5MhDiuxQc4u0MJA.text: Came here for a dinner in one of their private rooms. Since I was fasting I needed to eat vegan to which they were very accommodating. The potatoes brava were really good along with the winter veggies. People at the table enjoyed their food. I would recommend

NoXzVahPnAA3Y23H3C7hRA.text: My date and I decided to check out the new Firefly, just a block away from the old one. I enjoyed the spacious and hip interior, along with some ambiant music playing over the restaurant chatter. We didn't check out the bar but we did order some quenching sangrias since they were half off all month long. I'm not the tapas expert but the menu has a lot to choose from. Bacon wrapper dates were my favorite, along with the diablo shrimp and stuffed mushrooms. The staff was very friendly and attentive as well.  I will definitely make a return here very soon!

Heat49KKRWOeeuO6BiPgNQ.text: Fire Fly has an awesome food menu and and even better sangria. The stage is great and helpful Joaquin and Athena are great bartenders. This is must go restaurant and the night time atmosphere is great.

sJWdCXDFjlQpRYYX15nENQ.text: Nice cozy place, great service. Food comes out fast and is consistently delicious. Would definitely recommend. My favorite is the bacon wrapped dates and the sangria by far.

bw71-06yuTtvF3G2-FEX7g.text: My go-to-place when friends visit from out of town.  Bacon wrapped dates, ham & cheese croquetas, shrimp diablo and blood orange mojitos are personal favs.

K53xlxuL-kB4jvrnZpMxlA.text: STAY AWAY! This WAS the best restaurant. Service sucks now, we never even got waited on, we had to keep asking the bar back for things. My chocolate martini tasted off, and I've probably had 1000 from there. Possilby sour milk, but who knows since bartender didn't talk to us once even though we sat there for over an hour. Food was so-so, it's gone downhill. It's so sad, this was my favorite restaurant. I was willing to support them through their transistion of closing additional locations and focusing on their main location but they ruined that. I heard they are closing but have to complete their lease so the employees have already checked out.

qD7MSlT4svkAEkuJ5hTtHw.text: I was there tonight and i really enjoy the food and the service was amazing ....and really fast .....I really recommend this place....,. it's my favor place !!! And the manager was very nice and polite !!!!

f8G0BdFep4ujRWTCTdWd4w.text: I would probably rate it a 4.5. I had been eyeing this place for a couple of weeks and knew that it was a must try. I found a Groupon so I was even more excited. The food and atmosphere was really amazing (a little dark but romantic since I was with my hubby). So comfy/cozy and it wasn't crowded (Tuesday lunch time). The stuffed dates, stuffed mushrooms, chicken skewers, fried shrimp, mac and cheese and pear martini were definitely memorable. I'm coming back next time I'm in Vegas.  The only negative was the dried bread they served as a appetizer but I didn't pay for that lol.

ylx5my9R6Ui7sbO5wZVV5Q.text: Not the best service or nicest staff, but the chicken salad was spectacular, the veggie paella great, and the potatoes with Chipotle sauce delicious. The Chicago roast beef sandwiches weren't good, and neither were the peppers stuffed with cheese, but I have a feeling once you know what to order from this place, it would be fantastic.

CICV9rrqqnbYfF11KQY70w.text: LOVED this place. We got amazing tapas in a lovely setting for a great price with great service. The tuna tartare was outstanding. Definitely get the bacon wrapped dates, and the pork empanadas were to die for. Great ambiance, easy parking, really nice servers. I would recommend making reservations, especially if you're going on a Saturday night as we did. They utilize Open Table for online reservations, so it's super easy. I really wish this place had a location in my city.

opwDpGjubzzntER3uEfIow.text: What a beautiful place! Delicious food! Thank you for having vegan options! The staff, especially GM Carlos, was so friendly and accommodating! One of my best experiences in Las Vegas so far!!

x-fW2xbpV3nSan0YyXb2YQ.text: Just ehhhhh. Every time I am here I want everything to be just has great as the Sangria and I am always disappointed. The only thing I really love is the parm fries, but on occasion they are way to salty and stale. But I love the atmosphere, by atmosphere I mean the Latin concepts and hustle and bustle of the staff. it needs to be bigger with a better floor design. It feels musty and dirty most of the time.  I want to love this place but I just can't.

ibkzUEpscK8Pv97GyWXxHw.text: This place is worth checking out. It provides a comforting & spacious atmosphere plus delicious tapas & sangria. Come with a group and order many items collectively so that everyone can try a multitude of dishes (as one would at a dim sum restaurant). I recommend the bacon wrapped dates, shrimp diablo, lamb, skewers with filet mignon/shrimp/ chorizo, fries, octopus/potato dish, mac n cheese, and of course the red sangria :) Service was good. Expect around a total of $30/person in order to leave very satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friends, tapas, and sangria in a very comforting atmosphere:)

XwjkdcI-iwrUte8EY4BVhw.text: So much fun! This was my first time here, and I'm glad my friend made a reservation because this place was packed! I enjoyed the white sangria more than the red, but both were good. I'm told the champagne sangria is great and I will probably get it next time. I came here with my husband and 5 friends, this place is great for a group, because you can try many of there tapas this way. The bacon wrapped dates were my husband's favorite, and the group as a whole. I really loved the apple manchego salad, it was surprising how much I enjoyed it. It was so fresh, crisp, and nutty. I will definitely get it next time. The filet was delicious, I thought the Mac n cheese was just ok. The mushroom pastries were lightly crispy, but the saucy mushrooms on top we're just ok. Calamari good, stuffed peppers yummy. Padron peppers that were flash fried were a table favorite, I thought they were good but I might have enjoyed them more with more lemon. Was impressed with the stuffed mushrooms which was disappointing. The heirloom tomato salad wasn't very good. The butter lettuce, vinagrette, and tomatoes were yummy, but the creamy cheese they slathered on top was just too much. It overwhelmed the dish and ruined it for me. All in all I'm extremely excited to go back. I will definitely be getting Sangria (get the pitcher), filet, apple salad, dates, and stuffed red peppers again. Hopefully I'll leave some room to try some new things and dessert!  I took away a star because our waitress was kind of snobby, and seemed to be in a "wish I was anywhere but here" kind of mood. I'm assuming because we were in a group, they automatically added gratuity, and I don't think she was very deserving of it. Having been a waitress, I completely understand adding gratuity to parties (I wish they did that when I worked at Applebee's'), but I feel that some waiters take advantage of that and slack on service. I will return though!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum-o

D6xNZ_bmXmhTCwSIp94PHQ.text: Went there with my fiance, and we both loved it. We probably like the stuffed dates best. Also had the mushroom tartlet, stuffed peppers, and ahi tuna skewers. w57av2a-bWsfRnRIkUcHyg.text: Stuffed Bacon Wrapped Dates - 'nuff said!  Even of all the nice, fancy restaurants Las Vegas has to offer this one is always at the top of my list and mostly always on my mind when I dream about yummy dishes!

e4_SQkLWyP78Z7bT4ABSqg.text: We look forward to eating at Firefly on almost every Vegas trip. Love the tortilla a la espanola.

rFPP5uDmnLjp066IvYfJyQ.text: Best tapas I've ever had. The infused vodka is delish as well. Service was great. Delivery of the food (staggered) was perfect.

t_KOKKI4iOx9vX1QTTckUQ.text: Great food. Good selection but not too much. I had friends from out of town and they really enjoyed trying and sharing everything. No one was disappointed with their selections. Service was impeccable. Will definitely go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peppers and scallops!

17EF07zyJ3-eNC85CBnz3g.text: Amazing food & service! If you're looking for a good time and incredible food, this is definitely a place to try. Our group couldn't get over how delicious each plate tasted! My favorite? Definitely the mac & cheese and the chicken empanadas. Absolutely one of the best tapas meals I've had.

xfjg79sYKH4VE2oql8HU6Q.text: 3rd visit and still amazing!  Ordered almost the entire menu and loves everything.  Lamb meatballs and stuffed dates are off the charts.

RIRn06h-FEShguevxiCZxw.text: Another good place in Vegas that is way off strip. Been to vegas a bunch lately and man the food is just overpriced and terrible on the strip. Been investigating a bunch of places like this, and Firefly gets the thumbs way up.

POaQYkqSkgvlMC2JsjCOQw.text: Always an excellent evening as anticipated.  I took friends here that came in town.  They wanted a different type of dining experience.   They too became instant fans.

crzOBfZ-SzRc0VzjMimb6w.text: This restaurant was amazing. First of all we completely forgot what tapas was for a second and ordered too much food. However, it did not matter. Everything was cooked to perfection. My favorite was the garlic shrimp, steak and mushroom skewers, and lamb chops. We also had vegetables, a salad with green beans, tuna tar tar, fried calamari and a couple of other things. I have in to the sangria with white wine and it was delicious. I have a tapas place in Chicago that I love and this superseded my standards. The staff was really nice and friendly. Our waitress seemed a little timid but she took care of everything for us. Amazing. I will visit here every time I come to Vegas.

X68rry-37gAKNtD0yS2ELg.text: Came through after reading all the amazing reviews with a group of 12 people in town for a conference. The service was outstanding and the food was even better. The ribs fell off the bone and the Mac and cheese was killer. One of the tapas we ordered came out very late, but the staff took care of us and even brought out dessert for one of our party who had a birthday. If you only have one night in town and have a group of people I HIGHLY recommend Firefly.  Also we let them know we needed separate checks ahead of time and it was no problem.

LkGSObjz0ezF8rklaaWBKQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. I come here for every birthday or any special occasions. The service is top notch and the restaurant has a nice and dark ambiance. The food is always amazing and I've tried every dish on the menu. They also have great sangria, which you can order by the cup or pitcher. It does get busy, so a reservation is recommended. The private parking lot does get filled up, so you may be circling around to find a spot. You can also easily fill up on the tasty butter and bread. I came here last week with a reservation for a birthday party and we were sat down right away.   Food: The main staples that you should always order are 5+ orders of Stuffed Dates, Tierra y Mar Skewers, and the Steak & Mushroom Skewers. We also ordered the Seafood Paella, Chorizo Clams, and the Ceviche. They do bring out the food as it becomes ready, so if your party orders different dishes, they'll come out at different times. The Paella takes a long time to cook, so you'll most likely finish all the other dishes before it comes out. It's also a huge dish that can probably feed 4 people.  Dessert: Tres Leches is the best Tres Leches you'll ever eat. The tart strawberry with the chocolate shavings go perfectly with the soaked milky cake.

a3JhVyG8f7wyUVMESktPjQ.text: I had the pleasure of swinging by Firefly for an early lunch yesterday. Based on the building and parking lot (which is private), they must get incredibly busy later in the day, but at 11:30, I was the 2nd table seated.   I was seated right away and everyone was friendly. The service was great throughout. The waiter immediately brought bread and butter. The butter was honey and some type of pepper. I don't do bread, but it looked amazing and the sweet/spicy butter was great.   The waiter recommended 2 items and they were exactly what I had my eye on! So I got the stuffed dates and Tierra y mar from the Hot Tapas menu. Both were awesome. The dates were almonds, dates and then bacon-wrapped and had a red wine reduction and blue cheese on top. The Tierra y Mar was grilled chorizo, shrimp and steak skewers with salsa. Delicious! I will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tierra Y Mar Skewers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped Stuffed Dates
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

ACH21CBQZCR-OcUD3ZttVg.text: The stuffed dates are my absolute favorite along with the red wine sangria! One of my favorite places to go to. They also have a great happy house so check that out !

1QOrzCsOqbQdNWz1xvEbJQ.text: Talk about a surprise hit, wow. We were staying at the Elara in Vegas and were craving Spanish food, paella in particular, so after a brief search we settled on Firefly for delivery to the hotel. We ordered bacon wrapped dates, fried goat cheese, lamb chops, spicy aioli potatoes, the mixed paella and the desert sampler. After delivery charge and a $10 tip to the driver, the bill came to $100 and was worth every penny.  The flavor combinations, freshness of ingredients, execution of the dishes, and even presentation (yes even delivered) was incredible. The lamb chops were perfectly cooked, balanced salt pepper and herb profile with a great reduction served on perfect lentils. The bacon wrapped dates were decadent and creamy, with a nut in the center to give it crunch and bring all ingredients together. The fried goat cheese was spectacular, lots of spices and some crunch for texture. The star was the mixed paella, seafood, chorizo, chicken, veggies, rice, all perfectly cooked in a broth that gave the dish all the accents of home cooked Spanish food that I loved to eat while visiting my wifes family on various holidays.  I'd highly recommend anyone craving tapas, or great paella, give Firefly serious consideration. If you're at the Elara, its the perfect place since you'll have leftovers for sure.

K2zUEqEB89K-NCsxQRi6cg.text: Our 2nd time here and we definitely recommend it!  It's one of those places where you could close your eyes, and point to anything on the menu, and end up very satisfied with a tasty dish

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari, lamb, &amp; beef/mushroom skewers.

9a7RoeVEVlXYYlbcsDTbyA.text: Super good food with a lot of vegan options. My fav is the vegan carrots with cream cheese. Fun place to go dancing especially on Latin nights Fridays.

LLkCYIsxuR22xhDq8S0cEg.text: Sat outside. It was not busy :) Firefly's sangria was okay... Scallops were so tasty and the smell was intoxicating. Best item on their dessert platter was the chocolate tres leches cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop &#34;Escargots&#34;
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Platter, Fruit and Cheese Plate, White Wine Sangria
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red wine Sangria.

uP7yx3LlEoLFVa-nZr6zvg.text: Hipster gourmet with a small bite...and a large price.  It's easy for two people to spend $50 bucks on topas treats and leave kinda hungry.  The items we shared: the cod, lamb, Chicago sliders, and chicken skewers were all tasty for sure.  The service was friendly enough and attentive, but the time from order to table was not very efficient.  The chicken skewers from order to table was approx. 25 minutes.  Eventually I just had to ask to check on my order when a food expeditor asked.  They also use a team approach for food service and not just one server.  All in all, it was a tasty experience but an awful time suck.  Plan on spending at least $75-100 to fill your appetite.  I do recommend utilizing one of their two happy hours where the prices are much more reduced.

DMY78DVpjunh9MgRfsARnA.text: I absolutely love the food at Firefly! I have yet to have a meal that did not exceed my expectations!! Cool atmosphere & vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The calamari is always on point! Delicious

yLyf-u3DsiPZafxDFwVBXw.text: This is probably favorite Latin bar/restaurant! The environment is welcoming and Manny our bar tender was awesome. The tapas are delicious

LpgPs1Ai5Pe_uk4WLC-Uaw.text: I know this place for it's Paella. I've dined here a few times just for this dish. It is huge and the price will not gauge you especially since you have share this dish. The menu states it can be shared between 2-4 people, uh no. It could be shared between 3-8 people. It could feed more people if you are ordering tapas as well. Be aware that the paella takes at least 40 minutes to prepare so relax, order some tapas, drink some of their fruity sangria's and enjoy your time. The staff at Firefly will keep you filled one way or another. And if you're feeling daring, there are nights you can go for some salsa dancing. When the weather is beautiful, their patio area at night becomes festive with music and spirited people. I've had the pleasure of tasting half of their menu so to give my take on all would leave a lengthy review. There hasn't been a dish on their tapa menu I haven't enjoyed and same goes with their paella dishes. The only item I didn't care for was their Tres Leches Cake. They have fabulous desserts that I would choose before every having to try this cake. I am cake lover but this was not sitting well on my palate. A great thing about this place is their gluten free menu. There are many choices on it, so your friends who can't eat Gluten won't feel left out.

PUOb3wbdcmuPGokF9RaSdQ.text: If you have a big group, and you're craving some good Spanish food, then this is the right restaurant for you. Make sure you make reservation ahead of time and order the Spanish rice ahead of time since it takes about 40 minutes to make. The tapas are all good, except it's a bit salty. I'm not an expert at Spanish cuisine so I don't know if this is typical or not. We ordered a lot of other dishes and I didn't take all the pictures. Besides the rice, I thought the lamb chops were great. There's a lot of #Thinsulin approved dishes as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vIpIiA5Lrh9VaDBzcVa8kw.text: First time  Struggling to find a place with gazpazcho. Finally found it.  That and more was delicious.  ELENA was amazing

IeDNtPGQpwxmi7qO770kMw.text: Food  Pulpo Asado   Nose of skillet potato with a hint of sea brininess and tomato. Octopus had grilled nose, very gently salty and spicy palate with soft consistency with only a hint of chewiness. Potato was skillet with skin. Smokey nose, a bit of saltiness with skin crunchiness. Some sauteed small-diced pepper, tomato, and green onion added accent. I think potato was unnecessary. 4.25/5. 4.5/5 without potato.  Merguez  Nose of feta cheese and tomato-pepper confit. Gamy lamb nose on the sausage, followed by medium saltiness and high black-pepperiness. Feta gave accent and tomato-pepper confit gave sourness fresh counterbalance. Eat them together. 4.5/5.  Service  Half bar half trendy bistro. Bar open seating. Food delivery is as authentic Spanish as the tapasAlcohol service. 4/5.  Ambience  A trendy bistro for a nice getaway. 4/5.  Overall  A delicious food at a crowded trendy place. 4.5/5.

Ni_tnBNFcpgJMlThxWxDEQ.text: One of my favorite hot spots in Vegas, recommend the bacon wrapped dates and the clams!!!!!

kiv35G_b-dsU3HAHE40l7w.text: What a gem. Came with 15 people last night and ate a bunch of tapas, mojito jars and paella, and it came out to $45 pp. food was yummy and service was friendly. Nice ambience too. Ample free parking in the back. If you're looking for a bar food hangout with a twist or dinner place with work folks this will do it. Will definitely be back next time in Vegas. I highly recommend the traditional mojito. It's light and refreshing. Thanks

FGsnOs5jtsrf9CGVzElJWA.text: Eat on the bar with a friend and was really great. Every dish we ordered was excellent, great drinks and great service. Well done! Thanks Anna for the recommendation.

0rfuFkQISFqVKdMjHk_43Q.text: I like Firefly. I wished to dine here more often when I am in Vegas. The tapas are all yummy and the Happy Hours offerings are generous and with varieties. My favorite is the Dates and Sangria pitcher.   Friendly service and spacious restaurant off the beaten path like the stripe.

Ghk9RzAuAqTKaf6za3Vz6Q.text: Good ambiance for off the strip restaurant. Some portions extra small even considering it was tapas. Great tasting food and fast service considering it was Saturday night.

TMn_c345Y47VT1IvCnml1w.text: Vacationing in Las Vegas was wonderful especially because we found this great Tapas restaurant. We were a table of 4 and got a seat right away since we got there at 6:30pm on a Saturday. Expect a wait if you go after 6:30pm, but it's worth the wait to get a drink and relax while you wait. We started with a pitcher of Red Sangria, which was able to serve each of us a glass and a half (we ordered a pitcher of White Sangria after that was gone). I'm not sure which I liked better. Both were delicious and the red was a little dryer which was nice since we had it with dinner and it complimented the food nicely.   We had a friend with us that is allergic to shellfish and made sure we told our server before hand that way the server can tell him if he ordered anything for himself that had shellfish in it and he wasn't aware.   The dates wrapped in bacon were one of my favorites as well as the tuna tar tar. Yummy! The flavors were like fireworks on my palate exploding with flavor and making me want more. The dishes came out quickly and even after ordering so much our final bill was not as high as we all thought it would be. 4 people ordering dishes like crazy with 2 pitchers of margarita's around $200.   In my opinion the food was better than our favorite Tapas restaurant in Boston, MA and the prices were a lot better as well. Service was great and ambiance was perfect. With it being so big I thought it would get loud, but you don't notice it when you have good food, pitchers of sangria and wonderful company. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mushroom deliciousness
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dates wrapped in bacon (sweet and savory combo that can&#39;t be beat)
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tuna tar tar (beautiful)

vi0yTyavZR15uqqfldaNug.text: How lucky am I to have a dear friend who is a long time resident of LV?  I'm in town for a few days and she suggested we meet for lunch at Firefly.  Over 50 visits here and I had never before heard of it.  This place is Great!  Indoor and outside seating with a very large variety of food selection which include made to order paella.  Service was very good and the prices are quite reasonable.

gq993rgZW7a2C5aLQCubLA.text: Absolutely love the food and service here . Everyone is always so welcoming and attentive to our needs. We are regulars here now ! And probably will be for a long time

Pl-wWcZdm6gXAvq7BviHIQ.text: Delicious!! Fair price with good portion for 4 of us :D We ordered one pitcher of sangria, stuffed dates, lamb chops, tierra y mar skewers, babyback ribs, tuna tartare, fried calamari, and seafood paella for about $150 including tax and tips!! Good customer service!! Enjoy the atmosphere and environment!!!
