16VA8oCuKt4VQWcyDSn_sA.text: One of the best meals in Vegas. Delicious tapas, and great vegetarian options. Such friendly service and great value for money. I'm a huge fan and we stop by every time we're in Vegas.

xu0PevhFH0E1Y5prdlATqA.text: Arrived around 7 on a Monday. Very busy and only got busier. A very noisy place. Waitress was very nice. Had the patatas bravas, camarones a la diabla, tortilla espanola and the scallops.   Scallops are served like escargot. Mehta. Too hot, the butter and garlic overpower the scallop. Pan seared would be much better.   The patatas were very good and the sauce slightly spicy and tasty.   The tortilla is something that varies widely from place to place. This one is on the eggy side. This one was a bit underseasoned, as it needed a bit of salt. But the sauce was very good and helped an otherwise too bland dish.   The camarones were highly recommended by the waitress, and did not disappoint. Slightly spicy and sweet. Delicious.   The Rioja wine was very drinkable. The 9 ounce pour seemed a lot larger than 9 oz.. It paired well with the potatoes and shrimp.   This place isn't in the same league as Julian Serrano at the Aria, but definitely worth the visit.

fxNZNiYcUtkVl6WIPuNY5Q.text: The best little place off the strip!!! Try the grilled octopus!! It was amazing along with everything else! Great service, reasonable prices, and delicious food. Must try for Vegas!

RfkHuoka_4JKWpnUupFlbA.text: This place is great every time! Their food is great and the service even better... great place to host a birthday dinner! Their strawberry mojito pitcher my favorite!

WOVLnV2IQ-JmNMiWgk9jgA.text: It was my second time at this restaurant.  Went with a party of 4.  We ordered about 8 or 9 items.  Although the server said they will time it so we don't end up with everything at once, that is exactly what happened.  My first time was more enjoyable since I didn't have to rush to finish everything while the food was still hot.  Overall a good restaurant.  Hopefully next time, we won't be rushed.

hRIgY9LCJEPvJ-u3ccE_3A.text: Good food, drinks, and dancing? Firefly is your spot. This place is the spot to go to if you wanna dance, get your drink on and have a good meal off the strip. i would make reservations because they get packed. Service could be a little better, but overall i was happy.   I loved my eggplant tapa--i highly suggest this. the eggplant is cooked so well, and the filling is creamy.  the patatas are a must get too, a good snack to share with a spicy kick.  the mussels are okay, tasty for sure but i feel ive had better.   everything is reasonably priced, and theres options here for everyone--veggie and meat eaters alike!

D1RjsucXRMyKRQKU3Zrniw.text: Terrible service. Super slow. The waitress even let my ex come over to our table. We asked for bread everyone else had and I was told no. Use to be my favorite spot but now they don't even have professionalism.

ztgK_wXdYbzTA_9TSfg2DA.text: One of our off the strip go to restaurants when we're in Las Vegas. The paella takes about 40 min but it's worth the wait!  2nd only to paella in Spain.

u5718axKGDjF1NfFd33E7Q.text: Great food. Really wonderful, especially if you consider the price.   Ambiance- relaxed, pleasant. Fancy enough to go before a night out. Laid back enough for a casual meal.  Service- wonderful service! Waiters are not pushy, very willing to answer questions and give suggestions. Personable and fast. Clears dishes quickly, refills waters, great overall.   Food: lots of vegetarian options. I hear the meaty ones are good, too.  - Paella: large cast iron skillet- looking thing, which serves 3-6, not 2-4, was tasty and flavorful. *** Really does take about 40min., so order it first.   - Manchego mac & cheese: creamy & cheesy. Not overly salty  - Tomato soup: how come I can't get that flavor at home? Rich and smooth, just the right balance of tomato-sweet-salty.   - Mushroom puff pastry thing: creamy. With mushrooms that weren't overlooked- great texture.   -  Veggie empanadas:  crispy crust, and a filling of who-knows-what deliciousness. Outside wasn't too thick, and the filling was plentiful.   Sangria- 2 kinds: sparkling white or traditional red. Both were tasty, but most ppl preferred the red.  Check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts

7iZOKRGwwNNpHQU-mIHAhw.text: My wife and I absolutely love Tapas- so when we got to Vegas this was an absolute must and they definitely didn't disappoint. We started with a pitcher of Sangria that we were able to both get 3 cups out of- so that's a super win. As for the menu, it ranges from Cold, Hot, Seafood, and Meat Tapas so we were in Heaven.    We started with Some Shrimp ceviche that was incredible. Next we tried the Stuffed peppers that were solid. Being that we look Chicago style Italian beef sandwich with had to try their version in the tapas form and boy are we glad we did. It was three mini-mini size hoagie Italian beef that were delicious. We also tried the stuffed mushroom and the empanadas that were good.   All and All we had a blast here and definitely would come back. All the food and drinks came at reasonable price so don't be alarmed.

kRFFehoZ-XEYbaAxr5k3FA.text: I love tapas foods and drink in here. Also the price not expensive and about the portion is ok. We're been here last night for 2 ppl and we're order 5 menu that enough. And foods come fast too.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yrZ83FlxnEtVX0u2HRbvEQ.text: When you get off the plane in Vegas your first stop has to be Firefly Tapas. Order a few dishes per person and share. We did not have anything that wasn't over the top delicious. When asked which one was our favorite it was like asking which child you love the best. Oh and they have all these different flavors of Mojitos that will keep you cool in the 108 degree weather. They use fresh ingredients not syrups so the flavors are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oaUFwgsNDj25uoEPMSnPVw.text: I came here on my last visit to Vegas with pretty high expectations given the 4.5 star rating, reviews, and photos. I love tapas so I was excited to give this place a try! I will say that half the tapas we ordered were pretty good and the other half just didn't do it for me.  Here is what we ordered:  Chicken Skewers $8.50 - These were served cold and the meat was dry. I did like the garlic cream sauce so that saved this tapa even though I was disappointed with the cold meat.  Shrimp Ceviche $9.50 - The presentation wasn't all that but the taste was fresh, lemony, and delicious. I was surprised since it didn't look like it would have much flavor (see pic)  Tierra y Mar Skewers $11 - Thank you for serving up a nice piece of tender filet mignon as it should be. The shrimp and chorizo added a nice flavor to this skewer along with the salsa verde.  Apple & Manchego salad $6.50 - I love manchego cheese and apples but this salad definitely lacked flavor, nothing too special about. It was missing something but if you like manchego and apples that's exactly what this tapa is about.   Albondigas $7 - If you like Chef Boyardee then you will like these meatballs because that's exactly what they taste like. I wasn't too fond of the flavor and it was a disappointment.  They do serve complimentary garlic bread with a sweet almond butter. This was definitely addicting stuff! It was sooooo good we ordered another round.  My girlfriend ordered the Sangria and had to send it back because it was overly sweet. Our waiter was very kind about replacing her drink. So just FYI the sangria is pretty sweet!  Overall this place has reasonable prices but the tapas could be hit or miss. I'm glad I could check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas - Meh! Tastes like Chef Boyardee
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple and Manchego salad - Not too bad
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tierra y Mar Skewers  - Pretty good!

rxqZO_ssKRLy5mSXlbNNOQ.text: Been to Vegas many times, and never had a chance to try Firefly until recently. Sadly, the food was not worth the wait.  Sangria - No. Not strong enough, and way too little fruit flavor for a drink that claims to have been marinated for 3 days. Did feel like the pitcher was never-ending, just never-ending sugar juice.  Stuffed dates - No. Recommended by server. Tasted like BBQ sauce.  Stuffed peppers - No. I prefer the Peruvian version. This was a bit overly cheesy (and I love cheese).  Pulpo asado - Eh. I've had better.  Camarones a la diabla - No. Tasted Chinese, and not spicy at all.  Albondigas - Eh. 6 meatballs for $7. Could have had 3 In-N-Out cheeseburgers.  Lamb chops - Now we're talking. The 2 chops for $12 were very tender, and my favorite of the night (and I don't even eat lamb!).  Ambiance is not conducive to holding a conversation, anything romantic, or close to relaxing. It's probably easier to hold a conversation at Chinese dim sum restaurants than it is here, as noise is coming at you at all angles. I could barely hear my BF across the table. The only good thing was the service; my glass was always full!  Needless to say, I'll save my stomach space for Vegas meals elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb, meatballs, pulpo, shrimp diabla, dates, stuffed peppers, and complimentary bread

z0_sd3cTZnUC4V3IoNajxQ.text: Even on a Monday this place is great for after work drinks or dates or just come with friends the vibe very hip they have a bar in the middle and an outside patio area .the dress is dressy casual in case the ladies were wondering ..the servers are great very attentive and friendly and the food is perfect small bites of a variety !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan to die for with almond cookie and Nutella bites !!!

_G9ZuqqbvlT1MePM34Hdcw.text: A solid four! food was great, we tried several tapas style plates and they were all tasty. We sat at the bar and all the bartenders were quick to assist and friendly.   The ambience Friday night was fun and lively, they also have an outdoor patio with a Dj playing Latin music and salsa after 1030 on Fridays. Everyone dances outside... I would definitely recommend!

MqmLzU8LjhsSiy_8ecijrA.text: Rushed in for lunch during a convention and had a delightful experience. The food was great and our bartender Skylar was great!  He totally hustled to get our food and drinks out in a timely manner and made the most delish mojitos ever!  Skylar totally rocks and I look forward to returning

AAln-lPWsCkJAzFPk0dFdA.text: Was taken here for dinner, and it was pretty good. The food was great, the staff was nice, but a little slow on service. They had salsa music playing inside, but we were outside eating and talking. This place is a bit out of the way from the strip, so you may or may not make your way over here. However, if you are willing to take the ride over, or are in the area, I highly recommend you go! Great tapas, great serving sizes and a great atmosphere. Would visit again.

u8NQmDUnQCRRyrSXPEDTxA.text: Came here with my family on a Wednesday night. There is a couple parking spaces available in the front, and more in the back of the restaurant as well.  Atmosphere - The atmosphere is really nice. Modern decor and dim lighting.   Service - We were greeted promptly and were seated within a couple of minutes. The servers were friendly and came by every so often to refill our waters and ask how the food was.  Food - Oh my god. Everything was so on point. We ordered a lot of food, but my favorites would have to be the Babyback ribs and the Apple and manchego salad. The salad was delicious; it had just the right amount of dressing to counter the sweetness of the apples. The ribs were also amazing! The meat was cooked perfectly and the sauce was drool-worthy. Everything was perfect. The portions are decently sized, allowing you to order a variety of tapas to try. And just to add on, the mixed paella was just as tasty. There was a perfect proportion of seafood, chicken, and rice. The flavors were incredible. I would highly recommend this place. Yum yum yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed paella!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple and manchego salad!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Babyback rib!

lNOCaK43Ca2TrAjP0ZWKvA.text: Love love love firefly !  I love all the different kinds of food they have to choose from....the waters are really nice and friendly and the food comes out quick ...... Thank you for great dining every time we come ..... And for anyone that might be second guessing about going because you might not find something for the little ones...We have 4 kids and they find something to eat every time we go .

_CKBlqfqgnovin9C7uG-HA.text: Amazing service from Alejandro! Bacon wrapped dates, blood orange mojito, green apple salad, tuna tar tar, empanadas all AMAZING!

hW6zPNa9g-75m9FhFvVKsg.text: I had my wedding dinner at Firefly on Saturday.  I must say they are not the best at returning phone calls and emails and I was ready to take off a star for that but...  They made me look so good on Saturday! Service was absolutely impeccable, thank you Ana and Neo!  All of my guests raved about the food and even drinks.  Lol seeing their faces when they found octopus in paella was priceless. Btw we ordered 4 course menu which started with bread and butter with olives, followed by stuffed dates ( the bomb!!!) and some kind of delicious meatball tapas. Garden salad was generously sprinkled with pine nuts, yum.  For entrees we had were ribeye( tender and delicious), roasted chicken and paella. Tres leches cake for dessert. All served family style  All of the above for $40 pp plus drinks, way below the banquet prices everyone else charges( by Vegas standards).  Highly recommend for events and will come back next time I am in Vegas

5MAaA0cHSd3HOtzrJr27yQ.text: Oh, Firefly...I wanted to give you five stars, I REALLY did. After reading amazing reviews, I attempted to make a reservation though Open Table. The time provided was a little later than I wanted so I called the restaurant directly. The hostess hung up on me the first call. She flat out told me the second call that they weren't accepting any more reservations for the evening. I wish I'd gotten your name, love, because your hosting/customer service skills are lacking.  Er, okay. I logged back into Open Table and booked a table for 2 at 9pm no problem. Kind of made me wonder if they try to lighten up the later reservations so the host staff can get cut? Anyway, we arrived at nine on the dot. And we sat. For fifteen minutes. Staring at an empty two top. Which we were eventually seated at.  We had a server...who took our order and who we pretty much never saw again until we got the check. Odd, There was an "assistant server"...some young girl who seemed annoyed to be there. No smile, no initiative to refill my boyfriend's Sprite.   The food! The food! Good, great, awesome! (5/5)  The service (crying emoji face) Stop the madness. If management doesn't oversee this closely, they will crash and burn. Good food only carries you so far. Especially in a town with endless options.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy reasonable!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gPtZVk-gC-SAs7TdDDTC2g.text: I love Firefly. I have been to many tapas spots, but none can compare to the fire that is Firefly (Cheesy? Yes. Accurate? Also, yes).  I would say this is the best low-key tapas spot in Vegas. And no, I am not including anything with an address on LVBLVD (read: low-key). The menu is reasonably priced for small-plates, and the waitstaff is both attentive and knowledgeable about their food and drinks. I especially love the dessert sampler, which comes with approximately 5-6 desserts for tasting (the Lemon-Berry tarte is my favorite!). In addition, the Firefly fries are delicious, I love the ceviche of shrimp, mushroom tart, and the Manchego mac'n' cheese is to die for! The fried calamari is also a win here.   I hope that you go, and experience the love of tapas that is Firefly. Yes, they had issues. Yes, those have been resolved.   Go. Love the tapas.

kU4qGBNRS7piT46eKh33ag.text: We came here for brunch on our first day in town and got a seat at the bar. We tried a couple mojitos (which I wish were on the all you can drink option menu!) and my favorite was my blood orange one. I tried the white house sangria and it was a little tart for me. The bartender was great and gave us suggestions on his favorite dishes on the menu. We ended up ordering solely off the regular menu instead of getting brunch and got the tuna tartare, the shrimp in garlic butter sauce, chicken tinga empanadas, and the filet/shrimp/chorizo skewers. While we waited, they brought out bread and butter and the butter was so amazing I could have just made a meal of the bread and butter. My boyfriend's favorite dish was the tuna, but mine was the shrimp - so flavorful. The empanadas were really good and I would get them again. I wasn't as big of a fan of the skewers, some of the meat was a little tough and the sauce wasn't my favorite. I will definitely make this a stop on our next trip!

EHZ-HsD5cRpi2u3Ani3IaQ.text: This restaurant was Amazing and not on the Strip. The food was fabulous and our server Alejandro was amazing..... I love how all the servers worked as a team to bring out the food..... Baked Goat Cheese, Tuna Tatars, White Sparking Sangria, we had so many wonderful dishes I cannot even name them all..... it was definitely worth the drive

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our crew @ Firefly

mZ2--o0jMKIzq9nezLWB3Q.text: A cozy establishment with a great assortment for myself, the vegetarian, and my meat-eater boyfriend. Between us we ordered, the roasted beets and persimmon salad, Firefly fries, albongigas and Chicago beef bocadillos and either of us had a complaint and enjoyed every bite. We are moving to Vegas and this is the first comeback spot we have found. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojitos on point

OH5_uWe6eNwFkn3_1nmVrg.text: Traditional tapas dishes with flamenco music and patio dining? Why didn't I come to Firefly sooner?!* Sampled several dishes, was mostly pleased with the flavors and quality. Servers are professional but are assigned far too many tables, and I imagine it only got worse- they were considerably busier by the time we left.  BOQUERONES ($7): 4  tasty toasts with a mix of compatible toppings including anchovies, avocado, roasted red peppers, and a lemony drizzle. Bright and fresh!  BEET SALAD ($7.50): roasted red and gold beets with vin-dressed greens and pecan crusted goat cheese. Definitely my kind of dish. STUFFED DATES ($6.5): wayyy too rich for me, but I can see why they're a favorite for others STUFFED PEPPERS ($8.5): piquillos with mozz and garlic cream cheese, in a tomato sauce with crispy fried and fresh green onions. Think of a classy version of jalapeno poppers, but with a different kind of pepper. Almost too cheesy for me, but good. PULPO ASADO ($10):  I didn't like this at all.  Potatoes and tomatoes were not enough to save the unappealing octopus. Menu claims it is grilled but seemed boiled or overcooked, unfavorable texture. ALBONDIGAS ($7): dish of mini meatballs in sherry sauce, basic but successful. MERGUEZ ($10): two links of spicy lamb sausage with a heap of roasted red peppers and two tiny slices of bread. Sausage and peppers had a good kick to them, but the lack of accompanying bread made it hard to enjoy this dish without chopping it up and rearranging like a stir fry.  Difficult to give a rating: I usually round down but this 3.5 is going up because I definitely want to come back for paella and sangria.   * Rhetorical question: their negative reputation precedes them, unfortunately. Lots of locals still associate the restaurant with their old (but serious) salmonella outbreak from 2013, but if you look up the stats on SNHD, they've received As on all inspections for nearly two years. It might be time to give them a try again.

G4RImylsNIV2AGXTn3_JKQ.text: Excellent service and delicious food!   We avoided going to the Vegas buffets and decided to eat here instead.   I don't think you could go wrong with any of the dishes! It's that good!  Just to give you an idea, I came with two friends and we ordered 8 small plates. We were full!  I would definitely come back!

RnFoPIMWInqAfmdTQQG_nw.text: must say it was totally worth it coming here for dinner!!!! I would totally come back!!!!

gEI0pq0P5bu9KJevTFFQ5g.text: Everything was just awesome. Food came out promptly and the drinks were very good. We got there during happy hour which was an added bonus.

NS6wP-5CU4PPcim8_jq9BQ.text: This is one of the best places I've been to in Vegas! The menu, the food and service are excellent! Can't say enough good !!

s4JyZdfeWCuARqZCsj9XQQ.text: I died and went to tapas heaven!!!  OMG the pork empanadas gave me a foodgasm. You must get the stuffed dates.  Think candied bacon with a sweet creamy filling. Paired with a yummy sangria this. Place will be visited twice while I'm here on vacation.

Y-c2Yij9LBeddKKjvpM_dg.text: Firefly has delicious and varied tapas (small plates), which is a great way to do dinner. Their sangria is refreshing and cold on a hot day, with the ice that some reviewers complain about adding a bit of welcome hydration.  But one of the best reasons to come here is for the lovely shaded patio just off the Strip. For a city known for its great weather during much of the year, it's surprisingly difficult to find outdoor seating in Las Vegas.

dgdTZtbtJ_p_iRFnuM7b1w.text: Oh, FireFly. How i love thee, let me count the ways!  Every time I decide to try a new restaurant in town, I almost immediately regret not going to my faithful FireFly.   I've been a regular for about a year now, and I'm never disappointed. I love the tapas style. Tapas meaning small plate, If you didn't already know that. It's great to share a few plates with a friend or scarf a few down all to yourself.   I'm a vegetarian but I have no problem with options here!  Some of my favorite plates include; -Apple and manchego salad- scrumptious and light  -Artichoke toasts- a delicious little snack  -Veggie Empanada- Pretty filling  -Warm spinach salad- healthy and yummy  And of course the Manchego Mac and Cheese if you can afford the calories!    Not to mention the pistachio gelato! To freakin die for.   As for drinks, the sangria's, both red and white are delicious.  My personal faves are "The new girl" a red vodka drink infused with a hint of jalapeno! Yum!  And the "cherry mule" a Moscow mule with cherry flavored  grey goose!   Ok, but MOST IMPORTANTLY.... The servers and bartenders.  Athena, Omar and Eduardo are so sweet and they always take such good care of me!  I love it when I walk in and they greet me like a friend, and then ask, "your usual?" Maybe it's because I come here too often, or maybe it's because they're great at serving their loyal customers!  Either way, I'll keep coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke toasts!

c1RcYlBIyiulFQRfLdUtwg.text: Made reservations on some day, no problem. Environment is nice. It's dark but they had lights wear it need to be so we can see our food. Everyine was welcoming. Hottest were very kind, our waiter was very nice and on point. He new when to check up on us.   My boyfriend and I ordered:  lamb chop, baby back ribs with mango salsa on top, scallop escargot in Garlic, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche and passion fruit cheese cake. The only dish that was okay was the shrimp ceviche. Not enough flavor. But everything else was GREAT! I would recommend this place to all my friends. And would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop escargot in garlic sauce
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby back ribs with mango salsa on top

ocvgFeGNbebQkv2OMZwGUA.text: As Owl City famously once said: "Try the Sangria, it's delicious." With the drinks sorted out, you have a multitude of tapas options... and I haven't met a menu item I didn't like. The apple salad or tempura shrimp are always good picks. Great place to bring the posse.

7OJu4cfr1Pqh-jopWx4TCw.text: Love this place,I go every time I visit Vegas. Did brunch yesterday for the first time and everything was great!! The best sangria I've had.

rfXT2cKqHJa9kytXMUneCA.text: I was surprised to see this new, bigger location. I really like the intimate setting of the previous spot but they did a good job with this one. Obviously, the demand led them to a bigger space, which makes business sense.   We sat near the bar... they have TV's with sports on, which takes away from the experience in my opinion. Whenever I have had tapas, it's usually an intimate spot with your wine or sangria, your tapas, and your friends. This was almost like tapas in a sports bar!  As for the food, I can't find any reason to complain. I thought the bacon wrapped dates were pretty much dead on. I didn't expect the chicken salad to be as good as it was. The steak skewers were really good and also the empanadas hit the spot.   Although the setting may not be what it was it is nice to see the quality of the food to be where it always has been and that it didn't disappoint!

xtdxa2XttTKvL4HQTcaglw.text: We were kinda skeptical about going to this place so soon after the Salmonella scare but we figured we would try it out and give it a go!  MAN were we on the MONEY!!  Fantastic spot to check out hipsters, have a few shots, and a few more tapas, savory and sweet alike, as well as enjoy the beautiful decor and friendly staff.  Started off with Patron shots, then a pitcher of Sangria which was very refreshing then we moved on to tilapia sauteed in butter and wine, dates stuffed with goat cheese and wrapped in bacon, shrimp cocktail, Spanish albondigas, Angus sliders, ohh and so many other delicacies that I want to remember but it's been a month since I was there and my memory is a bit shot from the Patron but I promise, everything was excellent.  This is definitely a MUST GO TO when in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angus sliders, dates, sangria and Patron

4MS364We3JYzSfow0V6UAg.text: I ate here twice while visiting Las Vegas, NV. I love the prices. The quality of the food is quite good.  I enjoyed the flamenco paintings on the wall and the atmosphere afforded by pleasant waiters reminding me of southern Spain.  The tapas make me happy. The only thing I would add is some more architecture...as it is, the place is a bit too much of a strip mall in a desert city in the U.S.A..  It needs a bit more stone work, a tighter decor that makes you feel like you are in a tiny alley in a historic town in Andalucia.  Oh well, it's Las Vegas.  Go for the prices and you won't be disappointed by the food.    I guess the "firefly" lived up to it's name: the place needs to add some fly catchers on the front patio.  Another recommendation to improve this place would be a better beer list.  More microbrews from the United States would be a good addition to the Spanish wine drinks.

rXB2uB521Pw2pkQDtLiiRg.text: I want to make this pretty simple. I came on a Friday night, it was busy, there was a wait. We were told 15-20 mins... We waited an hour. We sat at the bar and had a couple cocktails until our table was ready and those cocktails were delicious. When we finally got our table our waitress was nice and explained the popular tapas dishes to us. We ordered based off of her suggestions. We were very happy with the food but we never really saw our waitress again until we had to ask for her so we could get our check. It was really busy and really loud. Don't come here if you are on a date because you can't really have an intimate conversation and aside from that the tables are so close together you are rubbing elbows with strangers. I'd definitely come here again, but maybe on a regular week night. If you come here, definitely order the popular dishes that they recommend and you won't be disappointed.

jcuNaXyeDlgjMFDEV4Xqgw.text: I've been driving by Firefly for a few years now, telling my wife:  "We should really stop in there sometime."  Sometime finally came, and now I'm kicking myself for waiting so long to try this place.  It's a tapas place, so everything on the menu is a small portion, generally meant to be shared.  They all probably average around $6-9, with just a few topping the $10 mark.  Everything I tried was outstanding, and I'm looking forward to trying a bunch of new things next time.    The restaurant itself was clean, new, and very tastefully decorated.  And the service was outstanding.  We were there maybe 45 minutes, and had no less than three people (including what I assumed was the manager) make sure everything was to our liking.    What a great find.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The manchego Mac &amp; Cheese.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tinga Empanada.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke toasts.

2g_w7463muv1mq1Is7U2oQ.text: I'm an avid firefly food-lover so I was happy (oh, and my stomach was too) to find out that they didn't close down. They literally just moved down the street! The new place looks great and service was awesome! And, most importantly no change in food quality!   Same great food but new and improved place! Where all the locals go and you can chill with friends over tapas and sangria! What can be better? Definitely a spot to hit up during your stay at Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary matchsticks for guests available at host desk
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t miss it with their new big SIGN
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Voila! Restaurant front (patio seating not pictured but it&#39;s to the left)

EnMw8f7lCAKJ2P0DYbSj7Q.text: Dude, just eat here. Eder was our waiter. We told him to bring us his five favorites. It included tuna tartare that was amazeballs. We also had cod, lamb chops, and skewers of some sort of delicious meat. Do yourself a favor and go to Firefly, find Eder, and prepare your face for greatness. PS, this is a tapas bar, not a topless bar ya jigaloo

agvYeuuTdVNMjBmqmmAryg.text: Place is totally incredible. Local joint with great cocktails and tapas. Just off strip in comfortable and lively atmosphere. Ceviche, tuna, grilled octopus, papas bravas, petite filet are all excellent every single time.

CgxoOATttbaqkF-NygeTAQ.text: Great menu, especially the vegan / vegetarian one! Great service, tasty food.

J1BnVRsNBUmU21LrY7czyg.text: Great service, great food, try the sangria.  If anyone is considering going it might be best to make a reservation, they're that good.   Also they have valet.

qWwGT93hjzqfrQUOmZazKQ.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for something a little cheaper than all the fancy and expensive options in the Strip. A friend referred us to this place and I'm glad she did! We came for dinner and luckily had reservations, the place was PACKED. We ordered 4-5 tapas to split. Each was served one at a time and came right on time. Service was exceptional. Only complaint is that it was very loud inside, sort of dark, and the tables are very close together. would definitely recommend to a friend.

rVc7DdXNev2Yln7_PhR6lA.text: Firefly is a great place to meet someone for a bite to eat that is staying on the strip.  It's close to the strip. The food is good.  I dined on the outside patio and was surprised that the street noise was minimal.  My sister and I could converse in normal voice.  The service was just right and not over-attentive.  When you want something different from the status quo, try this place.    Phil V

uq9bN1fvlGHZMabfJ2uV8A.text: I used to love Firefly, but unfortunately it is nothing like what it used to be.   The big disappointment over the years has been the change of the atmosphere.  The first Firefly we went to many years back was in downtown Vegas.  Although the seating was nothing special, the great view of the old casinos and the light show made for a very cool atmosphere.  The second Firefly we went to was at their PREVIOUS/smaller Paradise location.   That one had some cool seating with couches and what not, giving that a very cool atmosphere as well.  Suffice to say that when we were seated at their CURRENT Paradise location, it was a bit of a letdown.   The atmosphere is completely missing in this larger location of theirs on Paradise.   They tried to give it some atmosphere with the candles and red hue, but the space is just too big and open for sit down tables for that to work well.     The red pitchers of Sangria are still delicious and well worth the $28.       The tapas don't seem to stand out to me as they used to; they were all good, but nothing really stuck out as being delicious.  The old Fireflys used to be something we would visit every time we would go to Vegas.   With this latest experience, things have changed.

Mg_hIpB8SqywVe9jXGOQMw.text: This was our first experience with a tapas restaurant and we loved it. Food was delicious, staff very friendly and informative, prices reasonable. Can't wait for our next trip to Vegas so we can visit Firefly again.

NIHm2XGH7oNO3uTbu2MKjA.text: One of our favorite restaurants. We left in 2008 and came back to more Firefly locations. We tried one of the new locations and hated it. We tried it again thinking it was a fluke and it was still terrible. Then the food poisoning happened. and while I would not wish that on any business, it has forced them to close the other locations and focus again on their main one.   This has allowed them to go back to doing what they did so well before. Although I wish they would bring out the bread, olives and honey almond butter like they used to. Now you have to ask for it. They have some new things on the menu now too like the Chicago beef sandwiches. Their flavors on that one are spot on. (I'm from Chicago, I can say that). The dates are to die for and   The things have have changed for the not so good are the mushroom tarts, filet sliders (now it's much cheaper meat) and ham and cheese croquets. Those are so bad that the inside is ground down to the consistency of baby food.   So it's all about knowing what to order.

__-PmAfnQppkYP92I8Caxg.text: Went here on our visit to Vegas with another couple. The food was absolutely fantastic!!! Everything we ordered was great, even got the dessert platter. We ordered four tapas and the seafood paella and dessert with two drinks, bill for the four of us was just under $100. The atmosphere was beautiful with velvet walls, rich colors and original eclectic array of art. The food was fresh and we would have loved to come on Friday instead as I heard they have live music and dancing. Either way this place is a definite must when we are in Vegas again. Missing one star because our waiter/male was inattentive and unwelcoming, he was like, "what do you want to eat" and did not engage when asked questions about the menu, only really seen him during check time. Oh well, I will still come back as this was one of my better dining experience with food and value.

j0uMR5Os5OG-9c4MxmX2Xg.text: I absolutely love this place and I always come here. Whenever friends are in town or I am trying to impress a friend with a Vegas local hot spot, this is my go-to place.  My favorites include: Apple and manchego salad Tuna Tartare Stuffed Dates Scallop / Excargots Petite Filet Last time we visited we ventured out of the comfort zone and ordered some plates for the very first time. My new favorite is actually the Herb-roasted chicken. It is so juicy and flavorful. So many restaurants miss on chicken but this just hit the spot. It also comes with delicious crispy fries and it is very filling.  I was dreaming of their Paella since ordering in on my birthday in May and I ordered it again this time but something went terribly wrong. It was super salty and I could taste the rice distinctively as though it was not flavored well. I advised the waiter who alerted the chef. The manager was very kind. He came to our table and apologized and took the Paella off our bill. We would have loved to order one more but we had already waited 40 minutes for this one to cook and had a place to go after so we decided to pass. I love how they handled the situation. We are still loyal and will be back in the future for sure!  We also ordered their sangria pitcher and that was wonderful. It is very smooth and fruity, I think it is perfect for a light weight but only if you are sharing ;)  Overall, besides the wonderful food, the decor is beautiful with slight dim lighting. The noise level is a little higher if you sit inside but they also have outside seating with beautiful lights. It is all very fresh and exciting.

GdzrrMAFqutzr-bqn_PQtg.text: Very cool spot off the strip for a great brunch, lunch or dinner. The cold tapas plates were my favorite, especially the chorizo meats and the shrimp ceviche. Great selection of beers on tap and a full bar. Added bonus was the band, complete with kettle drum, playing on the patio on Sunday afternoon. Definitely a must-visit!

ieqYWOExWbJ43D3Yr1f4CQ.text: Amazing service and delicious food!!! I am a local and I enjoy coming to this place every time because every time servers like Oscar make my time there super special by recommending new things to try (like the tres leches cake...yummy!)  Sangria is a MUST with your tapas which always hit the spot and are not too heavy because the portions are just perfect.    If you're a tourist and are looking for the perfect spot to have drinks while having a good ambience, definitely go here.  Love dining on the outdoor patio filled with charming lights and Spanish music. On Friday nights they even have Latin dancing!

yInoSOBvdQYQ98BNFJpWUw.text: We haven't been to Firefly in awhile, but thought we would give the new location a try.  It is awesome!  They have made a few changes to the menu that are great.  Specifically, they have mini Italian Beef sandwiches Chicago style.  As a Chicago native, I thought they were spectacular.  The new restaurant is roomy and has great ambiance.  Our interest in Firefly definitely has been renewed and it will be back on the list of regular places we frequent.  Room for improvement: The service was a bit slow, especially since we went on a Friday night and the place was not packed.  We prefer to order a couple plates at a time. Though we told our waiter this, he was not very good at checking back regularly to see if we were ready to order more.  Also, something has to be done about the noise level.  I suspect that due to the low ceilings and type of flooring there is nothing to absorb the noise all the patrons make.  It was very difficult to carry on a conversation due to the loud crowd noise.  If the place was packed, it would have been unbearable.  I hope management will do something to help minimize.  If the noise issue is resolved I would give it a 5 star rating.  Overall: This is a must on any trip to Vegas.

JJlqjtzuADXkS9qqeYFmhw.text: WOWZA. Every time we come to Vegas, Firefly is our go-to dinner. I'd highly recommend coming here with a group of people, as it makes things more fun with getting to try a little of everything if everyone orders 2-3 tapas a piece. The pitchers of mojitos are a must. Some memorable items not to pass on include the bacon-wrapped dates, the calamari, and the shrimp ceviche. This time we went with the mixed paella, and it was enough to feed 4 people although there were only two of us. The service here is outstanding every time we come. From what I heard this last year was hard for Firefly because of a salmonella issue and scared off a lot of customers. As a veteran industry worker, this was sad to hear, but it happens to everyone, and I can't give enough kudos to the Firefly owner for stepping it up and resolving the issues immediately and moving forward. If I could offer any advice to the restaurant from a customer who just dined at the new location for the first time it would be that my experience was less intimate than at the older location. There is too much bright light in the building, and that needs to be addressed. A big part of why we come is for the intimate low-lit vibe with some gypsy kings on the loudspeaker. This time I was sitting next to the kitchen with a spot-light on me listening to top-40. Still giving you 5 stars because I'm a die-hard fan of the food and service. Get the ambience back and I'll be a lifer.

N2Z1HNEgVI3tjPG0ePfigg.text: No complaints here. Groupon has a $79 deal for 2 pitchers of Sangria and 8 tapas. Ceviche apple salad and calamari were muy bueno.

T5--ESU6OjmaYYSsJhGrjw.text: This food is incredible! The servers are friendly and attentive! Pepe, Alejandra and Vanessa are the best!! :)) my favorite place to go after work!

22YIhs-fUwEhQ3tluCJfUg.text: Great place off the strip. The food was amazing and debated about giving it 5 stars or not. I'll be back.

mMyTu4DtC0gu3rzf3JK2ag.text: My wife and I had date night here on a Friday night.  The food was great, we were seated quickly and everyone was pleasant. They even had non-alcoholic beer, which is a plus because I was the designated driver.  The food was great, fresh, and you can't beat the price. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.  The only set back was that it gets a little loud, and the seating doesn't allow you to sit closely to your date. So, I had to cup my ears to listen to my wife tell me how her day was. Probably better for a social night out, than a date place.  I am looking forward to returning soon.

cpGWTfR_0bGJmkYv-1Oeiw.text: This was my first visit to Firefly.  This place was really, really great. I has a very nice atmosphere, great food, and the service was impeccable.  We had a large party, and they added the automatic gratuity; this is usually very annoying to me.  However in the case of Firefly, they earned it and I was happy to sign the bill.  I am a fan, you should certainly check them out when in LV.

XJcdGUQUrQKlow1vUcoIpA.text: The tapas here are to die for.  We love the variety and the different flavors they have to offer.  The scallops and tuna tare tare were our favorites.  We had the paella which was great, but would have preferred to not order it as it was so filling we didn't have any room for more tapas.  We will definitely be coming back!

mlFv8oDS4q2yLFrjYSHCsg.text: I should've done this sooner, but we celebrated my best friends birthday on March 31st and Fireflys did a wonderful job at accommodating our entire party. Our server was Ivan and he was just awesome! The manager on duty was awesome as well although I can't remember his name. Fireflys is one of my favorite places to grab a bite to eat and have some drinks. Their food is amazing and my favorite drink is the sparkling Sangria which is amazing as well.

MZ2UGO8COvPhet-NMsnkBA.text: Great food, friendly staff, they know the menu well, all of the drinks and food they suggested was awesome. Great for a group of people willing to share. New place to visit every time I come to Vegas.

sBUVuI7_mtJlBWw4BeW_Kg.text: Food was amazing as always. Stuffed dates and chopped chicken salad. Yum!!! Mango mojitos are to die for. We needed a pitcher. This place never disappoints me. Great service. Fast and friendly service. I highly recommend this place and I bring all my out of town guests to eat here. I have introduced many locals to here as well. Many memories and great times. Thank you to Nahum our server he was great!!!

vRJfd_ATyGNyr-p93_n1Hw.text: Bartender is friendly and makes great drinks. Also recommends what to get since it's my first time.

X4BrYN1JscL_saeOVhZEYw.text: I cannot find one bad thing to say about this place!  We had our 20th Anniversary party here, after doing our vow renewal at Little Chapel of Flowers this past Saturday.  The Chapel went faster then we thought it would and our reservations weren't until 7:00pm and we were done by 6pm!  With 30 people standing around I called Firefly and they were SO accommodating to see if we could get in early!  We got there at 615pm and the room wasn't quite ready but no worries, we all went into the bar area and ordered a drink.  About 15 minutes later we were ushered into a really cute room with a long table and then drink orders were taken and then appetizers started to flow!  We did the multi-course sit down for 30 people ($35 a head) and a two hour open bar.  The food was SO good and I'd never been here before, was totally off of the Yelp reviews that I picked this place!  The manager and our coordinator were amazing, always ensuring we were happy and that everyone always had a full drink and food in front of them.  I guess the only thing I could say is that I wish the glass door to the room stayed closed, it got a little loud, and my dad was having a hard time hearing, but that would be THE only thing I could say!  This place has amazing service, awesome food and wonderful people working here!  Next time we are in Vegas we will be back.............with less people but we'll be there!!!!  THANK YOU SO MUCH FIREFLY!

LR5PgxEaH_Ev8IVantIg6g.text: Cute but flavorful tapas plates. Great service for low price (relatively speaking)!

-G7xgjYgaREJrxND7qfshw.text: Well we saw the good reviews on yelp so we decided to try it out. I have to say, I really enjoyed the place. We made reservations for 5:30pm on a Wednesday. I know it was early, but I like to eat an early dinner. This was a birthday also for my friend so this is where we went. When you pull in the parking lot, there is some street work going on and the parking lot seems plain. Most of the parking is in the back. Not really impressive looking. But when you walk in the front door, it is like an oasis. Beautiful inside. VERY nice. I had checked the menu ahead of time and about the last 50 Yelp reviews so I had written down the accumulation of the six most recommended food items. You will need about 3 items each for a man my size (6'1 225 lbs). My friend got a red wine sangria, which I tasted, it was VERY good. I'm not a wine drinker either. I'd probably get the sparkling sangria next time. I got the strawberry mojito. Good but too sweet to have with dinner.  We got and shared the: Bacon wrapped stuffed dates. Everybody says to get these. These and the sangria were probably the most listed items on the prior 50 Yelp reviews. I didn't see it. They were ok, but not to die for. Would I eat them again? Oh yeah. Would I order them again? No.  The petit filet. This was the most expensive item at $12.50 and a very small piece, but very good piece of filet. It sat on a bed of tomatoes and spinach and diced potatoes that was very good. Wouldn't get it again as money can be better spent. Chorizo and chicken stuffed mushrooms topped with melted cheese. Yummo! I would get this again. I am half Mexican though so I may like chorizo more than most. The scallops escargot. There are NO snails in this, just made with garlic and butter. You get 6 decent size scallops cooked to perfection. I would totally get these again. Gotta try these. Camarones a la diabla. Fantastic! The best thing we had. Decent size shrimp, cooked perfectly, in a sauce that is hot, but not too hot, and sweet also. The sauce is so good that you want to dip the bread they give you into any remaining sauce. Five shrimp came in a serving.  Tierra y mar skewers. These are skewers that are maybe $8.50. So $4 cheaper than the petit filet. On each skewer is a chunk of filet, a shrimp, a chunk of tomato and a piece of chorizo. You get three skewers and if you combine the amount of filet on each skewer you get more on the skewers than in the petit filet. So get this instead of the petit filet and save.  We both had the chocolate and cherry bread pudding for dessert. We could have shared one dessert but weren't sure how big it was. It was a big serving of bread pudding and a rather large scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. No bourbon sauce. But like I said, even if there are three of you, just share one as you will already be full. If it is not someone's birthday, I'd just skip the dessert. My TIPS: Ask for Alejandro, as he was a superb server. He was always around if you needed him, but never a bother.  TIP 2: order all items at once as they bring them out as they get cooked. Ours were staggered and since they are small plates, the most we had at once at the table were two items out of 6.  TIP 3: get the tierra y mar skewers instead of petit filet. TIP 4: get the sangria. It really is that good.  TIP 5: Make a reservation. We got there at 5:20pm on a Wednesday. Maybe 1/4 full at most. By 5:45pm it was 3/4 full and by 6pm it was completely full. On a Wednesday. It's a nice place and worth it. We were dressed fine and we were in shorts and Hawaaian shirts. Our bill with two drinks each and 6 Tapas and two desserts was $86.75 and with tip $102. If you cut out the desserts, that would be $17 less after tax and tip. Which would bring the bill down to $85 for two. Of course if you drink water instead of the 4 alcoholic drinks, that would save a lot more, maybe $30 more when you think about the tax and tip.... but I want the two drinks. hehe.

ZPV6OeVRGwkxCgGFyQ3UQw.text: I love coming here for their amazing martinis and their tasty chicken dishes but one thing I don't like is sometimes I have to wait for a table for a very long time

0NzTVYVc7B8yhRDChC9JlA.text: Awesome food, drinks ands atmosphere !!! Always a good time when my friends and I go here

hLBAQrA0CoS7VQrTRfGP6Q.text: Great food. Mac and cheese and bacon dates unreal.. Great wine. Sat at the bar, nice setup..

lDERZyDKSYV0BXn6B3mSRA.text: One of the most reasonably priced restaurants you will find anywhere near the strip. Great variety and great service!

yVOV-6RlRyxtOv6kYiKjhQ.text: This is a 4-4.5 star eatery that gets extra credit for extremely good service. GREAT meals, solid service and surprisingly fast turn-around make this a location that I and my news crew always visit whenever we have a Las Vegas event. We've been there through both locations and the resultant visits have only gotten better with time. An outstanding restaurant. We will be back -- again and again.

r2Trl4rYga_TV8k4lyjoQA.text: Great experience, excellent happy hour. My family of 6 ordered everything on the happy hour menu and we were extremely satisfied with all the tapas. The Fly Mule was a little too melon-y for our taste. The mojito was also good. Definitely worth $5.

_Ba_2KBueGH9-Ay1eWVTJQ.text: You will not find better food in Las Vegas!  The ambiance is wonderful. Staff is friendly.   The shrimp ceviche is a MUST! And the banana nutella is a great way to end your meal. I've yet to have a bad thing on the menu. This is a wonderful restaurant with loyal customers. We have been going to all of their locations for years and will continue to do so.

fGtvp1992rhd-0du9JmP0g.text: Had a great time here, the food is awesome we had the apple salad, the dates, and the paella. We drank red sangria. The mood is very red and romantic but seems like a fun place for all kinds of "night out" type events, a good mix of local and tourists

ecoAiS4YylKzVB6BnFbMZQ.text: Great Small plates. Stuffed peppers are awesome. A little loud on atmosphere, maybe it's just a busy night. The food is awesome though

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OLWsSSvz3XiVmB_Ck3-sDg.text: I have been coming here for years every time I stay in Vegas I try to come here to eat at the tapas. My favorite believe it or not is the filet mignon and the mushroom Chicken chorizo. By the way don't forget their bread and their butter it's also really good will continue to come love this place

GkDrasYHT1ny91AjIngHpg.text: Great food! Atmosphere is good. Does get busy at times, best to call ahead and make a reservation. The drinks are amazing, and the service is great.

2BFsiPq-gZDlvEb0QastQA.text: I'm giving 2 stars because the drinks were good. The food was smothered in cream sauces. The surf and turf I ordered came with raw shrimp and beef. Don't understand why this place has a high star rating.

3w4xBfiLTb6q7SPJVfKZEQ.text: 5 stars! Yes! Why? Everything was on point! Food beer, service and price. I had four dishes.... Dates, chorizo clams, pulpo (octopus) asado, and albondigas (meatballs)! All were exceptional! And I am from LA so I know good food. A serious must try . Or I should say don't come at all so I can have the place all to myself! I have never been to an establishment when I didn't have any negative criticism. Karen and Omar at the bar were amazing! I'm coming back tomorrow. Shhhh but don't tell anyone!

bQlyIMa9IiSCAjWf-aCf3g.text: Modern Spanish tapas.  Big classy place.  The recommended mac & cheese and empanadas were great.  Warm spinach salad was good.  Mojitos were quite decent.  Prices were fair for LV.

rkxMhbqa6aW3uom0LAUefA.text: We were told this place was a good spot with a lively nightlife. When we went there only people that were there were having dinner. We went to the bar and had a drink. We ordered the infused vodka with blackberry and lychee. It tasted like syrup. We struggled to finish our drink. We didn't have any of the food. I am just rating the bar.

n5wLHI1HgusPVfPQfMzslQ.text: Firefly has amazing food and great service. Carlos knows exactly what's going on and I recommend you request him as your server if you want to have a great experience. Our favorites were the Firefly fries, tuna tartar, lemon garlic shrimp, and lamb chops. Carlos knew how to provide excellent wine service and never left our glasses empty. The establishment was constantly busy which attests to the quality of service they provide.

XKOLJdRzA9b5Q3nnECtgqw.text: Favorites were goat cheese with sauce and melt in your mouth chicken tinga empanadas! My husband had the blood orange mojito which was a bit on the sour side for me but he enjoyed it. He ordered the filet mignon which he devoured!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice ambiance for a date night.
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tinga empandas

IsA5kSaEpySD6KyTPNBm_A.text: Place is amazing. Great for a group meal. Lots of options and very accommodating. Def recommend this place for any meal.

njVzRfXSrK3Ov_JNUvOcSA.text: I was fortunate enough to dine here during CES last week. Holeeee moleee it was good. We bought pitchers of the Sangria which was suitable for 3-4 people. Then we started off with the bacon wrapped dates because BACON. My colleague was very eager to try something with Manchengo cheese so we ordered the Manchego Mac & Cheese which was good but I'd pass next time around(not a manchego cheese fan). The pork empanadas were good as well but I'd definitely recommend the steak and mushroom. Nom nom noms.  Price was reasonable so if you get a chance dine here!

zebaqVMfxvVGY2sTseVMLQ.text: The new Firefly on Paradise is beautiful! Upscale and trendy! Lots of delicious and fresh vegetarian options!!! And the best sparkling white sangria! Check it out!!!

eFIsAI0bazSoVTu4z4xGZQ.text: Probably everything you order off the menu would be good!  We had a party of 16 people, and I had no idea what we were ordering, so I just threw out some dishes I saw that caught my eyes - fish sticks, clams, mussels, and paella.    Everything was delicious, and I mean EVERYTHING!  The tuna tartare and the ceviche were on point!  We had two birthday boys with us, and the restaurant treated us with a few pitchers of sangrias, two birthday shots, and two tshirts for the birthday boys.    Don't have anything but good thing to say about this place.  I know this is the new location, (I've never been to the old location) but the place seems nice and clean.    Our party had a great time! Definitely be back next time we're in town!

XLTt51J1x1ptYK4Ca73CTg.text: Always a great experience coming here. Food and service is excellent. I don't think I've ever ordered anything that I wasn't pleased with. That being said, I have a particular fondness to the tuna tartare, tuna skewers, tres leches cake, and especially the chocolate cherry bread pudding (warm with a generous serving of ice cream on the top).   The ambiance is really lovely as well. You wouldn't be out of place dressed up or down (as with most LV places). Prices are very reasonable. I think each individual plate is good for two people to share and feel satisfied with the amount tasted. If you have three or more, you might want to order doubles of some plates to make sure everyone gets a decent amount. The two of us order four to five plates, plus one dessert (and you get some delicious free bread), and leave feeling well-satisfied.

jRpk6hR27yizcfLGiCrZcw.text: Good spot for after work drinks, atmosphere is pleasant and the staff is on point, try the stuffed dates #lifechanger

T7cZgxQTSDkUODrrtey6Eg.text: The best place ever, food is fantastic, atmosphere is great, The bartender Omar super star! Thank u:)

54-maJKqNPQxPRnr3hrDZg.text: Frustrating place to dine.  We were with a group on the patio. When we tried to order food, they told us we have to order inside. We went in and sat at one of the 2-tops in the bar, and were informed that we cant order from the bar unless we sit at the bar. Finally a waiter came over and took our order.  Then the waiter from outside informs us that if we need anything he will take care of us and not the waiter who took our order.  Wow!!!  Last visit here.

ovmWExAYAoDIBvdipPbYww.text: Always have to visit this place every time we come to Vegas. In fact we have been coming here since it was the small venue down the street. We try to have something new every visit but also have to have the almond stuffed dates and skewers. Never had anything I didn't like   If you like garlic try the scallops escargot. This place is large and unfortunately rather noisy for conversation. But they have large celebrations of people as well as small tables. You must go here when you are here

XJXMQ1eNWr1QiVwU4szf6A.text: I've never had a bad experience here, until this weekend. I called ahead for reservations as well as to notify them that we would need a gluten free menu as my sister is highly allergic and is on medications. They assured me there wouldn't be a problem with this as they have a full vegan/gluten free menu. As we sat down, they forgot to bring us this Menu as previously requested over the phone so we had to call her back, no big deal we thought. We placed our orders, and I do admit we placed them at different times as we were a bit all over the place with our menus'. Once my sister's order came, she seemed concerned and was sure her dish was not gluten free. We asked the waiter, he said, "No, it's not gluten free, its not in that menu" as he rolled his eyes at us. We were confused as we made sure to only order from that menu for her. We asked for it to be taken back and asked for the menu again to see if we wanted to order something else, but at that point we were more worried that she would have an allergic reaction and decided to stick with drinks. They did remove 1 of my drinks from the bill as well as my sisters untouched cod (and made it seem as they were doing us a favor by removing it from our bill). Out of everything the Hostess provided us with a good attitude over the whole experience, can't say the same for one of male waiters, the other guy was pleasant though. We don't expect anyone to kiss our ass or anything like that, but if we took the time to call ahead and let you know of severe allergies as well as specified there no less then 3 times once we arrived, then we would appreciate if you don't give us attitude if we had to send untouched food back when you messed up our order.

04fcTyalnMSBXqX2ayyupg.text: Delicious tapas and drinks at a reasonable price? I'm there!   Called Firefly in the afternoon on Sunday and was able to get a reservation for 7pm for 4 people that night. Parking was easy to find there's a medium lot in the back of the restaurant. The interior has a clean and modern night club type feel. We arrived at 6:45pm and was seated right away in a booth.   We ordered the stuffed dates, padron peppers, boquerones, petite filet, merguez (lamb sausage), and chicken paella. The only underwhelming dish was the peppers I would skip those the next time. But please do yourself a favor and get the petite filet! It was super flavorful and perfectly medium rare. I've had a lot of stuffed dates but this one was one of the best I've had. The paella is AMAZING. Perfectly cooked and not too salty. Chicken can be tough if cooked for too long but this chicken in the paella was tender and juicy. For dessert we ordered the cheesecake and flan. They're both good but the star of the dessert was the little cookie that came with the flan! They should have a dish with a bunch of those little cookies. On a side note we ordered a pitcher of red wine sangria to share. Delicious and smooth! You can't go wrong with the drinks here either.   Definitely try this place out when you're in Vegas! It's a little off strip but it's so worth it. Didn't feel overly crowded and the food was amazing. Looking forward to trying this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Merguez, spicy lamb sausage
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boquerones

BS6DqdJfK8Qf6p7Ihn0k7w.text: Excellent food, service, and drinks.  Drinks are a waterdown and on the small size.  Expensive.

PsibbWH3MUHloqzOl6dCzQ.text: Sweet little local gem off the strip!!...tapas and awesome adult beverages!!...we really enjoyed everything we had and would come back again and again!!...keep up the good work gang!!...BOOM!!

dUdI-mZDcI_iLOLbssjbXw.text: First time eating here for drinks and dinner. I ordered the seafood paella and it was amazing! Great service and all food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U0zERgv2zK292YCjNntQwg.text: Firefly is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. I love love love this place.  I usually enjoy coming during dinner hours. The lights are dimmed, the ambience is chic, dressing up here is welcomed but you can also be casual.   The tapas here are so damn good. The scallops "escargot" are buttery and cooked just right. The camarones aljillo, tuna tartare (with taro chips), shrimp ceviche, steak and mushroom skewers MUST TRY THESE), and any of their empanadas are always what I order right away. Did I also mention they have bacon wrapped dates? Try them. They sound weird, but so worth it.  If the party being seated to eat is more than 6 people, gratuity is already included in bill.   I come to Firefly at least once a month and I can honestly say, despite it's salmonella outbreak a few years back, I'm still a loyal food-goer and will always be willing to throw some dollars on their pitchers of sangria!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Camarones aljillo
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops escargot
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

EelLcqWosePImpf46fZ6Cg.text: They have stepped up their game with this location. Our server was knowledgeable and the food didn't disappoint. Paella is pretty good but order it first thing since it takes a normal 40 minutes.

AS0GIor4K3eX2r-HZ-cFZQ.text: My wife and had dinner rather late around 10pm and it was maybe 50 % occupied. We ordered the combo paella first because it takes about 40 to 50 minutes. We had the patatas brava and wasn't to impressed by it the potatoes were not crispy my daughter had this in Barcelona and it was not up to par and we also had the huevos estrellados which is similar to the braves but with a fried egg and chorizo.  I was waiting for the server to mention that I had  2 potato dishes but he said nothing and it was a little better but I have to say that both potato dishes seemed like they sat around for awhile. Someplace place use the 2 fry method to crisp them up but it seems like over fried once trying crisp them but it was not.  Then we had octopus(pulpo Saadi)was really good and tender.  Next came the warm Spinach salad and it's just okay.    The ipaella finally showed up and it was okay but not prepared properly it had no socarrat at the bottom of the pan which I was looking for; the flavor was rather muted.  We had dessert the cherry bread pudding and flan.   The bread could have more edge it lacked any cherry flavor but the flan was one the best I had in flavor and texture not heavy or aerated it was perfect.

3wVIbU51L0vT6xREs6s0fQ.text: Firefly is my go-to Happy Hour during the week. After 11pm Monday-Thursday, the fun begins. A glass of sangria for $5, and they have a small menu of tapas for $4 or $5. Always go with the Firefly fries, stuffed dates, and the chicken skewers. They have the best stuffed dates I've ever had, and the chicken skewers always have different seasonal veggies every time I go. Last time I went they had brussel sprouts. Firefly also has some of the best bread! It's a sliced garlic bread with AMAZING almond and chipotle butter I think.   This is a great place for a late night dinner with friends, my friends are always reluctant to go but by the end of our meal they rave! They have a fun photo booth too so you can commemorate your awesome dinner.

aomfjt4wg5p5vxgcsrCGIg.text: resto's by the strip is expensive and overrated.  tapas here are awesome! price is low for the quality of food.nice ambiance and outside seating.

tqlLus3LvB9EFfloRPpP0A.text: Nice and clean; excellent tapas.  My husband had the gazpacho full of flavor, light but rich.  I had the shrimp ceviche extremely generous amount of shrimp considering the price and very fresh and tastey. For our meal we decided on seafood paella.  Honestly I've had better. The seafood portion was on the light side and so there was a lot of rice.  Wouldn't have minded increased muscles and clams and shrimp for a higher price tag.  Flavor was solid but just lacked the natural magic that comes together with cooked to order paella.

sV1yfkLPuprVih6pC3aBBg.text: This was my fiances & my first time eating here and we were very impressed. The service was great and the food came out super quick. Not only was everything plated beautifully, but it tasted great too. 10/10 would definitely return.

5ixNOqJ-53FH6gbEPQB2bQ.text: This place was so fun!! We hit it up for a Sunday brunch based off of Yelp reviews and honestly, it was one of our best meals in Vegas. We sat outside where a guy was playing the bongos to a DJ. Different, but cool.   Our server was great as was everyone else who was helping.   The food was incredible. We wanted so many things and couldn't decide, so we ended up getting way too much! Next time, I would order one thing at a time so I don't get as full. However, the online menu said that brunch came with two sides and the menu contradicted that, so I assumed the portions were small. Regardless, we loved everything we ordered!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heuvos rancheros. This was delish!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apples and manchego cheese. I loved this, but didn&#39;t realize there was cilantro on it when I ordered.

Qg8gRcRfN9wyvhTzLw9YvQ.text: My favorite spot in Vegas!  The palla is amazing! The tapas... Omg you can't go wrong after several visits and nearly sampling everything u am damn near an expert at this place! Oh let me tell you about the burger! Damn, it's bomb! It's close to a chimi from the BX!

QNrV4vNN4xZXKaDTnExXUA.text: Affordable, excellent service and great menu. Good option for dinner off the strip. Our server helped with recommendations and we kept ordering more plates.

PJwaZ36IYS5hVLHJEU0Kkw.text: I ate twice at this restaurant while staying in Vegas, and I can highly recommend. The portions are small and priced accordingly, but that was ok since I just ordered at least 2 entrees. Everything tasted fresh and was served hot. The bread and butter are a must! The butte seemed to have a cheese flavor and tasted amazing. One night I had the dessert sampler, and this was great! I ate the desserts over a couple nights and they all were to die for! The sampler could easily make 3-5 people happy, and was reasonable priced too. I highly recommend this place while in Vegas!!!

0iOWz9NOKjc8fSlbvwV1KA.text: Awesome!! Tried many dishes and all were yummy!! Highly recommend tuna tartar!!!! Stuffed peppers definitely need to order!!! Highly highly recommended! Very nice atmosphere and reasonably priced! The hostess actually walks around looking for you after your table is ready! Pomegranate monitor delicious!!

FPVOxbpyMCCM3vkhArtLFw.text: Firefly is ALWAYS a must when in Vegas. I just wish they had HH on the weekends.  You can never go wrong with the calamari,  steak & mushrooms, ceviche,empanadas....I could go on. Next time...Im gonna stick it out and wait 40min for the paella!!

Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak&amp; mushroom skewers
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada...roasted pork

e9MeAM7w-Hr3bsBr3_kOhw.text: Very good flavor in all the food we ordered. The music is very loud in the restaurant, the restaurant itself is quite loud, but the impeccable service and food made up for it.   The restaurant is about a ten minute walk from the strip which made it easy to get to. We ordered several small plates which included the Mac and cheese (AMAZING!), the chicken skewers, beef and mushroom skewers and the ahi tuna skewers ( AMAZING!). Every single dish we got was very very good. Complex flavors, not something you normally find at a place with good reviews, strangely.   We got the dessert platter which featured 4 different desserts including the caramel flan (AMAZINGGGGGG!)  If you live in Vegas or passing by, you need to come here. No questions asked!

w-UGN_gHSa8eGrlLXmnBfQ.text: Everything I try here is delicious!  Come early and it much quieter!! You have to try the dates, mac n cheese, peppers, tuna tartare is my favorite.  Love the tre Che for dessert.  It a great first date or anniversary experience!!!

YoY0iU4YhfMaKkCjlgVOjg.text: The only criticism is that it is very loud... hence the 4 stars. We ordered from every category  Chilled- ceviche of shrimp, my daughter liked it however I did not like all of the lime flavor, but that's a ceviche, the shrimp was huge and in abundance so if that's your thing order it Hot- manche go Mac n cheese. Delicious and creamy very tasty for a mac n cheese Seafood-our favorite!!! Scallops escargot, everything about it was delicious we even put the remaining sauce on the Mac n cheese we loved it so much. Meat and poultry- steak and mushroom skewers ordered medium they are very tasty with lots of flavor and very tender.   Mojito and Sangria was nice and refreshing

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TJjb4DOava_UW8PIf1arZw.text: We had a very good time. The food was good and fairly priced. They even have a large gluten free menu, which is hard to find in Vegas. There was a mixup about whether the Mac n cheese was gluten free or not, but luckily we caught it before it became a problem.

tq4dTR6fSUZ19cAhZstnlw.text: With 985 reviews under my belt, my friends handed me the task of picking a place to eat on a Friday night.  "Keep it cheap, but not too cheap". "Classy but not stuffy".  "I want MEAT".  "Something off the strip".  "$20 entrees, plus drinks."  "Dude, we trust you".  Ok, I got this.  The reviews were, in the words of Vin Scully, "remarkable".  Two $$. Good looking pictures (food porn).  Easy to make reservations for a party of eight.  My wife and I were the first to arrive and we had the choice of inside or outside.  The bar area is gorgeous, the inside had cool music and a classy vibe but the patio was perfect for us.  We are a loud group so we wanted to feel more comfortable.  Red and white lights above us on the canvas patio cover.  Very simple, kind of cool.  Service was prompt and efficient.  The tapas were amazing.  Top picks were the hot cheese dishes with chorizo, bacon wrapped dates and tuna tartare.  The highlight was the paella.  We had one with seafood and another with chicken and mushroom.  Killer dishes.  3 pitchers of different sangria so made us all fuzzy and happy.  The desserts were plentiful and the banana Nutella dish was a standout dish.  In truth, I was pretty buzzed to remember too much but all of my friends had a great time.  About $40 per head including booze, tax and tip.  Winner winner tasty dinner.

6M42O3X4ZMcg5rq7Js3sGg.text: Oh my GOD that was the best Tapas experience I have had ever!!  On the recommendation of the bar tender I started with Stuffed Dates and added the Tierra y Mar Skewers.  Awesome combo!  Highly recommend if in a meat (with a little seafood) and red wine reduction mood!!  Ordered a Sangria that was not as flavorful as hoped (but still potent).  Next time I'll find a good Cabernet.  See you again in two weeks!

BX_u5kzHrRwS63xlWUu1Ug.text: Excellent place for small plate Tapas and wine. Modern Chic Decor, fun environment to go with excellent food. Service is good, staffs are friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant.
