Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulpo (Octopus) Asada
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and Almond Butter

Gl4s6g2A88TN6wz7hLqREQ.text: This place is awesome! Quick service and great food! Try the Artichoke toast and the filet! It's amazing!

e5WC6cgrhKr9rGMOqpeqtA.text: Great food options for all.  Great service.  Great huge bar.  Must go and it's right off the strip.  Petite Filet is the best bang for the buck!

D02fMEt5CQJSWLXMNm7DjQ.text: My wife loves this place. We used to go here a lot. Actually we used to go here everytime we go to las vegas. We would also recommend this place to everyone.  Its a tapas place (small plates) which is good so you get to taste a lot of different dishes.  Me and my wife felt that this place deteriorated over time.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S3dD78Dg6cD0ogvo31B-Eg.text: This place a amazing. We ate outside and it was so nice and open. Service was good our waiter was friendly and attentive. The tapas plates were of average size. The bacon wrapped dates were so good so flavorful I would just come back for that dish!  The muscles in a curry sauce as ok could have more flavor to it. Got to have the red sangria we had two pitchers so good!

4KRPjl95dEl7cSQLEaz7fg.text: Do not waste your time or money in this place.  The worst service i have experienced in as long as i can remember.  I must adjust my review. While the service i received was well below expectations,   That was possibly the individual.  The food i received was very good and certainly deserves 4 Stars.  I feel certain,  they will correct this oversite.

i6uSzlsGmsa7UKRN3kbpWw.text: I've had Firefly bookmarked for some time now and I was finally able to check it out this past weekend for my Birthday.  I made a reservation for 8 people and when we got there, we were seated right away. Although, I would have preferred to be seated in the main dinning room, we were sat in the room adjacent to the bar. Our server greeted us right away and offered up his suggestions on drinks. We opted for the pitcher of Watermelon Mojitos. It was so refreshing and tasted great!  We knew that we wanted to try the Mixed Paella so we put in an order right away since it takes about 40 min to make.   Here's a breakdown of what our table ordered:  Mixed Paella  Chorizo Plate  Serrano Ham & Manchego Cheese  Stuffed Dates  Camarones a la Diabla  Chicken & Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms  Babyback Ribs   Chicken Tinga Empanandas  Stuffed Peppers  Tierra y Mar Skewers  Everything tasted amazing but my top 3 favorite dishes of the night hands down had to be the Stuffed Dates, Mixed Paella & Camarones a la Diabla! The stuffed dates were so good, we ended up ordering 2 more orders of them! We just couldn't get enough of their goodness!   Only complaint of the night was that the room we were seated in was extremely hot. It started to get uncomfortable in there.   All in all, I would highly recommend dining at Firefly next time you are in the Las Vegas area. You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate after plate of complete goodness
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Paella
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Dates wrapped in bacon

lNZV2elDDZD_VLEGaHCLrg.text: Always a fav or mine when I am in town. Great food and atmosphere. This time tried the steak and mushroom skewers..OMG soooo yummy!!! Always love the bacon dates and tuna tare tare. Summer salad was light and refreshing.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eo5koeh9MFuRdxxhxeq_zw.text: Best place for Tapas. Service was friendly. Atmosphere was very amazing. Prices was nice.All in all a very nice place to try out.

r7bc0AdrhTfcE2ziihC8Ig.text: Synesthesia: the production of a sense impression relating to one sense or part of the body by stimulation of another sense or part of the body.   The taste of this food exceeds the synesthetical beauty of all I've seen here so far in Vegas and surrounding lands- the beautiful Hoover dam, the breathtaking Red Rock Canyon, the tasteful tits in the magazine kiosks advertising the college girls in need of tuition money. Maybe it's the mojotos talking, but WOW! What a meal. If I was stranded on a desert island with one restaurant for the rest of my life, it would be this place. Long live Firefly!

ZBdi4PXV1JPeRAtj8g18_Q.text: This is a great restaurant to dine or hang out when in Vegas.   The menu offers a variety of more of the American-Spanish fusion tapas rather than traditional Spanish tapas.  We ordered: 5/5 - Camarones a la diabla (shrimp with firely sweet and spicy sauce)  $10 5/5 - Grilled Scallops $12 4.5/5 - Steamed mussels $9.50 3/5 - Seafood paella $20 45 min. wait so order in advance 5/5 - Large Salad $12  The shrimp and scallops were absolutely flavorful and cooked to perfection.  Even the salad with sun dried tomatoes and roasted peppers was absolutely delicious!   Since this is a Spanish tapas restaurant, we decided to try their seafood paella. The paella takes 45 minutes to prepare and for most people, that's not a long wait since the times goes by fairly quickly when people are talking and sampling tapas. Nevertheless, it wasn't very authentic so will skip that next time around.  Great service and lively atmosphere. Will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed mussels
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Camarones a la diabla
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled scallops

idR47IqVYtsdR8hNLpJe2g.text: Came here for a CES networking event and was blown away with the food! We had stuffed dates, garlic chicken skewers, ham and cheese croquettes, and paella. They also passed artichoke crostini and tomato chutney toast. It was all amazing! My favorite was the dates stuffed with an almond, rolled in bacon and cooked with a red wine reduction, melted in my mouth with a little crunch from the almond. I would recommend this place to anyone. Exceptional for sharing as the plates are all served tapas style.

Dacni7fmrnjg14nT7tYn3A.text: The table where we were seating was disgusting, it was really sticky. Stuffed dates and baked goat cheese was good, chicken empanadas and steak skewer was ok, paella was nothing to brag about but the camarones Diabla was really good. I don't think we would go back again.

du0pwNCC6fgACKJqbA7eYA.text: This is the first Mexican Tapas restaurant that I have been to in Las Vegas. I I did not know what to expect. When we watching all of the hostesses and waitresses were extremely friendly. The menu was relatively cheap and had a variety of things that I had never seen before, such as bell pepper tomato soup. We were able to order a wide variety of things and nothing had let me down. The best items on the menu that we had ordered that I would probably have been the bacon wrapped dates or the paella for $26. I would most definitely come here again if I had the opportunity.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Paella
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon

NfTl8Ea9vhqxmGQJ_bUH1w.text: I came here for a Bachelorette party that was party of a VIP package - so we got treated to all you can eat and drink... I have to think the alcohol is definitely factoring in to what a great experience I had, but honestly the food was great and our servers (we had two) were AMAZING!! I would go back just for the service alone as they were attentive and went above and beyond to keep our party of 9 happy.    Food - like I said it was all you could eat tapas and desserts for us, and a table of 9 girls, yep we pretty much had it all.... and managed to hand the plates around as if they were big enough to be family style.   I loved the bacon wrapped dates, the octopus, the apple salad, the tuna tartare, the empanadas, and the dessert platter. You can probably skip the mussels, the chick peas in shells (these were actually good, but not worth the mess or effort to eat), the shrimp diabla, and the steak skewers....  trust me we ate many more than this, but these stick out as the best and the worst.  Drinks - the mojitos were ok, not as flavorful as I would have liked, but it was all you could drink and really I wasn't complaining. The sangria was strong, maybe too strong, and then others in our group ordered wine and beer.    Service - again, sooooo good!! Our waitress took the time to get the bachelorette a candle and sing a made up bachelorette song to her as though it was her birthday... she didn't think the bachelorette looked happy enough so she kept going above and beyond with little details to make our night that much better.    Atmosphere - loud, like really loud, and I'm sure our table wasn't helping... definitely not a romantic tapas spot I'd want to go to with the bf, but perfect for our kind of evening.

zLY5Tc72YfCvR7AWvQyC5Q.text: I'm writing this from the bar at Firefly as I enjoy a glass of pinot grigio,  Serrano ham and manchego cheese and the bacon wrapped dates. It's 1:30 pm and it's pretty quiet in here. Let me preface my comments by saying that I have lived in Spain and frequented many tapas bars there and in southern California, where I live. The prices are very reasonable. Comparable dishes at other places would cost the same or more in California. The portion of Serrano ham is very generous and delicious. I got my food quickly. Both items are beautifully presented and tasty. I will definitely come back. They have ample parking that's free. They have an extensive wine selection.

RZDCffbZaghu8CBc9481Sw.text: Always delighted to come here with great company. The attention, the sparkling sangria and tapas are great. Highly recommend. Let this Latin night get started. Woot woot!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers!

glZUvAX2bACTIgiS3cQu7A.text: Jessie and Eduardo's service was phenomenal. Came here with 11 people (late night as we work in the industry) and honestly we had a great time. They gave us a round of shots on the house. We have been laughing, eating, drink and having an excellent time. This is my second night coming in a row and I am truly happy to have found this place, especially considering they are open late night.

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A table full of tapas!!

m_9NAPYPYueBKNwgR1KblQ.text: Visited while in town for business based on a colleagues recommendation. I'm generally not a fan of Spanish tapas, but was very pleased. Everyone enjoyed and there is certainly something for everyone. Great for a group

ddKGAHxRgejYi43yzAi3nw.text: Always pleased. I always try to get new things but it's hard because there are so many favs! Absolute orders are tuna tartar, Mac and cheese, croquettes, and dates for dessert. Sangria is good but def weak. My bf gets a flavored monitor but asks them to muddle peppers inside so it's spicy! That's a better choice!

JywlQqw98WfoO1F3WhoOVQ.text: Would've never traveled this far to go to this location (I go to the one on the west side often) if it wasn't for latin nights on Friday nights. Just like the other location the sangria is good, service is friendly and although this place is bigger than the Sahara location there's still a lack of space to move around.  They have a large patio which I can see could be nice to dine on if the weather is  nice but the problem is that Vegas usually has very extreme weather, either too hot or too cold and appropriate weather days are far and few between. Latin nights would have been so much nicer if there were misters on the patio at least or if they held the event indoors. Everyone was complaining about the heat ALL NIGHT and most people had to dance one song and sit out for five to "cool off" in the 100 degree temperature. Heat + Sangria + sweating due to dancing = super dehydration and hang over and feeling that I shouldn't go out Friday nights ever again lol   Also I didn't know that there's an automatic 18% gratuity on drinks for a reservation. Not that we weren't going to tip but that was just a tad odd. I thought that was just for food. Just FYI so you won't be caught off guard!   And yes after all that complaining I still give them four stars bc I think under the right conditions this could be an amazing venue.

DIZPcsnHMR_tWaMCJLp2vg.text: Came here twice this trip! Ordered tons of tapas and let me tell you! They were all just perfect..the meats succulent, tender and full of flavor! And for the non-meat eaters, they have quite a few vegetarian options. This will be my go to whenever I'm in Vegas! And the service was awesome!

S7pmY8imXoakrD-ot9NHCw.text: We loved Firefly! Everything we ordered was full of flavor! The garlic shrimp was amazing and the wait staff were all very friendly and helpful!

cMeDovY_ahXRCjCNxC0P4Q.text: Really enjoyed the tapas! Plus it has a really fun atmosphere.   The stuffed dates were amazing! So was the tuna tartare.   Was a bit disappointed with the chicken stuffed mushrooms. But other than that dish everything was really yummy!!  Would definitely come back!

pl8A5aIaLYOCexXcax-nBg.text: Third time here and it's consistent.  The food is authentic and the service is just right.   FOOD: very solid authentic tapas. If anything the portions are too big which is not a terrible problem other than it limits what you can try in one sitting. Again - 3 visits and everything was very good.   SERVICE: Just right in my opinion. Not too aggressive but very attentive. Water was always filled and setups changed when needed without a bunch of fanfare. Perfect.   My server tonight was listed as Night on the bill - well done,  thanks.

_4UykEIQShzNv1rDPOsV6A.text: What a pleasant surprise.  Food, service and ambience were well above average. I can't believe locals won't swamp this place.  Tourists are lucky to find it.

GZXbY-vLz9BTfbV_hyfw9w.text: There are certain things you have to do when you go to Vegas.. Drink, party, gamble and eat at firefly. We come all the way from Australia and everytime we get here we make sure to book in a time to enjoy a decent meal with a nice range of tapas and a decent drinks list to go with it. On the busy nights I'd definitely recommend booking but allow a few hours to relax and enjoy here! I always get the prawn dish something a la diabla, bacon wrapped dates, french fries, anchovies and avo toast, Apple manchego salad. It's just always so good

CravQUkkH-Fs_JHZZiiAzg.text: We went to Firefly on a Friday night with a group of 6. We ordered about 10 dishes, and everything was delicious, particularly the Korean short ribs, the clams & chorizo, and the baked goat cheese. Even the complimentary bread and almond honey butter was incredible. There wasn't a single dish or drink we didn't love, and the service was fantastic. The atmosphere was great, too... we sat outside and had a great time.

3Kx7G1XgOydNX6vzPpXYTQ.text: This is one of our regular go to spots when we are in Vegas. It is stylish, and even though they say they're Spanish, it is more Latin American Fusion food. The service is on point and the prices are not bad for what you are getting. The Sangria is amazing, and the Tuna Tartar is one the best I have tasted. The Paella is good also, but you really need to make up your mind on that one as soon as you hit the door, since they make it fresh it takes about 20 minutes from order to your table. Will we go back yes!

QV44MicoJsXCS4hIZaOpLA.text: True story, I came here with my mom and girlfriend and we were seated next to a table of Vietnamese strippers.  Best dinner ever.  Alright, now that I've gotten that off my chest, onto the review!  Firefly is awesome. Period. We piled up plate upon plate of dishes, each one more delicious than the one before. Instead of eating some overpriced frou frou garbage on the Strip or succumbing to your newfound poverty and eating 99c hotdogs, please get in a cab or car or whatever and head to Firefly.  There's something for everyone. You like to kill and consume four-legged animals that run through the plains? They got it. Perhaps you're more of a follower of Poseidon and it's swimming creatures that get your tummy rumbling. You're covered there as well.  On the real real, I'd probably drive back Vegas on the stupid I-15 just to eat here again.

lvYTBYRUaxN-mwkE0cisSA.text: Have not been here since they moved from a block away. Big n spacious, with a valet that has a sh*ty attitude. Even if i ask what you perceive to be a stupid question. ..you should still be pleasant in your response. Since i hadn't been to the new location,  and the lighting is dark the place looked closed, and the valets were just setting up their stand, so i asked if the bar was open. Response with tude was "i guess, it should  be". Anyway, didn't eat,  just stopped by for drink and see the decor. Good for drinks. And self park your car!!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fly Tai

D9zuqQ8VFTXhvNrjfe_nkw.text: I have been here a number of times and have not been disappointed. I've tried about half of the menu and the food has been consistently great! The sangria is delicious. Nice outdoor seating area. Between the price point and the food quality, absolutely worth getting off the strip to eat here.

2rmV3APcBuArsmpUfllb-A.text: i went there tonight with my wife...the food was excellent.....our waitress was jasmine...she was excellent also.....i would recommend to anyone....happy hour was between 3 and 6 oclock. they serve a lot of small plates, which is nice you can try a lot of different things.........

cRyRofhdNDW3b5v9GU1Z-Q.text: My second time here. I was in charge of setting up a dinner for my Bffs Bachelorette for 6 girls! They all loved the food! Best part was Gerry the bus boy! Awesome and funny! The manager Eduardo was accommodating, funny, and made sure we were taken care of! Great food and atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq ribs on point!
Photo of Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Group meal for 6!

Bbc6fQaRSazA0yfudhHtoA.text: Authentic food, sangria excellent, got the pitcher and it's so good, just like the sangria we have in Spain. Spanish decor, very nice ambiance. I come here everytime we are in Vegas!

lVTts4MSFZtFvdueh7re9w.text: I cannot say enough about how great Firefly was. The menu was extensive, prices were great, and serving sizes were much bigger than I'm used to at tapas restaurants. What really made this worth five stars, however, was the excellent, excellent service. I went with two friends, one who has an extreme shellfish allergy. We called ahead of time, just to make sure it wouldn't be an issue (she knows not to order shellfish, of course, but kitchen cross-contamination can be deadly). We were told they could accommodate this food allergy, just to let our server know when we got there. Apparently, unbeknownst to us, they also flagged the reservation. So immediately after we were seated, Carlos, a manager, came to our table, acknowledged the allergy, and let us know we would be taken care of. The cleared out one fryer to only fry non-shellfish items for the evening, offered the best suggestions, and even put up with the additional issue that I'm a vegetarian. (Note: they have a separate vegetarian menu with only non-meat choices!) The sangria and mojitos were flowing, the food was great, and my friend was able to enjoy the meal without worry. Fantastic all the way around. This was, by far, our best food experience in Vegas, and we tried the gamut during our four days there!

SXGKedYwCTxuQcNGUpmd5Q.text: Food was great, drinks were great.  Too bad they don't understand how to run a business.  I purchased this Groupon for use on a Friday night while visiting Las Vegas.  I called first, because I read the restriction about only being able to use from 5:00 - 6:30 for dinner, and reservations being required.  The person I spoke with was really short with me, didn't really understand my question about "having a groupon and needing a reservation during that window, etc.".  She told me to just come right over, because they weren't busy and there was no wait.  When we got there, approximately an hour later, it was 6:15.  I know this, because we had told friends we would meet them there at 6:00 and I was upset with my husband because we were 15 mins late.  By the time we got sat and had ordered our drinks, it was probably 6:30.  We had a party of 8, and spent almost $300 and 1.5 hours there.  When I presented the Groupon, the waiter told me it was only valid from 5:00 to 6:30.  I explained that I had read the fine print, had called for a reservation, was told it was unnecessary, and was still seated by 6:30, regardless.  He persisted in saying that he understood, but still couldn't honor it, but i was welcomed to use it on a different night.  When I explained that we were in from out of town and had purchased it specifically to use that evening and asked him if he could let me talk with a manager, he said he would certainly check with the manager and explain my dilemma.  He came back a couple minutes later and told me that "the manager was sorry, but they couldn't accept it, and since I was from out of town, I was welcomed to call Groupon and request a refund".  Really?  I'm not a cheap skate.  In fact, I'm the opposite.  The measly Groupon amounted to a $17 discount on a $240 check, upon which I left a $50 tip.  I really don't care about the $17 but I do feel a little scammed for being lured into their business, bringing 7 other people with me (2 of which live in Las Vegas) only to be treated like dirt.  Worse than that, I hate that the employees at Firefly, clearly don't understand that the value in advertising is in bringing new customers into your business and keeping them coming back, not to bait and switch them, thus ensuring they will never visit again.  And, sadly, had the manager come over and spoken to me, I could have shared this feedback with him, rather than airing my grudge on Yelp.  Fail, Firefly.  Fail.

tZlYqkxFNrQoiGfuZsYG7g.text: Great cocktails but bad service.  Sat at the bar and pretty much had the menu thrown at me. It took about ten minutes for the bar tender to notice me after I had a chance to review the menu. It was my first time there and probably my last. Sucks because I was really excited about going there.

g8cD9_uw_QXFojF6VM5vfQ.text: We ordered a whole bunch of appetizers to share. There wasn't a single one that I didn't like. Really like their Sangria too. Great place to go with a bunch of friends to drink and try a bit of everything.

LagzrjBxyS9LJbJdGe1Uig.text: Boquerones and manchego mac and cheese were pretty good! Tres leches cake was also nice. Should have gone with the full pitcher of Sangria. Can't wait to try the paella next time.

LYYoqTMHnaCzWiq4xiyv-Q.text: This place is always fun. The sangria is great and the food is different than most other restaurants. It's one of my go to stops when Im in Vegas.

DkkK7YFALJMLp5VkSRrUrA.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat... food is great!! But the service was not so great.  We arrived on a monday night around 10:20pm the place was empty.  At this time we were the only ones who sat inside the restaurant.  Our server was Jesus (tall, skinny gentleman)  He greeted us with a smile, but throughout our visit.  We felt rushed when it came to ordering as if he didn't have time to be waiting on us.  I felt there were other workers in the restaurant that took care of us more than the server.  When it came time to pay the bill, we paid in cash and Jesus said he would be back with the change.  We waited, but all we saw was Jesus walking past us from the kitchen to the bar to his outside tables; He did not bother to look at us or come back to the table.  We flagged him down once we saw that he was not going to come back, only then did he say "Did you want your change?" without us having to say anything.  I will say we did not leave a good tip due to our experience.  We thought if was very rude of him to expect he deserved that tip.. We are very generous tippers but we tip based on the overall experience.  Because of that his tip went down further but it was never because of the fact that we are cheap.  We understand that people work for their tips and that is part of their income; but I also believe in excellent customer service wherever I go.  Because I love the food, i would order to go instead of dining in
